Text

ï»¿The Odd Women

By

[George]184-george Gissing

CHAPTER [I]0-i

[THE FOLD AND THE SHEPHERD]325-the fold and the shepherd

' So to - morrow , [Alice]185-alice , '[186-dr. madden] said [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden , as [he]186-dr. madden walked with [[his]186-dr. madden eldest daughter]326-his eldest daughter on [the coast - downs]327-the coast - downs by [Clevedon]1-clevedon , ' [I]186-dr. madden shall take steps for insuring [my]186-dr. madden life for a thousand pounds . '[186-dr. madden]

It was the outcome of a long and intimate conversation . [Alice Madden]185-alice , aged nineteen , [a plain , shy , gentle - mannered girl , short of stature , and in movement something less than graceful]328-a plain , shy , gentle - mannered girl , short of stature , and in movement something less than graceful , wore a pleased look as [she]185-alice glanced at [[her]185-alice father]329-her father 's face and then turned [her]185-alice eyes across [the blue channel]330-the blue channel to [the Welsh hills]331-the welsh hills . [She]185-alice was flattered by the confidence reposed in [her]185-alice , for [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden , reticent by nature , had never been known to speak in the domestic circle about [his]186-dr. madden pecuniary affairs . [He]186-dr. madden seemed to be [the kind of man who would inspire [[his]186-dr. madden children]333-his children with affection : grave but benign , amiably diffident , with a hint of lurking mirthfulness about [his]186-dr. madden eyes and lips]332-the kind of man who would inspire his children with affection : grave but benign , amiably diffident , with a hint of lurking mirthfulness about his eyes and lips . And to - day [he]186-dr. madden was in the best of humours ; professional prospects , as [he]186-dr. madden had just explained to [Alice]185-alice , were more encouraging than hitherto ; for twenty years [he]186-dr. madden had practised medicine at [Clevedon]1-clevedon , but with such trifling emolument that the needs of [[his]186-dr. madden large family]334-his large family left [him]186-dr. madden scarce a margin over expenditure ; now , at the age of forty - nine it was 1872 [he]186-dr. madden looked forward with a larger hope . Might [he]186-dr. madden not reasonably count on ten or fifteen more years of activity ? [Clevedon]1-clevedon was growing in repute as [a seaside resort]335-a seaside resort ; [new houses]336-new houses were rising ; assuredly [his]186-dr. madden practice would continue to extend .

' [I]186-dr. madden do n't think [girls]3460-girls ought to be troubled about this kind of thing , '[186-dr. madden] [he]186-dr. madden added apologetically . ' Let [men]3461-men grapple with [the world]3462-the world ; for , as the old hymn says , " '[186-dr. madden] tis [their]337-their nature to . " [I]0-i should grieve indeed if [I]0-i thought [[my]0-i girls]338-my girls would ever have to distress [themselves]338-my girls about money matters . But [I]0-i find [I]0-i have got into the habit , [Alice]185-alice , of talking to [you]185-alice very much as [I]0-i should talk with [[your]185-alice dear mother]339-your dear mother if [she]339-your dear mother were with [us]340-us . '[339-your dear mother]

[Mrs. Madden]187-mrs. madden , having given birth to [six daughters]341-six daughters , had fulfilled [her]187-mrs. madden function in [this wonderful world]342-this wonderful world ; for two years [she]187-mrs. madden had been resting in [the old churchyard that looks upon]343-the old churchyard that looks upon [the Severn sea]344-the severn sea . [Father]345-father and [daughter]346-daughter sighed as [they]340-us recalled [her]187-mrs. madden memory . [A sweet , calm , unpretending woman]347-a sweet , calm , unpretending woman ; admirable in the domesticities ; in speech and thought distinguished by a native refinement , which in the most fastidious eyes would have established [her]187-mrs. madden claim to the title of [lady]348-lady . [She]187-mrs. madden had known but little repose , and secret anxieties told upon [her]187-mrs. madden countenance long before the final collapse of health .

' And yet , '[186-dr. madden] pursued [the doctor doctor]349-the doctor doctor only by courtesy when [he]349-the doctor doctor had stooped to pluck and examine a flower , ' [I]349-the doctor doctor made a point of never discussing these matters with [her]187-mrs. madden . As no doubt [you]3463-you guess , life has been rather an uphill journey with [us]3464-us . But [the home]3465-the home must be guarded against sordid cares to the last possible moment ; nothing upsets [me]349-the doctor doctor more than the sight of [those poor homes where [wife]3467-wife and [children]3468-children are obliged to talk from morning to night of how the sorry earnings shall be laid out]3466-those poor homes where wife and children are obliged to talk from morning to night of how the sorry earnings shall be laid out . No , no ; [women , old or young]3469-women , old or young , should never have to think about money .[349-the doctor doctor]

The magnificent summer sunshine , and the western breeze that tasted of ocean , heightened [his]349-the doctor doctor natural cheeriness . [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden fell into a familiar strain of prescience .

' There will come a day , [Alice]185-alice , when [neither man]3470-neither man nor [woman]3471-woman is troubled with such sordid care . Not yet awhile ; no , no ; but the day will come . [Human beings]3472-human beings are not destined to struggle for ever like beasts of prey . Give [them]3472-human beings time ; let civilization grow . [You]185-alice know what [[our]3473-our poet]3474-our poet says : " There the common sense of most shall hold a fretful realm in awe " '[186-dr. madden]

[He]186-dr. madden quoted the couplet with a subdued fervour which characterized [the man]350-the man and explained [his]350-the man worldly lot . [Elkanah Madden]188-elkanah madden should never have entered the medical profession ; mere humanitarianism had prompted the choice in [his]188-elkanah madden dreamy youth ; [he]188-elkanah madden became [an empiric]351-an empiric , nothing more . ' [[Our]3473-our poet]3474-our poet , '[352-the doctor] said [the doctor]352-the doctor ; [Clevedon]1-clevedon was chiefly interesting to [him]188-elkanah madden for [its]1-clevedon literary associations . [Tennyson]189-tennyson [he]188-elkanah madden worshipped ; [he]188-elkanah madden never passed [[Coleridge]190-coleridge 's cottage]353-coleridge 's cottage without bowing in spirit . From the contact of coarse actualities [his]188-elkanah madden nature shrank .

When [he]188-elkanah madden and [Alice]185-alice returned from [their]354-their walk it was the hour of family tea . [A guest]355-a guest was present this afternoon ; [the eight persons who sat down to table]356-the eight persons who sat down to table were as many as [the little parlour]357-the little parlour could comfortably contain . Of [the sisters]358-the sisters , next in age to [Alice]185-alice came [Virginia]191-virginia , [a pretty but delicate girl of seventeen]359-a pretty but delicate girl of seventeen . [Gertrude]192-gertrude , [Martha]193-martha , and [Isabel]194-isabel , ranging from fourteen to ten , had no physical charm but that of youthfulness ; [Isabel]194-isabel surpassed [[her]194-isabel eldest sister]360-her eldest sister in downright plainness of feature . [The youngest]361-the youngest , [Monica]195-monica , was [a bonny little maiden only just five years old]362-a bonny little maiden only just five years old , dark and bright - eyed .

[The parents]363-the parents had omitted no care in shepherding [their]363-the parents fold . Partly at [home]364-home , and partly in [local schools]365-local schools , [the young ladies]366-the young ladies had received instruction suitable to [their]366-the young ladies breeding , and [the elder ones]367-the elder ones were disposed to better this education by private study . The atmosphere of [the house]368-the house was intellectual ; books , especially [the poets]369-the poets , lay in [every room]370-every room . But it never occurred to [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden that [[his]186-dr. madden daughters]371-his daughters would do well to study with a professional object . In hours of melancholy [he]186-dr. madden had of course dreaded the risks of life , and resolved , always with postponement , to make some practical provision for [[his]186-dr. madden family]372-his family ; in educating [them]372-his family as well as circumstances allowed , [he]186-dr. madden conceived that [he]186-dr. madden was doing the next best thing to saving money , for , if a fatality befell , teaching would always be [their]372-his family resource . The thought , however , of [[his]186-dr. madden girls]373-his girls having to work for money was so utterly repulsive to [him]186-dr. madden that [he]186-dr. madden could never seriously dwell upon it . A vague piety supported [his]186-dr. madden courage . [Providence]196-providence would not deal harshly with [him]186-dr. madden and [[his]186-dr. madden dear ones]374-his dear ones . [He]186-dr. madden enjoyed excellent health ; [his]186-dr. madden practice decidedly improved . The one duty clearly before [him]186-dr. madden was to set an example of righteous life , and to develop [the girls]375-the girls ' minds in every proper direction . For , as to training [them]375-the girls for any path save those trodden by [English ladies of the familiar type]3476-english ladies of the familiar type , [he]186-dr. madden could not have dreamt of any such thing . [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden 's hopes for the race were inseparable from a maintenance of morals and conventions such as [the average man]3477-the average man assumes in [his]186-dr. madden estimate of [women]3478-women .[377-a young girl named rhoda nunn]

[The guest at table]376-the guest at table was [a young girl named [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn . Tall , thin , eager - looking , but with promise of bodily vigour , [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn was singled at a glance as [no member of [the Madden family]379-the madden family]378-no member of the madden family . [Her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn immaturity but fifteen , [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn looked two years older appeared in nervous restlessness , and in [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn manner of speaking , childish at times in the hustling of inconsequent thoughts , yet striving to imitate the talk of [[her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn seniors]380-her seniors . [She]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn had a good head , in both senses of the phrase ; might or might not develop a certain beauty , but would assuredly put forth the fruits of intellect . [[Her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn mother]381-her mother , [an invalid]382-an invalid , was spending the summer months at [Clevedon]1-clevedon , with [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden for [medical adviser]383-medical adviser , and in this way [the girl]384-the girl became friendly with [the Madden household]385-the madden household . [[Its]385-the madden household younger members]386-its younger members [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn treated rather condescendingly ; childish things [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn had long ago put away , and [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn sole pleasure was in intellectual talk . With a frankness peculiar to [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn , indicative of pride , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda let it be known that [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn would have to earn [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn living , probably as [a school teacher]387-a school teacher ; study for examinations occupied most of [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn day , and [her]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn hours of leisure were frequently spent either at [the Maddens]198-the maddens or with [a family named [Smithson]199-mr. smithson people]388-a family named smithson people , these latter , for whom [she]377-a young girl named rhoda nunn had a profound and somewhat mysterious admiration . [Mr. Smithson]199-mr. smithson , [a widower with [a consumptive daughter]390-a consumptive daughter]389-a widower with a consumptive daughter , was [a harsh - featured , rough - voiced man of about five - and - thirty]391-a harsh - featured , rough - voiced man of about five - and - thirty , secretly much disliked by [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden because of [his]186-dr. madden aggressive radicalism ; if [women]3478-women 's observation could be trusted , [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda had simply fallen in love with [him]186-dr. madden , had made [him]186-dr. madden , perhaps unconsciously , the object of [her]197-rhoda earliest passion . [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia commented on the fact in [their]393-they private colloquy with a shamefaced amusement ; [they]393-they feared that it spoke ill for [the young lady]394-the young lady 's breeding . None the less [they]393-they thought [Rhoda]197-rhoda [a remarkable person]395-a remarkable person , and listened to [her]197-rhoda utterances respectfully .

' And what is [your]197-rhoda latest paradox , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ? '[352-the doctor] inquired [the doctor]352-the doctor , with grave facetiousness , when [he]352-the doctor had looked round the young faces at [his]352-the doctor board .

' Really , [I]352-the doctor forget , [doctor]3479-doctor . Oh , but [I]352-the doctor wanted to ask [you]197-rhoda , Do [you]197-rhoda think [women]3478-women ought to sit in [Parliament]3481-parliament ? '[352-the doctor]

' Why , no , '[352-the doctor] was the response , as if after due consideration . ' If [they]3478-women are there at all [they]3478-women ought to stand . '[352-the doctor]

' Oh , [I]197-rhoda ca n't get [you]197-rhoda to talk seriously , '[197-rhoda] rejoined [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with an air of vexation , whilst [the others]397-the others were good - naturedly laughing . ' [Mr. Smithson]199-mr. smithson thinks there ought to be [female members of Parliament]3482-female members of parliament .[397-the others]

' Does [he]199-mr. smithson ? Have [the girls]375-the girls told [you]197-rhoda that there 's a nightingale in [[Mr. Williams]200-mr. williams 's orchard]3484-mr. williams 's orchard ? '[197-rhoda]

It was always thus . [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden did not care to discuss even playfully the radical notions which [Rhoda]197-rhoda got from [[her]197-rhoda objectionable friend]398-her objectionable friend . [[His]186-dr. madden daughters]371-his daughters would not have ventured to express an opinion on such topics when [he]186-dr. madden was present ; apart with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , [they]371-his daughters betrayed a timid interest in whatever proposition [she]197-rhoda advanced , but no gleam of originality distinguished [their]371-his daughters arguments .

After tea [the little company]400-the little company fell into groups some out of doors beneath the apple - trees , others near the piano at which [Virginia]191-virginia was playing [Mendelssohn]201-mendelssohn . [Monica]195-monica ran about among [them]400-the little company with [her]195-monica five - year - old prattle , ever watched by [[her]195-monica father]329-her father , who lounged in a canvas chair against the sunny ivied wall , pipe in mouth . [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden was thinking how happy [they]371-his daughters made [him]186-dr. madden , [these kind , gentle girls]402-these kind , gentle girls ; how [his]186-dr. madden love for [them]402-these kind , gentle girls seemed to ripen with every summer ; what a delightful old age [his]186-dr. madden would be , when [some were married]403-some were married and had children of [their]403-some were married own , and [the others]397-the others tended [him]186-dr. madden [they]397-the others whom [he]186-dr. madden had tended . [Virginia]191-virginia would probably be sought in marriage ; [she]191-virginia had good looks , a graceful demeanour , a bright understanding . [Gertrude]192-gertrude also , perhaps . And [little Monica]195-monica ah , [little Monica]195-monica ! [she]195-monica would be [the beauty of [the family]406-the family]405-the beauty of the family . When [Monica]195-monica had grown up it would be time for [him]186-dr. madden to retire from practice ; by then [he]186-dr. madden would doubtless have saved money .

[He]186-dr. madden must find more society for [them]402-these kind , gentle girls ; [they]402-these kind , gentle girls had always been too much alone , whence [their]402-these kind , gentle girls shyness among [strangers]407-strangers . If [[their]402-these kind , gentle girls mother]408-their mother had but lived !

' [Rhoda]197-rhoda wishes [you]186-dr. madden to read [us]402-these kind , gentle girls something , [father]345-father , '[409-his eldest girl , who had approached whilst he was lost in dream] said [[his]186-dr. madden eldest girl , who had approached whilst [he]186-dr. madden was lost in dream]409-his eldest girl , who had approached whilst he was lost in dream .

[He]186-dr. madden often read aloud to [them]402-these kind , gentle girls from [the poets]369-the poets ; [Coleridge]190-coleridge and [Tennyson]189-tennyson by preference . Little persuasion was needed . [Alice]185-alice brought the volume , and [he]186-dr. madden selected ' [The Lotus - Eaters]3486-the lotus - eaters . '[186-dr. madden] [The girls]375-the girls grouped [themselves]375-the girls about [him]186-dr. madden , delighted to listen . Many an hour of summer evening had [they]375-the girls thus spent , none more peaceful than the present . [The reader]412-the reader 's cadenced voice blended with the song of a thrush .

' " Let [us]375-the girls alone . Time driveth onward fast , And in a little while [our]375-the girls lips are dumb . Let [us]375-the girls alone . What is it that will last ? All thing '[412-the reader] are taken from [us]375-the girls " '[412-the reader]

There came an interruption , hurried , peremptory . [A farmer over at [Kingston Seymour]2-kingston seymour]413-a farmer over at kingston seymour had been seized with alarming illness ; [the doctor]352-the doctor must come at once .

' Very sorry , [girls]3460-girls . Tell [James]202-james to put the horse in , sharp as [he]202-james can .[352-the doctor]

In ten minutes [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden was driving at full speed , alone in [[his]186-dr. madden dog - cart]415-his dog - cart , towards the scene of duty .

About seven o'clock [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda took leave , remarking with [her]197-rhoda usual directness , that before going [home]364-home [she]197-rhoda would walk along [the sea]417-the sea - front in the hope of a meeting with [Mr. Smithson]199-mr. smithson and [[his]199-mr. smithson daughter]418-his daughter . [Mrs. Nunn]203-mrs. nunn was not well enough to leave [the house]368-the house to - day ; but , said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , [the invalid]420-the invalid preferred being left alone at such times .

' Are [you]384-the girl sure [she]203-mrs. nunn prefers it ? '[185-alice] [Alice]185-alice ventured to ask . [The girl]384-the girl gave [her]185-alice a look of surprise .

' Why should [mother]3488-mother say what [she]203-mrs. nunn does n't mean ? '[384-the girl]

It was uttered with an ingenuousness which threw some light on [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's character .

By nine o'clock [the younger trio of sisters]422-the younger trio of sisters had gone to bed ; [Alice]185-alice , [Virginia]191-virginia , and [Gertrude]192-gertrude sat in [the parlour]423-the parlour , occupied with books , from time to time exchanging a quiet remark . A tap at the door scarcely drew [their]422-the younger trio of sisters attention , for [they]422-the younger trio of sisters supposed it was [the maid - servant]424-the maid - servant coming to lay supper . But when the door opened there was a mysterious silence ; [Alice]185-alice looked up and saw the expected face , wearing , however , so strange an expression that [she]185-alice rose with sudden fear .

' Can [I]185-alice speak to [you]185-alice , please , [miss]3489-miss ? '[185-alice]

The dialogue out in [the passage]425-the passage was brief . [A messenger]426-a messenger had just arrived with the tidings that [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden , driving back from [Kingston Seymour]2-kingston seymour , had been thrown from [his]186-dr. madden vehicle and lay insensible at [a roadside cottage]427-a roadside cottage .

For some time [the doctor]352-the doctor had been intending to buy a new horse ; [[his]186-dr. madden faithful old roadster]429-his faithful old roadster was very weak in the knees . As in other matters , so in this , postponement became fatality ; the horse stumbled and fell , and [its driver]430-its driver was flung head forward into [the road]431-the road . Some hours later [they]422-the younger trio of sisters brought [him]430-its driver to [[his]430-its driver home]432-his home , and for a day or two there were hopes that [he]430-its driver might rally . But [the sufferer]433-the sufferer 's respite only permitted [him]430-its driver to dictate and sign a brief will ; this duty performed , [Dr. Madden]186-dr. madden closed [his]186-dr. madden lips for ever .

CHAPTER II

ADRIFT

Just before Christmas of 1887 , [a lady past [her]434-a lady past her twenties twenties]434-a lady past her twenties , and with a look of discouraged weariness on [her]434-a lady past her twenties thin face , knocked at [a house - door in [a little street by [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill]436-a little street by lavender hill]435-a house - door in a little street by lavender hill . A card in the window gave notice that [a bedroom]437-a bedroom was here to let . When the door opened , and [a clean , grave , elderly woman]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman presented [herself]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman , [the visitor]439-the visitor , regarding [her]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman anxiously , made known that [she]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman was in search of [a lodging]440-a lodging .

' It may be for a few weeks only , or it may be for a longer period , '[438-a clean , grave , elderly woman] [she]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman said in a low , tired voice , with an accent of good breeding . ' [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman have a difficulty in finding precisely what [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman want . [One room]3490-one room would be sufficient , and [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman ask for very little attendance . '[438-a clean , grave , elderly woman]

[She]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman had but [one room to let]441-one room to let , replied the other . It might be inspected .

[They]442-they went [upstairs]443-upstairs . [The room]444-the room was at the back of [the house]368-the house , small , but neatly furnished . Its appearance seemed to gratify [the visitor]439-the visitor , for [she]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman smiled timidly .

' What rent should [you]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman ask ? '[438-a clean , grave , elderly woman]

' That would depend , [mum]3491-mum , on what attendance was required . '[447-the landlady]

' Yes of course . [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman think will [you]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman permit [me]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman to sit down ? [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman am really very tired . Thank [you]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman . [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman require very little attendance indeed . [My]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman ways are very simple . [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman should make the bed [myself]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman , and and , do the other little things that are necessary from day to day . Perhaps [I]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman might ask [you]438-a clean , grave , elderly woman to sweep [the room]444-the room out once a week or so . '[438-a clean , grave , elderly woman]

[The landlady]447-the landlady grew meditative . Possibly [she]447-the landlady had had experience of [lodgers who were anxious to give as little trouble as possible]448-lodgers who were anxious to give as little trouble as possible . [She]447-the landlady glanced furtively at [the stranger]449-the stranger .

' And what , '[447-the landlady] was [her]447-the landlady question at length , ' would [you]449-the stranger be thinking of paying ? '[447-the landlady]

' Perhaps [I]447-the landlady had better explain [my]447-the landlady position . For several years [I]447-the landlady have been companion to [a lady in [Hampshire]5-hampshire]3493-a lady in hampshire . [Her]3493-a lady in hampshire death has thrown [me]447-the landlady on [my]447-the landlady own resources [I]447-the landlady hope only for a short time . [I]447-the landlady have come to [London]6-london because [a younger sister of mine]3494-a younger sister of mine is employed [here]3495-here in [a house of business]3496-a house of business ; [she]3494-a younger sister of mine recommended [me]447-the landlady to seek for lodgings in this part ; [I]447-the landlady might as well be near [her]3494-a younger sister of mine whilst [I]447-the landlady am endeavouring to find another post ; perhaps [I]447-the landlady may be fortunate enough to find one in [London]6-london . Quietness and economy are necessary to [me]447-the landlady . [A house like [yours]3498-yours]3497-a house like yours would suit [me]447-the landlady very well very well indeed . Could [we]3499-we not agree upon terms within [my]447-the landlady within [my]447-the landlady power ? '[447-the landlady]

Again [the landlady]447-the landlady pondered .

' Would [you]447-the landlady be willing to pay five and sixpence ? '[447-the landlady]

' Yes , [I]447-the landlady would pay five and sixpence if [you]447-the landlady are quite sure that [you]447-the landlady could let [me]447-the landlady live in [my]447-the landlady own way with satisfaction to [yourself]447-the landlady . [I]447-the landlady in fact , [I]447-the landlady am [a vegetarian]3500-a vegetarian , and as the meals [I]447-the landlady take are so very simple , [I]447-the landlady feel that [I]447-the landlady might just as well prepare them [myself]447-the landlady . Would [you]447-the landlady object to [my]447-the landlady doing so in [this room]3501-this room ? A kettle and a saucepan are really all absolutely all that [I]447-the landlady should need to use . As [I]447-the landlady shall be much at [home]364-home , it will be of course necessary for [me]447-the landlady to have a fire . '[447-the landlady]

In the course of half an hour an agreement had been devised which seemed fairly satisfactory to [both parties]451-both parties .

' [I]447-the landlady 'm[447-the landlady] not one of [the graspin ' ones]3503-the graspin ' ones , '[447-the landlady] remarked [the landlady]447-the landlady . ' [I]447-the landlady think [I]447-the landlady may say that of [myself]447-the landlady . If [I]447-the landlady make five or six shillings a week out of [[my]447-the landlady spare room]3504-my spare room , [I]447-the landlady do n't grumble . But [the party as takes it]3505-the party as takes it must do [their]3505-the party as takes it duty on [their]3505-the party as takes it side . [You]447-the landlady have n't told [me]447-the landlady [your]447-the landlady name yet , [mum]3491-mum . '[447-the landlady]

' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . [My]447-the landlady luggage is at [the railway station]3507-the railway station ; it shall be brought [here]3495-here this evening . And , as [I]447-the landlady am quite unknown to [you]3491-mum , [I]447-the landlady shall be glad to pay [my]447-the landlady rent in advance . '[447-the landlady]

' Well , [I]447-the landlady do n't ask for that ; but it 's just as [you]3491-mum like . '[447-the landlady]

' Then [I]447-the landlady will pay [you]3491-mum five and sixpence at once . Be so kind as to let [me]447-the landlady have a receipt . '[447-the landlady]

So [Miss Madden]204-miss madden established [herself]204-miss madden at [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill , and dwelt [there]453-there alone for three months .

[She]204-miss madden received letters frequently , but [only one person]454-only one person called upon [her]204-miss madden . This was [[her]204-miss madden sister]455-her sister [Monica]195-monica , now serving at [[a draper]456-a draper 's in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road]457-a draper 's in walworth road . [The young lady]394-the young lady came every Sunday , and in bad weather spent the whole day up in [the little bedroom]459-the little bedroom . [Lodger]205-lodger and [landlady]460-landlady were on remarkably good terms ; [the one]461-the one paid [her]204-miss madden dues with exactness , and [the other]462-the other did many a little kindness not bargained for in the original contract .

Time went on to the spring of ' 88 . Then , one afternoon , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden descended to [the kitchen]3509-the kitchen and tapped in [her]204-miss madden usual timid way at the door .[447-the landlady]

' Are [you]447-the landlady at leisure , [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee ? Could [I]447-the landlady have a little conversation with [you]447-the landlady ? '[447-the landlady]

[The landlady]447-the landlady was alone , and with no more engrossing occupation than the ironing of some linen [she]447-the landlady had recently washed .

' [I]447-the landlady have mentioned [[my]447-the landlady elder sister]3510-my elder sister now and then . [I]447-the landlady am sorry to say [she]3510-my elder sister is leaving [her]3510-my elder sister post with [the family]406-the family at [Hereford]8-hereford . [The children]3512-the children are going to [school]3513-school , so that [her]3510-my elder sister services are no longer needed . '[447-the landlady]

' Indeed , [mum]3491-mum ? '[447-the landlady]

' Yes . For a shorter or longer time [she]3510-my elder sister will be in need of [a home]3515-a home . Now it has occurred to [me]447-the landlady , [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , that that [I]447-the landlady would ask [you]447-the landlady whether [you]447-the landlady would have any objection to [her]3510-my elder sister sharing [[my]447-the landlady room]3516-my room with [me]447-the landlady ? Of course there must be an extra payment . [The room]444-the room is small for [two persons]3518-two persons , but then the arrangement would only be temporary . [[My]447-the landlady sister]3519-my sister is [a good and experienced teacher]3520-a good and experienced teacher , and [I]447-the landlady am sure [she]3519-my sister will have no difficulty in obtaining another engagement . '[447-the landlady]

[Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee reflected , but without a shade of discontent . By this time [she]206-mrs. conisbee knew that [[her]206-mrs. conisbee lodger]464-her lodger was thoroughly to be trusted .

' Well , it 's if [you]447-the landlady can manage , [mum]3491-mum , '[206-mrs. conisbee] [she]206-mrs. conisbee replied . ' [I]206-mrs. conisbee do n't see as [I]206-mrs. conisbee could have any fault to find , if [you]447-the landlady thought [you]447-the landlady could both live in [that little room]3522-that little room . And as for the rent , [I]206-mrs. conisbee should be quite satisfied if [we]3523-we said seven shillings instead of five and six . '[206-mrs. conisbee]

' Thank [you]447-the landlady , [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee ; thank [you]447-the landlady very much indeed . [I]206-mrs. conisbee will write to [[my]206-mrs. conisbee sister]3519-my sister at once ; the news will be a great relief to [her]3519-my sister . [We]3523-we shall have quite an enjoyable little holiday together . '[206-mrs. conisbee]

A week later [the eldest of [the three Miss Maddens]198-the maddens]465-the eldest of the three miss maddens arrived . As it was quite impossible to find space for [her]465-the eldest of the three miss maddens boxes in [the bedroom]466-the bedroom , [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee allowed them to be deposited in [the room occupied by [[her]206-mrs. conisbee daughter]468-her daughter , which was on the same floor]467-the room occupied by her daughter , which was on the same floor . In a day or two [the sisters]358-the sisters had begun a life of orderly tenor . When weather permitted [they]358-the sisters were out either in the morning or afternoon . [Alice Madden]185-alice was in [London]6-london for the first time ; [she]185-alice desired to see the sights , but suffered the restrictions of poverty and ill - health . After nightfall , neither [she]185-alice nor [Virginia]191-virginia ever left [home]364-home .

There was not much personal likeness between [them]358-the sisters .

[The elder now five - and - thirty]471-the elder now five - and - thirty tended to corpulence , the result of sedentary life ; [she]471-the elder now five - and - thirty had round shoulders and very short legs . [Her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty face would not have been disagreeable but for its spoilt complexion ; the homely features , if health had but rounded and coloured them , would have expressed pleasantly enough the gentleness and sincerity of [her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty character . [Her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty cheeks were loose , puffy , and permanently of the hue which is produced by cold ; [her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty forehead generally had a few pimples ; [her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty shapeless chin lost itself in two or three fleshy fissures . Scarcely less shy than in girlhood , [she]471-the elder now five - and - thirty walked with a quick , ungainly movement as if seeking to escape from some one , [her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty head bent forward .

[Virginia]191-virginia about thirty - three had also an unhealthy look , but the poverty , or vitiation , of [her]191-virginia blood manifested itself in less unsightly forms . [One]472-one saw that [she]191-virginia had been comely , and from certain points of view [her]191-virginia countenance still had a grace , a sweetness , all the more noticeable because of its threatened extinction . For [she]191-virginia was rapidly ageing ; [her]191-virginia lax lips grew laxer , with emphasis of a characteristic one would rather not have perceived there ; [her]191-virginia eyes sank into deeper hollows ; wrinkles extended their network ; the flesh of [her]191-virginia neck wore away . [Her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty tall meagre body did not seem strong enough to hold itself upright .

[Alice]185-alice had brown hair , but very little of it . [Virginia]191-virginia 's was inclined to be ruddy ; it surmounted [her]191-virginia small head in coils and plaits not without beauty . The voice of [the elder sister]473-the elder sister had contracted an unpleasant hoarseness , but [she]471-the elder now five - and - thirty spoke with good enunciation ; a slight stiffness and pedantry of phrase came , no doubt , of [her]471-the elder now five - and - thirty scholastic habits . [Virginia]191-virginia was much more natural in manner and fluent in speech , even as [she]191-virginia moved far more gracefully .

It was now sixteen years since the death of [Dr. Madden of Clevedon]186-dr. madden . The story of [[his]186-dr. madden daughters]371-his daughters ' lives in the interval may be told with brevity suitable to so unexciting a narrative .[186-dr. madden]

When [the doctor]352-the doctor 's affairs were set in order , it was found that the patrimony of [[his]186-dr. madden six girls]476-his six girls amounted , as nearly as possible , to eight hundred pounds .

Eight hundred pounds is , to be sure , a sum of money ; but how , in these circumstances , was it to be applied ?

There came over from [Cheltenham]9-cheltenham [a bachelor uncle]477-a bachelor uncle , aged about sixty . [This gentleman]478-this gentleman lived on an annuity of seventy pounds , which would terminate when [he]478-this gentleman did . It might be reckoned to [him]478-this gentleman for righteousness that [he]478-this gentleman spent the railway fare between [Cheltenham]9-cheltenham and [Clevedon]1-clevedon to attend [[his]478-this gentleman brother]479-his brother 's funeral , and to speak a kind word to [[his]478-this gentleman nieces]480-his nieces . Influence [he]478-this gentleman had none ; initiative , very little . There was no reckoning upon [him]478-this gentleman for aid of any kind .

From [Richmond]10-richmond in [Yorkshire]11-yorkshire , in reply to a letter from [Alice]185-alice , wrote [an old , old aunt of [the late Mrs. Madden]187-mrs. madden , who had occasionally sent [the girls]375-the girls presents]481-an old , old aunt of the late mrs. madden , who had occasionally sent the girls presents . [Her]481-an old , old aunt of the late mrs. madden , who had occasionally sent the girls presents communication was barely legible ; it seemed to contain fortifying texts of Scripture , but nothing in the way of worldly counsel . [This old lady]483-this old lady had no possessions to bequeath . And , as far as [the girls]375-the girls knew , [she]483-this old lady was [[their]375-the girls mother 's only surviving relative]485-their mother 's only surviving relative .

[The executor of the will]486-the executor of the will was [a Clevedon tradesman]487-a clevedon tradesman , [a kind and capable friend of [the family]406-the family for many years , [a man of parts and attainments]490-a man of parts and attainments superior to [his]478-this gentleman station]488-a kind and capable friend of the family for many years , a man of parts and attainments superior to his station . In council with [certain other well - disposed persons]491-certain other well - disposed persons , who regarded [the Maddens]198-the maddens ' circumstances with friendly anxiety , [Mr. Hungerford]207-mr. hungerford testamentary instruction allowing [him]207-mr. hungerford much freedom of action decided that [the three elder girls]3525-the three elder girls must forthwith become self - supporting , and that [the three younger]3526-the three younger should live together in the care of [a lady of small means , who offered to house and keep [them]3526-the three younger for the bare outlay necessitated]3527-a lady of small means , who offered to house and keep them for the bare outlay necessitated . A prudent investment of the eight hundred pounds might , by this arrangement , feed , clothe , and in some sort educate [Martha]193-martha , [Isabel]194-isabel , and [Monica]195-monica . To see thus far ahead sufficed for the present ; fresh circumstances could be dealt with as they arose .[491-certain other well - disposed persons]

[Alice]185-alice obtained a situation as [nursery - governess]492-nursery - governess at sixteen pounds a year . [Virginia]191-virginia was fortunate enough to be accepted as [companion]493-companion by [a gentlewoman at [Weston - super - Mare]13-weston]494-a gentlewoman at weston - super - mare ; [her]191-virginia payment , twelve pounds . [Gertrude]192-gertrude , fourteen years old , also went to [Weston]13-weston , where [she]192-gertrude was offered employment in [a fancy - goods shop]495-a fancy - goods shop [her]192-gertrude payment nothing at all , but lodging , board , and dress assured to [her]192-gertrude .

Ten years went by , and saw many changes .

[Gertrude]192-gertrude and [Martha]193-martha were dead ; [the former of consumption]496-the former of consumption , [the other]462-the other drowned by the overturning of [a pleasure - boat]498-a pleasure - boat . [Mr. Hungerford]207-mr. hungerford also was dead , and [a new guardian]499-a new guardian administered the fund which was still a common property of [the four surviving daughters]500-the four surviving daughters . [Alice]185-alice plied [her]185-alice domestic teaching ; [Virginia]191-virginia remained [a ' companion . ']3528-a ' companion . '[3528-a ' companion . '] [Isabel]194-isabel , now aged twenty , taught in [a Board School]501-a board school at [Bridgewater]14-bridgewater , and [Monica]195-monica , just fifteen , was on the point of being apprenticed to [a draper at [Weston]13-weston]502-a draper at weston , where [Virginia]191-virginia abode . To serve behind a counter would not have been [Monica]195-monica 's choice if any more liberal employment had seemed within [her]195-monica reach . [She]195-monica had no aptitude whatever for giving instruction ; indeed , had no aptitude for anything but being [a pretty , cheerful , engaging girl]503-a pretty , cheerful , engaging girl , much dependent on the love and gentleness of those about [her]195-monica . In speech and bearing [Monica]195-monica greatly resembled [[her]195-monica mother]381-her mother ; that is to say , [she]195-monica had native elegance . Certainly it might be deemed a pity that [such a girl]505-such a girl could not be introduced to one of the higher walks of life ; but the time had come when [she]505-such a girl must ' do something '[195-monica] , and [the people to whose guidance]506-the people to whose guidance [she]505-such a girl looked had but narrow experience of life . [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia sighed over the contrast with bygone hopes , but [their]507-their own careers made it seem probable that [Monica]195-monica would be better off ' in business '[509-occasional chaperon] than in a more strictly genteel position . And there was every likelihood that , at such a place as [Weston]13-weston , with [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister for [occasional chaperon]509-occasional chaperon , [she]185-alice would ere long find [herself]185-alice relieved of the necessity of working for a livelihood .

To [the others]397-the others , [no wooer]511-no wooer had yet presented [himself]511-no wooer . [Alice]185-alice , if [she]185-alice had ever dreamt of marriage , must by now have resigned [herself]185-alice to spinsterhood . [Virginia]191-virginia could scarce hope that [her]185-alice faded prettiness , [her]185-alice health damaged by attendance upon [an exacting invalid]512-an exacting invalid and in profitless study when [she]185-alice ought to have been sleeping , would attract [any man]513-any man in search of [a wife]514-a wife . [Poor Isabel]194-isabel was so extremely plain . [Monica]195-monica , if [her]195-monica promise were fulfilled , would be by far the best looking , as well as the sprightliest , of [the family]406-the family . [She]195-monica must marry ; of course [she]195-monica must marry ! [[Her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters gladdened in the thought .

[Isabel]194-isabel was soon worked into illness . Brain trouble came on , resulting in melancholia . [A charitable institution]517-a charitable institution ultimately received [her]194-isabel , and there , at two - and - twenty , [the poor hard - featured girl]518-the poor hard - featured girl drowned [herself]518-the poor hard - featured girl in a bath .

[Their]516-her sisters numbers had thus been reduced by half . Up to now , the income of [their]516-her sisters eight hundred pounds had served , impartially , the ends now of this , now of that one , doing a little good to all , saving [them]516-her sisters from many an hour of bitterness which must else have been added to [their]516-her sisters lot . By a new arrangement , the capital was at length made over to [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia jointly , [the youngest sister]519-the youngest sister having a claim upon [them]516-her sisters to the extent of an annual nine pounds . A trifle , but it would buy [her]519-the youngest sister clothing and then [Monica]195-monica was sure to marry . Thank Heaven , [she]195-monica was sure to marry !

Without notable event , matrimonial or other , time went on to this present year of 1888 .

Late in June , [Monica]195-monica would complete [her]195-monica twenty - first year ; [the elders]520-the elders , full of affection for [the sister]521-the sister , who so notably surpassed [them]520-the elders in beauty of person , talked much about [her]521-the sister as the time approached , devising how to procure [her]521-the sister a little pleasure on [her]521-the sister birthday . [Virginia]191-virginia thought a suitable present would be a copy of ' the Christian Year '[185-alice] .

' [She]191-virginia has really no time for continuous reading . A verse of [Keble]208-keble just one verse at bedtime and in the morning might be strength to [the poor girl]3529-the poor girl . '[185-alice]

[Alice]185-alice assented .

' [We]522-they must join to buy it , [dear]3530-dear , '[185-alice] [she]185-alice added , with anxious look . ' It would n't be justifiable to spend more than two or three shillings . '[185-alice]

' [I]185-alice fear not . '[185-alice]

[They]522-they were preparing [their]522-they midday meal , the substantial repast of the day . In a little saucepan on an oil cooking - stove was some plain rice , bubbling as [Alice]185-alice stirred it . [Virginia]191-virginia fetched from [downstairs]523-downstairs [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee had assigned to [them]522-they a shelf in [her]206-mrs. conisbee larder bread , butter , cheese , a pot of preserve , and arranged the table three feet by one and a half at which [they]522-they were accustomed to eat . The rice being ready , it was turned out in two proportions ; made savoury with a little butter , pepper , and salt , it invited [them]522-they to sit down .

As [they]522-they had been out in the morning , the afternoon would be spent in domestic occupations . The low cane - chair [Virginia]191-virginia had appropriated to [[her]191-virginia sister]455-her sister , because of the latter 's headaches and backaches , and other disorders ; [she]191-virginia [herself]191-virginia sat on an ordinary chair of the bedside species , to which by this time [she]191-virginia had become used . [Their]522-they sewing , when [they]522-they did any , was strictly indispensable ; if nothing demanded the needle , [both]525-both preferred a book . [Alice]185-alice , who had never been [a student in the proper sense of the word]526-a student in the proper sense of the word , read for the twentieth time a few volumes in [her]185-alice possession poetry , popular history , and half a dozen novels such as [the average mother of children]527-the average mother of children would have approved in [the governess]528-the governess 's hands . With [Virginia]191-virginia the case was somewhat different . Up to about [her]191-virginia twenty - fourth year [she]191-virginia had pursued one subject with a zeal limited only by [her]191-virginia opportunities ; study absolutely disinterested , seeing that [she]191-virginia had never supposed it would increase [her]191-virginia value as [a ' companion ']3531-a ' companion '[3531-a ' companion '] , or enable [her]191-virginia to take any better position . [Her]191-virginia one intellectual desire was to know as much as possible about ecclesiastical history . Not in a spirit of fanaticism ; [she]191-virginia was devout , but in moderation , and never spoke bitterly on religious topics . The growth of [the Christian Church]529-the christian church , old sects and schisms , the Councils , affairs of Papal policy these things had a very genuine interest for [her]191-virginia ; circumstances favouring , [she]191-virginia might have become [an erudite woman]530-an erudite woman ; But the conditions were so far from favourable that all [she]191-virginia succeeded in doing was to undermine [her]191-virginia health . Upon a sudden breakdown there followed mental lassitude , from which [she]191-virginia never recovered . It being subsequently [her]191-virginia duty to read novels aloud for [the lady whom [she]191-virginia ' companioned]3532-the lady whom she ' companioned , '[191-virginia] new novels at the rate of a volume a day , [she]191-virginia lost all power of giving [her]191-virginia mind to anything but the feebler fiction . Nowadays [she]191-virginia procured such works from [a lending library]531-a lending library , on a subscription of a shilling a month . Ashamed at first to indulge this taste before [Alice]185-alice , [she]191-virginia tried more solid literature , but this either sent [her]191-virginia to sleep or induced headache . The feeble novels reappeared , and as [Alice]185-alice made no adverse comment , [they]532-they soon came and went with the old regularity .

This afternoon [the sisters]358-the sisters were disposed for conversation . The same grave thought preoccupied [both of [them]358-the sisters]534-both of them , and [they]358-the sisters soon made it [their]358-the sisters subject .

' Surely , '[185-alice] [Alice]185-alice began by murmuring , half absently , ' [I]185-alice shall soon hear of something . '[185-alice]

' [I]455-her sister am dreadfully uneasy on [my]455-her sister own account , '[455-her sister] [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister replied .

' [You]455-her sister think [the person at [Southend]15-southend]3533-the person at southend wo n't write again ? '[455-her sister]

' [I]185-alice 'm[185-alice] afraid not . And [she]536-she seemed so very unsatisfactory . Positively illiterate oh , [I]0-i could n't bear that . ' [Virginia]191-virginia gave a shudder as [she]191-virginia spoke .[0-i]

' [I]185-alice almost wish , '[185-alice] said [Alice]185-alice , ' that [I]185-alice had accepted the place at [Plymouth]16-plymouth . '[185-alice]

' Oh , [[my]0-i dear]3534-my dear ! [Five children]3535-five children and not a penny of salary . It was a shameless proposal . '[0-i]

' It was , indeed , '[537-the poor governess] sighed [the poor governess]537-the poor governess . ' But there is so little choice for [[people]3536-people like [myself]537-the poor governess]3537-people like myself . Certificates , and even degrees , are asked for on every hand . With nothing but references to [past employers]3538-past employers , what can [one]472-one expect ? [I]537-the poor governess know it will end in [my]537-the poor governess taking a place without salary . '[537-the poor governess]

' [People]3536-people seem to have still less need of [me]538-the companion , '[538-the companion] lamented [the companion]538-the companion . ' [I]538-the companion wish now that [I]538-the companion had gone to [Norwich]17-norwich as [lady - help]3541-lady - help . '[538-the companion]

' [Dear]3530-dear , [your]3530-dear health would never have supported it . '[537-the poor governess]

' [I]538-the companion do n't know . Possibly the more active life might do [me]538-the companion good . [It]3543-it might , [you]3530-dear know , [Alice]185-alice . '[538-the companion]

[The other]462-the other admitted this possibility with a deep sigh .

' Let [us]3544-we review [our]3544-we position , '[462-the other] [she]462-the other then exclaimed .

It was a phrase frequently on [her]462-the other lips , and always made [her]462-the other more cheerful . [Virginia]191-virginia also seemed to welcome it as an encouragement .

' [Mine]538-the companion , '[538-the companion] said [the companion]538-the companion , ' is almost as serious as it could be . [I]538-the companion have only one pound left , with the exception of the dividend . '[538-the companion]

' [I]185-alice have rather more than four pounds still . Now , let [us]3544-we think , '[185-alice] [Alice]185-alice paused . ' Supposing [we]3544-we neither of [us]3544-we obtain employment before the end of this year . [We]3544-we have to live , in that case , more than six months [you]185-alice on seven pounds , and [I]185-alice on ten . '[185-alice]

' It 's impossible , '[191-virginia] said [Virginia]191-virginia .

' Let [us]3544-we see . Put it in another form . [We]3544-we have both to live together on seventeen pounds . That is '[462-the other] [she]462-the other made a computation on a piece of paper ' that is two pounds , sixteen shillings and eightpence a month let [us]3544-we suppose this month at an end . That represents fourteen shillings and twopence a week . Yes , [we]3544-we can do it ! '[462-the other]

[She]462-the other laid down [her]462-the other pencil with an air of triumph . [Her]462-the other dull eyes brightened as though [she]462-the other had discovered a new source of income .

' [We]3544-we can not , [dear]3530-dear , '[191-virginia] urged [Virginia]191-virginia in a subdued voice . ' Seven shillings rent ; that leaves only seven and twopence a week for everything everything . '[191-virginia]

' [We]3544-we could do it , [dear]3530-dear , '[462-the other] persisted [the other]462-the other . ' If it came to the very worst , [our]3544-we food need not cost more than sixpence a day three and sixpence a week . [I]462-the other do really believe , [Virgie]209-virgie , [we]3544-we could support life on less say , on fourpence . Yes , [we]3544-we could dear ! '[462-the other]

[They]542-they looked fixedly at [each other]543-each other , like people about to stake everything on [their]542-they courage .

' Is such a life worthy of the name ? '[191-virginia] asked [Virginia]191-virginia in tones of awe .

' [We]3544-we sha n't be driven to that . Oh , [we]3544-we certainly shall not . But it helps [one]472-one to know that , strictly speaking , [we]3544-we are independent for another six months . '[542-they]

That word gave [Virginia]191-virginia an obvious thrill .

' Independent ! Oh , [Alice]185-alice , what a blessed thing is independence ! Do [you]185-alice know , [[my]185-alice dear]3534-my dear , [I]185-alice am afraid [I]185-alice have not exerted [myself]185-alice as [I]185-alice might have done to find a new place . [These comfortable lodgings]3549-these comfortable lodgings , and the pleasure of seeing [Monica]195-monica once a week , have tempted [me]185-alice into idleness . It is n't really [my]185-alice wish to be idle ; [I]185-alice know the harm it does [me]185-alice ; but oh ! if [one]472-one could work in [a home of one 's own]3551-a home of one 's own ! '[185-alice]

[Alice]185-alice had a startled , apprehensive look , as if [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister were touching on a subject hardly proper for discussion , or at least dangerous .

' [I]185-alice 'm[185-alice] afraid it 's no use thinking of that , [dear]3530-dear , ' [she]185-alice answered awkwardly .[3530-dear]

' No use ; no use whatever . [I]185-alice am wrong to indulge in such thoughts . '[185-alice]

' Whatever happens , [[my]185-alice dear]3534-my dear , '[185-alice] said [Alice]185-alice presently , with all the impressiveness of tone [she]185-alice could command , ' [we]546-they must never entrench upon [[our]546-they capital]3553-our capital never never ! '[185-alice]

' Oh , never ! If [we]546-they grow old and useless '[185-alice]

' If [no one]3554-no one will give [us]546-they even board and lodging for [our]546-they services '[185-alice]

' If [we]546-they have n't [a friend]3555-a friend to look to , '[185-alice] [Alice]185-alice threw in , as though [they]546-they were answering [each other]543-each other in a doleful litany , ' then indeed [we]546-they shall be glad that nothing tempted [us]546-they to entrench on [[our]546-they capital]3553-our capital ! It would just keep [us]546-they '[185-alice] [her]185-alice voice sank ' from [the workhouse]3557-the workhouse . '[185-alice]

After this [each]548-each took up a volume , and until teatime [they]546-they read quietly .

From six to nine in the evening [they]546-they again talked and read alternately . [Their]546-they conversation was now retrospective ; [each]548-each revived memories of what [she]185-alice had endured in one or [the other house of bondage]550-the other house of bondage . Never had it been [their]546-they lot to serve ' really nice '[548-each] people this phrase of [theirs]546-they was anything but meaningless . [They]546-they had lived with more or less well - to - do families in [the lower middle class people who could not have inherited refinement , and had not acquired any , neither [proletarians nor gentlefolk , consumed with a disease of vulgar pretentiousness , inflated with the miasma of democracy]552-proletarians nor gentlefolk , consumed with a disease of vulgar pretentiousness , inflated with the miasma of democracy . It would have been but a natural result of such a life if [the sisters]358-the sisters had commented upon it in a spirit somewhat akin to that of [[their]358-the sisters employers]554-their employers]551-the lower middle class people who could not have inherited refinement , and had not acquired any , neither proletarians nor gentlefolk , consumed with a disease of vulgar pretentiousness , inflated with the miasma of democracy . it would have been but a natural result of such a life if the sisters had commented upon it in a spirit somewhat akin to that of their employers ; but [they]546-they spoke without rancour , without scandalmongering . [They]546-they knew [themselves]546-they superior to [the women who had grudgingly paid [them]546-they]555-the women who had grudgingly paid them , and often smiled at recollections which would have moved the servile mind to venomous abuse .

At nine o'clock [they]546-they took a cup of cocoa and a biscuit , and half an hour later [they]546-they went to bed . Lamp oil was costly ; and indeed [they]546-they felt glad to say as early as possible that another day had gone by .

[Their]546-they hour of rising was eight . [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee provided hot water for [their]546-they breakfast . On descending to fetch it , [Virginia]191-virginia found that [the postman]556-the postman had left a letter for [her]191-virginia . The writing on the envelope seemed to be [a stranger]557-a stranger 's . [She]191-virginia ran [upstairs]443-upstairs again in excitement .

' Who can this be from , [Alice]185-alice ? '[191-virginia]

[The elder sister]473-the elder sister had one of [her]473-the elder sister headaches this morning ; [she]473-the elder sister was clay colour , and tottered in moving about . The close atmosphere of [the bedroom]466-the bedroom would alone have accounted for such a malady . But an unexpected letter made [her]191-virginia for the moment oblivious of suffering .

' Posted in [London]6-london , '[191-virginia] [she]191-virginia said , examining the envelope eagerly .

' Some one [you]556-the postman have been in correspondence with ? '[191-virginia]

' It 's months since [I]191-virginia wrote to [any one in [London]6-london]3558-any one in london . '[191-virginia]

For full five minutes [they]546-they debated the mystery , afraid of dashing [their]546-they hopes by breaking the envelope . At length [Virginia]191-virginia summoned courage . Standing at a distance from the other , [she]191-virginia took out the sheet of paper with tremulous hand , and glanced fearfully at the signature .

' What do [you]556-the postman think ? It 's [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ! '[191-virginia]

' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ! Never ! How could [she]197-rhoda have got the address ? '[191-virginia]

Again the difficulty was discussed whilst its ready solution lay neglected .

' Do read it ! '[185-alice] said [Alice]185-alice at length , [her]185-alice throbbing head , made worse by the agitation , obliging [her]185-alice to sink down into the chair .

The letter ran thus :

' [DEAR Miss MADDEN]204-miss madden , This morning [I]562-i chanced to meet with [Mrs. Darby]210-mrs. darby , who was passing through [London]6-london on [her]562-i way [home]364-home from [the seaside]3560-the seaside . [We]3561-we had only five minutes '[562-i] talk it was at [a railway station]561-a railway station , but [she]562-i mentioned that [you]563-you were at present in [London]6-london , and gave [me]0-i [your]563-you address . After all these years , how glad [I]0-i should be to see [you]563-you ! The struggle of life has made [me]0-i selfish ; [I]0-i have neglected [[my]0-i old friends]564-my old friends . And yet [I]0-i am bound to add that some of [them]564-my old friends have neglected [me]0-i . Would [you]563-you rather that [I]0-i came to [[your]563-you lodgings]565-your lodgings or [you]563-you to [mine]0-i ? Which [you]563-you like . [I]0-i hear that [[your]563-you elder sister]566-your elder sister is with [you]563-you , and that [Monica]195-monica is also in [London]6-london somewhere . Do let [us]567-us all see [each other]543-each other once more . Write as soon as [you]563-you can . [My]0-i kindest regards to all of [you]563-you . Sincerely [yours]563-you , [RHODA NUNN]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

' How like [her]197-rhoda , '[191-virginia] exclaimed [Virginia]191-virginia , when [she]191-virginia had read this aloud , ' to remember that perhaps [we]567-us may not care to receive [visitors]3562-visitors ! [She]197-rhoda was always so thoughtful . And it is true that [I]191-virginia ought to have written to [her]197-rhoda . '[191-virginia]

' [We]567-us shall go to [her]197-rhoda , of course ? '[197-rhoda]

' Oh yes , as [she]197-rhoda gives [us]567-us the choice . How delightful ! [I]191-virginia wonder what [she]197-rhoda is doing ? [She]197-rhoda writes cheerfully ; [I]191-virginia am sure [she]197-rhoda must be in a good position . What is the address ? [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road , [Chelsea]19-chelsea . Oh , [I]191-virginia 'm[191-virginia] so glad it 's not very far . [We]569-they can walk there and back easily . '[569-they]

For several years [they]569-they had lost sight of [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda . [She]197-rhoda left [Clevedon]1-clevedon shortly after [the Maddens]570-the maddens were scattered , and [they]569-they heard [she]197-rhoda had become [a teacher]571-a teacher . About the date of [Monica]195-monica 's apprenticeship at [Weston]13-weston , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda had a chance meeting with [Virginia]191-virginia and [the younger girl]572-the younger girl ; [she]197-rhoda was still teaching , but spoke of [her]197-rhoda work with extreme discontent , and hinted at vague projects . Whether [she]197-rhoda succeeded in releasing [herself]197-rhoda [the Maddens]570-the maddens never heard .

It was a morning of doubtful fairness . Before going to bed last night [they]569-they had decided to walk out together this morning and purchase the present for [Monica]195-monica 's birthday , which was next Sunday . But [Alice]185-alice felt too unwell to leave [the house]368-the house . [Virginia]191-virginia should write a reply to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's letter , and then go to [[the bookseller]575-the bookseller 's alone]576-the bookseller 's alone .

[She]191-virginia set forth at half - past nine . With extreme care [she]191-virginia had preserved an out - of - doors dress into the third summer ; it did not look shabby . [Her]191-virginia mantle was in its second year only ; the original fawn colour had gone to an indeterminate grey . [Her]191-virginia hat of brown straw was a possession for ever ; it underwent new trimming , at an outlay of a few pence , when that became unavoidable . Yet [Virginia]191-virginia could not have been judged anything but [a lady]577-a lady . [She]191-virginia wore [her]191-virginia garments as [only a lady]578-only a lady can the position and movement of the arms has much to do with this , and had the step never to be acquired by [a person of vulgar instincts]579-a person of vulgar instincts .

A very long walk was before [her]191-virginia . [She]191-virginia wished to get as far as [the Strand bookshops]580-the strand bookshops , not only for the sake of choice , but because this region pleased [her]191-virginia and gave [her]191-virginia a sense of holiday . Past [Battersea Park]20-battersea park , over [Chelsea Bridge]21-chelsea bridge , then [the weary stretch to [Victoria Station]22-victoria station]581-the weary stretch to victoria station , and the upward labour to [Charing Cross]23-charing cross . Five miles , at least , measured by pavement . But [Virginia]191-virginia walked quickly ; at half - past eleven [she]191-virginia was within sight of [her]191-virginia goal .

A presentable copy of [Keble]208-keble 's work cost less than [she]191-virginia had imagined . This rejoiced [her]191-virginia . But after leaving [the shop]582-the shop [she]191-virginia had a singular expression on [her]191-virginia face something more than weariness , something less than anxiety , something other than calculation . In front of [Charing Cross Station]583-charing cross station [she]191-virginia stopped , looking vaguely about [her]191-virginia . Perhaps [she]191-virginia had it in [her]191-virginia mind to return [home]364-home by omnibus , and was dreading the expense . Yet of a sudden [she]191-virginia turned and went up the approach to [the railway]585-the railway .

At the entrance again [she]191-virginia stopped . [Her]191-virginia features were now working in the strangest way , as though a difficulty of breathing had assailed [her]191-virginia . In [her]191-virginia eyes was an eager yet frightened look ; [her]191-virginia lips stood apart .

Another quick movement , and [she]191-virginia entered [the station]586-the station . [She]191-virginia went straight to the door of [the refreshment room]587-the refreshment room , and looked in through the glass . [Two or three people]588-two or three people were standing inside . [She]191-virginia drew back , a tremor passing through [her]191-virginia .

[A lady]577-a lady came out . Then again [Virginia]191-virginia approached the door . [Two men]590-two men only were within , talking together . With a hurried , nervous movement , [she]191-virginia pushed the door open and went up to a part of the counter as far as possible from [the two customers]591-the two customers . Bending forward , [she]191-virginia said to [the barmaid]592-the barmaid in a voice just above a whisper ,

' Kindly give [me]191-virginia a little brandy . '[191-virginia]

Beads of perspiration were on [her]191-virginia face , which had turned to a ghastly pallor . [The barmaid]592-the barmaid , concluding that [she]191-virginia was ill , served [her]191-virginia promptly and with a sympathetic look .

[Virginia]191-virginia added to the spirit twice its quantity of water , standing , as [she]191-virginia did so , half turned from the bar . Then [she]191-virginia sipped hurriedly two or three times , and at length took a draught . Colour flowed to [her]191-virginia cheeks ; [her]191-virginia eyes lost their frightened glare . Another draught finished the stimulant . [She]191-virginia hastily wiped [her]191-virginia lips , and walked away with firm step .

In the meantime a threatening cloud had passed from the sun ; warm rays fell upon [the street]594-the street and its clamorous life . [Virginia]191-virginia felt tired in body , but a delightful animation , rarest of boons , gave [her]191-virginia new strength . [She]191-virginia walked into [Trafalgar Square]24-trafalgar square and viewed [it]24-trafalgar square like [a person who stands there for the first time , smiling , interested]595-a person who stands there for the first time , smiling , interested . A quarter of an hour passed whilst [she]191-virginia merely enjoyed the air , the sunshine , and the scene about [her]191-virginia . Such a quarter of an hour so calm , contented , unconsciously hopeful as [she]191-virginia had not known since [Alice]185-alice 's coming to [London]6-london .

[She]191-virginia reached [the house]368-the house by half - past one , bringing in a paper bag something which was to serve for dinner . [Alice]185-alice had a wretched appearance ; [her]185-alice head ached worse than ever .

' [Virgie]209-virgie , '[185-alice] [she]185-alice moaned , ' [we]3563-we never took account of illness , [you]209-virgie know . '[185-alice]

' Oh , [we]3563-we must keep that off , '[462-the other] replied [the other]462-the other , sitting down with a look of exhaustion . [She]462-the other smiled , but no longer as in the sunlight of [Trafalgar Square]24-trafalgar square .

' Yes , [I]462-the other must struggle against it . [We]3563-we will have dinner as soon as possible . [I]462-the other feel faint . '[462-the other]

If [both of [them]534-both of them]534-both of them had avowed [their]534-both of them faintness as often as [they]534-both of them felt it , the complaint would have been perpetual . But [they]534-both of them generally made a point of deceiving [each other]543-each other , and tried to delude [themselves]534-both of them ; professing that no diet could be better for [their]534-both of them particular needs than this which poverty imposed .

' Ah ! it 's a good sign to be hungry , '[191-virginia] exclaimed [Virginia]191-virginia . ' [You]185-alice 'll be better this afternoon , [dear]3530-dear . '[191-virginia]

[Alice]185-alice turned over ' The Christian Year , '[185-alice] and endeavoured to console [herself]185-alice out of it , whilst [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister prepared the meal .

CHAPTER III

AN INDEPENDENT WOMAN

[Virginia]191-virginia 's reply to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's letter brought another note next morning Saturday . It was to request a call from [the sisters]358-the sisters that same afternoon .

[Alice]185-alice , unfortunately , would not be able to leave [home]364-home . [Her]185-alice disorder had become a feverish cold caught , doubtless , between open window and door whilst [the bedroom]466-the bedroom was being aired for breakfast . [She]185-alice lay in bed , and [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister administered remedies of [the chemist]605-the chemist 's advising .

But [she]185-alice insisted on [Virginia]191-virginia leaving [her]185-alice in the afternoon . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda might have something of importance to tell or to suggest . [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , sympathetic in [her]206-mrs. conisbee crude way , would see that [the invalid]420-the invalid wanted for nothing .

So , after a dinner of mashed potatoes and milk ' [The Irish peasantry]3565-the irish peasantry live almost entirely on that , '[185-alice] croaked [Alice]185-alice , ' and [they]3565-the irish peasantry are physically a fine race '[185-alice] , [the younger sister]607-the younger sister started on [her]185-alice walk to [Chelsea]19-chelsea . [[Her]185-alice destination]608-her destination was [a plain , low roomy old house in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road]609-a plain , low roomy old house in queen 's road , over against [the hospital gardens]610-the hospital gardens . On asking for [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , [she]185-alice was led to [a back room on the ground floor]611-a back room on the ground floor , and there waited for a few moments . Several large bookcases , a well - equipped writing - table , and kindred objects , indicated that [the occupant of [the house]368-the house]612-the occupant of the house was studious ; the numerous bunches of cut flowers , which agreeably scented the air , seemed to prove [the student]614-the student was [a woman]615-a woman .

[Miss Nunn]197-rhoda entered . Younger only by a year or two than [Virginia]191-virginia , [she]197-rhoda was yet far from presenting any sorrowful image of [a person on the way to old - maidenhood]616-a person on the way to old - maidenhood . [She]197-rhoda had a clear though pale skin , a vigorous frame , a brisk movement all the signs of fairly good health . Whether or not [she]197-rhoda could be called [a comely woman]617-a comely woman might have furnished matter for male discussion ; the prevailing voice of [her]197-rhoda own sex would have denied [her]197-rhoda charm of feature . At first view the countenance seemed masculine , its expression somewhat aggressive eyes shrewdly observant and lips consciously impregnable . But [the connoisseur]618-the connoisseur delayed [his]618-the connoisseur verdict . It was a face that invited , that compelled , study . Self - confidence , intellectual keenness , a bright humour , frank courage , were traits legible enough ; and when the lips parted to show their warmth , their fullness , when the eyelids drooped a little in meditation , one became aware of a suggestiveness directed not solely to the intellect , of something like an unfamiliar sexual type , remote indeed from the voluptuous , but hinting a possibility of subtle feminine forces that might be released by circumstance . [She]197-rhoda wore a black serge gown , with white collar and cuffs ; [her]197-rhoda thick hair rippled low upon each side of the forehead , and behind was gathered into loose vertical coils ; in shadow the hue seemed black , but when illumined it was seen to be the darkest , warmest brown .

Offering a strong , shapely hand , [she]197-rhoda looked at [[her]197-rhoda visitor]619-her visitor with a smile which betrayed some mixture of pain in the hearty welcome .

' And how long have [you]619-her visitor been in [London]6-london ? '[197-rhoda]

It was the tone of [a busy , practical person]620-a busy , practical person . [Her]197-rhoda voice had not much softness of timbre , and perhaps on that account [she]197-rhoda kept it carefully subdued .

' So long as that ? How [I]197-rhoda wish [I]197-rhoda had known [you]619-her visitor were so near ! [I]197-rhoda have been in [London]6-london [myself]197-rhoda about two years . And [[your]619-her visitor sisters]3566-your sisters ? '[197-rhoda]

[Virginia]191-virginia explained [Alice]185-alice 's absence , adding ,

' As for poor [Monica]195-monica , [she]195-monica has only Sunday free except one evening a month . [She]195-monica is at business till half - past nine , and on Saturday till half - past eleven or twelve . '[191-virginia]

' Oh , dear , dear , [dear]3530-dear ! '[197-rhoda] exclaimed the other rapidly , making a motion with [her]197-rhoda hand as if to brush away something disagreeable . ' That will never do . [You]191-virginia must put a stop to that . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]191-virginia am sure [we]3568-we ought to . '[191-virginia]

[Virginia]191-virginia 's thin , timid voice and weak manner were thrown into painful contrast by [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's personality .

' Yes , yes ; [we]3568-we will talk about it presently . [Poor little Monica]195-monica ! But do tell [me]197-rhoda about [yourself]619-her visitor and [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . It is so long since [I]197-rhoda heard about [you]619-her visitor . '[197-rhoda]

' Indeed [I]197-rhoda ought to have written . [I]197-rhoda remember that at the end of [our]3568-we correspondence [I]197-rhoda remained in [your]619-her visitor debt . ' [You]191-virginia did n't stay long , [I]197-rhoda trust , with that trying [Mrs. Carr]211-mrs. carr ? '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , [your]619-her visitor patience ! '[197-rhoda]

' Very kind of [you]191-virginia , but those questions are so difficult to decide . Self - sacrifice may be quite wrong , [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] afraid . '[197-rhoda]

' [The poor woman]3570-the poor woman died . Then [I]197-rhoda had a place scarcely less disagreeable . Now [I]197-rhoda have none at all ; but [I]197-rhoda really must find one very soon . '[197-rhoda]

[She]191-virginia laughed at this allusion to [her]191-virginia poverty , and made nervous motions .

' Let [me]197-rhoda tell [you]191-virginia what [my]197-rhoda own course has been , '[197-rhoda] said [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , after a short reflection . ' When [[my]197-rhoda mother]3571-my mother died , [I]197-rhoda determined to have done with teaching [you]191-virginia know that . [I]197-rhoda disliked it too much , and partly , of course , because [I]197-rhoda was incapable . ' Like poor [Alice]185-alice , [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] afraid . '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , it 's a distressing subject . When [[my]197-rhoda mother]3571-my mother left [me]197-rhoda that little sum of money [I]197-rhoda took a bold step . [I]197-rhoda went to [Bristol]25-bristol to learn everything [I]197-rhoda could that would help [me]197-rhoda out of school life . It did [me]197-rhoda good ; at the end of the year [I]197-rhoda was vastly improved in health , and felt [myself]197-rhoda worth something in [the world]3462-the world . [Virginia]191-virginia sported with the subject . [She]191-virginia brightened wonderfully .

' [I]462-the other quite understand [you]462-the other . But would n't it be possible to make a better use of that money ? It is eight hundred pounds , [I]462-the other think ? Have [you]462-the other never thought of employing it in some practical enterprise ? '[462-the other]

' Would it be possible ? Really ? [You]462-the other think '[462-the other]

' [I]462-the other can only suggest , of course . [One]472-one must n't argue about [others]3608-others from one 's own habit of thought . ' Ah , if [we]629-we could ! The very thing [we]629-we were saying the other day ! But how ? [I]462-the other have no idea how . '[462-the other]

[Miss Nunn]197-rhoda seemed to hesitate .

' [I]197-rhoda do n't advise . [You]191-virginia must n't give any weight to what [I]197-rhoda say , except in so far as [your]191-virginia own judgment approves it . [Virginia]191-virginia drew in [her]191-virginia breath , and it was easy for [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda to perceive that the proposal went altogether beyond [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend 's scope . Impossible , perhaps , to inspire [these worn and discouraged women]634-these worn and discouraged women with a particle of [her]197-rhoda own enterprise . [She]197-rhoda did not press the subject ; it might come up on another occasion . ' Do take some of these flowers , '[197-rhoda] said [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , collecting a rich nosegay from the vases .
