With a fluttering heart [Virginia]191-virginia made what haste [she]191-virginia could homewards . The interview had filled [her]191-virginia with a turmoil of strange new thoughts , which [she]191-virginia was impatient to pour forth for [Alice]185-alice 's wondering comment . It was the first time in [her]191-virginia life that [she]191-virginia had spoken with [a woman]615-a woman daring enough to think and act for [herself]615-a woman .

CHAPTER IV

[MONICA]195-monica 'S MAJORITY[195-monica]

In [the drapery establishment where [Monica Madden]195-monica worked and lived]639-the drapery establishment where monica madden worked and lived it was not as is sometimes the case positively forbidden to [the resident employees]640-the resident employees to remain at [home]364-home on Sunday ; but [they]640-the resident employees were strongly recommended to make the utmost possible use of that weekly vacation . [Herein]642-herein , no doubt , appeared a laudable regard for [their]640-the resident employees health . [Young people]643-young people , especially [young women , who are laboriously engaged in a shop for thirteen hours and a half every weekday , and on Saturday for an average of sixteen]644-young women , who are laboriously engaged in a shop for thirteen hours and a half every weekday , and on saturday for an average of sixteen , may be supposed to need a Sabbath of open air . [Messrs. Scotcher]645-messrs. scotcher and [Co.]214-co. acted like [conscientious men]646-conscientious men in driving [them]640-the resident employees forth immediately after breakfast , and enjoining upon [them]640-the resident employees not to return until bedtime . By way of well - meaning constraint , it was directed that only the very scantiest meals plain bread and cheese , in fact should be supplied to [those who did not take advantage of the holiday]647-those who did not take advantage of the holiday .

[Messrs. Scotcher and Co.]648-messrs. scotcher and co. were [large - minded men]649-large - minded men . Not only did [they]648-messrs. scotcher and co. insist that the Sunday ought to be used for bodily recreation , but [they]648-messrs. scotcher and co. had no objection whatever to [[their]648-messrs. scotcher and co. young friends]650-their young friends taking a stroll after closing - time each evening . Nay , so generous and confiding were [they]648-messrs. scotcher and co. , that to [each young person]651-each young person [they]648-messrs. scotcher and co. allowed a latchkey . The air of [Walworth Road]7-walworth road is pure and invigorating about midnight ; why should the reposeful ramble be hurried by consideration for [weary domestics]652-weary domestics ?

[Monica]195-monica always felt too tired to walk after ten o'clock ; moreover , the usual conversation in [the dormitory which [she]195-monica shared with [five other young women]654-five other young women]653-the dormitory which she shared with five other young women was so little to [her]195-monica taste that [she]195-monica wished to be asleep when [the talkers]655-the talkers came up to bed . But on Sunday [she]195-monica gladly followed the counsel of [[her]195-monica employers]656-her employers . If the weather were bad , [the little room at [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill]657-the little room at lavender hill offered [her]195-monica a retreat ; when the sun shone , [she]195-monica liked to spend a part of the day in free wandering about [London]6-london , which even yet had not quite disillusioned [her]195-monica .

And to - day it shone brightly . This was [her]195-monica birthday , the completion of [her]195-monica one - and - twentieth year . [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia of course expected [her]195-monica early in the morning , and of course [they]658-they were all to dine together at the table measuring three feet by one and a half ; but the afternoon and evening [she]195-monica must have to [herself]195-monica The afternoon , because a few hours of [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister 's talk invariably depressed [her]195-monica ; and the evening , because [she]195-monica had an appointment to keep . As [she]195-monica left [the big ugly ' establishment]3613-the big ugly ' establishment '[195-monica] [her]195-monica heart beat cheerfully , and a smile fluttered about [her]195-monica lips . [She]195-monica did not feel very well , but that was a matter of course ; the ride in [an omnibus]660-an omnibus would perhaps make [her]195-monica head clearer .

[Monica]195-monica 's face was of a recognized type of prettiness ; a pure oval ; from the smooth forehead to the dimpled little chin all its lines were soft and graceful . [Her]195-monica lack of colour , by heightening the effect of black eyebrows and darkly lustrous eyes , gave [her]195-monica at present a more spiritual cast than [her]195-monica character justified ; but a thoughtful firmness was native to [her]195-monica lips , and no possibility of smirk or simper lurked in the attractive features . [The slim figure]661-the slim figure was well fitted in a costume of pale blue , cheap but becoming ; a modest little hat rested on [her]195-monica black hair ; [her]195-monica gloves and [her]195-monica sunshade completed the dainty picture .

[An omnibus]660-an omnibus would be met in [Kennington Park Road]30-kennington park road . On [her]195-monica way thither , in [a quiet cross - street]663-a quiet cross - street , [she]195-monica was overtaken by [a young man who had left [the house of business]665-the house of business]664-a young man who had left the house of business a moment after [her]195-monica , and had followed at a short distance timidly . [A young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of [his]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking nose , but not otherwise ill - looking]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking . [He]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking was clad with propriety stove - pipe hat , diagonal frockcoat , grey trousers , and [he]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking walked with a springy gait .

' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden '[666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking]

[He]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking had ventured , with perturbation in [his]666-a young man of unhealthy countenance , with a red pimple on the side of his nose , but not otherwise ill - looking face , to overtake , [Monica]195-monica . [She]195-monica stopped .

' What is it , [Mr. Bullivant]215-mr. bullivant ? '[195-monica]

[Her]195-monica tone was far from encouraging , but [the young man]667-the young man smiled upon [her]195-monica with timorous tenderness .

' What a beautiful morning ! Are [you]195-monica going far ? '[667-the young man]

[He]667-the young man had the Cockney accent , but not in an offensive degree ; [his]667-the young man manners were not flagrantly of [the shop]582-the shop .

' Yes ; some distance . '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica walked slowly on .

' Will [you]195-monica allow [me]667-the young man to walk a little way with [you]195-monica ? '[667-the young man] [he]667-the young man pleaded , bending towards [her]195-monica .

[They]669-they went forward together . [Monica]195-monica no longer smiled , but neither did [she]195-monica look angry . [Her]195-monica expression was one of trouble .

' [I]667-the young man could n't ask [Miss Eade]216-miss eade to let [me]667-the young man accompany [her]216-miss eade , '[667-the young man] said [the young man]667-the young man gravely .

[Monica]195-monica looked rather frightened at [her]195-monica boldness , and quickly added

[Bullivant]215-mr. bullivant turned desperately in that direction . [He]215-mr. bullivant saw there was as yet [no inside passenger]671-no inside passenger .

[Monica]195-monica had signalled to [the driver]672-the driver , and was hurrying forward . [Bullivant]215-mr. bullivant followed , reckless of consequences . In a minute [both]525-both were seated within .

' [You]215-mr. bullivant will forgive [me]674-the young fellow ? '[674-the young fellow] pleaded [the young fellow]674-the young fellow , remarking a look of serious irritation on [[his]674-the young fellow companion]675-his companion 's face . ' [I]195-monica think when [I]195-monica have begged [you]215-mr. bullivant not to '[195-monica]

' [I]674-the young fellow know how bad [my]674-the young fellow behaviour must seem . But , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , may [I]674-the young fellow not be on terms of friendship with [you]215-mr. bullivant ? '[674-the young fellow]

' Of course [you]215-mr. bullivant may but [you]215-mr. bullivant are not content with that . '[195-monica]

' Yes indeed [I]674-the young fellow will be content '[674-the young fellow]

' It 's foolish to say so . Have n't [you]215-mr. bullivant broken the understanding three or four times ? '[195-monica]

[The bus]3618-the bus stopped for [a passenger]677-a passenger , [a man , who mounted to the top]678-a man , who mounted to the top .

' [I]215-mr. bullivant am so sorry , '[215-mr. bullivant] murmured [Bullivant]215-mr. bullivant , as the starting horses jolted [them]679-them together . ' [I]215-mr. bullivant try not to worry [you]215-mr. bullivant . Think of [my]215-mr. bullivant position . [You]215-mr. bullivant have told [me]215-mr. bullivant that there is [no one else]3619-no one else who whose rights [I]215-mr. bullivant ought to respect . ' And now to [God the Father]218-god the father . '[350-the man] The bustle throughout [the church]751-the church wakened [her]195-monica from reverie so complete that [she]195-monica knew not a syllable of the sermon . By an arrangement with [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , dinner was down in [the parlour]423-the parlour to - day . [Alice]185-alice , alone [upstairs]443-upstairs , made a dinner of gruel .

[Monica]195-monica was to be at [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road , [Chelsea]19-chelsea , by three o'clock . [The sisters]358-the sisters hoped [she]195-monica would return to [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill with [her]195-monica news , but that was left uncertain by [Monica]195-monica [herself]195-monica purposely . As an amusement , [she]195-monica had decided to keep [her]195-monica promise to [Mr. Edmund Widdowson]217-widdowson . [She]195-monica was curious to see [him]217-widdowson again , and receive a new impression of [his]217-widdowson personality . If [he]217-widdowson behaved as inoffensively as at [Richmond]10-richmond , acquaintance with [him]217-widdowson might be continued for the variety it brought into [her]195-monica life . If anything unpleasant happened , [she]195-monica had only to walk away . The slight , very slight , tremor of anticipation was reasonably to be prized by [a shop - girl at [Messrs. Scotcher 's]760-messrs. scotcher 's]759-a shop - girl at messrs. scotcher 's .

Drawing near to [Queen]219-queen 's Road the wrapped - up Keble in [her]195-monica hand [she]195-monica began to wonder whether [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda would have any serious proposal to offer . [Virginia]191-virginia 's report and ecstatic forecasts were , [she]195-monica knew , not completely trustworthy ; though more than ten years [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister 's junior , [Monica]195-monica saw [the world]3462-the world with [eyes much less disposed to magnify and colour ordinary facts]763-eyes much less disposed to magnify and colour ordinary facts .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was still from [home]364-home . [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda received [the visitor]439-the visitor in [a pleasant , old - fashioned drawing - room]766-a pleasant , old - fashioned drawing - room , where there was nothing costly , nothing luxurious ; yet to [Monica]195-monica [it]766-a pleasant , old - fashioned drawing - room appeared richly furnished . A sense of strangeness amid [such surroundings]767-such surroundings had more to do with [her]195-monica constrained silence for the first few minutes than the difficulty with which [she]195-monica recognized in [this lady before [her]195-monica]768-this lady before her [the Miss Nunn whom [she]195-monica had known years ago]769-the miss nunn whom she had known years ago .

' [I]197-rhoda should never have known [you]195-monica , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , equally surprised . ' For one thing , [you]195-monica look like [a fever patient just recovering]3646-a fever patient just recovering . What can be expected ? [[Your]195-monica sister]3611-your sister gave [me]197-rhoda a shocking account of how [you]195-monica live . '[197-rhoda]

' The work is very hard . '[197-rhoda]

' Preposterous . Why do [you]195-monica stay at such a place , [Monica]195-monica ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda am getting experience . '[197-rhoda]

' To be used in [the next world]3648-the next world ? '[197-rhoda]

[They]770-they laughed .

' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden is better to - day , [I]197-rhoda hope ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Alice]185-alice ? Not much , [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] sorry to say . '[197-rhoda]

' Will [you]384-the girl tell [me]197-rhoda something more about the " experience " [you]384-the girl are getting ? For instance , what time is given [you]384-the girl for meals ? '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda was not [the person to manufacture light gossip when a matter of the gravest interest waited for discussion]771-the person to manufacture light gossip when a matter of the gravest interest waited for discussion . With a face that expressed thoughtful sympathy , [she]197-rhoda encouraged [the girl]384-the girl to speak and confide in [her]197-rhoda .

' There 's twenty minutes for each meal , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica explained ; ' but at dinner and tea one is very likely to be called into [the shop]582-the shop before finishing . If [you]384-the girl are long away [you]384-the girl find the table cleared . '[195-monica]

' Charming arrangement ! No sitting down behind the counter , [I]197-rhoda suppose ? '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , of course not . [We]770-they stiffer a great deal from that . [Some of [us]770-they]3650-some of us get diseases . [A girl]3628-a girl has just gone to [the hospital]3652-the hospital with varicose veins , and [two or three others]3653-two or three others have the same thing in a less troublesome form . Sometimes , on Saturday night , [I]195-monica lose all feeling in [my]195-monica feet ; [I]195-monica have to stamp on the floor to be sure it 's still under [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

' Ah , that Saturday night ! '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , it 's bad enough now ; but at Christmas ! There was a week or more of Saturday night going on to one o'clock in the morning . [A girl by [me]195-monica]3654-a girl by me was twice carried out fainting , one night after another . [They]3655-they gave [her]3654-a girl by me brandy , and [she]3654-a girl by me came back again . '[195-monica]

' [They]3655-they compelled [her]3654-a girl by me to ? '[197-rhoda]

' Well , no , it was [her]3654-a girl by me own wish . [Her]3654-a girl by me " book of takings " was n't very good , poor thing , and if it did n't come up to a certain figure at the end of the week [she]3654-a girl by me would lose [her]3654-a girl by me place . [She]3654-a girl by me lost it after all . [They]3655-they told [her]3654-a girl by me [she]3654-a girl by me was too weak . After Christmas [she]3654-a girl by me was lucky enough to get a place as [a lady's - maid]3656-a lady's - maid at twenty - five pounds a year at [Scotcher 's]3657-scotcher 's [she]3654-a girl by me had fifteen . But [we]3658-we heard that [she]3654-a girl by me burst a blood - vessel , and now [she]3654-a girl by me 's in [the hospital at [Brompton]35-brompton]3659-the hospital at brompton . '[195-monica]

' Delightful story ! Have n't [you]3660-you an early - closing day ? '[197-rhoda]

' [They]3655-they had before [I]195-monica went [there]453-there ; but only for about three months . Then the agreement broke down . '[195-monica]

' Like [the assistants]3662-the assistants . A pity [the establishment]3663-the establishment does n't follow suit . '[197-rhoda]

' But [you]3660-you would n't say so , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , if [you]3660-you knew how terribly hard it is for [many girls]3664-many girls to find [a place]3665-a place , even now . '[195-monica]

' [I]197-rhoda know it perfectly well . And [I]197-rhoda wish it were harder . [I]197-rhoda wish [girls]3460-girls fell down and died of hunger in [the streets]3667-the streets , instead of creeping to [[their]3460-girls garrets]3668-their garrets and [the hospitals]3669-the hospitals . [I]197-rhoda should like to see [their]3460-girls dead bodies collected together in some open place for [the crowd]3670-the crowd to stare at . '[197-rhoda]

[Monica]195-monica gazed at [her]195-monica with wide eyes .

' [You]195-monica mean , [I]195-monica suppose , that [people]3536-people would try to reform things . '[195-monica]

' Who knows ? Perhaps [they]3536-people might only congratulate [each other]543-each other that [a few of [the superfluous females]3674-the superfluous females]3673-a few of the superfluous females had been struck off . Do [they]3536-people give [you]195-monica any summer holiday ? '[195-monica]

' A week , with salary continued . '[195-monica]

' Really ? With salary continued ? That takes [one]472-one 's breath away . - Are [many of [the girls ladies]3677-the girls ladies]3676-many of the girls ladies ? '[195-monica]

' None , at [Scotcher]220-scotcher 's . [They]3460-girls nearly all come from [the country]3602-the country . [Several]3679-several are [daughters of [small farmers]3681-small farmers]3680-daughters of small farmers and [those are dreadfully ignorant]3682-those are dreadfully ignorant . [One of [them]3679-several]3683-one of them asked [me]195-monica the other day in what [country Africa]3684-country africa was . '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica do n't find [them]3679-several very pleasant company ? '[195-monica]

' [One or two]3685-one or two are [nice quiet girls]3686-nice quiet girls . '[195-monica]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda drew a deep sigh , and moved with impatience .

' Well , do n't [you]195-monica think [you]195-monica 've had about enough of it experience and all ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica might go into a country business : it would be easier . '[195-monica]

' But [you]195-monica do n't care for the thought ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica wish now [they]3679-several had brought [me]195-monica up to something different . And [I]195-monica 'm[195-monica] not clever , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . [I]0-i never did much at [school]3513-school . '[0-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda regarded [her]197-rhoda , smiling gently .

' [You]0-i have no inclination to study now ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] afraid not , ' replied [the other]462-the other , looking away . '[197-rhoda] Certainly [I]0-i should like to be better educated , but [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i could study seriously , to earn [my]0-i living by it . The time for that has gone by . '[197-rhoda]

' Perhaps so . But there are things [you]195-monica might manage . No doubt [[your]195-monica sister]3611-your sister told [you]195-monica how [I]197-rhoda get [my]197-rhoda living . There 's a good deal of employment for [women who learn to use a typewriter]3693-women who learn to use a typewriter . Did [you]195-monica ever have piano lessons ? '[197-rhoda]

' No . '[197-rhoda]

' No more did [I]197-rhoda , and [I]197-rhoda was sorry for it when [I]197-rhoda went to typewriting . The fingers have to be light and supple and quick . Come with [me]197-rhoda , and [I]197-rhoda 'll show [you]195-monica one of the machines . '[197-rhoda]

[They]774-they went to [a room downstairs a bare little room by [the library]3604-the library]775-a room downstairs a bare little room by the library . Here were [two Remingtons]777-two remingtons , and [Rhoda]197-rhoda patiently explained [their]777-two remingtons use .

' [One]472-one must practise until one can do fifty words a minute at least . It takes a good six months '[197-rhoda] work to learn for any profitable use . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot takes [pupils]778-pupils . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Monica]195-monica , at first very attentive , was growing absent . [Her]195-monica eyes wandered about [the room]444-the room . [The other]462-the other observed [her]195-monica closely , and , it seemed , doubtfully .

' Do [you]195-monica feel any impulse to try for it ? '[462-the other]

' [I]197-rhoda should have to live for six months without earning anything . '[197-rhoda]

' That is by no means impossible for [you]195-monica , [I]462-the other think ? '[462-the other]

' Not really impossible , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica replied with hesitation .

Something like dissatisfaction passed over [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's face , though [she]197-rhoda did not allow [Monica]195-monica to see it . [Her]197-rhoda lips moved in a way that perhaps signified disdain for such timidity . Tolerance was not one of the virtues expressed in [her]197-rhoda physiognomy .

' Let [us]3696-us go back to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room and have some tea . '[197-rhoda]

[Monica]195-monica could not become quite at ease . [This energetic woman]781-this energetic woman had little attraction for [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica saw the characteristics which made [Virginia]191-virginia enthusiastic , but feared rather than admired [them]782-them . To put [herself]195-monica in [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's hands might possibly result in a worse form of bondage than [she]195-monica suffered at [the shop]582-the shop ; [she]195-monica would never be able to please [such a person]784-such a person , and failure , [she]195-monica imagined , would result in more or less contemptuous dismissal .

Then of a sudden , as it [she]195-monica had divined these thoughts , [Rhoda]197-rhoda assumed an air of gaiety of frank kindness .

' So it is [your]195-monica birthday ? [I]197-rhoda no longer keep count of [mine]197-rhoda , and could n't tell [you]195-monica without a calculation what [I]197-rhoda am exactly . It does n't matter , [you]195-monica see . Thirty - one or fifty - one is much the same for [a woman who has made up [her]3698-a woman who has made up her mind to live alone and work steadily for a definite object mind to live alone and work steadily for a definite object]3698-a woman who has made up her mind to live alone and work steadily for a definite object . But [you]195-monica are still [a young girl]3699-a young girl , [Monica]195-monica . [My]197-rhoda best wishes ! '[197-rhoda]

[Monica]195-monica emboldened [herself]195-monica to ask what the object was for which [[her]195-monica friend]631-her friend worked .

' How shall [I]462-the other put it ? '[462-the other] replied [the other]462-the other , smiling . ' To make [women]3478-women hard - hearted . '[462-the other]

' Hard - hearted ? [I]195-monica think [I]195-monica understand . '[195-monica]

' Do [you]195-monica ? '[462-the other]

' [You]195-monica mean that [you]195-monica like to see [them]3478-women live unmarried . '[195-monica]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda laughed merrily .

' [You]195-monica say that almost with resentment . '[197-rhoda]

' No indeed [I]462-the other did n't intend it . '[462-the other]

[Monica]195-monica reddened a little .

' Nothing more natural if [you]384-the girl have done . At [your]384-the girl age , [I]197-rhoda should have resented it . '[197-rhoda]

' But '[384-the girl] [the girl]384-the girl hesitated ' do n't [you]384-the girl approve of [any one marrying]3701-any one marrying ? '[384-the girl]

' Oh , [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] not so severe ! But do [you]384-the girl know that there are half a million more women than [men]3461-men in [this happy country of ours]789-this happy country of ours ? '[384-the girl]

' [Half a million]3702-half a million ! '[195-monica]

[Her]195-monica naive alarm again excited [Rhoda]197-rhoda to laughter .

' Something like that , [they]3478-women say . [So many odd women]3703-so many odd women no making a pair with [them]3703-so many odd women . [The pessimists]3704-the pessimists call [them]3703-so many odd women useless , lost , futile lives . [I]197-rhoda , naturally being one of [them]3703-so many odd women [myself]197-rhoda take another view . [I]197-rhoda look upon [them]3703-so many odd women as a great reserve . When [one woman]3705-one woman vanishes in matrimony , the reserve offers a substitute for [the world]3462-the world 's work . True , [they]3703-so many odd women are not all trained yet far from it . [I]197-rhoda want to help in that to train [the reserve]3707-the reserve . '[197-rhoda]

' But [married woman]3708-married woman are not idle , '[195-monica] protested [Monica]195-monica earnestly .

' [Not all of [them]3708-married woman]3709-not all of them . [Some cook and rock cradles]3710-some cook and rock cradles . '[197-rhoda]

Again [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's mood changed . [She]197-rhoda laughed the subject away , and abruptly began to talk of old days down in [Somerset]36-somerset , of rambles about [Cheddar Cliffs]37-cheddar cliffs , or at [Glastonbury]38-glastonbury , or on [the Quantocks]39-the quantocks . [Monica]195-monica , however , could not listen , and with difficulty commanded [her]195-monica face to a pleasant smile .

' Will [you]384-the girl come and see [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot ? '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda asked , when it had become clear to [her]195-monica that [the girl]384-the girl would gladly get away . ' [I]197-rhoda am only [[her]197-rhoda subordinate]3711-her subordinate , but [I]197-rhoda know [she]197-rhoda will wish to be of all the use to [you]384-the girl [she]197-rhoda can . '[197-rhoda]

[Monica]195-monica expressed [her]195-monica thanks , and promised to act as soon as possible on any invitation that was sent [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica took leave just as [the servant]791-the servant announced [another caller]792-another caller .

CHAPTER V

THE CASUAL ACQUAINTANCE

At [that corner of [Battersea Park]20-battersea park]793-that corner of battersea park which is near [Albert Bridge]40-albert bridge there has lain for more than twenty years a curious collection of architectural fragments , chiefly dismembered columns , spread in order upon the ground , and looking like portions of [a razed temple]794-a razed temple . It is [the colonnade of old [Burlington House]41-burlington house]795-the colonnade of old burlington house , conveyed hither from [Piccadilly]42-piccadilly who knows why , and likely to rest here , the sporting ground for [adventurous infants]796-adventurous infants , until its origin is lost in the abyss of time .

It was at [this spot]797-this spot that [Monica]195-monica had agreed to meet with [[her]195-monica casual acquaintance]798-her casual acquaintance , [Edmund Widdowson]217-widdowson , and there , from a distance , [she]195-monica saw [his]217-widdowson lank , upright , well - dressed figure moving backwards and forwards upon the grass . Even at the last moment [Monica]195-monica doubted whether to approach . Emotional interest in [him]217-widdowson [she]195-monica had none , and the knowledge of life [she]195-monica had gained in [London]6-london assured [her]195-monica that in thus encouraging [a perfect stranger]799-a perfect stranger [she]195-monica was doing a very hazardous thing . But the evening must somehow be spent , and if [she]195-monica went off in another direction it would only be to wander about with an adventurous mind ; for [her]195-monica conversation with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda had had precisely the opposite effect of that which [Rhoda]197-rhoda doubtless intended ; [she]195-monica felt something of the recklessness which formerly excited [her]195-monica wonder when [she]195-monica remarked it in [the other shop - girls]800-the other shop - girls . [She]195-monica could no longer be without [a male companion]801-a male companion , and as [she]195-monica had given [her]195-monica promise to [this man]742-this man

[He]742-this man had seen [her]195-monica , and was coming forward . Today [he]742-this man carried a walking - stick , and wore gloves ; otherwise [his]742-this man appearance was the same as at [Richmond]10-richmond . At the distance of a few yards [he]742-this man raised [his]742-this man hat , not very gracefully . [Monica]195-monica did not offer [her]195-monica hand , nor did [Widdowson]217-widdowson seem to expect it . But [he]742-this man gave proof of an intense pleasure in the meeting ; [his]742-this man sallow cheeks grew warm , and in the many wrinkles about [his]742-this man eyes played a singular smile , good - natured but anxious , apprehensive .

' [I]742-this man am so glad [you]195-monica were able to come , '[742-this man] [he]742-this man said in a low voice , bending towards [her]195-monica .

' It has been even finer than last Sunday , '[195-monica] was [Monica]195-monica 's rather vague reply , as [she]195-monica glanced at [some people who were passing]803-some people who were passing .

' Yes , a wonderful day . But [I]195-monica only left [home]364-home an hour ago . Shall [we]804-we walk this way ? '[195-monica]

[They]804-we went along the path by [the river]3616-the river . [Widdowson]217-widdowson exhibited none of the artifices of gallantry practised by [men who are in the habit of picking up an acquaintance with [shop - girls]807-shop - girls]806-men who are in the habit of picking up an acquaintance with shop - girls . [His]217-widdowson smile did not return ; an extreme sobriety characterized [his]217-widdowson manner and speech ; for the most part [he]217-widdowson kept [his]217-widdowson eyes on the ground , and when silent [he]217-widdowson had the look of [one who inwardly debates a grave question]808-one who inwardly debates a grave question .

' Have [you]217-widdowson been into [the country]3602-the country ? '[809-i] was one of [his]217-widdowson first inquiries .

' No . [I]809-i spent the morning with [[my]809-i sisters]3714-my sisters , and in the afternoon [I]809-i had to see [a lady in [Chelsea]19-chelsea]3715-a lady in chelsea . '[809-i]

' [[Your]217-widdowson sisters]3566-your sisters are older than [yourself]217-widdowson ? '[809-i]

' Yes , some years older . '[809-i]

' Is it long since [you]217-widdowson went to live apart from [them]3566-your sisters ? '[809-i]

' [We]3717-we have never had [a home of [our]3717-we own]3718-a home of our own since [I]809-i was quite [a child]3719-a child . '[809-i]

And , after a moment 's hesitation , [she]809-i went on to give a brief account of [her]809-i history . [Widdowson]217-widdowson listened with the closest attention , [his]217-widdowson lips twitching now and then , [his]217-widdowson eyes half closed . But for cheek - bones that were too prominent and nostrils rather too large , [he]217-widdowson was not ill - featured . No particular force of character declared itself in [his]217-widdowson countenance , and [his]217-widdowson mode of speech did not suggest a very active brain . Speculating again about [his]217-widdowson age , [Monica]195-monica concluded that [he]217-widdowson must be two or three and forty , in spite of the fact that [his]217-widdowson grizzled beard argued for a higher figure . [He]217-widdowson had brown hair untouched by any sign of advanced life , [his]217-widdowson teeth were white and regular , and something [she]195-monica could not make clear to [her]195-monica mind exactly what convinced [her]195-monica that [he]217-widdowson had a right to judge [himself]217-widdowson comparatively young .

' [I]217-widdowson supposed [you]195-monica were not [a Londoner]3720-a londoner , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said , when [she]195-monica came to a pause .

' How ? '[217-widdowson]

' [Your]195-monica speech . Not , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson added quickly , ' that [you]195-monica have any provincial accent . And even if [you]195-monica had been [a Londoner]3720-a londoner [you]195-monica would not have shown it in that way . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson seemed to be reproving [himself]217-widdowson for a blunder , and after a short silence asked in a tone of kindness ,

' Do [you]195-monica prefer [the town]3722-the town ? '[217-widdowson]

' In some ways not in all . '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson am glad [you]195-monica have [relatives]3723-relatives [here]3495-here , and [friends]3725-friends . [So many young ladies]3726-so many young ladies come up from [the country]3602-the country who are quite alone . '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , [many]3728-many . '[217-widdowson]

[Their]810-they progress to familiarity could hardly have been slower . Now and then [they]810-they spoke with a formal coldness which threatened absolute silence . [Monica]195-monica 's brain was so actively at work that [she]195-monica lost consciousness of [the people who were moving about [them]810-they]811-the people who were moving about them , and at times [[her]195-monica companion]812-her companion was scarcely more to [her]195-monica than a voice .

[They]810-they had walked along the whole front of [the park]813-the park , and were near [Chelsea Bridge]21-chelsea bridge . [Widdowson]217-widdowson gazed at [the pleasure - boats]814-the pleasure - boats lying below on [the strand]815-the strand , and said diffidently ,

' Would [you]195-monica care to go on [the river]3616-the river ? '[217-widdowson]

The proposal was so unexpected that [Monica]195-monica looked up with a startled air . [She]195-monica had not thought of [the man]350-the man as likely to offer any kind of amusement .

' It would be pleasant , [I]217-widdowson think , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson added . ' The tide is still running up . [We]810-they might go very quietly for a mile or two , and be back as soon as [you]195-monica like . '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , [I]217-widdowson should like it . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson brightened up , and moved with a livelier step . In a few minutes [they]810-they had chosen [[their]810-they boat]817-their boat , had pushed off , and were gliding to the middle of [the broad water]818-the broad water . [Widdowson]217-widdowson managed the sculls without awkwardness , but by no means like [a man well trained in this form of exercise]819-a man well trained in this form of exercise . On sitting down , [he]217-widdowson had taken off [his]217-widdowson hat , stowed it away , and put on a little travelling - cap , which [he]217-widdowson drew from [his]217-widdowson pocket . [Monica]195-monica thought this became [him]217-widdowson . After all , [he]217-widdowson was not [a companion to be ashamed of]820-a companion to be ashamed of . [She]195-monica looked with pleasure at [his]217-widdowson white hairy hands with [their]821-their firm grip ; then at [his]217-widdowson boots very good boots indeed . [He]217-widdowson had gold links in [his]217-widdowson white shirt - cuffs , and a gold watch - guard chosen with [a gentleman]740-a gentleman 's taste .

' [I]217-widdowson am at [your]195-monica service , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said , with an approach to gaiety . ' Direct [me]217-widdowson . Shall [we]3730-we go quickly some distance , or only just a little quicker than the tide would float [us]3730-we ? '[217-widdowson]

' Which [you]195-monica like . To row much would make [you]195-monica too hot . '[217-widdowson]

' [You]195-monica would like to go some distance [I]217-widdowson see . '[217-widdowson]

' No , no . Do exactly what [you]195-monica like . Of course [we]3730-we must be back in an hour or two . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson drew out [his]217-widdowson watch .

' It 's now ten minutes past six , and there is daylight till nine or after . When do [you]195-monica wish to be [home]364-home ? '[217-widdowson]

' Not much later than nine , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered , with the insincerity of prudence .

' Then [we]3730-we will just go quietly along . [I]217-widdowson wish [we]3730-we could have started early in the afternoon . But that may be for another day , [I]217-widdowson hope . '[217-widdowson]

On [her]195-monica lap [Monica]195-monica had the little brown - paper parcel which contained [her]195-monica present . [She]195-monica saw that [Widdowson]217-widdowson glanced at it from time to time , but [she]195-monica could not bring [herself]195-monica to explain what it was .

' [I]217-widdowson was very much afraid that [I]217-widdowson should not see [you]195-monica to - day , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said , as [they]823-they glided softly by [Chelsea Embankment]43-chelsea embankment .

' But [I]217-widdowson promised to come if it was fine . '[217-widdowson]

' Yes . [I]217-widdowson feared something might prevent [you]195-monica . [You]195-monica are very kind to give [me]217-widdowson [your]195-monica company . '[217-widdowson] [He]217-widdowson was looking at the tips of [her]195-monica little boots . ' [I]217-widdowson ca n't say how [I]217-widdowson thank [you]195-monica . '[217-widdowson]

Much embarrassed , [Monica]195-monica could only gaze at one of the sculls , as it rose and fell , the water dripping from it in bright beads .

' Last year , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson pursued , ' [I]217-widdowson went on [the river]3616-the river two or three times , but alone . This year [I]217-widdowson have n't been in [a boat]737-a boat till to - day . '[217-widdowson]

' [You]217-widdowson prefer driving ? '[217-widdowson]

' Oh , it 's only chance . [I]217-widdowson do drive a good deal , however . [I]217-widdowson have [a housekeeper]3735-a housekeeper ; [no relative]3736-no relative lives with [me]217-widdowson . ' [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] very idle . But that 's partly because [I]0-i have worked very hard and hopelessly all [my]0-i life till a year and a half ago . [I]0-i began to earn [my]0-i own living when [I]0-i was fourteen , and now [I]0-i am forty - four to - day . '[0-i]

' This is [your]217-widdowson birthday ? '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , with an odd look [the other]462-the other could not understand .

' Yes [I]195-monica only remembered it a few hours ago . Strange that such a treat should have been provided for [me]195-monica . Yes , [I]195-monica am very idle . A year and a half ago [[my]195-monica only brother]3740-my only brother died . [He]3740-my only brother had been very successful in life , and [he]3740-my only brother left [me]195-monica what [I]195-monica regard as a fortune , though it was only a small part of what [he]3740-my only brother had . '[195-monica]

[The listener]632-the listener 's heart throbbed . Without intending it , [she]195-monica pulled the tiller so that [the boat]826-the boat began to turn towards [land]827-land .

' The left hand a little , '[217-widdowson] said [Widdowson]217-widdowson , smiling correctly . ' That 's right . Many days [I]217-widdowson do n't leave [home]364-home . ' [I]195-monica never read very much , and [I]195-monica feel very ignorant . '[195-monica]

[He]217-widdowson glanced at the brown - paper parcel . Acting on an impulse which perturbed [her]195-monica , [Monica]195-monica began to slip off the loosely - tied string , and to unfold the paper .

' [I]195-monica thought it was a book ! '[195-monica] exclaimed [Widdowson]217-widdowson merrily , when [she]195-monica had revealed a part of [her]195-monica present .

[She]195-monica offered the little volume . [He]217-widdowson took it as though it were something fragile , and the sculls fixed under [his]217-widdowson elbows turned to the fly - leaf .

' What ? It is [your]217-widdowson birthday ? '[195-monica]

' Yes . [I]195-monica am twenty - one . '[195-monica]

The last remark was uttered anxiously , mournfully . Then , as if to reassure [himself]217-widdowson by exerting physical strength , [he]217-widdowson drove [the boat]826-the boat along with half a dozen vigorous strokes . [Monica]195-monica was rustling over the pages , but without seeing them .

' [I]812-her companion do n't think , '[812-her companion] said [[her]195-monica companion]812-her companion presently , ' [you]217-widdowson are very well contented with [your]217-widdowson life in [that house of business]3744-that house of business . '[812-her companion]

[Monica]195-monica answered with all necessary detail , and went on to mention the proposal that had been made to [her]195-monica . [The hearer]830-the hearer reflected , and put further questions . But [Widdowson]217-widdowson had become abstracted ; [he]217-widdowson ceased pulling , crossed [his]217-widdowson arms on the oars , and watched other boats that were near . ' Yes , '[217-widdowson] fell from [him]217-widdowson at length , as though in continuation of something [he]217-widdowson had been saying , ' [I]217-widdowson began to earn [my]217-widdowson bread when [I]217-widdowson was fourteen . [I]0-i did serve [him]3748-my father for years , and for next to no payment , but [he]3748-my father taught [me]0-i nothing more than [he]3748-my father could help . [He]3748-my father was one of [those heartless , utterly selfish men]845-those heartless , utterly selfish men that [one meets too often in the business world]846-one meets too often in the business world . '[3748-my father]

[He]3748-my father was silent , and began rowing again .

' What happened [them]3755-them ? '[195-monica] asked [Monica]195-monica .

'[3748-my father]

' [I]195-monica ca n't understand that , '[195-monica] remarked [Monica]195-monica thoughtfully .

' Why not ? '[3748-my father]

' [You]849-i seem to to be the kind of man that would make [your]849-i way . '[3748-my father]

' Do [I]3748-my father ? '[3748-my father] The description pleased [him]849-i ; [he]849-i laughed cheerfully . ' But [I]849-i never found what [my]849-i way was to be . ' But [[your]195-monica brother]3773-your brother got on well . Why did n't [he]3773-your brother help [you]195-monica ? '[3748-my father]

' [We]3774-we could n't agree . [We]3774-we always quarrelled . '[849-i]

' Are [you]217-widdowson really so ill - tempered ? '[3748-my father]

It was asked in [Monica]195-monica 's most naive tone , with a serious air of investigation which at first confused [Widdowson]217-widdowson , then made [him]217-widdowson laugh .

' Since [I]217-widdowson was [a lad]3775-a lad , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson replied , ' [I]217-widdowson have never quarrelled with [any one]3776-any one except [[my]217-widdowson brother]3777-my brother . ' So [[your]217-widdowson brother]3773-your brother always refused to help [you]217-widdowson ? '[849-i]

' It was n't easy for [him]3773-your brother to help [me]217-widdowson . [He]3773-your brother got into [a stockbroker]3783-a stockbroker 's , and went on step by step until [he]3773-your brother had saved a little money ; then [he]3773-your brother speculated in all sorts of ways . [He]3773-your brother was [a born money - maker]3787-a born money - maker . [I]217-widdowson 'll give [you]3788-you an example of how [he]3773-your brother grew rich . In consequence of some mortgage business [he]3773-your brother came into possession of [a field at [Clapham]46-clapham]3789-a field at clapham . As late as 1875 [this field]3790-this field brought [him]3773-your brother only a rent of forty pounds ; it was freehold property , and [he]3773-your brother refused many offers of purchase . Well , in 1885 , the year before [he]3773-your brother died , the ground - rents from [that field now covered with houses]3791-that field now covered with houses were seven hundred and ninety pounds a year . That 's how [men]3461-men get on who have capital and know how to use it . If [I]217-widdowson had had capital , it would never have yielded [me]217-widdowson more than three or four per cent . [I]217-widdowson was doomed to work for [other people who were growing rich]3793-other people who were growing rich . It does n't matter much now , except that so many years of life have been lost . '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica drew in [her]195-monica breath silently , then gazed at the distance .

' No , [I]849-i have n't made [any new friends]3801-any new friends . When a few minutes had passed in silence , [he]851-you asked ,

' [One]472-one never knows . [I]849-i doubted whether [I]849-i ought to talk with [a stranger]557-a stranger '[849-i]

[A large boat]856-a large boat was passing with [four or five young men]857-four or five young men and [girls who sang in good time and tune . ' And [you]854-i will let [me]860-me see [you]851-you again before long ? Let [me]860-me drive [you]851-you to [Hampton Court]47-hampton court next Sunday or [any other place [you]851-you would choose]3811-any other place you would choose . '[860-me]

[He]860-me bent [his]860-me head , looked desperately grave , and drove [the boat]826-the boat on [Monica]195-monica was disturbed , but held to [her]195-monica resolution , which [Widdowson]217-widdowson silently accepted . ' Now [I]195-monica must go quickly [home]364-home , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica .

' But how ? '[217-widdowson]

' By [train]3815-train from [York Road]48-york road to [Walworth Road]7-walworth road . '[217-widdowson]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson cast a curious glance at [her]195-monica . [One]472-one would have imagined that [he]217-widdowson found something to disapprove in this ready knowledge of [London]6-london transit .

' [I]217-widdowson will go with [you]195-monica to [the station]586-the station , then . '[217-widdowson]

Without a word spoken , [they]862-they walked the short distance to [York Road]48-york road . [Monica]195-monica took [her]195-monica ticket , and offered a hand for good - bye .

' [I]217-widdowson may write to [you]195-monica , '[217-widdowson] said [Widdowson]217-widdowson , [his]217-widdowson face set in an expression of anxiety , ' and make an appointment , if possible , for the Sunday after next ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson shall be glad to come if [I]217-widdowson can . '[217-widdowson]

' It will be a very long time to [me]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

With a faint smile , [Monica]195-monica hurried away to [the platform]865-the platform . In [the train]866-the train [she]195-monica looked like one whose mind is occupied with grave trouble . At [a street corner very near to [Messrs. Scotcher 's establishment]868-messrs. scotcher 's establishment]867-a street corner very near to messrs. scotcher 's establishment [she]195-monica was intercepted by [a tall , showily - dressed , rather coarse - featured girl , who seemed to have been loitering about]869-a tall , showily - dressed , rather coarse - featured girl , who seemed to have been loitering about . [The gifted anecdotist]897-the gifted anecdotist replied with a long laugh , then cried , ' Good - night , [young ladies]3828-young ladies ! '[897-the gifted anecdotist] and sank peacefully to slumber .

As for [Monica]195-monica , [she]195-monica saw the white dawn peep at the window , and closed [her]195-monica tear - stained eyes only when the life of a new week had begun noisily in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road .

CHAPTER VI

A CAMP OF [THE RESERVE]3707-the reserve

In consequence of letters exchanged during the week , next Sunday brought [the three Miss Maddens]899-the three miss maddens to [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road to lunch with [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . [Alice]185-alice had recovered from [her]185-alice cold , but was still ailing , and took rather a gloomy view of the situation [she]185-alice had lately reviewed with such courage . [Virginia]191-virginia maintained [her]191-virginia enthusiastic faith in [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , and was prepared to reverence [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot with hardly less fervour . [Both of [them]534-both of them]534-both of them found it difficult to understand [[their]534-both of them young sister]901-their young sister , who , in [her]901-their young sister letters , had betrayed distaste for the change of career proposed to [her]901-their young sister . [They]534-both of them were received with the utmost kindness , and all greatly enjoyed [their]534-both of them afternoon , for not even [Monica]195-monica 's prejudice against [a house]902-a house , which in [her]195-monica own mind [she]195-monica had stigmatized as ' [an old - maid factory]3829-an old - maid factory , '[195-monica] could resist the charm of [the hostess]903-the hostess .

Though [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had something less than [a woman]615-a woman 's average stature , the note of [her]212-miss barfoot presence was personal dignity . [She]212-miss barfoot was handsome , and [her]212-miss barfoot carriage occasionally betrayed a consciousness of the fact . According to circumstances , [she]212-miss barfoot bore [herself]212-miss barfoot as [the lady of aristocratic tastes]905-the lady of aristocratic tastes , as [a genial woman of the world]906-a genial woman of the world , or as [a fervid prophetess of female emancipation]907-a fervid prophetess of female emancipation , and [each character]908-each character was supported with a spontaneity , a good - natured confidence , which inspired liking and respect . A brilliant complexion and eyes that sparkled with habitual cheerfulness gave [her]212-miss barfoot the benefit of doubt when [her]212-miss barfoot age was in question ; [her]212-miss barfoot style of dress , gracefully ornate , would have led [a stranger]557-a stranger to presume [her]212-miss barfoot [a wedded lady of some distinction]910-a wedded lady of some distinction . Yet [Mary Barfoot]225-mary had known many troubles , poverty among them . [Her]212-miss barfoot experiences and struggles bore a close resemblance to those which [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda had gone through , and the time of trial had lasted longer . Mental and moral stamina would have assured [her]212-miss barfoot against such evils of celibacy as appeared in [the elder Maddens]911-the elder maddens , but it was to a change of worldly fortune that [she]212-miss barfoot owed this revival of youthful spirit and energy in middle life .

' [You]195-monica and [I]212-miss barfoot must be [friends]3725-friends , '[212-miss barfoot] [she]212-miss barfoot said to [Monica]195-monica , holding [the girl]384-the girl 's soft little hand . ' [We]3831-we are both black but comely . '[212-miss barfoot]

The compliment to [herself]195-monica seemed the most natural thing in [the world]3462-the world . [Monica]195-monica blushed with pleasure , and could not help laughing .

It was all but decided that [Monica]195-monica should become [a pupil at [the school in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]915-the school in great portland street]914-a pupil at the school in great portland street . ' Nothing but a business transaction , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . [The visitors]916-the visitors took [their]916-the visitors leave at about five o'clock .

' But surely [you]903-the hostess do n't limit [your]903-the hostess humanity , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , by the artificial divisions of society . '[226-mrs. smallbrook]

' [I]903-the hostess think those divisions are anything but artificial , '[903-the hostess] replied [the hostess]903-the hostess good - humouredly . ' In [the uneducated classes]3871-the uneducated classes [I]903-the hostess have no interest whatever . [You]903-the hostess have heard [me]903-the hostess say so .[903-the hostess]

' Yes , but [I]226-mrs. smallbrook can not think is n't that just a little narrow ? '[226-mrs. smallbrook]

' Perhaps so . [I]903-the hostess choose [my]903-the hostess sphere , that 's all . ' But surely , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , '[934-the widow] cried [the widow]934-the widow , turning to [Rhoda]197-rhoda , ' [we]3874-we work for the abolition of all unjust privilege ? To [us]3874-we , is not [a woman]615-a woman [a woman]615-a woman ? '[934-the widow]

' [I]903-the hostess am obliged to agree with [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . [We]3874-we have to learn a new language , for one thing . But [your]212-miss barfoot missionary enterprise is admirable . '[903-the hostess]

' For [my]226-mrs. smallbrook part , '[226-mrs. smallbrook] declared [Mrs. Smallbrook]226-mrs. smallbrook , ' [I]226-mrs. smallbrook aim at the solidarity of [woman]3471-woman . ' [I]227-miss haven really do n't think , [aunt]928-aunt , that there can be any solidarity of [ladies]3880-ladies with [servant girls]3881-servant girls , '[227-miss haven] responded [Miss Haven]227-miss haven , encouraged by a look from [Rhoda]197-rhoda .

' Then [I]197-rhoda grieve that [your]212-miss barfoot charity falls so far below the Christian standard . '[197-rhoda]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot firmly guided the conversation to a more hopeful subject .

[Not many people]946-not many people visited [this house]947-this house . Every Wednesday evening , from half - past eight to eleven , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was at [home]364-home to [any of [[her]212-miss barfoot acquaintances]950-her acquaintances , including [[her]212-miss barfoot pupils]951-her pupils , who chose to call upon [her]212-miss barfoot]949-any of her acquaintances , including her pupils , who chose to call upon her ; but this was in the nature of an association with recognized objects . Of society in the common sense [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot saw very little ; [she]212-miss barfoot had no time to sacrifice in the pursuit of idle ceremonies . By the successive deaths of [two relatives]952-two relatives , [a widowed sister]953-a widowed sister and [an uncle]954-an uncle , [she]212-miss barfoot had come into possession of a modest fortune ; but no thought of a life such as would have suggested itself to [most women in [her]212-miss barfoot place]955-most women in her place ever tempted [her]212-miss barfoot . [Her]212-miss barfoot studies had always been of a very positive nature ; [her]212-miss barfoot abilities were of a kind uncommon in [women]3478-women , or at all events very rarely developed in one of [her]212-miss barfoot sex . [She]212-miss barfoot could have managed a large and complicated business , could have filled a place on [a board of directors]957-a board of directors , have taken an active part in municipal government nay , perchance in [national]958-national . And this turn of intellect consisted with many traits of character so strongly feminine that [people who knew [her]212-miss barfoot best]959-people who knew her best thought of [her]212-miss barfoot with as much tenderness as admiration . [She]212-miss barfoot did not seek to become known as [the leader of a ' movement]3882-the leader of a ' movement , '[3882-the leader of a ' movement] yet [her]212-miss barfoot quiet work was probably more effectual than the public career of [women who propagandize for female emancipation]960-women who propagandize for female emancipation . [Her]212-miss barfoot aim was to draw from the overstocked profession of teaching [as many capable young women as [she]212-miss barfoot could lay hands on]961-as many capable young women as she could lay hands on , and to fit [them]961-as many capable young women as she could lay hands on for certain of the pursuits nowadays thrown open to [their]961-as many capable young women as she could lay hands on sex . [She]212-miss barfoot held the conviction that whatever [man]962-man could do , [woman]3471-woman could do equally well those tasks only excepted which demand great physical strength . At [her]212-miss barfoot instance , and with help from [her]212-miss barfoot purse , [two girls]964-two girls were preparing [themselves]964-two girls to be [pharmaceutical chemists]965-pharmaceutical chemists ; [two others]966-two others had been aided by [her]212-miss barfoot to open [[a bookseller]967-a bookseller 's shop]968-a bookseller 's shop ; and [several who had clerkships in view]969-several who had clerkships in view received an admirable training ' at [[her]212-miss barfoot school in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]3883-her school in great portland street .[212-miss barfoot]

[Thither]212-miss barfoot every weekday morning [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Rhoda]197-rhoda repaired ; [they]970-they arrived at nine o'clock , and with an hour 's interval work went on until five .

Entering by the private door of a picture - cleaner 's shop , [they]970-they ascended to [the second story]971-the second story , where [two rooms]972-two rooms had been furnished like [comfortable offices]973-comfortable offices ; two smaller on the floor above served for [dressing - rooms]974-dressing - rooms . In [one of [the offices]976-the offices]975-one of the offices , typewriting and occasionally other kinds of work that demanded intelligence were carried on by [three or four young women]977-three or four young women regularly employed . To superintend [this department]978-this department was [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's chief duty , together with business correspondence under [the principal]979-the principal 's direction . In [the second room]980-the second room [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot instructed [[her]212-miss barfoot pupils]951-her pupils , never more than three being with [her]212-miss barfoot at a time . A bookcase full of works on [the Woman Question and allied topics]982-the woman question and allied topics served as a circulating library ; volumes were lent without charge to [the members of [this little society]984-this little society]983-the members of this little society . Once a month [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot or [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , by turns , gave a brief address on some set subject ; the hour was four o'clock , and [about a dozen hearers]985-about a dozen hearers generally assembled . [Both]525-both worked very hard . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot did not look upon [her]212-miss barfoot enterprise as a source of pecuniary profit , but [she]212-miss barfoot had made the establishment more than self - supporting . [[Her]212-miss barfoot pupils]951-her pupils increased in number , and [the working department]988-the working department promised occupation for a larger staff than was at present engaged . [The young women in general]989-the young women in general answered [[their]989-the young women in general friend]990-their friend 's expectations , but of course there were disappointing instances . One of these had caused [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot special distress . [A young girl whom [she]212-miss barfoot [had released from a life of much hardship , and who , after a couple of months ' trial , bade fair to develop noteworthy ability , of a sudden disappeared]3885-had released from a life of much hardship , and who , after a couple of months ' trial , bade fair to develop noteworthy ability , of a sudden disappeared]3884-a young girl whom she had released from a life of much hardship , and who , after a couple of months ' trial , bade fair to develop noteworthy ability , of a sudden disappeared . This Monday morning , among letters delivered at [the house]368-the house , was one from [the strayed girl]992-the strayed girl . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot read it in private , and throughout the day remained unusually grave . At five o'clock , when [staff]993-staff and [pupils]778-pupils had all departed , [she]212-miss barfoot sat for a while in meditation , then spoke to [Rhoda]197-rhoda , who was glancing over a book by the window .

' Here 's a letter [I]212-miss barfoot should like [you]212-miss barfoot to read . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Something that has been troubling [you]212-miss barfoot since morning , is n't it ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Yes . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda took the sheet and quickly ran through its contents . [Her]197-rhoda face hardened , and [she]197-rhoda threw down the letter with a smile of contempt .

' What do [you]212-miss barfoot advise ? '[924-the elder woman] asked [the elder woman]924-the elder woman , closely observing [her]212-miss barfoot .

' An answer in two lines with a cheque enclosed , if [you]212-miss barfoot see fit . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Does that really meet the case ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' More than meets it , [I]212-miss barfoot should say . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot pondered .

' [I]212-miss barfoot am doubtful . That is a letter of despair , and [I]212-miss barfoot ca n't close [my]212-miss barfoot ears to it . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [You]212-miss barfoot had an affection for [the girl]384-the girl . Help [her]384-the girl , by all means , if [you]212-miss barfoot feel compelled to . But [you]212-miss barfoot would hardly dream of taking [her]384-the girl back again ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' That 's the point . Why should n't [I]212-miss barfoot ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' For one thing , '[197-rhoda] replied [Rhoda]197-rhoda , looking coldly down upon [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend , ' [you]212-miss barfoot will never do any good with [her]384-the girl . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]212-miss barfoot ca n't be sure of either objection . [She]384-the girl acted with deplorable rashness , with infatuation , but [I]212-miss barfoot never discovered any sign of evil in [her]384-the girl . Did [you]212-miss barfoot ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Evil ? Well , what does the word mean ? [I]197-rhoda am not [a Puritan]3893-a puritan , and [I]197-rhoda do n't judge [her]384-the girl as [the ordinary woman]3894-the ordinary woman would . But [I]197-rhoda think [she]384-the girl has put [herself]384-the girl altogether beyond [our]3895-our sympathy . [She]384-the girl was twenty - two years old [no child]3896-no child and [she]384-the girl acted with [her]384-the girl eyes open . No deceit was practised with [her]384-the girl . [She]384-the girl knew [the man]350-the man had [a wife]514-a wife , and [she]384-the girl was base enough to accept a share of [his]350-the man attentions . ' [[My]212-miss barfoot dear]3534-my dear [Rhoda]197-rhoda , do n't enrage [yourself]197-rhoda . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]197-rhoda will try not to . '[197-rhoda]

' But [I]212-miss barfoot ca n't see the temptation to do so . Come and sit down , and talk quietly . No , [I]212-miss barfoot have no fondness for polygamy . [I]212-miss barfoot find it very hard to understand how [she]384-the girl could act as [she]384-the girl did . But a mistake , however wretched , must n't condemn [a woman]615-a woman for life . That 's the way of [the world]3462-the world , and decidedly it must n't be [ours]3902-ours . '[212-miss barfoot]

' On this point [I]197-rhoda practically agree with [the world]3462-the world . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]212-miss barfoot see [you]212-miss barfoot do , and it astonishes [me]212-miss barfoot . [You]212-miss barfoot are going through curious changes , in several respects . A year ago [you]212-miss barfoot did n't speak of [her]384-the girl like this . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Partly because [I]197-rhoda did n't know [you]212-miss barfoot well enough to speak [my]197-rhoda mind . Partly yes , [I]197-rhoda have changed a good deal , no doubt . ' A favourite word on [your]212-miss barfoot lips just now , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Why is it anti - social ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Because one of the supreme social needs of [our]3902-ours day is the education of [women]3478-women in self - respect and self - restraint . ' [I]212-miss barfoot do n't , altogether . " The education of [women]3478-women in self - respect . " Very well . [She]3908-a poor woman whose self - respect has given way under grievous temptation has brains , and does n't belong to [the vulgar]3912-the vulgar . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's strong features were moved as if by a suppressed laugh ; the colour of [her]197-rhoda cheeks grew very slightly warm .

' [You]197-rhoda will bring [this girl]3849-this girl back , and continue teaching [her]3849-this girl as before ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , and at a stroke change the whole character of [your]197-rhoda work . [You]197-rhoda never proposed keeping a reformatory .
