[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was silent . [She]212-miss barfoot tapped with [her]212-miss barfoot fingers on the table .

' Personal feeling is misleading [you]197-rhoda , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda pursued . ' [Miss Royston]228-miss royston had a certain cleverness , [I]197-rhoda grant ; but do [you]197-rhoda think [I]197-rhoda did n't know that [she]228-miss royston would never become what [you]197-rhoda hoped ? All [her]228-miss royston spare time was given to novel - reading . If [every novelist]3931-every novelist could be strangled and thrown into [the sea]417-the sea [we]3933-we should have some chance of reforming [women]3478-women . [The girl]384-the girl 's nature was corrupted with sentimentality , like that of all but [every woman who is intelligent enough to read what is called the best fiction]3936-every woman who is intelligent enough to read what is called the best fiction , but not intelligent enough to understand its vice . Love love love ; a sickening sameness of vulgarity . What is more vulgar than the ideal of [novelists]3937-novelists ? [They]3937-novelists wo n't represent [the actual world]3938-the actual world ; it would be too dull for [[their]3937-novelists readers]3939-their readers . In real life , how many [men]3461-men and [women]3478-women fall in love ? Not one in every ten thousand , [I]197-rhoda am convinced . [Not one married pair in ten thousand]3942-not one married pair in ten thousand have felt for [each other]543-each other as [two or three couples]3944-two or three couples do in every novel . There is the sexual instinct , of course , but that is quite a different thing ; [the novelists]3945-the novelists dare n't talk about that . [The paltry creatures]3946-the paltry creatures dare n't tell the one truth that would be profitable . The result is that [women]3478-women imagine [themselves]3478-women noble and glorious when [they]3478-women are most near the animals . This [Miss Royston]228-miss royston when [she]228-miss royston rushed off to perdition , ten to one [she]228-miss royston had in mind [some idiot heroine of a book]3948-some idiot heroine of a book . Oh , [I]197-rhoda tell [you]3949-you that [you]3949-you are losing sight of [your]3949-you first duty . There are [people]3536-people enough to act [the good Samaritan]3951-the good samaritan ; [you]3949-you have quite another task in life . It is [your]3949-you work to train and encourage [girls]3460-girls in a path as far as possible from that of [the husband - hunter]3953-the husband - hunter . Let [them]3460-girls marry later , if [they]3460-girls must ; but at all events [you]3949-you will have cleared [their]3460-girls views on the subject of marriage , and put [them]3460-girls in a position to judge [the man who offers [himself]3954-the man who offers himself]3954-the man who offers himself . [You]3949-you will have taught [them]3460-girls that marriage is an alliance of intellects not a means of support , or something more ignoble still . But to do this with effect [you]3949-you must show [yourself]3949-you relentless to female imbecility . If [a girl]3628-a girl gets to know that [you]3949-you have received back such a person as [Miss Royston]228-miss royston [she]3628-a girl will be corrupted by [your]3949-you spirit of charity corrupted , at all events , for [our]3956-we purposes . The endeavour to give [women]3478-women a new soul is so difficult that [we]3956-we ca n't be cumbered by side - tasks , such as fishing [foolish people out of the mud [they]3958-foolish people out of the mud they have walked into have walked into]3958-foolish people out of the mud they have walked into . Charity for human weakness is all very well in its place , but it is precisely one of the virtues that [you]3949-you must not teach . [You]3949-you have to set an example of the sterner qualities to discourage anything that resembles sentimentalism . And think if [you]3949-you illustrate in [your]3949-you own behaviour a sympathy for the very vice of character [we]3956-we are trying [our]3956-we hardest to extirpate ! '[197-rhoda]

' This is a terrible harangue , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , when the passionate voice had been silent for a few ticks of the clock . ' [I]212-miss barfoot quite enter into [your]3949-you point of view , but [I]212-miss barfoot think [you]3949-you go beyond practical zeal . However , [I]212-miss barfoot will help [the girl]384-the girl in some other way , if possible . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]212-miss barfoot have offended [you]212-miss barfoot . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Impossible to take offence at such obvious sincerity . '[212-miss barfoot]

' But surely [you]212-miss barfoot grant the force of what [I]212-miss barfoot say ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [We]3956-we differ a good deal , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , on certain points which as a rule would never come up to interfere with [our]3956-we working in harmony . [You]3949-you have come to dislike the very thought of marriage and everything of that kind . [I]212-miss barfoot think it 's a danger [you]3949-you ought to have avoided . True , [we]3956-we wish to prevent [girls]3460-girls from marrying just for the sake of being supported , and from degrading [themselves]3460-girls as poor [Bella Royston]194-isabel has done ; but surely between [ourselves]3956-we [we]3956-we can admit that [the vast majority of [women]3478-women]3961-the vast majority of women would lead a wasted life if [they]3961-the vast majority of women did not marry . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]212-miss barfoot maintain that [the vast majority of [women]3478-women]3961-the vast majority of women lead a vain and miserable life because [they]3961-the vast majority of women do marry . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Do n't [you]212-miss barfoot blame the institution of marriage with what is chargeable to human fate ? A vain and miserable life is the lot of [nearly all mortals]3965-nearly all mortals . [Most women]3966-most women , whether [they]3966-most women marry or not , will suffer and commit endless follies . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Most women as life is at present arranged for [them]3966-most women . Things are changing , and [we]3956-we try to have [our]3956-we part in hastening a new order . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Ah , [we]3956-we use words in a different sense . [I]212-miss barfoot speak of human nature , not of the effect of institutions . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Now it is [you]212-miss barfoot who are unpractical . Those views lead only to pessimism and paralysis of effort . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot rose .

' [I]212-miss barfoot give in to [your]212-miss barfoot objection against bringing [the girl]384-the girl back to work [here]3495-here . [I]212-miss barfoot will help [her]384-the girl in other ways . It 's quite true that [she]384-the girl is n't to be relied upon . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Impossible to trust [her]384-the girl in any detail of life . The pity is that [her]384-the girl degradation ca n't be used as an object lesson for [[our]3956-we other girls]3969-our other girls . '[212-miss barfoot]

' There again [we]3956-we differ . [You]212-miss barfoot are quite mistaken in [your]212-miss barfoot ideas of how the mind is influenced . The misery of [Bella Royston]194-isabel would not in the least affect [any other girl]3970-any other girl 's way of thinking about the destiny of [her]384-the girl sex . [We]3956-we must avoid exaggeration . If [[our]3956-we friends]3921-our friends get to think of [us]3956-we as [fanatics]3972-fanatics , all [our]3956-we usefulness is over . The ideal [we]3956-we set up must be human . Do [you]212-miss barfoot think now that [we]3956-we know [one single girl who in [her]3973-one single girl who in her heart heart]3973-one single girl who in her heart believes it is better never to love and never to marry ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Perhaps not , '[197-rhoda] admitted [Rhoda]197-rhoda , more cheerful now that [she]197-rhoda had gained [her]197-rhoda point . ' But [we]3956-we know [several who will not dream of marrying]3974-several who will not dream of marrying unless reason urges [them]3974-several who will not dream of marrying as strongly as inclination . '[197-rhoda]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot laughed .

' [Pray]229-pray , who ever distinguished in such a case between reason and inclination ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [You]212-miss barfoot are most unusually sceptical to - day , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with an impatient laugh .

' No , [[my]212-miss barfoot dear]3534-my dear . [We]3956-we happen to be going to the root of things , that 's all . Perhaps it 's as well to do so now and then . Oh , [I]212-miss barfoot admire [you]3534-my dear immensely , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . [You]3534-my dear are [the ideal adversary of [those care - nothing and believe - nothing women who keep [the world]3462-the world back]3977-those care - nothing and believe - nothing women who keep the world back . But do n't prepare for [yourself]3534-my dear a woeful disillusion]3976-the ideal adversary of those care - nothing and believe - nothing women who keep the world back . but do n't prepare for yourself a woeful disillusion . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Take the case of [Winifred Haven]227-miss haven , '[197-rhoda] urged [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . ' [She]227-miss haven is [a good - looking and charming girl]3979-a good - looking and charming girl , and [some one or other]3980-some one or other will want to marry [her]227-miss haven some day , no doubt . '[197-rhoda]

' Forgive [my]212-miss barfoot interrupting [you]462-the other . There is great doubt . [She]227-miss haven has no money but what [she]227-miss haven can earn , and [such girls]3981-such girls , unless [they]3981-such girls are exceptionally beautiful , are very likely indeed to remain unsought . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Granted . But let [us]3982-we suppose [she]227-miss haven has an offer . Should [you]462-the other fear for [her]227-miss haven prudence ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Winifred]227-miss haven has much good sense , '[462-the other] admitted [the other]462-the other . ' [I]462-the other think [she]227-miss haven is in as little danger as [any girl [we]3982-we know]3983-any girl we know . But it would n't startle [me]462-the other if [she]227-miss haven made the most lamentable mistake . Certainly [I]462-the other do n't fear it . [The girls of [our]3982-we class]3984-the girls of our class are not like the uneducated , who , for one reason or another , will marry almost [any man rather than remain single]3985-any man rather than remain single . [They]3984-the girls of our class have at all events personal delicacy . But what [I]462-the other insist upon is , that [Winifred]227-miss haven would rather marry than not . And [we]3982-we must carefully bear that fact in mind . A strained ideal is as bad , practically , as no ideal at all . Only [the most exceptional girl]3986-the most exceptional girl will believe it [her]3986-the most exceptional girl duty to remain single as an example and support to what [we]3982-we call [the odd women]3987-the odd women ; yet that is the most human way of urging what [you]3988-you desire . By taking up the proud position that [a woman]615-a woman must be altogether independent of sexual things , [you]3988-you damage [your]3988-you cause . Let [us]3982-we be glad if [we]3982-we put a few of them in the way of living single with no more discontent than [an unmarried man]3990-an unmarried man experiences . '[462-the other]

' Surely that 's an unfortunate comparison , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda coldly . ' [What man]3991-what man lives in celibacy ? Consider that unmentionable fact , and then say whether [I]197-rhoda am wrong in refusing to forgive [Miss Royston]228-miss royston . [Women]3478-women 's battle is not only against [themselves]3478-women . The necessity of the case demands what [you]3988-you call a strained ideal . [I]197-rhoda am seriously convinced that before the female sex can be raised from its low level there will have to be a widespread revolt against sexual instinct . Christianity could n't spread over [the world]3462-the world without help of [the ascetic ideal]3994-the ascetic ideal , and this great movement for [woman]3471-woman 's emancipation must also have its ascetics . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]462-the other ca n't declare that [you]462-the other are wrong in that . Who knows ? But it is n't good policy to preach it to [[our]3982-we young disciples]3996-our young disciples . '[462-the other]

' [I]197-rhoda shall respect [your]462-the other wish ; but '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda paused and shook [her]197-rhoda head .

' [[My]924-the elder woman dear]3534-my dear , '[924-the elder woman] said [the elder woman]924-the elder woman gravely , ' believe [me]924-the elder woman that the less [we]3982-we talk or think about such things the better for the peace of [us]3982-we all . The odious fault of [working - class girls , in [town]624-town and [country]4000-country alike]3998-working - class girls , in town and country alike , is that [they]3998-working - class girls , in town and country alike are absorbed in preoccupation with [their]3998-working - class girls , in town and country alike animal nature . [We]3982-we , thanks to [our]3982-we education and the tone of [[our]3982-we society]4001-our society , manage to keep that in the background . Do n't interfere with this satisfactory state of things . Be content to show [[our]3982-we girls]4002-our girls that it is [their]4002-our girls duty to lead a life of effort to earn [their]4002-our girls bread and to cultivate [their]4002-our girls minds . Simply ignore marriage that 's the wisest . Behave as if the thing did n't exist . [You]3534-my dear will do positive harm by taking the other course the aggressive course . '[924-the elder woman]

' [I]212-miss barfoot shall obey [you]212-miss barfoot . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Good , [humble creature]4003-humble creature ! '[212-miss barfoot] laughed [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . ' Come , let [us]3982-we be off to [Chelsea]19-chelsea . Did [Miss Grey]230-miss grey finish that copy for [Mr. Houghton]231-mr. houghton ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Yes , it has gone to post . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Look , here 's a big manuscript from [[our]3982-we friend]4004-our friend [the antiquary]4005-the antiquary . [Two of [the girls]375-the girls]4006-two of the girls must get to work on it at once in the morning . '[212-miss barfoot]

Manuscripts entrusted to [them]1000-them were kept in a fire - proof safe . When this had been locked up , [the ladies]1001-the ladies went to [[their]1001-the ladies dressing - room]1002-their dressing - room and prepared for departure . [The people who lived on [the premises]1004-the premises]1003-the people who lived on the premises were responsible for cleaning [the rooms]1005-the rooms and other care ; to [them]1003-the people who lived on the premises [Rhoda]197-rhoda delivered the door - keys .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was grave and silent on the way [home]364-home . [Rhoda]197-rhoda , annoyed at the subject that doubtless occupied [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend 's thoughts , gave [herself]197-rhoda up to reflections of [her]197-rhoda own .

CHAPTER VII

A SOCIAL ADVANCE

A week 's notice to [[her]1008-her employers]656-her employers would release [Monica]195-monica from the engagement in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road . Such notice must be given on Monday , so that , if [she]1008-her could at once make up [her]1008-her mind to accept [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's offer , the coming week would be [her]1008-her last of slavery behind the counter . On the way [home]364-home from [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road , [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia pressed for immediate decision ; [they]1011-they were unable to comprehend how [Monica]195-monica could hesitate for another moment . The question of [[her]195-monica place of abode]1012-her place of abode had already been discussed . [One of [[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's young women , who lived at a convenient distance from [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]1014-miss barfoot 's young women , who lived at a convenient distance from great portland street]1013-one of miss barfoot 's young women , who lived at a convenient distance from great portland street , would gladly accept [a partner in [her]195-monica lodging]1015-a partner in her lodging an arrangement to be recommended for [its]1016-its economy . Yet [Monica]195-monica shrank from speaking the final word .

' [I]191-virginia do n't know whether it 's worth while , '[191-virginia] [she]191-virginia said , after a long silence , as [they]1017-they drew near to [York Road Station]50-york road station , whence [they]1017-they were to take train for [Clapham Junction]51-clapham junction .

' Not worth while ? '[191-virginia] exclaimed [Virginia]191-virginia . ' [You]191-virginia do n't think it would be an improvement ? '[191-virginia]

' Yes , [I]191-virginia suppose it would . [I]191-virginia shall see how [I]191-virginia feel about it tomorrow morning . '[191-virginia]

[She]191-virginia spent the evening at [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill , but without change in the mood thus indicated . A strange inquietude appeared in [her]191-virginia behaviour . It was as though [she]191-virginia were being urged to undertake something hard and repugnant .

On [her]191-virginia return to [Walworth Road]7-walworth road , just as [she]191-virginia came within sight of [the shop]582-the shop , [she]191-virginia observed [a man]3627-a man 's figure some twenty yards distant , which instantly held [her]191-virginia attention . The dim gaslight occasioned some uncertainty , but [she]191-virginia believed [the figure]1020-the figure was that of [Widdowson]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson was walking on the other side of [the street]594-the street , and away from [her]191-virginia . When [the man]350-the man was exactly opposite [[Scotcher]220-scotcher 's establishment]1023-scotcher 's establishment [he]217-widdowson gazed in that direction , but without stopping . [Monica]195-monica hastened , fearing to be seen and approached . Already [she]195-monica had reached the door , when [Widdowson]217-widdowson yes , [he]217-widdowson it was turned abruptly to walk back again . [His]217-widdowson eye was at once upon [her]191-virginia ; but whether [he]217-widdowson recognized [her]191-virginia or not [Monica]195-monica could not know . At that moment [she]195-monica opened the door and passed in .

A fit of trembling seized [her]195-monica , as if [she]195-monica had barely escaped some peril . In [the passage]425-the passage [she]195-monica stood motionless , listening with the intensity of dread . [She]195-monica could hear footsteps on [the pavement]1025-the pavement ; [she]195-monica expected a ring at the door - bell . If [he]217-widdowson were so thoughtless as to come to the door , [she]195-monica would on no account see [him]217-widdowson .

But there was no ring , and after a few minutes ' waiting [she]195-monica recovered [her]195-monica self - command . [She]195-monica had not made a mistake ; even [his]217-widdowson features had been discernible as [he]217-widdowson turned towards [her]195-monica . Was this the first time that [he]217-widdowson had come to look at [the place where [she]195-monica lived]4008-the place where she lived possibly to spy upon [her]195-monica ? [She]195-monica resented this behaviour , yet the feeling was confused with a certain satisfaction .[195-monica]

From [one of [the dormitories]1027-the dormitories]1026-one of the dormitories there was a view of [Walworth Road]7-walworth road . [She]195-monica ran [upstairs]443-upstairs , softly opened the door of [that room]1029-that room , and peeped in . The low burning gas showed [her]195-monica that only [one bed]1030-one bed had [an occupant , who appeared to be asleep]1031-an occupant , who appeared to be asleep . [Softly]232-softly [she]195-monica went to the window , drew the blind aside , and looked down into [the street]594-the street . But [Widdowson]217-widdowson had disappeared . [He]217-widdowson might of course be on this side of the way .

' Who 's that ? '[462-the other] suddenly asked a voice from the occupied bed .

[The speaker]884-the speaker was [Miss Eade]216-miss eade . [Monica]195-monica looked at [her]884-the speaker , and nodded .

' [You]884-the speaker ? What are [you]884-the speaker doing [here]3495-here ? '[884-the speaker]

' [I]884-the speaker wanted to see if [some one]735-some one was standing outside . '[884-the speaker]

' [You]884-the speaker mean [him]735-some one ? '[884-the speaker]

[The other]462-the other nodded .

' [I]462-the other 've got a beastly headache . [I]462-the other could n't hold [myself]462-the other up , and [I]462-the other had to come [home]364-home at eight o'clock . There 's such pains all down [my]462-the other back too . [I]462-the other sha n't stay at [this beastly place]4012-this beastly place much longer . [I]462-the other do n't want to get ill , like [Miss Radford]233-miss radford . [Somebody]4013-somebody went to see [her]233-miss radford at [the hospital]3652-the hospital this afternoon , and [she]233-miss radford 's awfully bad . Well , have [you]195-monica seen [him]4013-somebody ? '[462-the other]

' [He]4013-somebody 's gone . Good - night . '[884-the speaker]

And [Monica]195-monica left [the room]444-the room .

Next day [she]195-monica notified [her]195-monica intention of leaving [her]195-monica employment . No questions were asked ; [she]195-monica was of no particular importance ; fifty , or , for the matter of that , five score , young women equally capable could be found to fill [[her]195-monica place]1036-her place .

On Tuesday morning there came a letter from [Virginia]191-virginia a few lines requesting [her]195-monica to meet [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters , as soon as possible after closing time that evening , in front of [the shop]582-the shop . ' [We]4015-we have something very delightful to tell [you]195-monica . [We]4015-we do hope [you]195-monica gave notice to - day , as things are getting so bright in every direction . '[1039-the eldest]

At a quarter to ten [she]195-monica was able to run out , and close at hand were the two eagerly awaiting [her]195-monica .

' [Mrs. Darby]210-mrs. darby has found a place for [Alice]185-alice , '[191-virginia] began [Virginia]191-virginia . ' [We]4015-we heard by the afternoon post yesterday . [A lady at [Yatton]52-yatton]4016-a lady at yatton wants [a governess for [two young children]4018-two young children]4017-a governess for two young children . Is n't it fortunate ? '[191-virginia]

' So delightfully convenient for what [we]4015-we were thinking of , '[1039-the eldest] put in [the eldest]1039-the eldest , with [her]1039-the eldest croaking voice . ' Nothing could have been better . '[1039-the eldest]

' [You]195-monica mean about [the school]3929-the school ? '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica dreamily .

' Yes , [the school]3929-the school , '[191-virginia] [Virginia]191-virginia replied , with trembling earnestness . ' [Yatton]52-yatton is convenient both for [Clevedon]1-clevedon and [Weston]13-weston . [Alice]185-alice will be able to run over to [both places]4021-both places and make enquiries , and ascertain where the best opening would be . '[191-virginia]

[Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's suggestion , hitherto but timidly discussed , had taken hold upon [their]1040-their minds as soon as [Alice]185-alice received the practical call to [[her]185-alice native region]1041-her native region . [Both]525-both were enthusiastic for the undertaking . It afforded [them]525-both a novel subject of conversation , and inspirited [them]525-both by seeming to restore [their]525-both self - respect . After all , [they]525-both might have a mission , a task in [the world]3462-the world . [They]525-both pictured [themselves]525-both [the heads of [a respectable and thriving establishment , with [subordinate teachers , with pleasant social relations]1046-subordinate teachers , with pleasant social relations]1045-a respectable and thriving establishment , with subordinate teachers , with pleasant social relations]1044-the heads of a respectable and thriving establishment , with subordinate teachers , with pleasant social relations ; [they]525-both felt young again , and capable of indefinite activity . Why had [they]525-both not thought of this long ago ? and thereupon [they]525-both reverted to antistrophic laudation of [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda .

' Is [it]4022-it [a good place]4023-a good place ? '[1047-their younger sister] [[their]525-both younger sister]1047-their younger sister inquired .

' Oh , pretty good . Only twelve pounds a year , but [nice people]4024-nice people , [Mrs. Darby]210-mrs. darby says . [They]4024-nice people want [me]1047-their younger sister at once , and it is very likely that in a few weeks [I]1047-their younger sister shall go with [them]4024-nice people to [the seaside]3560-the seaside . '[1047-their younger sister]

' What could have been better ? '[191-virginia] cried [Virginia]191-virginia . ' [Her]3628-a girl health will be established , and in half a year , or less , [we]525-both shall be able to come to a decision about the great step . Oh , and have [you]191-virginia given notice , [darling]3629-darling ? '[191-virginia]

' Yes , [I]1047-their younger sister have . '[1047-their younger sister]

[Both]525-both clapped [their]525-both hands like [children]3468-children . It was an odd little scene on [the [London]6-london pavement]1050-the london pavement at ten o'clock at night ; so intimately domestic amid surroundings the very antithesis of domesticity . Only a few yards away , [a girl]3628-a girl , to whom [the pavement]1025-the pavement was a place of commerce , stood laughing with [two men]590-two men . The sound of [her]191-virginia voice hinted to [Monica]195-monica the advisability of walking as [they]525-both conversed , and [they]525-both moved towards [Walworth Road Station]53-walworth road station .

' [We]525-both thought at first , '[191-virginia] said [Virginia]191-virginia , ' that when [Alice]185-alice had gone [you]195-monica might like to share [[my]191-virginia room]3516-my room ; but then the distance from [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street would be a decided objection . [I]191-virginia might move , but [we]525-both doubt whether that would be worth while . It is so comfortable with [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , and for the short remaining time Christmas , [I]191-virginia should think , would be a very good time for opening . If it were possible to decide upon dear old Clevedon , of course [we]525-both should prefer it ; but perhaps [Weston]13-weston will offer more scope . [Alice]185-alice will weigh all the arguments on the spot . Do n't [you]195-monica envy [her]185-alice , [Monica]195-monica ? Think of being there in this summer weather ! '[191-virginia]

' Why do n't [you]195-monica go as well ? '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica asked .

' [I]191-virginia ? And take lodgings , [you]195-monica mean ? [We]525-both never thought of that . But [we]525-both still have to consider expenditure very seriously , [you]195-monica know . If possible , [I]191-virginia must find employment for the rest of the year . Remember how very likely it is that [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda will have something to suggest for [me]191-virginia . And when [I]191-virginia think it will be of so much practical use for [me]191-virginia to see [her]197-rhoda frequently for a few weeks . Already [I]191-virginia have learnt so much from [her]197-rhoda and from [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . [Their]4028-them conversation is so encouraging . [I]191-virginia feel that it is a training of the mind to be in contact with [them]4028-them . '[191-virginia]

' Yes , [I]185-alice quite share that view , '[185-alice] said [Alice]185-alice , with tremulous earnestness . ' [Virginia]191-virginia can reap much profit from intercourse with [them]4028-them . [They]4028-them have the new ideas in education , and it would be so good if [[our]4029-our school]4030-our school began with the advantage of quite a modern system . '[185-alice]

[Monica]195-monica became silent . When [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters had talked in the same strain for a quarter of an hour , [she]195-monica said absently ,

' [I]195-monica wrote to [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot last night , so [I]195-monica suppose [I]195-monica shall be able to move to [those lodgings]4031-those lodgings next Sunday . '[195-monica]

It was eleven o'clock before [they]516-her sisters parted . Having taken leave of [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters near [the station]586-the station , [Monica]195-monica turned to walk quickly [home]364-home . [She]195-monica had gone about half the way , when [her]195-monica name was spoken just behind [her]195-monica , in [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's voice . [She]195-monica stopped , and there stood [the man]350-the man , offering [his]350-the man hand .

' Why are [you]350-the man here at this time ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked in an unsteady voice .

' Not by chance . [I]350-the man had a hope that [I]350-the man might see [you]350-the man . '[350-the man]

[He]350-the man was gloomy , and looked at [her]195-monica searchingly .

' [I]350-the man must n't wait to talk now , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson . It 's very late . '[350-the man]

' Very late indeed . It surprised [me]217-widdowson to see [you]350-the man . '[217-widdowson]

' Surprised [you]350-the man ? Why should it ? '[350-the man]

' [I]217-widdowson mean that it seemed so very unlikely at this hour . '[217-widdowson]

' Then how could [you]350-the man have hoped to see [me]350-the man ? '[350-the man]

[Monica]195-monica walked on , with an air of displeasure , and [Widdowson]217-widdowson kept beside [her]195-monica , incessantly eyeing [her]195-monica countenance .

' No , [I]217-widdowson did n't really think of seeing [you]195-monica , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . [I]217-widdowson wished to be near the place where [you]195-monica were , that was all . '[217-widdowson]

' [You]350-the man saw [me]350-the man come out [I]350-the man dare say . '[350-the man]

' No . '[217-widdowson]

' If [you]350-the man had done , [you]350-the man would have known that [I]350-the man came to meet [two ladies]927-two ladies , [[my]350-the man sisters]3714-my sisters . [I]350-the man walked with [them]927-two ladies to [the station]586-the station , and now [I]350-the man am going [home]364-home . [You]350-the man seem to think an explanation necessary '[350-the man]

' Do forgive [me]217-widdowson ! What right have [I]217-widdowson to ask anything of the kind ? But [I]217-widdowson have been very restless since Sunday . [I]217-widdowson wished so to meet [you]350-the man , if only for a few minutes . Only an hour or two ago [I]217-widdowson posted a letter to [you]350-the man . '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica said nothing .

' It was to ask [you]350-the man to meet [me]350-the man next Sunday , as [we]4036-we arranged . Shall [you]350-the man be able to do so ? '[350-the man]

' [I]350-the man 'm[350-the man] afraid [I]0-i ca n't . At the end of this week [I]0-i leave [[my]0-i place here]1059-my place here , and on Sunday [I]0-i shall be moving to [another part of [London]6-london]1060-another part of london . '[350-the man]

' [You]350-the man are leaving ? [You]350-the man have decided to make the change [you]350-the man spoke of ? '[350-the man]

' Yes . '[350-the man]

' And will [you]350-the man tell [me]350-the man where [you]350-the man are going to live ? '[350-the man]

' [In lodgings near [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]4037-in lodgings near great portland street . [I]350-the man must say good - night , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson . [I]350-the man must , indeed . '[350-the man]

' Please do give [me]350-the man one moment ! '[350-the man]

' [I]350-the man ca n't stay [I]350-the man ca n't good - night ! '[350-the man]

It was impossible for [him]1061-he to detain [her]1062-her . Ungracefully [he]1061-he caught at [his]1061-he hat , made the salute , and moved away with rapid , uneven strides . In less than half an hour [he]1061-he was back again at [this spot]797-this spot . [He]1061-he walked past [the shop]582-the shop many times without pausing ; [his]1061-he eyes devoured the front of [the building]1065-the building , and noted those windows in which there was a glimmer of light . [He]1061-he saw [girls]3460-girls enter by the private door , but [Monica]195-monica did not again show [herself]195-monica . Some time after midnight , when [the house]368-the house had long been dark and perfectly quiet , [the uneasy man]1068-the uneasy man took a last look , and then sought [a cab]836-a cab to convey [him]1061-he [home]364-home .

The letter of which [he]1068-the uneasy man had spoken reached [Monica]195-monica 's hands next morning . It was a very respectful invitation to accompany [the writer]1071-the writer on a drive in [Surrey]44-surrey . [Widdowson]217-widdowson proposed to meet [her]195-monica at [Herne Hill railway station]1072-herne hill railway station , where [[his]217-widdowson vehicle would be waiting]1073-his vehicle would be waiting . ' In passing , [I]217-widdowson shall be able to point out to [you]195-monica [the house which has been [my]217-widdowson home]4038-the house which has been my home for about a year . '[217-widdowson]

As circumstances were , it would be hardly possible to accept this invitation without exciting curiosity in [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters . The Sunday morning would be occupied , probably , in going to [the new lodgings]1075-the new lodgings and making the acquaintance of [[her]195-monica future companion]1076-her future companion [there]453-there ; in the afternoon , [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters were to pay [her]195-monica a visit , as [Alice]185-alice had decided to start for [Somerset]36-somerset on the Monday . [She]195-monica must write a refusal , but it was by no means [her]195-monica wish to discourage [Widdowson]217-widdowson altogether . The note which at length satisfied [her]195-monica ran thus :

' [DEAR MR . WIDDOWSON]217-widdowson [I]195-monica am very sorry that it will be impossible for [me]195-monica to see [you]217-widdowson next Sunday . All day [I]195-monica shall be occupied . [[My]195-monica eldest sister]4039-my eldest sister is leaving [London]6-london , and Sunday will be [my]195-monica last day with [her]4039-my eldest sister , perhaps for a long time . Please do not think that [I]195-monica make light of [your]217-widdowson kindness . When [I]195-monica am settled in [my]195-monica new life , [I]195-monica hope to be able to let [you]217-widdowson know how it suits [me]195-monica . Sincerely [yours]217-widdowson ,[195-monica]

[MONICA MADDEN]195-monica . '[195-monica]

In a postscript [she]195-monica mentioned [her]195-monica new address . It was written in very small characters perhaps an unpurposed indication of the misgiving with which [she]195-monica allowed [herself]195-monica to pen the words .

Two days went by , and again a letter from [Widdowson]217-widdowson was delivered ,

' [DEAR MISS MADDEN]204-miss madden [My]217-widdowson chief purpose in writing again so soon is to apologize sincerely for [my]217-widdowson behaviour on Tuesday evening . It was quite unjustifiable . The best way of confessing [my]217-widdowson fault is to own that [I]217-widdowson had a foolish dislike of [your]217-widdowson walking in [the streets]3667-the streets unaccompanied at so late an hour . [I]217-widdowson believe that [any man who had newly made [your]217-widdowson acquaintance]4041-any man who had newly made your acquaintance , and had thought as much about [you]217-widdowson as [I]217-widdowson have , would have experienced the same feeling . The life which made it impossible for [you]217-widdowson to see [friends]3725-friends at any other time of the day was so evidently unsuited to one of [your]217-widdowson refinement that [I]217-widdowson was made angry by the thought of it . Happily it is coming to an end , and [I]217-widdowson shall be greatly relieved when [I]217-widdowson know that [you]217-widdowson have left [the house of business]665-the house of business .[217-widdowson]

' [You]217-widdowson remember that [we]4044-we are to be [friends]3725-friends . [I]217-widdowson should be much less than [[your]217-widdowson friend]4046-your friend if [I]217-widdowson did not desire for [you]217-widdowson a position very different from that which necessity forced upon [you]217-widdowson . Thank [you]217-widdowson very much for the promise to tell [me]217-widdowson how [you]217-widdowson like the new employment and [[your]217-widdowson new friends]4047-your new friends . Shall [you]217-widdowson not henceforth be at leisure on other days besides Sunday ? As [you]217-widdowson will now be near [Regent 's Park]54-regent 's park , perhaps [I]217-widdowson may hope to meet [you]217-widdowson there some evening before long . [I]217-widdowson would go any distance to see [you]217-widdowson and speak with [you]217-widdowson for only a few minutes .[217-widdowson]

' Do forgive [my]217-widdowson impertinence , and believe [me]217-widdowson , dear [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . Ever [yours]217-widdowson ,[217-widdowson]

[EDMUND WIDDOWSON]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

Now this undoubtedly might be considered a love - letter , and it was the first of its kind that [Monica]195-monica had ever received . [No man]1079-no man had ever written to [her]195-monica that [he]1079-no man was willing to go ' any distance '[1079-no man] for the reward of looking on [her]195-monica face . [She]195-monica read the composition many times , and with many thoughts . It did not enchant [her]195-monica ; presently [she]195-monica felt it to be dull and prosy anything but the ideal of a love - letter , even at this early stage .

The remarks concerning [Widdowson]217-widdowson made in [the bedroom]466-the bedroom by [the girl who fancied [her]195-monica asleep]1081-the girl who fancied her asleep had greatly disturbed [her]195-monica conception of [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson was old , and looked still older to a casual eye . [He]217-widdowson had a stiff dry way , and already had begun to show how precise and exacting [he]217-widdowson could be . A year or two ago the image of [such a man]1082-such a man would have repelled [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica did not think it possible to regard [him]217-widdowson with warm feelings ; yet , if [he]217-widdowson asked [her]195-monica to marry [him]217-widdowson and that seemed likely to happen very soon almost certainly [her]195-monica answer would be yes . Provided , of course , that all [he]217-widdowson had told [her]195-monica about [himself]217-widdowson could be in some satisfactory way confirmed .

[Her]195-monica acquaintance with [him]217-widdowson was an extraordinary thing . With what amazement and rapture would [any one of [[her]195-monica shop companions]1084-her shop companions]1083-any one of her shop companions listen to the advances of [a man who had six hundred a year]1085-a man who had six hundred a year ! Yet [Monica]195-monica did not doubt this truthfulness and the honesty of [his]217-widdowson intentions . [His]217-widdowson life - story sounded credible enough , and the very dryness of [his]217-widdowson manner inspired confidence . As things went in the marriage war , [she]195-monica might esteem [herself]195-monica [a most fortunate young woman]1086-a most fortunate young woman . It seemed that [he]217-widdowson had really fallen in love with [her]195-monica ; [he]217-widdowson might prove [a devoted husband]1087-a devoted husband . [She]195-monica felt no love in return ; but between the prospect of a marriage of esteem and that of no marriage at all there was little room for hesitation . The chances were that [she]195-monica might never again receive an offer from [a man whose social standing [she]195-monica could respect]1088-a man whose social standing she could respect .

In the meantime there had come a civil little note from [the girl whose rooms [she]195-monica was to share]1089-the girl whose rooms she was to share . ' [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot has spoken of [you]195-monica so favourably that [I]1089-the girl whose rooms she was to share did not think it necessary to see [you]195-monica before consenting to what [she]212-miss barfoot suggested . '[1089-the girl whose rooms she was to share] The signature was ' [Mildred H. Vesper]234-mildred . '[1089-the girl whose rooms she was to share]

The day of release arrived . [She]195-monica went by [train]3815-train to [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street , and thence by [cab]1094-cab , with [her]195-monica two boxes , to [Rutland Street]55-rutland street , [Hampstead Road]56-hampstead road [an uphill little street of [small houses]1096-small houses]1095-an uphill little street of small houses . ' [You]1099-a short , prim , plain - featured girl are [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper ? '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica said , approaching [her]1099-a short , prim , plain - featured girl .

'[195-monica]

[[Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper 's two rooms]1105-miss vesper 's two rooms were very humble , but homely . ' Will it do ? '[235-miss vesper]

' [I]462-the other have been trying to find [someone]4055-someone to share [my]462-the other rent , '[462-the other] said [the other]462-the other , with a simple frankness that was very agreeable . [Monica]195-monica had to look at [the speaker]884-the speaker to be sure that this was said in pleasantry . [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper was fond of making dry little jokes in the gravest tone ; only a twinkle of [her]235-miss vesper eyes and a movement of [her]235-miss vesper tight little lips betrayed [her]235-miss vesper .

Such a state of mind is curious , but one ends by accepting it as a fact in nature . '[235-miss vesper]

[They]1108-they joined in merry laughter . When [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper gave way to open mirth , [she]235-miss vesper enjoyed it so thoroughly that it was a delight to look at [her]235-miss vesper .

By the time dinner was over [they]1108-they were on excellent terms , and had exchanged a great deal of personal information . [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred seemed to be [one of the most contented of [young women]1110-young women]1109-one of the most contented of young women . [She]234-mildred had [sisters]1111-sisters and [brothers]1112-brothers , whom [she]234-mildred loved , all scattered about [England]58-england in pursuit of a livelihood ; it was rare for [any two of [them]1108-they]1113-any two of them to see [each other]543-each other , but [she]234-mildred spoke of this as quite in the order of things . For [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot [her]234-mildred respect was unbounded .

' [She]234-mildred had made more of [me]234-mildred than [any one else]4063-any one else could have done . ' [You]234-mildred mean '[234-mildred]

[Monica]195-monica laughed , and spoke of something else . [The bedroom which both were to occupy]1117-the bedroom which both were to occupy might with advantage have been larger , but [they]1118-they knew that [many girls of instinct no less delicate than [their]1119-many girls of instinct no less delicate than their own own]1119-many girls of instinct no less delicate than their own had to endure far worse accommodation in [London]6-london where poverty pays for [its]6-london sheltered breathing - space at so much a square foot . It was only of late that [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper had been able to buy furniture four sovereigns it cost in all , and thus to allow [herself]235-miss vesper the luxury of [two rooms]972-two rooms at the rent [she]235-miss vesper previously paid for one . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot did not remunerate [[her]212-miss barfoot workers]1121-her workers on a philanthropic scale , but strictly in accordance with market prices ; common sense dictated this principle . In talking over [their]1118-they arrangements , [Monica]195-monica decided to expend a few shillings on the purchase of a chair - bedstead for [her]195-monica own use .

' [I]195-monica often have nightmares , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica remarked , ' and kick a great deal . It would n't be nice to give [you]4068-you bruises . '[195-monica]

A week passed . [Alice]185-alice had written from [Yatton]52-yatton , and in a cheerful tone . [Virginia]191-virginia , chronically excited , had made calls at [Rutland Street]55-rutland street and at [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road ; [she]191-virginia talked like [one who had suddenly received a great illumination]1122-one who had suddenly received a great illumination , and [her]191-virginia zeal in the cause of independent womanhood rivalled [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's . Without enthusiasm , but seemingly contented , [Monica]195-monica worked at the typewriting machine , and had begun certain studies which [[her]195-monica friends]1123-her friends judged to be useful . [She]195-monica experienced a growth of self - respect . It was much to have risen above the status of [shop - girl]1124-shop - girl , and the change of moral atmosphere had a very beneficial effect upon [her]195-monica .

[Mildred Vesper]234-mildred was [a studious little person]1125-a studious little person , after a fashion of [her]234-mildred own . [She]234-mildred possessed four volumes of [Maunder]239-maunder 's ' Treasuries '[234-mildred] , and to one or other of these [she]234-mildred applied [herself]234-mildred for at least an hour every evening .

' By nature , '[234-mildred] [she]234-mildred said , when [Monica]195-monica sought an explanation of this study , ' [my]234-mildred mind is frivolous . What [I]234-mildred need is a store of solid information , to reflect upon . [No one]3554-no one could possibly have a worse memory , but by persevering [I]234-mildred manage to learn one or two facts a day . '[234-mildred]

[Monica]195-monica glanced at the books now and then , but had no desire to cultivate [Maunder]239-maunder 's acquaintance . Instead of reading , [she]195-monica meditated the problems of [her]195-monica own life .

[Edmund Widdowson]217-widdowson , of course , wrote to [her]195-monica at [the new address]1126-the new address . In [her]195-monica reply [she]195-monica again postponed [their]1127-their meeting . Whenever [she]195-monica went out in the evening , it was with expectation of seeing [him]217-widdowson somewhere in [the neighbourhood]1128-the neighbourhood ; [she]195-monica felt assured that [he]217-widdowson had long ago come to look at [the house]368-the house , and more likely than not [his]217-widdowson eyes had several times been upon [her]195-monica . That did not matter ; [her]195-monica life was innocent , and [Widdowson]217-widdowson might watch [her]195-monica coming and going as much as [he]217-widdowson would .

At length , about nine o'clock one evening , [she]195-monica came face to face with [him]217-widdowson . It was in [Hampstead Road]56-hampstead road ; [she]195-monica had been buying at [a draper]456-a draper 's , and carried the little parcel . At the moment of recognition , [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's face so flushed and brightened that [Monica]195-monica could not help a sympathetic feeling of pleasure .

' Why are [you]217-widdowson so cruel to [me]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said in a low voice , as [she]195-monica gave [her]195-monica hand . ' What a time since [I]217-widdowson saw [you]217-widdowson ! '[217-widdowson]

' Is that really true ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica replied , with an air more resembling coquetry than any [he]217-widdowson had yet seen in [her]195-monica .

' Since [I]217-widdowson spoke to [you]217-widdowson , then . '[217-widdowson]

' [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper , [the friend [I]217-widdowson live with]4071-the friend i live with . '[217-widdowson]

For reply [Monica]195-monica moved slowly on . [They]1131-they turned up one of the ways parallel with [Rutland Street]55-rutland street , and so came into [the quiet district that skirts [Regent 's Park]54-regent 's park]1132-the quiet district that skirts regent 's park , [Widdowson]217-widdowson talking all the way in a strain of all but avowed tenderness , [his]217-widdowson head bent towards [her]195-monica and [his]217-widdowson voice so much subdued that occasionally [she]195-monica lost a few words .

' [I]217-widdowson ca n't live without seeing [you]195-monica , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said at length . ' If [you]195-monica refuse to meet [me]217-widdowson , [I]217-widdowson have no choice but to come wandering about the places where [you]195-monica are . ' [I]217-widdowson am sorry for that , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

' Oh , not with less friendliness . But if [I]217-widdowson only make [you]217-widdowson unhappy '[217-widdowson]

[Presently Monica]195-monica assented . If it were fine , [she]1133-she would be by [the southeast entrance to [Regent 's Park]54-regent 's park]1134-the southeast entrance to regent 's park at two o'clock . [He]1135-he thanked [her]1133-she with words of the most submissive gratitude , and then [they]1136-they parted .

The day proved doubtful , but [she]1133-she kept [her]1133-she appointment . [Widdowson]217-widdowson was on the spot with horse and trap . [These]1137-these were not , as [he]217-widdowson presently informed [Monica]195-monica , [[his]217-widdowson own property]1138-his own property , but hired from [a livery stable]1139-a livery stable , according to [his]217-widdowson custom .

' It wo n't rain , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson exclaimed , gazing at the sky . ' It sha n't rain ! These few hours are too precious to [me]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

' It would be very awkward if it did , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica replied , in merry humour , as [they]1136-they drove along .

The sky threatened till sundown , but [Widdowson]217-widdowson was able to keep declaring that rain would not come . [He]217-widdowson took a south - westward course , crossed [Waterloo Bridge]60-waterloo bridge , and thence by [the highways made for [Herne Hill]32-herne hill]1140-the highways made for herne hill . [Monica]195-monica observed that [he]217-widdowson made a short detour to avoid [Walworth Road]7-walworth road . [She]195-monica asked [his]217-widdowson reason .

' [I]217-widdowson hate [the road]431-the road ! '[217-widdowson] [Widdowson]217-widdowson answered , with vehemence .

' [You]217-widdowson hate it ? '[195-monica]

' Because [you]217-widdowson slaved and suffered [there]453-there . If [I]217-widdowson had the power , [I]217-widdowson would destroy it [every house]4077-every house . Many a time , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson added , in a lower voice , ' when [you]217-widdowson were lying asleep , [I]217-widdowson walked up and down there in horrible misery . '[217-widdowson]

' Just because [I]195-monica had to stand at a counter ? '[195-monica]

' Not only that . It was n't fit for [you]217-widdowson to work in that way but [the people]4078-the people about [you]217-widdowson ! [I]217-widdowson hated every face of [man]962-man or woman that passed along [the street]594-the street . '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica did n't like [the society]4081-the society . '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson should hope not . Of course , [I]217-widdowson know [you]217-widdowson did n't . Why did [you]217-widdowson ever come to such a place ? '[217-widdowson]

There was severity rather than sympathy in [his]217-widdowson look .

' [I]195-monica was tired of the dull country life , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica replied frankly . ' And then [I]195-monica did n't know what [the shops]4082-the shops and [the people]4078-the people were like . '[195-monica]

' Do [you]195-monica need a life of excitement ? '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson asked , with a sidelong glance .

' Excitement ? No , but [one]472-one must have change . '[217-widdowson]

When [they]1141-they reached [Herne Hill]32-herne hill , [Widdowson]217-widdowson became silent , and presently [he]217-widdowson allowed the horse to walk .

' That is [[my]195-monica house]3643-my house , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden the right - hand one .[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica looked , and saw [two little villas]1142-two little villas , built together with stone facings , porches at the doors and [ornamented gables]1143-ornamented gables .

' [I]217-widdowson only wanted to show it [you]195-monica , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson added quickly . ' There 's nothing pretty or noticeable about [it]3643-my house , and [it]3643-my house is n't at all grandly furnished . [[My]217-widdowson old housekeeper]4086-my old housekeeper and [one servant]4087-one servant manage to keep it in order . '[217-widdowson]

[They]1141-they passed , and [Monica]195-monica did not allow [herself]195-monica to look back .

' [I]195-monica think it 's [a nice house]4088-a nice house , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said presently .

' All [my]1144-i life [I]1144-i have wished to have [a house of [my]1144-i own]4089-a house of my own , but [I]1144-i did n't dare to hope [I]1144-i ever should . [Men in general]4090-men in general do n't seem to care so long as [they]4090-men in general have lodgings that suit [them]4090-men in general [I]1144-i mean [unmarried men]4091-unmarried men . But [I]1144-i always wanted to live alone without [strangers]407-strangers , that is to say . [I]1144-i told [you]4093-you that [I]1144-i am not very sociable . When [I]1144-i got [[my]1144-i house]3643-my house , [I]1144-i was like [a child with a toy]4095-a child with a toy ; [I]1144-i could n't sleep for satisfaction . [I]1144-i used to walk all over [it]3643-my house , day after day , before [it]3643-my house was furnished . There was something that delighted [me]1144-i in the sound of [my]1144-i footsteps on the staircases and the bare floors . Here [I]1144-i shall live and die , [I]1144-i kept saying to [myself]1144-i . Not in solitude , [I]1144-i hoped . Perhaps [I]1144-i might meet [some one]735-some one '[1144-i]

[Monica]195-monica interrupted [him]1144-i to ask a question about some object in [the landscape]1145-the landscape . [He]1144-i answered [her]195-monica very briefly , and for a long time [neither]1146-neither spoke . Then [the girl]384-the girl , glancing at [him]1144-i with a smile of apology , said in a gentle tone

' [You]1144-i were telling [me]384-the girl how [the house]368-the house pleased [you]1144-i . Have [you]1144-i still the same pleasure in living [there]453-there ? '[384-the girl]

' Yes . But lately [I]384-the girl have been hoping [I]384-the girl dare n't say more . [You]1144-i will interrupt [me]384-the girl again . '[384-the girl]

' Which way are [we]4099-we going now , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson ? '[384-the girl]

' To [Streatham]62-streatham , then on to [Carshalton]63-carshalton . At five o'clock [we]4099-we will use [our]4099-we right as [travellers]4100-travellers , and get [some innkeeper]4101-some innkeeper to make tea for [us]4099-we . Look , the sun is trying to break through ; [we]4099-we shall have a fine evening yet . May [I]384-the girl , without rudeness , say that [you]675-his companion look better since [you]675-his companion left [that abominable place]4102-that abominable place . '[384-the girl]

' Oh , [I]384-the girl feel better . '[384-the girl]

After keeping [his]1148-his look fixed for a long time on the horse 's ears , [Widdowson]217-widdowson turned gravely to [[his]217-widdowson companion]675-his companion .

' [I]384-the girl told [you]675-his companion about [[my]384-the girl sister - in - law]4103-my sister - in - law . Would [you]675-his companion be willing to make [her]4103-my sister - in - law acquaintance ? '[384-the girl]

' [I]195-monica do n't feel able to do that , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered with decision .

Prepared for this reply , [he]217-widdowson began a long and urgent persuasion . It was useless ; [Monica]195-monica listened quietly , but without sign of yielding . The subject dropped , and [they]1150-they talked of indifferent things .

On [the homeward drive]1151-the homeward drive , when the dull sky grew dusk about [them]1150-they , and the suburban street - lamps began to show themselves in long glimmering lines , [Widdowson]217-widdowson returned with shamefaced courage to the subject which for some hours had been in abeyance .

' [I]384-the girl ca n't part from [you]675-his companion this evening without a word of hope to remember . [You]675-his companion know that [I]384-the girl want [you]675-his companion to be [[my]384-the girl wife]4104-my wife . Will [you]675-his companion tell [me]384-the girl if there is anything [I]384-the girl can say or do to make [your]675-his companion consent possible ? Have [you]675-his companion any doubt of [me]384-the girl ? '[384-the girl]

' No doubt whatever of [your]675-his companion sincerity . '[384-the girl]

' In one sense , [I]384-the girl am still [a stranger to [you]675-his companion]3805-a stranger to you . Will [you]675-his companion give [me]384-the girl the Opportunity of making things between [us]4106-us more regular ? Will [you]675-his companion allow [me]384-the girl to meet [some friend of [yours]675-his companion whom [you]675-his companion trust]4107-some friend of yours whom you trust ? '[384-the girl]

' [I]384-the girl had rather [you]675-his companion did n't yet . '[384-the girl]

' [You]675-his companion wish to know still more of [me]384-the girl , personally ? '[384-the girl]

' Yes [I]384-the girl think [I]384-the girl must know [you]675-his companion much better before [I]384-the girl can consent to any step of that kind . '[384-the girl]

' But , '[1152-i] [he]1152-i urged , ' if [we]4106-us became [acquaintances]4108-acquaintances in the ordinary way , and knew [[each other]543-each other 's friends]4110-each other 's friends , would n't that be most satisfactory to [you]675-his companion ? '[1152-i]

' It might be . But [you]675-his companion forget that so much would have to be explained . [I]384-the girl have behaved very strangely . If [I]384-the girl told everything to [[my]384-the girl friends]4111-my friends [I]384-the girl should leave [myself]384-the girl no choice . '[384-the girl]

' Oh , why not ? [You]675-his companion would be absolutely free . [I]1152-i could no more than try to recommend [myself]1152-i to [you]675-his companion . If [I]1152-i am so unhappy as to fail , how would [you]675-his companion be anything but quite free ? '[1152-i]

' But surely [you]675-his companion must understand [me]384-the girl . In this position , [I]384-the girl must either not speak of [you]675-his companion at all , or make it known that [I]384-the girl am engaged to [you]675-his companion . [I]384-the girl ca n't have it taken for granted that [I]384-the girl am engaged to [you]675-his companion when [I]384-the girl do n't wish to be . '[384-the girl]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson 's head drooped ; [he]217-widdowson set [his]217-widdowson lips in a hard gloomy expression .

' [I]384-the girl have behaved very imprudently , '[384-the girl] continued [the girl]384-the girl . But [I]0-i do n't see [I]0-i ca n't see what else [I]0-i could have done . Things are so badly arranged . It was n't possible for [us]1154-us to be introduced by [any one who knew [us]1154-us both]1155-any one who knew us both , so [I]0-i had either to break off [your]217-widdowson acquaintance after that first conversation , or conduct [myself]0-i as [I]0-i have been doing . [I]0-i think it 's a very hard position . [[My]0-i sisters]3714-my sisters would call [me]0-i [an immodest girl]1157-an immodest girl , but [I]0-i do n't think it is true . [I]0-i may perhaps come to feel [you]217-widdowson as [a girl]3628-a girl ought to when [she]3628-a girl marries , and how else can [I]0-i tell unless [I]0-i meet [you]217-widdowson and talk with [you]217-widdowson ? And [your]217-widdowson position is just the same . [I]0-i do n't blame [you]217-widdowson for a moment ; [I]0-i think it would be ridiculous to blame [you]217-widdowson . Yet [we]1159-us have gone against the ordinary rule , and [people]3536-people would make [us]1159-us suffer for it or [me]0-i , at all events .

[Her]1161-i voice at the close was uncertain . [Widdowson]217-widdowson looked at [her]1161-i with eyes of passionate admiration .

' Thank [you]1161-i for saying that for putting it so well , and so kindly for [me]217-widdowson . Let [us]1159-us disregard [people]3536-people , then . Let [us]1159-us go on seeing [each other]543-each other . [I]217-widdowson love [you]217-widdowson with all [my]217-widdowson soul '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson choked a little at this first utterance of the solemn word ' and [your]217-widdowson rules shall be [mine]217-widdowson . Give [me]217-widdowson a chance of winning [you]217-widdowson . Tell [me]217-widdowson if [I]217-widdowson offend [you]217-widdowson in anything if there 's anything [you]217-widdowson dislike in [me]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

' Will [you]217-widdowson cease coming to look for [me]1161-i when [I]1161-i do n't know of it ? '[1161-i]

' [I]217-widdowson promise [you]217-widdowson . [I]217-widdowson will never come again . And [you]217-widdowson will meet [me]217-widdowson a little oftener ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]1161-i will see [you]217-widdowson once every week . But [I]1161-i must still be perfectly free . '[1161-i]

' Perfectly ! [I]217-widdowson will only try to win [you]217-widdowson as [any man may who loves [a woman]615-a woman]4114-any man may who loves a woman . '[217-widdowson]

The tired horse clattered upon [the hard highway]1162-the hard highway and clouds gathered for a night of storm .

CHAPTER VIII

[COUSIN EVERARD]240-cousin everard

As [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's eye fell on the letters brought to [her]212-miss barfoot at breakfast - time , [she]212-miss barfoot uttered an exclamation , doubtful in its significance . [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , who rarely had a letter from [any one]3776-any one , looked up inquiringly .

' [I]212-miss barfoot am greatly mistaken if that is n't [[my]212-miss barfoot cousin]4116-my cousin [Everard]240-cousin everard 's writing . [I]212-miss barfoot thought so . [He]4116-my cousin is in [London]6-london . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda made no remark .

' Pray read it , '[212-miss barfoot] said the other , handing [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend the epistle after [she]197-rhoda had gone through it .

The handwriting was remarkably bold , but careful . Punctuation was strictly attended to , and in places a word had been obliterated with a circular scrawl which left it still legible .

' [DEAR COUSIN MARY]213-mary , [I]197-rhoda hear that [you]213-mary are still active in an original way , and that civilization is more and more indebted to [you]213-mary . Since [my]197-rhoda arrival in [London]6-london a few weeks ago , [I]197-rhoda have several times been on the point of calling at [[your]213-mary house]4117-your house , but scruples withheld [me]197-rhoda . [Our]4118-us last interview was not quite friendly on [your]213-mary side , [you]213-mary will remember , and perhaps [your]213-mary failure to write to [me]197-rhoda means continued displeasure ; in that case [I]197-rhoda might be rejected at [your]213-mary door , which [I]197-rhoda should n't like , for [I]197-rhoda am troubled with a foolish sense of personal dignity . [I]197-rhoda have taken [a flat]4119-a flat , and mean to stay in [London]6-london for at least half a year . Please let [me]197-rhoda know whether [I]197-rhoda may see [you]213-mary . Indeed [I]197-rhoda should like to . [Nature]241-nature meant [us]4118-us for [good friends]4120-good friends , but prejudice came between [us]4118-us . Just a line , either of welcome or " get [thee]213-mary behind [me]197-rhoda ! " In spite of [your]213-mary censures , [I]197-rhoda always was , and still am , affectionately [yours]213-mary ,[197-rhoda]

[EVERARD BARFOOT]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda perused the sheet very attentively .

' An impudent letter , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . ' Just like [him]242-everard . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Where does [he]242-everard appear from ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Japan]64-japan , [I]212-miss barfoot suppose . " But prejudice came between [us]4118-us . " [I]212-miss barfoot like that ! Moral conviction is always prejudice in the eyes of [these advanced young men]4121-these advanced young men . Of course [he]242-everard must come . [I]212-miss barfoot am anxious to see what time has made of [him]242-everard . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Was it really moral censure that kept [you]212-miss barfoot from writing to [him]242-everard ? '[197-rhoda] inquired [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with a smile .

' Decidedly . [I]212-miss barfoot did n't approve of [him]242-everard at all , as [I]212-miss barfoot have frequently told [you]212-miss barfoot . '[212-miss barfoot]

' But [I]212-miss barfoot gather that [he]242-everard has n't changed much . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Not in theories , '[212-miss barfoot] replied [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . ' That is n't to be expected . [He]242-everard is far too stubborn . But in mode of life [he]242-everard may possibly be more tolerable . '[212-miss barfoot]

' After two or three years in [Japan]64-japan , '[197-rhoda] rejoined [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with a slight raising of the eyebrows .

' [He]242-everard is about three - and - thirty , and before [he]242-everard left [England]58-england [I]212-miss barfoot think [he]242-everard showed possibilities of future wisdom . Of course [I]212-miss barfoot disapprove of [him]242-everard , and , if necessary , shall let [him]242-everard understand that quite as plainly as before . But there 's no harm in seeing if [he]242-everard has learnt to behave [himself]242-everard . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Everard Barfoot]242-everard received an invitation to dine . It was promptly accepted , and on the evening of the appointment [he]242-everard arrived at half - past seven . [[His]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin sat alone in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room . At [his]242-everard entrance [she]1165-his cousin regarded [him]242-everard with keen but friendly scrutiny .

[He]242-everard had a tall , muscular frame , and a head of striking outline , with large nose , full lips , deep - set eyes , and prominent eyebrows . [His]242-everard hair was the richest tone of chestnut ; [his]242-everard moustache and beard the latter peaking slightly forward inclined to redness . Excellent health manifested itself in the warm purity of [his]242-everard skin , in [his]242-everard cheerful aspect , and the lightness of [his]242-everard bearing . The lower half of [his]242-everard forehead was wrinkled , and when [he]242-everard did not fix [his]242-everard look on anything in particular , [his]242-everard eyelids drooped , giving [him]242-everard for the moment an air of languor . On sitting down , [he]242-everard at once abandoned [himself]242-everard to a posture of the completest ease , which [his]242-everard admirable proportions made graceful . From [his]242-everard appearance one would have expected [him]242-everard to speak in rather loud and decided tones ; but [he]242-everard had a soft voice , and used it with all the discretion of good - breeding , so that at times it seemed to caress the ear . To this mode of utterance corresponded [his]242-everard smile , which was frequent , but restrained to the expression of a delicate , good - natured irony .

' [No one]3554-no one had told [me]212-miss barfoot of [your]242-everard return , '[212-miss barfoot] were [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's first words as [she]212-miss barfoot shook hands with [him]242-everard .

' [I]242-everard fancy because [no one]3554-no one knew . [You]242-everard were [the first of [[my]242-everard kinsfolk]4125-my kinsfolk to whom [I]242-everard wrote]4124-the first of my kinsfolk to whom i wrote . '[242-everard]

' Much honour , [Everard]242-everard . [You]242-everard look very well . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard am glad to be able to say the same of [you]242-everard . And yet [I]242-everard hear that [you]242-everard work harder than ever . '[242-everard]

' Who is the source of [your]242-everard information about [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard had an account of [you]242-everard from [Tom]223-mr. thomas , in a letter that caught [me]242-everard at [Constantinople]65-constantinople . '[242-everard]

' [Tom]223-mr. thomas ? [I]242-everard thought [he]223-mr. thomas had forgotten [my]242-everard existence . Who told [him]223-mr. thomas about [me]242-everard [I]242-everard ca n't imagine . So [you]242-everard did n't come straight [home]364-home from [Japan]64-japan ? '[242-everard]

[Barfoot]242-everard was nursing [his]242-everard knee , [his]242-everard head thrown back .

' No ; [I]242-everard loitered a little in [Egypt]66-egypt and [Turkey]67-turkey . Are [you]242-everard living quite alone ? '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard drawled slightly on the last word , its second vowel making quite a musical note , of wonderful expressiveness . The clear decision of [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin 's reply was a sharp contrast .

' [A lady]577-a lady lives with [me]242-everard [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . [She]577-a lady will join [us]4128-us in a moment . '[242-everard]

' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard] [He]242-everard smiled . ' A partner in [your]242-everard activity ? '[242-everard]

' [She]577-a lady gives [me]242-everard valuable help . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard must hear all about it if [you]242-everard will kindly tell [me]242-everard some day . It will interest [me]242-everard greatly . [You]242-everard always were [the most interesting of [[our]4128-us family]4130-our family]4129-the most interesting of our family . [Brother Tom]243-tom promised to be [a genius]4131-a genius , but marriage has blighted the hope , [I]242-everard fear . '[242-everard]

' The marriage was a very absurd one . '[242-everard]

' Was it ? [I]242-everard feared so ; but [Tom]243-tom seems satisfied . [I]242-everard suppose [they]4132-they will stay at [Madeira]68-madeira . '[242-everard]

' Until [[his]243-tom wife]4133-his wife is tired of [her]4133-his wife imaginary phthisis , and amuses [herself]4133-his wife with imagining some other ailment that requires [them]4132-they to go to [Siberia]69-siberia . '[242-everard]

' Ah , [that kind of person]4134-that kind of person , is [she]197-rhoda ? '[1168-he] [He]1168-he smiled indulgently , and played for a moment with the lobe of [his]1168-he right ear . [His]1168-he ears were small , and of the ideal contour ; the hand , too , thus displayed , was a fine example of blended strength and elegance .

[Rhoda]197-rhoda came in , so quietly that [she]197-rhoda was able to observe [the guest]1169-the guest before [he]1168-he had detected [her]197-rhoda presence . The movement of [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's eyes first informed [him]1168-he that [another person]1170-another person was in [the room]444-the room . In the quietest possible way the introduction was performed , and [all]1172-all seated [themselves]1172-all .

Dressed , like [the hostess]903-the hostess , in black , and without ornaments of any kind save a silver buckle at [her]197-rhoda waist , [Rhoda]197-rhoda seemed to have endeavoured to liken [herself]197-rhoda to the suggestion of [her]197-rhoda name by the excessive plainness with which [she]197-rhoda had arranged [her]197-rhoda hair ; its tight smoothness was nothing like so becoming as the mode [she]197-rhoda usually adopted , and it made [her]197-rhoda look older . Whether by accident or design , [she]197-rhoda took an upright chair , and sat upon it in a stiff attitude . Finding it difficult to suspect [Rhoda]197-rhoda of shyness , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot once or twice glanced at [her]197-rhoda with curiosity . For settled conversation there was no time ; [a servant]622-a servant announced dinner almost immediately .

' There shall be no forms , [cousin Everard]242-everard , '[903-the hostess] said [the hostess]903-the hostess . ' Please to follow [us]4135-us . '[903-the hostess]

Doing so , [Everard]242-everard examined [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's figure , which in its way was strong and shapely as [his]242-everard own . A motion of [his]242-everard lips indicated amused approval , but at once [he]242-everard commanded [himself]242-everard , and entered [the dining - room]3603-the dining - room with exemplary gravity . Naturally , [he]242-everard sat opposite [Rhoda]197-rhoda , and [his]242-everard eyes often skimmed [her]197-rhoda face ; when [she]197-rhoda spoke , which was very seldom , [he]242-everard gazed at [her]197-rhoda with close attention .

During the first part of the meal , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot questioned [[her]212-miss barfoot relative]1177-her relative concerning [his]242-everard Oriental experiences . [Everard]242-everard spoke of [them]1178-them in a light , agreeable way , avoiding the tone of instruction , and , in short , giving evidence of good taste . [Rhoda]197-rhoda listened with a look of civil interest , but asked no question , and smiled only when it was unavoidable . Presently the talk turned to things of [home]364-home .

' Have [you]903-the hostess heard of [[your]903-the hostess friend]4046-your friend [Mr. Poppleton]244-mr. poppleton ? '[903-the hostess] [the hostess]903-the hostess asked .

' [Poppleton]244-mr. poppleton ? Nothing whatever . [I]903-the hostess should like to see [him]244-mr. poppleton . '[903-the hostess]

' [I]903-the hostess 'm[903-the hostess] sorry to tell [you]903-the hostess [he]242-everard is in [a lunatic asylum]1181-a lunatic asylum . '[903-the hostess]

As [Barfoot]242-everard kept the silence of astonishment , [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin went on to tell [him]242-everard that [the unhappy man]1183-the unhappy man seemed to have lost [his]1183-the unhappy man wits among business troubles .

' Is n't the spectacle of existence quite enough to occupy one through a lifetime ? ' It amounted to that . From quite [a child]3719-a child , [Everard]242-everard was at odds with [[his]242-everard father]4208-his father . A strange thing , for in so many respects [they]4212-they resembled [each other]543-each other very closely . Physically , [Everard]242-everard is [[his]242-everard father]4208-his father walking [the earth]4215-the earth again .
