'[197-rhoda]

The expression of [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's countenance suddenly changed . An extreme mobility of facial muscles was one of the things in [her]197-rhoda that held [Everard]242-everard 's attention .

' There 's something in [your]242-everard way of putting it that [I]197-rhoda do n't like , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said , with much frankness ; ' but of course [I]197-rhoda agree with [you]242-everard in the facts . [I]197-rhoda am convinced that most marriages are hateful , from every point of view . But there will be no improvement until [women]3478-women have revolted against marriage , from a reasonable conviction of [its]4558-its hatefulness . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]242-everard wish [you]3478-women all success most sincerely [I]242-everard do . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard paused , looked about [the room]444-the room , and stroked [his]242-everard ear . Then , in a grave tone ,

' [My]242-everard own ideal of marriage involves perfect freedom on both sides . Of course it could only be realized where conditions are favourable ; poverty and other wretched things force [us]4559-us so often to sin against [our]4559-us best beliefs . But there are plenty of [people who might marry on these ideal terms]4560-people who might marry on these ideal terms . Perfect freedom , sanctioned by the sense of intelligent society , would abolish most of the evils [we]4559-us have in mind . But [women]3478-women must first be civilized ; [you]242-everard are quite right in that . '[242-everard]

The door opened , and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot came in . [She]197-rhoda glanced from one to the other , and without speaking gave [her]197-rhoda hand to [Everard]242-everard .

' How is [[your]197-rhoda patient]4562-your patient ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard asked .

' A little better , [I]197-rhoda think . It is nothing dangerous . Here 's a letter from [[your]242-everard brother]3773-your brother [Tom]252-micklethwaite . Perhaps [I]197-rhoda had better read it at once ; there may be news [you]242-everard would like to hear . '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda sat down and broke the envelope . Whilst [she]197-rhoda was reading the letter to [herself]197-rhoda , [Rhoda]197-rhoda quietly left [the room]444-the room .

' Yes , there is news , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot presently , ' and of a disagreeable kind . A few weeks ago before writing , that is [he]252-micklethwaite was thrown off a horse and had a rib fractured . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Oh ? How is [he]252-micklethwaite going on ? '[197-rhoda]

' Getting right again , [he]252-micklethwaite says . And [they]4564-they are coming back to [England]58-england ; [[his]252-micklethwaite wife]4133-his wife 's consumptive symptoms have disappeared , of course , and [she]4133-his wife is very impatient to leave [Madeira]68-madeira . It is to be hoped [she]4133-his wife will allow poor [Tom]252-micklethwaite time to get [his]252-micklethwaite rib set . Probably that consideration does n't weigh much with [her]4133-his wife . [He]252-micklethwaite says that [he]252-micklethwaite is writing to [you]197-rhoda by the same mail . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [Poor old fellow]4566-poor old fellow ! '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , with feeling . ' Does [he]252-micklethwaite complain about [[his]252-micklethwaite wife]4133-his wife ? '[242-everard]

' [He]252-micklethwaite never has done till now , but there 's a sentence here that reads doubtfully . " [Muriel]262-muriel , " [he]252-micklethwaite says , " has been terribly upset about [my]212-miss barfoot accident . [I]212-miss barfoot ca n't persuade [her]262-muriel that [I]212-miss barfoot did n't get thrown on purpose ; yet [I]212-miss barfoot assure [you]197-rhoda [I]212-miss barfoot did n't . " '[212-miss barfoot]

[Everard]242-everard laughed .

' If [old Tom]252-micklethwaite becomes ironical , [he]252-micklethwaite must be hard driven . [I]242-everard have no great longing to meet [Mrs. Thomas]263-mrs. thomas . '[242-everard]

' [She]263-mrs. thomas 's [a silly and a vulgar woman]4568-a silly and a vulgar woman . But [I]242-everard told [him]252-micklethwaite that in plain terms before [he]252-micklethwaite married . It says much for [his]252-micklethwaite good nature that [he]252-micklethwaite remains so friendly with [me]242-everard . Read the letter , [Everard]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard did so .

' H'm very kind things about [me]242-everard . [Good old Tom]263-mrs. thomas ! Why do n't [I]242-everard marry ? Well , now , [one]472-one would have thought that [his]472-one own experience '[242-everard]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot began to talk about something else . Before very long [Rhoda]197-rhoda came back , and in the conversation that followed it was mentioned that [she]197-rhoda would leave for [her]197-rhoda holiday in two days .

' [I]242-everard have been reading about [Cheddar]84-cheddar , '[242-everard] exclaimed [Everard]242-everard , with animation . ' There 's a flower grows among the rocks called the Cheddar pink . Do [you]242-everard know it ? '[242-everard]

' Oh , very well , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered . ' [I]197-rhoda 'll bring [you]242-everard some specimens . '[197-rhoda]

' Will [you]242-everard ? That 's very kind . '[242-everard]

' Bring [me]212-miss barfoot a genuine pound or two of the cheese , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , '[212-miss barfoot] requested [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot gaily .

' [I]242-everard will . What [they]1288-they sell in [the shops]4082-the shops there is all sham , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot like so much else in [this world]4571-this world . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard care nothing about the cheese . That 's all very well for [a matter - of - fact person like [cousin Mary]213-mary]4572-a matter - of - fact person like cousin mary , but [I]242-everard have a strong vein of poetry ; [you]242-everard must have noticed it ? '[242-everard]

When [they]1288-they shook hands ,

' [You]242-everard will really bring [me]242-everard the flowers ? '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard said in a voice sensibly softened .

' [I]242-everard will make a note of it , '[242-everard] was the reassuring answer .

CHAPTER XI

AT NATURE 'S BIDDING[242-everard]

[The sick girl whom [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had been to see]1289-the sick girl whom miss barfoot had been to see was [Monica Madden]195-monica .

With strange suddenness , after several weeks of steady application to [her]195-monica work , in a cheerful spirit which at times rose to gaiety , [Monica]195-monica became dull , remiss , unhappy ; then violent headaches attacked [her]195-monica , and one morning [she]195-monica declared [herself]195-monica unable to rise . [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred went to [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street at the usual hour , and informed [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot of [[her]234-mildred companion]812-her companion 's illness . [A doctor]1291-a doctor was summoned ; to [him]1291-a doctor it seemed probable that [the girl]384-the girl was suffering from consequences of overstrain at [her]384-the girl old employment ; there was nervous collapse , hysteria , general disorder of the system . Had [the patient]1293-the patient any mental disquietude ? Was trouble of any kind [the doctor]352-the doctor smiled weighing upon [her]384-the girl ? [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , unable to answer these questions , held private colloquy with [Mildred]234-mildred ; but [the latter]1187-the latter , though [she]1187-the latter pondered a good deal with corrugated brows , could furnish no information .

In a day or two [Monica]195-monica was removed to [[[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister 's lodgings]1297-her sister 's lodgings at [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill . [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee managed to put [a room]1298-a room at [her]206-mrs. conisbee disposal , and [Virginia]191-virginia tended [her]384-the girl . [Thither Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot went on the evening when [Everard]242-everard found [her]384-the girl away ; [she]212-miss barfoot and [Virginia]191-virginia , talking together after being with [the invalid]420-the invalid for a quarter of an hour , agreed that there was considerable improvement , but felt a like uneasiness regarding [Monica]195-monica 's state of mind .

' Do [you]439-the visitor think , '[439-the visitor] asked [the visitor]439-the visitor , ' that [she]195-monica regrets the step [I]439-the visitor persuaded [her]195-monica to take ? '[439-the visitor]

' Oh , [I]197-rhoda ca n't think that ! [She]195-monica has been so delighted with [her]195-monica progress each time [I]197-rhoda have seen [her]195-monica . No , [I]197-rhoda feel sure it 's only the results of what [she]195-monica suffered at [Walworth Road]7-walworth road . In a very short time [we]4573-we shall have [her]195-monica at work again , and brighter than ever . '[197-rhoda]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was not convinced . After [Everard]242-everard 's departure that evening [she]212-miss barfoot talked of the matter with [Rhoda]197-rhoda .

' [I]212-miss barfoot 'm[212-miss barfoot] afraid , ' said [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , '[212-miss barfoot] that [Monica]195-monica is rather [a silly girl]1301-a silly girl . [She]195-monica does n't know [her]195-monica own mind . If this kind of thing is repeated , [we]1302-we had better send [her]195-monica back to [the country]3602-the country . '[197-rhoda]

' To shop work again ? '[197-rhoda]

' It might be better . '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , [I]197-rhoda do n't like the thought of that . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda had one of [her]197-rhoda fits of wrathful eloquence .

' Now could one have a better instance than [this Madden family]4574-this madden family of the crime that [middle - class parents]4575-middle - class parents commit when [they]4575-middle - class parents allow [[their]4575-middle - class parents girls]4576-their girls to go without rational training ? Of course [I]197-rhoda know that [Monica]195-monica was only [a little child]4577-a little child when [they]4575-middle - class parents were left [orphans]4578-orphans ; but [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters had already grown up into uselessness , and [their]516-her sisters example has been harmful to [her]195-monica all along . [[Her]195-monica guardians]4580-her guardians dealt with [her]195-monica absurdly ; [they]4580-her guardians made [her]195-monica [half a lady]4581-half a lady and [half a shop - girl]4582-half a shop - girl . [I]197-rhoda do n't think [she]195-monica 'll ever be good for much . And [the elder ones]367-the elder ones will go on just keeping [themselves]367-the elder ones alive ; [you]4584-you can see that . [They]367-the elder ones 'll never start the school that there 's so much talk of . [That poor , helpless , foolish Virginia]4585-that poor , helpless , foolish virginia , alone there in [[her]4585-that poor , helpless , foolish virginia miserable lodging]4586-her miserable lodging ! How can [we]4587-we hope that [any one]3776-any one will take [her]195-monica as [a companion]3617-a companion ? And yet [they]4580-her guardians are [capitalists]4590-capitalists ; eight hundred pounds between [them]4580-her guardians . Think what [capable women]4591-capable women might do with eight hundred pounds . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda am really afraid to urge [them]4580-her guardians to meddle with the investments . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course ; so am [I.]197-rhoda [One]472-one is afraid to do or propose anything . [Virginia]191-virginia is starving , must be starving . [Poor creature]4593-poor creature ! [I]197-rhoda can never forget how [her]191-virginia eyes shone when [I]197-rhoda put that joint of meat before [her]191-virginia . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]212-miss barfoot do , do wish , '[212-miss barfoot] sighed [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , with a pained smile , ' that [I]212-miss barfoot knew [some honest man who would be likely to fall in love with [little Monica]195-monica]4594-some honest man who would be likely to fall in love with little monica ! In spite of [you]212-miss barfoot , [[my]212-miss barfoot dear]3534-my dear , [I]212-miss barfoot would devote [myself]212-miss barfoot to making the match . But there 's [no one]3554-no one . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Oh , [I]197-rhoda would help , '[197-rhoda] laughed [Rhoda]197-rhoda , not unkindly . ' [She]195-monica 's fit for nothing else , [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] afraid . [We]1304-we must n't look for any kind of heroism in [Monica]195-monica . '[212-miss barfoot]

Less than half an hour after [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had left [the house]368-the house at [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill , [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred made a call [there]453-there . It was about half - past nine ; [the invalid]420-the invalid , after sitting up since midday , had gone to bed , but could not sleep . Summoned to [the house]368-the house - door , [Virginia]191-virginia acquainted [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper with the state of affairs .

' [I]191-virginia think [you]235-miss vesper might see [her]195-monica for a few minutes . '[191-virginia]

' [I]234-mildred should like to , if [you]235-miss vesper please , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , '[234-mildred] replied [Mildred]234-mildred , who had a rather uneasy look .

[She]234-mildred went [upstairs]443-upstairs and entered [the bedroom]466-the bedroom , where a lamp was burning . At the sight of [[her]234-mildred friend]631-her friend [Monica]195-monica showed much satisfaction ; [they]1312-they kissed [each other]543-each other affectionately .

' [Good old girl]4597-good old girl ! [I]234-mildred had made up [my]234-mildred mind to come back tomorrow , or at all events the day after . It 's so frightfully dull here . Oh , and [I]234-mildred wanted to know if anything any letter had come for [me]234-mildred . '[234-mildred]

' That 's just why [I]234-mildred came to see [you]234-mildred to - night . '[234-mildred]

[Mildred]234-mildred took a letter from [her]234-mildred pocket , and half averted [her]234-mildred face as [she]234-mildred handed it .

' It 's nothing particular , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , putting it away under [her]195-monica pillow . ' Thank [you]234-mildred , [dear]3530-dear . '[195-monica]

But [her]195-monica cheeks had become hot , and [she]195-monica trembled .

' [Monica]195-monica '[195-monica]

' Well ? '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica would n't care to tell [me]195-monica about anything ? [You]195-monica do n't think it would make [your]195-monica mind easier ? '[195-monica]

For a minute [Monica]195-monica lay back , gazing at the wall , then [she]195-monica looked round quickly , with a shamefaced laugh .

' It 's very silly of [me]195-monica not to have told [you]195-monica long before this . But [you]195-monica 're[195-monica] so sensible ; [I]0-i was afraid . [I]0-i 'll tell [you]195-monica everything . Not now , but as soon as [I]0-i get to [Rutland Street]55-rutland street . [I]0-i shall come to - morrow . '[0-i]

' Do [you]195-monica think [you]195-monica can ? [You]195-monica look dreadfully bad still . '[195-monica]

' [I]420-the invalid sha n't get any better here , '[420-the invalid] replied [the invalid]420-the invalid in a whisper . ' [Poor Virgie]209-virgie does depress [me]420-the invalid so . [She]209-virgie does n't understand that [I]420-the invalid ca n't bear to hear [her]209-virgie repeating the kind of things [she]209-virgie has heard from [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . [She]209-virgie tries so hard to look forward hopefully but [I]420-the invalid know [she]209-virgie is miserable , and it makes [me]420-the invalid more miserable still . [I]420-the invalid ought n't to have left [you]1315-you ; [I]420-the invalid should have been all right in a day or two , with [you]1315-you to help [me]420-the invalid . [You]1315-you do n't make - believe , [Milly]234-mildred ; it 's all real and natural good spirits . It has done [me]420-the invalid good only to see [your]1315-you dear old face . '[420-the invalid]

' Oh , [you]1315-you 're[1318-the missive] a flatterer . And do [you]1315-you really feel better ? '[420-the invalid]

' Very much better . [I]420-the invalid shall go to sleep very soon . '[420-the invalid]

[The visitor]439-the visitor took [her]439-the visitor leave . When , a few minutes after , [Monica]195-monica had bidden good - night to [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister requesting that the lamp might be left , [she]195-monica read what [Mildred]234-mildred had brought .

' [MY]1318-the missive DEAREST [MONICA]195-monica , '[1318-the missive] [the missive]1318-the missive began ' Why have [you]195-monica not written before this ? Why have n't [you]195-monica made another appointment ? It is all [I]1318-the missive can do to keep from breaking [my]1318-the missive promise and coming to ask about [you]195-monica . [You]195-monica know so well that [I]1318-the missive love [you]195-monica with all [my]1318-the missive heart and soul ; [I]1318-the missive ca n't address [you]195-monica like [I]1318-the missive did when [we]4600-we first corresponded . [[My]1318-the missive darling]4601-my darling ! [[My]1318-the missive dear]3534-my dear , [sweet , beautiful little girl]4603-sweet , beautiful little girl '[1318-the missive]

Four close pages of this , with scarce room at the end for ' E.W. '[1319-she] When [she]1319-she had gone through it , [Monica]195-monica turned [her]195-monica face upon the pillow and lay so for a long time . Not long after [she]195-monica was asleep .

The next day , on returning from [her]195-monica work and opening the sitting - room door , [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred was greeted with a merry laugh . [Monica]195-monica had been [here]3495-here since three o'clock , and had made tea in readiness for [[her]195-monica friend]631-her friend 's arrival . [She]195-monica looked very white , but [her]195-monica eyes gleamed with pleasure , and [she]195-monica moved about [the room]444-the room as actively as before .

' [Virgie]209-virgie came with [me]195-monica , but [she]209-virgie would n't stay . [She]209-virgie says [she]209-virgie has a most important letter to write to [Alice]185-alice about [the school]3929-the school , of course . Oh , [that school]4605-that school ! [I]195-monica do wish [they]4606-they could make up [their]4606-they minds . [I]195-monica 've told [them]4606-they [they]4606-they may have all [my]195-monica money , if [they]4606-they like . '[195-monica]

' Oh , only two hundred ! A wretched little sum . '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica are [a person of large ideas]4608-a person of large ideas , as [I]195-monica have often told [you]195-monica . Where did [you]195-monica get [them]4606-they , [I]195-monica wonder ? '[195-monica]

' Do n't put on that face ! It 's the one [I]195-monica like least of all [your]195-monica many faces . It 's suspicious . '[195-monica]

[Mildred]234-mildred went to take off [her]234-mildred things , and was quickly at the tea - table . [She]234-mildred had a somewhat graver look than usual , and chose rather to listen than talk .

Not long after tea , when there had been a long and unnatural silence , [Mildred]234-mildred making pretence of absorption in a ' Treasury '[234-mildred] and [[her]234-mildred companion]812-her companion standing at the window , whence [she]234-mildred threw back furtive glances , the thunder of [a postman]1325-a postman 's knock [downstairs]523-downstairs caused [both of [them]534-both of them]534-both of them to start , and look at [each other]543-each other in a conscience - stricken way .

' That may be for [me]195-monica , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , stepping to the door . ' [I]195-monica 'll go and look . '[195-monica]

[Her]195-monica conjecture was right . Another letter from [Widdowson]217-widdowson , still more alarmed and vehement than the last . [She]234-mildred read it rapidly on the staircase , and entered [the room]444-the room with sheet and envelope squeezed together in [her]234-mildred hand .

' [I]234-mildred 'm[234-mildred] going to tell [you]1330-you all about this , [Milly]234-mildred . '[234-mildred]

[The other]462-the other nodded and assumed an attitude of sober attention . In relating [her]195-monica story , [Monica]195-monica moved hither and thither ; now playing with objects on the mantlepiece , now standing in the middle of the floor , hands locked nervously behind [her]195-monica . Throughout , [her]195-monica manner was that of defence ; [she]195-monica seemed doubtful of [herself]195-monica , and anxious to represent the case as favourably as possible ; not for a moment had [her]195-monica voice the ring of courageous passion , nor the softness of tender feeling . The narrative hung together but awkwardly , and in truth gave a very indistinct notion of how [she]195-monica had comported [herself]195-monica at the various stages of the irregular courtship . [Her]195-monica behaviour had been marked by far more delicacy and scruple than [she]195-monica succeeded in representing . Painfully conscious of this , [she]195-monica exclaimed at length ,

' [I]195-monica see [your]1330-you opinion of [me]195-monica has suffered . [You]1330-you do n't like this story . [You]1330-you wonder how [I]195-monica could do such things . '[195-monica]

' Well , [dear]3530-dear , [I]234-mildred certainly wonder how [you]3530-dear could begin , '[234-mildred] [Mildred]234-mildred made answer , with [her]234-mildred natural directness , but gently . ' Afterwards , of course , it was different . When [you]3530-dear had once got to be sure that [he]4610-him was [a gentleman]740-a gentleman '[234-mildred]

' [I]195-monica was sure of that so soon , '[195-monica] exclaimed [Monica]195-monica , [her]195-monica cheeks still red . ' [You]1330-you will understand it much better when [you]1330-you have seen [him]4610-him . '[195-monica]

' [You]1330-you wish [me]234-mildred to ? '[234-mildred]

' [I]195-monica am going to write now , and say that [I]195-monica will marry [him]4610-him . '[195-monica]

[They]1332-they looked long at [each other]543-each other .

' [You]1330-you are really ? '[234-mildred]

' Yes . [I]234-mildred made up [my]234-mildred mind last night . '[234-mildred]

' But , [Monica]195-monica [you]1330-you must n't mind [my]234-mildred speaking plainly [I]234-mildred do n't think [you]1330-you love [him]4610-him . '[234-mildred]

' Yes , [I]1334-i love [him]4610-him well enough to feel that [I]1334-i am doing right in marrying [him]4610-him . '[1334-i] [She]1334-i sat down by the table , and propped [her]1334-i head on [her]1334-i hand . ' [He]4610-him loves [me]1334-i ; [I]1334-i ca n't doubt that . If [you]1330-you could read [his]4610-him letters , [you]1330-you would see how strong [his]4610-him feeling is . '[1334-i]

[She]1334-i shook with the cold induced by excitement ; [her]1334-i voice was at moments all but choked .

' But , putting love aside , '[234-mildred] went on the other , very gravely , ' what do [you]1330-you really know of [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson ? ' Yes . [I]1334-i shall tell [[my]1334-i sisters]3714-my sisters , and no doubt [they]3714-my sisters will go to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda at once . [I]1334-i do n't want to do anything rash . But it will be all right [I]1334-i mean , [he]217-widdowson has told [me]1334-i the truth about everything . [You]1330-you would be sure of that if [you]1330-you knew [him]217-widdowson . '[1334-i]

[Mildred]234-mildred , with hands before [her]234-mildred on the table , made the tips of [her]234-mildred fingers meet . [Her]234-mildred lips were drawn in ; [her]234-mildred eyes seemed looking for something minute on the cloth .

' [You]1330-you know , '[234-mildred] [she]234-mildred said at length , ' [I]234-mildred suspected what was going on . [I]234-mildred could n't help . '[234-mildred]

' Of course [you]1330-you could n't . '[234-mildred]

' Naturally [I]234-mildred thought it was [some one whose acquaintance [you]1330-you had made at [the shop]582-the shop]4614-some one whose acquaintance you had made at the shop . '[234-mildred]

' How could [I]234-mildred think of marrying [any one of that kind]4616-any one of that kind ? '[234-mildred]

' [I]234-mildred should have been grieved . '[234-mildred]

' [You]1330-you may believe [me]234-mildred , [Milly]234-mildred ; [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson is [a man [you]1330-you will respect and like as soon as [you]1330-you know [him]217-widdowson]4617-a man you will respect and like as soon as you know him . [He]217-widdowson could n't have behaved to [me]234-mildred with more delicacy . '[234-mildred]

' [I]195-monica said [you]234-mildred would respect and like [him]217-widdowson , '[195-monica] exclaimed [Monica]195-monica , with humorous impatience . ' [I]195-monica do n't want [you]234-mildred to love [him]217-widdowson . '[195-monica]

[Mildred]234-mildred laughed , with constraint .

' [I]234-mildred never loved [any one]3776-any one yet , [dear]3530-dear , and it 's very unlikely [I]234-mildred ever shall . But [I]234-mildred think [I]234-mildred know the signs of the feeling . '[234-mildred]

[Monica]195-monica came behind [her]234-mildred , and leaned upon [her]234-mildred shoulder .

' [He]217-widdowson loves [me]195-monica so much that [he]217-widdowson has made [me]195-monica think [I]195-monica must marry [him]217-widdowson . And [I]195-monica am glad of it . [I]195-monica 'm[195-monica] not like [you]234-mildred , [Milly]234-mildred ; [I]0-i ca n't be contented with this life . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda are very sensible and [good people]1335-good people , and [I]0-i admire [them]1335-good people very much , but [I]0-i ca n't go [their]1335-good people way . It seems to [me]0-i that it would be dreadful , dreadful , to live [one]472-one 's life alone . Do n't turn round and snap at [me]0-i ; [I]0-i want to tell [you]234-mildred the truth whilst [you]234-mildred ca n't see [me]0-i . Whenever [I]0-i think of [Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia , [I]0-i am frightened ; [I]0-i had rather , oh , far rather , kill [myself]0-i than live such a life at [their]1335-good people age . [You]234-mildred ca n't imagine how miserable [they]1335-good people are , really . And [I]0-i have the same nature as [theirs]1335-good people , [you]234-mildred know . Compared with [you]234-mildred and [Miss Haven]227-miss haven [I]0-i 'm very weak and childish . '[0-i]

After drumming on the table for a moment , with wrinkled brows , [Mildred]234-mildred made grave response .

' [You]234-mildred must let [me]234-mildred tell the truth as well . [I]234-mildred think [you]234-mildred 're[234-mildred] going to marry with altogether wrong ideas . [I]0-i think [you]234-mildred 'll do an injustice to [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson . [Monica]195-monica raised [herself]195-monica and stood apart .

' For one thing , '[234-mildred] pursued [Mildred]234-mildred , with nervous earnestness , ' [he]217-widdowson 's too old . [Your]234-mildred habits and [his]217-widdowson wo n't suit . '[234-mildred]

' [He]217-widdowson has assured [me]195-monica that [I]195-monica shall live exactly the kind of life [I]195-monica please . And that will be what [he]217-widdowson pleases . ' That 's a very nice spirit ; but [I]234-mildred believe married life is no easy thing even when [the people]4078-the people are well matched . [Monica]195-monica drew [herself]195-monica up .

' No ; that 's turning it very unkindly . [I]195-monica only said that after [I]195-monica had told [you]234-mildred that [I]195-monica did love [him]4623-him . And [I]195-monica do love [him]4623-him . [He]4623-him has made [me]195-monica love [him]4623-him . '[195-monica]

[Mildred]234-mildred heaved a sigh , and pretended to give [her]234-mildred attention to [Maunder]239-maunder .

CHAPTER XII

WEDDINGS

When [they]1351-they reached [the house at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill [the sisters]358-the sisters]1352-the house at herne hill the sisters were both in a state of nervous tremor . [Monica]195-monica had only the vaguest idea of the kind of person [Mrs. Luke Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson would prove to be , and [Virginia]191-virginia seemed to [herself]191-virginia to be walking in a dream .

' Have [you]195-monica been [here]3495-here often ? '[1187-the latter] whispered [the latter]1187-the latter , as soon as [they]1351-they came in view of [the place]1355-the place . Its aspect delighted [her]195-monica , but the conflict of [her]195-monica emotions was so disturbing that [she]195-monica had to pause and seek the support of [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister 's arm .

' [I]195-monica 've never been inside , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered indistinctly . ' Come ; [we]1351-they shall be unpunctual . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica do wish [you]191-virginia would tell [me]195-monica , [dear]3530-dear '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica ca n't talk , [Virgie]209-virgie . Try and keep quiet , and behave as if it were all quite natural . '[195-monica]

This was altogether beyond [Virginia]191-virginia 's power . It happened most luckily , though greatly to [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's annoyance , that [the sister - in - law]1357-the sister - in - law , [Mrs. Luke Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , arrived nearly half an hour later than the time [she]265-mrs. widdowson had appointed . Led by [the servant]791-the servant into [a comfortable drawing - room]1359-a comfortable drawing - room , [the visitors]916-the visitors were received by [the master of [the house]368-the house]1361-the master of the house alone ; with a grim smile , the result of [his]1361-the master of the house embarrassment , with profuse apologies and a courtesy altogether excessive , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson did [his]1361-the master of the house best to put [them]916-the visitors at [their]916-the visitors ease of course with small result . [The sisters]358-the sisters side by side on a settee at one end of [the room]444-the room , and [the host]1365-the host seated far away from [them]358-the sisters , [they]358-the sisters talked with scarcely any understanding of what was said on either side the weather and the vastness of [London]6-london serving as topics until of a sudden the door was thrown open , and there appeared [a person of such imposing presence]1366-a person of such imposing presence that [Virginia]191-virginia gave a start and [Monica]195-monica gazed in painful fascination . [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson was [a tall and portly woman in the prime of life]1367-a tall and portly woman in the prime of life , with rather a high colour ; [her]265-mrs. widdowson features were handsome , but without much refinement , [their]358-the sisters expression a condescending good - humour . [Her]265-mrs. widdowson mourning garb , if mourning it could be called , represented an extreme of the prevailing fashion ; its glint and rustle inspired awe in [the female observer]1368-the female observer . A moment ago [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room had seemed empty ; [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson , in [[her]265-mrs. widdowson sole person]1370-her sole person , filled and illumined [it]3697-the drawing - room .

[Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson addressed [this resplendent personage]1371-this resplendent personage by [her]265-mrs. widdowson Christian name , [his]1372-his familiarity exciting in [Monica]195-monica an irrational surprise . [He]1372-his presented [the sisters]358-the sisters to [her]265-mrs. widdowson , and [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson , bowing grandly at a distance , drew from [her]265-mrs. widdowson bosom a gold - rimmed pince - nez , through which [she]265-mrs. widdowson scrutinized [Monica]195-monica . The smile which followed might have been interpreted in several senses ; [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , alone capable of remarking it , answered with a look of severe dignity .

[Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson had no thought of apologizing for the lateness of [her]265-mrs. widdowson arrival , and it was evident that [she]265-mrs. widdowson did not intend to stay long . [Her]265-mrs. widdowson purpose seemed to be to make the occasion as informal as possible .

' Do [you]1177-her relative , by chance , know [the Hodgson Bulls]266-the hodgson bulls ? '[265-mrs. widdowson] [she]265-mrs. widdowson asked of [[her]265-mrs. widdowson relative]1177-her relative , interrupting [him]1177-her relative in the nervous commonplaces with which [he]1177-her relative was endeavouring to smooth the way to a general conversation . [She]265-mrs. widdowson had the accent of cultivation , but spoke rather imperiously .

' [I]265-mrs. widdowson never heard of [them]4651-them , '[265-mrs. widdowson] was the cold reply .

' No ? [They]4651-them live somewhere about here . [I]265-mrs. widdowson have to make a call on [them]4651-them . [I]265-mrs. widdowson suppose [[my]265-mrs. widdowson coachman]4652-my coachman will find [the place]1355-the place . '[265-mrs. widdowson]

There was an awkward silence . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was about to say something to [Monica]195-monica , when [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson , who had again closely observed [the girl]384-the girl through the glasses , interposed in a gentle tone .

[Monica]195-monica gave the expected answer , [her]195-monica voice sounding very weak and timid by comparison . And so , for some ten minutes , an appearance of dialogue was sustained . [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson , though still condescending , evinced a desire to be agreeable ; [she]265-mrs. widdowson smiled and nodded in reply to [the girl]384-the girl 's remarks , and occasionally addressed [Virginia]191-virginia with careful civility , conveying the impression , perhaps involuntarily , that [she]265-mrs. widdowson commiserated [the shy and shabbily - dressed person]1377-the shy and shabbily - dressed person . ' But very rich , [[my]191-virginia dear]3534-my dear , '[191-virginia] said [Virginia]191-virginia in a murmuring voice . ' [You]3534-my dear can see that . When , on the next day , [Monica]195-monica met [[her]195-monica betrothed]1386-her betrothed in [Regent 's Park]1387-regent 's park [she]195-monica still lived with [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred , but no longer went to [Great Portland Street]1388-great portland street [their]1389-their talk was naturally of [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson . That morning [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had received from [[his]1392-his sister - in - law]4636-his sister - in - law a scribbled post - card , asking [him]1392-his to call upon [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson early the day that followed . Of course this meant that [the lady]4316-the lady was desirous of further talk concerning [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . Unwillingly , but as a matter of duty , [he]1392-his kept the appointment . It was at eleven in the morning , and , when admitted to [the flat in [Victoria Street]89-victoria street which was [[his]1392-his relative]1396-his relative 's abode]1395-the flat in victoria street which was his relative 's abode , [he]1392-his had to wait a quarter of an hour for [the lady]4316-the lady 's appearance .

Luxurious fashion , as might have been expected , distinguished [[Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson 's drawing - room]1398-mrs. luke 's drawing - room . Costly and beautiful things superabounded ; perfume soothed the air . Only since [her]265-mrs. widdowson bereavement had [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson been able to indulge this taste for modern exuberance in domestic adornment . [The deceased Luke]265-mrs. widdowson was [a plain man of business]1399-a plain man of business , who clung to the fashions which had been familiar to [him]1392-his in [his]1392-his youth ; [[his]1392-his second wife]1400-his second wife found [a suburban house]1401-a suburban house already furnished , and [her]1400-his second wife influence with [him]1392-his could not prevail to banish the horrors amid which [he]1392-his chose to live : chairs in maroon rep , Brussels carpets of red roses on a green ground , horse - hair sofas of the most uncomfortable shape ever designed , antimacassars everywhere , chimney ornaments of cut glass trembling in sympathy with the kindred chandeliers . [She]265-mrs. widdowson belonged to an obscure branch of [a house that culminated in [an obscure baronetcy]1403-an obscure baronetcy]1402-a house that culminated in an obscure baronetcy ; penniless and ambitious , [she]265-mrs. widdowson had to thank [her]265-mrs. widdowson imposing physique for rescue at a perilous age , and though despising [Mr. Luke Widdowson]267-mr. luke widdowson for [his]267-mr. luke widdowson plebeian tastes , [she]265-mrs. widdowson shrewdly retained the good - will of a husband who seemed [no candidate for length of years]1404-no candidate for length of years . [The money - maker]1405-the money - maker died much sooner than [she]265-mrs. widdowson could reasonably have hoped , and left [her]265-mrs. widdowson an income of four thousand pounds . Thereupon began for [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson a life of feverish aspiration . [The baronetcy to which [she]265-mrs. widdowson was akin]1406-the baronetcy to which she was akin had inspired [her]265-mrs. widdowson , even from childhood , with an aristocratic ideal ; [a handsome widow of only eight - and - thirty]1407-a handsome widow of only eight - and - thirty , [she]265-mrs. widdowson resolved that [her]265-mrs. widdowson wealth should pave the way for [her]265-mrs. widdowson to a titled alliance . [Her]265-mrs. widdowson acquaintance lay among [City people]1408-city people , but with the opportunities of freedom it was soon extended to the sphere of what is known as smart society ; [[her]265-mrs. widdowson flat in [Victoria Street]89-victoria street]1409-her flat in victoria street attracted [a heterogeneous cluster of [pleasure - seekers]1411-pleasure - seekers and [fortune - hunters]1412-fortune - hunters]1410-a heterogeneous cluster of pleasure - seekers and fortune - hunters , among [them]1410-a heterogeneous cluster of pleasure - seekers and fortune - hunters [one or two vagrant members of [the younger aristocracy]1414-the younger aristocracy]1413-one or two vagrant members of the younger aristocracy . [She]265-mrs. widdowson lived at the utmost pace compatible with technical virtue . When , as shortly happened , it became evident that [her]265-mrs. widdowson income was not large enough for [her]265-mrs. widdowson serious purpose , [she]265-mrs. widdowson took counsel with [an old friend great in finance]1415-an old friend great in finance , and thenceforth the excitement of [the gambler]1416-the gambler gave a new zest to [her]265-mrs. widdowson turbid existence . Like [most of [[her]265-mrs. widdowson female associates]1418-her female associates]1417-most of her female associates , [she]265-mrs. widdowson had free recourse to the bottle ; but for such stimulus the life of [a smart woman]1419-a smart woman would be physically impossible . And [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson enjoyed life , enjoyed it vastly . The goal of [her]265-mrs. widdowson ambition , if all went well in [the City]3768-the city , was quite within reasonable hope . [She]265-mrs. widdowson foretasted the day when a vulgar prefix would no longer attach to [her]265-mrs. widdowson name , and when the journals of society would reflect [her]265-mrs. widdowson rising effulgence .

Apart from [[her]195-monica future husband]1441-her future husband , [Monica]195-monica was in a sportive mood , with occasional fits of exhilaration which seemed rather unnatural . The ceremony was performed at [a church at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill]1444-a church at herne hill . It was one of the quietest of weddings , but all ordinary formalities were complied with , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson having no independent views on the subject . [Virginia]191-virginia 's gladness gave way just before the company assembled , and [she]191-virginia too shed many tears .

There was a breakfast , more dismal fooling than even this species of fooling is wo nt to be . It happened that [his]1469-his return to [England]58-england was almost simultaneous with the arrival from [Madeira]68-madeira of [Mr.]1470-mr. and [Mrs. Thomas Barfoot]263-mrs. thomas . An engagement called [Everard]242-everard back to [town]624-town .
