That evening [the sisters]358-the sisters arrived from [[their]358-the sisters country home]1489-their country home . [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite gave up [the house]368-the house to [them]358-the sisters , and went to [a lodging]440-a lodging .

It was with no little curiosity that , on the appointed morning , [Barfoot]242-everard repaired to [South Tottenham]95-south tottenham . [He]242-everard had seen a photograph of [Miss Wheatley]271-miss wheatley , but it dated from seventeen years ago . Standing in [her]271-miss wheatley presence , [he]242-everard was moved with compassion , and with another feeling more rarely excited in [him]242-everard by [a women]1492-a women 's face , that of reverential tenderness . Impossible to recognize in this countenance the features known to [him]242-everard from the portrait . At three - and - twenty [she]271-miss wheatley had possessed a sweet , simple comeliness on which [any man]513-any man 's eye would have rested with pleasure ; at forty [she]271-miss wheatley was wrinkled , hollow - cheeked , sallow , indelible weariness stamped upon [her]271-miss wheatley brow and lips . [She]271-miss wheatley looked much older than [Mary Barfoot]225-mary , though [they]1494-they were just of an age . And all this for want of a little money . The life of [a pure , gentle , tender - hearted woman worn away in hopeless longing and in hard struggle for daily bread]1495-a pure , gentle , tender - hearted woman worn away in hopeless longing and in hard struggle for daily bread . As [she]271-miss wheatley took [his]242-everard hand and thanked [him]242-everard with an exquisite modesty for the present [she]271-miss wheatley had received , [Everard]242-everard felt a lump rise in [his]242-everard throat . [He]242-everard was ashamed to notice that the years had dealt so unkindly with [her]271-miss wheatley ; fixing [his]242-everard look upon [her]271-miss wheatley eyes , [he]242-everard gladdened at the gladness which shone in them , at the soft light which [they]1494-they could still shed forth .

[Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite was probably unconscious of [the poor woman]3570-the poor woman 's faded appearance . [He]242-everard had seen [her]271-miss wheatley from time to time , and always with the love which idealizes . In [his]242-everard own pathetic phrase , [she]271-miss wheatley was simply a part of [himself]242-everard ; [he]242-everard no more thought of criticizing [her]271-miss wheatley features than of standing before the glass to mark and comment upon [his]242-everard own . It was enough to glance at [him]242-everard as [he]242-everard took [his]242-everard place beside [her]271-miss wheatley , [the proudest and happiest of [men]3461-men]1497-the proudest and happiest of men . A miracle had been wrought for [him]242-everard ; kind fate , in giving [her]271-miss wheatley to [his]242-everard arms , had blotted out those long years of sorrow , and to - day [Fanny]257-fanny was [the betrothed of [his]242-everard youth]1499-the betrothed of his youth , beautiful in [his]242-everard sight as when first [he]242-everard looked upon [her]257-fanny .

[[Her]257-fanny sister]455-her sister , younger by five years , had more regular lineaments , but [she]455-her sister too was worn with suffering , and [her]455-her sister sightless eyes made it more distressing to contemplate [her]455-her sister . [She]455-her sister spoke cheerfully , however , and laughed with joy in [Fanny]257-fanny 's happiness . [Barfoot]242-everard pressed both [her]271-miss wheatley hands with the friendliest warmth .

One vehicle conveyed [them]1501-them all to [the church]751-the church , and in half an hour [the lady to whom the piano]1503-the lady to whom the piano was addressed had come into being . The simplest of transformations ; no bridal gown , no veil , no wreath ; only the gold ring for symbol of union . And it might have happened nigh a score of years ago ; nigh a score of years lost from the span of human life all for want of a little money .

' [I]242-everard will say good - bye to [you]1214-his friend here , '[242-everard] muttered [Everard]242-everard to [[his]242-everard friend]1214-his friend at the church door .

[The married man]1505-the married man gripped [him]1214-his friend by the arm .

' [You]1214-his friend will do nothing of the kind . [Fanny]257-fanny , [he]1505-the married man wants to be off at once ! [You]1214-his friend wo n't go until [you]1214-his friend have heard [[my]1505-the married man wife]4104-my wife play something on that blessed instrument . '[1505-the married man]

So all entered [a cab]836-a cab again and drove back to [the house]368-the house . [A servant who had come with [Fanny]257-fanny from [the country]3602-the country]1508-a servant who had come with fanny from the country , [a girl of fifteen]1510-a girl of fifteen , opened the door to [them]1511-them , smiling and curtseying . And all sat together in happy talk , [the blind woman gayest among [them]1511-them]1512-the blind woman gayest among them ; [she]1512-the blind woman gayest among them wished to have [the clergyman]1513-the clergyman described to [her]1512-the blind woman gayest among them , and the appearance of [the church]751-the church . Then [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite placed [herself]270-micklethwaite at the piano , and played simple , old - fashioned music , neither well nor badly , but to the infinite delight of [two of [[her]270-micklethwaite hearers]1516-her hearers]1515-two of her hearers .

' [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , '[521-the sister] said [the sister]521-the sister at length , ' [I]521-the sister have known [your]249-mr. barfoot name for a long time , but [I]521-the sister little thought to meet [you]249-mr. barfoot on such a day as this , and to owe [you]249-mr. barfoot such endless thanks . So long as [I]521-the sister can have music [I]521-the sister forget that [I]521-the sister ca n't see .[521-the sister]

' [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot is [the finest fellow on [earth]4708-earth]4707-the finest fellow on earth , '[270-micklethwaite] exclaimed [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite . ' At least , [he]249-mr. barfoot would be if [he]249-mr. barfoot understood Trilinear Co - ordinates . '[270-micklethwaite]

' Are [you]270-micklethwaite strong in mathematics , [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite ? '[242-everard] asked [Everard]242-everard .

' [I]521-the sister ? Oh dear , no ! [I]521-the sister never got much past the Rule of Three . But [Tom]252-micklethwaite has forgiven [me]521-the sister that long ago . '[521-the sister]

' [I]270-micklethwaite do n't despair of getting [you]270-micklethwaite into plane trigonometry , [Fanny]257-fanny . [We]1518-we will gossip about sines and co - sines before [we]1518-we die . '[270-micklethwaite]

It was said half - seriously , and [Everard]242-everard could not but burst into laughter .

[He]242-everard sat down with [them]1518-we to [their]1518-we plain midday meal , and early in the afternoon took [his]242-everard leave . [He]242-everard had no inclination to go [home]364-home , if [the empty fiat]1520-the empty fiat could be dignified with such a name . After reading the papers at [[his]242-everard club]1521-his club , [he]242-everard walked aimlessly about [the streets]3667-the streets until it was time to return to [the same place]1523-the same place for dinner . Then [he]242-everard sat with a cigar , dreaming , and at half - past eight went to [the Royal Oak Station]1524-the royal oak station , and journeyed to [Chelsea]19-chelsea .

[CHAPTER XIII

DISCORD OF LEADERS]272-chapter xiii discord of leaders

A disappointment awaited [him]242-everard . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was not well enough to see [any one]3776-any one . Had [she]212-miss barfoot been suffering long ? [he]242-everard inquired . No ; it was only this evening ; [she]212-miss barfoot had not dined , and was gone to [[her]212-miss barfoot room]1526-her room . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda could not receive [him]242-everard .

[He]242-everard went [home]364-home , and wrote to [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin .

The next morning [he]242-everard came upon a passage in the newspaper which seemed to suggest a cause for [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's indisposition . It was the report of an inquest . [A girl named [Bella Royston]194-isabel]1529-a girl named bella royston had poisoned [herself]1529-a girl named bella royston . [She]1529-a girl named bella royston was living alone , without occupation , and received visits only from [one lady]1530-one lady . [This lady]4194-this lady , [her]4194-this lady name [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , had been supplying [her]1529-a girl named bella royston with money , and had just found [her]1529-a girl named bella royston a situation in [a house of business]3496-a house of business ; but [the girl]384-the girl appeared to have gone through troubles which had so disturbed [her]384-the girl mind that [she]384-the girl could not make the effort required of [her]384-the girl . [She]384-the girl left a few lines addressed to [[her]384-the girl benefactress]1534-her benefactress , just saying that [she]384-the girl chose death rather than the struggle to recover [her]384-the girl position .

It was Saturday . [He]1535-he decided to call in the afternoon and see whether [Mary]225-mary had recovered .

Again a disappointment . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was better , and had been away since breakfast ; [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda was also absent .

[Everard]242-everard sauntered about [the neighbourhood]1128-the neighbourhood , and presently found [himself]242-everard in [the gardens of [Chelsea Hospital]97-chelsea hospital]1537-the gardens of chelsea hospital . It was a warm afternoon , and so still that [he]242-everard heard the fall of yellow leaves as [he]242-everard walked hither and thither along [the alleys]1538-the alleys . [His]242-everard failure to obtain an interview with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda annoyed [him]242-everard ; but for [her]197-rhoda presence in [the house]368-the house [he]242-everard would not have got into this habit of going [there]453-there . As far as ever from harbouring any serious thoughts concerning [Rhoda]197-rhoda , [he]1535-he felt [himself]1535-he impelled along the way which [he]1535-he had jokingly indicated in talk with [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite ; [he]1535-he was tempted to make love to [her]197-rhoda as an interesting pastime , to observe how so strong - minded [a woman]615-a woman would conduct [herself]615-a woman under such circumstances . Had [she]197-rhoda or not a vein of sentiment in [her]197-rhoda character ? Was it impossible to move [her]197-rhoda as [other women]1542-other women are moved ? Meditating thus , [he]1535-he looked up and saw the subject of [his]1535-he thoughts . [She]197-rhoda was seated a few yards away , and seemingly had not yet become aware of [him]1535-he , [her]197-rhoda eyes were on the ground , and troubled reverie appeared in [her]197-rhoda countenance .

' [I]197-rhoda have just called at [the house]368-the house , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . How is [[my]197-rhoda cousin]4116-my cousin to - day ? '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda had looked up only a moment before [he]1535-he spoke , and seemed vexed at being thus discovered .

' [I]197-rhoda believe [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot is quite well , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda answered coldly , as [they]1543-they shook hands .

' But yesterday [she]197-rhoda was not so . '[197-rhoda]

' A headache , or something of the kind . '[1535-he]

[He]1535-he was astonished . [Rhoda]197-rhoda spoke with a cold indifference . [She]197-rhoda has risen , and showed [her]197-rhoda wish to move from the spot .

' [She]197-rhoda had to attend an inquest yesterday . Perhaps it rather upset [her]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda think it did . '[197-rhoda]

Unable to adapt [himself]1535-he at once to this singular mood of [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's , but resolved not to let [her]197-rhoda go before [he]1535-he had tried to learn the cause of it , [he]1535-he walked along by [her]197-rhoda side . In [this part of [the gardens]1545-the gardens]1544-this part of the gardens there were only [a few nursemaids]1546-a few nursemaids and [children]3468-children ; it would have been a capital place and time for improving [his]1535-he intimacy with [the remarkable woman]1548-the remarkable woman . But possibly [she]197-rhoda was determined to be rid of [him]1535-he . A contest between [his]1535-he will and [hers]197-rhoda would be an amusement decidedly to [his]1535-he taste .

' [You]197-rhoda also have been disturbed by it , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . '[1535-he]

' By the inquest ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda returned , with barely veiled scorn . ' Indeed [I]197-rhoda have not . '[197-rhoda]

' Did [you]197-rhoda know [that poor girl]4711-that poor girl ? '[1535-he]

' Some time ago . '[197-rhoda]

' Then it is only natural that [her]4711-that poor girl miserable fate should sadden [you]197-rhoda . '[1535-he]

[He]1535-he spoke as if with respectful sympathy , ignoring what [she]197-rhoda had said .

' It has no effect whatever upon [me]197-rhoda , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered , glancing at [him]1535-he with surprise and displeasure .

' Forgive [me]197-rhoda if [I]197-rhoda say that [I]197-rhoda find it difficult to believe that . Perhaps [you]1535-he '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda interrupted [him]1535-he .

' [I]197-rhoda do n't easily forgive anyone who charges [me]197-rhoda with falsehood , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , [you]197-rhoda take it too seriously . [I]197-rhoda beg [your]197-rhoda pardon a thousand times . [I]197-rhoda was going to say that perhaps [you]197-rhoda wo n't allow [yourself]197-rhoda to acknowledge any feeling of compassion in such a case . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda do n't acknowledge what [I]197-rhoda do n't feel . [I]197-rhoda will bid [you]197-rhoda good - afternoon . '[197-rhoda]

[He]1535-he smiled at [her]197-rhoda with all the softness and persuasiveness of which [he]1535-he was capable . [She]197-rhoda had offered [her]197-rhoda hand with cold dignity , and instead of taking it merely for good - bye [he]1535-he retained it .

' [You]197-rhoda must , [you]197-rhoda shall forgive [me]197-rhoda ! [I]197-rhoda shall be too miserable if [you]197-rhoda dismiss [me]197-rhoda in this way . [I]197-rhoda see that [I]197-rhoda was altogether wrong . [You]197-rhoda know all the particulars of the case , and [I]197-rhoda have only read a brief newspaper account . [I]197-rhoda am sure [the girl]384-the girl did n't deserve [your]197-rhoda pity . '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda was trying to draw [her]197-rhoda hand away . [Everard]242-everard felt the strength of [her]197-rhoda muscles , and the sensation was somehow so pleasant that [he]1535-he could not at once release [her]197-rhoda .

' [You]242-everard do pardon [me]197-rhoda , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Please do n't be foolish . [I]197-rhoda will thank [you]197-rhoda to let [my]197-rhoda hand go . '[197-rhoda]

Was it possible ? [Her]197-rhoda cheek had coloured , ever so slightly . But with indignation , no doubt , for [her]197-rhoda eyes flashed sternly at [him]242-everard . Very unwillingly , [Everard]242-everard had no choice but to obey the command .

' Will [you]197-rhoda have the kindness to tell [me]242-everard , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said more gravely , ' whether [[my]242-everard cousin]4116-my cousin was suffering only from that cause ? '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda ca n't say , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda added after a pause . ' [I]197-rhoda have n't spoken with [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot for two or three days . '[197-rhoda]

[He]242-everard looked at [her]197-rhoda with genuine astonishment .

' [You]197-rhoda have n't seen [each other]543-each other ? '[242-everard]

' [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot is angry with [me]242-everard . [I]242-everard think [we]4715-we shall be obliged to part . '[242-everard]

' To part ? What can possibly have happened ? [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot angry with [you]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' If [I]242-everard must satisfy [your]242-everard curiosity , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , [I]242-everard had better tell [you]242-everard at once that the subject of [our]4715-we difference is [the girl [you]242-everard mentioned]4716-the girl you mentioned . Not very long ago [she]4716-the girl you mentioned tried to persuade [[your]242-everard cousin]4717-your cousin to receive [her]4716-the girl you mentioned again to give [her]4716-the girl you mentioned lessons at [the place in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]4718-the place in great portland street , as before [she]4716-the girl you mentioned disgraced [herself]4716-the girl you mentioned . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , with too ready good - nature , was willing to do this , but [I]242-everard resisted . It seemed to [me]242-everard that it would be a very weak and wrong thing to do . At the time [she]4716-the girl you mentioned ended by agreeing with [me]242-everard . Now that [the girl]384-the girl has killed [herself]384-the girl , [she]4716-the girl you mentioned throws the blame upon [my]242-everard interference . [We]4720-we had a painful conversation , and [I]242-everard do n't think [we]4720-we can continue to live together . '[242-everard]

[Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot listened with gratification . It was much to have compelled [Rhoda]197-rhoda to explain [herself]197-rhoda , and on such a subject .

' Nor even to work together ? '[249-mr. barfoot] [he]249-mr. barfoot asked .

' It is doubtful . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda still moved forward , but very slowly , and without impatience .

' [You]249-mr. barfoot will somehow get over this difficulty , [I]197-rhoda am sure . [Such friends as [you]249-mr. barfoot and [Mary]225-mary]4721-such friends as you and mary do n't quarrel like [ordinary unreasonable women]4722-ordinary unreasonable women . Wo n't [you]249-mr. barfoot let [me]197-rhoda be of use ? '[197-rhoda]

' How ? '[197-rhoda] asked [Rhoda]197-rhoda with surprise .

' [I]197-rhoda shall make [[my]197-rhoda cousin]4116-my cousin see that [she]4116-my cousin is wrong . '[197-rhoda]

' How do [you]249-mr. barfoot know that [she]4116-my cousin is wrong ? '[197-rhoda]

' Because [I]197-rhoda am convinced that [you]249-mr. barfoot must be right . [I]197-rhoda respect [Mary]225-mary 's judgment , but [I]197-rhoda respect [yours]249-mr. barfoot still more . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda raised [her]197-rhoda head and smiled .

' That compliment , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said , ' pleases [me]197-rhoda less than the one [you]249-mr. barfoot have uttered without intending it . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]249-mr. barfoot must explain . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]249-mr. barfoot said that by making [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot see [she]4116-my cousin was wrong [you]249-mr. barfoot could alter [her]4116-my cousin mind towards [me]197-rhoda . [The world]3462-the world 's opinion would hardly support [you]249-mr. barfoot in that , even in the case of [men]3461-men . '[197-rhoda]

[Everard]242-everard laughed .

' Now this is better . Now [we]4726-we are talking in the old way . Surely [you]197-rhoda know that [the world]3462-the world 's opinion has no validity for [me]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda kept silence .

' But , after all , is [Mary]225-mary wrong ? [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] not afraid to ask the question now that [your]197-rhoda face has cleared a little . How angry [you]197-rhoda were with [me]0-i ! But surely [I]0-i did n't deserve it . [You]197-rhoda would have been much more forbearing if [you]197-rhoda had known what delight [I]0-i felt when [I]0-i saw [you]197-rhoda sitting over there . It is nearly a month since [we]1549-we met , and [I]0-i could n't keep away any longer . '[0-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda swept the distance with indifferent eyes .

' [Mary]225-mary was fond of [this girl]3849-this girl ? '[1550-i] [he]1550-i inquired , watching [her]197-rhoda .

' Yes , [she]3849-this girl was . '[197-rhoda]

' Then [her]3849-this girl distress , and even anger , are natural enough . [We]1549-we wo n't discuss [the girl]384-the girl 's history ; probably [I]1550-i know all that [I]1550-i need to . But whatever [her]3849-this girl misdoing , [you]1550-i certainly did n't wish to drive [her]3849-this girl to suicide . '[1550-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda deigned no reply .

' All the same , '[1550-i] [he]1550-i continued in [his]1550-i gentlest tone , ' it turns out that [you]197-rhoda have practically done so . If [Mary]225-mary had taken [the girl]384-the girl back that despair would most likely never have come upon [her]3849-this girl . Is n't it natural that [Mary]225-mary should repent of having been guided by [you]1550-i , and perhaps say rather severe things ? '[1550-i]

' Natural , no doubt . But it is just as natural for [me]1550-i to resent blame where [I]1550-i have done nothing blameworthy . '[1550-i]

' [You]1550-i are absolutely sure that this is the case ? '[1550-i]

' [I]1550-i thought [you]1550-i expressed a conviction that [I]1550-i was in the right ? '[1550-i]

There was no smile , but [Everard]242-everard believed that [he]242-everard detected its possibility on the closed lips .

' [I]1551-she have got into the way of always thinking so in questions of this kind . But perhaps [you]1550-i tend to err on the side of severity . Perhaps [you]1550-i make too little allowance for human weakness . '[1551-she]

' Human weakness is a plea that has been much abused , and generally in an interested spirit . '[1551-she]

This was something like a personal rebuke . Whether [she]1551-she so meant it , [Barfoot]242-everard could not determine . [He]1550-i hoped [she]1551-she did , for the more personal [their]1552-we talk became the better [he]1550-i would be pleased .

' [I]1550-i , for one , '[1550-i] [he]1550-i said , ' ve ry seldom urge that plea , whether in [my]1550-i own defence or another 's . But it answers to a spirit [we]1552-we ca n't altogether dispense with . Do n't [you]1550-i feel ever so little regret that [your]1550-i severe logic prevailed ? '[1550-i]

' Not the slightest regret . '[1551-she]

[Everard]242-everard thought this answer magnificent . [He]242-everard had anticipated some evasion . However inappropriately , [he]242-everard was constrained to smile .

' How [I]1550-i admire [your]1550-i consistency ! [We]1552-we [others]3608-others are [poor halting creatures]4732-poor halting creatures in comparison . '[1550-i]

' [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda suddenly , ' [I]197-rhoda have had enough of this . If [your]249-mr. barfoot approval is sincere , [I]197-rhoda do n't ask for it . If [you]249-mr. barfoot are practising [your]249-mr. barfoot powers of irony , [I]197-rhoda had rather [you]249-mr. barfoot chose [some other person]4733-some other person . [I]197-rhoda will go [my]197-rhoda way , if [you]249-mr. barfoot please . '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda just bent [her]197-rhoda head , and left [him]1553-his .

Enough for the present . Having raised [his]1553-his hat and turned on [his]1553-his heels , [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot strolled away in a mood of peculiar satisfaction . [He]249-mr. barfoot laughed to [himself]249-mr. barfoot . [She]197-rhoda was certainly [a fine creature]1554-a fine creature yes , physically as well . [Her]197-rhoda out - of - door appearance on the whole pleased [him]249-mr. barfoot ; [she]197-rhoda could dress very plainly without disguising the advantages of figure [she]197-rhoda possessed . [He]249-mr. barfoot pictured [her]197-rhoda rambling about [the hills]4487-the hills , and longed to be [[her]197-rhoda companion]812-her companion on such an expedition ; there would be no consulting with feebleness , as when one sets forth to walk with [the everyday woman]1557-the everyday woman . What daring topics might come up in the course of a twenty - mile stretch across [country]4000-country ! No Grundyism in [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda ; no simpering , no mincing of phrases . Why , [a man]3627-a man might do worse than secure [her]197-rhoda for [[his]3627-a man comrade]1560-his comrade through the whole journey of life .

Suppose [he]249-mr. barfoot pushed [his]249-mr. barfoot joke to the very point of asking [her]197-rhoda to marry [him]249-mr. barfoot ? Undoubtedly [she]197-rhoda would refuse ; but how enjoyable to watch the proud vigour of [her]197-rhoda freedom asserting itself ! Yet would not an offer of marriage be too commonplace ? Rather propose to [her]197-rhoda to share [his]249-mr. barfoot life in a free union , without sanction of forms which neither for [her]197-rhoda nor [him]249-mr. barfoot were sanction at all . Was it too bold a thought ?

Not if [he]249-mr. barfoot really meant it . Uttered insincerely , such words would be insult ; [she]197-rhoda would see through [his]249-mr. barfoot pretence of earnestness , and then farewell to [her]197-rhoda for ever . But if [his]249-mr. barfoot intellectual sympathy became tinged with passion and did [he]249-mr. barfoot discern no possibility of that ? An odd thing were [he]249-mr. barfoot to fall in love with [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda . Hitherto [his]249-mr. barfoot ideal had been [a widely different type of woman]1561-a widely different type of woman ; [he]249-mr. barfoot had demanded rare beauty of face , and the charm of a refined voluptuousness . To be sure , it was but an ideal ; [no woman that approached it]1562-no woman that approached it had ever come within [his]249-mr. barfoot sphere . The dream exercised less power over [him]249-mr. barfoot than a few years ago ; perhaps because [his]249-mr. barfoot youth was behind [him]249-mr. barfoot . [Rhoda]197-rhoda might well represent the desire of [a mature man , strengthened by modern culture]1563-a mature man , strengthened by modern culture and with [his]249-mr. barfoot senses fairly subordinate to reason . Heaven forbid that [he]249-mr. barfoot should ever tie [himself]249-mr. barfoot to [the tame domestic female]1564-the tame domestic female ; and just as little could [he]249-mr. barfoot seek for a mate among [the women of society]1565-the women of society , [the creatures all surface]1566-the creatures all surface , with empty pates and vitiated blood . No marriage for [him]249-mr. barfoot , in the common understanding of the word . [He]249-mr. barfoot wanted neither [offspring]1567-offspring nor a ' [home]364-home '[197-rhoda] . [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , if [she]197-rhoda thought of such things at all , probably desired a union which would permit [her]197-rhoda to remain [an intellectual being]1568-an intellectual being ; [the kitchen]3509-the kitchen , the cradle , and the work - basket had no power over [her]197-rhoda imagination . As likely as not , however , [she]197-rhoda was perfectly content with single life even regarded it as essential to [her]197-rhoda purposes . In [her]197-rhoda face [he]249-mr. barfoot read chastity ; [her]197-rhoda eye avoided no scrutiny ; [her]197-rhoda palm was cold .

[One]472-one does not break the heart of [such a woman]1571-such a woman . Heartbreak is a very old - fashioned disorder , associated with poverty of brain . If [Rhoda]197-rhoda were what [he]249-mr. barfoot thought [her]197-rhoda , [she]197-rhoda enjoyed this opportunity of studying [a modern male]1572-a modern male , and cared not how far [he]249-mr. barfoot proceeded in [his]249-mr. barfoot own investigations , sure that at any moment [she]197-rhoda could bid [him]249-mr. barfoot fall back . The amusement was only just beginning . And if for [him]249-mr. barfoot it became earnest , why what did [he]249-mr. barfoot seek but strong experiences ?

[Rhoda]197-rhoda , in the meantime , had gone [home]364-home . [She]197-rhoda shut [herself]197-rhoda in [[her]197-rhoda bedroom]1574-her bedroom , and remained [there]453-there until the bell rang for dinner .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot entered [the dining - room]3603-the dining - room just before [her]197-rhoda ; [they]1577-we sat down in silence , and through the meal exchanged but a few sentences , relative to a topic of the hour which interested neither of [them]1577-we .

[The elder woman]924-the elder woman had a very unhappy countenance ; [she]924-the elder woman looked worn out ; [her]924-the elder woman eyes never lifted themselves from the table .

Dinner over , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot went to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room alone . [She]212-miss barfoot had sat there about half an hour , brooding , unoccupied , when [Rhoda]197-rhoda came in and stood before [her]212-miss barfoot .

' [I]197-rhoda have been thinking it over . It is n't right for [me]197-rhoda to remain [here]3495-here . Such an arrangement was only possible whilst [we]1577-we were on terms of perfect understanding . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]197-rhoda must do what [you]197-rhoda think best , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , '[462-the other] [the other]462-the other replied gravely , but with no accent of displeasure .

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda had better take a lodging somewhere . What [I]197-rhoda wish to know is , whether [you]197-rhoda can still employ [me]197-rhoda with any satisfaction ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda do n't employ [you]197-rhoda . That is not the word to describe [your]197-rhoda relations with [me]197-rhoda . If [we]1577-we must use business language , [you]197-rhoda are simply [[my]197-rhoda partner]4736-my partner . '[197-rhoda]

' Only [your]197-rhoda kindness put [me]197-rhoda into that position . When [you]197-rhoda no longer regard [me]197-rhoda as [a friend]3555-a friend , [I]197-rhoda am only in [your]197-rhoda employment . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda have n't ceased to regard [you]197-rhoda as [a friend]3555-a friend . The estrangement between [us]1577-we is entirely of [your]197-rhoda making . '[197-rhoda]

Seeing that [Rhoda]197-rhoda would not sit down , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot rose and stood by the fireplace .

' [I]930-the former ca n't bear reproaches , '[930-the former] said [the former]930-the former ; ' least of all when [they]4739-they are irrational and undeserved . '[930-the former]

' If [I]197-rhoda reproached [you]197-rhoda , it was in a tone which should never have given [you]197-rhoda offence . [One]472-one would think that [I]197-rhoda had rated [you]197-rhoda like [a disobedient servant]4741-a disobedient servant . '[197-rhoda]

' If that had been possible , '[197-rhoda] answered [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with a faint smile , ' [I]197-rhoda should never have been [here]3495-here . [You]197-rhoda said that [you]197-rhoda bitterly repented having given way to [me]197-rhoda on a certain occasion . That was unreasonable ; in giving way , [you]197-rhoda declared [yourself]197-rhoda convinced . And the reproach [I]197-rhoda certainly did n't deserve , for [I]197-rhoda had behaved conscientiously . '[197-rhoda]

' Is n't it allowed [me]197-rhoda to disapprove of what [your]197-rhoda conscience dictates ? '[197-rhoda]

' Not when [you]197-rhoda have taken the same view , and acted upon it . [I]197-rhoda do n't lay claim to many virtues , and [I]197-rhoda have n't that of meekness . [I]197-rhoda could never endure anger ; [my]197-rhoda nature resents it . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda did wrong to speak angrily , but indeed [I]197-rhoda hardly knew what [I]197-rhoda was saying . [I]197-rhoda had suffered a terrible shock . [I]197-rhoda loved [that poor girl]4711-that poor girl ; [I]197-rhoda loved [her]4711-that poor girl all the more for what [I]197-rhoda had seen of [her]4711-that poor girl since [she]4711-that poor girl came to implore [my]197-rhoda help . [Your]197-rhoda utter coldness it seemed to [me]197-rhoda inhuman [I]197-rhoda shrank from [you]197-rhoda . If [your]197-rhoda face had shown ever so little compassion '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda felt no compassion . '[197-rhoda]

' No . [You]197-rhoda have hardened [your]197-rhoda heart with theory . Guard [yourself]197-rhoda , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ! To work for [women]3478-women one must keep [one]472-one 's womanhood . [You]197-rhoda are becoming [you]197-rhoda are wandering as far from the true way oh , much further than [Bella]194-isabel did ! '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda ca n't answer [you]197-rhoda . When [we]4746-us argued about [our]4746-us differences in a friendly spirit , all was permissible ; now if [I]197-rhoda spoke [my]197-rhoda thought it would be mere harshness and cause of embitterment . [I]197-rhoda fear all is at an end between [us]4746-us . [I]197-rhoda should perpetually remind [you]197-rhoda of this sorrow . '[197-rhoda]

There was a silence of some length . [Rhoda]197-rhoda turned away , and stood in reflection .

' Let [us]4746-us do nothing hastily , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . ' [We]4746-us have more to think of than [our]4746-us own feelings . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]197-rhoda have said that [I]197-rhoda am quite willing to go on with [my]197-rhoda work , but it must be on a different footing . The relation between [us]4746-us can no longer be that of [equals]4747-equals . [I]197-rhoda am content to follow [your]197-rhoda directions . But [your]197-rhoda dislike of [me]197-rhoda will make this impossible . '[197-rhoda]

' Dislike ? [You]197-rhoda misunderstand [me]212-miss barfoot wretchedly . [I]212-miss barfoot think rather it is [you]197-rhoda who dislike [me]212-miss barfoot , as [a weak woman with no command of [her]4748-a weak woman with no command of her emotions emotions]4748-a weak woman with no command of her emotions . '[212-miss barfoot]

Again [they]1582-we ceased from speech . Presently [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot stepped forward .

' [Rhoda]197-rhoda , [I]197-rhoda shall be away all to - morrow ; [I]197-rhoda may not return to [London]6-london until Monday morning . Will [you]197-rhoda think quietly over it all ? Believe [me]197-rhoda , [I]197-rhoda am not angry with [you]197-rhoda , and as for disliking [you]197-rhoda what nonsense are [we]1582-we talking ! But [I]197-rhoda ca n't regret that [I]197-rhoda let [you]197-rhoda see how painfully [your]197-rhoda behaviour impressed [me]197-rhoda . That hardness is not natural to [you]197-rhoda . [You]197-rhoda have encouraged [yourself]197-rhoda in it , and [you]197-rhoda are warping a very noble character . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda wish only to be honest . Where [you]197-rhoda felt compassion [I]197-rhoda felt indignation . '[197-rhoda]

' Yes ; [we]1582-we have gone through all that . The indignation was a forced , exaggerated sentiment . [You]197-rhoda ca n't see it in that light perhaps . But try to imagine for a moment that [Bella]194-isabel had been [[your]197-rhoda sister]3611-your sister '[197-rhoda]

' That is confusing the point at issue , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda exclaimed irritably . ' Have [I]197-rhoda ever denied the force of such feelings ? [My]197-rhoda grief would have blinded [me]197-rhoda to all larger considerations , of course . But [she]194-isabel was happily not [[my]197-rhoda sister]3519-my sister , and [I]197-rhoda remained free to speak the simple truth about [her]194-isabel case . It is n't personal feeling that directs a great movement in civilization . If [you]197-rhoda were right , [I]197-rhoda also was right . [You]197-rhoda should have recognized the inevitable discord of [our]1582-we Opinions at that moment . '[197-rhoda]

' It did n't seem to [me]197-rhoda inevitable . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda should have despised [myself]197-rhoda if [I]197-rhoda could have affected sympathy . '[197-rhoda]

' Affected yes . '[197-rhoda]

' Or have really felt it . That would have meant that [I]197-rhoda did not know [myself]197-rhoda . [I]197-rhoda should never again have dared to speak on any grave subject . '[197-rhoda]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot smiled sadly .

' How young [you]197-rhoda are ! Oh , there is far more than ten years between [our]1582-we ages , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ! In spirit [you]197-rhoda are [a young girl]3699-a young girl , and [I]197-rhoda [an old woman]4752-an old woman . No , no ; [we]1582-we will not quarrel . [Your]197-rhoda companionship is far too precious to [me]197-rhoda , and [I]197-rhoda dare to think that mine is not without value for [you]197-rhoda . Wait till [my]197-rhoda grief has had its course ; then [I]197-rhoda shall be more reasonable and do [you]197-rhoda more justice . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda turned towards the door , lingered , but without looking back , and so left [the room]444-the room .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was absent as [she]212-miss barfoot had announced , returning only in time for [her]212-miss barfoot duties in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street on Monday morning . [She]212-miss barfoot and [Rhoda]197-rhoda then shook hands , but without a word of personal reference . [They]1584-they went through the day 's work as usual .

This was the day of the month on which [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot would deliver [her]212-miss barfoot four o'clock address . The subject had been announced a week ago : ' [Woman]3471-woman as [an Invader]4754-an invader . '[197-rhoda] An hour earlier than usual work was put aside , and seats were rapidly arranged for [the small audience]1585-the small audience ; it numbered only thirteen [the girls already on the premises]1586-the girls already on the premises and [a few who came specially]1587-a few who came specially . [All]1172-all were aware of the tragedy in which [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had recently been concerned ; [her]212-miss barfoot air of sadness , so great a contrast to that with which [she]212-miss barfoot was wo nt to address [them]1172-all , [they]1172-all naturally attributed to this cause .

As always , [she]212-miss barfoot began in the simplest conversational tone . Not long since [she]212-miss barfoot had received an anonymous letter , written by [some clerk out of employment]1589-some clerk out of employment , abusing [her]212-miss barfoot roundly for [her]212-miss barfoot encouragement of female competition in the clerkly world . The taste of this epistle was as bad as its grammar , but [they]1172-all should hear it ; [she]212-miss barfoot read it all through . Now , whoever [the writer]1071-the writer might be , it seemed pretty clear that [he]1071-the writer was not the kind of person with whom [one]472-one could profitably argue ; no use in replying to [him]1071-the writer , even had [he]1071-the writer given the opportunity . For all that , [his]1071-the writer uncivil attack had a meaning , and there were [plenty of people]1592-plenty of people ready to urge [his]1071-the writer argument in more respectable terms . ' [They]1172-all will tell [you]4755-you that , in entering the commercial world , [you]4755-you not only unsex [yourselves]4755-you , but do a grievous wrong to [the numberless men struggling hard for bare sustenance]4756-the numberless men struggling hard for bare sustenance . [You]4755-you reduce salaries , [you]4755-you press into [an already overcrowded field]4757-an already overcrowded field , [you]4755-you injure even [your]4755-you own sex by making it impossible for [men]3461-men to marry , who , if [they]3461-men earned enough , would be supporting [a wife]514-a wife . '[212-miss barfoot] To - day , continued [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , it was not [her]212-miss barfoot purpose to debate the economic aspects of the question . [She]212-miss barfoot would consider it from another point of view , repeating , perhaps , much that [she]212-miss barfoot had already said to [them]1593-them on other occasions , but doing so because these thoughts had just now very strong possession of [her]212-miss barfoot mind .

[This abusive correspondent , who declared that [he]1594-this abusive correspondent , who declared that he was supplanted by a young woman who did his work for smaller payment , doubtless had a grievance was supplanted by [a young woman who did [his]1594-this abusive correspondent , who declared that he was supplanted by a young woman who did his work for smaller payment , doubtless had a grievance work for smaller payment]1595-a young woman who did his work for smaller payment , doubtless had a grievance]1594-this abusive correspondent , who declared that he was supplanted by a young woman who did his work for smaller payment , doubtless had a grievance . But , in the miserable disorder of [our]1596-our social state , one grievance had to be weighed against another , and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot held that there was much more to be urged on behalf of [women who invaded what had been exclusively the men]1597-women who invaded what had been exclusively the men 's sphere , than on behalf of [the men who began to complain of this invasion]1598-the men who began to complain of this invasion .

' [They]1593-them point to half a dozen occupations which are deemed strictly suitable for [women]3478-women . Why do n't [we]1596-our confine [ourselves]1596-our to this ground ? Why do n't [I]212-miss barfoot encourage [girls]3460-girls to become [governesses]4762-governesses , [hospital nurses]4763-hospital nurses , and so on ? [You]4764-you think [I]212-miss barfoot ought to reply that already there are too many applicants for such places . It would be true , but [I]212-miss barfoot do n't care to make use of the argument , which at once involves [us]1596-our in a debate with [the out - crowded clerk]4765-the out - crowded clerk . No ; to put the truth in a few words , [I]212-miss barfoot am not chiefly anxious that [you]4764-you should earn money , but that [women in general]4766-women in general shall become [rational and responsible human beings]4767-rational and responsible human beings .[212-miss barfoot]

' Follow [me]212-miss barfoot carefully . [A governess]4331-a governess , [a nurse]4769-a nurse , may be the most admirable of [women]3478-women . [I]212-miss barfoot will dissuade [no one]3554-no one from following those careers who is distinctly fitted for [them]3460-girls . But these are only [a few out of the vast number of girls who must , if [they]3460-girls are not to be [despicable persons]4773-despicable persons]4772-a few out of the vast number of girls who must , if they are not to be despicable persons , somehow find serious work . Because [I]212-miss barfoot [myself]212-miss barfoot have had an education in clerkship , and have most capacity for such employment , [I]212-miss barfoot look about for [girls of like mind]4774-girls of like mind , and do [my]212-miss barfoot best to prepare [them]4774-girls of like mind for work in [offices]3588-offices . And here [I]212-miss barfoot must become emphatic once more [I]212-miss barfoot am glad to have entered on this course . [I]212-miss barfoot am glad that [I]212-miss barfoot can show [girls]3460-girls the way to a career which [[my]212-miss barfoot opponents]4777-my opponents call unwomanly .[212-miss barfoot]

' Now see why . Womanly and womanish are two very different words ; but the latter , as [the world]3462-the world uses it , has become practically synonymous with the former . A womanly occupation means , practically , an occupation that [a man]3627-a man disdains . And here is the root of the matter . [I]212-miss barfoot repeat that [I]212-miss barfoot am not first of all anxious to keep [you]4780-you supplied with daily bread . [I]212-miss barfoot am [a troublesome , aggressive , revolutionary person]4781-a troublesome , aggressive , revolutionary person . [I]212-miss barfoot want to do away with that common confusion of the words womanly and womanish , and [I]212-miss barfoot see very clearly that this can only be effected by an armed movement , an invasion by women of the spheres which [men]3461-men have always forbidden [us]4783-we to enter . [I]212-miss barfoot am strenuously opposed to that view of [us]4783-we set forth in such charming language by [Mr. Ruskin]273-mr. ruskin for it tells on the side of [those men who think and speak of [us]4783-we]4784-those men who think and speak of us in a way the reverse of charming . Were [we]4783-we living in [an ideal world]4785-an ideal world , [I]212-miss barfoot think [women]3478-women would not go to sit all day in [offices]3588-offices . But the fact is that [we]4783-we live in [a world as far from ideal as can be conceived]4788-a world as far from ideal as can be conceived . [We]4783-we live in a time of warfare , of revolt . If [woman]3471-woman is no longer to be womanish , but [a human being of powers and responsibilities]4790-a human being of powers and responsibilities , [she]3471-woman must become militant , defiant . [She]3471-woman must push [her]3471-woman claims to the extremity .[212-miss barfoot]

' [An excellent governess]4791-an excellent governess , [a perfect hospital nurse]4792-a perfect hospital nurse , do work which is invaluable ; but for [our]4783-we cause of emancipation [they]4793-they are no good nay , they are harmful . [Men]3461-men point to [them]4793-they , and say , Imitate these , keep to [[your]4795-your proper world]4796-your proper world . [[Our]4783-we proper world]4797-our proper world is the world of intelligence , of honest effort , of moral strength . The old types of womanly perfection are no longer helpful to [us]4783-we . Like the Church service , which to [all but one person in a thousand]4798-all but one person in a thousand has become meaningless gabble by dint of repetition , these types have lost [their]4793-they effect . [They]4793-they are no longer educational . [We]4783-we have to ask [ourselves]4783-we , What course of training will wake [women]3478-women up , make [them]3478-women conscious of [their]3478-women souls , startle [them]3478-women into healthy activity ?[212-miss barfoot]

' It must be something new , something free from the reproach of womanliness . [I]212-miss barfoot do n't care whether [we]4783-we crowd out [the men]4528-the men or not . [I]212-miss barfoot do n't care what results , if only [women]3478-women are made strong and self - reliant and nobly independent ! [The world]3462-the world must look to [its]3462-the world concerns . Most likely [we]4783-we shall have a revolution in the social order greater than any that yet seems possible . Let it come , and let [us]4783-we help its coming . When [I]212-miss barfoot think of the contemptible wretchedness of [women enslaved by custom]4803-women enslaved by custom , by [their]3478-women weakness , by [their]3478-women desires , [I]212-miss barfoot am ready to cry , Let [the world]3462-the world perish in tumult rather than things go on in this way ! '[212-miss barfoot]

For a moment [her]1599-her voice failed . There were tears in [her]1599-her eyes . [The hearers]1600-the hearers , [most of [them]1600-the hearers]1601-most of them , understood what made [her]1599-her so passionate ; [they]1600-the hearers exchanged grave looks .

' [[Our]4783-we abusive correspondent]4805-our abusive correspondent shall do as best [he]4805-our abusive correspondent can . [He]4805-our abusive correspondent suffers for the folly of [men]3461-men in all ages . [We]4783-we ca n't help it . It is very far from [our]4783-we wish to cause hardship to [any one]3776-any one , but [we]4783-we [ourselves]4783-we are escaping from a hardship that has become intolerable . [We]4783-we are educating [ourselves]4783-we . There must be [a new type of woman , active in every sphere of life]4808-a new type of woman , active in every sphere of life : [a new worker]4809-a new worker out in [the world]3462-the world , [a new ruler of the home]4811-a new ruler of the home . Of the old ideal virtues [we]4783-we can retain many , but [we]4783-we have to add to them those which have been thought appropriate only in [men]3461-men . Let [a woman]615-a woman be gentle , but at the same time let [her]615-a woman be strong ; let [her]615-a woman be pure of heart , but [none the less wise and instructed]4814-none the less wise and instructed . Because [we]4783-we have to set an example to the sleepy of [our]4783-we sex , [we]4783-we must carry on an active warfare must be invaders . Whether [woman]3471-woman is the equal of [man]962-man [I]1600-the hearers neither know nor care . [We]4783-we are not [his]962-man equal in size , in weight , in muscle , and , for all [I]1600-the hearers can say , [we]4783-we may have less power of brain . That has nothing to do with it . Enough for [us]4783-we to know that [our]4783-we natural growth has been stunted . The mass of [women]3478-women have always been paltry creatures , and [their]3478-women paltriness has proved a curse to [men]3461-men . So , if [you]4819-you like to put it in this way , [we]4783-we are working for the advantage of [men]3461-men as well as for [our]4783-we own . Let the responsibility for disorder rest on [those who have made [us]4783-we despise [our]4783-we old selves]4821-those who have made us despise our old selves . At any cost at any cost [we]4783-we will free [ourselves]4783-we from the heritage of weakness and contempt ! '[1600-the hearers]

The assembly was longer than usual in dispersing . When all were gone , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot listened for a footstep in [the other room]1602-the other room . As [she]212-miss barfoot could detect no sound , [she]212-miss barfoot went to see if [Rhoda]197-rhoda was there or not .

Yes ; [Rhoda]197-rhoda was sitting in a thoughtful attitude . [She]197-rhoda looked up , smiled , and came a few paces forward .

' It was very good . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]212-miss barfoot thought it would please [you]212-miss barfoot . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot drew nearer , and added ,

' It was addressed to [you]212-miss barfoot . It seemed to [me]212-miss barfoot that [you]212-miss barfoot had forgotten how [I]212-miss barfoot really thought about these things . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]197-rhoda have been ill - tempered , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda replied . ' Obstinacy is one of [my]197-rhoda faults . '[197-rhoda]

' It is . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Their]1603-their eyes met .

' [I]197-rhoda believe , '[197-rhoda] continued [Rhoda]197-rhoda , ' that [I]197-rhoda ought to ask [your]212-miss barfoot pardon . Right or wrong , [I]197-rhoda behaved in an unmannerly way . '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda think [you]212-miss barfoot did . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda smiled , bending [her]197-rhoda head to the rebuke .

' And there 's the last of it , '[212-miss barfoot] added [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . ' Let [us]1603-their kiss and be [friends]3725-friends . '[212-miss barfoot]

CHAPTER XIV

MOTIVES MEETING

When [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot made [his]1604-he next evening call [Rhoda]197-rhoda did not appear . [He]1604-he sat for some time in pleasant talk with [[his]1604-he cousin]1165-his cousin , no reference whatever being made to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ; then at length , beginning to fear that [he]1604-he would not see [her]197-rhoda , [he]1604-he inquired after [her]197-rhoda health . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda was very well , answered [the hostess]903-the hostess , smiling .

' Not at [home]364-home this evening ? '[903-the hostess]

' Busy with some kind of study , [I]903-the hostess think . '[903-the hostess]

Plainly , the difference between [these women]1607-these women had come to a happy end , as [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot foresaw that it would . [He]1604-he thought it better to make no mention of [his]1604-he meeting with [Rhoda]197-rhoda in [the gardens]1545-the gardens .

' That was a very unpleasant affair that [I]1604-he saw [your]197-rhoda name connected with last week , '[1604-he] [he]1604-he said presently .

' It made [me]212-miss barfoot very miserable ill indeed for a day or two . '[212-miss barfoot]

' That was why [you]1604-he could n't see [me]212-miss barfoot ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Yes . '[212-miss barfoot]

' But in [your]197-rhoda reply to [my]212-miss barfoot note [you]197-rhoda made no mention of the circumstances . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot kept silence ; frowning slightly , [she]212-miss barfoot looked at the fire near which [they]1607-these women were both sitting , for the weather had become very cold .

' No doubt , '[242-everard] pursued [Everard]242-everard , glancing at [her]212-miss barfoot , ' [you]197-rhoda refrained out of delicacy on [my]242-everard account , [I]242-everard mean . '[242-everard]

' Need [we]1607-these women talk of it ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' For a moment , please . [You]197-rhoda are very friendly with [me]242-everard nowadays , but [I]242-everard suppose [your]197-rhoda estimate of [my]242-everard character remains very much the same as years ago ? '[242-everard]

' What is the use of such questions ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]242-everard ask for a distinct purpose . [You]197-rhoda ca n't regard [me]242-everard with any respect ? '[242-everard]

' To tell [you]197-rhoda the truth , [Everard]242-everard , [I]212-miss barfoot know nothing about [you]197-rhoda . [I]212-miss barfoot have no wish to revive disagreeable memories , and [I]212-miss barfoot think it quite possible that [you]197-rhoda may be worthy of respect . '[212-miss barfoot]

' So far so good . Now , in justice , please answer [me]242-everard another question . How have [you]197-rhoda spoken of [me]242-everard to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard]

' How can it matter ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' It matters a good deal . Have [you]197-rhoda told [her]197-rhoda any scandal about [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' Yes , [I]212-miss barfoot have . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Everard]242-everard looked at [her]1609-i with surprise .

' [I]1609-i spoke to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda about [you]197-rhoda , '[1609-i] [she]1609-i continued , ' before [I]1609-i thought of [your]197-rhoda coming here . Frankly , [I]1609-i used [you]197-rhoda as an illustration of the evils [I]1609-i abominate . '[1609-i]

' [You]1609-i are [a courageous and plain - spoken woman]4824-a courageous and plain - spoken woman , [cousin Mary]225-mary , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , laughing a little . ' Could n't [you]197-rhoda have found some other example ? '[242-everard]

There was no reply .

' So , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard proceeded , ' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda regards [me]242-everard as [a proved scoundrel]4825-a proved scoundrel ? '[242-everard]

' Fiction ? '[1609-i]

' [I]242-everard am not going into details ; the thing 's over and done with , and [I]242-everard chose [my]242-everard course at the time . There followed a silence of some moments . Then , with a perfectly calm manner , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot began to speak of a new subject . [Everard]242-everard followed [her]212-miss barfoot lead . [He]242-everard did not stay much longer , and on leaving asked to be remembered to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda .

A week later [he]242-everard again found [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin alone . [He]242-everard now felt sure that [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda was keeping out of [his]242-everard way . [Her]197-rhoda parting from [him]242-everard in [the gardens]1545-the gardens had been decidedly abrupt , and possibly it signified more serious offence than at the time [he]242-everard attributed to [her]197-rhoda . It was so difficult to be sure of anything in regard to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . If [another woman]1613-another woman had acted thus [he]242-everard would have judged it coquetry . But perhaps [Rhoda]197-rhoda was quite incapable of anything of that kind . Perhaps [she]197-rhoda took [herself]197-rhoda so very seriously that the mere suspicion of banter in [his]242-everard talk had moved [her]197-rhoda to grave resentment . Some ten days went by , and [he]242-everard paid a call at the hour sanctioned by [society]1614-society , five in the afternoon ; it being Saturday . If [Everard]242-everard had pleased [himself]242-everard [he]242-everard would have visited [the house in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road]1274-the house in queen 's road every other day . [She]275-agnes brissenden had no beauty , but mental powers above the average superior , certainly , to [[her]275-agnes brissenden sister]455-her sister 's .

It was worth thinking about , but in the meantime [he]242-everard wanted to see much more of [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda . [Rhoda]197-rhoda [he]242-everard was beginning to class with [women who are attractive both physically and mentally]1654-women who are attractive both physically and mentally . Strange how [her]275-agnes brissenden face had altered to [his]242-everard perception since the first meeting . [He]242-everard smiled now when [he]242-everard beheld it smiled as [a man]3627-a man does when [his]3627-a man senses are pleasantly affected . [He]242-everard was getting to know it so well , to be prepared for its constant changes , to watch for certain movements of brows or lips when [he]242-everard had said certain things . That forcible holding of [her]275-agnes brissenden hand had marked a stage in progressive appreciation ; since then [he]242-everard felt a desire to repeat the experiment .

' Or if [[thy]242-everard mistress]4844-thy mistress some rich anger shows , Imprison [her]4844-thy mistress soft hand , and let [her]4844-thy mistress rave '[242-everard]

The lines occurred to [his]242-everard memory , and [he]242-everard understood them better than heretofore . But this was something very like being in love , and [he]242-everard by no means wished to be seriously in love with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda .

It was another three weeks before [he]242-everard had an opportunity of private talk with [her]197-rhoda . Trying a Sunday afternoon , about four , [he]242-everard found [Rhoda]197-rhoda alone in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room ; [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was out of [town]624-town . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's greeting had a frank friendliness which [she]197-rhoda had not bestowed upon [him]242-everard for a long time ; not , indeed , since [they]1658-they met on [her]197-rhoda return from [Cheddar]84-cheddar . [She]197-rhoda looked very well , readily laughed , and seemed altogether in a coming - on disposition . [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot noticed that the piano was open .

' Do [you]197-rhoda play ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard inquired . ' Strange that [I]242-everard should still have to ask the question . '[242-everard]

In this humour [she]197-rhoda seemed more than ever a challenge to [his]1659-i manhood . [She]197-rhoda was armed at all points . [She]197-rhoda feared nothing that [he]1659-i might say . [She]197-rhoda liked this conversation ; [he]1659-i read pleasure in [her]197-rhoda face , saw in [her]197-rhoda eyes a glint of merry defiance . And [his]1659-i pulses throbbed the quicker for it .

' [You]197-rhoda have a prejudice against [me]197-rhoda , for instance . '[197-rhoda]

' The teacups shall come at once . '[1659-i]

[He]1659-i laughed slightly , and looked at [her]197-rhoda from beneath drooping lids . [Rhoda]197-rhoda went on with talk of trifles , until the tea was brought and [she]197-rhoda had given a cup . Having emptied it at two draughts , [he]1659-i resumed [his]1659-i former leaning position .

' Well , [you]197-rhoda were saying that [you]197-rhoda had a prejudice against [me]1659-i . Of course [[my]1659-i cousin]4116-my cousin [Mary]225-mary is accountable for that . ' [She]4865-she mentioned something of the kind once . '[1659-i]

' [You]197-rhoda could hardly believe it , [I]1659-i dare say ? [I]1659-i am [a far more reasonable being]4866-a far more reasonable being now .
