[Rhoda]197-rhoda looked into [her]197-rhoda teacup for a second or two , then said with a smile ,

' [You]1659-i also are [a reformer]4872-a reformer ? '[197-rhoda]

' In that direction . '[1661-he]

[He]1661-he had difficulty in suppressing signs of nervousness . The bold declaration had come without forethought , and [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's calm acceptance of it delighted [him]1661-he .

' Questions of marriage , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda went on to say , ' do n't interest [me]197-rhoda much ; but this particular reform does n't seem very practical . It is trying to bring about an ideal state of things whilst [we]4873-we are yet struggling with elementary obstacles . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda do n't advocate this liberty for [all mankind]4874-all mankind . Only for [those who are worthy of it]4875-those who are worthy of it . '[197-rhoda]

' And what '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda laughed a little ' are the sure signs of worthiness ? [I]197-rhoda think it would be very needful to know them . '[197-rhoda]

[Everard]242-everard kept a grave face .

' True . But a free union presupposes equality of position . [No honest man]4876-no honest man would propose it , for instance , to [a woman incapable of understanding all it involved , or incapable of resuming [her]4877-a woman incapable of understanding all it involved , or incapable of resuming her separate life separate life]4877-a woman incapable of understanding all it involved , or incapable of resuming her separate life if that became desirable . [I]197-rhoda admit all the difficulties . [One]472-one must consider those of feeling , as well as the material . If [[my]197-rhoda wife]4104-my wife should declare that [she]4104-my wife must be released , [I]197-rhoda might suffer grievously , but being [a man of some intelligence]4880-a man of some intelligence , [I]197-rhoda should admit that the suffering could n't be helped ; the brutality of enforced marriage does n't seem to [me]197-rhoda an alternative worth considering . It would n't seem so to [any woman of the kind]4881-any woman of the kind [I]197-rhoda mean . '[197-rhoda]

Would [she]197-rhoda have the courage to urge one grave difficulty that [he]242-everard left aside ? No . [He]242-everard fancied [her]197-rhoda about to speak , but [she]197-rhoda ended by offering [him]242-everard another cup of tea .

' After all , that is not [your]197-rhoda ideal ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said .

' [I]197-rhoda have n't to do with the subject at all , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered , with perhaps a trace of impatience . ' [My]197-rhoda work and thought are for [the women who do not marry [the '[197-rhoda] odd women]4883-the ' odd women ' [I]197-rhoda call [them]4883-the ' odd women]4882-the women who do not marry the ' odd women ' i call them . [They]4883-the ' odd women alone interest [me]197-rhoda . [One]472-one must n't undertake too much . '[197-rhoda]

' And [you]242-everard resolutely class [yourself]242-everard with [them]4883-the ' odd women ? '[197-rhoda]

' Of course [I]197-rhoda do . '[197-rhoda]

' And therefore [you]242-everard have certain views of life which [I]197-rhoda should like to change . [You]242-everard are doing good work , but [I]197-rhoda had rather see [any other woman in [the world]3462-the world]4885-any other woman in the world devote [her]4885-any other woman in the world life to it . [I]197-rhoda am selfish enough to wish '[197-rhoda]

The door opened , and [the servant]791-the servant announced ,

' [Mr.]4887-mr. and [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . '[791-the servant]

With perfect self - command [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda rose and stepped forward . [Barfoot]242-everard , rising more slowly , looked with curiosity at [the husband of the pretty , black - browed woman whom [he]242-everard had already met]1663-the husband of the pretty , black - browed woman whom he had already met . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson surprised and amused [him]242-everard . How had [this stiff , stern fellow with the grizzled beard]1664-this stiff , stern fellow with the grizzled beard won [such a wife]1665-such a wife ? Not that [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson seemed [a remarkable person]395-a remarkable person , but certainly it was an ill - assorted union .

[She]265-mrs. widdowson came and shook hands . As [he]242-everard spoke a few natural words , [Everard]242-everard chanced to notice that [the husband]1667-the husband 's eye was upon [him]242-everard , and with what a look ! If ever [a man]3627-a man declared in [his]3627-a man countenance the worst species of jealous temper , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson did so . [His]217-widdowson fixed smile became sardonic .

[Presently Barfoot]276-presently barfoot and [he]242-everard were introduced . [They]1669-they had nothing to say to [each other]543-each other , but [Everard]242-everard maintained a brief conversation just to observe [the man]350-the man . Turning at length , [he]242-everard began to talk with [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , and , because [he]242-everard was conscious of the jealous eye , assumed an especial sprightliness , an air of familiar pleasantry , to which [the lady]4316-the lady responded , but with a nervous hesitation .

The arrival of [these people]1673-these people was an intense annoyance to [him]242-everard . Another quarter of an hour and things would have come to an exciting pass between [Rhoda]197-rhoda and [himself]242-everard ; [he]242-everard would have heard how [she]197-rhoda received a declaration of love . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's self - possession notwithstanding , [he]242-everard believed that [he]242-everard was not without power over [her]197-rhoda . [She]197-rhoda liked to talk with [him]242-everard , enjoyed the freedom [he]242-everard allowed [himself]242-everard in choice of subject . Perhaps [no man]1079-no man before had ever shown an appreciation of [her]197-rhoda qualities as [woman]3471-woman . But [she]197-rhoda would not yield , was in no real danger from [his]242-everard love - making . Nay , the danger was to [his]242-everard own peace . [He]242-everard felt that resistance would intensify the ardour of [his]242-everard wooing , and possibly end by making [him]242-everard a victim of genuine passion . Well , let [her]197-rhoda enjoy that triumph , if [she]197-rhoda were capable of winning it .

[He]242-everard had made up [his]242-everard mind to outstay [the Widdowsons , who clearly would not make a long call]1676-the widdowsons , who clearly would not make a long call . But the fates were against [him]242-everard . [Another visitor]1677-another visitor arrived , [a lady named [Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove]1678-a lady named cosgrove , who settled [herself]1678-a lady named cosgrove as if for at least an hour . Worse than that , [he]242-everard heard [her]1678-a lady named cosgrove say to [Rhoda]197-rhoda ,

' Oh , then do come and dine with [us]4888-us . Do , [I]1678-a lady named cosgrove beg ! '[1678-a lady named cosgrove]

' [I]197-rhoda will , with pleasure , '[197-rhoda] was [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's reply . ' Can [you]242-everard wait and take [me]197-rhoda with [you]242-everard ? '[197-rhoda]

Useless to stay longer . As soon as [the Widdowsons]278-the widdowsons had departed [he]242-everard went up to [Rhoda]197-rhoda and silently offered [his]242-everard hand . [She]197-rhoda scarcely looked at [him]242-everard , and did not in the least return [his]242-everard pressure .

[Rhoda]197-rhoda dined at [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's , and was [home]364-home again at eleven o'clock . When [the house]368-the house was locked up , and [the servants]1681-the servants had gone to bed , [she]197-rhoda sat in [the library]3604-the library , turning over a book that [she]197-rhoda had brought from [[[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend 's house]1684-her friend 's house . It was a volume of essays , one of which dealt with the relations between the sexes in a very modern spirit , treating the subject as a perfectly open one , and arriving at unorthodox conclusions . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove had spoken of this dissertation with lively interest . [Rhoda]197-rhoda perused it very carefully , pausing now and then to reflect .

In this reading of [her]197-rhoda mind , [Barfoot]242-everard came near the truth .

[No man]1079-no man had ever made love to [her]197-rhoda ; [no man]1079-no man , to [her]197-rhoda knowledge , had ever been tempted to do so . In certain moods [she]197-rhoda derived satisfaction from this thought , using it to strengthen [her]197-rhoda life 's purpose ; having passed [her]197-rhoda thirtieth year , [she]197-rhoda might take it as a settled thing that [she]197-rhoda would never be sought in marriage , and so could shut the doors on every instinct tending to trouble [her]197-rhoda intellectual decisions . But these instincts sometimes refused to be thus treated . As [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot told [her]197-rhoda , [she]197-rhoda was very young for [her]197-rhoda years , young in physique , young in emotion . As [a girl]3628-a girl [she]197-rhoda had dreamt passionately , and the fires of [her]197-rhoda nature , though hidden beneath aggregations of moral and mental attainment , were not yet smothered . An hour of lassitude filled [her]197-rhoda with despondency , none the less real because [she]197-rhoda was ashamed of it . If only [she]197-rhoda had once been loved , like other women if [she]197-rhoda had listened to an offer of devotion , and rejected it [her]197-rhoda heart would be more securely at peace . So [she]197-rhoda thought . Secretly [she]197-rhoda deemed it a hard thing never to have known that common triumph of [her]197-rhoda sex . And , moreover , it took away from the merit of [her]197-rhoda position as [a leader and encourager of [women living independently]1689-women living independently]1688-a leader and encourager of women living independently . There might be some who said , or thought , that [she]197-rhoda made a virtue of necessity .

[Everard Barfoot]242-everard 's advances surprised [her]197-rhoda not a little . Judging [him]242-everard as [a man wholly without principle]1690-a man wholly without principle , [she]197-rhoda supposed at first that this was merely [his]242-everard way with [all women]1691-all women , and resented it as impertinence . But even then [she]197-rhoda did not dislike the show of homage ; what [her]197-rhoda mind regarded with disdain , [her]197-rhoda heart was all but willing to feed upon , after its long hunger . [Barfoot]242-everard interested [her]197-rhoda , and not the less because of [his]242-everard evil reputation . Here was [one of [the men for whom [women doubtless more than one]1694-women doubtless more than one had sacrificed [themselves]1694-women doubtless more than one]1693-the men for whom women doubtless more than one had sacrificed themselves]1692-one of the men for whom women doubtless more than one had sacrificed themselves ; [she]197-rhoda could not but regard [him]242-everard with sexual curiosity . And [her]197-rhoda interest grew , [her]197-rhoda curiosity was more haunting , as [their]1695-their acquaintance became a sort of friendship ; [she]197-rhoda found that [her]197-rhoda moral disapprobation wavered , or was altogether forgotten . Perhaps it was to compensate for this that [she]197-rhoda went the length of outraging [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's feelings on the death of [Bella Royston]194-isabel .

Certainly [she]197-rhoda thought with much frequency of [Barfoot]242-everard , and looked forward to [his]242-everard coming . Never had [she]197-rhoda wished so much to see [him]242-everard again as after [their]1695-their encounter in [Chelsea Gardens]99-chelsea gardens , and on that account [she]197-rhoda forced [herself]197-rhoda to hold aloof when [he]242-everard came . It was not love , nor the beginning of love ; [she]197-rhoda judged it something less possible to avow . [The man]350-the man 's presence affected [her]197-rhoda with a perturbation which [she]197-rhoda had no difficulty in concealing at the time , though afterwards it distressed and shamed [her]197-rhoda . [She]197-rhoda took refuge in the undeniable fact that the quality of [his]350-the man mind made an impression upon [her]197-rhoda , that [his]350-the man talk was sympathetic . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot submitted to this influence ; [she]197-rhoda confessed that [[her]197-rhoda cousin]1204-her cousin 's talk had always had a charm for [her]197-rhoda .

Could it be that [this man]742-this man reciprocated , and more than reciprocated , [her]197-rhoda complex feeling ? To - day only accident had prevented [him]350-the man from making an avowal of love unless [she]197-rhoda strangely mistook [him]350-the man . All the evening [she]197-rhoda had dwelt on this thought ; it grew more and more astonishing . Was [he]350-the man worse than [she]197-rhoda had imagined ? Under cover of independent thought , of serious moral theories , did [he]350-the man conceal mere profligacy and heartlessness ? It was an extraordinary thing to have to ask such questions in relation to [herself]197-rhoda . It made [her]197-rhoda feel as if [she]197-rhoda had to learn [herself]197-rhoda anew , to form a fresh conception of [her]197-rhoda personality . [She]197-rhoda the object of [a man]3627-a man 's passion !

And the thought was exultant . Even thus late , then , the satisfaction of vanity had been granted [her]197-rhoda nay , not of vanity alone .

[He]350-the man must be sincere . What motive could [he]350-the man possibly have for playing a part ? Might it not be true that [he]350-the man was [a changed man]1700-a changed man in certain respects , and that a genuine emotion at length had control of [him]350-the man ? If so , [she]197-rhoda had only to wait for [his]350-the man next speech with [her]197-rhoda in private ; [she]197-rhoda could not misjudge [a lover]1701-a lover 's pleading .

The interest would only be that of comedy . [She]197-rhoda did not love [Everard Barfoot]242-everard , and saw no likelihood of ever doing so ; on the whole , a subject for thankfulness . Nor could [he]350-the man seriously anticipate an assent to [his]350-the man proposal for a free union ; in declaring that legal marriage was out of the question for [him]350-the man , [he]350-the man had removed [his]350-the man love - making to the region of mere ideal sentiment . But , if [he]350-the man loved [her]197-rhoda , these theories would sooner or later be swept aside ; [he]350-the man would plead with [her]197-rhoda to become [[his]350-the man legal wife]1702-his legal wife .

To that point [she]197-rhoda desired to bring [him]350-the man . Offer what [he]350-the man might , [she]197-rhoda would not accept it ; but the secret chagrin that was upon [her]197-rhoda would be removed . Love would no longer be the privilege of [other women]1542-other women . To reject [a lover]1701-a lover in so many respects desirable , whom [so many women]1705-so many women might envy [her]197-rhoda , would fortify [her]197-rhoda self - esteem , and enable [her]197-rhoda to go forward in the chosen path with firmer tread .

It was one o'clock ; the fire had died out and [she]197-rhoda began to shiver with cold . But a trembling of joy at the same time went through [her]197-rhoda limbs ; again [she]197-rhoda had the sense of exultation , of triumph . [She]197-rhoda would not dismiss [him]350-the man peremptorily . [He]350-the man should prove the quality of [his]350-the man love , if love it were . Coming so late , the experience must yield [her]197-rhoda all it had to yield of delight and contentment .

CHAPTER XV

THE JOYS OF [HOME]364-home

[Monica]195-monica and [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , on leaving [the house]368-the house in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road , walked slowly in the eastward direction . Though night had fallen , the air was not unpleasant ; [they]1709-they had no object before [them]1709-they , and for five minutes [they]1709-they occupied [themselves]1709-they with [their]1709-they thoughts . Then [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson stopped .

' Shall [we]1709-they go [home]364-home again ? '[4145-her husband] [he]4145-her husband asked , just glancing at [Monica]195-monica , then letting [his]4145-her husband eyes stray vaguely in the gloom .

' [I]4145-her husband should like to see [Milly]234-mildred , but [I]4145-her husband 'm[4145-her husband] afraid [I]0-i can hardly take [you]195-monica [there]453-there to call with [me]0-i . '[0-i]

' Why not ? '[4145-her husband]

' It 's [a very poor little sitting - room]4890-a very poor little sitting - room , [you]195-monica know , and [she]234-mildred might have [some friend]4891-some friend . Is n't there anywhere [you]195-monica could go , and meet [me]0-i afterwards ? '[0-i]

Frowning , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson looked at [his]4145-her husband watch .

' Nearly six o'clock . There is n't much time . '[4145-her husband]

' [Edmund]217-widdowson , suppose [you]217-widdowson go [home]364-home , and let [me]4145-her husband come back by [myself]4145-her husband ? [You]217-widdowson would n't mind , for once ? [I]4145-her husband should like so much to have a talk with [Milly]234-mildred . If [I]4145-her husband got back about nine or half - past , [I]4145-her husband could have a little supper , and that 's all [I]4145-her husband should want . '[4145-her husband]

[He]4145-her husband answered abruptly ,

' Oh , but [I]4145-her husband ca n't have [you]217-widdowson going about alone at night . '[4145-her husband]

' Why not ? '[195-monica] answered [Monica]195-monica , with a just perceptible note of irritation . ' Are [you]4145-her husband afraid [I]195-monica shall be robbed or murdered ? '[195-monica]

' Nonsense . But [you]217-widdowson must n't be alone . '[4145-her husband]

' Did n't [I]195-monica always use to be alone ? '[195-monica]

[He]4145-her husband made an angry gesture .

' [I]4145-her husband have begged [you]217-widdowson not to speak of that . Why do [you]217-widdowson say what [you]217-widdowson know is disagreeable to [me]4145-her husband ? [You]217-widdowson used to do all sorts of things that [you]217-widdowson never ought to have been obliged to do , and it 's very painful to remember it . '[4145-her husband]

[Monica]195-monica , seeing that [people]3536-people were approaching , walked on , and [neither]1146-neither spoke until [they]1713-we had nearly reached the end of [the road]431-the road .

' [I]217-widdowson think [we]1713-we had better go [home]364-home , '[217-widdowson] [Widdowson]217-widdowson at length remarked .

' If [you]217-widdowson wish it ; but [I]4145-her husband really do n't see why [I]4145-her husband should n't call on [Milly]234-mildred , now that [we]1713-we are [here]3495-here . '[4145-her husband]

' Why did n't [you]217-widdowson speak of it before [we]1713-we left [home]364-home ? [You]217-widdowson ought to be more methodical , [Monica]195-monica . Each morning [I]217-widdowson always plan how [my]217-widdowson day is to be spent , and it would be much better if [you]217-widdowson would do the same . Then [you]217-widdowson would n't be so restless and uncertain . '[217-widdowson]

' If [I]195-monica go to [Rutland Street]55-rutland street , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , without heeding this admonition , ' could n't [you]217-widdowson leave [me]195-monica [there]453-there for an hour ? '[195-monica]

' What in [the world]3462-the world am [I]217-widdowson to do ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica should have thought [you]1715-you might walk about . It 's a pity [you]1715-you do n't know [more people]4898-more people , [Edmund]217-widdowson . It would make things so much pleasanter for [you]1715-you . '[195-monica]

In the end [he]1715-you consented to see [her]195-monica safely as far as [Rutland Street]55-rutland street , occupy [himself]1715-you for an hour , and come back for [her]195-monica . [They]1716-they went by [cab]1094-cab , which was dismissed in [Hampstead Road]56-hampstead road . [Widdowson]217-widdowson did not turn away until [he]217-widdowson had ocular proof of [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's admittance to [the house where [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper lived]1719-the house where miss vesper lived , and even then [he]217-widdowson walked no farther than [the neighbouring streets]1720-the neighbouring streets , returning about every ten minutes to watch [the house]368-the house from a short distance , as though [he]217-widdowson feared [Monica]195-monica might have some project of escape . [His]217-widdowson look was very bilious ; trudging mechanically hither and thither where [fewest people were to be met]1722-fewest people were to be met , [he]217-widdowson kept [his]217-widdowson eyes on the ground , and clumped to a dismal rhythm with the end of [his]217-widdowson walking - stick . In the three or four months since [his]217-widdowson marriage , [he]217-widdowson seemed to have grown older ; [he]217-widdowson no longer held [himself]217-widdowson so upright .

At the very moment agreed upon [he]217-widdowson was waiting close by [the house]368-the house . Five minutes passed ; twice [he]217-widdowson had looked at [his]217-widdowson watch , and [he]217-widdowson grew excessively impatient , stamping as if it were necessary to keep [himself]217-widdowson warm . Another five minutes , and [he]217-widdowson uttered a nervous ejaculation . [He]217-widdowson had all but made up [his]217-widdowson mind to go and knock at the door when [Monica]195-monica came forth .

' [You]217-widdowson have n't been waiting here long , [I]195-monica hope ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said cheerfully .

' Ten minutes . But it does n't matter . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica 'm[195-monica] very sorry . [We]1724-we were talking on '[1724-we]

' Yes , but one must always be punctual . [I]195-monica wish [I]195-monica could impress that upon [you]217-widdowson . Life without punctuality is quite impossible . '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] very sorry , [Edmund]217-widdowson . [I]0-i will be more careful . Please do n't lecture [me]0-i , [dear]3530-dear . How shall [we]1724-we go [home]364-home ? '[195-monica]

' [We]1724-we had better take [a cab]836-a cab to [Victoria]100-victoria . No knowing how long [we]1724-we may have to wait for [a train]4900-a train when [we]1724-we get [there]453-there . '[195-monica]

' Now do n't be so grumpy . Where have [you]0-i been all the time ? '[195-monica]

' Oh , walking about . What else was [I]195-monica to do ? '[195-monica]

On [the drive]1727-the drive [they]1724-we held no conversation . At [Victoria]100-victoria [they]1724-we were delayed about half an hour before [a train]4900-a train started for [Herne Hill]32-herne hill ; [Monica]195-monica sat in [a waiting - room]1729-a waiting - room , and [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband trudged about [the platform]865-the platform , still clumping rhythmically with [his]4145-her husband stick .

[Their]1724-we Sunday custom was to dine at one o'clock , and at six to have tea . [Widdowson]217-widdowson hated the slightest interference with domestic routine , and [he]217-widdowson had reluctantly indulged [Monica]195-monica 's desire to go to [Chelsea]19-chelsea this afternoon . Hunger was now added to [his]217-widdowson causes of discontent .

' Let [us]1724-we have something to eat at once , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said on entering [the house]368-the house . ' This disorder really wo n't do : [we]1724-we must manage better somehow . '[217-widdowson]

Without replying , [Monica]195-monica rang the dining - room bell , and gave orders .

Little change had been made in the interior of [the house]368-the house since [its master]1734-its master 's marriage . [The dressing - room adjoining [the principal bed - chamber]1736-the principal bed - chamber]1735-the dressing - room adjoining the principal bed - chamber was adapted to [Monica]195-monica 's use , and a few ornaments were added to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room . Unlike [[his]217-widdowson deceased brother]1738-his deceased brother , [Widdowson]217-widdowson had the elements of artistic taste ; in furnishing [[his]217-widdowson abode]1739-his abode [he]217-widdowson took counsel with [approved decorators]1740-approved decorators , and at moderate cost had made [himself]217-widdowson [a home which presented no original features , but gave no offence to a cultivated eye]1741-a home which presented no original features , but gave no offence to a cultivated eye . The first sight of [the rooms]1005-the rooms pleased [Monica]195-monica greatly . [She]195-monica declared that all was perfect , nothing need be altered . In those days , if [she]195-monica had bidden [him]217-widdowson spend a hundred pounds on reconstruction , [the lover]1743-the lover would have obeyed , delighted to hear [her]195-monica express a wish .

Though competence had come to [him]217-widdowson only after a lifetime of narrow means , [Widdowson]217-widdowson felt no temptation to parsimony . Secure in [his]217-widdowson all - sufficing income , [he]217-widdowson grudged no expenditure that could bring [himself]217-widdowson or [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife satisfaction . On the wedding - tour in [Cornwall]91-cornwall , [Devon]101-devon , and [Somerset]36-somerset it lasted about seven weeks [Monica]195-monica learnt , among other things less agreeable , that [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband was generous with money .

[He]217-widdowson was anxious [she]195-monica should dress well , though only , as [Monica]195-monica soon discovered , for [his]217-widdowson own gratification . Soon after [they]1746-they had settled down at [home]364-home [she]195-monica equipped [herself]195-monica for the cold season , and [Widdowson]217-widdowson cared little about the price so long as the effect of [her]195-monica new costumes was pleasing to [him]217-widdowson .

' [You]217-widdowson are making a butterfly of [me]195-monica , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica merrily , when [he]217-widdowson expressed strong approval of a bright morning dress that had just come [home]364-home .

' [A beautiful woman]4902-a beautiful woman , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson replied , with the nervous gravity which still possessed [him]217-widdowson when complimenting [her]195-monica , or saying tender things , ' [a beautiful woman]4902-a beautiful woman ought to be beautifully clad . '[217-widdowson]

At the same time [he]217-widdowson endeavoured to impress [her]195-monica with the gravest sense of [a married woman]1749-a married woman 's obligations . [His]217-widdowson raptures , genuine enough , were sometimes interrupted in the oddest way if [Monica]195-monica chanced to utter a careless remark of which [he]217-widdowson could not strictly approve , and such interruptions frequently became the opportunity for a long and solemn review of the wifely status . Without much trouble [he]217-widdowson had brought [her]195-monica into a daily routine which satisfied [him]217-widdowson . During the whole of the morning [she]195-monica was to be absorbed in household cares . In the afternoon [he]217-widdowson would take [her]195-monica to walk or drive , and the evening [he]217-widdowson wished [her]195-monica to spend either in [drawing - room]1750-drawing - room or [library]1751-library , occupied with a book . [Monica]195-monica soon found that [his]217-widdowson idea of wedded happiness was that [they]1752-they should always be together . Most reluctantly [he]217-widdowson consented to [her]195-monica going any distance alone , for whatever purpose . Public entertainments [he]217-widdowson regarded with no great favour , but when [he]217-widdowson saw how [Monica]195-monica enjoyed [herself]195-monica at concert or [theatre]1753-theatre , [he]217-widdowson made no objection to indulging [her]195-monica at intervals of a fortnight or so ; [his]217-widdowson own fondness for music made this compliance easier . [He]217-widdowson was jealous of [her]195-monica forming [new acquaintances]1754-new acquaintances ; indifferent to society [himself]217-widdowson , [he]217-widdowson thought [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife should be satisfied with [[her]195-monica present friends]1756-her present friends , and could not understand why [she]4133-his wife wished to see [them]1756-her present friends so often .

[The girl]384-the girl was docile , and for a time [he]217-widdowson imagined that there would never be conflict between [his]217-widdowson will and [hers]195-monica . Whilst enjoying [their]1758-their holiday [they]1758-their naturally went everywhere together , and were scarce an hour out of [each other]543-each other 's presence , day or night . In quiet spots by [the seashore]1760-the seashore , when [they]1758-their sat in solitude , [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's tongue was loosened , and [he]217-widdowson poured forth [his]217-widdowson philosophy of life with the happy assurance that [Monica]195-monica would listen passively . [His]217-widdowson devotion to [her]195-monica proved itself in a thousand ways ; week after week [he]217-widdowson grew , if anything , more kind , more tender ; yet in [his]217-widdowson view of [their]1758-their relations [he]217-widdowson was unconsciously [the most complete despot]1761-the most complete despot , [a monument of male autocracy]1762-a monument of male autocracy . Never had it occurred to [Widdowson]217-widdowson that [a wife]514-a wife remains [an individual]1764-an individual , with rights and obligations independent of [her]514-a wife wifely condition . Everything [he]217-widdowson said presupposed [his]217-widdowson own supremacy ; [he]217-widdowson took for granted that it was [his]217-widdowson to direct , [hers]195-monica to be guided . A display of energy , purpose , ambition , on [Monica]195-monica 's part , which had no reference to domestic pursuits , would have gravely troubled [him]217-widdowson ; at once [he]217-widdowson would have set [himself]217-widdowson to subdue , with all gentleness , impulses so inimical to [his]217-widdowson idea of the married state . It rejoiced [him]217-widdowson that [she]195-monica spoke with so little sympathy of the principles supported by [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ; [these persons]1765-these persons seemed to [him]217-widdowson well - meaning , but grievously mistaken . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda [he]217-widdowson judged ' unwomanly , '[197-rhoda] and hoped in secret that [Monica]195-monica would not long remain on terms of friendship with [her]197-rhoda . Of course [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's former pursuits were an abomination to [him]217-widdowson ; [he]217-widdowson could not bear to hear [them]1767-them referred to .

' [Woman]3471-woman 's sphere is [the home]3465-the home , [Monica]195-monica . [Unfortunately girls]4906-unfortunately girls are often obliged to go out and earn [their]4906-unfortunately girls living , but this is unnatural , a necessity which [advanced civilization]4907-advanced civilization will altogether abolish . [You]4908-you shall read [John Ruskin]279-john ruskin ; every word [he]279-john ruskin says about [women]3478-women is good and precious . If [a woman]615-a woman can neither have [a home of [her]615-a woman own]4911-a home of her own , nor find occupation in any one else 's [she]615-a woman is deeply to be pitied ; [her]615-a woman life is bound to be unhappy . [I]195-monica sincerely believe that [an educated woman]4912-an educated woman had better become [a domestic servant]4913-a domestic servant than try to imitate the life of [a man]3627-a man . '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica seemed to listen attentively , but before long [she]195-monica accustomed [herself]195-monica to wear this look whilst in truth [she]195-monica was thinking [her]195-monica own thoughts . And as often as not they were of a nature little suspected by [[her]195-monica prosing companion]1768-her prosing companion .

[He]1769-he believed [himself]1769-he [the happiest of [men]3461-men]1770-the happiest of men . [He]1769-he had taken a daring step , but fortune smiled upon [him]1769-he , [Monica]195-monica was all [he]1769-he had imagined in [his]1769-he love - fever ; knowledge of [her]195-monica had as yet brought to light no single untruth , not trait of character that [he]1769-he could condemn . That [she]195-monica returned [his]1769-he love [he]1769-he would not and could not doubt . And something [she]195-monica said to [him]1769-he one day , early in [their]1772-their honeymoon , filled up the measure of [his]1769-he bliss .

' What a change [you]1769-he have made in [my]195-monica life , [Edmund]217-widdowson ! How much [I]195-monica have to thank [you]1769-he for ! '[195-monica]

That was what [he]1769-he had hoped to hear . [He]1769-he had thought it [himself]1769-he ; had wondered whether [Monica]195-monica saw [her]195-monica position in this light . And when the words actually fell from [her]195-monica lips [he]1769-he glowed with joy . This , to [his]1769-he mind , was the perfect relation of [wife]3467-wife to [husband]1774-husband . [She]195-monica must look up to [him]1769-he as [[her]195-monica benefactor]1775-her benefactor , [[her]195-monica providence]1776-her providence . It would have pleased [him]1769-he still better if [she]195-monica had not possessed a penny of [her]195-monica own , but happily [Monica]195-monica seemed never to give a thought to the sum at [her]195-monica disposal .

Surely [he]1769-he was the easiest of [men to live with]1777-men to live with . When [he]1769-he first became aware that [Monica]195-monica suffered an occasional discontent , it caused [him]1769-he troublous surprise . As soon as [he]1769-he understood that [she]195-monica desired more freedom of movement , [he]1769-he became anxious , suspicious irritable . Nothing like a quarrel had yet taken place between [them]1778-them , but [Widdowson]217-widdowson began to perceive that [he]217-widdowson must exert authority in a way [he]217-widdowson had imagined would never be necessary . All [his]217-widdowson fears , after all , were not groundless . [Monica]195-monica 's undomestic life , and perhaps the association with [those Chelsea people]1779-those chelsea people , had left results upon [her]195-monica mind . By way of mild discipline , [he]217-widdowson first of all suggested a closer attention to the affairs of [the house]368-the house . Would it not be well if [she]195-monica spent an hour a day in sewing or fancy work ? [Monica]195-monica so far obeyed as to provide [herself]195-monica with some plain needlework , but [Widdowson]217-widdowson , watching with keen eye , soon remarked that [her]195-monica use of the needle was only a feint . [He]217-widdowson lay awake o ' nights , pondering darkly .[217-widdowson]

On the present evening [he]217-widdowson was more decidedly out of temper than ever hitherto . [He]217-widdowson satisfied [his]217-widdowson hunger hurriedly and in silence . Then , observing that [Monica]195-monica ate only a few morsels , [he]217-widdowson took offence at this .

' [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] afraid [you]195-monica are not well , [dear]3530-dear . [You]195-monica have had no appetite for several days . '[195-monica]

' As much as usual , [I]195-monica think , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica replied absently .

[They]1782-they went into [the library]3604-the library , commonly [their]1782-they resort of an evening . [Widdowson]217-widdowson possessed several hundred volumes of English literature , most of them the works which are supposed to be indispensible to [a well - informed man]1784-a well - informed man , though [very few men]1785-very few men even make a pretence of reading [them]1786-them . Self - educated , [Widdowson]217-widdowson deemed it [his]217-widdowson duty to make acquaintance with [the great]1787-the great , [the solid authors]1788-the solid authors . Nor was [his]217-widdowson study of [them]1786-them affectation . For [the poets]369-the poets [he]217-widdowson had little taste ; the novelists [he]217-widdowson considered only profitable in intervals of graver reading ; but history , political economy , even metaphysics , genuinely appealed to [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson had always two or three solid books on hand , each with its marker ; [he]217-widdowson studied them at stated hours , and always sitting at a table , a notebook open beside [him]217-widdowson . A little work once well - known , [Todd]280-todd 's ' Student 's Manual , '[280-todd] had formed [his]217-widdowson method and inspired [him]217-widdowson with zeal .

To - night , it being Sunday , [he]217-widdowson took down a volume of [Barrow]281-barrow 's Sermons . Though not strictly orthodox in religious faith , [he]217-widdowson conformed to the practices of [the Church of [England]58-england]1790-the church of england , and since [his]217-widdowson marriage had been more scrupulous on this point than before . [He]217-widdowson abhorred unorthodoxy in [a woman]615-a woman , and would not on any account have suffered [Monica]195-monica to surmise that [he]217-widdowson had [his]217-widdowson doubts concerning any article of the Christian faith . Like [most men of [his]217-widdowson kind]1792-most men of his kind , [he]217-widdowson viewed religion as a precious and powerful instrument for directing the female conscience . Frequently [he]217-widdowson read aloud to [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife , but this evening [he]217-widdowson showed no intention of doing so . [Monica]195-monica , however , sat unoccupied . After glancing at [her]195-monica once or twice , [he]217-widdowson said reprovingly ,

' Have [you]195-monica finished [your]195-monica Sunday book ? '[217-widdowson]

' Not quite . But [I]217-widdowson do n't care to read just now . '[217-widdowson]

The silence that followed was broken by [Monica]195-monica [herself]195-monica .

' Have [you]217-widdowson accepted [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson 's invitation to dinner ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked .

' [I]217-widdowson have declined it , '[217-widdowson] was the reply , carelessly given .

[Monica]195-monica bit [her]195-monica lip .

' But why ? '[195-monica]

' Surely [we]4915-we need n't discuss that over again , [Monica]195-monica . '[217-widdowson]

[His]217-widdowson eyes were still on the book , and [he]217-widdowson stirred impatiently .

' But , '[4133-his wife] urged [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife , ' do [you]217-widdowson mean to break with [her]4133-his wife altogether ? [Widdowson]217-widdowson drummed on the floor with [his]217-widdowson foot . In a few moments , ignoring [Monica]195-monica 's remarks , [he]217-widdowson stroked [his]217-widdowson beard , and asked , with a show of casual interest

[Monica]195-monica had already learnt that the jealousy which [Widdowson]217-widdowson so often betrayed before [their]1796-their manage still lurked in [his]217-widdowson mind . [Their]1797-their bedtime was half - past ten . [He]217-widdowson had a passion for routine . Every night , before going [upstairs]443-upstairs , [he]217-widdowson did a number of little things in unvarying sequence changed the calendar for next day , made perfect order on [his]217-widdowson writing - table , wound lip [his]217-widdowson watch , and so on . That [Monica]195-monica could not direct [her]195-monica habits with like exactitude was frequently a distress to [him]217-widdowson ; if [she]195-monica chanced to forget any most trivial detail of daily custom [he]217-widdowson looked very solemn , and begged [her]195-monica to be more vigilant .

Next morning after breakfast , as [Monica]195-monica stood by the dining - room window and looked rather cheerlessly at a leaden sky , [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband came towards [her]195-monica as if [he]217-widdowson had something to say . [Monica]195-monica nodded cheerfully , and went off to look after [[her]195-monica housekeeping]1802-her housekeeping .

The week was in all respects what [Widdowson]217-widdowson desired . [Not a soul]1803-not a soul came to [the house]368-the house ; [Monica]195-monica went to see [no one]3554-no one . Saturday brought no improvement of the atmosphere , but [Widdowson]217-widdowson was in [his]217-widdowson happiest mood ; [he]217-widdowson cheerfully kept [his]217-widdowson promise about the concert . As [they]1806-they sat together at night , [his]217-widdowson contentment overflowed in tenderness like that of the first days of marriage .

' Now , why ca n't [we]4931-we always live like this ? What have [we]4931-we to do with [other people]942-other people ? Let [us]4931-we be everything to [each other]543-each other , and forget that [any one else]4063-any one else exists . '[1807-i]

[Monica]195-monica was silent .

This was a word [Widdowson]217-widdowson detested . Change , on [Monica]195-monica 's lips , always seemed to mean a release from [his]217-widdowson society . But [he]217-widdowson swallowed [his]217-widdowson dissatisfaction , and finally consented to the arrangement .

[Virginia]191-virginia came to dinner , and stayed until nightfall . Thanks to [[her]191-virginia sister]455-her sister 's kindness , [she]191-virginia was better clad than in former days , but [her]191-virginia face signified no improvement of health . The enthusiasm with which [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda had inspired [her]191-virginia appeared only in fitful affectations of interest when [Monica]195-monica pressed [her]191-virginia concerning the projected undertaking down in [Somerset]36-somerset . In general [she]191-virginia had a dreamy , reticent look , and became uncomfortable when [any one]3776-any one gazed at [her]191-virginia inquiringly . [Her]191-virginia talk was of the most insignificant things ; this afternoon [she]191-virginia spent nearly half an hour in describing a kitten which [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee had given [her]191-virginia ; care of the little animal appeared to have absorbed [her]191-virginia whole attention for many days past .

[Another visitor to - day]1813-another visitor to - day was [Mr. Newdick]268-mr. newdick , [the City clerk who had been present at [Monica]195-monica 's wedding]1814-the city clerk who had been present at monica 's wedding . [He]268-mr. newdick and [Mrs. Luke Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson were [the sole friends of [[her]191-virginia husband]4145-her husband that [Monica]195-monica had seen]1815-the sole friends of her husband that monica had seen . [Mr. Newdick]268-mr. newdick enjoyed coming to [Herne Hill]32-herne hill . Always lugubrious to begin with , [he]268-mr. newdick gradually cheered up , and by the time for departure was loquacious . But [he]268-mr. newdick had the oddest ideas of talk suitable to [a drawing - room]4833-a drawing - room . Had [he]268-mr. newdick been permitted , [he]268-mr. newdick would have held forth to [Monica]195-monica by the hour on the history of [the business firm which [he]268-mr. newdick had served for a quarter of a century]1818-the business firm which he had served for a quarter of a century . This subject alone could animate [him]268-mr. newdick . [His]268-mr. newdick anecdotes were as often as not quite unintelligible , save to [people of City experience]1819-people of city experience . For all that [Monica]195-monica did not dislike [the man]350-the man ; [he]350-the man was [a good , simple , unselfish fellow]1821-a good , simple , unselfish fellow , and to [her]195-monica [he]350-the man behaved with exaggeration of respect .

A few days later [Monica]195-monica had a sudden fit of illness . [Her]195-monica marriage , and the long open - air holiday , had given [her]195-monica a much healthier appearance than when [she]195-monica was at [the shop]582-the shop ; but this present disorder resembled the attack [she]195-monica had suffered in [Rutland Street]55-rutland street . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson hoped that it signified a condition for which [he]268-mr. newdick was anxiously waiting . That , however , did not seem to be the case . [The medical man who was called in]1823-the medical man who was called in asked questions about [the patient]1293-the patient 's mode of life . Did [she]195-monica take enough exercise ? Had [she]195-monica wholesome variety of occupation ? At these inquiries [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson inwardly raged . [He]268-mr. newdick was tormented with a suspicion that they resulted from something [Monica]195-monica had said to [the doctor]352-the doctor .

[She]195-monica kept [her]195-monica bed for three or four days , and on rising could only sit by the fireside , silent , melancholy . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson indulged [his]268-mr. newdick hope , though [Monica]195-monica [herself]195-monica laughed it aside , and even showed annoyance if [he]268-mr. newdick return to the subject . [Her]195-monica temper was strangely uncertain ; some chance word in a conversation would irritate [her]195-monica beyond endurance , and after an outburst of petulant displeasure [she]195-monica became obstinately mute . At other times [she]195-monica behaved with such exquisite docility and sweetness that [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was beside [himself]265-mrs. widdowson with rapture .

After a week of convalescence , [she]195-monica said one morning ,

' Could n't [we]4941-we go away somewhere ? [I]195-monica do n't think [I]195-monica shall ever be quite well staying [here]3495-here . '[195-monica]

' It 's wretched weather , '[4145-her husband] replied [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband .

' Oh , but there are places where it would n't be like this . [You]268-mr. newdick do n't mind the expense , do [you]268-mr. newdick , [Edmund]217-widdowson ? '[195-monica]

' Expense ? Not [I]195-monica , indeed ! But were [you]268-mr. newdick thinking of abroad ? '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica looked at [him]268-mr. newdick with eyes that had suddenly brightened .

' Oh ! would it be possible ? [People]3536-people do go out of [England]58-england in the winter . '[195-monica]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson plucked at [his]217-widdowson grizzled beard and fingered [his]217-widdowson watch - chain . It was a temptation . Why not take [her]195-monica away to [some place where only [foreigners]1828-foreigners and [strangers]407-strangers would be about [them]1830-them]1827-some place where only foreigners and strangers would be about them ? Yet the enterprise alarmed [him]217-widdowson .

' [I]217-widdowson have never been out of [England]58-england , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said , with misgiving .

' All the more reason why [we]4944-we should go . [I]195-monica think [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot could advise [us]4944-we about it . [She]212-miss barfoot has been abroad , [I]195-monica know , and [she]212-miss barfoot has so many [friends]3725-friends . '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson do n't see any need to consult [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson replied stiffly . ' [I]217-widdowson am not such [a helpless man]4946-a helpless man , [Monica]195-monica . '[217-widdowson]

Yet a feeling of inability to grapple with such an undertaking as this grew on [him]217-widdowson the more [he]217-widdowson thought of it . Naturally , [his]217-widdowson mind busied itself with such vague knowledge as [he]217-widdowson had gathered of those places in [the South of [France]102-france]1831-the south of france , where [rich English people]1832-rich english people go to escape [their]1832-rich english people own climate : [Nice]103-nice , [Cannes]104-cannes . [He]217-widdowson could not imagine [himself]217-widdowson setting forth to [these regions]1833-these regions . Doubtless it was possible to travel thither , and live [there]453-there when [one]472-one arrived , without a knowledge of French ; but [he]217-widdowson pictured all sorts of humiliating situations resulting from [his]217-widdowson ignorance . Above everything [he]217-widdowson dreaded humiliation in [Monica]195-monica 's sight ; it would be intolerable to have [her]195-monica comparing [him]217-widdowson with [men who spoke foreign languages]1836-men who spoke foreign languages , and were at home on [the Continent]105-the continent .

Nevertheless , [he]217-widdowson wrote to [[his]217-widdowson friend]1214-his friend [Newdick]268-mr. newdick , and invited [him]268-mr. newdick to dine , solely for the purpose of talking over this question with [him]268-mr. newdick in private . To [his]217-widdowson surprise , [Newdick]268-mr. newdick had ideas concerning [Nice]103-nice and [Cannes]104-cannes and [such places]1838-such places . ' [An immoral lot there]4947-an immoral lot there , '[268-mr. newdick] [he]268-mr. newdick said , smiling and shaking [his]268-mr. newdick head . ' Queer goings on . '[268-mr. newdick]

' Oh , but that 's among [the foreigners]4948-the foreigners , is n't it ? '[268-mr. newdick]

Thereupon [Mr. Newdick]268-mr. newdick revealed [his]268-mr. newdick acquaintance with English literature .

' Did [you]217-widdowson ever read any of [Ouida]282-ouida 's novels ? '[268-mr. newdick]

' No , [I]268-mr. newdick never did . '[268-mr. newdick]

' [I]268-mr. newdick advise [you]217-widdowson to before [you]217-widdowson think of taking [[your]217-widdowson wife]4949-your wife over [there]453-there . [They]4952-they 're[268-mr. newdick] a queer lot , [I]0-i believe . '[268-mr. newdick]

[He]268-mr. newdick abandoned the thought , at once and utterly . When [Monica]195-monica learnt this [he]268-mr. newdick gave only vague and unsatisfactory reasons [she]195-monica fell back into [her]195-monica despondent mood . For a whole day [she]195-monica scarcely uttered a word .

On the next day , in the dreary afternoon , [they]1842-they were surprised by a call from [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson . [The widow]934-the widow less than ever [a widow in externals]1844-a widow in externals came in with a burst of exuberant spirits , and began to scold [the moping couple]1845-the moping couple like [an affectionate parent]1846-an affectionate parent .

' When are [you]1845-the moping couple [silly young people coming to an end of [your]1845-the moping couple honeymoon]4953-silly young people coming to an end of your honeymoon ? [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson kept silence , waiting to see what [[his]1848-his wife]4133-his wife would do . ' Oh ! '[439-the visitor] laughed [the visitor]439-the visitor . ' [I]439-the visitor see , [I]439-the visitor see ! Do just as [you]195-monica like , of course . [The vivacious lady]1852-the vivacious lady did not stay long . When [she]195-monica had rustled forth again to [[her]195-monica carriage]1381-her carriage , [Widdowson]217-widdowson broke into a paean of amorous gratitude . What could [he]217-widdowson do to show how [he]217-widdowson appreciated [Monica]195-monica 's self - denial on [his]217-widdowson behalf ? For a day or two [he]217-widdowson was absent rather mysteriously , and in the meantime made up [his]217-widdowson mind , after consultation with [Newdick]268-mr. newdick , to take [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife for a holiday in [Guernsey]107-guernsey .

[Monica]195-monica , when [she]195-monica heard of this project , was at first moderately grateful , but in a day or two showed by reviving strength and spirits that [she]195-monica looked forward eagerly to the departure . [[Her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband advertised for lodgings in [St. Peter Port]108-st. peter port ; [he]217-widdowson would not face the disagreeable chances of [a hotel]1473-a hotel . In a fortnight 's time all [their]1857-their preparations were made . During [their]1857-their absence , which might extend over a month , [Virginia]191-virginia was to live at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill , in supervision of [the two servants]1858-the two servants .

On the last Sunday [Monica]195-monica went to see [[her]195-monica friends]1123-her friends in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road . [Widdowson]217-widdowson was ashamed to offer an objection ; [he]217-widdowson much disliked [her]195-monica going [there]453-there alone , but disliked equally the thought of accompanying [her]195-monica , for at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's [he]217-widdowson could not pretend to sit , stand , or converse with ease .

It happened that [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove was again calling . On the first occasion of meeting with [Monica]195-monica [this lady]4194-this lady paid [her]195-monica no particular attention ; to - day [she]4194-this lady addressed [her]195-monica in a friendly manner , and [their]1862-their conversation led to the discovery that both of [them]1862-their were about to spend the ensuing month in [the same place]1523-the same place . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove hoped [they]1862-their might occasionally see [each other]543-each other .

Of this coincidence [Monica]195-monica thought better to say nothing on [her]195-monica return [home]364-home . [She]195-monica could not be sure that [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband might not , at the last moment , decide to stay at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill rather than incur the risk of [her]195-monica meeting [an acquaintance in [Guernsey]107-guernsey]1867-an acquaintance in guernsey . On this point [he]4145-her husband could not be trusted to exercise common sense . For the first time [Monica]195-monica had a secret [she]195-monica desired to keep from [him]4145-her husband , and the necessity was one which could not but have an unfavourable effect on [her]195-monica manner of regarding [Widdowson]217-widdowson . [They]1862-their were to start on Monday evening . Through the day [her]195-monica mind was divided between joy in the thought of seeing a new part of [the world]3462-the world and a sense of weary dislike for [[her]195-monica home]1869-her home . [She]195-monica had not understood until now how terrible would be the prospect of living [here]3495-here for a long time with no companionship but [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband 's . On the return that prospect would lie before [her]195-monica . But no ; [their]1862-their way of life must somehow be modified ; on that [she]195-monica was resolved .

CHAPTER [XVI

HEALTH]109-xvi health FROM [THE SEA]110-the sea

From [Herne Hill]32-herne hill to [St. Peter Port]108-st. peter port was a change which made of [Monica]195-monica [a new creature]1872-a new creature . The weather could not have been more propitious ; day after day of still air and magnificent sky , with temperature which made a brisk walk at any hour thoroughly enjoyable , yet allowed [one]472-one to sit at ease in the midday sunshine . [[Their]1862-their lodgings]1874-their lodgings were in [the best part of [the town]3722-the town]1875-the best part of the town , high up , looking forth over [blue sea]1877-blue sea to [the cliffs of [Sark]112-sark]1878-the cliffs of sark . [Widdowson]217-widdowson congratulated [himself]217-widdowson on having taken this step ; it was like a revival of [his]217-widdowson honeymoon ; never since [their]1862-their settling down at [home]364-home had [Monica]195-monica been so grateful , so affectionate . Why , [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife was what [he]217-widdowson had thought [her]4133-his wife from the first , perfect in every wifely attribute . How lovely [she]4133-his wife looked as [she]4133-his wife sat down to the breakfast - table , after breathing sea air at the open windows , in [her]4133-his wife charming dress , [her]4133-his wife black hair arranged in some new fashion just to please [him]217-widdowson ! Or when [she]4133-his wife walked with [him]217-widdowson about [the quays]1881-the quays , obviously admired by [men who passed them]1882-men who passed them . Or when [she]4133-his wife seated [herself]4133-his wife in [the open carriage]1883-the open carriage for a drive which would warm [her]4133-his wife cheeks and make [her]4133-his wife lips redder and sweeter .

' [Edmund]217-widdowson , '[4133-his wife] [she]4133-his wife said to [him]217-widdowson one evening , as [they]1884-they talked by [the fireside]1885-the fireside , ' do n't [you]217-widdowson think [you]217-widdowson take life rather too gravely ? '[4133-his wife]

[He]217-widdowson laughed .

' Gravely ? Do n't [I]4133-his wife seem to enjoy [myself]4133-his wife ? '[4133-his wife]

' Oh yes ; just now . But still in a rather serious way . [One]472-one would think [you]217-widdowson always had cares on [your]217-widdowson mind , and were struggling to get rid of [them]4960-them . '[4133-his wife]

' [I]4133-his wife have n't a care in [the world]3462-the world . [I]4133-his wife am the most blessed of [mortals]4284-mortals . '[4133-his wife]

' So [you]217-widdowson ought to think [yourself]217-widdowson . But when [we]4963-we get back again , how will it be ? [You]217-widdowson wo n't be angry with [me]4133-his wife ? [I]4133-his wife really do n't think [I]4133-his wife can live again as [we]4963-we were doing . '[4133-his wife]

' Not live as '[4133-his wife]

[His]217-widdowson brow darkened ; [he]217-widdowson looked at [her]1886-i in astonishment .

' [We]4963-we ought to have more enjoyment , '[1886-i] [she]1886-i pursued courageously . ' Think of the numbers of [people who live a dull , monotonous life]4964-people who live a dull , monotonous life just because [they]4964-people who live a dull , monotonous life ca n't help it . ' Do n't , [[my]217-widdowson darling]4601-my darling ! '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson implored . ' Do n't ! That makes [me]217-widdowson think [you]1886-i do n't really love [me]217-widdowson .[217-widdowson]

' Nonsense ! [I]1886-i want [you]1886-i to see what [I]1886-i mean . ' But come , come ; [we]4963-we have [our]4963-we occupations . Surely it ought to be a pleasure to [you]1886-i to see that [the house]368-the house is kept in order . There are duties '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , [I]1886-i know . But these duties [I]1886-i could perform in an hour or two . '[1886-i]

' Not thoroughly . '[217-widdowson]

' Quite thoroughly enough . '[1886-i]

' In [my]217-widdowson Opinion , [Monica]195-monica , [a woman]615-a woman ought never to be so happy as when [she]615-a woman is looking after [[her]615-a woman home]1869-her home . '[217-widdowson]

It was the old pedantic tone . [His]1887-his figure , in sympathy with it , abandoned an easy attitude and became awkward . But [Monica]195-monica would not allow [herself]195-monica to be alarmed . During the past week [she]195-monica had conducted [herself]195-monica so as to smooth the way for this very discussion . [Unsuspecting husband]1888-unsuspecting husband !

' [I]195-monica wish to do [my]195-monica duty , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said in a firm tone , ' but [I]195-monica do n't think it 's right to make dull work for [oneself]4971-oneself , when [one]472-one might be living . ' Make the best of it ! '[1888-unsuspecting husband] [he]1888-unsuspecting husband interrupted indignantly . ' What an expression to use ! It would not only be [your]1888-unsuspecting husband duty , [dear]3530-dear , but [your]1888-unsuspecting husband privilege ! '[195-monica]

'[1888-unsuspecting husband]

' Work is work , and when [a woman]615-a woman is overburdened with it [she]615-a woman must find it difficult not to weary of [home]364-home and [husband]1774-husband and [children]3468-children all together . ' [Monica]195-monica , [you]195-monica have got these ideas from [those people at [Chelsea]19-chelsea]4987-those people at chelsea . That is exactly why [I]195-monica do n't care for [you]195-monica to see much of them . [I]195-monica utterly disapprove of '[195-monica]

' But [you]195-monica are mistaken . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda are all for work . [They]4987-those people at chelsea take life as seriously as [you]195-monica do . '[195-monica]

' Work ? What kind of work ? [They]4987-those people at chelsea want to make [women]3478-women unwomanly , to make [them]3478-women unfit for the only duties [women]3478-women ought to perform . [You]195-monica know very well [my]1889-my opinions about that kind of thing . '[1889-my]

[He]1889-my was trembling with the endeavour to control [himself]1889-my , to speak indulgently .

' [I]195-monica do n't think , [Edmund]217-widdowson , there 's much real difference between [men]3461-men and [women]3478-women . That is , there would n't be , if [women]3478-women had fair treatment . '[195-monica]

' Not much difference ? Oh , come ; [you]217-widdowson are talking nonsense . There 's as much difference between [their]3478-women minds as between [their]3478-women bodies . [They]3478-women are made for entirely different duties . '[283-pained]

[Monica]195-monica sighed .

' Oh , that word Duty ! '[195-monica]

[Pained]283-pained unutterably , [Widdowson]217-widdowson bent forward and took [her]195-monica hand . [He]217-widdowson spoke in a tone of the gravest but softest rebuke . [She]195-monica was giving entertainment to thoughts that would lead [her]195-monica who knew whither , that would undermine [her]195-monica happiness , would end by making both of [them]1890-them miserable . [He]217-widdowson besought [her]195-monica to put all such monstrous speculations out of [her]195-monica mind .

' [Dear]3530-dear , [good little wife]4994-good little wife ! Do be guided by [[your]4994-good little wife husband]4995-your husband . [He]4995-your husband is older than [you]4994-good little wife , [darling]3629-darling , and has seen so much more of [the world]3462-the world . '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson have n't said anything dreadful , [dear]3530-dear . [My]217-widdowson thoughts do n't come from [other people]942-other people ; they rise naturally in [my]217-widdowson own head . '[217-widdowson]

' Now , what do [you]217-widdowson really want ? [You]217-widdowson say [you]217-widdowson ca n't live as [we]5000-we were doing . What change would [you]217-widdowson make ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson should like to make [more friends]5001-more friends , and to see [them]5001-more friends often . [I]217-widdowson want to hear [people]3536-people talk , and know what is going on round about [me]217-widdowson .
