Life will be a burden to [me]217-widdowson before long if [I]217-widdowson do n't have more freedom . '[217-widdowson]

' Freedom ? '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , [I]217-widdowson do n't think there 's any harm in saying that . '[217-widdowson]

' Freedom ? '[1891-i] [He]1891-i glared at [her]1892-you . ' [I]1891-i shall begin to think that [you]1892-you wish [you]1892-you had never married [me]1891-i . '[1891-i]

' [I]217-widdowson should only wish that if [I]217-widdowson were made to feel that [you]1892-you shut [me]217-widdowson up in [a house]902-a house and could n't trust [me]217-widdowson to go where [I]217-widdowson chose . Suppose the thought took [you]1892-you that [you]1892-you would go and walk about [the City]3768-the city some afternoon , and [you]1892-you wished to go alone , just to be more at ease , should [I]217-widdowson have a right to forbid [you]1892-you , or grumble at [you]1892-you ? And yet [you]1892-you are very dissatisfied if [I]217-widdowson wish to go anywhere alone . '[217-widdowson]

' But here 's the old confusion . [I]1891-i am [a man]3627-a man ; [you]1892-you are [a woman]615-a woman . '[1891-i]

' [I]217-widdowson ca n't see that that makes any difference . [A woman]615-a woman ought to go about just as freely as [a man]3627-a man . [I]217-widdowson do n't think it 's just . When [I]217-widdowson have done [my]217-widdowson work at [home]364-home [I]217-widdowson think [I]217-widdowson ought to be every bit as free as [you]1892-you are every bit as free . And [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] sure , [Edmund]217-widdowson , that love needs freedom if it is to remain love in truth . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson looked at [her]1893-her keenly .

' That 's a dreadful thing for [you]1893-her to say . So , if [I]217-widdowson disapprove of [your]1893-her becoming [the kind of woman that acknowledges no law]5010-the kind of woman that acknowledges no law , [you]1893-her will cease to love [me]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson]

' What law do [you]217-widdowson mean ? '[217-widdowson]

' Why , the natural law that points out [a woman]615-a woman 's place , and '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson added , with shaken voice ' commands [her]615-a woman to follow [[her]615-a woman husband]4145-her husband 's guidance . '[217-widdowson]

' Now [you]217-widdowson are angry . [We]1894-they must n't talk about it any more just now . '[217-widdowson]

[She]1893-her rose and poured out a glass of water . [Her]1893-her hand trembled as [she]1893-her drank . [Widdowson]217-widdowson fell into gloomy abstraction . Later , as [they]1894-they lay side by side , [he]217-widdowson wished to renew the theme , but [Monica]195-monica would not talk ; [she]195-monica declared [herself]195-monica too sleepy , turned [her]195-monica back to [him]217-widdowson , and soon slept indeed .

That night the weather became stormy ; a roaring wind swept [the Channel]1895-the channel , and when day broke nothing could be seen but cloud and rain . [Widdowson]217-widdowson , who had rested little , was in a heavy , taciturn mood ; [Monica]195-monica , on the other hand , talked gaily , seeming not to observe [[her]195-monica companion]812-her companion 's irresponsiveness . [She]195-monica was glad of the wild sky ; now [they]1894-they would see another aspect of island life the fierce and perilous surges beating about [these granite shores]1897-these granite shores .

[They]1894-they had brought with [them]1894-they a few books , and [Widdowson]217-widdowson , after breakfast , sat down by the fire to read . [Monica]195-monica first of all wrote a letter to [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister ; then , as it was still impossible to go out , [she]195-monica took up one of the volumes that lay on a side - table in [[their]1894-they sitting - room]1899-their sitting - room , novels left by [former lodgers]1900-former lodgers . [Her]195-monica choice was something or other with yellow back . [Widdowson]217-widdowson , watching all [her]195-monica movements furtively , became aware of the pictured cover .

' [I]217-widdowson do n't think [you]195-monica 'll get much good out of that , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson remarked , after one or two efforts to speak .

' No harm , at all events , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica replied good - humouredly .

' [I]195-monica 'm[195-monica] not so sure . Why should [you]195-monica waste [your]195-monica time ? Take " [Guy Mannering]284-guy mannering , " if [you]195-monica want a novel . '[284-guy mannering]

' [I]217-widdowson 'll see how [I]217-widdowson like this first . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson felt [himself]217-widdowson powerless , and suffered acutely from the thought that [Monica]195-monica was in rebellion against [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson could not understand what had brought about this sudden change . Fear of losing [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's love restrained [him]217-widdowson from practical despotism , yet [he]217-widdowson was very near to uttering a definite command .

In the afternoon it no longer rained , and the wind had less violence . [They]1902-they went out to look at [the sea]417-the sea . [Many people]1904-many people were gathered about [the harbour]1905-the harbour , whence was a fine view of the great waves that broke into leaping foam and spray against [the crags of [Sark]112-sark]1906-the crags of sark . As [they]1902-they stood thus Occupied , [Monica]195-monica heard [her]195-monica name spoken in a friendly voice that of [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove .

' [I]4316-the lady have been expecting to see [you]217-widdowson , '[4316-the lady] said [the lady]4316-the lady . ' [We]1902-they arrived three days ago . '[4316-the lady]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson , starting with surprise , turned to examine [the speaker]884-the speaker . [He]217-widdowson saw [a woman of something less than middle age]1909-a woman of something less than middle age , unfashionably attired , good - looking , with an air of high spirits ; only when [she]1909-a woman of something less than middle age offered [her]1909-a woman of something less than middle age hand to [him]217-widdowson did [he]217-widdowson remember having met [her]1909-a woman of something less than middle age at [[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's]1910-miss barfoot 's . To be graceful in a high wind is difficult for [any man]513-any man ; the ungainliness with which [he]217-widdowson returned [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's greeting could not have been surpassed , and probably would have been much the same even had [he]217-widdowson not , of necessity , stood clutching at [his]217-widdowson felt hat .

[The three]1912-the three talked for a few minutes . With [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove were [two persons]3518-two persons , [a younger woman]1914-a younger woman and [a man of about thirty]1915-a man of about thirty [the latter]1187-the latter [a comely and vivacious fellow , with rather long hair of the orange - tawny hue]1917-a comely and vivacious fellow , with rather long hair of the orange - tawny hue . [These]1137-these looked at [Monica]195-monica , but [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove made no introduction .

' Come and see [me]277-mrs. cosgrove , will [you]1137-these ? '[277-mrs. cosgrove] [she]277-mrs. cosgrove said , mentioning [her]277-mrs. cosgrove address . ' One ca n't get much in the evenings ; [I]277-mrs. cosgrove shall be nearly always at [home]364-home after dinner , and [we]1912-the three have music of a kind . '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

[Monica]195-monica boldly accepted the invitation , said [she]195-monica would be glad to come . Then [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove took leave of [them]1912-the three , and walked landwards with [[her]277-mrs. cosgrove companions]885-her companions .

[Widdowson]217-widdowson stood gazing at [the sea]417-the sea . There was no misreading [his]217-widdowson countenance . When [Monica]195-monica had remarked it , [she]195-monica pressed [her]195-monica lips together , and waited for what [he]217-widdowson would say or do . [He]217-widdowson said nothing , but presently turned [his]217-widdowson back upon the waves and began to walk on . [Neither]1146-neither spoke until [they]1912-the three were in the shelter of [the streets]3667-the streets ; then [Widdowson]217-widdowson asked suddenly ,

' Who is [that person]5014-that person ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica only know [her]5014-that person name , and that [she]5014-that person goes to [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's . '[195-monica]

' It 's a most extraordinary thing , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson exclaimed in high irritation . ' There 's no getting out of the way of [those people]5015-those people . '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica also was angry ; [her]195-monica cheeks , reddened by the wind , grew hotter .

' It 's still more extraordinary that [you]217-widdowson should object so to [them]5015-those people . '[195-monica]

' Whether or no [I]195-monica do object , and [I]195-monica had rather [you]217-widdowson did n't go to see [that woman]5016-that woman . '[195-monica]

' [You]217-widdowson are unreasonable , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered sharply . ' Certainly [I]195-monica shall go and see [her]5016-that woman . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica forbid [you]217-widdowson to do so ! If [you]217-widdowson go , it will be in defiance of [my]195-monica wish . '[195-monica]

' Then [I]1923-he am obliged to defy [your]217-widdowson wish . [I]1923-he shall certainly go . '[1923-he]

[His]1923-he face was frightfully distorted . Had [they]1924-they been in [a lonely spot]1925-a lonely spot , [Monica]195-monica would have felt afraid of [him]1923-he . [She]195-monica moved hurriedly away in the direction of [[their]1924-they lodgings]1874-their lodgings , and for a few paces [he]1923-he followed ; then [he]1923-he checked [himself]1923-he , turned round about , took an opposite way .

With strides of rage [he]1923-he went along by [the quay]1927-the quay , past [the hotels]1928-the hotels and [the smaller houses that follow]1929-the smaller houses that follow , on to [St. Sampson]113-st. sampson . The wind , again preparing for a tempestuous night , beat and shook and at moments all but stopped [him]1923-he ; [he]1923-he set [his]1923-he teeth like [a madman]1930-a madman , and raged on . Past [the granite quarries at [Bordeaux Harbour]114-bordeaux harbour]1931-the granite quarries at bordeaux harbour , then towards [the wild north extremity of [the island]1933-the island]1932-the wild north extremity of the island , [the sandy waste of [L'Ancresse]115-l'ancresse]1934-the sandy waste of l'ancresse . When darkness began to fall , [no human being]4202-no human being was in [his]1923-he range of sight . [He]1923-he stood on one spot for nearly a quarter of an hour , watching , or appearing to watch , the black , low - flying scud .

[Their]1936-their time for dining was seven . Shortly before this [Widdowson]217-widdowson entered [the house]368-the house and went to [the sitting - room]1938-the sitting - room ; [Monica]195-monica was not there . [He]217-widdowson found [her]195-monica in [the bed - chamber]1939-the bed - chamber , before the looking - glass . At the sight of [his]217-widdowson reflected face [she]195-monica turned instantly .

' [Monica]195-monica ! '[217-widdowson] [He]217-widdowson put [his]217-widdowson hands on [her]195-monica shoulders , whispering hoarsely , ' [Monica]195-monica ! do n't [you]195-monica love [me]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson]

[She]195-monica looked away , not replying .

' [Monica]195-monica ! '[195-monica]

And of a sudden [he]217-widdowson fell on [his]217-widdowson knees before [her]195-monica , clasped [her]195-monica about the waist , burst into choking sobs .

' Have [you]195-monica no love for [me]217-widdowson ? [[My]217-widdowson darling]4601-my darling ! [[My]217-widdowson dear , beautiful wife]5018-my dear , beautiful wife ! Have [you]195-monica begun to hate [me]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson]

Tears came to [her]195-monica eyes . [She]195-monica implored [him]217-widdowson to rise and command [himself]217-widdowson .

' [I]195-monica was so violent , so brutal with [you]217-widdowson . [I]195-monica spoke without thinking '[195-monica]

' But why should [you]217-widdowson speak like that ? Why are [you]217-widdowson so unreasonable ? If [you]217-widdowson forbid [me]195-monica to do simple things , with not the least harm in them , [you]217-widdowson ca n't expect [me]195-monica to take it like [a child]3719-a child . [I]195-monica shall resist ; [I]195-monica ca n't help it . '[195-monica]

[He]217-widdowson had risen and was crushing [her]195-monica in [his]217-widdowson arms , [his]217-widdowson hot breath on [her]195-monica neck , when [he]217-widdowson began to whisper ,

' [I]217-widdowson want to keep [you]195-monica all to [myself]217-widdowson . [I]217-widdowson do n't like these people [they]5020-they think so differently [they]5020-they put such hateful ideas into [your]195-monica mind [they]5020-they are not the right kind of friends for [you]195-monica '[217-widdowson]

' [You]195-monica misunderstand [them]5020-they , and [you]195-monica do n't in the least understand [me]217-widdowson . Oh , [you]195-monica hurt [me]217-widdowson , [Edmund]217-widdowson ! '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson released [her]195-monica body , and took [her]195-monica head between [his]217-widdowson hands .

' [I]217-widdowson had rather [you]195-monica were dead than that [you]195-monica should cease to love [me]217-widdowson ! [You]195-monica shall go to see [her]5021-her ; [I]217-widdowson wo n't say a word against it . But , [Monica]195-monica , be faithful , be faithful to [me]217-widdowson ! '[217-widdowson]

' Faithful to [you]217-widdowson ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica echoed in astonishment . ' What have [I]195-monica said or done to put [you]217-widdowson in such a state ? Because [I]195-monica wish to make [a few friends]5022-a few friends as [all women]1691-all women do '[195-monica]

' It 's because [I]217-widdowson have lived so much alone . [I]217-widdowson have never had more than [one or two friends]5024-one or two friends , and [I]217-widdowson am absurdly jealous when [you]195-monica want to get away from [me]217-widdowson and amuse [yourself]195-monica with [strangers]407-strangers . [I]217-widdowson ca n't talk to [such people]4656-such people . [I]217-widdowson am not suited for society . If [I]217-widdowson had n't met [you]195-monica in that strange way , by miracle , [I]217-widdowson should never have been able to marry . If [I]217-widdowson allow [you]195-monica to have [these friends]5027-these friends '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica do n't like to hear that word . Why should [you]217-widdowson say allow ? Do [you]217-widdowson think of [me]195-monica as [[your]217-widdowson servant]5028-your servant , [Edmund]217-widdowson ? '[195-monica]

' [You]217-widdowson know how [I]217-widdowson think of [you]217-widdowson . It is [I]217-widdowson who am [[your]217-widdowson servant]5028-your servant , [[your]217-widdowson slave]5030-your slave . '[217-widdowson]

' Oh , [I]1940-she ca n't believe that ! '[1940-she] [She]1940-she pressed [her]1940-she handkerchief to [her]1940-she cheeks , and laughed unnaturally . ' Such words do n't mean anything . It is [you]217-widdowson who forbid and allow and command , and '[1940-she]

' [I]217-widdowson will never again use such words . Only convince [me]217-widdowson that [you]217-widdowson love [me]217-widdowson as much as ever . '[217-widdowson]

' It is so miserable to begin quarrelling '[1940-she]

' Never again ! Say [you]217-widdowson love [me]217-widdowson ! Put [your]217-widdowson arms round [my]217-widdowson neck press closer to [me]217-widdowson '[217-widdowson]

[She]1940-she kissed [his]1941-you cheek , but did not utter a word .

' [You]1941-you ca n't say that [you]1941-you love [me]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson think [I]217-widdowson am always showing it . Do get ready for dinner now ; it 's past seven . Oh , how foolish [you]1941-you have been ! '[217-widdowson]

Of course [their]1942-their talk lasted half through the night . [Monica]195-monica held with remarkable firmness to the position [she]195-monica had taken ; [a much older woman]1943-a much older woman might have envied [her]195-monica steadfast yet quite rational assertion of the right to live a life of [her]195-monica Own apart from that imposed upon [her]195-monica by the duties of wedlock . A great deal of this spirit and the utterance [it]1944-it found was traceable to [her]195-monica association with [the women whom [Widdowson]217-widdowson so deeply suspected]1945-the women whom widdowson so deeply suspected ; prior to [her]195-monica sojourn in [Rutland Street]55-rutland street [she]195-monica could not even have made clear to [herself]195-monica the demands which [she]195-monica now very clearly formulated . Believing that [she]195-monica had learnt nothing from [them]1945-the women whom widdowson so deeply suspected , and till of late instinctively opposing the doctrines held by [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , [Monica]195-monica in truth owed the sole bit of real education [she]195-monica had ever received to those few weeks of attendance in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street . Circumstances were now proving how apt [a pupil]1946-a pupil [she]195-monica had been , even against [her]195-monica will . Marriage , as is always the case with [women capable of development]1947-women capable of development , made for [her]195-monica [a new heaven]1948-a new heaven and [a new earth]1949-a new earth ; perhaps on no single subject did [she]195-monica now think as on the morning of [her]195-monica wedding - day .

' [You]4145-her husband must either trust [me]195-monica completely , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said , ' or not at all . If [you]4145-her husband ca n't and wo n't trust [me]195-monica , how can [I]195-monica possibly love [you]4145-her husband ? '[195-monica]

' Am [I]4145-her husband never to advise ? '[4145-her husband] asked [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , baffled , and even awed , by this extraordinary revelation of [a woman [he]4145-her husband had supposed [himself]4145-her husband to know thoroughly]1951-a woman he had supposed himself to know thoroughly .

' Oh , that 's a very different thing from forbidding and commanding ! '[195-monica] [she]195-monica laughed . ' There was that novel this morning . Of course [I]195-monica know as well as [you]4145-her husband do that " Guy Mannering " is better ; but that does n't say [I]195-monica am not to form [my]195-monica opinion of other books . [You]4145-her husband must n't be afraid to leave [me]195-monica the same freedom [you]4145-her husband have [yourself]4145-her husband . '[195-monica]

The result of it all was that [Widdowson]217-widdowson felt [his]217-widdowson passionate love glow with new fire . For a moment [he]217-widdowson thought [himself]217-widdowson capable of accepting this change in [their]1952-their relations . The marvellous thought of equality between [man]962-man and [wife]3467-wife , that gospel which in far - off days will refashion [the world]3462-the world , for an instant smote [his]217-widdowson imagination and exalted [him]217-widdowson above [his]217-widdowson native level .

[Monica]195-monica paid for the energy [she]195-monica had put forth by a day of suffering . [Her]195-monica head ached intolerably ; [she]195-monica had feverish symptoms , and could hardly raise [herself]195-monica from the bed . It passed , and [she]195-monica was once more eager to go forth under the blue sky that followed the tempest .

' Will [you]4145-her husband go with [me]195-monica to [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's this evening ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked of [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband .

[He]4145-her husband consented , and after dinner [they]1952-their sought [the hotel where [[their]1952-their acquaintance]1958-their acquaintance was staying]1957-the hotel where their acquaintance was staying . [Widdowson]217-widdowson was in extreme discomfort , partly due to the fact that [he]217-widdowson had no dress clothes to put on ; for far from anticipating or desiring any such intercourse in [Guernsey]107-guernsey , [he]217-widdowson had never thought of packing an evening suit . Had [he]217-widdowson known [Mrs. Cosgrave]285-mrs. cosgrave this uneasiness would have been spared [him]217-widdowson . [That lady]3746-that lady was in revolt against far graver institutions than the swallow - tail ; [she]3746-that lady cared not a button in what garb [[her]3746-that lady visitors]1960-her visitors came to [her]3746-that lady . On [their]1952-their arrival , [they]1952-their found , to [[Widdowson]217-widdowson 's horror]1961-widdowson 's horror , [a room full of [women]3478-women]1962-a room full of women . With [the hostess]903-the hostess was [that younger lady [they]1952-their had seen on [the quay]1927-the quay]1965-that younger lady they had seen on the quay , [[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's unmarried sister]1967-mrs. cosgrove 's unmarried sister ; [Miss Knott]286-miss knott 's health had demanded this retreat from the [London]6-london winter . [The guests]1968-the guests were four a [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis and [[her]287-mrs. bevis three daughters]1969-her three daughters all [invalidish persons]1970-invalidish persons , [the mother]4328-the mother somewhat lackadaisical , [the girls with a look of unwilling spinsterhood]1972-the girls with a look of unwilling spinsterhood .

[Monica]195-monica , noteworthy among the gathering for [her]195-monica sweet , bright prettiness , and the finish of [her]195-monica dress , soon made [herself]195-monica at [home]364-home ; [she]195-monica chatted gaily with [the girls]375-the girls wondering indeed at [her]195-monica own air of maturity , which came to [her]195-monica for the first time . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove , [an easy woman of the world when circumstances required it]1975-an easy woman of the world when circumstances required it , did [her]277-mrs. cosgrove best to get something out of [Widdowson]217-widdowson who presently thawed a little .

Then [Miss Knott]286-miss knott sat down to the piano , and played more than tolerably well ; and [the youngest Miss Bevis]288-bevis sang a song of Schubert , with passable voice but in very distressing German [the sole person distressed by it]1976-the sole person distressed by it being [the hostess]903-the hostess .

Meanwhile [Monica]195-monica had been captured by [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis , who discoursed to [her]195-monica on a subject painfully familiar to [all [the old lady]1979-the old lady 's friends]1978-all the old lady 's friends .

' Do [you]287-mrs. bevis know [[my]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? Oh , [I]287-mrs. bevis thought [you]287-mrs. bevis had perhaps met [him]5031-my son . [You]287-mrs. bevis will do so this evening , [I]287-mrs. bevis hope . [He]5031-my son is over here on a fortnight 's holiday . '[287-mrs. bevis]

' Do [you]287-mrs. bevis live in [Guernsey]107-guernsey ? '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica inquired .

' [I]287-mrs. bevis practically live [here]3495-here , and [one of [[my]287-mrs. bevis daughters]5034-my daughters]5033-one of my daughters is always with [me]287-mrs. bevis . [The other two]5035-the other two live with [[their]5035-the other two brother]5036-their brother in [a flat in [Bayswater]77-bayswater]5037-a flat in bayswater . Do [you]287-mrs. bevis care for [flats]5038-flats , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? '[287-mrs. bevis]

[Monica]195-monica could only say that [she]195-monica had no experience of [that institution]1980-that institution .

' [I]287-mrs. bevis do think [them]5038-flats such a boon , '[287-mrs. bevis] pursued [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis . ' [They]5038-flats are expensive but the advantages and comforts are so many . [[My]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son would n't on any consideration give up [[his]5031-my son flat]5040-his flat . As [I]287-mrs. bevis was saying , [he]5031-my son always has [two of [[his]5031-my son sisters]5042-his sisters]5041-two of his sisters to keep [house]5043-house for [him]5031-my son . [He]5031-my son is quite [a young man]5044-a young man , not yet thirty , but would [you]5045-you believe it ? [we]5046-we are all dependent upon [him]5031-my son ! [[My]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son has supported [the whole of [the family]406-the family]5048-the whole of the family for the last six or seven years , and that by [his]5031-my son own work . It sounds incredible , does n't it ? But for [him]5031-my son [we]5046-we should be quite unable to live . [The dear girls]5050-the dear girls have very delicate health ; simply impossible for [them]5050-the dear girls to exert [themselves]5050-the dear girls in any way . [[My]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son has made extraordinary sacrifices on [our]5046-we account . [His]5031-my son desire was to be [a professional musician]5052-a professional musician , and [every one]3621-every one thinks [he]5031-my son would have become eminent ; [myself]287-mrs. bevis , [I]287-mrs. bevis am convinced of it perhaps that is only natural . But when [our]5046-we circumstances began to grow very doubtful , and [we]5046-we really did n't know what was before [us]5046-we , [[my]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son consented to follow a business career that of [wine merchant]5055-wine merchant , with which [[his]5031-my son father]4208-his father was connected . And [he]5031-my son exerted [himself]5031-my son so nobly , and gave proof of such ability , that very soon all [our]5046-we fears were at an end ; and now , before [he]5031-my son is thirty , [his]5031-my son position is quite assured . [We]5046-we have no longer a care . [I]287-mrs. bevis live here [very economically really sweet lodgings on [the road to [St. Martin 's]117-st. martin 's]5058-the road to st. martin 's]5057-very economically really sweet lodgings on the road to st. martin 's ; [I]287-mrs. bevis do hope [you]5059-you will come and see [me]287-mrs. bevis . And [the girls]375-the girls go backwards and forwards . [You]5059-you see [we]5046-we are all here at present . When [[my]287-mrs. bevis son]5031-my son returns to [London]6-london [he]5031-my son will take [the eldest]1039-the eldest and [the youngest]361-the youngest with [him]5031-my son . [The middle girl]5064-the middle girl , [dear Grace]288-bevis [she]5064-the middle girl is thought very clever in water - colours , and [I]287-mrs. bevis am quite sure , if it were necessary , [she]5064-the middle girl could pursue the arts in a professional spirit . '[287-mrs. bevis]

[Mr. Bevis]289-bevis entered [the room]444-the room , and [Monica]195-monica recognized [the sprightly young man whom [she]195-monica had seen on [the quay]1927-the quay]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay . [The hostess]903-the hostess presented [him]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay to [[her]903-the hostess new friends]1985-her new friends , and [he]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay got into talk with [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . Requested to make music for [the company]1986-the company , [he]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay sang a gay little piece , which , to [Monica]195-monica at all events , seemed one of the most delightful things [she]195-monica had ever heard .

' [His]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay own composition , '[288-bevis] whispered [Miss Grace Bevis]288-bevis , then sitting by [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson .

That increased [her]288-bevis delight . Foolish as [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis undoubtedly was , [she]287-mrs. bevis perchance had not praised [[her]287-mrs. bevis son]1987-her son beyond [his]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay merits . [He]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay looked the best of [good fellows]1988-good fellows ; so kind and merry and spirited ; such [a capable man]1989-a capable man , too . It struck [Monica]195-monica as a very hard fate that [he]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay should have [this family]1990-this family on [his]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay hands . What [they]1990-this family must cost [him]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay ! Probably [he]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay could not think of marrying , just on [their]1990-this family account .

[Mr. Bevis]289-bevis came and took a place by [her]195-monica side .

' Thank [you]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay so very much , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said , ' for that charming song . Is it published ? '[195-monica]

' Oh dear , no ! '[1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay] [He]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay laughed and shook [his]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay thick hair about . ' It 's one of two or three that [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay somehow struck out when [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay was studying in [Germany]118-germany , ages ago . [You]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay play , [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay hope ? '[1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay]

[Monica]195-monica gave a sad negative .

' Oh , what does it matter ? There are hosts of people who will always be overjoyed to play when [you]195-monica ask [them]5065-them . It would be a capital thing if only [those children]5066-those children were allowed to learn an instrument who showed genuine talent for music . '[195-monica]

' In that case , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , ' there certainly would n't be hosts of people ready to play for [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

' No . '[1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay] [His]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay merry laugh was repeated . ' [You]195-monica must n't mind when [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay contradict [myself]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay ; it 's one of [my]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay habits . ' And do [you]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay dread the voyage back ? '[1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay]

' To tell the truth , [I]195-monica do . [I]195-monica had a very unpleasant time coming . '[195-monica]

' As for [myself]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay , how [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay ever undertake the thing [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay really do n't know . One of these times [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay shall die ; there 's not a shadow of doubt of that . [The girls]375-the girls always have to carry [me]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay ashore , one holding [me]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay by the hair and one by the boots . Happily , [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay am so emancipated that [my]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay weight does n't distress [them]375-the girls . [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay pick up flesh in a day or two , and then [my]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay health is stupendous as at present . [You]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay see how marvellously fit [I]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay look . '[1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay]

' Yes , [you]1982-the sprightly young man whom she had seen on the quay look very well , '[195-monica] replied [Monica]195-monica , glancing at the fair , comely face .

' It 's deceptive . [All [our]5068-all our family family]5068-all our family have wretched constitutions . If [I]1991-you go to work regularly for a couple of months without a holiday , [I]1991-you sink into absolute decrepitude . [An office]5069-an office - chair has been specially made for [me]1991-you , to hold [me]1991-you up at the desk . [I]1991-you beg [your]195-monica pardon for this clowning , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , '[1991-you] [he]1991-you suddenly added in another voice . ' The air puts [me]1991-you in such spirits . What air it is ! Speaking quite seriously , [[my]1991-you mother]3571-my mother was saved by coming to live [here]3495-here . [We]5072-we believed [her]3571-my mother to be dying , and now [I]1991-you have hopes that [she]3571-my mother will live ever so many years longer . '[1991-you]

[He]1991-you spoke of [[his]1991-you mother]1992-his mother with evident affection , glancing kindly towards [her]1992-his mother with [his]1991-you blue eyes .

Only once or twice had [Monica]195-monica ventured to exchange a glance with [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . It satisfied [her]195-monica that [he]1991-you managed to converse ; what [his]1991-you mood really was could not be determined until afterwards . When [they]1994-they were about to leave [she]195-monica saw [him]1991-you , to [her]195-monica surprise , speaking quite pleasantly with [Mr. Bevis]289-bevis . [A carriage]1995-a carriage was procured to convey [them]1994-they [home]364-home , and as soon as [they]1994-they had started , [Monica]195-monica asked [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , with a merry look , how [he]1991-you had enjoyed [himself]1991-you .

' There is not much harm in it , '[1991-you] [he]1991-you replied dryly .

' Harm ? How like [you]1991-you , [Edmund]217-widdowson , to put it that way ! Now confess [you]1991-you will be glad to go again . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica shall go if [you]1991-you wish . '[195-monica]

' [Unsatisfactory man]5073-unsatisfactory man ! [You]1991-you ca n't bring [yourself]1991-you to admit that it was pleasant to be among [new people]5074-new people . ' [I]195-monica did n't think much of [the girl]384-the girl 's singing , but that fellow [Bevis]289-bevis was n't bad . '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica examined [him]1991-you as [he]1991-you spoke , and seemed to suppress a laugh .

' No , [he]289-bevis was n't at all bad . [I]195-monica saw [you]1991-you talking with [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis . Did [she]287-mrs. bevis tell [you]1991-you anything about [[her]287-mrs. bevis wonderful son]5076-her wonderful son ? '[195-monica]

' Nothing particular . '[195-monica]

' Oh , then [I]195-monica must tell [you]1991-you the whole story . '[195-monica]

And [she]195-monica did so , in a tone half of jest , half of serious approval .

' [I]217-widdowson do n't see that [he]289-bevis has done anything more than [his]289-bevis duty , '[217-widdowson] remarked [Widdowson]217-widdowson at the end . ' But [he]289-bevis is n't [a bad fellow]5077-a bad fellow . '[217-widdowson]

For private reasons , [Monica]195-monica contrasted this attitude towards [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis with the disfavour [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband had shown to [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , and was secretly much amused .

Two or three days after [they]1999-they went to spend the morning at [Petit Bot Bay]119-petit bot bay , and there encountered with [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis and [[his]4145-her husband three sisters]2000-his three sisters . The result was an invitation to go back and have lunch at [[Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis 's lodgings]2001-mrs. bevis 's lodgings ; [they]1999-they accepted it , and remained with [[their]1999-they acquaintances]2002-their acquaintances till dusk . [The young man]667-the young man 's holiday was at an end ; next morning [he]667-the young man would face the voyage which [he]667-the young man had depicted so grotesquely .

' And alone ! '[667-the young man] [he]667-the young man lamented to [Monica]195-monica . ' Only think of it . [The girls]375-the girls are all rather below par just now ; [they]375-the girls had better stay [here]3495-here for the present . '[667-the young man]

' And in [London]6-london [you]667-the young man will be alone too ? '[667-the young man]

' Yes . It 's very sad . [I]667-the young man must bear up under it . The worst of it is , [I]667-the young man am naturally subject to depression . In solitude [I]667-the young man sink , sink . But the subject is too painful . Do n't let [us]5080-us darken the last hours with such reflections . '[667-the young man]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson retained [his]217-widdowson indulgent opinion of [the facetious young wine merchant]2004-the facetious young wine merchant . [He]217-widdowson even laughed now and then in recalling some phrase or other that [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis had used to [him]667-the young man .

Subsequently , [Monica]195-monica had several long conversations with [the old lady]1979-the old lady . Impelled to gossipy frankness about all [her]195-monica affairs , [Mrs. Bevis]287-mrs. bevis allowed it to be understood that the chief reason for [two of [the girls]375-the girls]4006-two of the girls always being with [[their]4006-two of the girls brother]5036-their brother was the possibility thus afforded of [[their]4006-two of the girls ' meeting [people]3536-people]5081-their ' meeting people '[277-mrs. cosgrove] that is to say , of [their]4006-two of the girls having a chance of marriage . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove and [one or two other ladies]2009-one or two other ladies did [them]4006-two of the girls social service .

' [They]4006-two of the girls never will marry ! '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica to [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , rather thoughtfully than with commiseration .

' Why not ? [They]4006-two of the girls are [nice enough girls]5083-nice enough girls . '[195-monica]

' Yes , but [they]4006-two of the girls have no money ; and '[195-monica] [she]195-monica smiled ' [people]3536-people see that [they]4006-two of the girls want to find [husbands]5085-husbands . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica do n't see that the first matters ; and the second is only natural . '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica attempted no rejoinder , but said presently

' Now [they]4006-two of the girls are just the kind of [women who ought to find something to do]5086-women who ought to find something to do . '[195-monica]

' Something to do ? Why , [they]4006-two of the girls attend to [[their]4006-two of the girls mother]408-their mother and [[their]4006-two of the girls brother]5036-their brother . What could be more proper ? '[195-monica]

' Very proper , perhaps . But [they]4006-two of the girls are miserable , and always will be . '[195-monica]

' Then [they]4006-two of the girls have no right to be miserable . [They]4006-two of the girls are doing [their]4006-two of the girls duty , and that ought to keep [them]4006-two of the girls cheerful . '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica could have said many things , but [she]195-monica overcame the desire , and laughed the subject aside .

CHAPTER XVII

THE TRIUMPH

Nor till mid - winter did [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot again see [[his]249-mr. barfoot friends]4264-his friends [the Micklethwaites]290-the micklethwaites . By invitation [he]249-mr. barfoot went to [South Tottenham]95-south tottenham on New Year 's Eve , and dined with [them]4264-his friends at seven o'clock . [He]249-mr. barfoot was [the first guest that had entered [the house]368-the house since [their]2014-their marriage]2012-the first guest that had entered the house since their marriage .

From the very doorstep [Everard]242-everard became conscious of a domestic atmosphere that told soothingly upon [his]242-everard nerves . [The little servant who opened to [him]242-everard]2015-the little servant who opened to him exhibited a gentle , noiseless demeanour which was no doubt the result of careful discipline . [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite [himself]270-micklethwaite , who at once came out into [the passage]425-the passage , gave proof of a like influence ; [his]249-mr. barfoot hearty greeting was spoken in soft tones ; a placid happiness beamed from [his]249-mr. barfoot face . In [the sitting - room [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite 's study]2017-the sitting - room micklethwaite 's study , used for reception because the other had to serve as [dining - room]2018-dining - room tempered lamplight and the glow of a hospitable fire showed [the hostess]903-the hostess and [[her]903-the hostess blind sister]2020-her blind sister standing in expectation ; to [Everard]242-everard 's eyes both of [them]2014-their looked far better in health than a few months ago . [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite was no longer so distressingly old ; an expression that resembled girlish pleasure lit up [her]270-micklethwaite countenance as [she]270-micklethwaite stepped forward ; nay , if [he]242-everard mistook not , there came a gentle warmth to [her]270-micklethwaite cheek , and the momentary downward glance was as graceful and modest as in [a youthful bride]2021-a youthful bride . Never had [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot approached [a woman with more finished courtesy]2022-a woman with more finished courtesy , the sincere expression of [his]249-mr. barfoot feeling . [The blind sister [he]249-mr. barfoot regarded in like spirit]2023-the blind sister he regarded in like spirit ; [his]249-mr. barfoot voice touched its softest note as [he]249-mr. barfoot held [her]270-micklethwaite hand for a moment and replied to [her]270-micklethwaite pleasant words .

No undue indication of poverty disturbed [him]249-mr. barfoot . [He]249-mr. barfoot saw that [the house]368-the house had been improved in many ways since [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite had taken possession of [it]368-the house ; pictures , ornaments , pieces of furniture were added , all in simple taste , but serving to heighten the effect of refined comfort . Where [the average woman]4201-the average woman would have displayed pretentious emptiness , [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite had made [a home which in [its]2026-a home which in its way was beautiful way was beautiful]2026-a home which in its way was beautiful . The dinner , which [she]270-micklethwaite [herself]270-micklethwaite had cooked , and which [she]270-micklethwaite assisted in serving , aimed at being no more than a simple ; decorous meal , but [the guest]1169-the guest unfeignedly enjoyed it ; even the vegetables and the bread seemed to [him]1169-the guest to have a daintier flavour than at many a rich table . [He]249-mr. barfoot could not help noticing and admiring the skill with which [Miss Wheatley]271-miss wheatley ate without seeing what was before [her]271-miss wheatley ; had [he]249-mr. barfoot not known [her]271-miss wheatley misfortune , [he]249-mr. barfoot would hardly have become aware of it by any peculiarity as [she]271-miss wheatley sat opposite to [him]249-mr. barfoot .

[The mathematician]1226-the mathematician had learnt to sit upon a chair like [ordinary mortals]2029-ordinary mortals . For the first week or two it must have cost [him]249-mr. barfoot severe restraint ; now [he]249-mr. barfoot betrayed no temptation to roll and jerk and twist [himself]249-mr. barfoot . When [the ladies]1001-the ladies retired , [he]249-mr. barfoot reached from the sideboard a box which [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot viewed with uneasiness .

' Do [you]249-mr. barfoot smoke here in [this room]3501-this room ? '[249-mr. barfoot]

' Oh , why not ? '[291-emotions]

[Everard]242-everard glanced at the pretty curtains before the windows .

' No , [[my]242-everard boy]1228-my boy , [you]1228-my boy do not smoke [here]3495-here . And , in fact , [I]242-everard like [your]1228-my boy claret ; [I]242-everard wo n't spoil the flavour of it . '[242-everard]

' As [you]249-mr. barfoot please ; but [I]249-mr. barfoot think [Fanny]257-fanny will be distressed . '[249-mr. barfoot]

' [You]249-mr. barfoot shall say that [I]242-everard have abandoned the weed . '[242-everard]

[Emotions]291-emotions were at conflict in [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite 's mind , but finally [he]249-mr. barfoot beamed with gratitude .

' [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot '[249-mr. barfoot] [he]249-mr. barfoot bent forward and touched [[his]249-mr. barfoot friend]1214-his friend 's arm ' there are angels walking [the earth]4215-the earth in this [our]5093-our day . Science has n't abolished [them]5094-them , [[my]249-mr. barfoot dear fellow]4309-my dear fellow , and [I]249-mr. barfoot do n't think it ever will . '[249-mr. barfoot]

' It falls to the lot of but [few men]5096-few men to encounter [them]5094-them , and of fewer still to entertain [them]5094-them permanently in [a cottage at [South Tottenham]95-south tottenham]5097-a cottage at south tottenham . '[291-emotions]

' [You]249-mr. barfoot are right . '[270-micklethwaite] [Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite laughed in a new way , with scarcely any sound ; a change [Everard]242-everard had already noticed . ' [These two sisters]5098-these two sisters but [I]270-micklethwaite had better not speak about [them]5098-these two sisters . In [my]270-micklethwaite old age [I]270-micklethwaite have become [a worshipper]5099-a worshipper , [a mystic]5100-a mystic , [a man of dream and vision]5101-a man of dream and vision . '[270-micklethwaite]

' How about worship in a parochial sense ? '[249-mr. barfoot] inquired [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , smiling . ' Any difficulty of that point ? '[249-mr. barfoot]

' [I]270-micklethwaite conform , in moderation . Nothing would be asked of [me]270-micklethwaite . There is no fanaticism , no intolerance . It would be brutal if [I]270-micklethwaite declined to go to [church]699-church on a Sunday morning . [You]249-mr. barfoot see , [my]270-micklethwaite strictly scientific attitude helps in avoiding offence . [Fanny]257-fanny ca n't understand it , but [my]270-micklethwaite lack of dogmatism vastly relieves [her]257-fanny . [I]270-micklethwaite have been trying to explain to [her]257-fanny that the scientific mind can have nothing to do with materialism . The new order of ideas is of course very difficult for [her]257-fanny to grasp ; but in time , in time . '[270-micklethwaite]

' For heaven 's sake , do n't attempt conversion ! '[249-mr. barfoot]

' On no account whatever . But [I]270-micklethwaite should like [her]257-fanny to see what is meant by perception and conception , by the relativity of time and space and a few simple things of that kind ! '[270-micklethwaite]

[Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot laughed heartily .

' By - the - bye , '[249-mr. barfoot] [he]249-mr. barfoot said , shifting to safer ground , ' [[my]249-mr. barfoot brother]3777-my brother [Tom]252-micklethwaite is in [London]6-london , and in wretched health . [[His]252-micklethwaite angel]5104-his angel is from [the wrong quarter]5105-the wrong quarter , from [the nethermost pit]5106-the nethermost pit . [I]249-mr. barfoot seriously believe that [she]257-fanny has a plan for killing [[her]257-fanny husband]4145-her husband . [You]5108-you remember [my]249-mr. barfoot mentioning in a letter [his]252-micklethwaite horse - accident ? [He]252-micklethwaite has never recovered from that , and as likely as not never will . [[His]252-micklethwaite wife]4133-his wife brought [him]252-micklethwaite away from [Madeira]68-madeira just when [he]252-micklethwaite ought to have stopped [there]453-there to get well . [He]252-micklethwaite settled [himself]252-micklethwaite at [Torquay]94-torquay , whilst [that woman]5016-that woman ran about to pay visits . It was understood that [she]257-fanny should go back to [him]252-micklethwaite at [Torquay]94-torquay , but this [she]257-fanny at length refused to do . [The place]1355-the place was too dull ; it did n't suit [her]257-fanny extremely delicate health ; [she]257-fanny must live in [London]6-london , [her]257-fanny pure native air . If [Tom]252-micklethwaite had taken any advice , [he]252-micklethwaite would have let [her]257-fanny live just where [she]257-fanny pleased , thanking [Heaven]292-heaven that [she]257-fanny was at a distance from [him]252-micklethwaite . But [the poor fellow]5113-the poor fellow ca n't be away from [her]257-fanny . [He]5113-the poor fellow has come up , and here [I]249-mr. barfoot feel convinced [he]5113-the poor fellow will die . It 's a very monstrous thing , but uncommonly like [women in general who have got [a man]3627-a man into [their]5114-women in general who have got a man into their power power]5114-women in general who have got a man into their power . '[249-mr. barfoot]

[Micklethwaite]252-micklethwaite shook [his]252-micklethwaite head .

' [You]1226-the mathematician are too hard upon [them]5114-women in general who have got a man into their power . [You]1226-the mathematician have been unlucky . [You]1226-the mathematician know [my]252-micklethwaite view of [your]1226-the mathematician duty . '[252-micklethwaite]

' [I]249-mr. barfoot begin to think that marriage is n't impossible for [me]249-mr. barfoot , '[249-mr. barfoot] said [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , with a grave smile .

' Ha ! Capital ! '[249-mr. barfoot]

' But as likely as not it will be marriage without forms imply a free union . '[252-micklethwaite]

[The mathematician]1226-the mathematician was downcast .

' [I]249-mr. barfoot 'm[249-mr. barfoot] sorry to hear that . It wo n't do . [We]2033-we must conform . Besides , in that case [the person decidedly is n't suitable to [you]2035-i]2034-the person decidedly is n't suitable to you . [[You]2035-i of [all men]2037-all men]2036-you of all men must marry [a lady]577-a lady . '[2035-i]

' [I]577-a lady should never think of any one that was n't [a lady]577-a lady . '[577-a lady]

' Is emancipation getting as far as that ? Do [ladies]3880-ladies enter into that kind of union ? '[2035-i]

' [I]577-a lady do n't know of any example . That 's just why the idea tempts [me]577-a lady . '[577-a lady] [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot would go no further in explanation .

' How about [your]577-a lady new algebra ? '[577-a lady]

' Alas ! [[My]2035-i dear boy]1430-my dear boy , the temptation is so frightful when [I]2035-i get back [home]364-home . Remember that [I]2035-i have never known what it was to sit and talk through the evening with [ordinary friends]5120-ordinary friends , let alone It 's too much for [me]2035-i just yet . And , [you]2035-i know , [I]2035-i do n't venture to work on [Sundays]120-sundays . That will come ; all in good time . [I]2035-i must grant [myself]2035-i half a year of luxury after such a life as [mine]2035-i has been . '[2035-i]

' Of course [you]577-a lady must . Let [algebra]5121-algebra wait . '[577-a lady]

' [I]2035-i think it over , of course , at odd moments . Church on Sunday morning is a good opportunity . '[2035-i]

[Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot could not stay to see the old year out , but good wishes were none the less heartily exchanged before [he]249-mr. barfoot went . [Micklethwaite]252-micklethwaite walked with [him]249-mr. barfoot to [the railway station]3507-the railway station ; at a few paces ' distance from [[his]252-micklethwaite house]4634-his house [he]252-micklethwaite stood and pointed back to [it]3507-the railway station .[252-micklethwaite]

' [That little place]5123-that little place , [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , is [one of the sacred spots of [the earth]4215-the earth]5124-one of the sacred spots of the earth . Strange to think that [the house]368-the house has been waiting for [me]2035-i [there]453-there through all the years of [my]2035-i hopelessness . [I]2035-i feel that a mysterious light ought to shine about it . It ought n't to look just like [common houses]5128-common houses . '[2035-i]

On [his]249-mr. barfoot way [home]364-home [Everard]242-everard thought over what [he]249-mr. barfoot had seen and heard , smiling good - naturedly . Well , that was one ideal of marriage . Not [his]242-everard ideal ; but very beautiful amid the vulgarities and vileness of ordinary experience . It was the old fashion in its purest presentment ; the consecrated form of domestic happiness , removed beyond reach of satire , only to be touched , if touched at all , with the very gentlest irony .

A life by no means for [him]242-everard . If [he]242-everard tried it , even with [a woman so perfect]2041-a woman so perfect , [he]242-everard would perish of ennui . For [him]242-everard marriage must not mean repose , inevitably tending to drowsiness , but the mutual incitement of vigorous minds . Passion yes , there must be passion , at all events to begin with ; passion not impossible of revival in days subsequent to its first indulgence . Beauty in the academic sense [he]242-everard no longer demanded ; enough that the face spoke eloquently , that the limbs were vigorous . Let beauty perish if it can not ally itself with mind ; be [a woman]615-a woman what else [she]615-a woman may , let [her]615-a woman have brains and the power of using them ! In that demand the maturity of [his]242-everard manhood expressed itself . For [casual amour]2043-casual amour [the odalisque]2044-the odalisque could still prevail with [him]242-everard ; but for the life of wedlock , the durable companionship of [man]962-man and [woman]3471-woman , intellect was [his]242-everard first requirement .

[A woman with [man]962-man]2047-a woman with man 's capability of understanding and reasoning ; free from superstition , religious or social ; far above the ignoble weaknesses which [men]3461-men have been base enough to idealize in [her]2041-a woman so perfect sex . [A woman who would scorn the vulgarism of jealousy , and yet know what it is to love]2050-a woman who would scorn the vulgarism of jealousy , and yet know what it is to love . This was asking much of nature and civilization ; did [he]242-everard grossly deceive [himself]242-everard in thinking [he]242-everard had found the paragon ?

For thus far had [he]242-everard advanced in [his]242-everard thoughts of [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda . If the phrase had any meaning , [he]242-everard was in love with [her]197-rhoda ; yet , strange complex of emotions , [he]242-everard was still only half serious in [his]242-everard desire to take [her]197-rhoda for [a wife]514-a wife , wishing rather to amuse and flatter [himself]242-everard by merely inspiring [her]197-rhoda with passion . Therefore [he]242-everard refused to entertain a thought of formal marriage . To obtain [her]197-rhoda consent to marriage would mean nothing at all ; it would afford [him]242-everard no satisfaction . But so to play upon [her]197-rhoda emotions that [the proud , intellectual , earnest woman]2052-the proud , intellectual , earnest woman was willing to defy society for [his]242-everard sake ah ! that would be an end worth achieving .

Ever since the dialogue in which [he]242-everard frankly explained [his]242-everard position , and all but declared love , [he]242-everard had not once seen [Rhoda]197-rhoda in private . [She]197-rhoda shunned [him]242-everard purposely beyond a doubt , and did not that denote a fear of [him]242-everard justified by [her]197-rhoda inclination ? The postponement of what must necessarily come to pass between [them]2053-them began to try [his]242-everard patience , as assuredly it inflamed [his]242-everard ardour . If no other resource offered , [he]242-everard would be obliged to make [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin an accomplice by requesting [her]1165-his cousin beforehand to leave [him]242-everard alone with [Rhoda]197-rhoda some evening when [he]242-everard had called upon [them]2053-them .

But it was time that chance favoured [him]242-everard , and [his]242-everard interview with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda came about in a way [he]242-everard could not have foreseen .

At the end of the first week of January [he]242-everard was invited to dine at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's . The afternoon had been foggy , and when [he]242-everard set forth there seemed to be some likelihood of a plague of choking darkness such as would obstruct traffic . As usual , [he]242-everard went by [train]3815-train to [Sloane Square]121-sloane square , purposing for [it]121-sloane square was dry under foot , and [he]242-everard could not disregard small economies to walk the short distance from there to [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road . On coming out from [the station]586-the station [he]242-everard found the fog so dense that it was doubtful whether [he]242-everard could reach [his]242-everard journey 's end . [Cabs]2057-cabs were not to be had ; [he]242-everard must either explore the gloom , with risk of getting nowhere at all , or give it up and take [a train]4900-a train back . But [he]242-everard longed too ardently for the sight of [Rhoda]197-rhoda to abandon [his]242-everard evening without an effort . Having with difficulty made [his]242-everard way into [King 's Road]122-king 's road , [he]242-everard found progress easier on account of the shop illuminations ; the fog , however , was growing every moment more fearsome , and when [he]242-everard had to turn out of [the highway]4312-the highway [his]242-everard case appeared desperate . Literally [he]242-everard groped along , feeling the fronts of [the houses]2060-the houses . As under ordinary circumstances [he]242-everard would have had only just time enough to reach [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin 's punctually , [he]242-everard must be very late : perhaps [they]2062-they would conclude that [he]242-everard had not ventured out on such a night , and were already dining without [him]242-everard . No matter ; as well go one way as another now . After abandoning hope several times , and all but asphyxiated , [he]242-everard found by inquiry of [a man with whom [he]242-everard collided]2063-a man with whom he collided that [he]242-everard was actually within a few doors of [his]242-everard destination . Another effort and [he]242-everard rang a joyous peal at the bell .

A mistake . It was [the wrong house]2064-the wrong house , and [he]242-everard had to go two doors farther on .

This time [he]242-everard procured admittance to [the familiar little hall]2065-the familiar little hall . [The servant]791-the servant smiled at [him]242-everard , but said nothing . [He]242-everard was led to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room , and there found [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda alone . This fact did not so much surprise [him]242-everard as [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's appearance . For the first time since [he]242-everard had known [her]197-rhoda , [her]197-rhoda dress was not uniform black ; [she]197-rhoda wore a red silk blouse with a black skirt , and so admirable was the effect of this costume that [he]242-everard scarcely refrained from a delighted exclamation .

Some concern was visible in [her]197-rhoda face .

' [I]197-rhoda am sorry to say , '[197-rhoda] were [her]197-rhoda first words , ' that [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot will not be [here]3495-here in time for dinner . [She]212-miss barfoot went to [Faversham]123-faversham this morning , and ought to have been back about half - past seven . But a telegram came some time ago . A thick fog caused [her]212-miss barfoot to miss [the train]866-the train , and the next does n't reach [Victoria]100-victoria till ten minutes past ten . '[197-rhoda]

It was now half - past eight ; dinner had been appointed for the hour . [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot explained [his]242-everard lateness in arriving .

' Is it so bad as that ? [I]212-miss barfoot did n't know . '[212-miss barfoot]

The situation embarrassed [both of [them]534-both of them]534-both of them . [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot suspected a hope on [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's part that [he]242-everard would relieve [her]197-rhoda of [his]242-everard company , but , even had there been no external hindrance , [he]242-everard could not have relinquished the happy occasion . To use frankness was best .

' Out of the question for [me]242-everard to leave [the house]368-the house , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said , meeting [her]197-rhoda eyes and smiling . ' [You]197-rhoda wo n't be hard upon [a starving man]5132-a starving man ? '[242-everard]

At once [Rhoda]197-rhoda made a pretence of having felt no hesitation .

' Oh , of course [we]534-both of them will dine immediately . '[197-rhoda] [She]197-rhoda rang the bell . ' [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot took it for granted that [I]197-rhoda would represent [her]197-rhoda . Look , the fog is penetrating even to [our]534-both of them fireside . '[197-rhoda]

' [Cheerful]293-cheerful , very . What is [Mary]225-mary doing at [Faversham]123-faversham ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Some one [she]197-rhoda has been corresponding with]5133-some one she has been corresponding with for some time begged [her]197-rhoda to go down and give an address to a number of [ladies on a certain subject]5134-ladies on a certain subject . '[197-rhoda]

' Ah ! [Mary]225-mary is on the way to become [a celebrity]5135-a celebrity . '[197-rhoda]

' Quite against [her]197-rhoda will , as [you]197-rhoda know . '[197-rhoda]

[They]2069-they went to dinner , and [Barfoot]225-mary , thoroughly enjoying the abnormal state of things , continued to talk of [[his]225-mary cousin]1165-his cousin .

' It seems to [me]197-rhoda that [she]197-rhoda ca n't logically refuse to put [herself]197-rhoda forward . Work of [her]197-rhoda kind ca n't be done in a corner . It is n't a case of " Oh teach [the orphan girl]5136-the orphan girl to sew . " '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda have used the same argument to [her]197-rhoda , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda .

[Her]197-rhoda place at the head of the table had its full effect upon [Everard]242-everard 's imagination . Why should [he]242-everard hold by a resolve of which [he]242-everard did not absolutely approve the motive ? Why not ask [her]197-rhoda simply to be [[his]242-everard wife]4133-his wife , and so remove one element of difficulty from [his]242-everard pursuit ? True , [he]242-everard was wretchedly poor . Marrying on such an income , [he]242-everard would at once find [his]242-everard freedom restricted in every direction . But then , more likely than not , [Rhoda]197-rhoda had determined against marriage , and of [him]242-everard , especially , never thought for a moment as [a possible husband]2072-a possible husband . Well , that was what [he]242-everard wanted to ascertain .

[They]2073-they conversed naturally enough till the meal was over . Then [their]2073-they embarrassment revived , but this time it was [Rhoda]197-rhoda who took the initiative .

' Shall [I]197-rhoda leave [you]242-everard to [your]242-everard meditations ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda asked , moving a few inches from the table .

' [I]197-rhoda should much prefer [your]242-everard society , if [you]242-everard will grant it [me]197-rhoda for a little longer . '[197-rhoda]

Without speaking , [she]197-rhoda rose and led the way to [the drawingroom]2074-the drawingroom . There , sitting at a formal distance from [each other]543-each other , [they]2073-they talked of the fog . Would [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot be able to get back at all ?

' A propos , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , ' did [you]242-everard ever read " [The City of Dreadful Night]124-the city of dreadful night " ? '[242-everard]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda have read it . '[197-rhoda]

' Without sympathy , of course ? '[242-everard]

' Why " of course " ? Do [I]197-rhoda seem to [you]242-everard [a shallow optimist]5137-a shallow optimist ? '[197-rhoda]

' No . A vigorous and rational optimist such as [I]242-everard [myself]242-everard aim at being . '[242-everard]

' Do [you]242-everard ? But optimism of that kind must be proved by some effort on behalf of [society]1614-society . '[197-rhoda]

' Precisely the effort [I]242-everard am making . If [a man]3627-a man works at developing and fortifying the best things in [his]3627-a man own character , [he]3627-a man is surely doing society a service . '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda smiled sceptically .

' Yes , no doubt . But how do [you]242-everard develop and fortify [yourself]242-everard ? '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda was meeting [him]242-everard half - way , thought [Everard]242-everard . Foreseeing the inevitable , [she]197-rhoda wished to have it over and done with . Or else

' [I]242-everard live very quietly , '[242-everard] was [his]242-everard reply , ' thinking of grave problems most of [my]242-everard time . [You]197-rhoda know [I]242-everard am a great deal alone . '[242-everard]

' Naturally . '[242-everard]

' No ; anything but naturally . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda said nothing . [He]242-everard waited a moment , then moved to a seat much nearer [hers]197-rhoda . [Her]197-rhoda face hardened , and [he]242-everard saw [her]197-rhoda fingers lock together .

' Where [a man]3627-a man is in love , solitude seems to [him]3627-a man the most unnatural of conditions . '[242-everard]

' Please do n't make [me]197-rhoda [[your]242-everard confidante]5141-your confidante , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda with well - assumed pleasantry . ' [I]197-rhoda have no taste for that kind of thing . '[197-rhoda]

' But [I]197-rhoda ca n't help doing so . It is [you]242-everard that [I]197-rhoda am in love with . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda am very sorry to hear it . Happily , the sentiment will not long trouble [you]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

[He]242-everard read in [her]197-rhoda eyes and on [her]197-rhoda lips a profound agitation . [She]197-rhoda glanced about [the room]444-the room , and , before [he]242-everard could again speak , had risen to ring the bell .

' [You]242-everard always take coffee , [I]197-rhoda think ? '[197-rhoda]

Without troubling to give any assent , [he]242-everard moved apart and turned over some books on the table . For full five minutes there was silence . The coffee was brought ; [he]242-everard tasted it and put [his]242-everard cup down . Seeing that [Rhoda]197-rhoda had , as it were , entrenched [herself]197-rhoda behind the beverage , and would continue to sip at is as long as might be necessary , [he]242-everard went and stood in front of [her]197-rhoda .

' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , [I]242-everard am more serious than [you]197-rhoda will give [me]242-everard credit for being . The sentiment , as [you]197-rhoda call it , has troubled [me]242-everard for some time , and will last . '[242-everard]

[Her]197-rhoda refuge failed [her]197-rhoda . The cup [she]197-rhoda was holding began to shake a little .

' Please let [me]242-everard put it aside for [you]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda allowed [him]242-everard to do so , and then locked [her]197-rhoda fingers .

' [I]197-rhoda am so much in love with [you]197-rhoda that [I]197-rhoda ca n't keep away from [this house]947-this house more than a few days at a time . Of course [you]197-rhoda have known it ; [I]197-rhoda have n't tried to disguise why [I]197-rhoda came [here]3495-here so often . It 's so seldom that [I]197-rhoda see [you]197-rhoda alone ; and now that fortune is kind to [me]197-rhoda [I]197-rhoda must speak as best [I]197-rhoda can . [I]197-rhoda wo n't make [myself]197-rhoda ridiculous in [your]197-rhoda eyes if [I]197-rhoda can help it . [You]197-rhoda despise the love - making of [ballrooms]5144-ballrooms and garden parties ; so do [I]197-rhoda , most heartily . Let [me]197-rhoda speak like [a man who has few illusions to overcome]5145-a man who has few illusions to overcome . [I]197-rhoda want [you]197-rhoda for the companion of [my]197-rhoda life ; [I]197-rhoda do n't see very well how [I]197-rhoda am to do without [you]197-rhoda . [You]197-rhoda know , [I]197-rhoda think , that [I]197-rhoda have only a moderate competence ; it 's enough to live upon without miseries , that 's all one can say . Probably [I]197-rhoda shall never be richer , for [I]197-rhoda ca n't promise to exert [myself]197-rhoda to earn money ; [I]197-rhoda wish to live for other things . [You]197-rhoda can picture the kind of life [I]197-rhoda want [you]197-rhoda to share . [You]197-rhoda know [me]197-rhoda well enough to understand that [[my]197-rhoda wife]4104-my wife if [we]5147-them use the old word would be as free to live in [her]4104-my wife own way as [I]197-rhoda to live in [mine]197-rhoda . All the same , it is love that [I]197-rhoda am asking for . '[197-rhoda]

[He]2077-i could not see [her]2078-her eyes , but [she]2078-her was smiling in a forced way , with [her]2078-her lips close set .

' As [you]2077-i insisted on speaking , '[2078-her] [she]2078-her said at length , ' [I]2078-her had no choice but to listen . It is usual , [I]2078-her think if [one]472-one may trust the novels for [a woman]615-a woman to return thanks when an offer of this kind has been made to [her]615-a woman . [Everard]242-everard seized a little chair that was close by , planted it beside [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's , there seated [himself]242-everard and took possession of one of [her]197-rhoda hands . It was done so rapidly and vehemently that [Rhoda]197-rhoda started back , [her]2078-her expression changing from sportive mockery to all but alarm .

' [I]2077-i will have no such thanks , '[2077-i] [he]2077-i uttered in a low voice , much moved , a smile making [him]2077-i look strangely stern . ' [You]197-rhoda shall understand what it means when [a man]3627-a man says that [he]3627-a man loves [you]197-rhoda . [I]2077-i have come to think [your]197-rhoda face so beautiful that [I]2077-i am in torment with the desire to press [my]2077-i lips upon [yours]197-rhoda . Touch [me]2077-i with [your]197-rhoda fingers and [I]2077-i shall tremble that is what [my]2077-i love means . '[2077-i]

[She]2079-her was colourless ; [her]2079-her lips , just parted , quivered as the breath panted between them . [She]2079-her did not try to withdraw [her]2079-her hand .

' Can [you]197-rhoda love [me]242-everard in return ? '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard went on , [his]242-everard face still nearer . ' Am [I]242-everard anything like this to [you]197-rhoda ? ' [I]242-everard do n't love [you]197-rhoda in the least . And if [I]242-everard did [I]242-everard would never share [your]197-rhoda life . '[242-everard]

The voice was very unlike [her]2079-her familiar tones . It seemed to hurt [her]2079-her to speak .

' The reason . Because [you]197-rhoda have no faith in [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard ca n't say whether [I]242-everard have or not . [I]242-everard know absolutely nothing of [your]197-rhoda life . But [I]242-everard have [my]242-everard work , and [no one]3554-no one shall ever persuade [me]242-everard to abandon it . '[242-everard]

' [Your]197-rhoda work ? How do [you]197-rhoda understand it ? What is its importance to [you]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard]

[She]2079-her laughed mockingly , and tried to draw away [her]2079-her hand , for it was burnt by the heat of [his]2080-his . [Barfoot]242-everard held [her]2079-her firmly .

' What is [your]197-rhoda work ? Copying with a type - machine , and teaching [others]3608-others to do the same is n't that it ? '[242-everard]

' If [you]242-everard really wish it . '[242-everard] [He]242-everard remembered the circumstances and spoke submissively . ' Yet the fog gives [me]242-everard such a good excuse for begging [your]2079-her indulgence . The chances are [I]242-everard should only lose [myself]242-everard in an inferno . '[242-everard]

' Does n't it strike [you]242-everard that [you]242-everard take an advantage of [me]242-everard , as [you]242-everard did once before ? [I]242-everard make no pretence of equalling [you]242-everard in muscular strength , yet [you]242-everard try to hold [me]242-everard by force . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard divined in [her]197-rhoda pleasure akin to [his]242-everard own , the delight of conflict . Otherwise , [she]197-rhoda would never have spoken thus .

' Yes , it is true . Love revives [the barbarian]5163-the barbarian ; it would n't mean much if it did n't . Marriage by capture ca n't quite be done away with . [You]242-everard say [you]242-everard have not the least love for [me]242-everard ; if [you]242-everard had , should [I]242-everard like [you]242-everard to confess it instantly ? [A man]3627-a man must plead and woo ; but there are different ways . [I]242-everard ca n't kneel before [you]242-everard and exclaim about [my]242-everard miserable unworthiness for [I]242-everard am not unworthy of [you]242-everard .
