' How useless , then , for [us]5171-us to talk . If [you]242-everard are determined to remind [me]242-everard again and again that [your]242-everard strength puts [me]242-everard at [your]242-everard mercy '[242-everard]

' Oh , not that ! [I]242-everard will come no nearer to [you]242-everard . Sit down , and tell [me]242-everard what [I]242-everard asked . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda hesitated , but at length took the chair by which [she]197-rhoda was standing .

' [You]197-rhoda are resolved never to marry ? '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda never shall , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda replied firmly .

' But suppose marriage in no way interfered with [your]197-rhoda work ? '[242-everard]

' It would interfere hopelessly with the best part of [my]242-everard life . [I]242-everard thought [you]242-everard understood this . What would become of the encouragement [I]242-everard am able to offer [[our]5171-us girls]4002-our girls ? '[242-everard]

' Encouragement to refuse marriage ? '[242-everard]

' To scorn the old idea that [a woman]615-a woman 's life is wasted if [she]615-a woman does not marry . [My]242-everard work is to help [those women who , by sheer necessity , must live [alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules]5175-alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules]5174-those women who , by sheer necessity , must live alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules . How can [I]242-everard help [them]5174-those women who , by sheer necessity , must live alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules so effectually as by living among [them]5174-those women who , by sheer necessity , must live alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules , one of [them]5174-those women who , by sheer necessity , must live alone woman whom vulgar opinion ridicules , and showing that [my]242-everard life is anything but weariness and lamentation ? [I]242-everard am fitted for this . It gives [me]242-everard a sense of power and usefulness which [I]242-everard enjoy . [[Your]242-everard cousin]4717-your cousin is doing the same work admirably . If [I]242-everard deserted [I]242-everard should despise [myself]242-everard . '[242-everard]

' Magnificent ! If [I]242-everard could bear the thought of living without [you]242-everard , [I]242-everard should bid [you]242-everard persevere and be great . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard need no such bidding to persevere . '[242-everard]

' And for that very reason , because [you]242-everard are capable of such things , [I]242-everard love [you]242-everard only the more . '[242-everard]

There was triumph in [her]2081-she look , though [she]2081-she endeavoured to disguise it .

' Then , for [your]242-everard own peace , '[2081-she] [she]2081-she said , ' [I]2081-she must hope that [you]242-everard will avoid [me]2081-she . It is so easily done . [We]5177-we have nothing in common , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . '[2081-she]

' [I]242-everard ca n't agree with that . For one thing , there are perhaps not half a dozen women living with whom [I]242-everard could talk as [I]242-everard have talked with [you]242-everard . It is n't likely that [I]242-everard shall ever meet [one]472-one . Am [I]242-everard to make [my]242-everard bow , and abandon in resignation the one chance of perfecting [my]242-everard life ? '[242-everard]

' [You]242-everard do n't know [me]2081-she . [We]5177-we differ profoundly on a thousand essential points . '[2081-she]

' [You]242-everard think so because [you]242-everard have a very wrong idea of [me]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda glanced at the clock on the mantelpiece .

' [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said in a changed voice , ' [you]249-mr. barfoot will forgive [me]197-rhoda if [I]197-rhoda remind [you]249-mr. barfoot that it is past ten o'clock . '[197-rhoda]

[He]2082-he sighed and rose .

' The fog certainly can not be so thick now . Shall [I]2081-she ask [them]5179-them to try and get [you]2082-he [a cab]836-a cab ? '[2081-she]

' [I]242-everard shall walk to [the station]586-the station . '[242-everard]

' Only one more word . '[197-rhoda] [She]197-rhoda assumed a quiet dignity which [he]2082-he could not disregard . ' [We]5182-we have spoken in this way for the last time . [You]2082-he will not oblige [me]197-rhoda to take all sorts of trouble merely to avoid useless and painful conversations ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]242-everard love [you]2082-he , and [I]242-everard ca n't abandon hope . '[242-everard]

' Then [I]197-rhoda must take that trouble . '[197-rhoda] [Her]197-rhoda face darkened , and [she]197-rhoda stood in expectation of [his]2082-he departure .

' [I]242-everard must n't offer to shake hands , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , drawing a step nearer .

' [I]197-rhoda hope [you]2082-he can remember that [I]197-rhoda had no choice but to be [[your]2082-he hostess]5183-your hostess . '[197-rhoda]

The face and tone affected [him]2082-he with a brief shame . Bending [his]2082-he head , [he]2082-he approached [her]197-rhoda , and held [her]197-rhoda offered hand , without pressure , only for an instant .

Then [he]2082-he left [the room]444-the room .

There was a little improvement in the night ; [he]2082-he could make [his]2082-he way along [the pavement]1025-the pavement without actual groping , and no unpleasant adventure checked [him]2082-he before [he]2082-he reached [the station]586-the station . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's face and figure went before [him]2082-he . [He]2082-he was not downcast ; for all that [she]197-rhoda had said , [this woman]2086-this woman , soon or late , would yield [herself]2086-this woman ; [he]2082-he had a strange , unreasoning assurance of it . Perhaps the obstinacy of [his]2082-he temper supplied [him]2082-he with that confident expectation . [He]2082-he no longer cared on what terms [he]2082-he obtained [her]197-rhoda legal marriage or free union it was indifferent to [him]2082-he . But [her]197-rhoda life should be linked with [his]2082-he if fierce energy of will meant anything .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot arrived at half - past eleven , after many delays on [her]212-miss barfoot journey . [She]212-miss barfoot was pierced with cold , choked with the poisonous air , and had derived very little satisfaction from [her]212-miss barfoot visit to [Faversham]123-faversham .

' What happened ? '[212-miss barfoot] was [her]212-miss barfoot first question , as [Rhoda]197-rhoda came out into [the hall]2087-the hall with sympathy and solicitude . ' Did [the fog]5184-the fog keep [[our]2088-our guest]5185-our guest away ? '[197-rhoda]

' No ; [he]5185-our guest dined [here]3495-here . '[197-rhoda]

' It was just as well . [You]212-miss barfoot have n't been lonely . '[197-rhoda]

[They]2088-our spoke no more on the subject until [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot recovered from [her]212-miss barfoot discomfort , and was enjoying a much needed supper .

' Did [he]5185-our guest offer to go away ? '[197-rhoda]

' It was really impossible . It took [him]5185-our guest more than half an hour to get [here]3495-here from [Sloane Square]121-sloane square . '[197-rhoda]

' [Foolish fellow]5188-foolish fellow ! Why did n't [he]5185-our guest take [a train]4900-a train back at once ? '[197-rhoda]

There was a peculiar brightness in [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's countenance , and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had observed it from the first .

' Did [you]212-miss barfoot quarrel much ? '[197-rhoda]

' Not more than was to be expected . '[197-rhoda]

' [He]5185-our guest did n't think of staying for [my]197-rhoda return ? '[197-rhoda]

' [He]5185-our guest left about ten o'clock . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course . Quite late enough , under the circumstances . It was very unfortunate , but [I]197-rhoda do n't suppose [Everard]242-everard cared much . [He]5185-our guest would enjoy the opportunity of teasing [you]212-miss barfoot . '[197-rhoda]

A glance told [her]212-miss barfoot that [Everard]242-everard was not alone in [his]242-everard enjoyment of the evening . [Rhoda]197-rhoda led the talk into other channels , but [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot continued to reflect on what [she]212-miss barfoot had perceived .

A few evenings after , when [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had been sitting alone for an hour or two , [Rhoda]197-rhoda came to [the library]3604-the library and took a place near [her]197-rhoda . [The elder woman]924-the elder woman glanced up from [her]924-the elder woman book , and saw that [[her]924-the elder woman friend]631-her friend had something special to say .

' What is it , [dear]3530-dear ? '[924-the elder woman]

' [I]212-miss barfoot am going to tax [your]3530-dear good - nature , to ask [you]3530-dear about unpleasant things . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot knew immediately what this meant . [She]212-miss barfoot professed readiness to answer , but had an uneasy look .

' Will [you]3530-dear tell [me]212-miss barfoot in plain terms what it was that [[your]924-the elder woman cousin]4717-your cousin did when [he]4717-your cousin disgraced [himself]4717-your cousin ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' Must [you]3530-dear really know ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]212-miss barfoot wish to know . '[212-miss barfoot]

There was a pause . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot kept [her]212-miss barfoot eyes on the page open before [her]212-miss barfoot .

' Then [I]212-miss barfoot shall take the liberty of [an old friend]5192-an old friend , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Why do [you]3530-dear wish to know ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , '[2092-the other dryly] answered [the other dryly]2092-the other dryly , ' has been good enough to say that [he]4717-your cousin is in love with [me]2092-the other dryly . '[2092-the other dryly]

[Their]2093-i eyes met .

' [I]2093-i suspected it . [I]2093-i felt sure it was coming . [He]4717-your cousin asked [you]3530-dear to marry [him]4717-your cousin ? '[2093-i]

' No , [he]4717-your cousin did n't , '[197-rhoda] replied [Rhoda]197-rhoda in purposely ambiguous phrase .

' [You]249-mr. barfoot would n't allow [him]4717-your cousin to ? '[2093-i]

' At all events , it did n't come to that . [I]2093-i should be glad if [you]249-mr. barfoot would let [me]2093-i know what [I]2093-i asked . '[2093-i]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot deliberated , but finally told the story of [Amy Drake]259-amy drake . [Her]212-miss barfoot hands supporting one knee , [her]212-miss barfoot head bent , [Rhoda]197-rhoda listened without comment , and , to judge from [her]212-miss barfoot features , without any emotion of any kind .

' That , '[631-her friend] said [[her]212-miss barfoot friend]631-her friend at the close , ' is the story as it was understood at the time disgraceful to [him]4717-your cousin in every particular . [He]4717-your cousin knew what was said of [him]4717-your cousin , and offered not a word of contradiction . But not very long ago [he]4717-your cousin asked [me]631-her friend one evening if [you]249-mr. barfoot had been informed of this scandal . [I]631-her friend told [him]4717-your cousin that [you]249-mr. barfoot knew [he]4717-your cousin had done something which [I]631-her friend thought very base . [Everard]242-everard was hurt , and thereupon [he]4717-your cousin declared that neither [I]631-her friend nor [any other of [[his]4717-your cousin acquaintances]5194-his acquaintances]5193-any other of his acquaintances knew the truth that [he]4717-your cousin had been maligned . [He]4717-your cousin refused to say more , and what am [I]631-her friend to believe ? '[631-her friend]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda was listening with livelier attention .

' [He]4717-your cousin declared that [he]4717-your cousin was n't to blame ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]631-her friend suppose [he]4717-your cousin meant that . But it is difficult to see '[631-her friend]

' Of course the truth can never be known , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with sudden indifference . ' And it does n't matter . Thank [you]212-miss barfoot for satisfying [my]197-rhoda curiosity . '[197-rhoda]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot waited a moment , then laughed .

' Some day , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , [you]212-miss barfoot shall satisfy [mine]197-rhoda . '[631-her friend]

' Yes if [we]5195-we live long enough . '[212-miss barfoot]

What degree of blame might have attached to [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , [Rhoda]197-rhoda did not care to ask [herself]197-rhoda ; [she]197-rhoda thought no more of the story . Of course there must have been other such incidents in [his]2095-his career ; morally [he]2095-his was neither better nor worse than [men in general]4090-men in general . [She]197-rhoda viewed with contempt [the women who furnished such opportunities]2097-the women who furnished such opportunities ; in [her]197-rhoda judgment of [the male offenders]2098-the male offenders [she]197-rhoda was more lenient , more philosophical , than formerly .

[She]197-rhoda had gained [her]197-rhoda wish , had enjoyed [her]197-rhoda triumph . A raising of the finger and [Everard Barfoot]242-everard would marry [her]197-rhoda . Assured of that , [she]197-rhoda felt a new contentment in life ; at times when [she]197-rhoda was occupied with things as far as possible from this experience , a rush of joy would suddenly fill [her]197-rhoda heart , and make [her]197-rhoda cheek glow . [She]197-rhoda moved among [people]3536-people with a conscious dignity quite unlike that which had only satisfied [her]197-rhoda need of distinction . [She]197-rhoda spoke more softly , exercised more patience , smiled where [she]197-rhoda had been wo nt to scoff . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda was altogether [a more amiable person]2100-a more amiable person .

Yet , [she]197-rhoda convinced [herself]197-rhoda , essentially quite unchanged . [She]197-rhoda pursued the aim of [her]197-rhoda life with less bitterness , in a larger spirit , that was all . But pursued it , and without fear of being diverted from the generous path .

CHAPTER XVIII

[A REINFORCEMENT

Throughout January]295-a reinforcement throughout january , [Barfoot]242-everard was endeavouring to persuade [[his]242-everard brother]479-his brother [Tom]252-micklethwaite to leave [London]6-london , where [the invalid]420-the invalid 's health perceptibly grew worse . [Doctors]2103-doctors were urgent to the same end , but ineffectually ; for [Mrs. Thomas]263-mrs. thomas , though [she]263-mrs. thomas professed to be amazed at [[her]263-mrs. thomas husband]4145-her husband 's folly in remaining where [he]4145-her husband could not hope for recovery , [herself]263-mrs. thomas refused to accompany [him]4145-her husband any whither . [This pair]1445-this pair had [no children]3796-no children . [The lady]4316-the lady always spoke of [herself]4316-the lady as [a sad sufferer from mysterious infirmities]2108-a sad sufferer from mysterious infirmities , and had , in fact , a tendency to hysteria , which confused itself inextricably with the results of evil nurture and the impulses of a disposition originally base ; nevertheless [she]4316-the lady made a figure in a certain sphere of vulgar wealth , and even gave opportunity to scandalous tongues . [[Her]263-mrs. thomas husband]4145-her husband , whatever [his]4145-her husband secret thought , would hear nothing against [her]263-mrs. thomas ; [his]4145-her husband temper , like [Everard]242-everard 's , was marked with stubbornness , and after a good deal of wrangling [he]4145-her husband forbade [[his]4145-her husband brother]479-his brother to address [him]4145-her husband again on the subject of [their]1445-this pair disagreement .

' [Tom]263-mrs. thomas is dying , '[242-everard] wrote [Everard]242-everard , early in February , to [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road . ' [Dr. Swain]296-dr. swain assures [me]4145-her husband that unless [he]4145-her husband be removed [he]4145-her husband can not last more than a month or two . This morning [I]4145-her husband saw [the woman]5196-the woman '[4145-her husband] it was thus [he]4145-her husband always referred to [[his]4145-her husband sister - in - law]4636-his sister - in - law ' and talked to [her]5196-the woman in what was probably the plainest language [she]5196-the woman ever had the privilege of hearing . It was a tremendous scene , brought to a close only by [her]5196-the woman flinging [herself]5196-the woman on the sofa with shrieks which terrified [the whole household]5197-the whole household . [My]4145-her husband idea is that [we]2113-we must carry [the poor fellow]5113-the poor fellow away by force . [His]5113-the poor fellow infatuation makes [me]4145-her husband rage and curse , but [I]4145-her husband am bent on trying to save [his]5113-the poor fellow life . Will [you]5199-you come and give [your]5199-you help ? '[4145-her husband]

A week later [they]2113-we succeeded in carrying [the invalid]420-the invalid back to [Torquay]94-torquay . [Mrs. Barfoot]263-mrs. thomas had abandoned [him]4145-her husband to [[his]4145-her husband doctors]2115-his doctors , [nurses]2116-nurses , and [angry relatives]2117-angry relatives ; [she]263-mrs. thomas declared [herself]263-mrs. thomas driven out of [the house]368-the house , and went to live at [a fashionable hotel]2119-a fashionable hotel . [Everard]242-everard remained in [Devon]101-devon for more than a month , devoting [himself]242-everard with affection , which the trial of [his]242-everard temper seemed only to increase , to [[his]242-everard brother]479-his brother 's welfare . [Thomas]263-mrs. thomas improved a little ; once more there was hope . Then on a sudden frantic impulse , after writing fifty letters which elicited no reply , [he]4145-her husband travelled in pursuit of [[his]4145-her husband wife]4133-his wife ; and three days after [his]4145-her husband arrival in [London]6-london [he]4145-her husband was dead .

By a will , executed at [Torquay]94-torquay , [he]4145-her husband bequeathed to [Everard]242-everard about a quarter of [his]4145-her husband wealth . All the rest went to [Mrs. Barfoot]263-mrs. thomas , who had declared [herself]263-mrs. thomas too ill to attend the funeral , but in a fortnight was sufficiently recovered to visit [one of [[her]263-mrs. thomas friends]1123-her friends in [the country]3602-the country]2122-one of her friends in the country .

[Everard]242-everard could now count upon an income of not much less than fifteen hundred a year . That [[his]242-everard brother]479-his brother 's death would enrich [him]242-everard [he]242-everard had always foreseen , but [no man]1079-no man could have exerted [himself]242-everard with more ardent energy to postpone that advantage . [The widow]934-the widow charged [him]4145-her husband , wherever [she]934-the widow happened to be , with deliberate fratricide ; [she]934-the widow vilified [his]4145-her husband reputation , by word of mouth or by letter , to all who knew [him]4145-her husband , and protested that [his]4145-her husband furious wrath at not having profited more largely by the will put [her]934-the widow in fear of [her]934-the widow life . This last remarkable statement was made in a long and violent epistle to [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , which [the recipient]2128-the recipient showed to [[her]2128-the recipient cousin]1204-her cousin on the first opportunity . [Everard]242-everard had called one Sunday morning it was the end of March to say good - bye on [his]242-everard departure for a few weeks ' travel . Having read the letter , [he]242-everard laughed with a peculiar fierceness .[242-everard]

' This kind of thing , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , ' may necessitate [your]4145-her husband prosecuting [her]934-the widow . There is a limit , [you]4145-her husband know , even to [a woman]615-a woman 's licence . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]4145-her husband am far more likely , '[4145-her husband] [he]4145-her husband replied , ' to purchase a very nice little cane , and give [her]934-the widow an exemplary thrashing . '[4145-her husband]

' Oh ! Oh ! '[242-everard]

' Upon [my]4145-her husband word , [I]4145-her husband see no reason against it ! That 's how [I]4145-her husband should deal with [a man who talked about [me]4145-her husband in this way , and none the less if [he]4145-her husband were a puny creature quite unable to protect [himself]4145-her husband]5201-a man who talked about me in this way , and none the less if he were a puny creature quite unable to protect himself . In that furious scene before [we]5202-we got [Tom]263-mrs. thomas away [I]4145-her husband felt most terribly tempted to beat [her]934-the widow . There 's a great deal to be said for [woman]3471-woman - beating . [I]4145-her husband am quite sure that [many a labouring man who pommels [[his]5204-many a labouring man who pommels his wife wife]4133-his wife]5204-many a labouring man who pommels his wife is doing exactly the right thing ; no other measure would have the least result . [You]5206-you see what comes of impunity . If [this woman]2086-this woman saw the possibility that [I]4145-her husband should give [her]2086-this woman a public caning [she]2086-this woman would be far more careful how [she]2086-this woman behaved [herself]2086-this woman . Let [us]5208-us ask [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's opinion . '[4145-her husband]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda had that moment entered [the room]444-the room . [She]197-rhoda offered [her]197-rhoda hand frankly , and asked what the subject was .

' Glance over this letter , '[263-mrs. thomas] said [Barfoot]263-mrs. thomas . ' Oh , [you]5206-you have seen it . [I]263-mrs. thomas propose to get a light , supple , dandyish cane , and to give [Mrs. Thomas Barfoot]263-mrs. thomas half a dozen smart cuts across the back in [[her]2086-this woman own drawing - room]5209-her own drawing - room , some afternoon when [people]3536-people were present . What have [you]5206-you to say to it ? '[263-mrs. thomas]

[He]2131-he spoke with such show of angry seriousness that [Rhoda]197-rhoda paused before replying .

' [I]197-rhoda sympathized with [you]242-everard , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said at length , ' but [I]197-rhoda do n't think [I]197-rhoda would go to that extremity . '[197-rhoda]

[Everard]242-everard repeated the argument [he]242-everard had used to [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin .

' [You]242-everard are quite right , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda assented . ' [I]197-rhoda think [many women]5211-many women deserve to be beaten , and ought to be beaten . But public Opinion would be so much against [you]242-everard . '[197-rhoda]

' What do [I]197-rhoda care ? So is public opinion against [you]242-everard . '[197-rhoda]

' Very well . Do as [you]242-everard like . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot and [I]197-rhoda will come to [the police court]5212-the police court and give strong evidence in [your]242-everard favour . '[197-rhoda]

' Now there 's [a woman]615-a woman ! '[242-everard] exclaimed [Everard]242-everard , not all in jest , for [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's appearance had made [his]242-everard nerves thrill and [his]242-everard pulse beat . ' Look at [her]615-a woman , [Mary]225-mary . Do [you]242-everard wonder that [I]197-rhoda would walk the diameter of the globe to win [her]615-a woman love ? '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda flushed scarlet , and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was much embarrassed . [Neither]1146-neither could have anticipated such an utterance as this . ' That 's the simple truth , '[242-everard] went on [Everard]242-everard recklessly , ' and [she]615-a woman knows it , and yet wo n't listen to [me]242-everard . Well , good - bye to [[you]242-everard both]5214-you both ! Now that [I]242-everard have so grossly misbehaved [myself]242-everard , [she]615-a woman has a good excuse for refusing even to enter [the room]444-the room when [I]242-everard am here . But do speak a word for [me]242-everard whilst [I]242-everard am away , [Mary]225-mary . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard shook hands with [them]2134-them , scarcely looking at [their]2134-them faces , and abruptly departed .

[The women]2135-the women stood for a moments at a distance from [each other]543-each other . Then [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot glanced at [[her]212-miss barfoot friend]631-her friend and laughed .

' Really [[my]212-miss barfoot poor cousin]5216-my poor cousin is not very discreet . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Anything but , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered , resting on the back of a chair , [her]197-rhoda eyes cast down . ' Do [you]242-everard think [he]5216-my poor cousin will really cane [[his]5216-my poor cousin sister - in - law]4636-his sister - in - law ? '[197-rhoda]

' How can [you]242-everard ask such a question ? '[197-rhoda]

' It would be amusing . [I]197-rhoda should think better of [him]5216-my poor cousin for it . '[197-rhoda]

' Well , make it a condition . [We]5218-we know the story of [the lady]4316-the lady and [her]4316-the lady glove . [I]197-rhoda can see [you]242-everard sympathize with [her]4316-the lady . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda laughed and went away , leaving [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot with the impression that [she]212-miss barfoot had revealed a genuine impulse . It seemed not impossible that [Rhoda]197-rhoda might wish to say to [[her]197-rhoda lover]2138-her lover : ' Face this monstrous scandal and [I]212-miss barfoot am [yours]2138-her lover .[212-miss barfoot]

A week passed and there arrived a letter , with a foreign stamp , addressed to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . Happening to receive it before [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had come down to breakfast , [she]212-miss barfoot put in away in a drawer till evening leisure , and made no mention of [its]2139-its arrival . Exhilaration appeared in [her]212-miss barfoot behaviour through the day . After dinner [she]212-miss barfoot disappeared , shutting [herself]212-miss barfoot up to read the letter .

' DEAR [MISS NUNN]197-rhoda , [I]212-miss barfoot am sitting at a little marble table outside [a cafe on [the Cannibiere]125-the cannibiere]5220-a cafe on the cannibiere . Does that name convey anything to [you]197-rhoda ? [The Cannibiere]5221-the cannibiere is [the principal street of [Marseilles]126-marseilles]5222-the principal street of marseilles , [street of [gorgeous cafe 's]5224-gorgeous cafe 's]5223-street of gorgeous cafe 's and [restaurants , just now blazing with electric light]5225-restaurants , just now blazing with electric light . [You]197-rhoda , no doubt , are shivering by the fireside ; here it is like an evening of summer . [I]212-miss barfoot have dined luxuriously , and [I]212-miss barfoot am taking [my]212-miss barfoot coffee whilst [I]212-miss barfoot write . At a table near to [me]212-miss barfoot sit [two girls , engaged in the liveliest possible conversation]5226-two girls , engaged in the liveliest possible conversation , of which [I]212-miss barfoot catch a few words now and then , pretty French phrases that caress the ear . One of them is so strikingly beautiful that [I]212-miss barfoot can not take [my]212-miss barfoot eyes from [her]5227-her when [they]5226-two girls , engaged in the liveliest possible conversation have been tempted to that quarter . [She]5227-her speaks with indescribable grace and animation , has the sweetest eyes and lips[212-miss barfoot]

' And all the time [I]212-miss barfoot am thinking of [some one else]5228-some one else . Ah , if [you]197-rhoda were [here]3495-here ! How [we]5230-we would enjoy [ourselves]5230-we among these southern scenes ! Alone , it is delightful ; but with [you]197-rhoda for [a companion]3617-a companion , with [you]197-rhoda to talk about everything in [your]197-rhoda splendidly frank way ! [This French girl]5232-this french girl 's talk is of course only silly chatter ; it makes [me]212-miss barfoot long to hear a few words from [your]197-rhoda lips strong , brave , intelligent .[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]212-miss barfoot dream of the ideal possibility . Suppose [I]212-miss barfoot were to look up and see [you]197-rhoda standing just in front of [me]212-miss barfoot , there on the pavement . [You]197-rhoda have come in a few hours straight from [London]6-london . [Your]197-rhoda eyes glow with delight . To - morrow [we]5230-we shall travel on to [Genoa]127-genoa , [you]197-rhoda and [I]212-miss barfoot , more than [friends]3725-friends , and infinitely more than [the common husband]5234-the common husband and [wife]3467-wife ! [We]5230-we have bidden [the world]3462-the world go round for [our]5230-we amusement ; henceforth it is [our]5230-we occupation to observe and discuss and make merry .[212-miss barfoot]

' Is it all in vain ? [Rhoda]197-rhoda , if [you]197-rhoda never love [me]212-miss barfoot , [my]212-miss barfoot life will be poor to what it might have been ; and [you]197-rhoda , [you]197-rhoda also , will lose something . In imagination [I]212-miss barfoot kiss [your]197-rhoda hands and [your]197-rhoda lips .[212-miss barfoot]

[EVERARD BARFOOT]242-everard . '[242-everard]

There was an address at the head of this letter , but certainly [Barfoot]242-everard expected no reply , and [Rhoda]197-rhoda had no thought of sending one . Every night , however , [she]197-rhoda unfolded the sheet of thin foreign paper , and read , more than once , what was written upon it . Read it with external calm , with a brow of meditation , and afterwards sat for some time in absent mood .

Would [he]242-everard write again ? [Her]197-rhoda daily question was answered in rather more than a fortnight . This time the letter came from [Italy]128-italy ; it was lying on the hall table when [Rhoda]197-rhoda returned from [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street , and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was the first to read the address . [They]2140-they exchanged no remark . On breaking the envelope [she]197-rhoda did so at once [Rhoda]197-rhoda found a little bunch of violets crushed but fragrant .

' These in return for [your]197-rhoda Cheddar pinks , '[197-rhoda] began the informal note accompanying the flowers . ' [I]197-rhoda had them an hour ago from [a pretty girl in [the streets of [Parma]129-parma]5238-the streets of parma]5237-a pretty girl in the streets of parma . [I]197-rhoda did n't care to buy , and walked on , but [the pretty girl]5239-the pretty girl ran by [me]197-rhoda , and with gentle force fixed the flowers in [my]197-rhoda button - hole , so that [I]197-rhoda had no choice but to stroke [her]5239-the pretty girl velvety cheek and give [her]5239-the pretty girl a lira . How hungry [I]197-rhoda am for the sight of [your]197-rhoda face ! Think of [me]197-rhoda sometimes , [dear friend]5240-dear friend . '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda laughed , and laid the letter and its violets away with the other .

' [I]212-miss barfoot must depend on [you]197-rhoda , it seems , for news of [Everard]242-everard , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot after dinner .

' [I]197-rhoda can only tell [you]197-rhoda , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered lightly , ' that [he]242-everard has travelled from [the south of [France]102-france]1831-the south of france to [the north of [Italy]128-italy]5242-the north of italy , with much observation of female countenances . '[197-rhoda]

' [He]242-everard informs [you]197-rhoda of that ? '[197-rhoda]

' Very naturally . It is [his]242-everard chief interest . [One]472-one likes [people]3536-people to tell the truth . '[197-rhoda]

[Barfoot]242-everard was away until the end of April , but after that note from [Parma]129-parma [he]242-everard did not write . One bright afternoon in May , a Saturday , [he]242-everard presented [himself]242-everard at [[[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin 's house]2142-his cousin 's house , and found [two or three callers]2143-two or three callers in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room , [ladies as usual]2145-ladies as usual ; one of [them]2143-two or three callers was [Miss Winifred Haven]227-miss haven , another was [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . [Mary]225-mary received [him]242-everard without effusiveness , and after a few minutes ' talk with [her]2146-i [he]242-everard took a place by [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , who , it struck [him]242-everard , looked by no means in such good spirits as during the early days of [her]265-mrs. widdowson marriage . As soon as [she]2146-i began to converse , [his]242-everard impression of a change in [her]2146-i was confirmed ; the girlishness so pleasantly noticeable when first [he]242-everard knew [her]2146-i had disappeared , and the gravity substituted for it was suggestive of disillusion , of trouble .[2146-i]

[She]2146-i asked [him]242-everard if [he]242-everard knew [some people named [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis , who occupied [a flat just above [his]242-everard own]2148-a flat just above his own]2147-some people named bevis , who occupied a flat just above his own .

' [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis ? [I]2146-i have seen the name on the index at the foot of the stairs ; but [I]2146-i do n't know [them]2147-some people named bevis , who occupied a flat just above his own personally . '[2146-i]

' That was how [I]195-monica came to know that [you]242-everard live [there]453-there , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica . ' [[My]195-monica husband]5246-my husband took [me]195-monica to call upon [the Bevises]297-the bevises , and there [we]5247-we saw [your]242-everard name . ' Oh yes ; [I]2146-i live [there]453-there all alone , [a gloomy bachelor]5249-a gloomy bachelor . '[2146-i]

[Monica]195-monica smiled , and [her]195-monica eyes wandered restlessly .

' [You]2146-i have been away out of [England]58-england ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica next said .

' Yes ; in [Italy]128-italy . '[2146-i]

' [I]2146-i envy [you]2146-i . '[2146-i]

' [You]2146-i have never been [there]453-there ? '[2146-i]

' No not yet . '[2146-i]

[He]2149-he talked a little of the agreeables and disagreeables of life in [that country]4509-that country . But [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had become irresponsive ; [he]2149-he doubted at length whether [she]265-mrs. widdowson was listening to [him]2149-he , so , as [Miss Haven]227-miss haven stepped this way , [he]2149-he took an opportunity of a word aside with [[his]2149-he cousin]1165-his cousin .

' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda not at [home]364-home ? '[227-miss haven]

' No . Wo n't be till dinner - time . '[227-miss haven]

' Quite well ? '[227-miss haven]

' Never was better . Would [you]2149-he care to come back and dine with [us]5253-us at half - past seven ? '[227-miss haven]

With this pleasant prospect [he]2149-he took [his]2149-he leave . [They]2157-they entered [the station]586-the station , [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot chatting humorously . It was [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , returning sooner than [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had expected . [She]197-rhoda saw [the pair]2161-the pair , regarded [them]2161-the pair with a moment 's keen attentiveness , and went on , out into [the street]594-the street .

In [the first - class carriage which [they]2157-they entered]2163-the first - class carriage which they entered there was [no other passenger]2164-no other passenger as far as [[Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's station]2165-barfoot 's station . [He]2149-he could not resist the temptation to use rather an intimate tone , though one that was quite conventional , in the hope that [he]2149-he might discover something of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's mind . [He]2149-he began by asking whether [she]265-mrs. widdowson thought it a good Academy this year . [She]265-mrs. widdowson had not yet visited [it]2165-barfoot 's station , but hoped to do so on Monday . Did [she]265-mrs. widdowson [herself]265-mrs. widdowson do any kind of artistic work ? Oh , nothing whatever ; [she]265-mrs. widdowson was [a very useless and idle person]2166-a very useless and idle person . ' Probably because [I]265-mrs. widdowson married , '[265-mrs. widdowson] [she]265-mrs. widdowson added with a smile .

' Is [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda really such [a determined enemy of marriage]5254-a determined enemy of marriage ? '[265-mrs. widdowson]

This piece of news surprised [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot .

Seeing that [no woman]2171-no woman ever forgot the details of another 's dress , on however trivial an occasion , and at whatever distance of time , [Monica]195-monica was of course able to satisfy [the inquirer]2172-the inquirer . All at once [she]195-monica had brightened astonishingly . This subject was not pursued , but for the rest of the time [they]2173-they talked with a new appearance of mutual confidence and interest , [Monica]195-monica retaining [her]195-monica pretty , half - bashful smile . And when [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot alighted at [Bayswater]77-bayswater [they]2173-they shook hands with an especial friendliness , both seeming to suggest a wish that [they]2173-they might soon meet again .

[They]2173-they did so not later than the following Monday . Remembering what [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had said of [her]265-mrs. widdowson intention to visit [Burlington House]41-burlington house , [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot went [there]453-there in the afternoon . If [he]2174-i chanced to encounter [the pretty little woman]2177-the pretty little woman it would not be disagreeable . Perhaps [[her]2177-the pretty little woman husband]4145-her husband might be with [her]2177-the pretty little woman , and in that case [he]2174-i could judge of the terms on which [they]2173-they stood . [A surly fellow]2179-a surly fellow , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ; very likely to play [the tyrant]2180-the tyrant , [he]2174-i thought . ' [I]212-miss barfoot dined with [[our]2173-they friends]3921-our friends at [Chelsea]19-chelsea on Saturday evening , '[212-miss barfoot] said [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot .

[Monica]195-monica hinted an amused surprise .

[I]2174-i will confess to [you]2177-the pretty little woman [I]2174-i wrote [her]197-rhoda a letter whilst [I]2174-i was abroad , and it offended [her]197-rhoda , [I]2174-i suppose . '[2174-i]

' [I]212-miss barfoot do n't think [you]212-miss barfoot can always judge of [her]197-rhoda thoughts by [her]197-rhoda face . '[212-miss barfoot]

For all that , [she]197-rhoda is more a mystery to [me]2174-i than [any woman]5257-any woman [I]2174-i have ever known . That , of course , is partly the reason of [her]197-rhoda power over [me]2174-i . [I]2174-i feel that if ever if ever [she]197-rhoda should disclose [herself]197-rhoda to [me]2174-i , it would be the strangest revelation . [Every woman]5258-every woman wears a mask , except to [one man]5259-one man ; but [Rhoda 's Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's is , [I]2174-i fancy , a far completer disguise than [I]2174-i ever tried to pierce . '[2174-i]

[Monica]195-monica had a sense of something perilous in this conversation . It arose from a secret trouble in [her]195-monica own heart , which [she]195-monica might , involuntarily , be led to betray . [She]195-monica had never talked thus confidentially with [any man]513-any man ; not , in truth , with [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . There was no fear whatever of [her]195-monica conceiving an undue interest in [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot ; certain reasons assured [her]195-monica of that ; but talk that was at all sentimental gravely threatened [her]195-monica peace what little remained to [her]195-monica . It would have been better to discourage [this man]742-this man 's confidences ; yet [they]2186-they flattered [her]195-monica so pleasantly , and afforded such a fruitful subject for speculation , that [she]195-monica could not obey the prompting of prudence .

' Do [you]212-miss barfoot mean , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said , ' that [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda seems to disguise [her]197-rhoda feelings ? '[195-monica]

' It is supposed to be wrong is n't it ? for [a man]3627-a man to ask [one woman]3705-one woman [her]3705-one woman opinion of another . '[265-mrs. widdowson]

' [I]195-monica ca n't be treacherous if [I]195-monica wished , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica replied . ' [I]195-monica do n't feel that [I]195-monica understand [her]265-mrs. widdowson . '[195-monica]

[Barfoot]212-miss barfoot wondered how much intelligence [he]742-this man might attribute to [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . Obviously [her]265-mrs. widdowson level was much below that of [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Yet [she]265-mrs. widdowson seemed to possess delicate sensibilities , and a refinement of thought not often met with in [women of [her]265-mrs. widdowson position]2187-women of her position . Seriously desiring [her]265-mrs. widdowson aid , [he]742-this man looked at [her]265-mrs. widdowson with a grave smile , and asked ,

' Do [you]265-mrs. widdowson believe [her]265-mrs. widdowson capable of falling in love ? '[742-this man]

[Monica]195-monica showed a painful confusion . [She]195-monica overcame it , however , and soon answered .

' [She]265-mrs. widdowson would perhaps try not not to acknowledge it to [herself]265-mrs. widdowson . '[195-monica]

' When , in fact , it had happened ? '[742-this man]

' [She]265-mrs. widdowson thinks it so much nobler to disregard such feelings . '[195-monica]

' [I]742-this man know . [She]265-mrs. widdowson is to be an inspiring example to [the women who can not hope to marry]5262-the women who can not hope to marry . '[742-this man] [He]742-this man laughed silently . ' And [I]742-this man suppose it is quite possible that mere shame would withhold [her]265-mrs. widdowson from taking the opposite course . ' [I]195-monica think [she]265-mrs. widdowson is very strong . But '[195-monica]

' But ? '[742-this man]

' On the whole , [I]195-monica am glad to hear [you]742-this man say that . [I]195-monica believe it . It is only [the vulgar that hold a different opinion]5266-the vulgar that hold a different opinion . '[195-monica]

' Shall [we]2188-we look at the pictures , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot ? '[742-this man]

' Oh , [I]195-monica am so sorry . [I]195-monica have been wasting [your]742-this man time '[195-monica]

[They]2188-we walked on together for some ten minutes , until [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , who had turned to look at [a passing figure]2189-a passing figure , said in [his]249-mr. barfoot ordinary voice

[Monica]195-monica looked quickly round , and saw [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , as if occupied with the pictures , glancing in [her]195-monica direction .

CHAPTER XIX

THE CLANK OF THE CHAINS

Since Saturday evening [Monica]195-monica and [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband had not been on speaking terms . A visit [she]195-monica paid to [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred , after [her]195-monica call at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's , prolonged itself so that [she]195-monica did not reach [home]364-home until the dinner - hour was long past . On arriving , [she]195-monica was met with an outburst of tremendous wrath , to which [she]195-monica opposed a resolute and haughty silence ; and since then [the two]690-the two had kept as much apart as possible .

[Widdowson]217-widdowson knew that [Monica]195-monica was going to [the Academy]2194-the academy . [He]217-widdowson allowed [her]195-monica to set forth alone , and even tried to persuade [himself]217-widdowson that [he]217-widdowson was indifferent as to the hour of [her]195-monica return ; but [she]195-monica had not long been gone before [he]217-widdowson followed . Insufferable misery possessed [him]217-widdowson . [His]217-widdowson married life threatened to terminate in utter wreck , and [he]217-widdowson had the anguish of recognizing that to a great extent this catastrophe would be [his]217-widdowson own fault . Resolve as [he]217-widdowson might , [he]217-widdowson found it impossible to repress the impulses of jealousy which , as soon as peace had been declared between [them]690-the two , brought about a new misunderstanding . Terrible thoughts smouldered in [his]217-widdowson mind ; [he]217-widdowson felt [himself]217-widdowson to be one of [those men who are driven by passion into crime]2195-those men who are driven by passion into crime . Deliberately [he]217-widdowson had brooded over a tragic close to the wretchedness of [his]217-widdowson existence ; [he]217-widdowson would kill [himself]217-widdowson , and [Monica]195-monica should perish with [him]217-widdowson . But an hour of contentment sufficed to banish such visions as sheer frenzy . [He]217-widdowson saw once more how harmless , how natural , were [Monica]195-monica 's demands , and how peacefully [he]217-widdowson might live with [her]195-monica but for the curse of suspicion from which [he]217-widdowson could not free [himself]217-widdowson . [Any other man]2196-any other man would deem [her]195-monica a model wifely virtue . [Her]195-monica care of [the house]368-the house was all that reason could desire . In [her]195-monica behaviour [he]217-widdowson had never detected the slightest impropriety . [He]217-widdowson believed [her]195-monica chaste as [any woman living [She]195-monica asked only to be trusted]2198-any woman living she asked only to be trusted , and that , in spite of all , was beyond [his]217-widdowson power .

In [no woman on earth]2199-no woman on earth could [he]217-widdowson have put perfect confidence . [He]217-widdowson regarded [them]2200-their as born to perpetual pupilage . Not that [their]2200-their inclinations were necessarily wanton ; [they]2200-their were simply incapable of attaining maturity , remained throughout [their]2200-their life [imperfect beings]2201-imperfect beings , at the mercy of craft , ever liable to be misled by childish misconceptions . Of course [he]217-widdowson was right ; [he]217-widdowson [himself]217-widdowson represented [the guardian male]2202-the guardian male , [the wife - proprietor , who from the dawn of civilization]2203-the wife - proprietor , who from the dawn of civilization has taken abundant care that [woman]3471-woman shall not outgrow [her]3471-woman nonage . The bitterness of [his]217-widdowson situation lay in the fact that [he]217-widdowson had wedded [a woman who irresistibly proved to [him]217-widdowson [her]2205-a woman who irresistibly proved to him her claims as a human being claims as [a human being]2206-a human being]2205-a woman who irresistibly proved to him her claims as a human being . Reason and tradition contended in [him]217-widdowson , to [his]217-widdowson ceaseless torment .

And again , [he]217-widdowson feared that [Monica]195-monica did not love [him]217-widdowson . Had [she]195-monica ever loved [him]217-widdowson ? There was too much ground for suspecting that [she]195-monica had only yielded to the persistence of [his]217-widdowson entreaties , with just liking enough to permit a semblance of tenderness , and glad to exchange [her]195-monica prospect of distasteful work for a comfortable married life . [Her]195-monica liking [he]217-widdowson might have fostered ; during those first happy weeks , assuredly [he]217-widdowson had done so , for [no woman]2171-no woman could be insensible to the passionate worship manifest in [his]217-widdowson every look , [his]217-widdowson every word . Later , [he]217-widdowson took the wrong path , seeking to oppose [her]195-monica instincts , to reform [her]195-monica mind , eventually to become [[her]195-monica lord]2208-her lord and [master]2209-master . Could [he]217-widdowson not even now retrace [his]217-widdowson steps ? Supposing [her]195-monica incapable of bowing before [him]217-widdowson , of kissing [his]217-widdowson feet , could [he]217-widdowson not be content to make of [her]195-monica [a loyal friend]2210-a loyal friend , [a delightful companion]2211-a delightful companion ?

In that mood [he]217-widdowson hastened towards [Burlington House]41-burlington house . Seeking [Monica]195-monica through [the galleries]2212-the galleries , [he]217-widdowson saw [her]195-monica at length sitting side by side with [that man [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot]2213-that man barfoot . [They]2214-they were in closest colloquy . [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot bent towards [her]195-monica as if speaking in an undertone , a smile on [his]249-mr. barfoot face . [Monica]195-monica looked at once pleased and troubled .

The blood boiled in [his]217-widdowson veins . [His]217-widdowson first impulse was to walk straight up to [Monica]195-monica and bid [her]195-monica follow [him]217-widdowson . But the ecstasy of jealous suffering kept [him]217-widdowson an observer . [He]217-widdowson watched [the pair]2161-the pair until [he]217-widdowson was descried .

There was no help for it . Though [his]217-widdowson brain whirled , and [his]217-widdowson flesh was stabbed , [he]217-widdowson had no choice but to take the hand [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot offered [him]217-widdowson . Smile [he]217-widdowson could not , nor speak a word .

' So [you]217-widdowson have come after all ? '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica was saying to [him]217-widdowson .

[He]217-widdowson nodded . On [her]195-monica countenance there was obvious embarrassment , but this needed no explanation save the history of the last day or two . Looking into [her]195-monica eyes , [he]217-widdowson knew not whether consciousness of wrong might be read there . How to get at the secrets of [this woman]2086-this woman 's heart ?

[Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot was talking , pointing at this picture and that , doing [his]249-mr. barfoot best to smooth what [he]249-mr. barfoot saw was an awkward situation . [The gloomy husband]2217-the gloomy husband , more like [a tyrant than ever]2218-a tyrant than ever , muttered incoherent phrases . In a minute or two [Everard]242-everard freed [himself]242-everard and moved out of sight .

[Monica]195-monica turned from [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband and affected interest in the pictures . [They]2220-they reached the end of [the room]444-the room before [Widdowson]217-widdowson spoke .

' How long do [you]195-monica want to stay [here]3495-here ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica will go whenever [you]217-widdowson like , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica answered , without looking at [him]217-widdowson .

' [I]217-widdowson have no wish to spoil [your]217-widdowson pleasure . '[217-widdowson]

' Really , [I]217-widdowson have very little pleasure in anything . Did [you]195-monica come to keep [me]217-widdowson in sight ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson think [we]2220-they will go [home]364-home now , and [you]217-widdowson can come another day . '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica assented by closing [her]195-monica catalogue and walking on .

Without a word , [they]2220-they made the journey back to [Herne Hill]32-herne hill . [Widdowson]217-widdowson shut [himself]217-widdowson in [the library]3604-the library , and did not appear till dinner - time . The meal was a pretence for both of [them]2220-they , and as soon as [they]2220-they could rise from the table [they]2220-they again parted .

About ten o'clock [Monica]195-monica was joined by [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room .

' [I]4145-her husband have almost made up [my]4145-her husband mind , '[4145-her husband] [he]4145-her husband said , standing near [her]195-monica , ' to take a serious step . As [you]195-monica have always spoken with pleasure of [[your]195-monica old home]4692-your old home , [Clevedon]1-clevedon , suppose [we]2220-they give up [this house]947-this house and go and live [there]453-there ? '[4145-her husband]

' It is for [you]195-monica to decide . '[195-monica]

' [I]4145-her husband want to know whether [you]195-monica would have any objection . '[4145-her husband]

' [I]195-monica shall do as [you]195-monica wish . '[195-monica]

' No , that is n't enough . The plan [I]4145-her husband have in mind is this . [I]4145-her husband should take [a good large house]5273-a good large house no doubt rents are low in [the neighbourhood]1128-the neighbourhood and ask [[your]195-monica sisters]3566-your sisters to come and live with [us]2220-they . [I]4145-her husband think it would be a good thing both for [them]3566-your sisters and for [you]195-monica . '[4145-her husband]

' [You]195-monica ca n't be sure that [they]3566-your sisters would agree to it . [You]195-monica see that [Virginia]191-virginia prefers [[her]191-virginia lodgings]5276-her lodgings to living [here]3495-here . '[195-monica]

Oddly enough , this was the case . On [their]2225-their return from [Guernsey]107-guernsey [they]2225-their had invited [Virginia]191-virginia to make a permanent home with [them]2225-their , and [she]191-virginia refused . [Her]191-virginia reasons [Monica]195-monica could not understand ; those which [she]195-monica alleged vague arguments as to its being better for [[a wife]514-a wife 's relatives]2227-a wife 's relatives not to burden [the husband]1667-the husband hardly seemed genuine . It was possible that [Virginia]191-virginia had a distaste for [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's society .

' [I]1667-the husband think [they]2229-they both would be glad to live at [Clevedon]1-clevedon , '[1667-the husband] [he]1667-the husband urged , ' judging from [[your]195-monica sisters]3566-your sisters '[1667-the husband] talk . It 's plain that [they]2229-they have quite given up the idea of [the school]3929-the school , and [Alice]185-alice , [you]195-monica tell [me]0-i , is getting dissatisfied with [her]185-alice work at [Yatton]52-yatton . But [I]0-i must know whether [you]195-monica will enter seriously into this scheme . '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica kept silence .

' Please answer [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

' Why have [you]1667-the husband thought of it ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica do n't think [I]195-monica need explain . [We]5279-we have had too many unpleasant conversations , and [I]195-monica wish to act for the best without saying things [you]195-monica would misunderstand . '[195-monica]

' There is no fear of [my]195-monica misunderstanding . [You]195-monica have no confidence in [me]195-monica , and [you]195-monica want to get [me]195-monica away into a quiet country place where [I]195-monica shall be under [your]195-monica eyes every moment . It 's much better to say that plainly . '[195-monica]

' That means [you]1667-the husband would consider it going to [prison]5280-prison . '[195-monica]

' How could [I]195-monica help ? What other motive have [you]1667-the husband ? '[195-monica]

[He]2231-he was prompted to make brutal declaration of authority , and so cut the knot . [Monica]195-monica 's unanswerable argument merely angered [him]2231-he . But [he]2231-he made an effort over [himself]2231-he .

' Do n't [you]195-monica think it best that [we]5279-we should take some step before [our]5279-we happiness is irretrievably ruined ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica see no need for [its]5281-its ruin . As [I]195-monica have told [you]195-monica before , in talking like that [you]195-monica degrade [yourself]195-monica and insult [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica have [my]195-monica faults ; [I]195-monica know them only too well . One of them is that [I]195-monica can not bear [you]195-monica to make friends with [people who are not of [my]195-monica kind]5282-people who are not of my kind . [I]195-monica shall never be able to endure that . '[195-monica]

' Of course [you]195-monica are speaking of [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . '[195-monica]

' Yes , '[2232-he] [he]2232-he avowed sullenly . ' It was a very unfortunate thing that [I]2232-he happened to come up just as [he]249-mr. barfoot was in [your]195-monica company . '[2232-he]

' [You]2232-he are so very unreasonable , '[195-monica] exclaimed [Monica]195-monica tartly . ' What possible harm is there in [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , when [he]249-mr. barfoot meets [me]195-monica by chance in [a public place]5283-a public place , having a conversation with [me]195-monica ? [I]195-monica wish [I]195-monica knew [twenty such men]5284-twenty such men . Such conversation gives [me]195-monica a new interest in life . [I]195-monica have every reason to think well of [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . '[195-monica]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson was in anguish .

' And [I]217-widdowson , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson replied , in a voice shaken with angry feeling , ' feel that [I]217-widdowson have every reason to dislike and suspect [him]249-mr. barfoot . [He]249-mr. barfoot is not [an honest man]5285-an honest man ; [his]249-mr. barfoot face tells [me]217-widdowson that . [I]217-widdowson know [his]249-mr. barfoot life would n't bear inspection . [You]217-widdowson ca n't possibly be as good [a judge]5286-a judge as [I]217-widdowson am in such a case . Contrast [him]249-mr. barfoot with [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis . No , [Bevis]287-mrs. bevis is [a man one]5287-a man one can trust ; one talk with [him]249-mr. barfoot produces a lasting favourable impression . '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica , silent for a brief space , looked fixedly before [her]195-monica , [her]195-monica features all but expressionless .

' Yet even with [Mr. Bevis]289-bevis , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said at length , ' [you]289-bevis do n't make [friends]3725-friends . That is the fault in [you]289-bevis which causes all this trouble . [You]289-bevis have n't [a sociable spirit]5289-a sociable spirit . [Your]289-bevis dislike of [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot only means that [you]289-bevis do n't know [him]249-mr. barfoot , and do n't wish to . And [you]289-bevis are completely wrong in [your]289-bevis judgment of [him]249-mr. barfoot . [I]195-monica have every reason for being sure that [you]289-bevis are wrong . '[195-monica]

' Of course [you]289-bevis think so . In [your]289-bevis ignorance of [the world]3462-the world '[217-widdowson]

' Which [you]289-bevis think very proper in [a woman]615-a woman , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica interposed caustically .

' Yes , [I]217-widdowson do ! That kind of knowledge is harmful to [a woman]615-a woman . '[217-widdowson]

' Then , please , how is [she]615-a woman to judge [[her]615-a woman acquaintances]950-her acquaintances ? '[217-widdowson]

' [A married woman]1749-a married woman must accept [[her]1749-a married woman husband]4145-her husband 's opinion , at all events about [men]3461-men . '[2233-you] [He]2233-you plunged on into the ancient quagmire . ' [A man]3627-a man may know with impunity what is injurious if it enters [a woman]615-a woman 's mind . '[2233-you]

' [I]2233-you do n't believe that . [I]2233-you ca n't and wo n't believe it . '[2233-you]

[He]2233-you made a gesture of despair .

' [We]5299-we differ hopelessly . It was all very well to discuss these things when [you]2233-you could do so in a friendly spirit . Now [you]2233-you say whatever [you]2233-you know will irritate [me]217-widdowson , and [you]2233-you say it on purpose to irritate [me]217-widdowson . '[217-widdowson]

' No ; indeed [I]2233-you do not . But [you]2233-you are quite right that [I]2233-you find it hard to be friendly with [you]2233-you . Most earnestly [I]2233-you wish to be [[your]2233-you friend]4046-your friend [[your]2233-you true and faithful friend]5301-your true and faithful friend . But [you]2233-you wo n't let [me]2233-you . '[2233-you]

' [Friend]5302-friend ! '[2233-you] [he]2233-you cried scornfully . ' [The woman who has become [[my]2233-you wife]4104-my wife]5303-the woman who has become my wife ought to be something more than [a friend]3555-a friend , [I]2233-you should think . [You]2233-you have lost all love for [me]2233-you there 's the misery . '[2233-you]

[Monica]195-monica could not reply . That word ' love '[2233-you] had grown a weariness to [her]195-monica upon [his]2233-you lips . [She]195-monica did not love [him]2233-you ; could not pretend to love [him]2233-you . Every day the distance between [them]2234-them widened , and when [he]2233-you took [her]195-monica in [his]2233-you arms [she]195-monica had to struggle with a sense of shrinking , of disgust . The union was unnatural ; [she]195-monica felt [herself]195-monica constrained by a hateful force when [he]2233-you called upon [her]195-monica for the show of wifely tenderness . Yet how was [she]195-monica to utter this ? The moment such a truth had passed [her]195-monica lips [she]195-monica must leave [him]2233-you . To declare that no trace of love remained in [her]195-monica heart , and still to live with [him]2233-you that was impossible ! The dark foresight of a necessity of parting from [him]2233-you corresponded in [her]195-monica to those lurid visions which at times shook [Widdowson]217-widdowson with a horrible temptation .

' [You]195-monica do n't love [me]2233-you , '[2233-you] [he]2233-you continued in harsh , choking tones . ' [You]195-monica wish to be [[my]2233-you friend]3812-my friend . That 's how [you]195-monica try to compensate [me]2233-you for the loss of [your]195-monica love . '[2233-you]

[He]2233-you laughed with bitterness .

' When [you]2233-you say that , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered , ' do [you]2233-you ever ask [yourself]2233-you whether [you]2233-you try to make [me]195-monica love [you]2233-you ? Scenes like this are ruining [my]195-monica health . [I]195-monica have come to dread [your]2233-you talk . [I]195-monica have almost forgotten the sound of [your]2233-you voice when it is n't either angry or complaining . '[195-monica]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson walked about [the room]444-the room , and a deep moan escaped [him]217-widdowson .

' That is why [I]217-widdowson have asked [you]195-monica to go away from [here]3495-here , [Monica]195-monica . [We]5308-we must have [a new home]5309-a new home if [our]5308-we life is to begin anew . '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson have no faith in mere change of place . [You]217-widdowson would be [the same man]5310-the same man . If [you]217-widdowson can not command [your]217-widdowson senseless jealousy here , [you]217-widdowson never would anywhere else . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson made an effort to say something ; seemed to abandon it ; again tried , and spoke in a thick , unnatural voice .

' Can [you]195-monica honestly repeat to [me]217-widdowson what [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot was saying to - day , when [you]217-widdowson were on the seat together ? '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica 's eyes flashed .

' [I]217-widdowson could ; every word . But [I]217-widdowson shall not try to do so . '[217-widdowson]

' Not if [I]217-widdowson beseech [you]195-monica to , [Monica]195-monica ? To put [my]217-widdowson mind at rest '[217-widdowson]

' No . When [I]217-widdowson tell [you]195-monica that [you]195-monica might have heard every syllable , [I]217-widdowson have said all that [I]217-widdowson shall . '[217-widdowson]

It mortified [him]217-widdowson profoundly that [he]217-widdowson should have been driven to make so humiliating a request . [He]217-widdowson threw [himself]217-widdowson into a chair and hid [his]217-widdowson face , sitting thus for a long time in the hope that [Monica]195-monica would be moved to compassion . But when [she]195-monica rose it was only to retire for the night . And with wretchedness in [her]195-monica heart , because [she]195-monica must needs go to [the same chamber in which [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband would sleep]2236-the same chamber in which her husband would sleep . [She]195-monica wished so to be alone . [The poorest bed in [a servant]622-a servant 's garret]2238-the poorest bed in a servant 's garret would have been thrice welcome to [her]195-monica ; liberty to lie awake , to think without a disturbing presence , to shed tears of need be that seemed to [her]195-monica a precious boon . [She]195-monica thought with envy of [the shop - girls in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road]2240-the shop - girls in walworth road ; wished [herself]195-monica back [there]453-there . What unspeakable folly [she]195-monica had committed ! And how true was everything [she]195-monica had heard from [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda on the subject of marriage ! The next day [Widdowson]217-widdowson resorted to an expedient which [he]217-widdowson had once before tried in like circumstances . [He]217-widdowson wrote [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife a long letter , eight close pages , reviewing the cause of [their]2243-their troubles , confessing [his]217-widdowson own errors , insisting gently on those chargeable to [her]4133-his wife , and finally imploring [her]4133-his wife to cooperate with [him]217-widdowson in a sincere endeavour to restore [their]2243-their happiness . This [he]217-widdowson laid on the table after lunch , and then left [Monica]195-monica alone that [she]4133-his wife might read it . Knowing beforehand all that the letter contained , [Monica]195-monica glanced over it carelessly . An answer was expected , and [she]195-monica wrote one as briefly as possible .

' [Your]217-widdowson behaviour seems to [me]195-monica very weak , very unmanly . [You]217-widdowson make [us]2243-their both miserable , and quite without cause . [I]195-monica can only say as [I]195-monica have said before , that things will never be better until [you]217-widdowson come to think of [me]195-monica as [[your]217-widdowson free companion]5311-your free companion , not as [[your]217-widdowson bond - woman]5312-your bond - woman . If [you]217-widdowson ca n't do this , [you]217-widdowson will make [me]195-monica wish that [I]195-monica had never met [you]217-widdowson , and in the end [I]195-monica am sure it wo n't be possible for [us]2244-us to go on living together . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica left this note , in a blank envelope , on the hall table , and went out to walk for an hour .

It was the end of one more acute stage in [their]2244-us progressive discord . By keeping at [home]364-home for a fortnight . [Monica]195-monica soothed [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband and obtained some repose for [her]195-monica own nerves . But [she]195-monica could no longer affect a cordial reconciliation ; caresses left [her]195-monica cold , and [Widdowson]217-widdowson saw that [his]217-widdowson company was never so agreeable to [her]195-monica as solitude . When [they]2244-us sat together , [both]525-both were reading . [Monica]195-monica found more attraction in books as [her]195-monica life grew more unhappy . Though with reluctance [Widdowson]217-widdowson had consented to a subscription at [Mudie]298-mudie 's , and from the new catalogues [she]195-monica either chose for [herself]195-monica , necessarily at random , or by the advice of better - read people , such as [she]195-monica met at [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's . What modern teaching was to be got from these volumes [her]195-monica mind readily absorbed . [She]195-monica sought for opinions and arguments which were congenial to [her]195-monica mood of discontent , all but of revolt .

Sometimes the perusal of a love - story embittered [her]195-monica lot to the last point of endurance . Before marriage , [her]195-monica love - ideal had been very vague , elusive ; it found scarcely more than negative expression , as a shrinking from the vulgar or gross desires of [[her]195-monica companions]885-her companions in [the shop]582-the shop . Now that [she]195-monica had a clearer understanding of [her]195-monica own nature , the type of man correspondent to [her]195-monica natural sympathies also became clear . In every particular [he]2250-he was unlike [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . [She]195-monica found a suggestion of [him]2250-he in books ; and in actual life , already , perhaps something more than a suggestion . [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's jealousy , in so far as it directed itself against [her]195-monica longing for freedom , was fully justified ; this consciousness often made [her]195-monica sullen when [she]195-monica desired to express a nobler indignation ; but [his]2250-he special prejudice led [him]2250-he altogether astray , and in free resistance on this point [she]195-monica found the relief which enabled [her]195-monica to bear a secret self - reproach . [Her]195-monica refusal to repeat the substance of [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's conversation was , in some degree , prompted by a wish for the continuance of [his]2250-he groundless fears . By persevering in suspicion of [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , [he]2250-he afforded [her]195-monica a firm foothold in [their]2252-their ever - renewed quarrels .

[A husband]3844-a husband 's misdirected jealousy excites in [the wife]2254-the wife derision and a sense of superiority ; more often than not , it fosters an unsuspected attachment , prompts to a perverse pleasure in misleading . [Monica]195-monica became aware of this ; in [her]195-monica hours of misery [she]195-monica now and then gave a harsh laugh , the result of thoughts not seriously entertained , but tempting the fancy to recklessness . What , [she]195-monica asked [herself]195-monica again , would be the end of it all ? Ten years hence , would [she]195-monica have subdued [her]195-monica soul to a life of weary insignificance , if not of dishonour ? For it was dishonour to live with [a man [she]195-monica could not love]2255-a man she could not love , whether [her]195-monica heart cherished another image or was merely vacant . A dishonour to which [innumerable women]2256-innumerable women submitted , a dishonour glorified by social precept , enforced under dread penalties .

But [she]195-monica was so young , and life abounds in unexpected changes .

CHAPTER XX

THE FIRST LIE

[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove was [a childless widow , with sufficient means and a very mixed multitude of acquaintances]2257-a childless widow , with sufficient means and a very mixed multitude of acquaintances . In the general belief [her]277-mrs. cosgrove marriage had been a happy one ; when [she]277-mrs. cosgrove spoke of [[her]277-mrs. cosgrove deceased husband]2258-her deceased husband it was with respect , and not seldom with affection . Yet [her]277-mrs. cosgrove views on the matrimonial relation were known to be of singular audacity . [She]277-mrs. cosgrove revealed them only to [a small circle of intimates]2259-a small circle of intimates ; [most of the people who frequented [[her]277-mrs. cosgrove house]3584-her house]2260-most of the people who frequented her house had no startling theories to maintain , and regarded [[their]2260-most of the people who frequented her house hostess]2262-their hostess as [a good - natured , rather eccentric woman , who loved society and understood how to amuse [her]277-mrs. cosgrove guests]2263-a good - natured , rather eccentric woman , who loved society and understood how to amuse her guests .

Wealth and position were rarely represented in [[her]277-mrs. cosgrove drawing - room]2264-her drawing - room ; nor , on the other hand , was Bohemianism . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove belonged by birth and marriage to [the staid middle class]2265-the staid middle class , and it seemed as if [she]277-mrs. cosgrove made it [her]277-mrs. cosgrove object to provide with social entertainment [the kind of persons who , in an ordinary way , would enjoy very little of it]2266-the kind of persons who , in an ordinary way , would enjoy very little of it . [Lonely and impecunious girls]2267-lonely and impecunious girls or [women]3478-women were frequently about [her]277-mrs. cosgrove ; [she]277-mrs. cosgrove tried to keep [them]2267-lonely and impecunious girls in good spirits , tried to marry [them]2267-lonely and impecunious girls if marriage seemed possible , and , it was whispered , used a good deal of [her]277-mrs. cosgrove income for the practical benefit of [those who needed assistance]2269-those who needed assistance . A sprinkling of [maidens who were neither lonely nor impecunious]2270-maidens who were neither lonely nor impecunious served to attract [young men]4680-young men , generally strugglers in some profession or other , on the lookout for [a wife]514-a wife . Intercourse went on with a minimum of formalities . Chaperonage save for that represented by [the hostess]903-the hostess [herself]903-the hostess was as often as not dispensed with .

' [We]5313-we want to get rid of a lot of sham propriety '[277-mrs. cosgrove] so [she]277-mrs. cosgrove urged to [[her]277-mrs. cosgrove closer friends]2274-her closer friends . ' [Girls]3460-girls must learn to trust [themselves]3460-girls , and look out for dangers . If [a girl]3628-a girl can only be kept straight by incessant watchfulness , why , let [her]3628-a girl go where [she]3628-a girl will , and learn by experience . In fact , [I]277-mrs. cosgrove want to see experience substituted for precept . '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

Between [this lady]4194-this lady and [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot there were considerable divergences of opinion , yet [they]2276-they agreed on a sufficient number of points to like [each other]543-each other very well . Occasionally [one of [[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's protegees]2279-mrs. cosgrove 's protegees]2278-one of mrs. cosgrove 's protegees passed into [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's hands , abandoning the thought of matrimony for study in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street . [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , also , had a liking for [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove , though [she]197-rhoda made no secret of [her]197-rhoda opinion that [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's influence was on the whole decidedly harmful .

' [That house]5316-that house , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda once said to [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , ' is nothing more than a matrimonial agency . '[197-rhoda]

' But so is [every house where [many people]1904-many people are entertained]5317-every house where many people are entertained . '[197-rhoda]

' Not in the same way . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot could not restrain a laugh .

' The first part of [her]197-rhoda remark yes , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda caustically . ' But as for the " no harm in trying , " well , let [us]5322-us ask [the wife]2254-the wife 's opinion in a year 's time . '[197-rhoda]

Midway in the [London]6-london season on Sunday afternoon , [about a score of [visitors]3562-visitors]2280-about a score of visitors were assembled in [[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's drawing - rooms]2282-mrs. cosgrove 's drawing - rooms there were two of them , with a landing between . As usual , [some one]735-some one sat at the piano , but a hum of talk went on as undercurrent to the music . [Downstairs]523-downstairs , in [the library]3604-the library , [half a dozen people]2286-half a dozen people found the quietness [they]2286-half a dozen people preferred , and among these was [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . [She]265-mrs. widdowson had an album of portraits on [her]265-mrs. widdowson lap ; whilst turning them over , [she]265-mrs. widdowson listened to a chat going on between [the sprightly Mr. Bevis]289-bevis and [a young married woman who laughed ceaselessly at [his]289-bevis jokes]2287-a young married woman who laughed ceaselessly at his jokes . It was only a few minutes since [she]265-mrs. widdowson had come down from [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room . ' [[Your]289-bevis sisters]3566-your sisters are not here to - day ? '[265-mrs. widdowson] [she]265-mrs. widdowson said .

' Before long , [I]289-bevis hope . '[289-bevis]

[Laughing]299-laughing , [Monica]195-monica at length agreed to come if circumstances were favourable . [Her]195-monica talk with [Bevis]289-bevis continued for a long time , until [people]3536-people had begun to leave . [Some other acquaintance]2290-some other acquaintance then claimed [her]195-monica , but [she]195-monica was now dull and monosyllabic , as if conversation had exhausted [her]195-monica energies . At six o'clock [she]195-monica stole away unobserved , and went [home]364-home .

[Widdowson]217-widdowson had resigned [himself]217-widdowson , in appearance at all events , to these absences . It was several weeks since [he]217-widdowson had accompanied [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife to call upon [any one]3776-any one ; a sluggishness was creeping over [him]217-widdowson , strengthening [his]217-widdowson disinclination for society . The futile endeavour to act with decision , to carry [Monica]195-monica away into [Somerset]36-somerset , resulted , as futile efforts of that kind are wo nt to do , in increased feebleness of the will ; [he]217-widdowson was less capable than ever of exerting the authority which [he]217-widdowson still believed [himself]217-widdowson to keep for the last resort . Occasionally some days went by without [his]217-widdowson leaving [the house]368-the house . Instead of the one daily newspaper [he]217-widdowson had been used to take [he]217-widdowson now received three ; after breakfast [he]217-widdowson sometimes spent a couple of hours over the Times , and the evening papers often occupied [him]217-widdowson from dinner to bedtime . [Monica]195-monica noticed , with a painful conflict of emotions , that [his]217-widdowson hair had begun to lose its uniform colour , and to show streaks that matched with [his]217-widdowson grizzled beard . Was [she]195-monica responsible for this ?

On the Saturday when [she]195-monica was to visit [the Bevises]297-the bevises [she]195-monica feared lest [he]217-widdowson should propose to go with [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica wished even to avoid the necessity of telling [him]217-widdowson where [she]195-monica was going . ' [I]217-widdowson 've ordered the trap , [Monica]195-monica . Will [you]195-monica come for a drive ? '[217-widdowson]

' [I]217-widdowson have promised to go into [the town]3722-the town . [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] very sorry . '[217-widdowson]

' It does n't matter . '[217-widdowson]

This was [his]217-widdowson latest mode of appealing to [her]195-monica with an air of pained resignation .

' For a day or two [I]217-widdowson have n't felt at all well , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson continued gloomily . ' [I]217-widdowson thought a drive might do [me]217-widdowson good . '[217-widdowson]

' Oh yes long before dinner . '[217-widdowson]

So [she]195-monica got away without any explanation . [Bevis]289-bevis in [person]2297-person opened to [her]195-monica .

' Delighted ! [I]2297-person thought it might be '[2297-person]

' [[My]289-bevis sisters]3714-my sisters will be here in a few minutes , '[289-bevis] [he]289-bevis said . ' A few minutes at most . Will [you]195-monica take this chair , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? How delighted [I]289-bevis am that [you]195-monica were able to come ! '[289-bevis]

So perfectly natural was [his]289-bevis manner , that [Monica]195-monica , after the first moment of consternation , tried to forget that there was anything irregular in [her]195-monica presence [here]3495-here under these circumstances . As regards social propriety , [a flat]4119-a flat differs in many respects from [a house]902-a house . In [an ordinary drawing - room]2302-an ordinary drawing - room , it could scarcely have mattered if [Bevis]289-bevis entertained [her]195-monica for a short space until [[his]289-bevis sisters]5042-his sisters ' arrival ; but in [this little set of [rooms]5331-rooms]5330-this little set of rooms it was doubtfully permissible for [her]195-monica to sit tete - a - tete with [a young man]5044-a young man , under any excuse .
