' [A place like this]5335-a place like this must seem to [you]195-monica to be very unhomelike , '[289-bevis] [he]289-bevis was saying , as [he]289-bevis lounged on a low chair not very far from [her]195-monica . ' [The girls]375-the girls did n't like it at all at first . [I]289-bevis suppose it 's a retrograde step in civilization . [Servants]5337-servants are decidedly of that opinion ; [we]5338-we have a great difficulty in getting [them]5337-servants to stay [here]3495-here . ' Do [you]289-bevis think [she]195-monica smoked ? '[195-monica] asked [Monica]195-monica laughingly .

' [We]5338-we have debated that point with much interest . '[289-bevis]

[His]2306-i will , and [her]2307-her inclination , prevailed . [Monica]195-monica sat down again , and [Bevis]289-bevis disappeared to make the tea . With merry homage [he]667-the young man waited upon [[his]667-the young man guest]2309-his guest . [Monica]195-monica 's cheeks were warm . After the vain attempt to release [herself]195-monica from what was now distinctly a compromising situation , [she]195-monica sat down in an easier attitude than before , as though resolved to enjoy [her]195-monica liberty whilst [she]195-monica might . There was a suspicion in [her]195-monica mind that [Bevis]289-bevis had arranged this interview ; [she]195-monica doubted the truth of [his]289-bevis explanation . And indeed [she]195-monica hoped that [[his]289-bevis sisters]5042-his sisters would not return until after [her]195-monica departure ; it would be very embarrassing to meet [them]5042-his sisters .

Whilst talking and listening , [she]195-monica silently defended [herself]195-monica against the charge of impropriety . What wrong was [she]195-monica committing ? What matter that [they]2311-they were alone ? [Their]2311-they talk was precisely what it might have been in [other people]942-other people 's presence . And [Bevis]289-bevis , such [a frank , good - hearted fellow]2313-a frank , good - hearted fellow , could not by any possibility fail in respect to [her]195-monica . ' [You]289-bevis have n't made [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's acquaintance yet ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked .

[He]2315-i sat down and rattled over the keys . [Monica]195-monica was expecting a lively air and spirited words , as in the songs [she]195-monica had heard at [Guernsey]107-guernsey ; but this composition told of sadness and longing and the burden of a lonely heart . [She]195-monica thought it very beautiful , very touching . [Bevis]289-bevis looked round to see the effect it produced upon [her]195-monica , and [she]195-monica could not meet [his]289-bevis eyes .

' Quite a new sort of thing for [me]289-bevis , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . Does it strike [you]289-bevis as so very bad ? '[289-bevis]

' No not at all . '[289-bevis]

' [You]289-bevis will have it ? '[289-bevis] [he]289-bevis cried delightedly . ' Now for a triumphal march ! '[289-bevis]

Whilst [he]289-bevis played , with look corresponding to the exultant strain , [Monica]195-monica rose from [her]195-monica chair . [She]195-monica stood with eyes downcast and lips pressed together . When the last chord had sounded ,

[Monica]195-monica gave no verbal reply . [She]195-monica looked towards the door . [Bevis]288-bevis stepped forward , and held it open .

' Good - bye , then . [You]289-bevis know what [I]289-bevis told [you]289-bevis about [my]289-bevis tendency to low spirits . [I]289-bevis 'm[289-bevis] going to have a terrible turn down , down , down ! '[288-bevis]

[She]195-monica laughed , and offered [her]195-monica hand . [He]2316-he held it very lightly , looking at [her]195-monica with [his]2316-he blue eyes , which indeed expressed a profound melancholy .

' Thank [you]195-monica , '[2316-he] [he]2316-he murmured . ' Thank [you]195-monica for [your]195-monica great kindness . '[2316-he]

And thereupon [he]2316-he opened the front door for [her]195-monica . Without another look [Monica]195-monica went quickly down [the stairs]2317-the stairs ; [she]195-monica appreciated [his]2316-he motive for not accompanying [her]195-monica to the exit .

Before entering [the house]368-the house [she]195-monica had managed to conceal the sheet of music which [she]195-monica was carrying . But , happily , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was still absent . Half an hour passed half an hour of brooding and reverie before [she]195-monica heard [his]2316-he footstep ascending [the stairs]2317-the stairs . On [the landing]2320-the landing [she]195-monica met [him]2316-he with a pleasant smile .

' Have [you]2316-he enjoyed [your]2316-he drive ? '[195-monica]

' Pretty well . '[195-monica]

' And do [you]2316-he feel better ? '[195-monica]

' Not much , [dear]3530-dear . But it is n't worth talking about . '[195-monica]

Later , [he]2316-he inquired where [she]195-monica had been .

' [I]2316-he had an appointment with [Milly Vesper]234-mildred . '[2316-he]

The first falsehood [she]195-monica had ever told [him]2316-he , and yet uttered with such perfect assumption of sincerity as would have deceived [the acutest observer]2321-the acutest observer . [He]2316-he nodded , discontented as usual , but entertaining no doubt .

And from that moment [she]195-monica hated [him]2316-he . If [he]2316-he had plied [her]195-monica with interrogations , if [he]2316-he had seemed to suspect anything , the burden of untruth would have been more endurable . [His]2316-he simple acceptance of [her]195-monica word was the sternest rebuke [she]195-monica could have received . [She]195-monica despised [herself]195-monica , and hated [him]2316-he for the degradation which resulted from [his]2316-he lordship over [her]195-monica .

CHAPTER XXI

TOWARDS [THE DECISIVE

Mary Barfoot]225-mary had never suffered from lack of interest in life . Many a vivid moment dwelt in [her]195-monica memory ; joys and sorrows , personal or of larger scope , affected [her]195-monica the more deeply because of that ruling intelligence which enabled [her]195-monica to transmute them into principles . No longer anticipating or desiring any great change in [her]195-monica own environment , in the modes and motives of [her]195-monica activity , [she]195-monica found it a sufficient happiness to watch , and when possible to direct , the tendency of younger lives . So kindly had nature tempered [her]195-monica disposition , that already [she]195-monica had been able to outlive those fervours of instinct which often make the middle life of [an unwedded woman]2322-an unwedded woman one long repining ; but [her]195-monica womanly sympathies remained . And at present there was going forward under [her]195-monica own roof , within [her]195-monica daily observation , a comedy , a drama , which had power to excite all [her]195-monica disinterested emotions . It had been in progress for twelve months , and now , unless [she]195-monica was strangely mistaken , the denouement drew very near .

For all [her]195-monica self - study , [her]195-monica unflinching recognition of physical and psychical facts which [the average woman]4201-the average woman blinks over , [Mary]225-mary deceived [herself]225-mary as to the date of that final triumph which permitted [her]195-monica to observe [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda with perfect equanimity . [Her]195-monica outbreak of angry feeling on the occasion of [Bella Royston]194-isabel 's death meant something more than [she]195-monica would acknowledge before the inquisition of [her]195-monica own mind . It was just then that [she]195-monica had become aware of [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's changing attitude towards [Everard Barfoot]242-everard ; trifles such as only [a woman]615-a woman would detect had convinced [her]195-monica that [Everard]242-everard 's interest in [Rhoda]197-rhoda was awakening a serious response ; and this discovery , though it could not surprise [her]195-monica , caused an obscure pang which [she]195-monica attributed to impersonal regret , to mere natural misgiving . For some days [she]195-monica thought of [Rhoda]197-rhoda in an ironic , half - mocking spirit . Then came [Bella]194-isabel 's suicide , and the conversation in which [Rhoda]197-rhoda exhibited a seeming heartlessness , the result , undoubtedly , of grave emotional disturbance . To [her]195-monica own astonishment , [Mary]225-mary was overcome with an impulse of wrathful hostility , and spoke words which [she]195-monica regretted as soon as they had passed [her]195-monica lips .

[Poor Bella]301-poor bella had very little to do with this moment of discord between [two women who sincerely liked and admired [each other]543-each other]2325-two women who sincerely liked and admired each other . [She]195-monica only offered the occasion for an outburst of secret feeling which probably could not have been avoided . [Mary Barfoot]225-mary had loved [[her]195-monica cousin]1204-her cousin [Everard]242-everard ; it began when [he]242-everard was one - and - twenty ; [she]195-monica , so much older , had never allowed [Everard]242-everard or [any one else]4063-any one else to suspect [her]195-monica passion , which made [her]195-monica for two or three years more unhappy than [she]195-monica had ever been , or was ever to be when once [her]195-monica strong reason had prevailed . The scandal of [Amy Drake]259-amy drake , happening long after , revived [her]195-monica misery , which now took the form of truly feminine intolerance ; [she]195-monica tried to believe that [Everard]242-everard was henceforth of less than no account to [her]195-monica , that [she]195-monica detested [him]242-everard for [his]242-everard vices . [Amy Drake]259-amy drake , however , [she]195-monica detested much more .

When [her]195-monica friendship with [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda had progressed to intimacy , [she]195-monica could not refrain from speaking of [[her]195-monica cousin]1204-her cousin [Everard]242-everard , absent at [the ends of the earth]2330-the ends of the earth , and perchance lost to [her]195-monica sight for ever . [Her]195-monica mention of [him]242-everard was severe , yet of a severity so obviously blended with other feeling , that [Rhoda]197-rhoda could not but surmise the truth . Sentimental confession never entered [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's mind ; [she]195-monica had conquered [her]195-monica desires , and was by no means inclined to make [herself]195-monica ridiculous ; [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda , of [all women]1691-all women , seemed the least likely to make remarks , or put questions , such as would endanger a betrayal of the buried past . Yet , at a later time , when pressing the inquiry whether [Rhoda]197-rhoda had ever been in love , [Mary]225-mary did not scruple to suggest that [her]195-monica own knowledge in that direction was complete . [She]195-monica did it in lightness of heart , secure under the protection of [her]195-monica forty years . [Rhoda]197-rhoda , of course , understood [her]195-monica as referring to [Everard]242-everard .

So the quarrel was one of jealousy . But no sooner had it taken place when [Mary Barfoot]225-mary experienced a shame , a distress , which in truth signified the completion of self - conquest . [She]195-monica thought [herself]195-monica ashamed of being angry where anger was uncalled for ; in reality , [she]195-monica chastised [herself]195-monica for the last revival of a conflict practically over and done with so many years ago . And on this very account , precisely because [she]195-monica was deceiving [herself]195-monica as to [her]195-monica state of mind , [she]195-monica prolonged the painful situation . [She]195-monica said to [herself]195-monica that [Rhoda]197-rhoda had behaved so wrongly that displeasure was justified , that to make up the quarrel at once would be unwise , for [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda needed a little discipline . This insistence upon the side issue helped [her]195-monica to disregard the main one , and when at length [she]195-monica offered [Rhoda]197-rhoda the kiss of reconcilement , that also signified something other than was professed . It meant a hope that [Rhoda]197-rhoda might know the happiness which to [[her]195-monica friend]631-her friend had been denied .

[Everard]242-everard 's announcement of [his]242-everard passion for [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda seemed to [Mary]225-mary a well - calculated piece of boldness . If [he]242-everard seriously sought [Rhoda]197-rhoda for [[his]242-everard wife]4133-his wife , this frank avowal of the desire before [a third person]695-a third person might remove some of the peculiar difficulties of the case . Whether willing or not to be wooed , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , in mere consistency with [her]197-rhoda pronounced opinions , must needs maintain a scornful silence on the subject of [Everard]242-everard 's love - making ; by assailing this proud reserve , this dignity which perchance had begun to burden [[its]2335-its supporter]2336-its supporter , [Everard]242-everard made possible , if not inevitable , a discussion of [his]242-everard suit between [the two women]2337-the two women . [She]197-rhoda who talks of [[her]197-rhoda lover]2138-her lover will be led to think of [him]242-everard .

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot knew not whether to hope for the marriage of [this strange pair]2339-this strange pair . [She]212-miss barfoot was distrustful of [[her]212-miss barfoot cousin]1204-her cousin , found it hard to imagine [him]1204-her cousin [a loyal husband]2341-a loyal husband , and could not be sure whether [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's qualities were such as would ultimately retain or repel [him]1204-her cousin . [She]212-miss barfoot inclined to think this wooing a mere caprice . But [Rhoda]197-rhoda gave ear to [him]1204-her cousin , of that there could be little doubt ; and since [his]1204-her cousin inheritance of ample means the affair began to have a new aspect . That [Everard]242-everard persevered , though the world of [women]3478-women was now open to [him]242-everard for , on a moderate computation , [any man with [Barfoot]242-everard]2343-any man with barfoot 's personal advantages , and armed with fifteen hundred a year , may choose among [fifty possible maidens]2344-fifty possible maidens seemed to argue that [he]242-everard was really in love . But what it would cost [Rhoda]197-rhoda to appear before [[her]197-rhoda friends]1123-her friends in the character of [a bride]2346-a bride ! What a humbling of [her]197-rhoda glory !

Was [she]197-rhoda capable of the love which defies all humiliation ? Or , loving ardently , would [she]197-rhoda renounce a desired happiness from dread of female smiles and whispers ? Or would it be [her]197-rhoda sufficient satisfaction to reject [a wealthy suitor]2347-a wealthy suitor , and thus pose more grandly than ever before the circle who saw in [her]197-rhoda an example of [woman]3471-woman 's independence ? Powerful was the incitement to curiosity in a situation which , however it ended , would afford such matter for emotional hypothesis .

[They]2349-they did not talk of [Everard]242-everard . Whether [Rhoda]197-rhoda replied to [his]242-everard letters from [abroad]2350-abroad [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had no means of ascertaining . But after [his]242-everard return [he]242-everard had a very cold reception due , perhaps , to some audacity [he]242-everard had allowed [himself]242-everard in [his]242-everard correspondence . [Rhoda]197-rhoda again avoided meeting with [him]242-everard , and , as [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot noticed , threw [herself]197-rhoda with increased energy into all [her]197-rhoda old pursuits .

' What about [your]242-everard holiday this year ? '[225-mary] [Mary]225-mary asked one evening in June . ' Shall [you]242-everard go first , or shall [I]225-mary ? '[225-mary]

' Please make whatever arrangements [you]242-everard like . '[212-miss barfoot]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had a reason for wishing to postpone [her]197-rhoda holiday until late in August . [She]212-miss barfoot said so , and proposed that [Rhoda]197-rhoda should take any three weeks [she]197-rhoda liked prior to that .

' [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper , '[212-miss barfoot] [she]212-miss barfoot added , ' can manage [[your]242-everard room]5367-your room very well . [We]2351-we shall be much more at ease in that respect than last year . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Yes . [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper is getting to be very useful and trustworthy . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda mused when [she]197-rhoda had made this remark .

' Do [you]235-miss vesper know , '[212-miss barfoot] [she]212-miss barfoot asked presently , ' whether [she]235-miss vesper sees much of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? '[212-miss barfoot]

' [I]212-miss barfoot have no idea . '[212-miss barfoot]

[They]2351-we decided that [Rhoda]197-rhoda should go away at the close of July . Where was [her]197-rhoda holiday to be spent ? [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot suggested [the lake country]2352-the lake country .

' [I]197-rhoda was thinking of it [myself]197-rhoda , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda . ' [I]197-rhoda should like to have some sea - bathing , though . A week by [the shore]3760-the shore , and then the rest of the time spent in vagabondage among [the mountains]5369-the mountains , would suit [me]197-rhoda very well . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove is at [home]364-home in [Cumberland]86-cumberland ; [I]197-rhoda must ask [her]277-mrs. cosgrove advice . '[197-rhoda]

This was done , and there resulted a scheme which seemed to excite [Rhoda]197-rhoda with joyous anticipation . On [the coast of [Cumberland]86-cumberland]2353-the coast of cumberland , [a few miles south of [St. Bees]135-st. bees]2354-a few miles south of st. bees , is [a little place called [Seascale]137-seascale]2355-a little place called seascale , unknown to [the ordinary tourist]2356-the ordinary tourist , but with [a good hotel]2357-a good hotel and [a few scattered houses where lodgings]2358-a few scattered houses where lodgings can be obtained . Not far away rise [the mountain barriers of [lake - land]2360-lake - land]2359-the mountain barriers of lake - land , [Wastdale]149-wastdale clearly discernible . At [Seascale]137-seascale , then , [Rhoda]197-rhoda would spend [her]197-rhoda first week , the quiet shore with [[its]2361-its fine stretch of sand]2362-its fine stretch of sand affording [her]197-rhoda just the retreat that [she]197-rhoda desired .

' There are one or two bathing - machines , [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove says , but [I]149-wastdale hope to avoid such abominations . How delicious it was in [one]472-one 's childhood , when [one]472-one ran into [the sea]417-the sea naked ! [I]149-wastdale will enjoy that sensation once more , if [I]149-wastdale have to get up at three in the morning . '[149-wastdale]

About this time [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot made one of [his]2363-he evening calls . [He]2363-he had no hope of seeing [Rhoda]197-rhoda , and was agreeably surprised by [her]197-rhoda presence in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room . Just as happened a year ago , the subject of [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot making a direct inquiry . With lively interest , [Mary]225-mary waited for the reply , and was careful not to smile when [Rhoda]197-rhoda made known [her]197-rhoda intentions .

' Have [you]212-miss barfoot planned a route after [your]212-miss barfoot stay at [Seascale]137-seascale ? '[225-mary] [Barfoot]225-mary asked .

' No . [I]2363-he shall do that when [I]2363-he am [there]453-there . '[2363-he]

Whether or not [he]2363-he intended a contrast to these homely projects , [Barfoot]225-mary presently began to talk of travel on a grander scale . When [he]225-mary next left [England]58-england , [he]225-mary should go by [the Orient Express]138-the orient express right away to [Constantinople]65-constantinople . [[His]225-mary cousin]1165-his cousin asked questions about [the Orient Express]138-the orient express , and [he]225-mary supplied [her]1165-his cousin with details very exciting to the imagination of [any one who longs to see [the kingdoms of [the earth]4215-the earth]2367-the kingdoms of the earth as undoubtedly [Rhoda]197-rhoda did]2366-any one who longs to see the kingdoms of the earth as undoubtedly rhoda did . The very name , [Orient Express]138-the orient express , has a certain sublimity , such as attaches , more or less , to all the familiar nomenclature of world - transits . [He]225-mary talked [himself]225-mary into fervour , and kept a watch on [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's countenance . As also did [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . [Rhoda]197-rhoda tried to appear unaffected , but [her]197-rhoda coldness betrayed its insincerity .

The next day , when work at [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street was just finished , [she]197-rhoda fell into conversation with [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had an engagement to dine out that evening , and [Rhoda]197-rhoda ended by inviting [Milly]234-mildred to come [home]364-home with [her]197-rhoda to [Chelsea]19-chelsea . To [Milly]234-mildred this was a great honour ; [she]234-mildred hesitated because of [her]234-mildred very plain dress , but easily allowed [herself]234-mildred to be persuaded when [she]234-mildred saw that [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda really desired [her]197-rhoda company .

Before dinner [they]2370-they had a walk in [Battersea Park]20-battersea park . [Rhoda]197-rhoda had never been so frank and friendly ; [she]197-rhoda induced [the quiet , unpretending girl]2371-the quiet , unpretending girl to talk of [her]197-rhoda early days , [[her]197-rhoda schools]2372-her schools , [[her]197-rhoda family]2373-her family . Remarkable was [Milly]234-mildred 's quiet contentedness ; not long ago [she]234-mildred had received an increase of payment from [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , and [one]472-one would have judged that scarcely a wish now troubled [her]234-mildred , unless it were that [she]234-mildred might see [[her]234-mildred scattered brothers]2375-her scattered brothers and [sisters]1111-sisters , all of whom , happily , were doing pretty well in the struggle for existence .

' [You]197-rhoda must feel rather lonely in [[your]197-rhoda lodgings]565-your lodgings sometimes ? '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda .

' Very rarely . In future [I]197-rhoda shall have music in the evening . [[Our]5376-our best room]5377-our best room has been let to [a young man]5044-a young man who has a violin , and [he]5044-a young man plays " The Blue Bells of [Scotland]141-scotland " not badly . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda did not miss the humorous intention , veiled , as usual , under a manner of extreme sedateness .

' Does [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson come to see [you]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Not often . [She]265-mrs. widdowson came a few days ago . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]197-rhoda go to [[her]265-mrs. widdowson house]3584-her house sometimes ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda have n't been [there]453-there for several months . At first [I]197-rhoda used to go rather frequently , but it 's a long way . '[197-rhoda]

To this subject [Rhoda]197-rhoda returned after dinner , when [they]2377-they were cosily settled in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room .

' [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson comes [here]3495-here now and then , and [we]2377-they are always very glad to see [her]265-mrs. widdowson . But [I]197-rhoda ca n't help thinking [she]265-mrs. widdowson looks rather unhappy . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] afraid [she]2379-she does , ' assented [the other gravely]5382-the other gravely .[197-rhoda]

' [You]197-rhoda and [I]197-rhoda were both at [her]265-mrs. widdowson wedding . It was n't very cheerful , was it ? [I]197-rhoda had a disagreeable sense of bad omens all the time . Do [you]197-rhoda think [she]2379-she is sorry ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda 'm[197-rhoda] really afraid [she]2379-she is . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda observed the look that accompanied this admission .

' [Foolish girl]5383-foolish girl ! Why could n't [she]2379-she stay with [us]2377-they , and keep [her]2379-she liberty ? [She]2379-she does n't seem to have made [any new friends]3801-any new friends . Has [she]2379-she spoken to [you]197-rhoda of any ? '[197-rhoda]

' Only of people [she]2379-she has met [here]3495-here . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda yielded or seemed to yield to an impulse of frankness . Bending slightly forward , with an anxious expression , [she]197-rhoda said in confidential tones

' Can [you]197-rhoda help to put [my]197-rhoda mind at rest about [Monica]195-monica ? [You]197-rhoda saw [her]2379-she a week ago . Did [she]2379-she say anything , or give any sign , that might make one really uneasy on [her]2379-she account ? '[197-rhoda]

There was a struggle in [Milly]234-mildred before [she]234-mildred answered . [Rhoda]197-rhoda added

' Perhaps [you]197-rhoda had rather not '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda had rather tell [you]197-rhoda . [She]2379-she said a good many strange things , and [I]197-rhoda have been uneasy about [her]2379-she . [I]197-rhoda wished [I]197-rhoda could speak to [some one]735-some one '[197-rhoda]

' How strange that [I]197-rhoda should feel urged to ask [you]197-rhoda about this , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , [her]197-rhoda eyes , peculiarly bright and keen , fixed on [the girl]384-the girl 's face . ' [The poor thing]5387-the poor thing is very miserable , [I]197-rhoda am sure . [[Her]2379-she husband]4145-her husband seems to leave [her]2379-she entirely to [herself]2379-she . '[197-rhoda]

[Milly]234-mildred looked surprised .

' [Monica]195-monica made quite the opposite complaint to [me]197-rhoda . [She]195-monica said that was [a prisoner]5389-a prisoner . '[197-rhoda]

' That 's very odd . [She]195-monica certainly goes about a good deal and alone . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]234-mildred did n't know that , '[234-mildred] said [Milly]234-mildred . ' [She]195-monica has very often talked to [me]234-mildred about [a woman]615-a woman 's right to the same freedom as [a man]3627-a man , and [I]234-mildred always understood that [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson objected to [her]195-monica going anywhere without [him]217-widdowson , except just to call [here]3495-here , or at [[my]234-mildred lodgings]5393-my lodgings . '[234-mildred]

' Do [you]197-rhoda think [she]195-monica has any acquaintance that [he]217-widdowson dislikes ? '[197-rhoda]

The direct answer was delayed , but it came at length .

' There is [some one]735-some one . [She]195-monica has n't told [me]197-rhoda who it is . '[197-rhoda]

' In plain words , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson thinks [he]217-widdowson has cause for jealousy ? '[234-mildred]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda understand [Monica]195-monica to mean that . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's face had grown very dark . [She]197-rhoda moved [her]197-rhoda hands nervously .

' But [you]197-rhoda do n't think [she]195-monica could deceive [him]217-widdowson ? '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , [I]235-miss vesper ca n't think that ! '[235-miss vesper] replied [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper , with much earnestness . ' But what [I]235-miss vesper could n't help fearing , after [I]235-miss vesper saw [her]195-monica last , was that [she]195-monica might almost be tempted to leave [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . [She]195-monica spoke so much of freedom and of [a woman]615-a woman 's right to release [herself]195-monica if [she]195-monica found [her]195-monica marriage was a mistake . '[235-miss vesper]

' [I]197-rhoda am so grateful to [you]197-rhoda for telling [me]197-rhoda all this . [We]5397-we must try to help [her]195-monica . Of course [I]197-rhoda will make no mention of [you]197-rhoda , [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper . Then [you]197-rhoda are really under the impression that there 's some one [she]195-monica prefers to [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]235-miss vesper ca n't help thinking there is , '[235-miss vesper] admitted the other very solemnly . ' [I]235-miss vesper was so sorry for [her]195-monica , and felt so powerless . [She]195-monica cried a little . All [I]235-miss vesper could do was to entreat [her]195-monica not to behave rashly . [I]235-miss vesper thought [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister ought to know '[235-miss vesper]

' Oh , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden is useless . [Monica]195-monica can not look to [her]195-monica for advice or support . '[197-rhoda]

After this conversation [Rhoda]197-rhoda passed a very unquiet night , and gloom appeared in [her]197-rhoda countenance for the next few days .

[She]197-rhoda wished to have a private interview with [Monica]195-monica , but doubted whether it would in any degree serve [her]197-rhoda purpose that of discovering whether certain suspicions [she]197-rhoda entertained had actual ground . Confidence between [her]197-rhoda and [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had never existed , and in the present state of things [she]197-rhoda could not hope to probe [Monica]195-monica 's secret feelings . Whilst [she]197-rhoda still brooded over the difficulty there came a letter for [her]197-rhoda from [Everard Barfoot]242-everard . [He]242-everard wrote formally ; it had occurred to [him]242-everard that [he]242-everard might be of some slight service , in view of [her]197-rhoda approaching holiday , if [he]242-everard looked through the guide - books , and jotted down the outline of such a walking - tour as [she]197-rhoda had in mind . This [he]242-everard had done , and the results were written out on an enclosed sheet of paper . [Rhoda]197-rhoda allowed a day to intervene , then sent a reply . [She]197-rhoda thanked [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot sincerely for the trouble [he]249-mr. barfoot had so kindly taken . ' [I]197-rhoda see [you]249-mr. barfoot limit [me]197-rhoda to ten miles a day . In such scenery of course one does n't hurry on , but [I]197-rhoda ca n't help informing [you]249-mr. barfoot that twenty miles would n't alarm [me]197-rhoda . [I]197-rhoda think it very likely that [I]197-rhoda shall follow [your]249-mr. barfoot itinerary , after [my]197-rhoda week of bathing and idling . [I]197-rhoda leave on Monday week . '[197-rhoda]

[Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot did not call again . Every evening [she]197-rhoda sat in expectation of [his]249-mr. barfoot coming . Twice [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was away until a late hour , and on those occasions , after dinner , [Rhoda]197-rhoda sat in complete idleness , [her]197-rhoda face declaring the troubled nature of ' [her]197-rhoda thoughts . On the Sunday before [her]197-rhoda departure [she]197-rhoda took a sudden resolve and went to call upon [Monica]195-monica at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill .[197-rhoda]

[Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , [she]197-rhoda learnt from [the servant]791-the servant , had left [home]364-home about an hour since .

' Is [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson at [home]364-home ? '[249-mr. barfoot]

Yes , [he]249-mr. barfoot was . And [Rhoda]197-rhoda waited for some time in [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room until [he]249-mr. barfoot made [his]249-mr. barfoot appearance . Of late [Widdowson]217-widdowson had grown so careless in the matter of toilet , that an unexpected visit obliged [him]249-mr. barfoot to hurry through a change of apparel before [he]249-mr. barfoot could present [himself]249-mr. barfoot . Looking upon [him]249-mr. barfoot for the first time for several months , [Rhoda]197-rhoda saw that misery was undermining [the man]350-the man 's health . Words could not have declared [his]249-mr. barfoot trouble more plainly than the haggard features and stiff , depressed , self - conscious manner . [He]249-mr. barfoot fixed [his]249-mr. barfoot sunken eyes upon [the visitor]439-the visitor , and smiled , as was plain , only for civility 's sake . [Rhoda]197-rhoda did [her]197-rhoda best to seem at ease ; [she]197-rhoda explained standing , for [he]249-mr. barfoot forgot to ask [her]197-rhoda to be seated that [she]197-rhoda was going away on the morrow , and had hoped to see [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , who , [she]197-rhoda was told , had not been very well of late .

' No , [she]197-rhoda is not in very good health , '[265-mrs. widdowson] said [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson vaguely . ' [She]197-rhoda has gone this afternoon to [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's [I]265-mrs. widdowson think [you]197-rhoda know [her]197-rhoda . '[265-mrs. widdowson]

Less encouragement to remain could not have been offered , but [Rhoda]197-rhoda conceived a hope of hearing something significant if [she]197-rhoda persevered in conversation . The awkwardness of doing so was indifferent to [her]197-rhoda .

' Shall [you]2386-i be leaving [town]624-town shortly , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson ? '[2386-i]

' [We]5402-we are not quite sure But pray sit down , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . [You]2386-i have n't seen [[my]2386-i wife]4104-my wife lately ? '[2386-i]

[He]2386-i took a chair , and rested [his]2386-i hands upon [his]2386-i knees , gazing at [the visitor]439-the visitor 's skirt .

' [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson has n't been to see [us]5402-we for more than a month if [I]2386-i remember rightly . '[2386-i]

[His]2386-i look expressed both surprise and doubt .

' A month ? But [I]2386-i thought [I]2386-i had an idea that [she]4104-my wife went only a few days ago . '[2386-i]

' In the day time ? '[197-rhoda]

' To [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street , [I]2386-i mean to hear a lecture , or something of that kind , by [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . '[2386-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda kept silence for a moment . Then [she]197-rhoda replied hastily

' Oh yes very likely [I]197-rhoda was n't [there]453-there that afternoon . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]2386-i see . That would explain '[2386-i]

[He]2386-i seemed relieved , but only for the instant ; then [his]2386-i eyes glanced hither and thither , with painful restlessness . [Rhoda]197-rhoda observed [him]2386-i closely . After fidgeting with [his]2386-i feet , [he]2386-i suddenly took a stiff position , and said in a louder voice

' [We]5402-we are going to leave [London]6-london altogether . [I]2386-i have decided to take a house at [[[my]2386-i wife]4104-my wife 's native place]5406-my wife 's native place , [Clevedon]1-clevedon . [[Her]2388-her sisters]516-her sisters will come and live with [us]5402-we . '[2386-i]

' That is a recent decision , [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson ? '[2386-i]

' [I]2386-i have thought about it for some time . [London]6-london does n't suit [Monica]195-monica 's health ; [I]2386-i 'm[2386-i] sure it does n't . [She]2388-her will be much better in [the country]3602-the country . '[2386-i]

' Yes , [I]2386-i think that very likely . '[2386-i]

' As [you]2386-i say that [you]2386-i have noticed [her]2388-her changed looks , [I]2390-you shall lose no time in getting away . '[2390-you] [He]2390-you made a great show of determined energy . ' A few weeks . [We]5402-we will go down to [Clevedon]1-clevedon at once and find [a house]902-a house . Yes , [we]5402-we will go to - morrow , or the day after . [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , also , is very far from well . [I]2390-you wish [I]2390-you had n't delayed so long . '[2390-you]

' [You]2390-you are doing very wisely , [I]2386-i think . [I]2386-i had meant to suggest something of this kind to [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . Perhaps , if [I]2386-i went at once to [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's , [I]2386-i might be fortunate enough to find [her]2388-her still [there]453-there ? '[2386-i]

' [You]2390-you might . Did [I]2390-you understand [you]2390-you to say that [you]2390-you go away tomorrow ? For three weeks . Ah , then [we]5410-we may be getting ready to remove when [you]2390-you come back . '[2390-you]

The change that had come over [him]2391-him was remarkable . [He]2391-him could not keep [his]2391-him seat , and began to pace the end of [the room]444-the room . Seeing no possibility of prolonging the talk for [her]2393-her own purposes , [Rhoda]197-rhoda accepted this dismissal , and with the briefest leave - taking went [her]197-rhoda way to [[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's]2394-mrs. cosgrove 's .

[She]197-rhoda was deeply agitated . [Monica]195-monica had not attended that lecture of [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's , and so , it was evident , had purposely deceived [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . To what end ? Where were those hours spent ? [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred 's report supplied grounds for sombre conjecture , and the incident at [Sloane Square Station]142-sloane square station , the recollection of [Monica]195-monica and [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot absorbed in talk , seemed to have a possible significance which fired [Rhoda]197-rhoda with resentment .

[Her]195-monica arrival at [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's was too late . [Monica]195-monica had been [there]453-there said [the hostess]903-the hostess , but had left nearly half an hour ago .

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's instant desire was to go on to [Bayswater]77-bayswater , and somehow keep watch near [the flats where [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot lived]2398-the flats where barfoot lived . [Monica]195-monica might be there . [Her]195-monica coming forth from [the building]1065-the building might be detected .

But the difficulty of the understanding , and , still more , a dread of being seen hovering about [that quarter]2400-that quarter , checked [her]195-monica purpose as soon as it was formed . [She]195-monica returned [home]364-home , and for an hour or two kept in solitude .

' What has happened ? '[212-miss barfoot] asked [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , when [they]2402-they at length met .

' Happened ? Nothing that [I]212-miss barfoot know of . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [You]212-miss barfoot look very strange . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [Your]212-miss barfoot imagination . [I]212-miss barfoot have been packing ; perhaps it 's from stooping over the trunk . '[212-miss barfoot]

This by no means satisfied [Mary]225-mary , who felt that things mysterious were going on about [her]2403-she . But [she]2403-she could only wait , repeating to [herself]2403-she that the grand denouement decidedly was not far off .

At nine o'clock sounded [the visitor]439-the visitor 's bell . If , as [she]195-monica thought likely , [the caller]2405-the caller was [Everard]242-everard , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot decided that [she]195-monica would disregard everything but the dramatic pressure of the moment , and leave [those two]2406-those two alone together for half an hour . [Everard]242-everard it was ; [he]242-everard entered [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room with an unusual air of gaiety .

' [I]242-everard have been in [the country]3602-the country all day , '[242-everard] were [his]242-everard first words ; and [he]242-everard went on to talk of trivial things the doings of a Cockney excursion party that had come under [his]242-everard notice .

In a few minutes [Mary]225-mary made an excuse for absenting [herself]225-mary . When [she]2403-she was gone , [Rhoda]197-rhoda looked steadily at [Barfoot]242-everard , and asked

' Have [you]242-everard really been out of [town]624-town ? '[197-rhoda]

' Why should [you]242-everard doubt it ? '[197-rhoda]

' As [I]197-rhoda told [you]242-everard .[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda averted [her]197-rhoda look . After examining [her]197-rhoda curiously , [Everard]242-everard came and stood before [her]197-rhoda .

' [I]242-everard want to ask [your]197-rhoda leave to meet [you]197-rhoda somewhere during these next three weeks . At any point on [your]197-rhoda route . [We]5413-we could have a day 's ramble together , and then say good - bye . '[242-everard]

' [The lake country]2352-the lake country is free to [you]242-everard , [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . '[197-rhoda]

' But [I]242-everard must n't miss [you]242-everard . [You]242-everard will leave [Seascale]137-seascale to - morrow week ? '[242-everard]

' At present [I]197-rhoda think so . But [I]197-rhoda ca n't restrict [myself]197-rhoda by any agreement . Holiday must be a time of liberty . '[197-rhoda]

[They]2408-they looked at [each other]543-each other [she]197-rhoda with a carelessness which was all but defiance , [he]242-everard with a significant smile .

' To - morrow week , then , perhaps [we]2408-they may meet again . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda made no reply , beyond a movement of [her]197-rhoda eyebrows , as if to express indifference .

' [I]197-rhoda wo n't stay longer this evening . A pleasant journey to [you]197-rhoda ! '[197-rhoda]

[He]242-everard shook hands , and left [the room]444-the room . In [the hall]2087-the hall [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot came to meet [him]242-everard ; [they]2408-they exchanged a few words , unimportant and without reference to what had passed between [him]242-everard and [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Nor did [Rhoda]197-rhoda speak of the matter when joined by [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend . [She]212-miss barfoot retired early , having settled all the arrangements for [her]212-miss barfoot departure by the ten o'clock express from [Euston]143-euston next morning .

[Her]212-miss barfoot luggage was to consist of one trunk and a wallet with a strap , which would serve the purposes of [a man]3627-a man 's knapsack . Save the indispensable umbrella , [she]212-miss barfoot carried no impeding trifles . A new costume , suitable for [shore and mountain]2414-shore and mountain , was packed away in the trunk ; [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had judged of its effect , and was of opinion that it became [the wearer]2415-the wearer admirably .

But [Rhoda]197-rhoda , having adjusted everything that [she]197-rhoda was going to take with [her]197-rhoda , still had an occupation which kept [her]197-rhoda up for several hours . From a locked drawer [she]197-rhoda brought forth packets of letters , the storage of many years , and out of these selected carefully perhaps a tithe , which [she]197-rhoda bound together and deposited in a box ; the remainder [she]197-rhoda burnt in the empty fireplace . Moreover , [she]197-rhoda collected from about [the room]444-the room a number of little objects , ornaments and things of use , which also found a place in the same big box . All [her]197-rhoda personal property which had any value for [her]197-rhoda , except books , was finally under lock and key , and in portable repositories . But still [she]197-rhoda kept moving , as if in search of trifles that might have escaped [her]197-rhoda notice ; silently , in [her]197-rhoda soft slippers , [she]197-rhoda strayed hither and thither , till the short summer night had all but given place to dawn ; and when at length weariness compelled [her]197-rhoda to go to bed , [she]197-rhoda was not able to sleep .

Nor did [Mary Barfoot]225-mary enjoy much sleep that night . [She]197-rhoda lay thinking , and forecasting strange possibilities .

On Monday evening , returned from [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street , the first thing [she]197-rhoda did was to visit [[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's chamber]2417-rhoda 's chamber . The ashes of burnt paper had been cleared away , but a glance informed [her]197-rhoda of the needless and unprecedented care with which [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda had collected and packed most of the things that belonged to [her]197-rhoda . Again [Mary]225-mary had a troubled night .

CHAPTER XXII

HONOUR IN [DIFFICULTIES]144-difficulties

At [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's , this Sunday afternoon , [Monica]195-monica had eyes and thoughts for [one person]756-one person only . [Her]195-monica coming at all was practically an appointment to meet [Bevis]288-bevis , whom [she]195-monica had seen twice since [her]195-monica visit to [the flat]5334-the flat . A day or two after that occasion , [she]195-monica received a call from [[the Bevis]288-bevis girls]2420-the bevis girls , who told [her]195-monica of [[their]2420-the bevis girls brother]5036-their brother 's approaching departure for [Bordeaux]133-bordeaux , and thereupon [she]195-monica invited [the trio]2422-the trio to dine with [her]195-monica . A fortnight subsequently to the dinner [she]195-monica had a chance encounter with [Bevis]288-bevis in [Oxford Street]145-oxford street ; constraint of business did not allow [him]5036-their brother to walk beside [her]195-monica for more than a minute or two , but [they]2420-the bevis girls spoke of [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's on the following Sunday , and there , accordingly , found [each other]543-each other .

Tremor of self - consciousness kept [Monica]195-monica in dread of being watched and suspected . [Few people]2424-few people were present to - day , and after exchanging formal words with [Bevis]288-bevis , [she]195-monica moved away to talk with [the hostess]903-the hostess . Not till half an hour had passed did [she]195-monica venture to obey the glances which [[her]195-monica all but avowed lover]2426-her all but avowed lover cast towards [her]195-monica in conversation . [He]5036-their brother was so much at ease , so like what [she]195-monica had always known [him]5036-their brother , that [Monica]195-monica asked [herself]195-monica whether [she]195-monica had not mistaken the meaning of [his]5036-their brother homage . One moment [she]195-monica hoped it might be so ; the next , [she]195-monica longed for some sign of passionate devotion , and thought with anguish of the day , now so near , when [he]5036-their brother would be gone for ever . This , [she]195-monica ardently believed , was [the man who should have been [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband]2427-the man who should have been her husband . [Him]5036-their brother [she]195-monica could love with heart and soul , could make [his]5036-their brother will [her]195-monica absolute law , could live on [his]5036-their brother smiles , could devote [herself]195-monica to [his]5036-their brother interests . The independence [she]195-monica had been struggling to assert ever since [her]195-monica marriage meant only freedom to love . If [she]195-monica had understood [herself]195-monica as [she]195-monica now did , [her]195-monica life would never have been thus cast into bondage .

' [The girls]375-the girls , '[288-bevis] [Bevis]288-bevis was saying , ' leave on Thursday . The rest of the week [I]288-bevis shall be alone . On Monday the furniture will be stowed away at [the Pantechnicon]146-the pantechnicon , and on Tuesday off [I]288-bevis go . '[288-bevis]

[A casual listener]2429-a casual listener could have supposed that the prospect pleased [him]5036-their brother . [Monica]195-monica , with a fixed smile , looked at [the other groups conversing in the room]2430-the other groups conversing in the room ; [no one]3554-no one was paying any attention to [her]195-monica . In the same moment [she]195-monica heard a murmur from [[her]195-monica companion]812-her companion 's lips ; [he]5036-their brother was speaking still , but in a voice only just audible .

' Come on Friday afternoon about four o'clock . '[5036-their brother]

[Her]195-monica heart began to throb painfully , and [she]195-monica knew that a treacherous colour had risen to [her]195-monica checks .

' Do come once more for the last time . It shall be just as before just as before . An hour 's talk , and [we]2433-their will say good - bye to [each other]543-each other . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica was powerless to breathe a word . [Bevis]288-bevis , noticing that [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove had thrown a look in [their]2433-their direction , suddenly laughed as if at some jest between [them]2433-their , and resumed [his]5036-their brother lively strain of talk . [Monica]195-monica also laughed . An interval of make - believe , and again the soft murmur fell upon [her]195-monica ear .

' [I]5036-their brother shall expect [you]557-a stranger . [I]5036-their brother know [you]557-a stranger wo n't refuse [me]5036-their brother this one last kindness . Some day , '[5036-their brother] [his]5036-their brother voice was all but extinguished , ' some day who knows ? '[5036-their brother]

Dreadful hope struck through [her]195-monica . [A stranger]557-a stranger 's eyes turned [their]2433-their way , and again [she]195-monica laughed .

' On Friday , at four . [I]195-monica shall expect [you]5036-their brother . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica rose , looked for an instant about [the room]444-the room , then offered [him]5036-their brother [her]195-monica hand , uttering some commonplace word of leave - taking . [Their]2433-their eyes did not meet . [She]195-monica went up to [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove , and as soon as possible left [the house]368-the house .

[Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson met [her]195-monica as [she]195-monica crossed the threshold of [home]364-home . [His]5036-their brother face told [her]195-monica that something extraordinary had happened , and [she]195-monica trembled before [him]5036-their brother .

' Back already ? '[5036-their brother] [he]5036-their brother exclaimed , with a grim smile . ' Be quick , and take [your]195-monica things off , and come to [the library]3604-the library . '[5036-their brother]

If [he]5036-their brother had discovered anything the lie , for instance , that [she]195-monica told [him]5036-their brother a month ago , or that more recent falsehood when [she]195-monica pretended , without serious reason , to have been at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's lecture , [he]5036-their brother would not look and speak thus . Hurrying , panting , [she]195-monica made a change of dress , and obeyed [his]5036-their brother summons .

' [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda has been [here]3495-here , '[5036-their brother] were [his]5036-their brother first words .

[She]195-monica turned pale as death . Of course [he]5036-their brother observed it ; [she]195-monica was now preparing for anything .

' [She]197-rhoda wanted to see [you]5036-their brother because [she]197-rhoda is going away on Monday . What 's the matter ? '[2438-i]

' Nothing . [You]5036-their brother spoke so strangely '[2438-i]

' Did [I]2438-i ? And [you]5036-their brother look very strangely . [I]2438-i do n't understand [you]5036-their brother . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda says that [everybody]5321-everybody has noticed how ill [you]5036-their brother seem . It 's time [we]5420-we did something . To - morrow morning [we]5420-we are going down into [Somerset]36-somerset , to [Clevedon]1-clevedon , to find [a house]902-a house . '[2438-i]

' [I]2438-i thought [you]2438-i had given up that idea . '[2438-i]

' Whether [I]2438-i had or not does n't matter . '[2438-i]

In the determination to appear , and be , energetic , [he]2438-i spoke with a rough obstinacy , a doggedness that now and then became violence . ' [I]2438-i am decided on it now . There 's [a train]4900-a train to [Bristol]25-bristol at ten - twenty . [You]5036-their brother will pack just a few things ; [we]5420-we sha n't be away for more than a day or two . '[2438-i]

Tuesday , Wednesday , Thursday By Friday [they]2439-they might be back . Till now , in an anguish of uncertainty , [Monica]195-monica had made up [her]195-monica mind . [She]195-monica would keep the appointment on Friday , come of it what might . If [she]195-monica could not be back in time , [she]195-monica would write a letter .

' Why are [you]2438-i talking in this tone ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said coldly .

' What tone ? [I]195-monica am telling [you]2438-i what [I]195-monica have decided to do , that 's all . [I]195-monica shall easily find [a house down there]5423-a house down there , no doubt . Knowing [the place]1355-the place , [you]2438-i will be able to suggest [the likely localities]5425-the likely localities . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica sat down , for strength was failing [her]195-monica .

' It 's quite true , '[265-mrs. widdowson] [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson went on , staring at [her]195-monica with inflamed eyes . ' [You]195-monica are beginning to look like a ghost . Oh , [we]5426-we 'll have an end of this ! '[265-mrs. widdowson] [He]2440-you cackled in angry laughter . ' Not a day 's unnecessary delay ! Write to both [[your]195-monica sisters]3566-your sisters this evening and tell [them]3566-your sisters . [I]2440-you wish [them]3566-your sisters both to come and live with [us]5426-we . '[2440-you]

' Very well . '[195-monica]

' Now , wo n't [you]2440-you be glad ? Wo n't it be better in every way ? '[2440-you]

[He]2440-you came so near that [she]195-monica felt [his]2440-you feverish breath .

' [I]195-monica told [you]2440-you before , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica answered , ' to do just as [you]2440-you liked . '[195-monica]

' And [you]2440-you wo n't talk about being kept [a prisoner]5389-a prisoner ? '[2440-you]

[Monica]195-monica laughed .

' Oh no , [I]195-monica wo n't say anything at all . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica scarcely knew what words fell from [her]195-monica lips . Let [him]2440-you propose , let [him]2440-you do what [he]2440-you liked ; to [her]195-monica it was indifferent . [She]195-monica saw something before [her]195-monica something [she]195-monica durst not , even an hour ago , have steadily contemplated ; it drew [her]195-monica with the force of fate .

' [You]2440-you know [we]5429-we could n't go on living like this do n't [you]2440-you , [Monica]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

' No , [we]5429-we could n't . '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica see ! '[2440-you] [He]2440-you almost shouted in triumph , misled by the smile on [her]195-monica face . ' All that was needed was resolution on [my]2440-you part . [I]2440-you have been absurdly weak , and weakness in [the husband]1667-the husband means unhappiness in [the wife]2254-the wife . From today [you]195-monica look to [me]2440-you for guidance . [I]2440-you am [no tyrant]5432-no tyrant , but [I]2440-you shall rule [you]195-monica for [your]195-monica own good . '[2440-you]

Still [she]195-monica smiled .

' So there 's an end of [our]5429-we misery is n't it , [darling]3629-darling ? What misery ! Good [God]218-god the father , how [I]195-monica have suffered ! Have n't [you]195-monica known it ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica have known it too well . '[195-monica]

' And now [you]195-monica will make up to [me]195-monica for it , [Monica]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

Again prompted by the irresistible force , [she]195-monica answered mechanically ,

' [I]195-monica will do the best for [both]525-both . '[195-monica]

[He]2441-my threw [himself]2441-my on the ground beside [her]195-monica and clasped [her]195-monica in [his]2441-my arms .

' No , that is [[my]2441-my own dear wife]5435-my own dear wife once more ! [Your]195-monica face has altogether changed . See how right it is that [a husband]3844-a husband should take the law into [his]3844-a husband own hands ! [Our]5437-we second year of marriage shall be very different from the first . And yet [we]5437-we were happy , were n't [we]5437-we , [[my]2441-my beautiful]5438-my beautiful ? [Poor little girl]5441-poor little girl ! [[My]2441-my poor darling]5442-my poor darling ! '[2441-my]

Through the evening [he]2442-he was in a state of transport , due partly to the belief that [Monica]195-monica really welcomed [his]2442-he decision , partly to the sense of having behaved at length like [a resolute man]2443-a resolute man . [His]2442-he eyes were severely bloodshot , and before bedtime headache racked [him]2442-he intolerably .

Everything was carried out as [he]2442-he had planned it . [They]2444-they journeyed down into [Somerset]36-somerset , put up at [a Clevedon hotel]2445-a clevedon hotel , and began [house]5043-house - hunting . On Wednesday [the suitable abode]2447-the suitable abode was discovered [a house of modest pretensions]2448-a house of modest pretensions , but roomy and well situated . [It]2448-a house of modest pretensions could be made ready for occupation in a fortnight . Bent on continuing [his]2442-he exhibition of vigorous promptitude , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson signed a lease that same evening .

' To - morrow [we]2444-they will go straight [home]364-home and make [our]2444-they preparations for removal . '[2442-he] [He]2442-he laughed fatuously . ' Do n't listen to any objection . When [you]195-monica have once got [her]3611-your sister away [she]3611-your sister will thank [you]195-monica . '[2442-he]

By Thursday afternoon [they]2449-they were back at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson still kept up the show of extravagant spirits , but [he]2442-he was worn out . [He]2442-he spoke so hoarsely that [one]472-one would have thought [he]2442-he had contracted a severe sore throat ; it resulted merely from nervous strain . After a pretence of dinner , [he]2442-he seated [himself]2442-he as if to read ; glancing at [him]2442-he a few minutes later , [Monica]195-monica found that [he]2442-he was fast asleep .

[She]195-monica could not bear to gaze at [him]2442-he , yet [her]195-monica eyes turned thither again and again . [His]2442-he face was repulsive to [her]195-monica ; the deep furrows , the red eyelids , the mottled skin moved [her]195-monica to loathing . And yet [she]195-monica pitied [him]2442-he . [His]2442-he frantic exultation was the cruelest irony . What would [he]2442-he do ? What would become of [him]2442-he ? [She]195-monica turned away , and presently left [the room]444-the room , for the sound of [his]2442-he uneasy breathing made [her]195-monica suffer too much .

When [he]2442-he woke up , [he]2442-he came in search of [her]195-monica , and laughed over [his]2442-he involuntary nap .

' Well , now , [you]2442-he will go and see [[your]2442-he sister]3611-your sister to - morrow morning . '[2442-he]

' In the afternoon , [I]2442-he think . '[2442-he]

[He]2442-he caressed [her]195-monica .

' No , no . '[2442-he]

It was Friday . All the morning [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had business with [house agents]2452-house agents and [furniture removers]2453-furniture removers , for [he]2442-he would not let a day go by without some practical step towards release from the life [he]2442-he detested . [Monica]195-monica seemed to be equally active in [[her]195-monica own department]2454-her own department ; [she]195-monica was turning out drawers and wardrobes , and making selection of things on some principle understood by [herself]195-monica . A flush remained upon [her]195-monica cheeks , in marked contrast to the pallor which for a long time had given [her]195-monica an appearance of wasting away . That and [her]195-monica singularly bright eyes endowed [her]195-monica with beauty suggestive of what [she]195-monica might have gained in happy marriage .

[They]2455-they had luncheon at one o'clock , and at a quarter to two [Monica]195-monica started by [train]3815-train for [Clapham Junction]51-clapham junction . It was [her]195-monica purpose to have a short conversation with [Virginia]191-virginia , who knew of the trip to [Clevedon]1-clevedon , and to speak as though [she]195-monica were quite reconciled to the thought of removal ; after that , [she]195-monica would pursue [her]195-monica journey so as to reach [Bayswater]77-bayswater by four o'clock . But [Virginia]191-virginia was not at [home]364-home . [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee said [she]195-monica had gone out at eleven in the morning , and with the intention of returning by teatime . After a brief hesitation [Monica]195-monica requested [the landlady]447-the landlady to deliver a message .

' Please ask [her]447-the landlady not to come to [Herne Hill]32-herne hill until [she]447-the landlady hears from [me]447-the landlady , as [I]447-the landlady am not likely to be at [home]364-home for a day or two . '[447-the landlady]

This left more time at [her]195-monica disposal than [she]195-monica knew how to employ . [She]195-monica returned to [the railway station]3507-the railway station , and travelled on to [Victoria]100-victoria ; there , in the corner of [a waiting - room]1729-a waiting - room , [she]195-monica sat , feverishly impatient , until [her]195-monica watch told [her]195-monica that [she]195-monica might take [the next train]2461-the next train westward .

A possible danger was before [her]195-monica though perhaps [she]195-monica need not trouble [herself]195-monica with the thought of such dangers . [She]195-monica came to [the street]594-the street , approached [the block of flats]2464-the block of flats , involuntarily casting anxious glances about [her]195-monica . And when [she]195-monica was within twenty yards of the door , it opened , and forth came [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . [He]249-mr. barfoot walked this way ; [he]249-mr. barfoot saw [her]195-monica ; and the pleasantest smile of recognition lit up [his]249-mr. barfoot face .

[She]195-monica could not command [herself]195-monica . The shock had left [her]195-monica trembling , and the necessity of feigning calmness was a new trial of [her]195-monica nerves . [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot , [she]195-monica felt certain , was reading [her]195-monica face like a printed page ; [he]249-mr. barfoot saw guilt there ; [his]249-mr. barfoot quickly - averted eyes , [his]249-mr. barfoot peculiar smile , seemed to express the facile tolerance of [a man of the world]4254-a man of the world .

[Her]195-monica confusion would not be overcome . [She]195-monica felt a burning in [her]195-monica ears , on [her]195-monica neck . It was an agony of shame . ' If it is all in vain , '[249-mr. barfoot] [he]249-mr. barfoot continued , ' then [I]249-mr. barfoot shall say good - bye , and there 's an end . '[249-mr. barfoot]

' [I]249-mr. barfoot hope not [I]249-mr. barfoot should think '[249-mr. barfoot]

Useless . [She]195-monica set [her]195-monica lips and became mute . If only [he]249-mr. barfoot would leave [her]195-monica ! And almost immediately [he]249-mr. barfoot did so , with a few words of kind tone . [She]195-monica felt the pressure of [his]249-mr. barfoot hand , and saw [him]249-mr. barfoot walk rapidly away ; doubtless [he]249-mr. barfoot knew this was what [she]195-monica desired .

Until [he]249-mr. barfoot had passed out of sight , [Monica]195-monica kept the same direction . Then [she]195-monica turned round and hurried back , fearful lest the detention might make [her]195-monica late , and [Bevis]288-bevis might lose hope of [her]195-monica coming . There could be [no one in [the building]1065-the building]2468-no one in the building now whom [she]195-monica need fear to meet . [She]195-monica opened the big entrance door and went up .

[Bevis]288-bevis must have been waiting for the sound of [her]195-monica light footstep ; [his]249-mr. barfoot door flew open before [she]195-monica could knock . Without speaking , a silent laugh of joy upon [his]249-mr. barfoot lips , [he]249-mr. barfoot drew back to make room for [her]195-monica entrance , and then pressed both [her]195-monica hands .

In [the sitting - room]1938-the sitting - room were beginnings of disorder . Pictures had been taken down from the walls and light ornaments removed .

' Tell [me]249-mr. barfoot what [you]249-mr. barfoot have been doing . [I]249-mr. barfoot have thought of [you]249-mr. barfoot day and night . '[249-mr. barfoot]

[She]195-monica told [him]249-mr. barfoot the circumstances . [Bevis]288-bevis kept [his]249-mr. barfoot eyes upon [her]195-monica face , with a look of rapt adoration which turned at length to pain and woeful perplexity .

[The man]350-the man revealed [himself]350-the man in this dolorous sentimentality . [His]350-the man wonted blitheness and facetiousness , [his]350-the man healthy features , [his]350-the man supple , well - built frame , suggested that when love awoke within [him]350-the man [he]350-the man would express it with virile force . But [he]350-the man trembled and blushed like [a young girl]3699-a young girl , and [his]350-the man accents fell at last into a melodious whining .

[He]350-the man raised the gloved fingers to [his]350-the man lips . [Monica]195-monica bent [her]195-monica face away , deadly pale , with closed eyes .

[Monica]195-monica broke down . The unmanliness of [his]2480-i tone was so dreadful a disillusion . [She]195-monica had expected something so entirely different swift , virile passion , eagerness even to anticipate [her]195-monica desire of flight , a strength , a courage to which [she]195-monica could abandon [herself]195-monica , body and soul . [She]195-monica broke down utterly , and wept with [her]195-monica hands upon [her]195-monica face .

[Bevis]288-bevis , in sympathetic distraction , threw [himself]288-bevis on [his]2480-i knees before , clutching at [her]195-monica waist .

[She]195-monica went to the couch again , and rested [her]195-monica face against the back , sobbing . For a time [they]2481-they exchanged mere incoherences . Then passion seized upon [both]525-both , and [they]2481-they clung together , mute , motionless .

' To - morrow [I]195-monica shall leave [him]2480-i , '[195-monica] whispered [Monica]195-monica , when at length [their]2481-they eyes met . ' [He]2480-i will be away in the morning , and [I]195-monica can take what [I]195-monica need . Tell [me]195-monica where [I]195-monica shall go to , dear to wait until [you]195-monica are ready . [No one]3554-no one will ever suspect that [we]2481-they have gone together . [He]2480-i knows [I]195-monica am miserable with [him]2480-i ; [he]2480-i will believe that [I]195-monica have found some way of supporting [myself]195-monica in [London]6-london . Where shall [I]195-monica live till Tuesday ? '[195-monica]

[Bevis]288-bevis scarcely listened to [her]195-monica words . The temptation of [the natural man]2483-the natural man , basely selfish , was strengthening its hold upon [him]2483-the natural man .

' Do [you]195-monica love [me]2483-the natural man ? Do [you]195-monica really love [me]2483-the natural man ? '[2483-the natural man] [he]2483-the natural man replied to [her]195-monica , with thick , agitated utterance .

' Why should [you]195-monica ask that ? How can [you]195-monica doubt it ? '[195-monica]

' If [you]195-monica really love [me]2483-the natural man - '[2483-the natural man]

[His]2483-the natural man face and tones frightened [her]195-monica .

' Do n't make [me]195-monica doubt [your]195-monica love ! If [I]195-monica have not perfect trust in [you]195-monica what will become of [me]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

Yet once more [she]195-monica drew resolutely away from [him]2483-the natural man . [He]2483-the natural man pursued , and held [her]195-monica arms with violence .

' Oh , [I]195-monica am mistaken in [you]2483-the natural man ! '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica cried in fear and bitterness . ' [You]2483-the natural man do n't know what love means , as [I]195-monica feel it . [You]2483-the natural man wo n't speak , [you]2483-the natural man wo n't think , of [our]5484-our future life together '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica have promised '[195-monica]

' Leave loose of [me]195-monica ! It 's because [I]195-monica have come [here]3495-here . [You]2483-the natural man think [me]195-monica [a worthless woman , without sense of honour]5486-a worthless woman , without sense of honour , with no self - respect '[195-monica]

[He]2483-the natural man protested vehemently . The anguished look in [her]195-monica eyes had its effect upon [his]2483-the natural man senses ; by degrees it subjugated [him]2483-the natural man , and made [him]2483-the natural man ashamed of [his]2483-the natural man ignoble impulse .

' Shall [I]2483-the natural man find a lodging for [you]195-monica till Tuesday ? '[2483-the natural man] [he]2483-the natural man asked , after moving away arid returning .

' Will [you]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica are sure [you]195-monica can leave [home]364-home to - morrow without being suspected ? '[195-monica]

' Yes , [I]195-monica am sure [I]195-monica can . [He]2483-the natural man is going to [the City]3768-the city in the morning . Appoint some place where [I]195-monica can meet [you]195-monica . [I]195-monica will come in [a cab]836-a cab , and then [you]195-monica can take [me]195-monica on to the '[195-monica]

' But [you]195-monica are forgetting the risks . If [you]195-monica take [a cab]836-a cab from [Herne Hill]32-herne hill , with [your]195-monica luggage , [he]2483-the natural man will be able to find out [the driver]672-the driver afterwards , and learn where [you]195-monica went . '[195-monica]

' Then [I]195-monica will drive only as far as [the station]586-the station , and come to [Victoria]100-victoria , and [you]195-monica shall meet [me]195-monica [there]453-there . '[195-monica]

The necessity of these paltry arrangements filled [her]2484-her soul with shame . On the details of [her]2484-her escape [she]2484-her had hardly reflected . All such considerations were , [she]2484-her deemed , naturally the care of [[her]2484-her lover]2138-her lover , who would act with promptitude , and so as to spare [her]2484-her a moment 's perplexity . [She]2484-her had imagined everything in readiness within a few hours ; on [her]2484-her no responsibility save that of breaking the hated bond . Inevitably [she]2484-her turned to the wretched thought that [Bevis]288-bevis regarded [her]2484-her as a burden . Yes , [he]2138-her lover had already [[his]2138-her lover mother]1992-his mother and [[his]2138-her lover sisters]5042-his sisters to support ; [she]2484-her ought to have remembered that .

' What time would it be ? '[2138-her lover] [he]2138-her lover was asking .

Unable to reply , [she]2484-her pursued [her]2484-her reflections . [She]2484-her had money , but how to obtain possession of it ? Afterwards , when [her]2484-her flight was accomplished , secrecy , it appeared , would be no less needful than now . That necessity had never occurred to [her]2484-her ; declaration of the love that had freed [her]2484-her seemed inevitable nay , desirable . [Her]2484-her self - respect demanded it ; only thus could [she]2484-her justify [herself]2484-her before [[his]2138-her lover sisters]5042-his sisters and [other people who knew [her]2484-her]2489-other people who knew her . [They]2490-they , perhaps , would not see it in the light of justification , but that mattered little ; [her]2484-her own conscience would approve what [she]2484-her had done . But to steal away , and live henceforth in hiding , like [a woman dishonoured even in [her]2484-her own eyes from that [she]2484-her shrank with repugnance]2491-a woman dishonoured even in her own eyes from that she shrank with repugnance . Rather than that , would it not be preferable to break with [[her]2484-her husband]4145-her husband , and openly live apart from [him]2138-her lover , alone ?

' Be honest with [me]2484-her , '[2484-her] [she]2484-her suddenly exclaimed . ' Had [you]2138-her lover rather [I]2484-her did n't come ? '[2484-her]

' No , no ! [I]2138-her lover ca n't live without [you]2138-her lover '[2138-her lover]

' But , if that is true , why have n't [you]2138-her lover the courage to let [every one]3621-every one know it ? In [your]2138-her lover heart [you]2138-her lover must think that [we]5495-we are acting wrongly . '[2484-her]

' [I]2138-her lover do n't ! [I]2138-her lover believe , as [you]2484-her do , that love is the only true marriage . Very well ! '[2138-her lover] [He]2138-her lover made a desperate gesture . ' Let [us]5495-we defy all consequences . For [your]2484-her sake '[2138-her lover]

[His]2138-her lover exaggerated vehemence could not deceive [Monica]195-monica .

' What is it , '[2484-her] [she]2484-her asked , ' that [you]2138-her lover most fear ? '[2484-her]

[He]2138-her lover began to babble protestations , but [she]2484-her would not listen to them .

' Tell [me]2138-her lover [I]2138-her lover have every right to ask what [you]2138-her lover most fear ? '[2138-her lover]

' [I]2138-her lover fear nothing if [you]2138-her lover are with [me]2138-her lover . Let [[my]2138-her lover relatives]1252-my relatives say and think what [they]1252-my relatives like . [I]2138-her lover have made great sacrifices for [them]1252-my relatives ; to give up [you]2138-her lover would be too much . '[2138-her lover]

Yet [his]2138-her lover distress was evident . It strained the corners of [his]2138-her lover mouth , wrinkled [his]2138-her lover forehead .

' The disgrace would be more than [you]2138-her lover could bear . [You]2138-her lover would never see [[your]2138-her lover mother]5497-your mother and [[your]2138-her lover sisters]3566-your sisters again . '[2138-her lover]

[He]2138-her lover was interrupted by a loud rat - tat at the outer door . Blanched [herself]2493-herself , [Monica]195-monica saw that [[her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover 's face turned to ghastly pallor .

' Who can that be ? '[2138-her lover] [he]2138-her lover whispered hoarsely . ' [I]2138-her lover expect [no one]3554-no one . '[2138-her lover]

' Need [you]2138-her lover answer ? '[288-bevis]

' Can it be ? Have [you]2138-her lover been followed ? Does [any one]3776-any one suspect ? '[2138-her lover]

[They]2495-our stared at [each other]543-each other , still half - paralysed , and stood waiting thus until the knock was repeated impatiently .

' [I]288-bevis dare n't open , '[288-bevis] [Bevis]288-bevis whispered , coming close to [her]195-monica , as if on the impulse of seeking protection for to offer it was assuredly not in [his]2138-her lover mind . ' It might be '[288-bevis]

' No ! That 's impossible . '[288-bevis]

' [I]288-bevis dare n't go to the door . The risk is too frightful . [He]2138-her lover will go away , whoever it is , if [no one]3554-no one answers . '[288-bevis]

[Both]525-both were shaking in the second stage of terror . [Bevis]288-bevis put [his]2138-her lover arm about [Monica]195-monica , and felt [her]195-monica heart give great throbs against [his]2138-her lover own . [Their]2495-our passion for the moment was effectually quenched .

' Listen ! That 's the clink of the letter - box . A card or something has been put in . Then it 's all right . [I]2138-her lover 'll wait a moment . '[2138-her lover]

[He]2138-her lover stepped to the door of [the room]444-the room , opened it without sound , and at once heard footsteps descending the stairs . In the look which [he]2138-her lover cast back at [her]195-monica , a grin rather than a smile , [Monica]195-monica saw something that gave [her]195-monica a pang of shame on [his]2138-her lover behalf . On going to the letter - box [he]2138-her lover found a card , with a few words scribbled upon it .

' [Only one of [[our]2495-our partners]5503-our partners]5502-only one of our partners ! '[2138-her lover] [he]2138-her lover exclaimed gleefully . ' Wants to see [me]2138-her lover to - night . Of course [he]2138-her lover took it for granted [I]2138-her lover was out . '[2138-her lover]

[Monica]195-monica was looking at [her]195-monica watch . Past five o'clock .

' [I]195-monica think [I]195-monica must go , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said timidly .

' But what are [our]2495-our arrangements ? Do [you]2138-her lover still intend '[195-monica]

' Intend ? Is n't it for [you]195-monica to decide ? '[195-monica]

There was a coldness in the words of both , partly the result of the great shock [they]2499-they had undergone , in part due to [their]2499-they impatience with [each other]543-each other .

' Darling do what [I]195-monica proposed at first . Stay for a few days , until [I]195-monica am settled at [Bordeaux]133-bordeaux . '[195-monica]

' Stay with [[my]195-monica [my]195-monica husband]5504-my my husband ? '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica used the word purposely , significantly , to see how it would affect [him]2501-he . The bitterness of [her]195-monica growing disillusion allowed [her]195-monica to think and speak as if no ardent feeling were concerned .

' For both [our]2495-our sakes , dearest , dearest love ! A few days longer , until [I]2501-he have written to [you]195-monica , and told [you]195-monica exactly what to do . [He]2501-he embraced [her]195-monica with placid tenderness , laying [his]2501-he cheek against [hers]195-monica , kissing [her]195-monica hands .

' [We]2495-our must see [each other]543-each other again , '[2501-he] [he]2501-he continued . ' Come on Sunday , will [you]195-monica ? Be guided by [me]2501-he , [dear little girl]5510-dear little girl . Only a week or two to save the happiness of [our]2503-our whole lives . '[2501-he]

[Monica]195-monica listened , but with half - attention , [her]195-monica look fixed on the floor . Encouraged by [her]195-monica silence , [the lover]1743-the lover went on in a strain of heightening enthusiasm , depicting the raptures of [their]2503-our retirement from [the world]3462-the world in [some suburb of [Bordeaux]133-bordeaux]2505-some suburb of bordeaux . How this retreat was to escape the notice of [[his]2501-he business companions]2506-his business companions , through whom the scandal might get wind , [he]2501-he did not suggest . The truth was , [Bevis]288-bevis found [himself]288-bevis in an extremely awkward position , with issues [he]2501-he had not contemplated , and all [he]2501-he cared for was to avert the immediate peril of public discovery . [The easy - going , kindly fellow]2507-the easy - going , kindly fellow had never considered all the responsibility involved in making mild love timorously selfish from the first to [a married woman who took [his]2501-he advances with desperate seriousness]2508-a married woman who took his advances with desperate seriousness . [He]2501-he had not in [him]2501-he the stuff of vigorous rascality , still less the only other quality which can support [a man in such a situation as this heroism of moral revolt]2509-a man in such a situation as this heroism of moral revolt . So [he]2501-he cut [a very poor figure]2510-a very poor figure , and was dolefully aware of it . [He]2501-he talked , talked ; trying to disguise [his]2501-he feebleness in tinsel phrases ; and [Monica]195-monica still kept [her]195-monica eyes cast down .

When another half - hour had passed , [she]195-monica sighed deeply and rose from [her]195-monica seat . [She]195-monica would write to [him]2501-he , [she]195-monica said , and let [him]2501-he know where a reply would reach [her]195-monica . No , [she]195-monica must not come here again ; all [he]2501-he had to tell [her]195-monica would be communicated by letter . The subdued tone , the simple sadness of [her]195-monica words , distressed [Bevis]288-bevis , and yet [he]2501-he secretly congratulated [himself]2501-he . [He]2501-he had done nothing for which [this woman]2086-this woman could justly reproach [him]2501-he ; marvellous so [he]2501-he considered had been [his]2501-he self - restraint ; absolutely , [he]2501-he had behaved ' like [a gentleman]740-a gentleman . '[2501-he] To be sure , [he]2501-he was miserably in love , and , if circumstances by any means allowed of it , would send for [Monica]195-monica to join [him]2501-he in [France]102-france . Should the thing prove impossible , [he]2501-he had nothing whatever on [his]2501-he conscience .

[He]2501-he held out [his]2501-he arms to [her]195-monica . [Monica]195-monica shook [her]195-monica head and looked away .

' Say once more that [you]195-monica love [me]2501-he , [darling]3629-darling , '[2501-he] [he]2501-he pleaded . ' [I]2501-he shall not rest for an hour until [I]2501-he am able to write and say , " Come to [me]2501-he . " '[2501-he]

[She]195-monica permitted [him]2501-he to hold [her]195-monica once more in [his]2501-he soft embrace .

' Kiss [me]195-monica , [Monica]195-monica ! '[195-monica]
