[She]195-monica put [her]195-monica lips to [his]2501-he cheek , and withdrew them , still shunning [his]2501-he look .

' Oh , not that kind of kiss . Like [you]2501-he kissed [me]195-monica before . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica ca n't , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica replied , with choking voice , the tears again starting forth .

' But what have [I]195-monica done that [you]2501-he should love [me]195-monica less , [dearest]5459-dearest ? '[195-monica]

[He]2501-he kissed the falling drops , murmuring assurances , encouragements .

' [You]2501-he sha n't leave [me]2501-he until [I]2501-he have heard [you]2501-he say that [your]2501-he love is unchanged . Whisper it to [me]2501-he , [sweetest]5514-sweetest ! '[2501-he]

' When [we]5515-we meet again not now . '[2501-he]

' [You]2501-he frighten [me]2501-he . [Monica]195-monica , [we]5515-we are not saying good - bye for ever ? '[2501-he]

' If [you]2501-he send for [me]2501-he [I]2501-he will come . '[2501-he]

' [You]2501-he promise faithfully ? [You]2501-he will come ? '[2501-he]

' If [you]2501-he send for [me]2501-he [I]2501-he will come . '[2501-he]

That was [her]2512-her last word . [He]2513-he opened the door for [her]2512-her , and listened as [she]2512-her departed .

CHAPTER XXIII

IN AMBUSH

Hitherto , [Widdowson]217-widdowson had entertained no grave mistrust of [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife . The principles [she]4133-his wife had avowed , directly traceable as it seemed to [her]4133-his wife friendship with [the militant women in [Chelsea]19-chelsea]2515-the militant women in chelsea , [he]217-widdowson disliked and feared ; but [her]4133-his wife conduct [he]217-widdowson fully believed to be above reproach . [His]217-widdowson jealously of [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot did not glance at [Monica]195-monica 's attitude towards [the man]350-the man ; merely at [the man]350-the man [himself]350-the man , whom [he]217-widdowson credited with native scoundreldom . [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot represented to [his]350-the man mind a type of [licentious bachelor]2518-licentious bachelor ; why , [he]249-mr. barfoot could not have made perfectly clear to [his]249-mr. barfoot own understanding . Possibly the ease of [Everard]242-everard 's bearing , the something aristocratic in [his]350-the man countenance and [his]350-the man speech , the polish of [his]350-the man manner , especially in formal converse with [women]3478-women , from the first grave offence to [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's essentially middle - class sensibilities . If [Monica]195-monica were in danger at all , it was , [he]217-widdowson felt convinced , from that quarter . The subject of [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's intimate dialogue with [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot at [the Academy]2194-the academy still remained a mystery to [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson put faith in [her]4133-his wife rebellious declaration that every word might have been safely repeated in [his]217-widdowson hearing , but , be the matter what it might , the manner of [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's talk meant evil . Of that conviction [he]217-widdowson could not get rid .

[He]217-widdowson had read somewhere that [a persistently jealous husband]2522-a persistently jealous husband may not improbably end by irritating [an innocent wife]2523-an innocent wife into affording real ground for jealousy . [A man with small knowledge of [the world]3462-the world]2524-a man with small knowledge of the world is much impressed by dicta such as there ; they get into the crannies of [his]2524-a man with small knowledge of the world mind , and thence direct the course of [his]2524-a man with small knowledge of the world thinking . [Widdowson]217-widdowson , before [his]217-widdowson marriage , had never suspected the difficulty of understanding [a woman]615-a woman ; had [he]217-widdowson spoken [his]217-widdowson serious belief on that subject , it would have been found to represent the most primitive male conception of [the feminine being]2527-the feminine being . [Women]3478-women were very like [children]3468-children ; it was rather a task to amuse [them]3478-women and to keep [them]3478-women out of mischief . Therefore the blessedness of household toil , in especial the blessedness of [child - bearing]2530-child - bearing and all that followed . Intimacy with [Monica]195-monica had greatly affected [his]217-widdowson views , yet chiefly by disturbing them ; no firmer ground offered itself to [his]217-widdowson threading when [he]217-widdowson perforce admitted that [his]217-widdowson former standpoint was every day assailed by some incontestable piece of evidence . [Woman]3471-woman had individual characters ; that discovery , though not a very profound one , impressed [him]217-widdowson with the force of something arrived at by independent observation . [Monica]195-monica often puzzled [him]217-widdowson gravely ; [he]217-widdowson could not find the key to [her]195-monica satisfactions and discontents . To regard [her]195-monica simply as [a human being]2206-a human being was beyond the reach of [his]217-widdowson intelligence . [He]217-widdowson cast the blame of [his]217-widdowson difficulties upon sex , and paid more attention to the hints on such afforded [him]217-widdowson by [his]217-widdowson reading . [He]217-widdowson would endeavour to keep [his]217-widdowson jealousy out of sight , lest the mysterious tendency of the female nature might prompt [Monica]195-monica to deliberate wrongdoing .

To - day for the first time there flashed across [him]217-widdowson the thought that already [he]217-widdowson might have been deceived . It originated in a peculiarity of [Monica]195-monica 's behaviour at luncheon . [She]195-monica ate scarcely anything ; [she]195-monica seemed hurried , frequently glancing at the clock ; and [she]195-monica lost [herself]195-monica in reverie . Discovering that [his]217-widdowson eye was upon [her]195-monica , [she]195-monica betrayed uneasiness , and began to talk without considering what [she]195-monica meant to say . All this might mean nothing more than [her]195-monica barely - concealed regret at being obliged to leave [London]6-london ; but [Widdowson]217-widdowson remarked it with a vivacity of feeling perhaps due to the excitement in which [he]217-widdowson had lived for the past week . Perhaps the activity , the resolution to which [he]217-widdowson had urged [himself]217-widdowson , caused a sharpening of [his]217-widdowson perceptions . And the very thought , never out of [his]217-widdowson mind , that only a few days had to elapse before [he]217-widdowson carried off [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife from the scene of peril , tended to make [him]217-widdowson more vividly conscious of that peril . Certain it was that a moment 's clairvoyance assailed [his]217-widdowson peace , and left behind it all manner of ugly conjectures . [Woman]3471-woman so said the books are [adepts at dissimulation]2535-adepts at dissimulation . Was it conceivable that [Monica]195-monica had taken advantage of the liberty [he]217-widdowson had of late allowed [her]195-monica ? If [a woman]615-a woman could not endure a direct , searching gaze , must it not imply some enormous wickedness ? seeing that nature has armed [them]2537-them for this very trial .

In [her]195-monica setting forth for [the railway station]3507-the railway station hurry was again evident , and disinclination to exchange parting words . If the eagerness were simple and honest , would [she]195-monica not have accepted [his]217-widdowson suggestion and have gone in the morning ?

For five minutes after [her]195-monica departure [he]217-widdowson stood in [the hall]2087-the hall , staring before [him]217-widdowson . A new jealousy , a horrible constriction of the heart , had begun to torture [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson went and walked about in [the library]3604-the library , but could not dispel [his]217-widdowson suffering . Vain to keep repeating that [Monica]195-monica was incapable of baseness . Of that [he]217-widdowson was persuaded , but none the less a hideous image returned upon [his]217-widdowson mental vision a horror a pollution of thought .

One thing [he]217-widdowson could do to restore [his]217-widdowson sanity . [He]217-widdowson would walk over to [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill , and accompany [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife on [her]4133-his wife return [home]364-home . Indeed , the mere difficulty of getting through the afternoon advised this project . [He]217-widdowson could not employ [himself]217-widdowson , and knew that [his]217-widdowson imagination , once inflamed , would leave [him]217-widdowson not a moment 's rest . Yes , [he]217-widdowson would walk to [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill , and ramble about [that region]2543-that region until [Monica]195-monica had had reasonable time for talk with [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister .

About three o'clock there fell a heavy shower of rain . Strangely against [his]217-widdowson habits , [Widdowson]217-widdowson turned into [a quiet public - house]2545-a quiet public - house , and sat for a quarter of an hour at [the bar]2546-the bar , drinking a glass of whisky . During the past week [he]217-widdowson had taken considerably more wine than usual at meals ; [he]217-widdowson seemed to need the support . Whilst sipping at [his]217-widdowson glass of spirits , [he]217-widdowson oddly enough fell into talk with [the barmaid]592-the barmaid , [a young woman of some charms , and what appeared to be unaffected modesty]2548-a young woman of some charms , and what appeared to be unaffected modesty . Not for twenty years had [Widdowson]217-widdowson conversed with [a member of this sisterhood]2549-a member of this sisterhood . [Their]2550-their dialogue was made up of the most trifling of trivialities weather , a railway accident , the desirability of holidays at this season . And when at length [he]217-widdowson rose and put an end to the chat it was with appreciable reluctance .

' [A good , nice sort of girl]5516-a good , nice sort of girl , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson went away saying to [himself]217-widdowson . ' Pity [she]2549-a member of this sisterhood should be serving at [a bar]5517-a bar hearing doubtful talk , and seeing very often vile sights . [A nice , soft - spoken little girl]5518-a nice , soft - spoken little girl . '[217-widdowson]

And [he]217-widdowson mused upon [her]2549-a member of this sisterhood remembered face with a complacency which soothed [his]217-widdowson feelings .

Of a sudden [he]217-widdowson was checked by the conversion of [his]217-widdowson sentiment into thought . Would [he]217-widdowson not have been [a much happier man]2551-a much happier man if [he]217-widdowson had married [a girl distinctly [his]217-widdowson inferior]2552-a girl distinctly his inferior in mind and station ? Provided [she]2552-a girl distinctly his inferior were sweet , lovable , docile such [a wife]514-a wife would have spared [him]217-widdowson all the misery [he]217-widdowson had known with [Monica]195-monica . From the first [he]217-widdowson had understood that [Monica]195-monica was [no representative shopgirl]2554-no representative shopgirl , and on that very account [he]217-widdowson had striven so eagerly to win [her]195-monica . But it was a mistake . [He]217-widdowson had loved [her]195-monica , still loved [her]195-monica , with all the emotion of which [he]217-widdowson was capable . How many hours ' genuine happiness of soul had that love afforded [him]217-widdowson ? The minutest fraction of the twelve months for which [she]195-monica had been [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife . And of suffering , often amounting to frantic misery , [he]217-widdowson could count many weeks . Could such a marriage as this be judged a marriage at all , in any true sense of the word ?[217-widdowson]

' Let [me]217-widdowson ask [myself]217-widdowson a question . If [Monica]195-monica were absolutely free to choose between continuing to live with [me]217-widdowson and resuming [her]195-monica perfect liberty , can [I]217-widdowson persuade [myself]217-widdowson that [she]195-monica would remain [[my]217-widdowson wife]4104-my wife ? [She]195-monica would not . Not for a day , not for an hour . Of that [I]217-widdowson am morally convinced . And [I]217-widdowson acknowledge the grounds of [her]195-monica dissatisfaction . [We]5521-we are unsuited to [each other]543-each other . [We]5521-we do not understand [each other]543-each other . [Our]5521-we marriage is physical and nothing more . [My]217-widdowson love what is [my]217-widdowson love ? [I]217-widdowson do not love [her]195-monica mind , [her]195-monica intellectual part . If [I]217-widdowson did , this frightful jealousy from which [I]217-widdowson suffer would be impossible . [My]217-widdowson ideal of [the wife perfectly suited to [me]217-widdowson]5524-the wife perfectly suited to me is far liker [that girl at [the public - house bar]5526-the public - house bar]5525-that girl at the public - house bar than [Monica]195-monica . [Monica]195-monica 's independence of thought is a perpetual irritation to [me]217-widdowson . [I]217-widdowson do n't know what [her]195-monica thoughts really are , what [her]195-monica intellectual life signifies . And yet [I]217-widdowson hold [her]195-monica to [me]217-widdowson with the sternest grasp . If [she]195-monica endeavoured to release [herself]195-monica [I]217-widdowson should feel capable of killing [her]195-monica . Is not this a strange , a brutal thing ? '[217-widdowson]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson had never before reached this height of speculation . In the moment , by the very fact , of admitting that [Monica]195-monica and [he]217-widdowson ought not to be living together , [he]217-widdowson became more worthy of [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's companionship than ever hitherto .

Well , [he]217-widdowson would exercise greater forebearance . [He]217-widdowson would endeavour to win [her]4133-his wife respect by respecting the freedom [she]4133-his wife claimed . [His]217-widdowson recent suspicions of [her]4133-his wife were monstrous . If [she]4133-his wife knew them , how [her]4133-his wife soul would revolt from [him]217-widdowson ! What if [she]4133-his wife took an interest in [other men]3767-other men , perchance more [[her]4133-his wife equals]2557-her equals than [he]217-widdowson ? Why , had [he]217-widdowson not just been thinking of [another woman]1613-another woman , reflecting that [she]4133-his wife , or one like [her]4133-his wife , would have made [him]217-widdowson [a more suitable wife than [Monica]195-monica]2559-a more suitable wife than monica ? Yet this could not reasonably be called unfaithfulness .

[They]2560-they were bound together for life , and [their]2560-they wisdom lay in mutual toleration , the constant endeavour to understand [each other]543-each other aright not in fierce restraint of each other 's mental liberty . How many marriages were anything more than mutual forbearance ? Perhaps there ought not to be such a thing as enforced permanence of marriage . This was daring speculation ; [he]217-widdowson could not have endured to hear it from [Monica]195-monica 's lips . But perhaps , some day , marriage would be dissoluble at the will of [either party]2562-either party to it . Perhaps [the man who sought to hold [a woman]615-a woman when [she]615-a woman no longer loved [him]2563-the man who sought to hold a woman when she no longer loved him]2563-the man who sought to hold a woman when she no longer loved him would be regarded with contempt and condemnation .

What a simple thing marriage had always seemed to [him]217-widdowson , and how far from simple [he]217-widdowson had found it ! Why , it led [him]217-widdowson to musings which overset the order of [the world]3462-the world , and flung all ideas of religion and morality into wildest confusion . It would not do to think like this . [He]217-widdowson was [a man]3627-a man wedded to [a woman very difficult to manage there was the practical upshot of the matter]2567-a woman very difficult to manage there was the practical upshot of the matter . [His]217-widdowson duty was to manage [her]615-a woman . [He]217-widdowson was responsible for [her]615-a woman right conduct . With intentions perfectly harmless , [she]615-a woman might run into unknown jeopardy above all , just at this time when [she]615-a woman was taking reluctant leave of [[her]615-a woman friends]1123-her friends . The danger justified [him]217-widdowson in exceptional vigilance .

So , from [his]217-widdowson excursion into the realms of reason did [he]217-widdowson return to the safe sphere of the commonplace . And now [he]217-widdowson might venture to press on towards [[Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's house]2569-mrs. conisbee 's house , for it was half - past four , and already [Monica]195-monica must have been talking with [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister for a couple of hours .

[His]217-widdowson knock at the door was answered by [the landlady]447-the landlady [herself]447-the landlady . [She]447-the landlady told of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's arrival and departure . Ah , then [Monica]195-monica had no doubt gone straight [home]364-home again . But , as [Miss Madden]204-miss madden had returned , [he]217-widdowson would speak with [her]204-miss madden .

' [The poor lady]5527-the poor lady is n't very well , [sir]4958-sir , '[206-mrs. conisbee] said [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , fingering the hem of [her]206-mrs. conisbee apron .

' Not very well ? But could n't [I]206-mrs. conisbee see [her]5527-the poor lady for a moment ? '[206-mrs. conisbee]

[Virginia]191-virginia answered this question by appearing on the staircase .

' Some one for [me]191-virginia , [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee ? '[191-virginia] [she]191-virginia called from above . ' Oh , is it [you]217-widdowson , [Edmund]217-widdowson ? So very glad ! [I]191-virginia 'm[191-virginia] sure [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee will have the kindness to let [you]217-widdowson come into [[her]206-mrs. conisbee sitting - room]2573-her sitting - room . What a pity [I]0-i was away when [Monica]195-monica called ! [I]0-i 've had business to see to in [town]624-town ; and [I]0-i 've walked and walked , until [I]0-i 'm really hardly able '[191-virginia]

[She]191-virginia sank upon a chair in [the room]444-the room , and looked fixedly at [the visitor]439-the visitor with a broad , benevolent smile , [her]191-virginia head moving up and down . [Widdowson]217-widdowson was for a moment in perplexity . If the evidence of [his]217-widdowson eyes could be trusted , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden 's indisposition pointed to a cause so strange that it seemed incredible . [He]217-widdowson turned to look for [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee , but [the landlady]447-the landlady had hurriedly withdrawn , closing the door behind [her]447-the landlady .

' It is so foolish of [me]191-virginia , [Edmund]217-widdowson , '[191-virginia] [Virginia]191-virginia rambled on , addressing [him]217-widdowson with a familiarity [she]191-virginia had never yet used . ' When [I]191-virginia am away from [home]364-home [I]191-virginia forget all about [my]191-virginia meals really forget and then all at once [I]191-virginia find that [I]191-virginia am quite exhausted quite exhausted as [you]217-widdowson see . And the worst of it is [I]191-virginia have altogether lost [my]191-virginia appetite by the time [I]191-virginia get back . [I]191-virginia could n't eat a mouthful of food not a mouthful [I]191-virginia assure [you]217-widdowson [I]191-virginia could n't . And it does so distress good [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee . [She]206-mrs. conisbee is exceedingly kind to [me]191-virginia exceedingly careful about [my]191-virginia health . Oh , and in [Battersea Park Road]5530-battersea park road [I]191-virginia saw such a shocking sight ; a great cart ran over a poor little dog , and it was killed on the spot . It unnerved [me]191-virginia dreadfully . [I]191-virginia do think , [Edmund]217-widdowson , [those drivers]5531-those drivers ought to be more careful . [I]191-virginia was saying to [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee only the other day and that reminds [me]191-virginia , [I]191-virginia do so want to know all about [your]206-mrs. conisbee visit to [Clevedon]1-clevedon . [Dear]3530-dear , dear [Clevedon]1-clevedon ! And have [you]217-widdowson really taken [a house]902-a house [there]453-there , [Edmund]217-widdowson ? Oh , if [we]5535-our could all end [our]5535-our days at [Clevedon]1-clevedon ! [You]206-mrs. conisbee know that [[our]5535-our dear father]5536-our dear father and [mother]3488-mother are buried in [the old churchyard]5538-the old churchyard . [You]206-mrs. conisbee remember [Tennyson]189-tennyson 's lines about [the old church at [Clevedon]1-clevedon]5539-the old church at clevedon ? Oh , and what did [Monica]195-monica decide about about really , what was [I]191-virginia going to ask ? It is so foolish of [me]191-virginia to forget that dinner - time has come and gone . [I]191-virginia get so exhausted , and even [my]191-virginia memory fails [me]191-virginia . '[191-virginia]

[He]2578-i could doubt no longer . [This poor woman]2579-this poor woman had yielded to one of the temptations that beset a life of idleness and solitude . [His]2578-i pity was mingled with disgust .

' [I]2578-i only wished to tell [you]2579-this poor woman , '[2578-i] [he]2578-i said gravely , ' that [we]5540-we have taken [a house at [Clevedon]1-clevedon]5541-a house at clevedon '[2578-i]

' [You]2578-i really have ! '[2579-this poor woman] [She]2579-this poor woman clasped [her]2579-this poor woman hands together . ' Whereabouts ? '[2579-this poor woman]

' Near [Dial Hill]148-dial hill . '[2578-i]

[Virginia]191-virginia began a rhapsody which [[her]191-virginia brother - in - law]2580-her brother - in - law had no inclination to hear . [He]2578-i rose abruptly .

' Perhaps [you]2579-this poor woman had better come and see [us]5540-we to - morrow . '[2578-i]

' But [Monica]195-monica left a message that [she]195-monica would n't be at [home]364-home for the next few days , and that [I]2578-i was n't to come till [I]2578-i heard from [her]195-monica . '[2578-i]

' Not at [home]364-home ? [I]2578-i think there 's a mistake . '[2578-i]

' Oh , impossible ! [We]5540-we 'll ask [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee . '[2578-i]

[She]2579-this poor woman went to the door and called . From [the landlady]447-the landlady [Widdowson]217-widdowson learnt exactly what [Monica]195-monica had said . [He]217-widdowson reflected for a moment .

' [She]195-monica shall write to [you]447-the landlady then . Do n't come just yet . [I]217-widdowson must n't stay any longer now . '[217-widdowson]

And with a mere pretence of shaking hands [he]217-widdowson abruptly left [the house]368-the house .

Suspicions thickened about [him]217-widdowson . [He]217-widdowson would have thought it utterly impossible for [Miss Madden]204-miss madden to disgrace [herself]204-miss madden in this vulgar way , and the appalling discovery affected [his]217-widdowson view of [Monica]195-monica . [They]2583-they were [sisters]1111-sisters ; [they]2583-they had characteristics in common , family traits , weaknesses . If [the elder woman]924-the elder woman could fall into this degradation , might there not be possibilities in [Monica]195-monica 's character such as [he]217-widdowson had refused to contemplate ? Was there not terrible reason for mistrusting [her]195-monica ? What did [she]195-monica mean by [her]195-monica message to [Virginia]191-virginia .

Black and haggard , [he]217-widdowson went [home]364-home as fast as a hansom could take [him]217-widdowson . It was half - past five when [he]217-widdowson reached [the house]368-the house . [[His]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife was not [here]3495-here , and had not been [here]3495-here .

At this moment [Monica]195-monica was starting by [train]3815-train from [Bayswater]77-bayswater , after [her]195-monica parting with [Bevis]288-bevis . Arrived at [Victoria]100-victoria , [she]195-monica crossed to [the main station]2592-the main station , and went to [[the ladies]1001-the ladies ' waiting - room]5544-the ladies ' waiting - room for the purpose of bathing [her]195-monica face . [She]195-monica had red , swollen eyes , and [her]195-monica hair was in slight disorder . This done , [she]195-monica inquired as to [the next train]2461-the next train for [[Herne]5546-herne Hill]5547-herne hill . [One]472-one had just gone ; another would leave in about a quarter of an hour .[195-monica]

A dreadful indecision was harassing [her]195-monica . Ought [she]195-monica , did [she]195-monica dare , to return [home]364-home at all ? Even if [her]195-monica strength sufficed for simulating a natural manner , could [she]195-monica consent to play so base a part ?

There was but one possible alternative . [She]195-monica might go to [[Virginia]191-virginia 's lodgings]2595-virginia 's lodgings , and there remain , writing to [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband that [she]195-monica had left [him]4145-her husband . The true cause need not be confessed . [She]195-monica would merely declare that life with [him]4145-her husband had become intolerable to [her]195-monica , that [she]195-monica demanded a release . [Their]2597-their approaching removal to [Clevedon]1-clevedon offered the occasion . [She]195-monica would say that [her]195-monica endurance failed before that prospect of solitude , and that , feeling as [she]195-monica did , it was dishonourable to make longer pretence of doing [her]195-monica duty as [a wife]514-a wife . Then , if [Bevis]288-bevis wrote to [her]195-monica in such a way as to revive [her]195-monica love , if [he]4145-her husband seriously told [her]195-monica to come to [him]4145-her husband , all difficulties could be solved by [her]195-monica disappearance .

Was such revival of disheartened love a likely or a possible thing ? At this moment [she]195-monica felt that to flee in secret , and live with [Bevis]288-bevis as [he]4145-her husband proposed , would be no less dishonour than abiding with [the man who had a legal claim upon [her]195-monica companionship]2599-the man who had a legal claim upon her companionship . [[Her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover , as [she]195-monica had thought of [him]2138-her lover for the past two or three months , was only a figment of [her]195-monica imagination ; [Bevis]288-bevis had proved [himself]288-bevis [a complete stranger to [her]195-monica mind]2601-a complete stranger to her mind ; [she]195-monica must reshape [her]195-monica knowledge of [him]2138-her lover . [His]2138-her lover face was all that [she]195-monica could still dwell upon with the old desire ; nay , even that had suffered a change .

Insensibly the minutes went by . Whilst [she]195-monica sat in [the waiting - room]2602-the waiting - room [her]195-monica train started ; and when [she]195-monica had become aware of that , [her]195-monica irresolution grew more tormenting .

Suddenly there came upon [her]195-monica a feeling of illness , of nausea . Perspiration broke out on [her]195-monica forehead ; [her]195-monica eyes dazzled ; [she]195-monica had to let [her]195-monica head fall back . It passed , but in a minute or two the fit again seized [her]195-monica , and with a moan [she]195-monica lost consciousness .

[Two or three women who were in [the room]444-the room]2603-two or three women who were in the room rendered assistance . The remarks [they]2603-two or three women who were in the room exchanged , though expressing uncertainty and discreetly ambiguous , would have been significant to [Monica]195-monica . On [her]195-monica recovery , which took place in a few moments , [she]195-monica at once started up , and with hurried thanks to those about [her]195-monica , listening to nothing that was said and answering no inquiry , went out on to [the platform]865-the platform . There was just time to catch [the train]866-the train now departing for [Herne Hill]32-herne hill .

[She]195-monica explained [her]195-monica fainting fit by the hours of agitation through which [she]195-monica had passed . There was no room for surprise . [She]195-monica had suffered indescribably , and still suffered . [Her]195-monica wish was to get back into the quietness of [home]364-home , to rest and to lose [herself]195-monica in sleep .

On entering , [she]195-monica saw nothing of [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . [His]4145-her husband hat hung on the hall - tree , and [he]4145-her husband was perhaps sitting in [the library]3604-the library ; the more genial temper would account for [his]4145-her husband not coming forth at once to meet [her]195-monica , as had been [his]4145-her husband custom when [she]195-monica returned from an absence alone .

[She]195-monica changed [her]195-monica dress , and disguised as far as was possible the traces of suffering on [her]195-monica features . Weakness and tremor urged [her]195-monica to lie down , but [she]195-monica could not venture to do this until [she]195-monica had spoken to [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband . Supporting [herself]195-monica by the banisters , [she]195-monica slowly descended , and opened [the library]3604-the library door . [Widdowson]217-widdowson was reading a newspaper . [He]217-widdowson did not look round , but said carelessly ,

' So [you]195-monica are back ? '[217-widdowson]

' Yes . [I]217-widdowson hope [you]217-widdowson did n't expect [me]217-widdowson sooner . '[217-widdowson]

' Oh , it 's all right . '[217-widdowson] [He]217-widdowson threw a rapid glance at [her]195-monica over [his]217-widdowson shoulder . ' Had a long talk with [Virginia]191-virginia , [I]217-widdowson suppose ? '[217-widdowson]

' Yes . [I]217-widdowson could n't get away before . '[217-widdowson]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson seemed to be much interested in some paragraph . [He]217-widdowson put [his]217-widdowson face closer to the paper , and was silent for two or three seconds . Then [he]217-widdowson again looked round , this time observing [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife steadily , but with a face that gave no intimation of unusual thoughts .

' Does [she]191-virginia consent to go ? '[217-widdowson]

[Monica]195-monica replied that it was still uncertain ; [she]195-monica thought , however , that [Virginia]191-virginia 's objections would be overcome .

' [You]195-monica look very tired , '[462-the other] remarked [the other]462-the other .

' [I]195-monica am , very . '[195-monica]

And thereupon [she]195-monica withdrew , unable to command [her]195-monica countenance , scarce able to remain standing for another moment .

CHAPTER XXIV

TRACKED

When [Widdowson]217-widdowson went up to [the bedroom]466-the bedroom that night , [Monica]195-monica was already asleep . [He]217-widdowson discovered this on turning up the gas . The light fell upon [her]195-monica face , and [he]217-widdowson was drawn to the bedside to look at [her]195-monica . The features signified nothing but repose ; [her]195-monica lips were just apart , [her]195-monica eyelids lay softly with their black fringe of exquisite pencilling , and [her]195-monica hair was arranged as [she]195-monica always prepared it for the pillow . [He]217-widdowson watched [her]195-monica for full five minutes , and detected not the slightest movement , so profound was [her]195-monica sleep . Then [he]217-widdowson turned away , muttering savagely under [his]217-widdowson breath , ' Hypocrite ! Liar ! '[217-widdowson]

But for a purpose in [his]217-widdowson thoughts [he]217-widdowson would not have lain down beside [her]195-monica . On getting into bed [he]217-widdowson kept as far away as possible , and all through the wakeful night [his]217-widdowson limbs shrank from the touch of hers .

[He]217-widdowson rose an hour earlier than usual . [Monica]195-monica had long been awake , but [she]195-monica moved so seldom that [he]217-widdowson could not be sure of this ; [her]195-monica face was turned from [him]217-widdowson . When [he]217-widdowson came back to [the room]444-the room after [his]217-widdowson bath . [Monica]195-monica propped [herself]195-monica on [her]195-monica elbow and asked why [he]217-widdowson was moving so early .

' [I]217-widdowson want to be in [the City]3768-the city at nine , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson replied , with a show of cheerfulness . ' There 's a money affair [I]217-widdowson must see after . '[217-widdowson]

' Something that 's going wrong ? '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson 'm[217-widdowson] afraid so . [I]0-i must lose no time in looking to it . What plans have [you]217-widdowson for to - day ? '[217-widdowson]

' None whatever . '[195-monica]

' It 's Saturday , [you]217-widdowson know . [I]217-widdowson promised to see [Newdick]268-mr. newdick this afternoon . Perhaps [I]217-widdowson may bring [him]268-mr. newdick to dinner . '[217-widdowson]

About twelve o'clock [he]217-widdowson returned from [[his]217-widdowson business]2616-his business . At two [he]217-widdowson went away again , saying that [he]217-widdowson should not be back before seven , it might be a little later . In Monica these movements excited no special remark ; they were merely a continuance of [his]217-widdowson restlessness . But no sooner had [he]217-widdowson departed , after luncheon , than [she]2617-her went to [[her]2617-her dressing - room]2618-her dressing - room , and began to make slow , uncertain preparations for leaving [home]364-home [herself]2617-her .

This morning [she]2617-her had tried to write a letter for [Bevis]288-bevis , but vainly . [She]2617-her knew not what to say to [him]217-widdowson , uncertain of [her]2617-her own desires and of what lay before [her]2617-her . Yet , if [she]2617-her were to communicate with [him]217-widdowson henceforth at all , it was necessary , this very afternoon , to find an address where letters could be received for [her]2617-her , and to let [him]217-widdowson know of it . To - morrow , Sunday , was useless for the purpose , and on Monday it might be impossible for [her]2617-her to go out alone . Besides that , [she]2617-her could not be sure of the safety of a letter delivered at [the flat]5334-the flat on Monday night or Tuesday morning .

[She]2617-her dressed at length and went out . [Her]2617-her wisest course , probably , was to seek for [some obliging shopkeeper near [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill]2621-some obliging shopkeeper near lavender hill . Then [she]2617-her could call on [Virginia]191-virginia , transact the business [she]2617-her had pretended to discharge yesterday , and there pen a note to [Bevis]288-bevis .

[Her]2617-her moods alternated with distracting rapidity . A hundred times [she]2617-her had resolved that [Bevis]288-bevis could be nothing more to [her]2617-her , and again had thought of [him]217-widdowson with impulses of yearning , trying to persuade [herself]2617-her that [he]217-widdowson had acted well and wisely . A hundred times [she]2617-her determined to carry out [her]2617-her idea of yesterday to quit [[her]2617-her husband]4145-her husband and resist all [his]217-widdowson efforts to recall [her]2617-her and again had all but resigned [herself]2617-her to live with [him]217-widdowson , accepting degradation as [so many wives]2623-so many wives perforce did . [Her]2617-her mind was in confusion , and physically [she]2617-her felt far from well . A heaviness weighed upon [her]2617-her limbs , making it hardship to walk however short a distance .

Arrived at [Clapham Junction]51-clapham junction , [she]2617-her began to search wearily , indifferently , for the kind of shop that might answer [her]2617-her purpose . The receiving of letters which , for one reason or another , must be dispatched to [a secret address]2624-a secret address , is a very ordinary complaisance on the part of [small [London]6-london [stationers]2626-stationers]2625-small london stationers ; hundreds of such letters are sent and called for every week within [the metropolitan postal area]2627-the metropolitan postal area . It did not take [Monica]195-monica long to find [an obliging shopkeeper]2628-an obliging shopkeeper ; [the first to whom [she]2617-her applied [a decent woman behind a counter which displayed newspapers , tobacco , and fancy articles]2630-a decent woman behind a counter which displayed newspapers , tobacco , and fancy articles willingly accepted the commission]2629-the first to whom she applied a decent woman behind a counter which displayed newspapers , tobacco , and fancy articles willingly accepted the commission .

[She]2617-her came out of [the shop]582-the shop with flushed cheeks . Another step in shameful descent yet it had the result of strengthening once more [her]2617-her emotions favourable to [Bevis]288-bevis . On [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper account [she]2617-her had braved this ignominy , and it drew [her]2617-her towards [him]2628-an obliging shopkeeper , instead of producing the effect which would have seemed more natural . Perhaps the reason was that [she]2617-her felt [herself]2617-her more hopelessly [an outcast from the world of [honourable women]2633-honourable women]2632-an outcast from the world of honourable women , and therefore longed in [her]2617-her desolation for the support of [a man]3627-a man 's love . Did [he]2628-an obliging shopkeeper not love [her]2617-her ? It was [her]2617-her fault if [she]2617-her expected [him]2628-an obliging shopkeeper to act with a boldness that did not lie in [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper nature . Perhaps [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper discretion , which [she]2617-her had so bitterly condemned as weakness , meant a wise regard for [her]2617-her interests as well as [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper own . The public scandal of divorce was a hideous thing . If it damaged [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper prospects and sundered [him]2628-an obliging shopkeeper from [[his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper relatives]2635-his relatives , how could [she]2617-her hope that [his]2628-an obliging shopkeeper love of [her]2617-her , the cause of it all , would long endure ?

The need of love overcame [her]2617-her . [She]2617-her would submit to any conditions rather than lose [this lover whose kisses were upon [her]2617-her lips , and whose arms had held [her]2617-her so passionately]2636-this lover whose kisses were upon her lips , and whose arms had held her so passionately . [She]2617-her was too young to accept a life of resignation , too ardent . Why had [she]2617-her left [him]2628-an obliging shopkeeper in despondency , in doubt whether [he]2628-an obliging shopkeeper would ever again see [her]2617-her ?

[She]2617-her turned back on [her]2617-her way to [[Virginia]191-virginia 's lodgings]2595-virginia 's lodgings , re - entered [the station]586-the station , and journeyed townwards . It was an odd incident , by [Monica]195-monica unperceived , that when [she]2617-her was taking [her]2617-her ticket there stood close by [her]2617-her [a man , seemingly [a mechanic]2640-a mechanic , who had also stood within hearing when [she]2617-her booked at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill]2639-a man , seemingly a mechanic , who had also stood within hearing when she booked at herne hill . [This same man]2641-this same man , though [he]2641-this same man had not travelled in [the compartment]2642-the compartment with [her]2617-her , followed [her]2617-her when [she]2617-her alighted at [Bayswater]77-bayswater . [She]2617-her did not once observe [him]2641-this same man .

Instead of writing , [she]2617-her had resolved to see [Bevis]288-bevis again if it were possible . Perhaps [he]2641-this same man would not be at [the flat]5334-the flat ; yet [his]2641-this same man wish might suggest the bare hope of [her]2617-her coming to - day . The risk of meeting [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot probably need not be considered , for [he]2641-this same man had told [her]2617-her that [he]2641-this same man was travelling to - day into [Cumberland]86-cumberland , and for so long a journey [he]2641-this same man would be sure to set forth in the morning . At worst [she]2617-her would suffer a disappointment . Indulgence of [her]2617-her fervid feelings had made [her]2617-her as eager to see [Bevis]288-bevis as [she]2617-her was yesterday . Words of tenderness rushed to [her]2617-her lips for utterance . When [she]2617-her reached [the building]1065-the building all but delirium possessed [her]2617-her .

[She]2617-her had hurried up to [the first landing]2645-the first landing , when a footstep behind drew [her]2617-her attention . It was [a man in [mechanic]2647-mechanic 's dress , coming up with head bent , doubtless for some task or other in [one of [the flats]2649-the flats]2648-one of the flats]2646-a man in mechanic 's dress , coming up with head bent , doubtless for some task or other in one of the flats . Perhaps [he]2646-a man in mechanic 's dress , coming up with head bent , doubtless for some task or other in one of the flats was going to [[Bevis]288-bevis 's]2650-bevis 's . [She]2617-her went forward more slowly , and on [the next landing]2651-the next landing allowed [the man]350-the man to pass [her]2617-her . Yes , more likely than not [he]2646-a man in mechanic 's dress , coming up with head bent , doubtless for some task or other in one of the flats was engaged in packing [[her]2617-her lover]2138-her lover 's furniture . [She]2617-her stood still . At that moment a door closed above , and another step , lighter and quicker , that of [a woman]615-a woman , came [downstairs]523-downstairs . As far as [her]2617-her ear could judge , [this person]2656-this person might have left [[Bevis]288-bevis 's flat]2657-bevis 's flat . A conflict of emotions excited [her]2617-her to panic . [She]2617-her was afraid either to advance or to retreat , and in equal dread of standing without purpose . [She]2617-her stepped up to the nearest door , and gave a summons with the knocker .

This door was [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's . [She]2617-her knew that ; in the first instant of fear occasioned by [the workman]2658-the workman 's approach , [she]2617-her had glanced at the door and reminded [herself]2617-her that here [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot dwelt , immediately beneath [Bevis]288-bevis . But for the wild alarm due to [her]2617-her conscience - stricken state [she]2617-her could not have risked the possibility of [the tenant]2659-the tenant being still at [home]364-home ; and yet it seemed to [her]2617-her that [she]2617-her was doing the only thing possible under the circumstances . For [this woman whom [she]2617-her heard just above]2661-this woman whom she heard just above might perchance be [one of [[Bevis]288-bevis 's sisters]2663-bevis 's sisters]2662-one of bevis 's sisters , returned to [London]6-london for some purpose or other , and in that case [she]2661-this woman whom she heard just above preferred being seen at [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's door to detection as [she]2661-this woman whom she heard just above made for [[her]2661-this woman whom she heard just above lover]2138-her lover 's .

Uncertainty on this point lasted but a few seconds . Dreading to look at [the woman]5196-the woman , [Monica]195-monica yet did so , just as [she]195-monica passed , and beheld the face of [a perfect stranger]799-a perfect stranger . A young and good - looking face , however . [Her]195-monica mind , sufficiently tumultuous , received a new impulse of disturbance . Had [this woman]2086-this woman come forth from [[Bevis]288-bevis 's fiat]2668-bevis 's fiat or from the one opposite ? for on [each floor]2669-each floor there were [two dwellings]2670-two dwellings .

In the meantime [no one]3554-no one answered [her]195-monica knock . [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot had gone ; [she]195-monica breathed thankfully . Now [she]195-monica might venture to ascend to [the next floor]2672-the next floor . But then sounded a knock from above . That , [she]195-monica felt convinced , was at [Bevis]288-bevis 's door , and if so [her]195-monica conjecture about [the workman]2658-the workman was correct . [She]195-monica stood waiting for certainty , as if still expecting a reply to [her]195-monica own signal at [[Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's door]2674-mr. barfoot 's door . [The mechanic]2675-the mechanic looked down at [her]195-monica over the banisters , but of this [she]195-monica was unaware .

The knock above was repeated . Yes , this time there could be no mistake ; it was on this side of [the landing]2320-the landing that is to say , at [[her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover 's door . But the door did not open ; thus , without going up [herself]195-monica , [she]195-monica received assurance that [Bevis]288-bevis was not at [home]364-home . [He]2138-her lover might come later . [She]195-monica still had an hour or two to spare . So , as if disappointed in a call at [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's , [she]195-monica descended [the stairs]2317-the stairs and issued into [the street]594-the street .

Agitation had exhausted [her]195-monica , and a dazzling of [her]195-monica eyes threatened a recurrence of yesterday 's faintness . [She]195-monica found [a shop]2681-a shop where refreshments were sold , and sat for half an hour over a cup of tea , trying to amuse [herself]195-monica with illustrated papers . [The mechanic who had knocked at [Bevis]288-bevis 's door]2682-the mechanic who had knocked at bevis 's door passed once or twice along [the pavement]1025-the pavement , and , as long as [she]195-monica remained [here]3495-here , kept [the shop]582-the shop within sight .

At length [she]195-monica asked for writing materials , and penned a few lines . If on [her]195-monica second attempt [she]195-monica failed to see [Bevis]288-bevis , [she]195-monica would drop this note into [his]249-mr. barfoot letter - box . It acquainted [him]249-mr. barfoot with the address to which [he]249-mr. barfoot might direct letters , assured [him]249-mr. barfoot passionately of [her]195-monica love , and implored [him]249-mr. barfoot to be true to [her]195-monica , to send for [her]195-monica as soon as circumstances made it possible .

Self - torment of every kind was natural to [her]195-monica position . Though the relief of escaping from several distinct dangers had put [her]195-monica mind comparatively at ease for a short time , [she]195-monica had now begun to suffer a fresh uneasiness with reference to [the young and handsome woman who came]2686-the young and handsome woman who came [downstairs]523-downstairs . The fact that [no one answered the workman]2688-no one answered the workman 's knock had seemed to [her]195-monica a sufficient proof that [Bevis]288-bevis was not at [home]364-home , and that [the stranger]449-the stranger must have come forth from [the flat opposite]2691-the flat opposite [his]249-mr. barfoot . But [she]195-monica recollected the incident which had so alarmingly disturbed [her]195-monica and [[her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover yesterday . [Bevis]288-bevis did not then go to the door , and suppose oh , it was folly ! But suppose [that woman]5016-that woman had been with [him]249-mr. barfoot ; suppose [he]249-mr. barfoot did not care to open to [a visitor whose signal sounded only a minute or two after that person]2694-a visitor whose signal sounded only a minute or two after that person 's departure ?

Had [she]195-monica not anguish enough to endure without the addition of frantic jealousy ? [She]195-monica would not give another thought to such absurd suggestions . [The woman]5196-the woman had of course come from the dwelling opposite . Yet why might [she]195-monica not have been in [[Bevis]288-bevis 's flat]2657-bevis 's flat when [he]249-mr. barfoot [himself]249-mr. barfoot was absent ? Suppose [her]195-monica an intimate to whom [he]249-mr. barfoot had entrusted a latch - key . If any such connection existed , might it not help to explain [Bevis]288-bevis 's half - heartedness ?

To think thus was courting madness . Unable to sit still any longer , [Monica]195-monica left [the shop]582-the shop , and strayed for some ten minutes about [the neighbouring streets]1720-the neighbouring streets , drawing nearer and nearer to [her]195-monica goal . Finally [she]195-monica entered [the building]1065-the building and went [upstairs]443-upstairs . On this occasion [no one]3554-no one met [her]195-monica , and [no one]3554-no one entered in [her]195-monica rear . [She]195-monica knocked at [[her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover 's door , and stood longing , praying , that it might open . But it did not . Tears started to [her]195-monica eyes ; [she]195-monica uttered a moan of bitterest disappointment , and slipped the envelope [she]195-monica was carrying into the letter - box .

[The mechanic]2675-the mechanic had seen [her]195-monica go in , and [he]2675-the mechanic waited outside , a few yards away . Either [she]195-monica would soon reappear , or [her]195-monica not doing so would show that [she]195-monica had obtained admittance somewhere . In the latter case , [this workman of much curiosity and leisure]2705-this workman of much curiosity and leisure had only to lurk about the staircase until [she]195-monica came forth again . But this trial of patience was spared [him]2675-the mechanic . [He]2675-the mechanic found that [he]2675-the mechanic had simply to follow [the lady]4316-the lady back to [Herne Hill]32-herne hill . Acting on very suggestive instructions , it never occurred to [the worthy man]2707-the worthy man that [the lady]4316-the lady 's second visit was not to [the same flat]2709-the same flat as in the former instance .

[Monica]195-monica was [home]364-home again long before dinner - time . When that hour arrived [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband had not yet come ; the delay , no doubt , was somehow connected with [his]4145-her husband visit to [Mr. Newdick]268-mr. newdick . But this went on . At nine o'clock [Monica]195-monica still sat alone , hungry , yet scarce conscious of hunger owing to [her]195-monica miseries . [Widdowson]217-widdowson had never behaved thus . Another quarter of an hour and [she]195-monica heard the front door open .

[He]217-widdowson came to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room , where [she]195-monica sat waiting .

' How late [you]217-widdowson are ! Are [you]217-widdowson alone ? '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , alone . '[217-widdowson]

' [You]217-widdowson have n't had dinner ? '[217-widdowson]

' No . '[217-widdowson]

[He]217-widdowson seemed to be in rather a gloomy mood , but [Monica]195-monica noticed nothing that alarmed [her]195-monica . [He]217-widdowson was drawing nearer , [his]217-widdowson eyes on the ground .

' Have [you]217-widdowson had bad news in [the City]3768-the city ? '[217-widdowson]

' Yes , [I]217-widdowson have . '[217-widdowson]

Still [he]217-widdowson came nearer , and at length , when a yard or two away , raised [his]217-widdowson look to [her]195-monica face .

' Have [you]217-widdowson been out this afternoon ? '[217-widdowson]

[She]195-monica was prompted to a falsehood , but durst not utter it , so keenly was [he]217-widdowson regarding [her]195-monica .

' Yes , [I]217-widdowson went to see [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot . '[217-widdowson]

' Liar ! '[217-widdowson]

As the word burst from [his]217-widdowson lips , [he]217-widdowson sprang at [her]195-monica , clutched [her]195-monica dress at the throat , and flung [her]195-monica violently upon [her]195-monica knees . A short cry of terror escaped [her]195-monica ; then [she]195-monica was stricken dumb , with eyes starting and mouth open . It was well that [he]217-widdowson held [her]195-monica by the garment and not by the neck , for [his]217-widdowson hand closed with murderous convulsion , and the desire of crushing out [her]195-monica life was for an instant all [his]217-widdowson consciousness .

' [Liar]5551-liar ! '[217-widdowson] again burst from [him]217-widdowson . ' Day after day [you]5551-liar have lied to [me]217-widdowson . [Liar]5551-liar ! [Adultress]303-adultress ! '[217-widdowson]

' [I]195-monica am not ! [I]195-monica am not that ! '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica clung upon [his]217-widdowson arms and strove to raise [herself]195-monica . The bloodless lips , the choked voice , meant dread of [him]217-widdowson , but the distortion of [her]195-monica features was hatred and the will to resist .

' Not that ? What is [your]5551-liar word worth ? [The prostitute in [the street]594-the street]5553-the prostitute in the street is sooner to be believed . [She]5553-the prostitute in the street has the honesty to say what [she]5553-the prostitute in the street is , but [you]5551-liar Where were [you]5551-liar yesterday when [you]5551-liar were not at [[your]5551-liar sister]3611-your sister 's ? Where were [you]5551-liar this afternoon ? '[217-widdowson]

[She]195-monica had nearly struggled to [her]195-monica feet ; [he]217-widdowson thrust [her]195-monica down again , crushed [her]195-monica backwards until [her]195-monica head all but touched the floor .

' Where were [you]5551-liar ? Tell the truth , or [you]5551-liar shall never speak again ! '[217-widdowson]

' Oh help ! help ! [He]217-widdowson will kill [me]217-widdowson ! '[217-widdowson]

[Her]195-monica cry rang through [the room]444-the room .

' Call [them]5556-them up let [them]5556-them come and look at [you]5551-liar and hear what [you]5551-liar are . Soon enough [every one]3621-every one will know . Where were [you]5551-liar this afternoon ? [You]5551-liar were watched every step of the way from here to that place where [you]5551-liar have made [yourself]5551-liar [a base , vile , unclean creature]5558-a base , vile , unclean creature . '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson am not that ! [[Your]5551-liar spies]5559-your spies have misled [you]5551-liar . '[217-widdowson]

' Misled ? Did n't [you]5551-liar go to that man [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's door and knock there ? And because [you]5551-liar were disappointed , did n't [you]5551-liar wait about , and go there a second time ? '[195-monica]

' What if [I]217-widdowson did ? It does n't mean what [you]5551-liar think . '[217-widdowson]

' What ? [You]5551-liar go time after time to [the private chambers]5560-the private chambers of [an unmarried man]3990-an unmarried man [a man such as that]5562-a man such as that and it means no harm ? '[195-monica]

' [I]217-widdowson have never been [there]453-there before . '[217-widdowson]

' [You]217-widdowson expect [me]217-widdowson to believe [you]217-widdowson ? '[217-widdowson] [Widdowson]217-widdowson cried with savage contumely . [He]217-widdowson had just loosed [his]217-widdowson hold of [her]2714-her , and [she]2714-her was upright again before [him]217-widdowson , [her]2714-her eyes flashing defiance , though every muscle in [her]2714-her frame quivered . ' When did [your]217-widdowson lies begin ? Was it when [you]217-widdowson told [me]2714-her [you]217-widdowson had been to hear [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's lecture , and never went [there]453-there at all ? '[2714-her]

[He]217-widdowson aimed the charge at [a venture]2715-a venture , and [her]2714-her face told [him]217-widdowson that [his]217-widdowson suspicion had been grounded .

' For how many weeks , for how many months , have [you]217-widdowson been dishonouring [me]2714-her and [yourself]217-widdowson ? '[2714-her]

' [I]2715-a venture am not guilty of what [you]217-widdowson believe , but [I]2715-a venture sha n't try to defend [myself]2715-a venture . Thank Heaven , this is the end of everything between [us]5565-us ! Charge [me]2715-a venture with what [you]217-widdowson like . [I]2715-a venture am going away from [you]217-widdowson , and [I]2715-a venture hope [we]5565-us may never meet again . '[2715-a venture]

' Yes , [you]217-widdowson are going no doubt of that . But not before [you]217-widdowson have answered [my]525-both questions . Whether with lies or not does n't matter much . [You]217-widdowson shall give [your]217-widdowson own account of what [you]217-widdowson have been doing . '[525-both]

[Both]525-both panting as if after some supreme effort of [their]525-both physical force , [they]525-both stood and looked at [each other]543-each other . Each to [the other]462-the other 's eyes was incredibly transformed . [Monica]195-monica could not have imagined such brutal ferocity in [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband 's face , and [she]195-monica [herself]195-monica had a wild recklessness in [her]195-monica eyes , a scorn and abhorrence in all the lines of [her]195-monica countenance , which made [Widdowson]217-widdowson feel as if [a stranger]557-a stranger were before [him]217-widdowson .

' [I]195-monica shall answer no question whatever , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica replied . ' All [I]195-monica want is to leave [[your]217-widdowson house]4117-your house , and never see [you]217-widdowson again . '[195-monica]

[He]217-widdowson regretted what [he]217-widdowson had done . The result of the first day 's espionage being a piece of evidence so incomplete , [he]217-widdowson had hoped to command [himself]217-widdowson until more solid proof of [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's guilt were forthcoming . But jealousy was too strong for such prudence , and the sight of [Monica]195-monica as [she]195-monica uttered [her]195-monica falsehood made a mere madman of [him]217-widdowson . Predisposed to believe a story of this kind , [he]217-widdowson could not reason as [he]217-widdowson might have done if fear of [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot had never entered [his]217-widdowson thoughts . The whole course of dishonour seemed so clear ; [he]217-widdowson traced it from [Monica]195-monica 's earliest meetings with [Barfoot]212-miss barfoot at [Chelsea]19-chelsea . Wavering between the impulse to cast off [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife with every circumstance of public shame , and the piteous desire to arrest [her]195-monica on [her]195-monica path of destruction , [he]217-widdowson rushed into a middle course , compatible with neither of these intentions . If at this stage [he]217-widdowson chose to tell [Monica]195-monica what had come to [his]217-widdowson knowledge , it should have been done with the sternest calm , with dignity capable of shaming [her]195-monica guilt . As it was , [he]217-widdowson had spoilt [his]217-widdowson chances in every direction . Perhaps [Monica]195-monica understood this ; [he]217-widdowson had begun to esteem [her]195-monica [a mistress in craft and intrigue]2723-a mistress in craft and intrigue .

' [You]195-monica say [you]195-monica were never at [[that man]5567-that man 's rooms]5568-that man 's rooms before to - day ? '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson asked in a lower voice .

' What [I]217-widdowson have said [you]195-monica must take the trouble to recollect . [I]217-widdowson shall answer no question . '[217-widdowson]

Again the impulse assailed [him]217-widdowson to wring confession from [her]195-monica by terror . [He]217-widdowson took a step forward , the demon in [his]217-widdowson face . [Monica]195-monica in that moment leapt past [him]217-widdowson , and reached the door of [the room]444-the room before [he]217-widdowson could stop [her]195-monica .

' Stay where [you]217-widdowson are ! '[195-monica] [she]195-monica cried , ' If [your]217-widdowson hands touch [me]195-monica again [I]195-monica shall call for help until [someone]4055-someone comes up . [I]195-monica wo n't endure [your]217-widdowson touch ! '[195-monica]

' Do [you]217-widdowson pretend [you]217-widdowson are innocent of any crime against [me]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica am not what [you]217-widdowson called [me]195-monica . Explain everything as [you]217-widdowson like . [I]195-monica will explain nothing . [I]195-monica want only to be free from [you]217-widdowson . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica opened the door , rapidly crossed [the landing]2320-the landing , and went [upstairs]443-upstairs . Feeling it was useless to follow , [Widdowson]217-widdowson allowed the door to remain wide , and waited . Five minutes passed and [Monica]195-monica came down again , dressed for leaving [the house]368-the house .

' Where are [you]195-monica going ? '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson asked , stepping out of [the room]444-the room to intercept [her]195-monica .

' It is nothing to [you]195-monica . [I]217-widdowson am going away . '[217-widdowson]

[They]2729-they subdued [their]2729-they voices , which might else have been audible to [the servants below]2730-the servants below .

' No , that [you]195-monica shall not ! '[2729-they]

[He]217-widdowson stepped forward to block the head of the stairs , but again [Monica]195-monica was too quick for [him]217-widdowson . [She]195-monica fled down , and across [the hall]2087-the hall , and to [the house]368-the house - door . Only there , as [she]195-monica was arrested by the difficulty of drawing back the two latches , did [Widdowson]217-widdowson overtake [her]195-monica .

' Make what scandal [you]195-monica like , [you]195-monica do n't leave [this house]947-this house . '[217-widdowson]

[His]217-widdowson tones were violent rather than resolute . What could [he]217-widdowson do ? If [Monica]195-monica persisted , what means had [he]217-widdowson of confining [her]195-monica to [the house]368-the house short of carrying [her]195-monica by main force to [an upper room]2734-an upper room and there locking [her]195-monica in ? [He]217-widdowson knew that [his]217-widdowson courage would not sustain [him]217-widdowson through such a task as this .

' For scandal [I]195-monica care nothing , '[195-monica] was [her]195-monica reply . ' One way or another [I]195-monica will leave [the house]368-the house . '[195-monica]

' Where are [you]217-widdowson going ? '[195-monica]

' To [[my]195-monica sister]3519-my sister 's . '[195-monica]

[His]217-widdowson hand on the door , [Widdowson]217-widdowson stood as if determined in opposition . But [her]195-monica will was stronger than [his]217-widdowson . Only by homicide can [a man]3627-a man maintain [his]3627-a man dignity in a situation of this kind ; [Widdowson]217-widdowson could not kill [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife , and every moment that [he]217-widdowson stood there made [him]217-widdowson more ridiculous , more contemptible .

[He]217-widdowson turned back into [the hall]2087-the hall and reached [his]217-widdowson hat . Whilst [he]217-widdowson was doing so [Monica]195-monica opened the door . Heavy rain was falling , but [she]195-monica paid no heed to it . In a moment [Widdowson]217-widdowson hastened after [her]195-monica , careless , [he]217-widdowson too , of the descending floods . [Her]195-monica way was towards [the railway station]3507-the railway station , but [the driver of [a cab]836-a cab]2739-the driver of a cab chancing to attract [her]195-monica notice , [she]195-monica accepted [the man]350-the man 's offer , and bade [him]350-the man drive to [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill .

On the first opportunity [Widdowson]217-widdowson took like refuge from the rain , and was driven in the same direction . [He]217-widdowson alighted not far from [[Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's house]2569-mrs. conisbee 's house . That [Monica]195-monica had come hither [he]217-widdowson felt no doubt , but [he]217-widdowson would presently make sure of it . As it still rained [he]217-widdowson sought shelter in [a public - house]2743-a public - house , where [he]217-widdowson quenched a painful thirst , and then satisfied [his]217-widdowson hunger with such primitive foods as [a licensed victualler]2744-a licensed victualler is disposed to vend . It was nearing eleven o'clock , and [he]217-widdowson had neither eaten nor drunk since luncheon .

After that [he]217-widdowson walked to [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's , and knocked at the door . [The landlady]447-the landlady came .

' Will [you]447-the landlady please to tell [me]217-widdowson , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson asked ' whether [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson is [here]3495-here ? '[217-widdowson]

The sly curiosity of [the woman]5196-the woman 's face informed [him]217-widdowson at once that [she]5196-the woman saw something unusual in these circumstances .

' Yes , [sir]4958-sir . [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson is with [[her]265-mrs. widdowson sister]455-her sister , '[5196-the woman]

' Thank [you]4958-sir . '[5196-the woman]

Without another word [he]217-widdowson departed . But went only a short distance , and until midnight kept [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's door in view . The rain fell , the air was raw ; shelterless , and often shivering with fever , [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson walked [the pavement]1025-the pavement with [a constable]2748-a constable 's regularity . [He]217-widdowson could not but remember the many nights when [he]217-widdowson thus kept watch in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road and in [Rutland Street]55-rutland street , with jealousy , then too , burning in [his]217-widdowson heart , but also with amorous ardours , never again to be revived . A little more than twelve months ago ! And [he]217-widdowson had waited , longed for marriage through half a lifetime .

CHAPTER XXV

THE FATE OF THE IDEAL

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's week at [the seashore]1760-the seashore was spoilt by uncertain weather . Only two days of abiding sunshine ; for the rest , mere fitful gleams across a sky heaped with stormclouds . Over [Wastdale]149-wastdale hung a black canopy ; from [Scawfell]150-scawfell came mutterings of thunder ; and on the last night of the week when [Monica]195-monica fled from [[her]195-monica home]1869-her home in pelting rain tempest broke upon [the mountains]5369-the mountains and [the sea]417-the sea . Wakeful until early morning , and at times watching the sky from [her]195-monica inland - looking window , [Rhoda]197-rhoda saw [the rocky heights that frown upon [Wastwater]151-wastwater]2753-the rocky heights that frown upon wastwater illuminated by lightning - flare of such intensity and duration that miles of distance were annihilated , and it seemed but a step to these stern crags and precipices .

Sunday began with rain , but also with promise of better things ; far over [the sea]417-the sea was a broad expanse of blue , and before long the foam of the fallen tide glistened in strong , hopeful rays . [Rhoda]197-rhoda wandered about [the shore]3760-the shore towards [St. Bees Head]152-st. bees head . [A broad stream flowing into the sea]2756-a broad stream flowing into the sea stopped [her]197-rhoda progress before [she]197-rhoda had gone very far ; the only way of crossing [it]2756-a broad stream flowing into the sea was to go up on to [the line of railway]2757-the line of railway , which here runs along [the edge of the sands]2758-the edge of the sands . But [she]197-rhoda had little inclination to walk farther . [No house]2759-no house , [no person within sight]2760-no person within sight , [she]197-rhoda sat down to gaze at the gulls fishing by [the little river - mouth]2761-the little river - mouth , [their]2762-their screams the only sound that blended with that of the subdued breakers .

On the horizon lay a long , low shape that might have been mistaken for cloud , though it resembled [land]827-land . [It]2764-it was [the Isle of [Man]154-man]153-the isle of man . In an hour or two the outline had grown much clearer ; [the heights]2765-the heights and hollows were no longer doubtful . In [the north]2766-the north became visible [another remote and hilly tract]2767-another remote and hilly tract , it was [the coast of [Scotland]141-scotland beyond [Solway Firth]155-solway firth]2768-the coast of scotland beyond solway firth .

[These distant objects]2769-these distant objects acted as incentives to [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's imagination . [She]197-rhoda heard [Everard Barfoot]242-everard 's voice as [he]242-everard talked of travel of [the Orient Express]2770-the orient express . That joy of freedom [he]242-everard had offered [her]197-rhoda . Perhaps [he]242-everard was now very near [her]197-rhoda , anxious to repeat [his]242-everard offer . If [he]242-everard carried out the project suggested at [their]2771-their last interview , [she]197-rhoda would see [him]242-everard to - day or to - morrow morning then [she]197-rhoda must make [her]197-rhoda choice . To have a day 's walk with [him]242-everard among [the mountains]5369-the mountains would be practically deciding . But for what ? If [she]197-rhoda rejected [his]242-everard proposal of a free union , was [he]242-everard prepared to marry [her]197-rhoda in legal form ? Yes ; [she]197-rhoda had enough power over [him]242-everard for that . But how would it affect [his]242-everard thought of [her]197-rhoda ? Constraining [him]242-everard to legal marriage , would [she]197-rhoda not lower [herself]197-rhoda in [his]242-everard estimation , and make the endurance of [his]242-everard love less probable ? [Barfoot]242-everard was not [a man]3627-a man to accept with genuine satisfaction even the appearance of bondage , and more likely than not [his]242-everard love of [her]197-rhoda depended upon the belief that in [her]197-rhoda [he]242-everard had found [a woman]615-a woman capable of regarding life from [his]242-everard own point of view [a woman who , when [she]197-rhoda once , loved , would be scornful of the formalities clung to by feeble minds]2775-a woman who , when she once , loved , would be scornful of the formalities clung to by feeble minds . [He]242-everard would yield to [her]197-rhoda if [she]197-rhoda demanded forms , but afterwards when passion had subsided .

A week had been none too long to ponder these considerations by themselves ; but they were complicated with doubts of a more disturbing nature . [Her]197-rhoda mind could not free itself from the thought of [Monica]195-monica . That [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was not always truthful with [[her]265-mrs. widdowson husband]4145-her husband [she]265-mrs. widdowson had absolute proof ; whether that supported [her]265-mrs. widdowson fear of an intimacy between [Monica]195-monica and [Everard]242-everard [she]265-mrs. widdowson was unable to determine . The grounds of suspicion seemed to [her]197-rhoda very grave ; so grave , that during [her]197-rhoda first day or two in [Cumberland]86-cumberland [she]197-rhoda had all but renounced the hopes long secretly fostered . [She]197-rhoda knew [herself]197-rhoda well enough to understand how jealousy might wreck [her]197-rhoda life even if it were only retrospective . If [she]197-rhoda married [Barfoot]242-everard forms or none that question in no way touched this other , [she]197-rhoda would demand of [him]242-everard a flawless faith . [Her]197-rhoda pride revolted against the thought of possessing only a share in [his]242-everard devotion ; the moment that any faithlessness came to [her]197-rhoda knowledge [she]197-rhoda would leave [him]242-everard , perforce , inevitably and what miseries were then before [her]197-rhoda !

Was flawless faith possible to [Everard Barfoot]242-everard ? [[His]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin would ridicule the hope of any such thing or so [Rhoda]197-rhoda believed . [A conventional woman]2778-a conventional woman would of course see the completest evidence of [his]242-everard untrustworthiness in [his]242-everard dislike of legal marriage ; but [Rhoda]197-rhoda knew the idleness of this argument . If love did not hold [him]242-everard , assuredly the forms of marriage could be no restraint upon [Everard]242-everard ; married ten times over , [he]242-everard would still deem [himself]242-everard absolutely free from any obligation save that of love . Yet how did [he]242-everard think of that obligation ? [He]242-everard might hold it perfectly compatible with the indulgence of casual impulse . And this which [she]197-rhoda suspected to be the view of [every man]4190-every man [Rhoda]197-rhoda had no power of tolerating . It must be all or nothing , whole faith or none whatever .

In the afternoon [she]197-rhoda suffered from impatient expectancy . If [Barfoot]242-everard came to - day [she]197-rhoda imagined [him]242-everard somewhere in [the neighbourhood]1128-the neighbourhood , approaching [Seascale]137-seascale as the time of [his]242-everard appointment drew near would [he]242-everard call at [[her]197-rhoda lodgings]5276-her lodgings ? The address [she]197-rhoda had not given [him]242-everard , but doubtless [he]242-everard had obtained it from [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin . Perhaps [he]242-everard would prefer to meet [her]197-rhoda unexpectedly not a difficult thing in [this little place]698-this little place , with [[its]698-this little place handful of [residents]2785-residents]2784-its handful of residents and [visitors]3562-visitors . Certain it was [she]197-rhoda desired [his]242-everard arrival . [Her]197-rhoda heart leapt with joy in the thought that this very evening might bring [him]242-everard . [She]197-rhoda wished to study [him]242-everard under new conditions , and possibly to talk with [him]242-everard even more frankly than ever yet , for there would be opportunity enough .

About six o'clock [a train]4900-a train coming from [the south]2788-the south stopped at [the station]586-the station , which was visible from [[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's sitting - room window]2790-rhoda 's sitting - room window . [She]197-rhoda had been waiting for this moment . [She]197-rhoda could not go to [the station]586-the station , and did not venture even to wait anywhere in sight of [the exit]2792-the exit . Whether [any passenger]2793-any passenger had alighted must remain uncertain . If [Everard]242-everard had arrived by [this train]2794-this train , doubtless [he]242-everard would go to [the hotel]5444-the hotel , which stood only a few yards from the line . [He]242-everard would take a meal and presently come forth .

Having allowed half an hour to elapse , [she]197-rhoda dressed and walked [shoreward]2796-shoreward . [Seascale]137-seascale has [no street]2797-no street , [no shops]2798-no shops ; only two or three short rows of houses irregularly placed on [the rising ground above [the beach]2800-the beach]2799-the rising ground above the beach . To cross [the intervening railway]2801-the intervening railway , [Rhoda]197-rhoda could either pass through [the little station]2802-the little station , in which case [she]197-rhoda would also pass [the hotel]5444-the hotel and be observable from [its]5444-the hotel chief windows , or descend by [a longer road]2804-a longer road which led under [a bridge]2805-a bridge , and in this way avoid [the hotel]5444-the hotel altogether . [She]197-rhoda took [the former route]2807-the former route . On [the sands]2808-the sands were [a few scattered people]2809-a few scattered people , and [some children]2810-some children subdued to Sunday decorum . The tide was rising . [She]197-rhoda went down to [the nearest tract of hard sand]2811-the nearest tract of hard sand , and stood there for a long time , a soft western breeze playing upon [her]197-rhoda face .

If [Barfoot]242-everard were [here]3495-here [he]242-everard would now be coming out to look for [her]197-rhoda . From a distance [he]242-everard might not recognize [her]197-rhoda figure , clad as [she]197-rhoda was in a costume such as [he]242-everard had never seen [her]197-rhoda wearing . [She]197-rhoda might venture now to walk up towards [the dry , white sandheaps]2813-the dry , white sandheaps , where the little convolvulus grew in abundance , and other flowers of which [she]197-rhoda neither knew nor cared to learn the names . Scarcely had [she]197-rhoda turned when [she]197-rhoda saw [Everard]242-everard approaching , still far off , but unmistakable . [He]242-everard signalled by taking off [his]242-everard hat , and quickly was beside [her]197-rhoda .

' Did [you]242-everard know [me]197-rhoda before [I]197-rhoda happened to look round ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda asked laughingly .

' Of course [I]242-everard did . Up there by [the station]586-the station [I]242-everard caught sight of [you]242-everard . Who else bears [herself]5577-herself as [you]242-everard do with splendid disdain of [common mortals]5578-common mortals ? '[242-everard]

' Please do n't make [me]242-everard think that [my]242-everard movements are ridiculous . '[242-everard]

' They are superb . [The sea]417-the sea has already touched [your]242-everard cheeks . But [I]242-everard am afraid [you]242-everard have had abominable weather . '[242-everard]

' Yes , rather bad ; but there 's hope to - day . Where do [you]242-everard come from ? '[242-everard]

' By [train]3815-train , only from [Carnforth]156-carnforth . [I]242-everard left [London]6-london yesterday morning , and stopped at [Morecambe]157-morecambe [some people]5581-some people [I]242-everard know are there . As trains were awkward to - day , [I]242-everard drove from [Morecambe]157-morecambe to [Carnforth]156-carnforth . Did [you]242-everard expect [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard thought [you]242-everard might come , as [you]242-everard spoke of it . '[242-everard]

' How [I]242-everard have got through the week [I]242-everard could n't tell [you]242-everard . [I]242-everard should have been here days ago , but [I]242-everard was afraid . Let [us]5582-us go nearer to [the sea]417-the sea . [I]242-everard was afraid of making [you]242-everard angry . '[242-everard]

' It 's better to keep [one]472-one 's word . '[242-everard]

' Of course it is . And [I]242-everard am all the more delighted to be with [you]242-everard for the miserable week of waiting . Have [you]242-everard bathed ? '[242-everard]

' Once or twice . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard had a swim this morning before breakfast , in pouring rain . Now [you]242-everard ca n't swim . '[242-everard]

' No . [I]242-everard ca n't . But why were [you]242-everard sure about it ? '[242-everard]

' Only because it 's so rare for [any girl]5585-any girl to learn swimming . [A man who ca n't swim]5586-a man who ca n't swim is only half [the man [he]5586-a man who ca n't swim might be]5587-the man he might be , and to [a woman]615-a woman [I]242-everard should think it must be of even more benefit . As in everything else , [women]3478-women are trammelled by [their]3478-women clothes ; to be able to get rid of [them]3478-women , and to move about with free and brave exertion of all the body , must tend to every kind of health , physical , mental , and mortal . '[242-everard]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda quite believe that , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , gazing at [the sea]417-the sea .

' [I]242-everard spoke rather exultantly , did n't [I]242-everard ? [I]242-everard like to feel [myself]242-everard superior to [you]242-everard in some things . [You]242-everard have so often pointed out to [me]242-everard what [a paltry , ineffectual creature]5590-a paltry , ineffectual creature [I]242-everard am . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard do n't remember ever using those words , or implying them . '[242-everard]

' How does the day stand with [you]242-everard ? '[242-everard] asked [Everard]242-everard in the tone of perfect comradeship . ' Have [you]242-everard still to dine ? '[242-everard]

' [My]242-everard dining is a very simple matter ; it happens at one o'clock . About nine [I]242-everard shall have supper . '[242-everard]
