' Let [us]2815-us walk a little then . And may [I]242-everard smoke ? '[242-everard]

' Why not ? '[242-everard]

[Everard]242-everard lit a cigar , and , as the tide drove [them]2815-us back , [they]2815-us moved eventually to [the higher ground]2816-the higher ground , whence there was a fine view of [the mountains]5369-the mountains , rich in evening colours .

' To - morrow [you]242-everard leave [here]3495-here ? '[242-everard]

' Yes , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered . ' [I]197-rhoda shall go by railway to [Coniston]158-coniston , and walk from there towards [Helvellyn]159-helvellyn , as [you]242-everard suggested . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]242-everard have something else to propose . [A man [I]242-everard talked to in [the train]866-the train]5592-a man i talked to in the train told [me]242-everard of a fine walk in [this neighbourhood]4654-this neighbourhood . From [Ravenglass]160-ravenglass , just below here , there 's a little line runs up [Eskdale]164-eskdale to a terminus at [the foot of [Scawfell]150-scawfell]5595-the foot of scawfell , [a place called [Boot]162-boot]5596-a place called boot . From [Boot]162-boot [one]472-one can walk either over [the top of [Scawfell]150-scawfell]5598-the top of scawfell or by [a lower track to [Wastdale Head]163-wastdale head]5599-a lower track to wastdale head . It 's very grand , [wild country]5600-wild country , especially the last part , the going down to [Wastwater]151-wastwater , and not many miles in all . Suppose [we]5601-we have that walk to - morrow ? From [Wastdale]149-wastdale [we]5601-we could drive back to [Seascale]137-seascale in the evening , and then the next day just as [you]2818-you like . '[242-everard]

' Are [you]2818-you quite sure about the distances ? '[197-rhoda]

' Quite . [I]2818-you have the Ordnance map in [my]2818-you pocket . Let [me]2818-you show [you]2819-we . '[2818-you]

[He]2818-you spread the map on the top of a wall , and [they]2819-we stood side by side inspecting it .

' [We]2819-we must take something to eat ; [I]197-rhoda 'll provide for that . And at [the Wastdale Head hotel]5602-the wastdale head hotel [we]2819-we can have dinner about three or four , probably . It would be enjoyable , would n't it ? '[197-rhoda]

' If it does n't rain . '[197-rhoda]

' [We]2819-we 'll hope it wo n't . As [we]2819-we go back [we]2819-we can look out [the trains]5603-the trains at [the station]586-the station . No doubt there 's one soon after breakfast . '[197-rhoda]

[Their]2819-we rambling , with talk in a strain of easy friendliness , brought [them]2819-we back to [Seascale]137-seascale half an hour after sunset , which was of a kind that seemed to promise well for the morrow .

' Wo n't [you]242-everard come out again after supper ? '[242-everard] [Barfoot]242-everard asked .

' Not again to - night . '[197-rhoda]

' For a quarter of an hour , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard urged . ' Just down to [the sea]417-the sea and back . '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda have been walking all day . [I]197-rhoda shall be glad to rest and read . '[197-rhoda]

' Very well . To - morrow morning . '[242-everard]

Having discovered [the train]866-the train which would take [them]2819-we to [Ravenglass]160-ravenglass , and connect with one on [the [Eskdale]164-eskdale line]2821-the eskdale line , [they]2819-we agreed to meet at [the station]586-the station . [Barfoot]242-everard was to bring with [him]242-everard such refreshment as would be necessary .

[Their]2819-we hopes for the weather had complete fulfilment . The only fear was lest the sun 's heat might be oppressive , but this anxiety could be cheerfully borne . Slung over [his]242-everard shoulders [Barfoot]242-everard had a small forage - bag , which gave [him]242-everard matter for talk on the railway journey ; it had been [[his]242-everard companion]675-his companion in [many parts of [the world]3462-the world]2824-many parts of the world , and had held strange kinds of food .

The journey up [Eskdale]164-eskdale , from [Ravenglass]160-ravenglass to [Boot]162-boot , is by [a miniature railway , with the oddest little engine and [a carriage]1995-a carriage or two of primitive simplicity]2826-a miniature railway , with the oddest little engine and a carriage or two of primitive simplicity . At each station on [the upward winding track stations]2828-the upward winding track stations represented only by [a wooden shed like [a tool - house]2830-a tool - house]2829-a wooden shed like a tool - house [the guard]2831-the guard jumps down and acts as [booking - clerk]2832-booking - clerk , if [passengers]2833-passengers there be desirous of booking . In a few miles the scenery changes from beauty to grandeur , and at [the terminus]2834-the terminus no further steaming would be possible , for [the great flank of [Scawfell]150-scawfell]2835-the great flank of scawfell bars the way .

[Everard]242-everard and [[his]242-everard companion]675-his companion began [their]2837-they climb through [the pretty straggling village of [Boot]162-boot]2838-the pretty straggling village of boot . [A mountain torrent]2839-a mountain torrent roared by [the wayside]2840-the wayside , and the course [they]2837-they had marked upon the map showed that [they]2837-they must follow [this stream]2841-this stream for some miles up to the tarn where it originated . [Houses]2842-houses , [human beings]3472-human beings , and even [trodden paths]2844-trodden paths [they]2837-they soon left behind , coming out on to [a vast moorland]2845-a vast moorland , with hill summits near and far . [Scawfell]150-scawfell [they]2837-they could not hope to ascend ; with the walk that lay before [them]2837-they it was enough to make a way over one of [his]150-scawfell huge shoulders .

' If [your]5606-you strength fails , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard merrily , when for an hour [they]2837-they had been plodding through [grey solitudes]2846-grey solitudes , ' there is [no human help]5607-no human help . [I]242-everard should have to choose between carrying [you]5606-you back to [Boot]162-boot or on to [Wastdale]149-wastdale . '[242-everard]

' [My]242-everard strength is not likely to fail sooner than [yours]5606-you , '[242-everard] was the laughing reply .

' [I]242-everard have chicken sandwiches , and wine that maketh glad the heart of [man]962-man . Tell [me]242-everard when hunger overcomes [you]5606-you . [I]242-everard should think [we]2853-they had better make [our]2853-they halt at [Burmoor Tarn]165-burmoor tarn . '[242-everard]

That , indeed , proved to be the convenient resting - place . [A wild spot]2847-a wild spot , a hollow amid [the rolling expanse of moorland]2848-the rolling expanse of moorland , [[its]2847-a wild spot little lake of black water glistening under the midday sun]2849-its little lake of black water glistening under the midday sun . And here stood [[a shepherd]2850-a shepherd 's cottage]2851-a shepherd 's cottage , [the only habitation [they]2853-they had seen since leaving [Boot]162-boot]2852-the only habitation they had seen since leaving boot . Somewhat uncertain about the course to be henceforth followed , [they]2853-they made inquiry at [this cottage]2854-this cottage , and [a woman who appeared to be quite alone]2855-a woman who appeared to be quite alone gave [them]2853-they the needful direction . Thus at ease in mind [they]2853-they crossed the bridge at [the foot of [the tarn]2857-the tarn]2856-the foot of the tarn , and just beyond [it]2858-it found [a spot suitable for repose]2859-a spot suitable for repose . [Everard]242-everard brought forth [his]242-everard sandwiches and [his]242-everard flask of wine , moreover a wine - glass , which was for [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's use . [They]2853-they ate and drank festively .

' Now this is just what [I]242-everard have enjoyed in imagination for a year or more , '[242-everard] said [Barfoot]242-everard , when the luncheon was over , and [he]242-everard lay propped upon [his]242-everard elbow , gazing at [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's fine eyes and [her]197-rhoda sun - warmed cheeks . ' An ideal realized , for once in one 's life . A perfect moment . '[242-everard]

' Do n't [you]242-everard like the scent of burning peat from [that cottage]5609-that cottage ? '[242-everard]

' Yes . [I]242-everard like everything about [us]2853-they , in [heaven and earth]5610-heaven and earth , and most of all [I]242-everard like [your]197-rhoda companionship , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda could not resent this first use of [her]197-rhoda Christian name ; it was so natural , so inevitable ; yet [she]197-rhoda moved [her]197-rhoda head as if with a slight annoyance .

' Is [mine]242-everard as agreeable to [you]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard added , stroking the back of [her]197-rhoda hand with a spray of heather . ' Or do [you]197-rhoda just tolerate [me]242-everard out of good - nature ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard have liked [your]197-rhoda companionship all the way from [Seascale]137-seascale . Do n't disturb [my]242-everard enjoyment of it for the rest of the way . '[242-everard]

' That would be a misfortune indeed . The whole day shall be perfect . Not a note of discord . But [I]242-everard must have liberty to say what comes into [my]242-everard mind , and when [you]197-rhoda do n't choose to answer [I]242-everard shall respect [your]197-rhoda silence . '[242-everard]

' Would n't [you]242-everard like to smoke a cigar before [we]5611-we start again ? '[242-everard]

' Yes . But [I]242-everard like still better not to . The scent of peat is pleasanter to [you]197-rhoda than that of tobacco . '[242-everard]

' Oblige [me]242-everard by lighting the cigar . '[242-everard]

' If [you]197-rhoda command '[242-everard] [He]242-everard did [her]197-rhoda bidding . ' The whole day shall be perfect . ' All but the last . [I]242-everard shall be too tired . '[242-everard]

' No . [I]242-everard must have that hour of talk by [the sea]417-the sea . [You]197-rhoda are free to answer [me]242-everard or not , but [your]197-rhoda presence [you]197-rhoda must grant [me]242-everard . [We]5611-we are in an ideal world remember . [We]5611-we care nothing for [all the sons and daughters of [men]3461-men]5615-all the sons and daughters of men . [You]197-rhoda and [I]242-everard will spend this one day together between [cloudless heaven]5617-cloudless heaven and [silent earth]5618-silent earth a memory for lifetime . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda made no reply . [She]197-rhoda looked away from [him]2860-i at [the black , deep water]2861-the black , deep water .

' What an opportunity , '[2860-i] [he]2860-i went on , raising [his]2860-i hand to point at [the cottage]2862-the cottage , ' for saying the silliest of conceivable things ! '[2860-i]

' What might that be , [I]242-everard wonder ? '[242-everard]

' Why , that to dwell there together for the rest of [our]5620-we lives would be supreme felicity . [You]197-rhoda know [the kind of man that would say that]5621-the kind of man that would say that . '[2860-i]

' Not personally , thank goodness ! '[242-everard]

' A week a month , even with weather such as this . Nay , with a storm for variety ; clouds from the top of [Scawfell]150-scawfell falling thick about [us]5620-we ; a fierce wind shrieking across the tarn ; sheets and torrents and floods of rain beating upon [our]5620-we roof ; and [you]197-rhoda and [I]2860-i by the peat - fire . ' Be on [your]197-rhoda guard . Remember " [that kind of man]4207-that kind of man " . '[242-everard]

' [I]2860-i am in no danger . There is a vast difference between six months and [all one]5623-all one 's life . When the half - year was over [we]5620-we would leave [England]58-england . '[2860-i]

' By the Orient Express ? '[242-everard]

[They]2863-they laughed together , [Rhoda]197-rhoda colouring , for the words that had escaped [her]197-rhoda meant too much for mere jest .

' By the Orient Express . ' And how dreadfully tired of [each other]543-each other [we]5620-we should be ! '[2863-they]

[Barfoot]242-everard looked keenly at [her]197-rhoda . [He]242-everard could not with certainty read [her]197-rhoda countenance .

' [You]197-rhoda mean that ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard asked .

' [You]197-rhoda know it is true . '[2860-i]

' Hush ! The day is to be perfect . [I]242-everard wo n't admit that [we]5620-we could ever tire of [each other]543-each other with reasonable variety of circumstance . [You]5628-you to [me]242-everard are infinitely interesting , and [I]242-everard believe that [I]242-everard might become so to [you]5628-you . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard did not allow [himself]242-everard to vary from this tone of fanciful speculation , suited to the idle hour . [Rhoda]197-rhoda said very little ; [her]197-rhoda remarks were generally a purposed interruption of [Everard]242-everard 's theme . When the cigar was smoked Out [they]2864-they rose and set forward again . This latter half of [their]2864-they walk proved the most interesting , for [they]2864-they were expectant of the view down upon [Wastdale]149-wastdale . [A bold summit]2865-a bold summit came in sight , dark , desolate , which [they]2864-they judged to be [Great Gabel]304-great gabel ; and when [they]2864-they had pressed on eagerly for another mile , [the valley]2866-the valley opened beneath [them]2864-they with such striking suddenness that [they]2864-they stopped on the instant and glanced at [each other]543-each other in silence . From a noble height [they]2864-they looked down upon [Wastwater]151-wastwater , sternest and blackest of [the lakes]2868-the lakes , on the fields and copses of [the valley head]2869-the valley head with [[its]151-wastwater winding stream]2870-its winding stream , and [the rugged gorges which lie beyond in [mountain shadow]2872-mountain shadow]2871-the rugged gorges which lie beyond in mountain shadow .

The descent was by a path which in winter becomes [the bed of a torrent , steep and stony , zigzagging through a thick wood]2873-the bed of a torrent , steep and stony , zigzagging through a thick wood . Here , and when [they]2864-they had reached [the level road leading into [the village]2875-the village]2874-the level road leading into the village , [their]2864-they talk was in the same natural , light - hearted strain as before [they]2864-they rested . So at [the inn where]2876-the inn where [they]2864-they dined , and during [their]2864-they drive homewards by [the dark lake]2877-the dark lake with [[its]2877-the dark lake woods and precipices]2878-its woods and precipices , out into [the country of green hills]2879-the country of green hills , and thence through [Gosforth]168-gosforth on [the long road]2880-the long road descending seaward . Since [their]2864-they early departure scarcely a cloud had passed over the sun a perfect day .

[They]2864-they alighted before reaching [Seascale]137-seascale . [Barfoot]242-everard discharged [his]242-everard debt to [the driver who went on to bait at [the hotel]5444-the hotel and walked with [Rhoda]197-rhoda for the last quarter of a mile]2881-the driver who went on to bait at the hotel and walked with rhoda for the last quarter of a mile . This was [his]242-everard own idea ; [Rhoda]197-rhoda made no remark , but approved [his]242-everard discretion .

' It is six o'clock , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , after a short silence . ' [You]197-rhoda remember [your]197-rhoda arrangement . At eight , down on [the shore]3760-the shore . '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda should be much more comfortable in the armchair with a book . '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , [you]197-rhoda have had enough of books . It 's time to live . '[242-everard]

' It 's time to rest . '[197-rhoda]

' Are [you]197-rhoda so very tired ? [Poor girl]5630-poor girl ! The day has been rather too much for [you]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda laughed .

' [I]197-rhoda could walk back again to [Wastwater]151-wastwater if it were necessary . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course ; [I]197-rhoda knew that . [You]197-rhoda are magnificent . At eight o'clock then '[197-rhoda]

Nothing more was said on the subject . When in sight of [[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's lodgings]2883-rhoda 's lodgings [they]2884-they parted without hand - shaking .

Before eight [Everard]242-everard was straying about [the beach]2800-the beach , watching the sun go down in splendour . [He]242-everard smiled to [himself]242-everard frequently . The hour had come for [his]242-everard last trial of [Rhoda]197-rhoda , and [he]242-everard felt some confidence as to the result . If [her]197-rhoda mettle endured [his]242-everard test , if [she]197-rhoda declared [herself]197-rhoda willing not only to abandon [her]197-rhoda avowed ideal of life , but to defy [the world]3462-the world 's opinion by becoming [[his]242-everard wife]4133-his wife without forms of mutual bondage [she]197-rhoda was [the woman [he]242-everard had imagined]2888-the woman he had imagined , and by [her]197-rhoda side [he]242-everard would go cheerfully on [his]242-everard way as [a married man]3887-a married man . Legally married ; the proposal of free union was to be a test only . Loving [her]197-rhoda as [he]242-everard had never thought to love , there still remained with [him]242-everard so much of the temper in which [he]242-everard first wooed [her]197-rhoda that [he]242-everard could be satisfied with nothing short of unconditional surrender . Delighting in [her]197-rhoda independence of mind , [he]242-everard still desired to see [her]197-rhoda in complete subjugation to [him]242-everard , to inspire [her]197-rhoda with unreflecting passion . Tame consent to matrimony was an everyday experience . [Agnes Brissenden]275-agnes brissenden , [he]242-everard felt sure , would marry [him]242-everard whenever [he]242-everard chose to ask [her]275-agnes brissenden and would make [one of the best wives]2890-one of the best wives conceivable . But of [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda [he]242-everard expected and demanded more than this . [She]197-rhoda must rise far above the level of [ordinary intelligent women]2891-ordinary intelligent women . [She]197-rhoda must manifest an absolute confidence in [him]242-everard that was the true significance of [his]242-everard present motives . The censures and suspicions which [she]197-rhoda had not scrupled to confess in plain words must linger in no corner of [her]197-rhoda mind .

[His]242-everard heart throbbed with impatience for [her]197-rhoda coming . Come [she]197-rhoda would ; it was not in [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's nature to play tricks ; if [she]197-rhoda had not meant to meet [him]242-everard [she]197-rhoda would have said so resolutely , as last night .

At a few minutes past the hour [he]242-everard looked landward , and saw [her]197-rhoda figure against the golden sky . [She]197-rhoda came down from the sandbank very slowly , with careless , loitering steps . [He]242-everard moved but a little way to meet [her]197-rhoda , and then stood still . [He]242-everard had done [his]242-everard part ; it was now [hers]197-rhoda to forego female privileges , to obey the constraint of love . The western afterglow touched [her]197-rhoda features , heightening the beauty [Everard]242-everard had learnt to see in them . Still [she]197-rhoda loitered , stooping to pick up a piece of seaweed ; but still [he]242-everard kept [his]242-everard place , motionless , and [she]197-rhoda came nearer .

' Did [you]242-everard see the light of sunset on [the mountains]5369-the mountains ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard replied .

' There has been no such evening since [I]197-rhoda came . '[197-rhoda]

' And [you]242-everard wanted to sit at [home]364-home with a book . That was no close for a perfect day . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda found a letter from [[your]242-everard cousin]4717-your cousin . [She]4717-your cousin was with [[her]4717-your cousin friends]1123-her friends [the Goodalls]260-the goodalls yesterday . '[197-rhoda]

' [The Goodalls]260-the goodalls [I]197-rhoda used to know [them]260-the goodalls . '[197-rhoda]

' Yes . '[197-rhoda]

The word was uttered with significance . [Everard]242-everard understood the allusion , but did not care to show that [he]242-everard did .

' How does [Mary]225-mary get on without [you]242-everard ? '[197-rhoda]

' There 's no difficulty . '[197-rhoda]

' Has [she]4717-your cousin any one capable of taking [your]242-everard place ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes . [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper can do all that 's necessary . '[197-rhoda]

' Even to inspiring [the girls]375-the girls with zeal for an independent life ? '[197-rhoda]

' Perhaps even that . '[197-rhoda]

[They]2892-they went along by the waves , in the warm - coloured twilight , until [the houses of [Seascale]137-seascale]2893-the houses of seascale were hidden . Then [Everard]242-everard stopped .

' To - morrow [we]2892-they go to [Coniston]158-coniston ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said , smiling as [he]242-everard stood before [her]2894-her .

' [You]2894-her are going ? '[242-everard]

' Do [you]242-everard think [I]197-rhoda can leave [you]242-everard ? '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's eyes fell . [She]2894-her held the long strip of seaweed with both hands and tightened it .

' Do [you]242-everard wish [me]242-everard to leave [you]242-everard ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard added .

' [You]2894-her mean that [we]5636-we are to go through [the lakes]2868-the lakes together as [we]5636-we have been to - day ? '[2894-her]

' No . [I]197-rhoda do n't mean that . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda took a few steps onward , so that [he]242-everard remained standing behind . Another moment and [his]242-everard arms had folded about [her]2894-her , [his]242-everard lips were on [hers]2894-her . [She]2894-her did not resist . [His]242-everard embrace grew stronger , and [he]242-everard pressed kiss after kiss upon [her]2894-her mouth . With exquisite delight [he]242-everard saw the deep crimson flush that transfigured [her]2894-her countenance ; saw [her]2894-her look for one instant into [his]242-everard eyes , and was conscious of the triumphant gleam [she]2894-her met there .

' Do [you]2894-her remember [my]2894-her saying in the letter how [I]2894-her hungered to taste [your]2894-her lips ? [I]2894-her do n't know how [I]2894-her have refrained so long '[2894-her]

' What is [your]242-everard love worth ? '[197-rhoda] asked [Rhoda]197-rhoda , speaking with a great effort . [She]2894-her had dropped the seaweed , and one of [her]2894-her hands rested upon [his]242-everard shoulder , with a slight repelling pressure .

' Worth [your]2894-her whole life ! '[242-everard] [he]242-everard answered , with a low , glad laugh .

' That is what [I]2894-her doubt . Convince [me]2894-her of that . '[2894-her]

' Convince [you]242-everard ? With more kisses ? But what is [your]242-everard love worth ? '[2894-her]

' Perhaps more than [you]242-everard yet understand . Perhaps more than [you]242-everard can understand . '[2894-her]

' [I]2894-her will believe that , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . [I]2894-her know , at all events , that it is something of inestimable price . The knowledge has grown in [me]2894-her for a year and more . '[2894-her]

' Let [me]2894-her stand away from [you]2894-her again . There is something more to be said before No , let [me]2894-her be quite apart from [you]2894-her . '[2894-her]

[He]242-everard released [her]2894-her after one more kiss .

' Will [you]242-everard answer [me]2894-her a question with perfect truthfulness ? '[2894-her]

[Her]2894-her voice was not quite steady , but [she]2894-her succeeded in looking at [him]242-everard with unflinching eyes .

' Yes . [I]2894-her will answer [you]242-everard any question . '[2894-her]

' That is spoken like [a man]3627-a man . Tell [me]2894-her then is there at this moment [any woman living who has a claim upon [you]242-everard]5639-any woman living who has a claim upon you a moral claim ? '[2894-her]

' [No such woman]5640-no such woman exists . '[2894-her]

' But do [we]5641-we speak the same language ? '[2894-her]

' Surely , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard answered with great earnestness . ' There is [no woman to whom [I]242-everard am bound by any kind of obligation]5642-no woman to whom i am bound by any kind of obligation . '[242-everard]

A long wave rolled up , broke , and retreated , whilst [Rhoda]197-rhoda stood in silent uncertainty .

' [I]2894-her must put the question in another way . During the past month the past three months have [you]242-everard made profession of love have [you]242-everard even pretended love to [any woman]5257-any woman ? '[2894-her]

' To [no woman]2171-no woman whatever , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard answered firmly .

' That satisfies [me]2894-her . '[2894-her]

' If [I]242-everard knew what is in [your]242-everard mind ! '[242-everard] exclaimed [Everard]242-everard , laughing . ' What sort of life have [you]242-everard imagined for [me]242-everard ? Is this the result of [Mary]225-mary 's talk ? '[242-everard]

' Not immediately . '[2894-her]

' Still , [she]2894-her planted the suspicion . Believe [me]242-everard , [you]242-everard have been altogether mistaken . [I]242-everard never was the kind of man [Mary]225-mary thought [me]242-everard . Some day [you]242-everard shall understand more about it in the meantime [my]242-everard word must be enough . [I]242-everard have no thought of love for [any woman]5257-any woman but [you]242-everard . Did [I]242-everard frighten [you]242-everard with those joking confessions in [my]242-everard letters ? [I]242-everard wrote them purposely as [you]242-everard must have seen . The mean , paltry jealousies of [women such as one meets every day]5646-women such as one meets every day are so hateful to [me]242-everard . [They]5646-women such as one meets every day argue such a lack of brains . If [I]242-everard were so unfortunate as to love [a woman who looked sour when [I]242-everard praised a beautiful face]5647-a woman who looked sour when i praised a beautiful face . [I]242-everard would snap the bond between [us]5648-us like a bit of thread . But [you]242-everard are not one of [those poor creatures]5649-those poor creatures . '[242-everard]

[He]2895-he looked at [her]2896-her with some gravity .

' Should [you]2896-her think [me]2895-he [a poor creature]5650-a poor creature if [I]2895-he resented any kind of unfaithfulness ? whether love , in any noble sense , had part in it or not ? '[2895-he]

' No . That is the reasonable understanding between [man]962-man and [wife]3467-wife . If [I]242-everard exact fidelity from [you]242-everard , and certainly [I]242-everard should , [I]242-everard must consider [myself]242-everard under the same obligation . '[242-everard]

' [You]242-everard say " [man]962-man or [wife]3467-wife . " Do [you]242-everard say it with the ordinary meaning ? '[2895-he]

' Not as it applies to [us]5655-us . [You]242-everard know what [I]242-everard mean when [I]242-everard ask [you]242-everard to be [[my]242-everard wife]4104-my wife . If [we]5655-us can not trust [each other]543-each other without legal bonds , any union between [us]5655-us would be unjustified . '[242-everard]

Suppressing the agitation which [he]2897-he felt , [he]2897-he awaited [her]2898-her answer . [They]2899-they could still read [each other]543-each other 's faces perfectly in a pale yellow light from across [the sea]417-the sea . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's manifested an intense conflict .

' After all , [you]242-everard doubt of [your]242-everard love for [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard] said [Barfoot]242-everard quietly .

That was not [her]2898-her doubt . [She]2898-her loved with passion , allowing [herself]2898-her to indulge the luxurious emotion as never yet . [She]2898-her longed once more to feel [his]2897-he arms about [her]2898-her . But even thus [she]2898-her could consider the vast issues of the step to which [she]2898-her was urged . The temptation to yield was very strong , for it seemed to [her]2898-her an easier and a nobler thing to proclaim [her]2898-her emancipation from social statutes than to announce before [[her]2898-her friends]1123-her friends the simple news that [she]2898-her was about to marry . That announcement would excite something more than surprise . [Mary Barfoot]225-mary could not but smile with gentle irony ; [other women]1542-other women would laugh among [themselves]1542-other women ; [the girls]375-the girls would feel a shock , as at the fall of one who had made heroic pretences . A sure way of averting this ridicule was by furnishing occasion for much graver astonishment . If it became known that [she]2898-her had taken a step such as [few women]2905-few women would have dared to take deliberately setting an example of new liberty [her]2898-her position in the eyes of [all who knew [her]2898-her]2906-all who knew her remained one of proud independence . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's character was specially exposed to the temptation of such a motive . For months this argument had been in [her]2898-her mind , again and again [she]2898-her decided that the sensational step was preferable to a commonplace renunciation of all [she]2898-her had so vehemently preached . And now that the moment of actual choice had come [she]2898-her felt able to dare everything as far as the danger concerned [herself]2898-her ; but [she]2898-her perceived more strongly than hitherto that not only [her]2898-her own future was involved . How would such practical heresy affect [Everard]242-everard 's position ?

[She]2898-her uttered this thought .

' Are [you]242-everard willing , for the sake of this idea , to abandon all society but that of [the very few people who would approve or tolerate what [you]242-everard have done]5658-the very few people who would approve or tolerate what you have done ? '[2898-her]

' [I]2898-her look upon the thing in this way . [We]5659-we are not called upon to declare [our]5659-we principles wherever [we]5659-we go . If [we]5659-we regard [each other]543-each other as married , why , [we]5659-we are married . [I]2898-her am [no Quixote]5661-no quixote , hoping to convert [the world]3462-the world . It is between [you]242-everard and [me]2898-her [our]5659-we own sense of what is reasonable and dignified . '[2898-her]

' But [you]2907-he would not make it a mere deception ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Mary]225-mary would of course be told , and any one else [you]242-everard like . '[2898-her]

[She]2898-her believed [him]2907-he entirely serious . [Another woman]1613-another woman might have suspected that [he]2907-he was merely trying [her]2898-her courage , either to assure [himself]2907-he of [her]2898-her love or to gratify [his]2907-he vanity . But [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's idealism enabled [her]2898-her to take [him]2907-he literally . [She]2898-her [herself]2898-her had for years maintained an exaggerated standard of duty and merit ; desirous of seeing [Everard]242-everard in a nobler light than hitherto , [she]2898-her endeavoured to regard [his]2907-he scruple against formal wedlock as worthy of all respect .

' [I]2898-her ca n't answer [you]2907-he at once , '[2898-her] [she]2898-her said , half turning away .

' [You]2907-he must . Here and at once . '[2898-her]

The one word of assent would have satisfied [him]2907-he . This [he]2907-he obstinately required . [He]2907-he believed that it would confirm [his]2907-he love beyond any other satisfaction [she]2898-her could render [him]2907-he . [He]2907-he must be able to regard [her]2898-her as magnanimous , [a woman who had proved [herself]2898-her worth living or dying for]2909-a woman who had proved herself worth living or dying for . And [he]2907-he must have the joy of subduing [her]2898-her to [his]2907-he will .

' No , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda firmly . ' [I]197-rhoda ca n't answer [you]2907-he tonight . [I]197-rhoda ca n't decide so suddenly . '[197-rhoda]

This was disingenuous , and [she]2898-her felt humiliated by [her]2898-her subterfuge . Anything but a sudden decision was asked of [her]2898-her . Before leaving [Chelsea]19-chelsea [she]2898-her had ' foreseen this moment , and had made preparations for the possibility of never returning to [[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's house]5663-miss barfoot 's house knowing the nature of the proposal that would be offered to [her]2898-her . But the practical resolve needed a greater effort than [she]2898-her had imagined . Above all , [she]2898-her feared an ignominious failure of purpose after [her]2898-her word was given ; that would belittle [her]2898-her in [Everard]242-everard 's eyes , and so shame [her]2898-her in [her]2898-her own that all hope of happiness in marriage must be at an end .[2910-i]

' [You]2910-i are still doubtful of [me]2910-i , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ? '[2910-i]

[He]2910-i took [her]2898-her hand , and again drew [her]2898-her close . But [she]2898-her refused [her]2898-her lips .

' Or are [you]2910-i doubtful of [your]2910-i own love ? '[2910-i]

' No . If [I]2910-i understand what love means , [I]2910-i love [you]2910-i . '[2910-i]

' Then give [me]2910-i the kiss [I]2910-i am waiting for . [You]2910-i have not kissed [me]2910-i yet . '[2910-i]

' [I]2910-i ca n't until [I]2910-i am sure of [myself]2910-i of [my]2910-i readiness '[2910-i]

[Her]2898-her broken words betrayed the passion with which [she]2898-her was struggling . [Everard]242-everard felt [her]2898-her tremble against [his]242-everard side .

' Give [me]242-everard [your]2898-her hand , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard whispered . ' The left hand . '[242-everard]

Before [she]2898-her could guess [his]242-everard purpose [he]242-everard had slipped a ring upon [her]2898-her finger , a marriage ring . [Rhoda]197-rhoda started away from [him]242-everard , and at once drew off the perilous symbol .

' No that proves to [me]197-rhoda [I]197-rhoda ca n't ! What should [we]5664-we gain ? [You]2898-her see , [you]2898-her dare not be quite consistent . It 's only deceiving [the people who do n't know [us]5664-we]5665-the people who do n't know us . '[197-rhoda]

' But [I]197-rhoda have explained to [you]2898-her . The consistency is in [ourselves]5664-we , [our]5664-we own minds '[197-rhoda]

' Take it back . Custom is too strong for [us]5664-we . [We]5664-we should only play at defying it . Take it back or [I]197-rhoda shall drop it on the sand . '[197-rhoda]

Profoundly mortified , [Everard]242-everard restored the gold circlet to its hiding - place and stood gazing at the dim horizon . Some moments passed , then [he]242-everard heard [his]242-everard name murmured . [He]242-everard did not look round .

' [Everard]242-everard , dearest '[242-everard]

Was that [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's voice , so low , tender , caressing ? It thrilled [him]242-everard , and with a silent laugh of scorn at [his]242-everard own folly , [he]242-everard turned to [her]197-rhoda , every thought burnt up in passion .

' Will [you]197-rhoda kiss [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

For an answer [she]197-rhoda laid [her]197-rhoda hands on [his]242-everard shoulders and gazed at [him]242-everard . [Barfoot]242-everard understood . [He]242-everard smiled constrainedly , and said in a low voice ,

' [You]197-rhoda wish for that old , idle form ? '[242-everard]

' Not the religious form , which has no meaning for either of [us]5666-us , But '[242-everard]

' [You]242-everard have been living [here]3495-here seven or eight days . Stay till the fifteenth , then [we]5666-us can get a licence from [the registrar of [the district]5669-the district]5668-the registrar of the district . Does that please [you]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard]

[Her]197-rhoda eyes made reply .

' Do [you]242-everard love [me]242-everard any the less , [Everard]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' Kiss [me]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda did , and consciousness was lost for [them]2911-their as [their]2911-their mouths clung together and [their]2911-their hearts throbbed like one .

' Is n't it better ? '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda asked , as [they]2911-their walked back in the darkness . ' Wo n't it make [our]5666-us life so much simpler and happier ? '[197-rhoda]

' Perhaps . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]2912-you know it will . '[197-rhoda] [She]197-rhoda laughed joyously , trying to meet [his]2912-you look .

' Perhaps [you]2912-you are right . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda shall let [no one]3554-no one hear of it until . Then let [us]5666-us go abroad . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]242-everard dare not face [Mary]225-mary ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda dare , if [you]2912-you wish it . Of course [she]5671-she will laugh at [me]197-rhoda . [They]2911-their will all laugh at [me]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

' Why , [you]242-everard may laugh as well . '[197-rhoda]

' But [you]2912-you have spoilt [my]197-rhoda life , [you]2912-you know . Such a grand life it might have been . Why did [you]2912-you come and interfere with [me]197-rhoda ? And [you]2912-you have been so terribly obstinate . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course ; that 's [my]197-rhoda nature . But after all [I]197-rhoda have been weak . '[197-rhoda]

' Yielding in one point that did n't matter to [you]2912-you at all ? It was the only way of making sure that [you]2912-you loved [me]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

[Barfoot]225-mary laughed slightingly .

' And what if [I]225-mary needed the other proof that [you]2912-you loved [me]225-mary . '[225-mary]

CHAPTER XXVI

THE UNIDEAL TESTED

And neither was content .

[Barfoot]225-mary , over [his]225-mary cigar and glass of whisky at [the hotel]5444-the hotel , fell into a mood of chagrin . [The woman [he]225-mary loved]2914-the woman he loved would be [his]225-mary , and there was matter enough for ardent imagination in the indulgence of that thought ; but [his]225-mary temper disturbed [him]225-mary . After all , [he]225-mary had not triumphed . As usual [the woman]5196-the woman had [her]5196-the woman way . [She]5196-the woman played upon [his]225-mary senses , and made [him]225-mary [[her]5196-the woman obedient slave]2916-her obedient slave . To prolong the conflict would have availed nothing ; [Rhoda]197-rhoda , doubtless , was in part actuated by the desire to conquer , and [she]5196-the woman knew [her]5196-the woman power over [him]225-mary . So it was a mere repetition of the old story a marriage like any other . And how would it result ?

[She]5196-the woman had great qualities ; but was there not much in [her]5196-the woman that [he]225-mary must subdue , reform , if [they]2917-their were really to spend [their]2917-their lives together ? [Her]5196-the woman energy of domination perhaps excelled [his]225-mary . [Such a woman]1571-such a woman might be unable to concede [him]225-mary the liberty in marriage which theoretically [she]5196-the woman granted to be just . Perhaps [she]5196-the woman would torment [him]225-mary with restless jealousies , suspecting on every trivial occasion an infringement of [her]5196-the woman right . From that point of view it would have been far wiser to persist in rejecting legal marriage , that [her]5196-the woman dependence upon [him]225-mary might be more complete . Later , if all went well , the concession could have been made if , for instance , [she]5196-the woman became [a mother]2919-a mother . But then returned the exasperating thought that [Rhoda]197-rhoda had overcome [his]225-mary will . Was not that a beginning of evil augury ?

To be sure , after marriage [their]2917-their relations would be different . [He]225-mary would not then be at the mercy of [his]225-mary senses . But how miserable to anticipate a long , perhaps bitter , struggle for predominance . After all , that could hardly come about . The commencement of any such discord would be the signal for separation . [His]225-mary wealth assured [his]225-mary freedom . [He]225-mary was not like [the poor devils who must perforce live with [an intolerable woman]2921-an intolerable woman because [they]2920-the poor devils who must perforce live with an intolerable woman because they can not support themselves and their families in different places can not support [themselves]2920-the poor devils who must perforce live with an intolerable woman because they can not support themselves and their families in different places and [[their]2920-the poor devils who must perforce live with an intolerable woman because they can not support themselves and their families in different places families]2922-their families in different places]2920-the poor devils who must perforce live with an intolerable woman because they can not support themselves and their families in different places . Need [he]225-mary entertain that worst of fears the dread that [his]225-mary independence might fail [him]225-mary , subdued by [[his]225-mary wife]4133-his wife 's will ?

Free as [he]225-mary boasted [himself]225-mary from [lover]2924-lover 's silliness , [he]225-mary had magnified [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's image . [She]197-rhoda was not [the glorious rebel [he]225-mary had pictured]2925-the glorious rebel he had pictured . Like [any other woman]2926-any other woman , [she]197-rhoda mistrusted [her]197-rhoda love without the sanction of society . Well , that was something relinquished , lost . Marriage would after all be a compromise . [He]225-mary had not found [his]225-mary ideal though in these days it assuredly existed .

And [Rhoda]197-rhoda , sitting late in [the little lodging - house parlour]2927-the little lodging - house parlour , visited [her]197-rhoda soul with questionings no less troublesome . [Everard]242-everard was not satisfied with [her]197-rhoda . [He]225-mary had yielded , perhaps more than half contemptuously , to what [he]225-mary thought a feminine weakness . In going with [her]197-rhoda to [[the registrar]2928-the registrar 's office]2929-the registrar 's office [he]225-mary would feel [himself]225-mary to be acting an ignoble part . Was it not a bad beginning to rule [him]225-mary against [his]225-mary conscience ?

[She]197-rhoda had triumphed splendidly . In [the world]3462-the world 's eye this marriage of [hers]197-rhoda was far better than any [she]197-rhoda could reasonably have hoped , and [her]197-rhoda heart approved it with rapture . At a stage in life when [she]197-rhoda had sternly reconciled [herself]197-rhoda never to know [a man]3627-a man 's love , this love had sought [her]197-rhoda with passionate persistency of which even [a beautiful young girl]2932-a beautiful young girl might feel proud . [She]197-rhoda had no beauty ; [she]197-rhoda was loved for [her]197-rhoda mind , [her]197-rhoda very self . But must not [Everard]242-everard 's conception of [her]197-rhoda have suffered ? In winning [her]197-rhoda had [he]242-everard obtained [the woman of [his]242-everard desire]2933-the woman of his desire ?

Why was [she]197-rhoda not more politic ? Would it not have been possible to gratify [him]242-everard , and yet to gain [his]242-everard consent to legal marriage ? By first of all complying [she]197-rhoda would have seemed to confirm all [he]242-everard believed of [her]197-rhoda ; and then , [his]242-everard ardour at height , how simple to point out to [him]242-everard without entreaty , without show of much concern that by neglecting formalities [they]2934-they gained absolutely nothing . Artifice of that kind was perhaps demanded by the mere circumstances . Possibly [he]242-everard [himself]242-everard would have welcomed it after the grateful sense of inspiring such complete devotion . It is [the woman]5196-the woman 's part to exercise tact ; [she]197-rhoda had proved [herself]197-rhoda lamentably deficient in that quality .

To - morrow [she]197-rhoda must study [his]242-everard manner . If [she]197-rhoda discerned any serious change , any grave indication of disappointment

What was [her]197-rhoda life to be ? At first [they]2934-they would travel together ; but before long it might be necessary to have [a settled home]2936-a settled home , and what then would be [her]197-rhoda social position , [her]197-rhoda duties and pleasures ? Housekeeping , mere domesticities , could never occupy [her]197-rhoda for more than the smallest possible part of each day . Having lost one purpose in life , dignified , absorbing , likely to extend its sphere as time went on , what other could [she]197-rhoda hope to substitute for it ?

Love of [husband]1774-husband perhaps of [child]4629-child . There must be more than that . [Rhoda]197-rhoda did not deceive [herself]197-rhoda as to the requirements of [her]197-rhoda nature . Practical activity in some intellectual undertaking ; a share nay , leadership in some " movement ; " contact with the revolutionary life of [her]197-rhoda time the impulses of [her]197-rhoda heart once satisfied , these things would again claim [her]197-rhoda . But how if [Everard]242-everard resisted such tendencies ? Was [he]242-everard in truth capable of respecting [her]197-rhoda individuality ? Or would [his]242-everard strong instinct of lordship urge [him]242-everard to direct [[his]242-everard wife]4133-his wife as [a dependent]2940-a dependent , to impose upon [her]4133-his wife [his]242-everard own view of things ? [She]197-rhoda doubted whether [he]242-everard had much genuine sympathy with [woman]3471-woman 's emancipation as [she]197-rhoda understood it . Yet in no particular had [her]197-rhoda convictions changed ; nor would they change . [She]197-rhoda [herself]197-rhoda was no longer one of [the ' odd women]4883-the ' odd women '[4883-the ' odd women] ; fortune had or seemed to have been kind to [her]197-rhoda ; none the less [her]197-rhoda sense of a mission remained . No longer an example of perfect female independence , and unable therefore to use the same language as before , [she]197-rhoda might illustrate [woman]3471-woman 's claim of equality in marriage . If [her]197-rhoda experience proved no obstacle .

Next morning , as had been agreed , [they]2943-their met at some distance from [Seascale]137-seascale , and spent two or three hours together . There was little danger in observation unless by [a casual peasant]2944-a casual peasant ; for the most part [their]2943-their privacy could not have been more secure in [a locked chamber]2945-a locked chamber . [Lest]306-lest curiosity should be excited by [his]242-everard making inquiries at [the hotel]5444-the hotel , [Barfoot]242-everard proposed to walk over to [Gosforth]168-gosforth , [the nearest town]2947-the nearest town , this afternoon , and learn where [the registrar for [the locality of [Seascale]137-seascale]2949-the locality of seascale might be found]2948-the registrar for the locality of seascale might be found . By neither was allusion made to [their]2943-their difference of last evening , but [Rhoda]197-rhoda distressed [herself]197-rhoda by imagining a diminished fervour in [[her]197-rhoda companion]812-her companion ; [he]812-her companion seemed unusually silent and meditative , and was content to hold [her]197-rhoda hand now and then .

' Shall [you]812-her companion stay [here]3495-here all the week ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda inquired .

' If [you]812-her companion wish [me]197-rhoda to . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]812-her companion will find it wearisome . '[197-rhoda]

' Impossible , with [you]812-her companion here . But if [I]197-rhoda run up to [London]6-london for a day or two it might be better . There are preparations . [We]2943-their shall go first of all to [[my]197-rhoda rooms]5674-my rooms '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda would rather not have stayed in [London]6-london . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda thought [you]812-her companion might wish to make purchases . '[197-rhoda]

' Let [us]2943-their go to [some other town]5675-some other town , and spend a few days there before leaving [England]58-england . '[197-rhoda]

' Very well . [Manchester]169-manchester or [Birmingham]170-birmingham . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]2951-you speak rather impatiently , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , looking at [him]2951-you with an uneasy smile . ' Let it be [London]6-london if [you]2951-you prefer '[197-rhoda]

' On no account . [It]5676-it 's all indifferent to [me]197-rhoda so long as [we]2943-their get safely away together . [Every man]4190-every man is impatient of these preliminaries . Yes , in that case [I]197-rhoda must of course go up to [London]6-london . To - morrow , and back on Saturday ? '[197-rhoda]

A shower of rain caused [them]2952-them some discomfort . Through the afternoon it still rained at intervals whilst [Barfoot]242-everard was discharging [his]242-everard business at [Gosforth]168-gosforth . [He]242-everard was to see [Rhoda]197-rhoda again at eight o'clock , and as the time threatened to hang heavily on [his]242-everard hands [he]242-everard returned by a long detour , reaching [the Seascale hotel]2953-the seascale hotel about half - past six . No sooner had [he]242-everard entered than there was delivered to [him]242-everard a letter , brought by [messenger]2954-messenger an hour or two ago . It surprised [him]242-everard to recognize [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's writing on the envelope , which seemed to contain at least two sheets of notepaper . What now ? Some whimsey ? Agitated and annoyed by the anticipation of trouble , [he]242-everard went apart and broke the letter open .

First appeared an enclosure a letter in [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin [Mary]225-mary 's writing . [He]242-everard turned to the other sheet and read these lines ,

' [I]242-everard send [you]197-rhoda something that has come by post this afternoon . Please to bring it with [you]197-rhoda when [you]197-rhoda meet [me]242-everard at eight o'clock if [you]197-rhoda still care to do so . '[242-everard]

[His]242-everard face flushed with anger . What [contemptible woman]2956-contemptible woman 's folly was this ? ' If [you]197-rhoda still care to do so '[2956-contemptible woman] and written in a hand that shook . If this was to be [his]242-everard experience of matrimonial engagement What rubbish had [Mary]225-mary been communicating ?

' [[My]242-everard DEAR]3534-my dear [RHODA]197-rhoda , [I]242-everard have just gone through a very painful scene , and [I]242-everard feel bound to let [you]197-rhoda know of it without delay , as it may concern [you]197-rhoda . This evening Monday , when [I]242-everard came [home]364-home from [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street , [Emma]307-emma told [me]242-everard that [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson had called , that [he]217-widdowson wished to see [me]242-everard as soon as possible , and would be [here]3495-here again at six o'clock . [He]217-widdowson came , and [his]217-widdowson appearance alarmed [me]242-everard , [he]217-widdowson was looking so dreadfully ill . Without preface , [he]217-widdowson said , " [[My]242-everard wife]4104-my wife has left [me]242-everard ; [she]4104-my wife has gone to [[her]4104-my wife sister]455-her sister , and refuses to return . " This was astonishing in itself , and [I]242-everard wondered still more why [he]217-widdowson should come and tell [me]242-everard about it in so strange a way . The explanation followed very promptly , and [you]5683-you may judge how [I]242-everard heard it . [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson said that [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife had been behaving very badly of late ; that [he]217-widdowson had discovered several falsehoods [she]4133-his wife had told [him]217-widdowson as to [her]4133-his wife employment during absences from [home]364-home , in daytime and evening . Having cause for suspecting the worst , [he]217-widdowson last Saturday engaged [a private detective]5686-a private detective to follow [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson wherever [she]4133-his wife went . [This man]742-this man saw [her]4133-his wife go to [the flats in [Bayswater]77-bayswater where [Everard]242-everard lives and knock at [his]242-everard door]5688-the flats in bayswater where everard lives and knock at his door . As [no one]3554-no one replied , [she]4133-his wife went away for a time and returned , but again found [no one]3554-no one at [home]364-home . This being at once reported to [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson [he]217-widdowson asked [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife where [she]4133-his wife had been that afternoon . The answer was false ; [she]4133-his wife said [she]4133-his wife had been [here]3495-here , with [me]242-everard . Thereupon [he]217-widdowson lost command of [himself]217-widdowson , and charged [her]4133-his wife with infidelity . [She]4133-his wife refused to offer any kind of explanation , but denied that [she]4133-his wife was guilty and at once left [the house]368-the house . Since , [she]4133-his wife has utterly refused to see [him]217-widdowson . [[Her]4133-his wife sister]455-her sister can only report that [Monica]195-monica is very ill , and that [she]4133-his wife charges [[her]4133-his wife husband]4145-her husband with accusing [her]4133-his wife falsely .[242-everard]

' [He]217-widdowson had come to [me]225-mary , [he]217-widdowson said , in unspeakable anguish and helplessness , to ask [me]225-mary whether [I]225-mary had seen anything suspicious in the relations between [Monica]195-monica and [[my]225-mary cousin]4116-my cousin when [they]5698-they met at [this house]947-this house or elsewhere . A nice question ! Of course [I]225-mary could only reply that it had never even occurred to [me]225-mary to observe [them]5698-they that to [my]225-mary knowledge [they]5698-they had met so rarely and that [I]225-mary should never have dreamt of suspecting [Monica]195-monica . " Yet [you]225-mary see [she]195-monica must be guilty , " [he]217-widdowson kept on repeating . [I]225-mary said no , that [I]225-mary thought [her]195-monica visit might have an innocent significance , though [I]225-mary could n't suggest why [she]195-monica had told falsehoods . Then [he]217-widdowson inquired what [I]225-mary knew about [Everard]242-everard 's present movements . [I]225-mary answered that [I]225-mary had every reason to think that [he]217-widdowson was out of [town]624-town , but did n't know when [he]217-widdowson went , or when [he]217-widdowson might be expected to return . [The poor man]5701-the poor man was grievously dissatisfied ; [he]5701-the poor man looked at [me]225-mary as if [I]225-mary were in a base plot against [him]5701-the poor man . It was an immense relief when [he]5701-the poor man went away , after begging [me]225-mary to respect [his]5701-the poor man confidence .[225-mary]

' [I]242-everard write very hurriedly , as [you]225-mary see . That [I]242-everard ought to write is , [I]242-everard think , clear though [I]242-everard may be doing lamentable mischief . [I]242-everard can not credit this charge against [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ; there must surely be some explanation . If [you]225-mary have already left [Seascale]137-seascale , no doubt this letter will be forwarded . Ever [yours]225-mary , dear [Rhoda]197-rhoda ,[242-everard]

[MARY BARFOOT]225-mary . '[225-mary]

[Everard]242-everard laughed bitterly . The completeness of the case against [him]242-everard in [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's eyes must be so overwhelming , and [his]242-everard absolute innocence made it exasperating to have to defend [himself]242-everard . How , indeed , was [he]242-everard to defend [himself]242-everard ?

The story was strange enough . Could [he]242-everard be right in the interpretation which at once suggested itself to [his]242-everard mind or perhaps to [his]242-everard vanity ? [He]242-everard remembered the meeting with [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson near [[his]242-everard abode]1739-his abode on Friday . [He]242-everard recollected , moreover , the signs of interest in [himself]242-everard which , as [he]242-everard now thought , [she]265-mrs. widdowson had shown on previous occasions . Had [the poor little woman]2958-the poor little woman doubtless miserable with [[her]2958-the poor little woman husband]4145-her husband actually let [herself]2958-the poor little woman fall in love with [him]242-everard ? But , even in that case , what a reckless thing to do to come to [[his]242-everard rooms]2960-his rooms ! Why , [she]2958-the poor little woman must have been driven by a despair that blinded [her]2958-the poor little woman to all sense of delicacy ! Perhaps , had [he]242-everard been at [home]364-home , [she]2958-the poor little woman would have made a pretence of wishing to speak about [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda . That was imprudent behaviour of [his]242-everard , making [such a person]784-such a person [[his]242-everard confidante]2963-his confidante . But [he]242-everard was tempted by [his]242-everard liking for [her]2958-the poor little woman .

' By [Jove]308-jove ! '[242-everard] [he]242-everard muttered , overcome by the thought . ' [I]242-everard 'm[242-everard] glad [I]0-i was not at [home]364-home ! '[0-i]

But then [he]242-everard had told [her]2958-the poor little woman that [he]242-everard was going away on Saturday . How could [she]2958-the poor little woman expect to find [him]242-everard ? The hour of [her]2958-the poor little woman visit was not stated ; probably [she]2958-the poor little woman hoped to catch [him]242-everard before [he]242-everard left . And was [her]2958-the poor little woman appearance in [the neighbourhood]1128-the neighbourhood on Friday [her]2958-the poor little woman troubled aspect to be explained as an abortive attempt to have a private interview with [him]242-everard ?

The queerest affair and maddening in its issues ! [Rhoda]197-rhoda was raging with jealousy . Well , [he]242-everard too would rage . And without affectation . It was strange that [he]242-everard felt almost glad of a ground of quarrel with [Rhoda]197-rhoda . All day [he]242-everard had been in an irritable temper , and so far as [he]242-everard could understand [himself]242-everard it was due to resentment of [his]242-everard last night 's defeat . [He]242-everard though of [Rhoda]197-rhoda as ardently as ever , but an element that was very like brutality had intruded into [his]242-everard emotions ; that was [his]242-everard reason from refraining from caresses this morning ; [he]242-everard could not trust [himself]242-everard .

[He]242-everard would endure no absurdities . If [Rhoda]197-rhoda did not choose to accept [his]242-everard simple assurance let [her]197-rhoda take the consequences . Even now , perhaps , [he]242-everard would bring [her]197-rhoda to [her]197-rhoda knees before [him]242-everard . Let [her]197-rhoda wrong [him]242-everard by baseless accusation ! Then it would no longer be [he]242-everard who sued for favour . [He]242-everard would whistle [her]197-rhoda down the wind , and await [her]197-rhoda penitent reappearance . Sooner or later [his]242-everard pride and [hers]197-rhoda , the obstinacy in [their]2966-their natures , must battle it out ; better that it should be now , before the irrevocable step had been taken .

[He]242-everard ate [his]242-everard dinner with savage appetite , and drank a good deal more wine than of wo nt . Then [he]242-everard smoked until the last minute of delay that [his]242-everard engagement allowed . Of course [she]197-rhoda had sent the letter to [the hotel]5444-the hotel because [he]242-everard might be unable to read it in twilight . Wise precaution . And [he]242-everard was glad to have been able to think the matter over , to work [himself]242-everard into reasonable wrath . If ever [man]962-man did well to be angry !

There [she]197-rhoda was , down by the edge of the waves . [She]197-rhoda would not turn to see if [he]242-everard were coming ; [he]242-everard felt sure of that . Whether [she]197-rhoda heard [his]242-everard footsteps [he]242-everard could not tell . When quite close to [her]197-rhoda , [he]242-everard exclaimed ,

' Well , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ? '[242-everard] [She]197-rhoda must have known of [his]242-everard approach , for [she]197-rhoda gave no start .

[She]197-rhoda faced slowly to [him]242-everard . No trace of tears on [her]197-rhoda countenance ; no , [Rhoda]197-rhoda was above that . [Gravity]309-gravity of the sternest that was all .

' Well , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard continued , ' what have [you]197-rhoda to say to [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda ? Nothing . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]197-rhoda mean that it is [my]242-everard business to explain what [Mary]225-mary has told [you]197-rhoda . [I]242-everard ca n't , so there 's an end of it . '[242-everard]

' What do [you]242-everard mean by that ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda asked in clear , distant tones .

' Precisely what [I]242-everard say , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . And [I]242-everard am obliged to ask what [you]242-everard mean by this odd way of speaking to [me]242-everard . What has happened since [we]5702-we parted this morning ? '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda could not suppress [her]197-rhoda astonishment ; [she]197-rhoda gazed fixedly at [him]242-everard .

' If [you]242-everard ca n't explain this letter , [who]5703-who can ? '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda suppose [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson would be able to account for [her]265-mrs. widdowson doings . [I]197-rhoda certainly am not able to . And it seems to [me]197-rhoda that [you]242-everard are strangely forgetful of something that passed between [us]5702-we yesterday . '[197-rhoda]

' Of what ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda asked coldly , [her]197-rhoda face , which was held proudly up , turning towards [the sea]417-the sea .

' Evidently [you]242-everard accuse [me]242-everard of concealing something from [you]242-everard . Please to remember a certain plain question [you]242-everard asked [me]242-everard , and the equally plain answer [I]242-everard gave . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard detected the beginning of a smile about [her]197-rhoda rigid lips .

' [I]197-rhoda remember , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said .

' And [you]242-everard can still behave to [me]242-everard with indignation ? Surely the indignation should be on [my]242-everard side . [You]242-everard are telling [me]242-everard that [I]242-everard deceived [you]242-everard . '[242-everard]

For a moment [Rhoda]197-rhoda lost [her]197-rhoda self - control .

' How can [I]197-rhoda help thinking so ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda exclaimed , with a gesture of misery . ' What can this letter mean ? Why should [she]197-rhoda go to [[your]242-everard rooms]5704-your rooms ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]242-everard simply do n't know , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard preserved the show of calmness just because [he]242-everard saw that it provoked [her]197-rhoda to anger .

' [She]197-rhoda has never been [there]453-there before ? '[242-everard]

' Never to [my]242-everard knowledge . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda watched [his]242-everard face with greedy attention . [She]197-rhoda seemed to find there a confirmation of [her]197-rhoda doubts . Indeed , it was impossible for [her]197-rhoda to credit [his]242-everard denials after what [she]197-rhoda had observed in [London]6-london , and the circumstances which , even before [Mary]225-mary 's letter , had made [her]197-rhoda suspicious .

' When did [you]242-everard last see [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? '[197-rhoda]

' No , [I]242-everard sha n't consent to be cross - examined , '[242-everard] replied [Everard]242-everard , with a disdainful smile . ' As soon as [you]197-rhoda refuse to accept [my]242-everard word it 's folly to ask further questions . [You]197-rhoda do n't believe [me]242-everard . Say it honestly and let [us]5706-us understand [each other]543-each other . '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda have good reason for thinking that [you]242-everard could explain [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's behaviour if [you]242-everard chose . '[197-rhoda]

' Exactly . There 's no misunderstanding that . And if [I]242-everard get angry [I]242-everard am [an unpardonable brute]5708-an unpardonable brute . Come now , [you]197-rhoda ca n't be offended if [I]242-everard treat [you]197-rhoda as simply [[my]242-everard equal]5709-my equal , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Let [me]242-everard test [your]197-rhoda sincerity . Suppose [I]242-everard had seen [you]197-rhoda talking somewhere with some man who seemed to interest [you]197-rhoda very much , and then to - day , let [us]5710-us say [I]242-everard heard that [he]5711-he had called upon [you]197-rhoda when [you]197-rhoda were alone . [I]242-everard turn with a savage face and accuse [you]197-rhoda of grossly deceiving [me]242-everard in the worst sense . What would [your]197-rhoda answer be ? '[242-everard]

' These are idle suppositions , '[2970-she] [she]2970-she exclaimed scornfully .

' But the case is possible , [you]197-rhoda must admit . [I]242-everard want [you]197-rhoda to realize what [I]242-everard am feeling . In such a case as that , [you]197-rhoda could only turn from [me]242-everard with contempt . How else can [I]242-everard behave to [you]197-rhoda conscious of [my]242-everard innocence , yet in the nature of things unable to prove it ? '[242-everard]

' Appearances are very strongly against [you]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

' That 's an accident to [me]242-everard quite unaccountable . If [I]242-everard charged [you]197-rhoda with dishonour [you]197-rhoda would only have [your]197-rhoda word to offer in reply . So it is with [me]242-everard . And [my]242-everard word is bluntly rejected . [You]197-rhoda try [me]242-everard rather severely . '[242-everard]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda kept silence .

' [I]242-everard know what [you]197-rhoda are thinking . [My]242-everard character was previously none of the best . There is a prejudice against [me]242-everard in such a matter for [your]197-rhoda good . [My]242-everard record is not immaculate ; nor , [I]242-everard believe , is any as this . Well , [you]197-rhoda shall hear some more plain speech , [altogether man]5712-altogether man 's . [I]242-everard have gone here and there , and have had [my]242-everard adventures like [other men]3767-other men . One of [them]3767-other men [you]197-rhoda have heard about the story of [that girl]5714-that girl [Amy Drake]259-amy drake the subject of [Mrs. Goodall]258-mrs. goodall 's righteous wrath . [You]197-rhoda shall know the truth , and if it offends [your]197-rhoda ears [I]242-everard ca n't help it . [The girl]384-the girl simply threw [herself]384-the girl into [my]242-everard arms , on a railway journey , when [we]5716-we met by pure chance . '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda do n't care to hear that , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda , turning away .

' But [you]197-rhoda shall hear it . That story has predisposed [you]197-rhoda to believe the worst things of [me]242-everard . If [I]242-everard hold [you]197-rhoda by force , [you]197-rhoda shall hear every word of it . [Mary]225-mary seems to have given [you]197-rhoda mere dark hints '[242-everard]

' No ; [she]384-the girl has told [me]242-everard the details . [I]242-everard know it all . '[242-everard]

' From [their]5717-their point of view . Very well ; that saves [me]242-everard a lot of narrative . What [those good people]5718-those good people did n't understand was [the girl]384-the girl 's character . [They]5717-their thought [her]384-the girl a helpless innocent ; [she]384-the girl was a [I]242-everard 'll spare [you]197-rhoda the word . [She]384-the girl simply planned to get [me]242-everard into [her]384-the girl power thought [I]242-everard should be forced to marry [her]384-the girl . It 's the kind of thing that happens far oftener than [you]197-rhoda would suppose ; that 's the reason why [men]3461-men so often smile in what [you]197-rhoda would call a brutal way when certain stories are told to [other men]3767-other men 's discredit . [You]197-rhoda will have to take this into account , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , before [you]197-rhoda reach satisfactory results on the questions that have occupied [you]197-rhoda so much . [I]242-everard was not in the least responsible for [Amy Drake]259-amy drake 's desertion of creditable paths . At the worst [I]242-everard behaved foolishly ; and knowing [I]242-everard had done so , knowing how thankless it was to try and clear [myself]242-everard at [her]259-amy drake expense , [I]242-everard let [people]3536-people say what [they]3536-people would ; it did n't matter . And [you]197-rhoda do n't believe [me]242-everard ; [I]242-everard can see [you]197-rhoda do n't . Sexual pride wo n't let [you]197-rhoda believe [me]242-everard . In such a case [the man]350-the man must necessarily be [the villain]5724-the villain . '[242-everard]

' What [you]197-rhoda mean by saying [you]197-rhoda only behaved " foolishly , " [I]242-everard ca n't understand . '[242-everard]

' Perhaps not , and [I]242-everard ca n't explain as [I]242-everard once did in telling the story to [a man]3627-a man , [a friend of mine]5726-a friend of mine . But however strict [your]197-rhoda moral ideas , [you]197-rhoda will admit that [a girl of thoroughly bad character]5727-a girl of thoroughly bad character is n't a subject for the outcry that was raised about [Miss Amy Drake]259-amy drake . Well , that 's enough . [I]242-everard have never pretended to sanctity ; but , on the other hand , [I]242-everard have never behaved like [a scoundrel]4344-a scoundrel . [You]197-rhoda charge [me]242-everard , deliberately , with being [a scoundrel]4344-a scoundrel , and [I]242-everard defend [myself]242-everard as best [I]242-everard can . [You]197-rhoda argue that [the man who would mislead [an innocent girl]5731-an innocent girl and then cast [her]5731-an innocent girl off]5730-the man who would mislead an innocent girl and then cast her off is more likely than not to be guilty in a case like this of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , when appearances are decidedly against [him]5730-the man who would mislead an innocent girl and then cast her off . There is only [my]242-everard word in each instance . The question is Will [you]197-rhoda accept [my]242-everard word ? '[242-everard]

For a wonder , [their]2971-their privacy was threatened by the approach of [two men who were walking this way from [Seascale]137-seascale]2972-two men who were walking this way from seascale .
