' Let [us]2971-their go up on to [the higher sand]5732-the higher sand , '[225-mary] [he]225-mary said .

Without reply [Rhoda]197-rhoda accompanied [him]225-mary , and for several minutes [they]2971-their exchanged no word . [The men , talking and laughing loudly]2974-the men , talking and laughing loudly , went by ; [they]2974-the men , talking and laughing loudly seemed to be tourists of a kind that do not often trouble [this quiet spot on [the coast]2976-the coast]2975-this quiet spot on the coast ; [their]2974-the men , talking and laughing loudly cigars glowed in the dusk .

' After all this , what have [you]197-rhoda to say to [me]2974-the men , talking and laughing loudly , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ? '[2974-the men , talking and laughing loudly]

' Will [you]197-rhoda please to give [me]2977-she [[your]197-rhoda cousin]4717-your cousin 's letter ? '[2977-she] [she]2977-she said coldly .

' Here it is . Now [you]197-rhoda will go back to [[your]197-rhoda lodgings]565-your lodgings , and sit with that letter open before [you]197-rhoda half through the night . [You]197-rhoda will make [yourself]197-rhoda unutterably wretched , and all for what ? '[2977-she]

[He]2978-him felt [himself]2978-him once more in danger of weakness . [Rhoda]197-rhoda , in [her]2977-she haughty , resentful mood , was very attractive to [him]2978-him . [He]2978-him was tempted to take [her]2977-she in [his]2978-him arms , and kiss [her]2977-she until [she]2977-she softened , pleaded with [him]2978-him . [He]2978-him wished to see [her]2977-she shed tears . But the voice in which [she]2977-she now spoke to [him]2978-him was far enough from tearfulness .

' [You]2978-him must prove to [me]2977-she that [you]2978-him have been wrongly suspected . '[2977-she]

Ah , that was to be [her]2977-she line of conduct . [She]2977-she believed [her]2977-she power over [him]2978-him was absolute . [She]2977-she stood on [her]2977-she dignity , would bring [him]2978-him to supplication , would give [him]2978-him all the trouble [she]2977-she could before [she]2977-she professed [herself]2977-she satisfied .

' How am [I]2978-him to prove it ? '[2978-him] [he]2978-him asked bluntly .

' If there was nothing wrong between [you]2978-him and [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , there must be some very simple explanation of [her]265-mrs. widdowson coming to [[your]2978-him rooms]5704-your rooms and being so anxious to see [you]2978-him . '[2977-she]

' And is it [my]2978-him business to discover that explanation ? '[2978-him]

' Can it be [mine]2978-him ? '[2977-she]

' It must either be [yours]2978-him , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , or [no one]3554-no one 's . [I]2978-him shall take no single step in the matter . '[2978-him]

The battle was declared . [Each]548-each stood at full height , pertinacious , resolved on victory .

' [You]2978-him are putting [yourself]2978-him wildly in the wrong , '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard continued . ' By refusing to take [my]242-everard word [you]2978-him make it impossible for [me]242-everard to hope that [we]5737-we could live together as [we]5737-we imagined . '[242-everard]

The words fell upon [her]2980-she heart like a crushing weight . But [she]2980-she could not yield . Last night [she]2980-she had suffered in [his]242-everard opinion by urging what [he]242-everard thought a weak , womanly scruple ; [she]2980-she had condescended to plead tenderly with [him]242-everard , and had won [her]2980-she cause . Now [she]2980-she would prevail in another way . If [he]242-everard were telling the truth , [he]242-everard should acknowledge that natural suspicion made it incumbent upon [him]242-everard to clear so strange a case of its difficulties . If [he]242-everard were guilty of deception , as [she]2980-she still believed , though willing to admit to [herself]2980-she that [Monica]195-monica might be most at fault , that there might have been no actual wrongdoing between [them]2981-them [he]242-everard should confess with humblest penitence , and beseech pardon . Impossible to take any other attitude . Impossible to marry [him]242-everard with this doubt in [her]2980-she mind equally out of the question to seek [Monica]195-monica , and humiliate [herself]2980-she by making inquiries on such a subject . Guilty or not , [Monica]195-monica would regard [her]2980-she with secret disdain , with [woman]3471-woman 's malice . Were [she]2980-she able to believe [him]242-everard , that indeed would be a grand consummation of [their]2981-them love , an ideal union of heart and soul . Listening to [him]242-everard , [she]2980-she had tried to put faith in [his]242-everard indignant words . But it was useless . The incredulity [she]2980-she could not help must either part [them]2981-them for ever , or be to [her]2980-she an occasion of new triumph .

' [I]2980-she do n't refuse to take [your]242-everard word , '[2980-she] [she]2980-she said , with conscious quibbling . ' [I]2980-she only say that [your]242-everard name must be cleared from suspicion . [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson is sure to tell [his]217-widdowson story to [other people]942-other people . Why has [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife left [him]217-widdowson ? '[2980-she]

' [I]2983-you neither know nor care . '[2983-you]

' [You]242-everard must prove to [me]2980-she that [you]242-everard are not the cause of it . '[2980-she]

' [I]2983-you shall not make the slightest effort to do so . '[2983-you]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda began to move away from [him]2983-you . As [he]2983-you kept silence , [she]2980-she walked on in the Seascale direction . [He]2983-you followed at a distance of a few yards , watching [her]2980-she movements . When [they]2984-they had gone so far that five minutes more must bring [them]2984-they within sight of [the hotel]5444-the hotel , [Everard]242-everard spoke .

' [Rhoda]197-rhoda ! '[242-everard]

[She]2980-she paused and awaited [him]2983-you .

' [You]2983-you remember that [I]2980-she was going to [London]6-london to - morrow . It seems that [I]2980-she had better go and not trouble to return . '[2980-she]

' That is for [you]2983-you to decide . '[242-everard]

' For [you]2983-you rather . '[2980-she]

' [I]242-everard have said all that [I]242-everard can say . '[242-everard]

' And so have [I.]242-everard But surely [you]2983-you must be unconscious how grossly [you]2983-you are insulting [me]2980-she . '[2980-she]

' [I]242-everard want only to understand what purpose [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had in going to [[your]2983-you rooms]5704-your rooms . '[242-everard]

' Then why not ask [her]265-mrs. widdowson ? [You]2983-you are [friends]3725-friends . [She]265-mrs. widdowson would doubtless tell [you]2983-you the truth . '[2980-she]

' If [she]265-mrs. widdowson comes to [me]242-everard voluntarily to make an explanation , [I]242-everard will hear it . But [I]242-everard shall not ask [her]265-mrs. widdowson . '[242-everard]

' [Your]2983-you view of the fitness of things is that [I]2980-she should request [her]265-mrs. widdowson to wait upon [you]2983-you for that purpose ? '[2980-she]

' There are others who can act for [you]242-everard . '[242-everard]

' Very well . Then [we]2986-we are at a deadlock . It seems to [me]2980-she that [we]2986-we had better shake hands like [sensible people]5742-sensible people , and say good - bye . '[2980-she]

' Much better if it seems so to [you]2983-you . '[242-everard]

The time for emotional help was past . In very truth [they]2986-we had nothing more to say to [each other]543-each other , being now hardened in obstinacy . [Each]2988-each suffered from [the other]462-the other 's coldness , [each]548-each felt angry with [the other]462-the other 's stubborn refusal to concede a point of dignity . [Everard]242-everard put out [his]242-everard hand .

' When [you]2992-her are ready to say that [you]2992-her have used [me]242-everard very ill , [I]242-everard shall remember only yesterday . Till then good - bye , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[She]2992-her made a show of taking [his]242-everard hand , but said nothing . And so [they]2986-we parted .

At eight o'clock next morning [Barfoot]242-everard was seated in [the southward train]2993-the southward train . [He]242-everard rejoiced that [his]242-everard strength of will had thus far asserted itself . Of final farewell to [Rhoda]197-rhoda [he]242-everard had no thought whatever . [Her]2992-her curiosity would , of course , compel [her]2992-her to see [Monica]195-monica ; one way or another [she]2992-her would learn that [he]242-everard was blameless . [His]242-everard part was to keep aloof from [her]2992-her , and to wait for [her]2992-her inevitable submission .

Violent rain was beating upon the carriage windows ; it drove from [the mountains]5369-the mountains , themselves invisible , though dense low clouds marked their position . [Poor Rhoda]197-rhoda ! [She]2992-her would not have a very cheerful day at [Seascale]137-seascale . Perhaps [she]2992-her would follow [him]242-everard by [a later train]2995-a later train . Certain it was that [she]2992-her must be suffering intensely and that certainly rejoiced [him]242-everard . The keener [her]2992-her suffering the sooner [her]2992-her submission . Oh , but the submission should be perfect ! [He]242-everard had seen [her]2992-her in many moods , but not yet in the anguish of broken pride . [She]2992-her must shed tears before [him]242-everard , declare [her]2992-her spirit worn and subjugated by torment of jealousy and fear . Then [he]242-everard would raise [her]2992-her , and seat [her]2992-her in the place of honour , and fall down at [her]2992-her feet , and fill [her]2992-her soul with rapture .

Many times between [Seascale]137-seascale and [London]6-london [he]242-everard smiled in anticipation of that hour .

CHAPTER XXVII

THE REASCENT

Whilst the rain pelted , and it did so until afternoon , [Rhoda]197-rhoda sat in [[her]197-rhoda little parlour]2996-her little parlour , no whit less miserable than [Barfoot]242-everard imagined . [She]197-rhoda could not be sure whether [Everard]242-everard had gone to [London]6-london ; at the last moment reflection or emotion might have detained [him]242-everard . Early in the morning [she]197-rhoda had sent to post a letter for [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , written last night a letter which made no revelation of [her]197-rhoda feelings , but merely expressed a cold curiosity to hear anything that might become known as to the course of [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson 's domestic troubles . ' [You]197-rhoda may still write to this address ; if [I]217-widdowson leave , letters shall be forwarded . '[217-widdowson]

When the sky cleared [she]197-rhoda went out . In the evening [she]197-rhoda again rambled about [the shore]3760-the shore . [Evidently Barfoot]242-everard had gone ; if still [here]3495-here , [he]242-everard would have watched and joined [her]197-rhoda .

[Her]197-rhoda solitude now grew insufferable , yet [she]197-rhoda could not decide whither to betake [herself]197-rhoda . The temptation to return to [London]6-london was very strong , but pride prevailed against it . [Everard]242-everard might perhaps go to see [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin , and relate all that had happened at [Seascale]137-seascale , justifying [himself]242-everard as [he]242-everard had here done . Whether [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot became aware of the story or not , [Rhoda]197-rhoda could not reconcile it with [her]197-rhoda self - respect to curtail the stipulated three weeks of holiday . Rather [she]197-rhoda would strain [her]197-rhoda nerves to the last point of endurance and if [she]197-rhoda were not suffering , then never did [woman]3471-woman suffer .

Another cheerless day helped [her]197-rhoda to make up [her]197-rhoda mind . [She]197-rhoda cared nothing now for [lake and mountain]3001-lake and mountain ; human companionship was [her]197-rhoda supreme need . By the earliest train next day [she]197-rhoda started , not for [London]6-london , but for [[[her]197-rhoda brother]4486-her brother 's home in [Somerset]36-somerset]3003-her brother 's home in somerset , and there [she]197-rhoda remained until it was time to return to work . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot wrote twice in the interval , saying that [she]212-miss barfoot had heard nothing more of [Monica]195-monica . Of [Everard]242-everard [she]212-miss barfoot made no mention .

[Rhoda]197-rhoda got back again to [Chelsea]19-chelsea on the appointed Saturday afternoon . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot knew when [she]197-rhoda would arrive , but was not at [home]364-home to meet [her]197-rhoda , and did not return till a couple of hours had passed . [They]3005-they met at length as if nothing remarkable had occurred during the three weeks . [Mary]225-mary , if [she]197-rhoda felt any solicitude , effectually concealed it ; [Rhoda]197-rhoda talked as if very glad to be at [home]364-home again , explaining [her]197-rhoda desertion of [the lake country]2352-the lake country by the bad weather that prevailed there . It was not till after dinner that the inevitable subject came up between [them]3005-they .

' Have [you]212-miss barfoot seen [Everard]242-everard since [you]212-miss barfoot went away ? '[212-miss barfoot] [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot began by asking .

So [he]242-everard had not been [here]3495-here to tell [his]242-everard story and plead [his]242-everard cause or it seemed not .

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda saw [him]242-everard at [Seascale]137-seascale , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda replied , without sign of emotion .

' Before or after that news came ? '[197-rhoda]

' Both before and after . [I]197-rhoda showed [him]242-everard [your]212-miss barfoot letter , and all [he]242-everard had to say was that [he]242-everard knew nothing of the affair . '[197-rhoda]

' That 's all [he]242-everard has to say to [me]197-rhoda . [I]197-rhoda have n't seen [him]242-everard . A letter [I]197-rhoda sent to [[his]242-everard address]5743-his address was answered , after a week , from [a place [I]197-rhoda never heard of [Arromanches]171-arromanches]5744-a place i never heard of arromanches , in [Normandy]172-normandy . The shortest and rudest letter [I]197-rhoda ever had from [him]242-everard . Practically [he]242-everard told [me]197-rhoda to mind [my]197-rhoda own business . And there things stand . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda smiled a little , conscious of the extreme curiosity [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend must be feeling , and determined not to gratify it . For by this time , though [her]197-rhoda sunken cheeks were hard to reconcile with the enjoyment of a summer holiday , [she]197-rhoda had matured a resolve to betray nothing of what [she]197-rhoda had gone through . [Her]197-rhoda state of mind resembled that of the ascetic who has arrived at a morbid delight in self - torture . [She]197-rhoda regarded [the world]3462-the world with an intense bitterness , and persuaded [herself]197-rhoda not only that the thought of [Everard Barfoot]242-everard was hateful to [her]197-rhoda soul , but that sexual love had become , and would ever be , to [her]197-rhoda an impure idea , a vice of blood .

' [I]197-rhoda suppose , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said carelessly , ' [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson will try to divorce [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda am in dread of that . But [they]5746-they may have made it up . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course [you]197-rhoda have no doubt of [her]197-rhoda guilt ? '[197-rhoda]

[Mary]225-mary tried to understand the hard , austere face , with its touch of cynicism . Conjecture as to its meaning was not difficult , but , in the utter absence of information , certainty there could be none . Under any circumstances , it was to be expected that [Rhoda]197-rhoda would think and speak of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson no less severely than of [the errant Bella Royston]194-isabel .

' [I]212-miss barfoot have some doubt , '[212-miss barfoot] was [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's answer . ' But [I]212-miss barfoot should be glad of [some one else]5228-some one else 's favourable opinion to help [my]212-miss barfoot charity . '[212-miss barfoot]

' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden has n't been [here]3495-here , [you]197-rhoda see . [She]204-miss madden certainly would have come if [she]204-miss madden had felt convinced that [[her]204-miss madden sister]455-her sister was wronged . '[197-rhoda]

' Unless a day or two saw the end of the trouble when naturally [none of [them]5751-them]5750-none of them would say any more about it . '[212-miss barfoot]

This was the possibility which occupied [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's reflections as long as [she]197-rhoda lay awake that night .

[Her]197-rhoda feelings on entering [the familiar bedroom]3011-the familiar bedroom were very strange . Even before starting for [her]197-rhoda holiday [she]197-rhoda had bidden it good - bye , and at [Seascale]137-seascale , that night following upon the " perfect day , " [she]197-rhoda had thought of it as a part of [her]197-rhoda past life , a place abandoned for ever , already infinitely remote . [Her]197-rhoda first sensation when [she]197-rhoda looked upon the white bed was one of disgust ; [she]197-rhoda thought it would be impossible to use [this room]3501-this room henceforth , and that [she]197-rhoda must ask [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot to let [her]197-rhoda change to another . Tonight [she]197-rhoda did not restore any of the ornaments which were lying packed up . The scent of [the room]444-the room revived so many hours of conflict , of hope , that it caused [her]197-rhoda a sick faintness . In frenzy of detestation [she]197-rhoda cursed [the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of [her]197-rhoda life .

[Arromanches]171-arromanches , in [Normandy]172-normandy ? On Sunday [she]197-rhoda sought the name on a map , but it was not marked , being doubtless too insignificant . Improbable that [he]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of had gone to such a place alone ; [he]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of was enjoying [himself]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of with [friends]3725-friends , careless what became of [her]197-rhoda . Having allowed all this time to go by [he]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of would never seek [her]197-rhoda again . [He]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of found that [her]197-rhoda will was the equal of [his]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of own , and , as [he]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of could not rule [her]197-rhoda , [she]197-rhoda was numbered among [the women who had afforded [him]3014-the man who had so disturbed and sullied the swift , pure stream of interesting experiences]3016-the women who had afforded him interesting experiences , to be thought of seriously no more .

During the next week [she]197-rhoda threw [herself]197-rhoda with energy upon [her]197-rhoda work , stifling the repugnance with which at first it affected [her]197-rhoda , and seeming at length to recover the old enthusiasm . This was the only way of salvation . Idleness and absence of purpose would soon degrade [her]197-rhoda in a sense [she]197-rhoda had never dreamt of . [She]197-rhoda made a plan of daily occupation , which by leaving not a vacant moment from early morning to late at night , should give [her]197-rhoda the sleep of utter weariness . New studies were begun in the hour or two before breakfast . [She]197-rhoda even restricted [her]197-rhoda diet , and ate only just enough to support life , rejecting wine and everything that was most agreeable to [her]197-rhoda palate .

[She]197-rhoda desired to speak privately with [Mildred Vesper]234-mildred , and opportunity might have been made , but , as part of [her]197-rhoda scheme of self - subdual , this conversation was postponed until the second week . It took place one evening when work was over .

' [I]197-rhoda have been wanting to ask [you]234-mildred , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda began , ' whether [you]234-mildred have any news of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]234-mildred wrote to [her]265-mrs. widdowson not long ago , and [she]265-mrs. widdowson answered from a new address . [She]265-mrs. widdowson said [she]265-mrs. widdowson had left [[her]265-mrs. widdowson husband]4145-her husband and would never go back to [him]4145-her husband . '[234-mildred]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda nodded gravely .

' Then what [I]234-mildred had heard was true . [You]234-mildred have n't seen [her]265-mrs. widdowson ? '[234-mildred]

' [She]265-mrs. widdowson asked [me]197-rhoda not to come . [She]265-mrs. widdowson is living with [[her]265-mrs. widdowson sister]455-her sister . '[197-rhoda]

' Did [she]265-mrs. widdowson give [you]234-mildred any reason for the separation from [[her]265-mrs. widdowson husband]4145-her husband ? '[234-mildred]

' None , '[234-mildred] answered [Mildred]234-mildred . ' But [she]265-mrs. widdowson said it was no secret ; that [every one]3621-every one knew . That 's why [I]234-mildred have n't spoken to [you]234-mildred about it as [I]234-mildred should have done otherwise after [our]5756-our last conversation . '[234-mildred]

' The fact is no secret , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda coldly . ' But why will [she]265-mrs. widdowson offer no explanation ? '[197-rhoda]

[Mildred]234-mildred shook [her]234-mildred head , signifying inability to make any satisfactory reply , and there the dialogue ended ; for [Rhoda]197-rhoda could not proceed in it without appearing to encourage scandal . The hope of eliciting some suggestive information had failed ; but whether [Mildred]234-mildred had really disclosed all [she]234-mildred knew seemed doubtful .

At the end of the week [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot left [home]364-home for [her]212-miss barfoot own holiday ; [she]212-miss barfoot was going to [Scotland]141-scotland , and would be away for nearly the whole of September . At this time of the year the work in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street was very light ; not much employment offered for the typewriters , and [the pupils]3018-the pupils numbered only about half a dozen . Nevertheless , it pleased [Rhoda]197-rhoda to have the establishment under [her]197-rhoda sole direction ; [she]197-rhoda desired authority , and by magnifying the importance of that which now fell into [her]197-rhoda hands , [she]197-rhoda endeavoured to sustain [herself]197-rhoda under the secret misery which , for all [her]197-rhoda efforts , weighed no less upon [her]197-rhoda as time went on . It was a dreary make - believe . On the first night of solitude at [Chelsea]19-chelsea [she]197-rhoda shed bitter tears ; and not only wept , but agonized in mute frenzy , the passions of [her]197-rhoda flesh torturing [her]197-rhoda until [she]197-rhoda thought of death as a refuge . Now [she]197-rhoda whispered the name of [[her]197-rhoda lover]2138-her lover with every word and phrase of endearment that [her]197-rhoda heart could suggest ; the next moment [she]197-rhoda cursed [him]2138-her lover with the fury of deadliest hatred . In the half - delirium of sleeplessness , [she]197-rhoda revolved wild , impossible schemes for revenging [herself]197-rhoda , or , as the mood changed , all but resolved to sacrifice everything to [her]197-rhoda love , to accuse [herself]197-rhoda of ignoble jealousy and entreat forgiveness . Of many woeful nights this was the worst [she]197-rhoda had yet suffered .

It recalled to [her]197-rhoda with much vividness a memory of girlhood , or indeed of childhood . [She]197-rhoda thought of [that figure in the dim past]3020-that figure in the dim past , [that rugged , harsh - featured man , who had given [her]197-rhoda [the first suggestion of independence]3022-the first suggestion of independence ; thrice [her]197-rhoda own age]3021-that rugged , harsh - featured man , who had given her the first suggestion of independence ; thrice her own age , yet [the inspirer of such tumultuous emotion in [her]197-rhoda ignorant heart]3023-the inspirer of such tumultuous emotion in her ignorant heart ; [[her]197-rhoda friend]631-her friend at [Clevedon]1-clevedon [Mr. Smithson]199-mr. smithson . A question from [Mary Barfoot]225-mary had caused [her]197-rhoda to glance back at [him]199-mr. smithson across the years , but only for an instant , and with self - mockery . What [she]197-rhoda now endured was the ripe intensity of a woe that fell upon [her]197-rhoda , at fifteen , when [Mr. Smithson]199-mr. smithson passed from [her]197-rhoda sight and away for ever . Childish folly ! but the misery of it , the tossing at night , the blank outlook ! How contemptible to revive such sensations , with mature intellect , after so long and stern a discipline !

Dreading the Sunday , so terrible in its depressing effect upon the lonely and unhappy , [she]197-rhoda breakfasted as soon as possible , and left [home]364-home simply to walk , to exert [herself]197-rhoda physically , that fatigue and sleep might follow . There was a dull sky , but no immediate fear of rain ; the weather brightened a little towards noon . Careless of the direction , [she]197-rhoda walked on and on until the last maddening church bell had ceased its clangour ; [she]197-rhoda was far out in [the western suburbs]3026-the western suburbs , and weariness began to check [her]197-rhoda quick pace . Then [she]197-rhoda turned back . Without intending it , [she]197-rhoda passed by [[Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove 's house]3027-mrs. cosgrove 's house , or rather would have passed , when [she]197-rhoda saw [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove at the dining - room window making signs to [her]197-rhoda . In a moment the door opened and [she]197-rhoda went in . [She]197-rhoda was glad of this accident , for [the social lady]3028-the social lady might have something to tell about [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , who often visited [her]197-rhoda .

' In mercy , come and talk to [me]277-mrs. cosgrove ! '[277-mrs. cosgrove] exclaimed [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove . ' [I]277-mrs. cosgrove am quite alone , and feel as if [I]277-mrs. cosgrove could hang [myself]277-mrs. cosgrove . Are [you]277-mrs. cosgrove obliged to go anywhere ? '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

' No . [I]277-mrs. cosgrove was having a walk . '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

' A walk ? What astonishing energy ! It never occurs to [me]277-mrs. cosgrove to take a walk in [London]6-london . [I]277-mrs. cosgrove came from [the country]3602-the country last night and expected to find [[my]277-mrs. cosgrove sister]3519-my sister here , but [she]3519-my sister wo n't arrive till Tuesday . [I]277-mrs. cosgrove have been standing at the window for an hour , getting crazy with ennui . '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

[They]3029-they went to [the drawing - room]3697-the drawing - room . It was not long before [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove made an allusion which enabled [Rhoda]197-rhoda to speak of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . For a month or more [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove had seen and heard nothing of [her]265-mrs. widdowson ; [she]265-mrs. widdowson had been out of [town]624-town all the time . [Rhoda]197-rhoda hesitated , but could not keep silence on the subject that had become a morbid preoccupation of [her]197-rhoda mind . [She]265-mrs. widdowson told as much as [she]265-mrs. widdowson knew excepting the suspicion against [Everard Barfoot]242-everard .

' It does n't in the least surprise [me]632-the listener , '[632-the listener] said [the listener]632-the listener , with interest . ' [I]632-the listener saw [they]3029-they would n't be able to live together very well . Without [children]3468-children the thing was impossible . Of course [she]265-mrs. widdowson has told [you]632-the listener all about it ? '[632-the listener]

' [I]265-mrs. widdowson have n't seen [her]265-mrs. widdowson since it happened . '[265-mrs. widdowson]

' Do [you]632-the listener know , [I]632-the listener always have a distinct feeling of pleasure when [I]632-the listener hear of [married people]4421-married people parting . How horrible that would seem to [some of [[our]5762-we good friends]5763-our good friends]5761-some of our good friends ! But it is n't a malicious pleasure ; there 's nothing personal in it . As [I]632-the listener have told [you]632-the listener before , [I]632-the listener think , [I]632-the listener led a very contented life with [[my]632-the listener husband]5246-my husband . But marriage in general is such a humbug [you]632-the listener forgive the word . '[632-the listener]

' Of course it is , '[197-rhoda] assented [Rhoda]197-rhoda , laughing with forced gaiety .

' [I]632-the listener am glad of anything that seems to threaten it as an institution in its present form . A scandalous divorce case is a delight to [me]632-the listener anything that makes it evident how much misery would be spared if [we]5762-we could civilize [ourselves]5762-we in this respect . There are women whose conduct [I]632-the listener think personally detestable , and whom yet [I]632-the listener ca n't help thanking for [their]4421-married people assault upon social laws . [We]5762-we shall have to go through a stage of anarchy , [you]632-the listener know , before reconstruction begins . Yes , in that sense [I]632-the listener am [an anarchist]5765-an anarchist . Seriously , [I]632-the listener believe if [a few men]5766-a few men and [women in prominent position]5767-women in prominent position would contract marriage of the free kind , without [priest]5768-priest or [lawyer]5769-lawyer , open and defiantly , [they]5766-a few men would do more benefit to [their]5766-a few men kind than in any other possible way . [I]632-the listener do n't declare this opinion to [every one]3621-every one , but only because [I]632-the listener am [a coward]5771-a coward . Whatever [one]472-one believes with heart and soul [one]472-one ought to make known . '[632-the listener]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda wore a look of anxious reflection .

' It needs a great deal of courage , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said . ' To take that step , [I]197-rhoda mean . '[197-rhoda]

' Of course . [We]5762-we need [martyrs]5773-martyrs . And yet [I]632-the listener doubt whether the martyrdom would be very long , or very trying , to [intellectual people]5774-intellectual people . [A woman of brains who boldly acted upon [her]5775-a woman of brains who boldly acted upon her conviction conviction]5775-a woman of brains who boldly acted upon her conviction would have no lack of congenial society . [The best people]5776-the best people are getting more liberal than [they]5776-the best people care to confess to [each other]543-each other . Wait until [some one]735-some one puts the matter to the test and [you]197-rhoda will see . '[632-the listener]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda became so busy with [her]197-rhoda tumultuous thoughts that [she]197-rhoda spoke only a word now and then , allowing [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove to talk at large on this engrossing theme .

' Where is [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson living ? '[3033-the revolutionist] [the revolutionist]3033-the revolutionist at length inquired .

' [I]3033-the revolutionist do n't know . But [I]3033-the revolutionist can get [you]197-rhoda [her]265-mrs. widdowson address . '[3033-the revolutionist]

' Pray do . [I]235-miss vesper shall go and see [her]265-mrs. widdowson . [We]5779-we are quite friendly enough for [me]235-miss vesper to do so without impertinence . '[235-miss vesper]

Having lunched with [[her]197-rhoda acquaintance]3034-her acquaintance , [Rhoda]197-rhoda went in the afternoon to [[Mildred Vesper]234-mildred 's lodgings]3035-mildred vesper 's lodgings . [Miss Vesper]235-miss vesper was at [home]364-home , reading , in [her]235-miss vesper usual placid mood . [She]235-miss vesper gave [Rhoda]197-rhoda the address that was on [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's last brief note , and that evening [Rhoda]197-rhoda sent it to [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove by letter .

In two days [she]197-rhoda received a reply . [Mrs. Cosgrove]277-mrs. cosgrove had called upon [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson at [[her]265-mrs. widdowson lodgings at [Clapham]46-clapham]3037-her lodgings at clapham . ' [She]265-mrs. widdowson is ill , wretched , and unwilling to talk . [I]277-mrs. cosgrove could only stay about a quarter of an hour , and to ask questions was impossible . [She]265-mrs. widdowson mentioned [your]197-rhoda name , and appeared very anxious to hear about [you]197-rhoda ; but when [I]277-mrs. cosgrove asked whether [she]265-mrs. widdowson would like [you]197-rhoda to call [she]265-mrs. widdowson grew timid all at once , and said [she]265-mrs. widdowson hoped [you]197-rhoda would n't unless [you]197-rhoda really desired to see [her]265-mrs. widdowson . Poor thing ! Of course [I]277-mrs. cosgrove do n't know what it all means , but [I]277-mrs. cosgrove came away with maledictions on marriage in [my]277-mrs. cosgrove heart one is always safe in indulging that feeling . '[277-mrs. cosgrove]

A week or so after this there arrived for [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot a letter from [Everard]242-everard . The postmark was [Ostend]175-ostend .

Never before had [Rhoda]197-rhoda been tempted to commit a break of confidence such as in any one else [she]197-rhoda would have scorned beyond measure . [She]197-rhoda had heard , of course , of [people secretly opening letters with the help of steam]3038-people secretly opening letters with the help of steam ; whether it could be done with absolute security from detection [she]197-rhoda did not feel sure , but [her]197-rhoda thoughts dwelt on the subject for several hours . It was terrible to hold this letter of [Everard]242-everard 's writing , and yet be obliged to send it away without knowledge of the contents , which perhaps gravely concerned [her]197-rhoda . [She]197-rhoda could not ask [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot to let [her]197-rhoda know what [Everard]242-everard had written . The information might perhaps be voluntarily granted ; but perhaps not .

To steam the back of the envelope would it not leave marks , a rumpling or discoloration ? Even to be suspected of such dishonour would be more bitter to [her]197-rhoda than death . Could [she]197-rhoda even think of it ? How [she]197-rhoda was degraded by this hateful passion , which wrought in [her]197-rhoda like a disease !

With two others which that day had arrived [she]197-rhoda put the letter into a large envelope , and so dispatched it . But no satisfaction rewarded [her]197-rhoda ; [her]197-rhoda heart raged against [the world]3462-the world , against every law of life .

When , in a few days , a letter came to [her]197-rhoda from [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot , [she]197-rhoda tore it Open , and there yes , there was [Everard]242-everard 's handwriting . [Mary]225-mary had sent the communication for [her]197-rhoda to read .

' [DEAR COUSIN MARY]213-mary , After all [I]225-mary was rather too grumpy In [my]225-mary last note to [you]213-mary . But [my]225-mary patience had been desperately tried . [I]225-mary have gone through a good deal ; now at last [I]225-mary am recovering sanity , and can admit that [you]213-mary had no choice but to ask those questions . Here is a conundrum not very difficult to solve , [I]0-i dare say .

' Do [you]213-mary know anything about [Arromanches]171-arromanches ? [A very quiet little spot on [the Normandy coast]5781-the normandy coast]5780-a very quiet little spot on the normandy coast . [Everard]242-everard 's letter put [Rhoda]197-rhoda beside [herself]197-rhoda with wrath . If [she]197-rhoda could not crush out [her]197-rhoda love for [this man]742-this man [she]197-rhoda would poison [herself]197-rhoda as [she]197-rhoda had so often decided [she]197-rhoda would do if ever some hopeless malady , such as cancer , took hold upon [her]197-rhoda

And be content to feed [his]742-this man vanity ? To give [him]742-this man the lifelong reflection that , for love of [him]742-this man , [a woman excelled by few in qualities of brain and heart]3041-a woman excelled by few in qualities of brain and heart had died like a rat ?

[She]197-rhoda walked about [the rooms]1005-the rooms , here and there , [upstairs]443-upstairs and [downstairs]523-downstairs , in a fever of unrest . After all , was [he]742-this man not behaving in the very way [she]197-rhoda ought to desire ? Was [he]742-this man not helping [her]197-rhoda to hate [him]742-this man ? [He]742-this man struck at [her]197-rhoda with unmanly blows , thinking , no doubt , to quell [her]197-rhoda pride , and bring [her]197-rhoda to [him]742-this man in prostrate humility . Never ! If [he]742-this man loved [her]197-rhoda [he]742-this man must woo once more .

But the suggestion in [Mary]213-mary 's letter was not fruitless . When [she]197-rhoda had thought over it for a day or two [she]197-rhoda wrote to [Virginia Madden]191-virginia , asking [her]191-virginia as a favour to come to [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road on Saturday afternoon . [Virginia]191-virginia quickly replied with a promise to call , and punctually kept the engagement . Though [she]197-rhoda was much better dressed than in the days previous to [Monica]195-monica 's marriage , [she]197-rhoda had lost something for which costume could not compensate : [her]197-rhoda face had no longer that unmistakable refinement which had been wo nt to make [her]197-rhoda attire a secondary consideration . [She]197-rhoda sat down on the edge of a chair , like [an anxious applicant for work or charity]3046-an anxious applicant for work or charity , and a moistness of the eyes , which obliged [her]197-rhoda to use [her]197-rhoda handkerchief frequently , strengthened this resemblance .

' [I]0-i ca n't say . [I]0-i do n't know . '[0-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's voice signified a conflict of feeling . Had [she]197-rhoda been disinterested [her]197-rhoda opinion would not have wavered for a moment ; [she]197-rhoda would have declared that [the wife]2254-the wife 's inclination must be the only law in such a case . As it was , [she]197-rhoda could only regard [Monica]195-monica with profound mistrust and repugnance . The story of decisive evidence kept back seemed to [her]197-rhoda only [a weak woman]3060-a weak woman 's falsehood a fiction due to shame and despair . Undoubtedly it would give some vague relief to [her]197-rhoda mind if [Monica]195-monica were persuaded to go to [Clevedon]1-clevedon , but [she]197-rhoda could not bring [herself]197-rhoda to think of visiting [the suffering woman]3061-the suffering woman . Whatever the end might be , [she]197-rhoda would have not part in bringing it about . [Her]197-rhoda dignity , [her]197-rhoda pride , should remain unsullied by such hateful contact .

' [I]191-virginia must n't stay longer , '[191-virginia] said [Virginia]191-virginia , rising after a painful silence . ' [I]191-virginia am always afraid to be away from [her]3061-the suffering woman even for an hour ; the fear of dreadful things that might happen haunts [me]191-virginia day and night . How glad [I]191-virginia shall be when [Alice]185-alice comes ! '[191-virginia]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda had no words of sympathy . [Her]197-rhoda commiseration for [Virginia]191-virginia was only such as [she]197-rhoda might have felt for [any stranger involved in sordid troubles]3062-any stranger involved in sordid troubles ; all the old friendliness had vanished . Nor would [she]197-rhoda have been greatly shocked or astonished had [she]197-rhoda followed [Miss Madden]204-miss madden on the way to [the railway station]3507-the railway station and seen [her]204-miss madden , after a glance up and down [the street]594-the street , turn quickly into [a public - house]2743-a public - house , and come forth again holding [her]204-miss madden handkerchief to [her]204-miss madden lips . [A feeble , purposeless , hopeless woman]3066-a feeble , purposeless , hopeless woman ; type of [a whole class]3067-a whole class ; living only to deteriorate

Will ! Purpose ! Was [she]197-rhoda not in danger of forgetting these watchwords , which had guided [her]197-rhoda life out of youth into maturity ? [That poor creature]3068-that poor creature 's unhappiness was doubtless in great measure due to the conviction that in missing love and marriage [she]197-rhoda had missed everything . So thought [the average woman]4201-the average woman , and in [her]197-rhoda darkest hours [she]197-rhoda too had fallen among [those poor of spirit]3070-those poor of spirit , the flesh prevailing . But the soul in [her]197-rhoda had not finally succumbed . Passion had a new significance ; [her]197-rhoda conception of life was larger , more liberal ; [she]197-rhoda made no vows to crush the natural instincts . But [her]197-rhoda conscience , [her]197-rhoda sincerity should not suffer . Wherever destiny might lead , [she]197-rhoda would still be [the same proud and independent woman , responsible only to [herself]197-rhoda , fulfilling the nobler laws of [her]197-rhoda existence]3071-the same proud and independent woman , responsible only to herself , fulfilling the nobler laws of her existence .

A day or two after this [she]197-rhoda had [guests]5325-guests to dine with [[her]197-rhoda Mildred Vesper and [Winifred Haven]311-mildred]311-mildred . Among [the girls whom [she]197-rhoda had helped to educate]3073-the girls whom she had helped to educate , [these two]3074-these two seemed by far the most self - reliant , the most courageous and hopeful . In minor details of character [they]3074-these two differed widely , and intellectually [Miss Haven]227-miss haven was far in advance . [Rhoda]197-rhoda had a strong desire to observe [them]3074-these two as [they]3074-these two talked about the most various subjects ; [she]197-rhoda knew [them]3074-these two well , but hoped to find in [them]3074-these two some new suggestion of womanly force which would be of help to [her]197-rhoda in [her]197-rhoda own struggle for redemption .

It was seldom that either of [them]3074-these two ailed anything . [Mildred]311-mildred still showed traces of [her]311-mildred country breeding ; [she]311-mildred was the more robust , walked with a heavier step , had less polish of manner . Under strain of any kind [Winifred]311-mildred 's health would sooner give way , but [her]311-mildred natural vivacity promised long resistance to oppressing influences . [Mildred]311-mildred had worked harder , and amid privations of which [the other girl]3075-the other girl knew nothing . [She]311-mildred would never distinguish [herself]311-mildred , but it was difficult indeed to imagine [her]311-mildred repining so long as [she]311-mildred had [her]311-mildred strength and [[her]311-mildred congenial friends]3076-her congenial friends . Twenty years hence , in all probability , [she]311-mildred would keep the same clear , steady eye , the same honest smile , and the same dry humour in [her]311-mildred talk . [Winifred]311-mildred was more likely to traverse a latitude of storm . For one thing , [her]311-mildred social position brought [her]311-mildred in the way of [[men]3461-men who might fall in love with [her]311-mildred]3078-men who might fall in love with her , whereas [Mildred]311-mildred lived absolutely apart from [the male world]3079-the male world ; doubtless , too , [her]311-mildred passions were stronger . [She]311-mildred loved literature , spent as much time as possible in study , and had set [her]311-mildred mind upon helping to establish [that ideal woman]3080-that ideal woman 's paper of which there was often talk at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's .

In this company [Rhoda]197-rhoda felt [her]311-mildred old ambitions regaining their power over [her]311-mildred . To [these girls]3081-these girls [she]311-mildred was an exemplar ; it made [her]311-mildred smile to think how little [they]3081-these girls could dream of what [she]311-mildred had experienced during the last few weeks ; if ever a moment of discontent assailed [them]3081-these girls , [they]3081-these girls must naturally think of [her]311-mildred , of the brave , encouraging words [she]311-mildred had so often spoken . For a moment [she]311-mildred had deserted [them]3081-these girls , abandoning a course which [her]311-mildred reason steadily approved for one that was beset with perils of indignity . It would shame [her]311-mildred if [they]3081-these girls knew the whole truth and yet [she]311-mildred wished it were possible for [them]3081-these girls to learn that [she]311-mildred had been passionately wooed . A contemptible impulse of vanity ; away with it !

There was a chance , it seemed to [her]311-mildred , that during [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's absence [Everard]242-everard might come to [the house]368-the house . [Mary]213-mary had written to [him]242-everard ; [he]242-everard would know that [she]311-mildred was away . What better opportunity , if [he]242-everard had not dismissed [her]311-mildred memory from [his]242-everard thoughts ?

Every evening [she]311-mildred made [herself]311-mildred ready to receive [a possible visitor]3083-a possible visitor . [She]311-mildred took thought for [her]311-mildred appearance . But the weeks passed by , [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot returned , and [Everard]242-everard had given no sign .

[She]213-mary would set a date , a limit . If before Christmas [he]242-everard neither came nor wrote all was at an end ; after that [she]213-mary would not see [him]242-everard , whatever [his]242-everard plea . And having persuaded [herself]311-mildred that this decision was irrevocable , [she]311-mildred thought it as well to gratify [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's curiosity , for by now [she]311-mildred felt able to relate what had happened in [Cumberland]86-cumberland with a certain satisfaction the feeling [she]311-mildred had foreseen when , in the beginning of [her]311-mildred acquaintance with [Everard]242-everard , it flattered [her]311-mildred to observe [his]242-everard growing interest . [Her]311-mildred narrative , to which [Mary]213-mary listened with downcast eyes , presented the outlines of the story veraciously ; [she]311-mildred told of [Everard]242-everard 's wish to dispense with the legal bond , of [her]311-mildred own indecision , and of the issue .

' When [your]242-everard letter came , could [I]311-mildred very well have acted otherwise than [I]311-mildred did ? It was not a flat refusal to believe [him]242-everard ; all [I]311-mildred asked was that things should be cleared up before [our]5819-our marriage . For [his]242-everard own sake [he]242-everard ought to have willingly agreed to that . [He]242-everard preferred to take [my]311-mildred request as an insult . [His]242-everard unreasonable anger made [me]311-mildred angry too . And now [I]311-mildred do n't think [we]5819-our shall ever meet again unless as [mere acquaintances]5820-mere acquaintances . '[311-mildred]

' [I]632-the listener think , '[632-the listener] commented [the listener]632-the listener , ' that [he]242-everard behaved with extraordinary impudence . '[632-the listener]

' In the first proposal ? But [I]311-mildred [myself]311-mildred attach no importance to the marriage ceremony . '[311-mildred]

' Then why did [you]197-rhoda insist upon it ? '[213-mary] asked [Mary]213-mary , with a smile that might have become sarcastic but that [her]213-mary eye met [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's .

' Would [you]197-rhoda have received [us]5819-our ? '[311-mildred]

' In the one case as readily as in the other . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda was silent and darkly thoughtful .

' Perhaps [I]197-rhoda never felt entire confidence in [him]242-everard . '[197-rhoda]

[Mary]213-mary smiled and sighed .

CHAPTER XXVIII

THE BURDEN OF [FUTILE SOULS]312-futile souls

' [My]311-mildred own dearest love , if [I]311-mildred could but describe to [you]5821-you all [I]311-mildred have suffered before sitting down to write this letter ! Since [our]5819-our last meeting [I]311-mildred have not known one hour of quietness . To think that [I]311-mildred missed [you]5821-you when [you]5821-you called and left that note for it was [you]5821-you [yourself]5821-you , was it not ? The journey was horrible , and the week that [I]311-mildred have spent [here]3495-here [I]311-mildred assure [you]5821-you [I]311-mildred have not slept for more than a few minutes at a time , and [I]311-mildred am utterly broken down by misery . [[My]311-mildred darling]4601-my darling '[311-mildred] etc . ' [I]311-mildred regard [myself]311-mildred as [a criminal]5824-a criminal ; if [you]5821-you have suffered a thousandth part of what [I]311-mildred have , [I]311-mildred deserve any punishment that could be devised . For it has all been [my]311-mildred fault . Knowing as [I]311-mildred did that [our]5825-we love could never end in happiness , it was [my]311-mildred duty to hide what [I]311-mildred felt . [I]311-mildred ought never to have contrived that first meeting alone for it was contrived ; [I]311-mildred sent [[my]311-mildred sisters]3714-my sisters away on purpose . [I]311-mildred ought never '[311-mildred] etc . ' The only reflection that can ever bring [me]311-mildred comfort is that [our]5825-we love has been pure . [We]5825-we can always think of [each other]543-each other without shame . And why should this love ever have an end ? [We]5825-we are separated , and perhaps shall never see [each other]543-each other again , but may not [our]5825-we hearts remain for ever true ? May [we]5825-we not think '[311-mildred] etc . ' If [I]311-mildred were to bid [you]5829-you leave [[your]5829-you home]5440-your home and come to [me]311-mildred , [I]311-mildred should be once more acting with base selfishness . [I]311-mildred should ruin [your]5829-you life , and load [my]311-mildred own with endless self - reproach . [I]311-mildred find that even mere outward circumstances would not allow of what for a moment [we]5825-we dreamt might be possible , and of that [I]311-mildred am glad , since it helps [me]311-mildred to overcome the terrible temptation . Oh , if [you]5829-you knew how that temptation '[311-mildred] etc . ' Time will be [a friend to both of [us]5825-we]5831-a friend to both of us , dearest [Monica]195-monica . Forget [each other]543-each other [we]5825-we never can , [we]5825-we never will . But [our]5825-we unsullied love '[311-mildred] etc .

[Monica]195-monica read it through again , the long rigmarole . Since the day that [she]195-monica received it addressed to ' [Mrs. Williamson]313-mrs. williamson '[311-mildred] at [the little stationer]3085-the little stationer 's by [Lavender Hill]4-lavender hill the day before [she]195-monica consented to accompany [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister into [new lodgings]3087-new lodgings the letter had lain in its hiding - place . Alone this afternoon , for [Virginia]191-virginia was gone to call on [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , alone and miserable , every printed page a weariness to [her]195-monica sight , [she]195-monica took out the French - stamped envelope and tried to think that its contents interested [her]195-monica . But not a word had power of attraction or of repulsion . The tender phrases affected [her]195-monica no more than if they had been addressed to [a stranger]557-a stranger . Love was become a meaningless word . [She]195-monica could not understand how [she]195-monica had ever drifted into such relations with [the writer]1071-the writer . Fear and anger were the sole passions surviving in [her]195-monica memory from those days which had violently transformed [her]195-monica life , and it was not with [Bevis]288-bevis , but [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband , that these emotions were connected . [Bevis]288-bevis 's image stood in that already distant past like [a lay figure]3091-a lay figure , the mere semblance of [a man]3627-a man . And with such conception of [him]4145-her husband [his]4145-her husband letter corresponded ; it was artificial , lifeless , as if extracted from some vapid novel .

But [she]195-monica must not destroy it . Its use was still to come . Letter and envelope must go back again into hiding , and await the day which would give [them]3093-them power over human lives .

Suffering , as always , from headache and lassitude , [she]195-monica sat by the window and watched [the people who passed along [her]195-monica daily occupation]3094-the people who passed along her daily occupation . [This sitting - room]3095-this sitting - room was on [the ground floor]1221-the ground floor . In [a room above some one]3097-a room above some one was receiving a music lesson ; every now and then [the teacher]3098-the teacher 's voice became audible , raised in sharp impatience , and generally accompanied by a clash upon the keys of the piano . At the area gate of [the house]368-the house opposite [a servant]622-a servant was talking angrily with [[a tradesman]3101-a tradesman 's errand boy]3102-a tradesman 's errand boy , who at length put [his]3102-a tradesman 's errand boy thumb to [his]3102-a tradesman 's errand boy nose with insulting significance and scampered off . Then , at [the house next to [that one]3104-that one]3103-the house next to that one , there stopped [a cab]836-a cab , from which [three busy - looking men]3106-three busy - looking men alighted . [Cabs full of [people]3536-people]3107-cabs full of people were always stopping at that door . [Monica]195-monica wondered what it meant , who might live [there]453-there . [She]195-monica thought of asking [the landlady]447-the landlady .

[Virginia]191-virginia 's return aroused [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica went [upstairs]443-upstairs with [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister into [the double - bedded room which [they]3114-they occupied]3113-the double - bedded room which they occupied .

' What have [you]191-virginia heard ? '[195-monica]

' [He]5833-he went [there]453-there . [He]5833-he told [them]3114-they everything . '[447-the landlady]

[The sister]521-the sister , struggling with shame , was irritated by the needlessness of [her]195-monica falsehood .

' Then why were [you]195-monica so particular to forbid [me]195-monica , [Monica]195-monica ? '[195-monica]

' It was better but [I]195-monica do n't care . [I]195-monica do n't care for anything . Let [them]5840-them believe and say what [they]5840-them like '[195-monica]

' Oh , do , do , do be quiet ! '[3116-the other wretchedly] cried [the other wretchedly]3116-the other wretchedly . ' [I]3116-the other wretchedly shall go somewhere and live alone or die alone . ' [You]195-monica are not very grateful , [Monica]195-monica . '[195-monica]

Scenes such as this had been frequent lately . [The sisters]358-the sisters were a great trial to each other 's nerves . Tedium and pain drove [Monica]195-monica to the relief of altercation , and [Virginia]191-virginia , through [her]191-virginia secret vice , was losing all self - control . [They]358-the sisters wrangled , wailed , talked of parting , and only became quiet when [their]358-the sisters emotions had exhausted [them]358-the sisters . Yet no ill - feeling resulted from these disputes . [Virginia]191-virginia had a rooted faith in [[her]191-virginia sister]455-her sister 's innocence ; when angry , [she]191-virginia only tried to provoke [Monica]195-monica into a full explanation of the mystery , so insoluble by unaided conjecture . And [Monica]195-monica , say what [she]195-monica might , repaid this confidence with profound gratitude . Strangely , [she]195-monica had come to view [herself]195-monica as not only innocent of the specific charge brought against [her]195-monica , but as [a woman in every sense maligned]3119-a woman in every sense maligned . So utterly void of significance , from [her]195-monica present point of view , was all that had passed between [her]195-monica and [Bevis]288-bevis . One reason for this lay in the circumstance that , when exchanging declarations with [[her]195-monica lover]2138-her lover , [she]195-monica was ignorant of a fact which , had [she]195-monica known it , would have made [their]358-the sisters meetings impossible . [[Her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband [she]195-monica could never regard but as [a cruel enemy]3122-a cruel enemy ; none the less , nature had set a seal upon [their]358-the sisters marriage against which the revolt of [her]195-monica heart was powerless . If [she]195-monica lived to bear [a child]3719-a child , [that child]3124-that child would be [his]4145-her husband . [Widdowson]217-widdowson , when [he]217-widdowson heard of [her]195-monica condition , would declare it the final proof of infidelity ; and this injustice it was that exclusively occupied [her]195-monica mind . On this account [she]195-monica could think only of the accusation which connected [her]195-monica name with [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's all else was triviality . Had there been no slightest ground for imputation upon [her]195-monica conduct , [she]195-monica could not have resented more vigorously [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband 's refusal to acquit [her]195-monica of dishonour .

On the following day , after [their]358-the sisters early dinner , [Monica]195-monica unexpectedly declared that [she]195-monica must go out .

' Come with [me]195-monica . [We]358-the sisters 'll go into [the town]3722-the town . '[195-monica]

' [You]195-monica must be very careful not to catch cold . After all this time that [you]195-monica have n't left [the house]368-the house '[521-the sister]

[Monica]195-monica cut short the admonition and dressed [herself]195-monica with feverish impatience . As [they]3127-they set forth , drops of rain had begun to fall , but [Monica]195-monica would not hear of waiting . The journey by [train]3815-train made [her]195-monica nervous , but affected [her]195-monica spirits favourably . At [Victoria]100-victoria it rained so heavily that [they]3127-they could not go out into [the street]594-the street .

' It does n't matter . There 's plenty to see [here]3495-here . Let [us]3127-they walk about and look at things . [We]3127-they 'll buy something at [the bookstall]5847-the bookstall to take back . '[3131-the person]

As [they]3127-they turned again towards [the platform]865-the platform , [Monica]195-monica was confronted by a face which [she]195-monica at once recognized , though it had changed noticeably in the eighteen months since [she]195-monica last saw it . [The person]3131-the person was [Miss Eade]216-miss eade , [[her]195-monica old acquaintance at [the shop]582-the shop]3132-her old acquaintance at the shop . To what a remote period of [her]195-monica life this name seemed to recall [Monica]195-monica ! [She]195-monica glanced quickly at [the speaker]884-the speaker , and again detected suspicion in [her]195-monica eyes .

[Miss Eade]216-miss eade nodded , but immediately altered [her]216-miss eade mind and checked [Monica]195-monica as [she]195-monica was turning away .

The change from tolerable civility to coarse insolence was so sudden that [Monica]195-monica stood in astonishment . There was unconcealed malignity in the gaze fixed upon [her]195-monica .

' What do [you]195-monica mean ? What interest have [you]195-monica in learning [my]384-the girl name ? '[384-the girl]

[The girl]384-the girl brought [her]384-the girl face near , and snarled in the true voice of the pavement

[Monica]195-monica walked away to [the bookstall]5847-the bookstall . When [she]195-monica had joined [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister , [she]195-monica became aware that [Miss Eade]216-miss eade was keeping [her]195-monica in sight .

[They]3149-us selected a cheap volume , and , having [their]3149-us return tickets , moved towards [the departure platform]3150-the departure platform . Before [she]195-monica could reach the gates [Monica]195-monica heard [Miss Eade]216-miss eade 's voice just behind [her]195-monica ; it had changed again , and the appealing note reminded [her]195-monica of many conversations in [Walworth Road]7-walworth road .

' Do tell [me]216-miss eade ! [I]216-miss eade beg [your]216-miss eade pardon for bein '[216-miss eade] rude . Do n't go without telling [me]0-i . '[216-miss eade]

The meaning of this importunity had already flashed upon [Monica]195-monica , and now [she]195-monica felt a slight pity for the tawdry , abandoned creature , in whom there seemed to survive that hopeless passion of old days .

' [My]195-monica name , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said abruptly , ' is [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . '[195-monica]
