' [I]195-monica have told [you]216-miss eade what [you]216-miss eade wish to know . [I]195-monica ca n't talk '[195-monica]

' And [you]216-miss eade do n't really know nothing about [him]4486-her brother ? '[216-miss eade]

' Nothing whatever . '[195-monica]

[Miss Eade]216-miss eade moved sullenly away , not more than half convinced . Long after [Monica]195-monica 's disappearance [she]195-monica strayed about [the platform]865-the platform and the approaches to [the station]586-the station . [[Her]195-monica brother]4486-her brother was slow in arriving . Once or twice [she]195-monica held casual colloquy with [men who also stood waiting perchance for [[their]3154-men who also stood waiting perchance for their sisters sisters]3155-their sisters]3154-men who also stood waiting perchance for their sisters ; and ultimately one of these was kind enough to offer [her]195-monica refreshment , which [she]195-monica graciously accepted . [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda would have classed [her]195-monica and mused about [her]195-monica : a not unimportant type of [the odd woman]3156-the odd woman .

After this [Monica]195-monica frequently went out , always accompanied by [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister . It happened more than once that [they]3158-they saw [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , who walked past [the house at least every other day]3159-the house at least every other day ; [he]3160-i did n't approach [them]3158-they , and had [he]3160-i done so [Monica]195-monica would have kept an obstinate silence .

For more than a fortnight [he]3160-i had not written to [her]195-monica . At length there came a letter , merely a repetition of [his]3160-i former appeals .

' [I]3160-i hear , '[3160-i] [he]3160-i wrote , ' that [[your]195-monica elder sister]566-your elder sister is coming to [London]6-london . Why should [she]566-your elder sister live [here]3495-here in [lodgings]5863-lodgings , when [a comfortable house]5864-a comfortable house is at the disposal of [you]195-monica all ? Let [me]3160-i again entreat [you]195-monica to go to [Clevedon]1-clevedon . The furniture shall be moved any moment [you]195-monica wish . [I]3160-i solemnly promise not to molest [you]195-monica in any way , not even by writing . It shall be understood that business makes it necessary for [me]3160-i to live in [London]6-london . For [[your]195-monica sister]3611-your sister 's sake do accept this offer . If [I]3160-i could see [you]195-monica in private , [I]3160-i should be able to give [you]195-monica a very good reason why [[your]195-monica sister]3611-your sister [Virginia]191-virginia would benefit by the change ; perhaps [you]195-monica [yourself]195-monica know of it . Do answer [me]3160-i , [Monica]195-monica . Never again will [I]3160-i refer by word or look to what has passed . [I]3160-i am anxious only to put an end to the wretched life that [you]195-monica are leading . Do go to [the house at [Clevedon]1-clevedon]5814-the house at clevedon , [I]3160-i implore [you]195-monica . '[3160-i]

It was not the first time [he]3161-he had hinted darkly at a benefit that might accrue to [Virginia]191-virginia if [she]191-virginia left [London]6-london . [Monica]195-monica had no inkling of what [he]3161-he meant . [She]195-monica showed [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister this communication , and asked if [she]455-her sister could understand the passage which concerned [her]455-her sister .

' [I]191-virginia have n't the least idea , '[191-virginia] [Virginia]191-virginia replied , [her]191-virginia hand trembling as [she]191-virginia held the paper . ' [I]191-virginia can only suppose that [he]3161-he thinks that [I]191-virginia am not looking well . '[191-virginia]

The letter was burnt , as [all the others]3163-all the others had been , no answer vouchsafed . [Virginia]191-virginia 's mind seemed to waver with regard to the proposed settlement at [Clevedon]1-clevedon . Occasionally [she]191-virginia had urged [Monica]195-monica , with extreme persistence , to accept what was offered ; at other times , as now , for instance , [she]191-virginia said nothing . Yet [Alice]185-alice had written beseeching [her]185-alice to use all means for [Monica]195-monica 's persuasion . [Miss Madden]204-miss madden infinitely preferred the thought of dwelling at [Clevedon]1-clevedon however humble the circumstances had been to that of coming back into [[London]6-london lodgings]3164-london lodgings whilst [she]204-miss madden sought for a new engagement . The situation [she]204-miss madden was about to quit had proved more laborious than any in [her]204-miss madden experience . At first merely [a governess]4331-a governess , [she]204-miss madden had gradually become [[children]3468-children 's nurse]3167-children 's nurse as well , and for the past three months had been expected to add the tendance of [a chronic invalid]3168-a chronic invalid to [her]204-miss madden other duties . Not a day 's holiday since [she]204-miss madden came . [She]204-miss madden was broken down and utterly woebegone .

But [Monica]195-monica could not be moved . [She]204-miss madden refused to go again under [[her]204-miss madden husband]4145-her husband 's roof until [he]4145-her husband had stated that [his]4145-her husband charge against [her]204-miss madden was absolutely unfounded . This concession went beyond [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's power ; [he]4145-her husband would forgive , but still declined to stultify [himself]4145-her husband by a statement that could have no meaning . To what extent [[his]4145-her husband wife]4133-his wife had deceived [him]4145-her husband might be uncertain , but the deception was a proved fact . Of course it never occurred to [him]4145-her husband that [Monica]195-monica 's demand had a significance which emphasized the name of [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . Had [he]4145-her husband said , ' [I]4145-her husband am convinced that [your]195-monica relations with [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot were innocent , '[4145-her husband] [he]4145-her husband would have seemed to [himself]4145-her husband to be acquitting [her]195-monica of all criminality ; whereas [Monica]195-monica , from [her]195-monica point of view , illogically supposed that [he]4145-her husband might credit [her]195-monica on this one issue without overthrowing all the evidence that declared [her]195-monica untrustworthy . In short , [she]195-monica expected [him]4145-her husband to read a riddle which there was scarcely a possibility of [his]4145-her husband understanding .

[Alice]185-alice was in correspondence with [the gloomy husband]2217-the gloomy husband . [She]185-alice promised [him]4145-her husband to use every effort to gain [Monica]195-monica 's confidence . Perhaps as [the eldest sister]3172-the eldest sister [she]185-alice might succeed where [Virginia]191-virginia had failed . [Her]185-alice faith in [Monica]195-monica 's protestations had been much shaken by the item of intelligence which [Virginia]191-virginia secretly communicated ; [she]185-alice thought it too likely that [[her]185-alice unhappy sister]3173-her unhappy sister saw no refuge from disgrace but in stubborn denial of guilt . And in the undertaking that was before [her]185-alice [she]185-alice had no hope save through the influence of religion with [her]185-alice a much stronger force than with either of [the others]397-the others .

[Her]195-monica arrival was expected on the last day of September . The evening before , [Monica]195-monica went to bed soon after eight o'clock ; for a day or two [she]195-monica had suffered greatly , and at length had allowed [a doctor]1291-a doctor to be called . Whenever [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister retired very early , [Virginia]191-virginia also went to [[her]191-virginia own bedroom]3177-her own bedroom , saying that [she]191-virginia preferred to sit there .

[The room]444-the room much surpassed in comfort that which [she]191-virginia had occupied at [[Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's]1461-mrs. conisbee 's ; [it]444-the room was spacious , and provided with a couple of very soft armchairs . Having locked [her]191-virginia door , [Virginia]191-virginia made certain preparations which had nothing to do with natural repose . From the cupboard [she]191-virginia brought out a little spirit - kettle , and put water to boil . Then from [a more private repository]3180-a more private repository were produced a bottle of gin and a sugar - basin , which , together with a tumbler and spoon , found a place on a little table drawn up within reach of the chair where [she]191-virginia was going to sit . On the same table lay a novel procured this afternoon from [the library]3604-the library . Whilst the water was boiling , [Virginia]191-virginia made a slight change of dress , conducive to bodily ease . Finally , having mixed a glass of gin and water one - third only of the diluent [she]191-virginia sat down with one of [her]191-virginia frequent sighs and began to enjoy the evening .

The last , the very last , of such enjoyment ; so [she]191-virginia assured [herself]191-virginia . [Alice]185-alice 's presence in [the house]368-the house would render impossible what [she]185-alice had hitherto succeeded in disguising from [Monica]195-monica . [Her]185-alice conscience welcomed the restraint , which was coming none too soon , for [her]185-alice will could no longer be depended upon . If [she]185-alice abstained from strong liquors for three or four days it was now a great triumph ; yet worthless , for even in abstaining [she]185-alice knew that the hour of indulgence had only been postponed . A fit of unendurable depression soon drove [her]185-alice to the only resource which had immediate efficacy . The relief , [she]185-alice knew , was another downward step ; but presently [she]185-alice would find courage to climb back again up to the sure ground . Save for [her]185-alice trouble on [Monica]195-monica 's account the temptation would already have been conquered . And now [Alice]185-alice 's arrival made courage a mere necessity .

[Her]185-alice bottle was all but empty ; [she]185-alice would finish it to - night , and in the morning , as [her]185-alice custom was , take it back to [[the grocer]3183-the grocer 's]3184-the grocer 's in [her]185-alice little hand - bag . How convenient that this kind of thing could be purchased at [the grocer]3183-the grocer 's ! In the beginning [she]185-alice had chiefly made use of [railway refreshment rooms]3186-railway refreshment rooms . Only on rare occasions did [she]185-alice enter [a public - house]2743-a public - house , and always with the bitterest sense of degradation . To sit comfortably at [home]364-home , the bottle beside [her]185-alice , and a novel on [her]185-alice lap , was an avoidance of the worst shame attaching to this vice ; [she]185-alice went to bed , and in the morning ah , the morning brought its punishment , but [she]185-alice incurred no risk of being detected .

Brandy had first of all been [her]185-alice drink , as is generally the case with [women of the educated class]3189-women of the educated class . There are so many plausible excuses for taking a drop of brandy . But it cost too much . Whisky [she]185-alice had tried , and did not like . Finally [she]185-alice had recourse to gin , which was palatable and very cheap . The name , debased by such foul associations , still confused [her]185-alice when [she]185-alice uttered it ; as a rule , [she]185-alice wrote it down in a list of groceries which [she]185-alice handed over the counter .

To - night [she]185-alice drank [her]185-alice first glass quickly ; a consuming thirst was upon [her]185-alice . By half - past eight the second was gently steaming at [her]185-alice elbow . At nine [she]185-alice had mixed the third ; it must last a long time , for the bottle was now empty .

The novel entertained [her]185-alice , but [she]185-alice often let [her]185-alice thoughts stray from it ; [she]185-alice reflected with exultation that to - night 's indulgence was [her]185-alice very last . On the morrow [she]185-alice would be [a new woman]3190-a new woman . [Alice]185-alice and [she]185-alice would devote [themselves]3191-they to [[their]3191-they poor sister]3192-their poor sister , and never rest till [they]3191-they had restored [her]3192-their poor sister to a life of dignity . This was a worthy , a noble task ; success in it must need minister to [her]185-alice own peace . Before long [they]3191-they would all be living at [Clevedon]1-clevedon a life of ideal contentment . It was no longer necessary to think of [the school]3929-the school , but [she]185-alice would exert [herself]185-alice for the moral instruction of [young women]1110-young women on the principles inculcated by [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda .

The page before [her]185-alice was no longer legible ; the book dropped from [her]185-alice lap . Why this excited [her]185-alice laughter [she]185-alice could not understand ; but [she]185-alice laughed for a long time , until [her]185-alice eyes were dim with tears . It might be better to go to bed . What was the hour ? [She]185-alice tried vainly to read [her]185-alice watch , and again laughed at such absurd incapacity . Then

Surely that was a knock at [her]185-alice door ? Yes ; it was repeated , with a distinct calling of [her]185-alice name . [She]185-alice endeavoured to stand up .

' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden ! '[447-the landlady] It was [the landlady]447-the landlady 's voice . ' [Miss Madden]204-miss madden ! Are [you]185-alice in bed yet ? '[447-the landlady]

[Virginia]191-virginia succeeded in reaching the door .

' What is it ? '[447-the landlady]

Another voice spoke .

' It is [I]447-the landlady , [Virginia]191-virginia . [I]447-the landlady have come this evening instead of to - morrow . Please let [me]447-the landlady come in . '[447-the landlady]

' [Alice]185-alice ? [You]185-alice ca n't [I]447-the landlady 'll come wait [downstairs]523-downstairs . '[447-the landlady]

[She]185-alice was still able to understand the situation , and able , [she]185-alice thought , to speak coherently , to disguise [her]185-alice condition . The things on the table must be put out of sight . In trying to do this , [she]185-alice upset [her]185-alice glass and knocked the empty bottle on to the floor . But in a few minutes bottle , glass , and spirit - kettle were hidden away . The sugar - basin [she]185-alice lost sight of ; it still remained in its former place .

Then [she]185-alice opened the door , and with uncertain step went out into [the passage]425-the passage .

' [Alice]185-alice ! '[185-alice] [she]185-alice called aloud .

At once both [[her]185-alice sisters]516-her sisters appeared , coming out of [[Monica]195-monica 's chamber]3198-monica 's chamber . [Monica]195-monica had partly dressed [herself]195-monica .

' Why have [you]191-virginia come to - night ? '[191-virginia] [Virginia]191-virginia exclaimed , in a voice which seemed to [her]191-virginia own ears perfectly natural .

[She]191-virginia tottered , and was obliged to support [herself]191-virginia against the wall . The light from [[her]191-virginia room]1526-her room fell full upon [her]191-virginia , and [Alice]185-alice , who had stepped forward to give [her]191-virginia a kiss , not only saw , but smelt , that something very strange was the matter . The odour proceeding from [the bedroom]466-the bedroom , and that of [Virginia]191-virginia 's breath , left small doubt as to the cause of delay in giving admittance .

Whilst [Alice]185-alice stood bewildered , [Monica]195-monica received an illumination which instantly made clear to [her]195-monica many things in [Virginia]191-virginia 's daily life . At the same moment [she]195-monica understood those mysterious hints concerning [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister in [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's letters .

' Come into [the room]444-the room , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica said abruptly . ' Come , [Virgie]209-virgie . '[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica do n't understand why has [Alice]185-alice come to - night ? what 's the time ? '[195-monica]

[Monica]195-monica took hold of [the tottering woman]3202-the tottering woman 's arm and drew [her]3202-the tottering woman out of [the passage]425-the passage . The cold air had produced its natural effect upon [Virginia]191-virginia , who now with difficulty supported [herself]191-virginia .

' [O Virgie]209-virgie ! '[3172-the eldest sister] cried [the eldest sister]3172-the eldest sister , when the door was closed . ' What is the matter ? What does it mean ? '[3172-the eldest sister]

Already [she]191-virginia had been shedding tears at the meeting with [Monica]195-monica , and now distress overcame [her]191-virginia ; [she]191-virginia sobbed and lamented .

' What have [you]209-virgie been doing , [Virgie]209-virgie ? '[195-monica] asked [Monica]195-monica with severity .

' Doing ? [I]195-monica feel a little faint surprise did n't expect '[195-monica]

' Sit down at once . [You]209-virgie are disgusting ! Look , [Alice]185-alice . '[195-monica] [She]195-monica pointed to the sugar - basin on the table ; then , after a rapid glance round [the room]444-the room , [she]195-monica went to the cupboard and threw the door open . ' [I]195-monica thought so . Look , [Alice]185-alice . And to think [I]195-monica never suspected this ! It has been going on a long time oh , a long time . [She]195-monica was doing it at [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's before [I]195-monica was married . [I]195-monica remember smelling spirits '[195-monica]

[Virginia]191-virginia was making efforts to rise .

' What are [you]195-monica talking about ? '[191-virginia] [she]191-virginia exclaimed in a thick voice , and with a countenance which was changing from dazed astonishment to anger . ' It 's only when [I]191-virginia feel faint . Do [you]195-monica suppose [I]191-virginia drink ? Where 's [Alice]185-alice ? Was n't [Alice]185-alice here ? '[191-virginia]

' O [Virgie]209-virgie ! What does it mean ? How could [you]195-monica ? '[191-virginia]

' Go to bed at once , [Virginia]191-virginia , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica . ' [We]5870-we 're[195-monica] ashamed of [you]191-virginia . Go back into [[my]0-i room]3516-my room [Alice]185-alice , and [I]0-i 'll get [her]185-alice to bed . '[0-i]

Ultimately this was done . With no slight trouble , [Monica]195-monica persuaded [[her]195-monica sister]455-her sister to undress , and got [her]455-her sister into a recumbent position , [Virginia]191-virginia all the time protesting that [she]191-virginia had perfect command of [her]191-virginia faculties , that [she]191-virginia needed no help whatever , and was utterly at a loss to comprehend the insults directed against [her]191-virginia .

' Lie quiet and go to sleep , '[195-monica] was [Monica]195-monica 's last word , uttered contemptuously .

[She]195-monica extinguished the lamp and returned to [[her]195-monica own room]3208-her own room , where [Alice]185-alice was still weeping . The unexpected arrival had already been explained to [Monica]195-monica . Sudden necessity for housing [a visitor]3209-a visitor had led to the proposition that [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , for [her]204-miss madden last night , should occupy [[a servant]622-a servant 's bedroom]3211-a servant 's bedroom . Glad to get away , [Alice]185-alice chose the alternative of leaving [the house]368-the house at once . It had been arranged that [she]185-alice should share [[Virginia]191-virginia 's room]3213-virginia 's room , but to - night this did not seem advisable .

' To - morrow , '[195-monica] said [Monica]195-monica , ' [we]5871-we must talk to [her]185-alice very seriously . [I]195-monica believe [she]185-alice has been drinking like that night after night . It explains the look [she]185-alice always has the first thing in the morning . Could [you]185-alice have imagined anything so disgraceful ? '[195-monica]

But [Alice]185-alice had softened towards [the erring woman]3214-the erring woman .

' [You]185-alice must remember what [her]185-alice life has been , [dear]3530-dear . [I]185-alice 'm[185-alice] afraid loneliness is very often a cause '[185-alice]

' [She]185-alice need n't have been lonely . [She]185-alice refused to come and live at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill , and now of course [I]185-alice understand why . [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee must have known about it , and it was [her]185-alice duty to tell [me]185-alice . [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson had found out somehow , [I]185-alice feel sure . '[185-alice]

[She]185-alice explained the reason of this belief .

' [You]185-alice know what it all points to , '[204-miss madden] said [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , drying [her]3214-the erring woman sallow , pimpled cheeks . ' [You]185-alice must do as [[your]185-alice husband]4995-your husband wishes , dearest . [We]5874-we must go to [Clevedon]1-clevedon . [There]453-there [the poor girl]3529-the poor girl will be out of temptation . '[204-miss madden]

' [You]185-alice and [Virgie]209-virgie may go . '[185-alice]

' [You]185-alice too , [Monica]195-monica . [[My]204-miss madden dear sister]3052-my dear sister , it is [your]185-alice duty . '[204-miss madden]

' Do n't use that word to [me]3215-the other angrily ! '[3215-the other angrily] exclaimed [the other angrily]3215-the other angrily . ' It is not [my]3215-the other angrily duty . It can be [no woman]2171-no woman 's duty to live with [a man [she]2171-no woman hates]5879-a man she hates - or even to make a pretence of living with [him]5879-a man she hates . '[3215-the other angrily]

' But , dearest '[204-miss madden]

' [You]185-alice must n't begin this to - night , [Alice]185-alice . [I]3215-the other angrily have been ill all day , and now [my]3215-the other angrily head is aching terribly . Go [downstairs]523-downstairs and eat the supper [they]5881-they have laid for [you]185-alice . '[3215-the other angrily]

' [I]204-miss madden could n't touch a morsel , '[204-miss madden] sobbed [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . ' Oh , everything is too dreadful ! Life is too hard ! '[204-miss madden]

[Monica]195-monica had returned to bed , and lay there with [her]195-monica face half hidden against the pillow .

' If [you]185-alice do n't want any supper , '[204-miss madden] [she]204-miss madden said in a moment , ' please go and tell [them]5881-they , so that [they]5881-they need n't sit up for [you]185-alice . '[204-miss madden]

[Alice]185-alice obeyed . When [she]185-alice came up again , [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister was , or pretended to be , asleep ; even the noise made by bringing luggage into [the room]444-the room did not cause [her]185-alice to move . Having sat in despondency for a while , [Miss Madden]204-miss madden opened one of [her]204-miss madden boxes , and sought in it for the Bible which it was [her]204-miss madden custom to make use of every night . [She]204-miss madden read in the book for about half an hour , then covered [her]204-miss madden face with [her]204-miss madden hands and prayed silently . This was [her]204-miss madden refuge from the barrenness and bitterness of life .

CHAPTER XXIX

CONFESSION AND COUNSEL

[The sisters]358-the sisters did not exchange a word until morning , but [both of [them]358-the sisters]534-both of them lay long awake . [Monica]195-monica was the first to lose consciousness ; [she]195-monica slept for about an hour , then the pains of a horrid dream disturbed [her]195-monica , and again [she]195-monica took up the burden of thought . Such waking after brief , broken sleep , when mind and body are beset by weariness , yet can not rest , when night with its awful hush and its mysterious movements makes a strange , dread habitation for the spirit such waking is a grim trial of human fortitude . The blood flows sluggishly , yet subject to sudden tremors that chill the veins and for an instant choke the heart . Purpose is idle , the will impure ; over the past hangs a shadow of remorse , and life that must yet be lived shows lurid , a steep pathway to [the hopeless grave]3220-the hopeless grave . Of this cup [Monica]195-monica drank deeply .

A fear of death compassed [her]195-monica about . Night after night it had thus haunted [her]195-monica . In the daytime [she]195-monica could think of death with resignation , as a refuge from miseries of which [she]195-monica saw no other end ; but this hour of silent darkness shook [her]195-monica with terrors . Reason availed nothing ; its exercise seemed criminal . The old faiths , never abandoned , though modified by the breath of intellectual freedom that had just touched [her]195-monica , reasserted all [their]3221-their power . [She]195-monica saw [herself]195-monica as [a wicked woman]3222-a wicked woman , in the eye of truth not less wicked than [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband declared [her]195-monica . [A sinner]3224-a sinner stubborn in impenitence , defending [herself]195-monica by a paltry ambiguity that had all the evil of a direct lie . [Her]195-monica soul trembled in its nakedness .

What redemption could there be for [her]195-monica ? What path of spiritual health was discoverable ? [She]195-monica could not command [herself]195-monica to love [the father of [[her]195-monica child]4416-her child]3225-the father of her child ; the repugnance with which [she]195-monica regarded [him]3225-the father of her child seemed to [her]195-monica a sin against nature , yet how was [she]195-monica responsible for it ? Would it profit [her]195-monica to make confession and be humbled before [him]3225-the father of her child ? The confession must some day be made , if only for [[her]195-monica child]4416-her child 's sake ; but [she]195-monica foresaw in it no relief of mind . Of all human beings [[her]195-monica husband]4145-her husband was the one least fitted to console and strengthen [her]195-monica . [She]195-monica cared nothing for [his]3225-the father of her child pardon ; from [his]3225-the father of her child love [she]195-monica shrank . But if there were [some one to whom [she]195-monica could utter [her]195-monica thoughts with the certainty of being understood

[[Her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters had not the sympathetic intelligence necessary for aiding [her]195-monica]3229-some one to whom she could utter her thoughts with the certainty of being understood her sisters had not the sympathetic intelligence necessary for aiding her ; [Virginia]191-virginia was weaker than [she]191-virginia [herself]191-virginia , and [Alice]185-alice dealt only in sorrowful commonplaces , profitable perhaps to [her]185-alice own heart , but powerless over the trouble of another 's . Among [the few people [she]195-monica had called [[her]195-monica friends]1123-her friends]3231-the few people she had called her friends there was [one strong woman strong of brain]3233-one strong woman strong of brain , and capable , it might be , of speaking the words that go from soul to soul ; [this woman [she]195-monica had deeply offended , yet owing to mere mischance]3234-this woman she had deeply offended , yet owing to mere mischance . Whether or no [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda had lent ear to [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's wooing [she]195-monica must be gravely offended ; [she]195-monica had given proof of it in the interview reported by [Virginia]191-virginia . The scandal spread abroad by [Widdowson]217-widdowson might even have been fatal to a happiness of which [she]195-monica had dreamt . To [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda some form of reparation was owing . And might not an avowal of the whole truth elicit from [her]195-monica counsel of gratitude some solace , some guidance ?

Amid the tremors of night [Monica]195-monica felt able to take this step , for the mere chance of comfort that it offered . But when day came the resolution had vanished ; shame and pride again compelled [her]195-monica to silence .

And this morning [she]195-monica had new troubles to think about . [Virginia]191-virginia was keeping [[her]191-virginia [room]3236-room]1526-her room ; would admit [no one]3554-no one ; answered every whisper of appeal with brief , vague words that signified anything or nothing . [The others]397-the others breakfasted in gloom that harmonized only too well with the heavy , dripping sky visible from [their]397-the others windows . Only at midday did [Alice]185-alice succeed in obtaining speech with [[her]185-alice remorseful sister]3239-her remorseful sister . [They]397-the others were closeted together for more than an hour , and [the elder woman]924-the elder woman came forth at last with red , tear - swollen eyes .

' [We]397-the others must leave [her]924-the elder woman alone today , '[924-the elder woman] [she]924-the elder woman said to [Monica]195-monica . ' [She]924-the elder woman wo n't take any meal . Oh , the wretched state [she]924-the elder woman is in ! If only [I]924-the elder woman could have known of this before ! '[924-the elder woman]

' Has it been going on for very long ? '[924-the elder woman]

' It began soon after [she]924-the elder woman went to live at [[Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's]1461-mrs. conisbee 's . [She]924-the elder woman has told [me]924-the elder woman all about [it]5883-it [poor girl]5630-poor girl , poor thing ! Whether [she]924-the elder woman can ever break [herself]924-the elder woman of it , who knows ? [She]924-the elder woman says that [she]924-the elder woman will take the pledge of total abstinence , and [I]924-the elder woman encouraged [her]924-the elder woman to do so ; it may be some use , do n't [you]195-monica think ? '[924-the elder woman]

' Perhaps [I]924-the elder woman do n't know '[924-the elder woman]

' But [I]924-the elder woman have no faith in [her]924-the elder woman reforming unless [she]924-the elder woman goes away from [London]6-london . [She]924-the elder woman thinks [herself]924-the elder woman that only a new life in [a new place]5885-a new place will give [her]924-the elder woman the strength . [[My]924-the elder woman dear]3534-my dear , at [Mrs. Conisbee]206-mrs. conisbee 's [she]924-the elder woman starved [herself]924-the elder woman to have money to buy spirits ; [she]924-the elder woman went without any food but dry bread day after day . '[924-the elder woman]

' Of course that made it worse . [She]924-the elder woman must have craved for support . '[924-the elder woman]

' Of course . And [[your]195-monica husband]4995-your husband knows about it . [He]4995-your husband came once when [she]924-the elder woman was in that state when [you]195-monica were away '[924-the elder woman]

[Monica]195-monica nodded sullenly , [her]195-monica eyes averted .

' [Her]924-the elder woman life has been so dreadfully unhealthy . [She]924-the elder woman seems to have become weak - minded . All [her]924-the elder woman old interests have gone ; [she]924-the elder woman reads nothing but novels , day after day . '[924-the elder woman]

' [I]924-the elder woman have noticed that . '[924-the elder woman]

' How can [we]5888-we help [her]924-the elder woman , [Monica]195-monica ? Wo n't [you]195-monica make a sacrifice for [the poor girl]3529-the poor girl 's sake ? Can not [I]924-the elder woman persuade [you]195-monica , [dear]3530-dear ? [Your]195-monica position has a bad influence on [her]924-the elder woman ; [I]924-the elder woman can see it has . [She]924-the elder woman worries so about [you]195-monica , and then tries to forget the trouble [you]195-monica know how . '[924-the elder woman]

Not that day , nor the next , could [Monica]195-monica listen to these entreaties . But [[her]3241-her sister]455-her sister at length prevailed . It was late in the evening ; [Virginia]191-virginia had gone to bed , and [the others]397-the others sat silently , without occupation . [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , after several vain efforts to speak , bent forward and said in a low , grave voice ,

' [Monica]195-monica [you]195-monica are deceiving [us]397-the others all . [You]195-monica are guilty . '[204-miss madden]

' Why do [you]195-monica say that ? '[185-alice]

' [I]204-miss madden know it . [I]204-miss madden have watched [you]195-monica . [You]195-monica betray [yourself]195-monica when [you]195-monica are thinking . '[204-miss madden]

[The other]462-the other sat with brows knitted , with hard , defiant lips .

' All [your]195-monica natural affection is dead , and only guilt could have caused that . [You]195-monica do n't care what becomes of [[your]195-monica sister]3611-your sister . Only the fear , or the evil pride , that comes of guilt could make [you]195-monica refuse what [we]397-the others ask of [you]195-monica . [You]195-monica are afraid to let [[your]195-monica husband]4995-your husband know of [your]195-monica condition . '[462-the other]

[Alice]185-alice could not have spoken thus had [she]185-alice not believed what [she]185-alice said . The conviction had become irresistible to [her]185-alice mind . [Her]185-alice voice quivered with intensity of painful emotion .

' That last is true , '[455-her sister] said [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister , when there had been silence for a minute .

' [You]195-monica confess it ? O [Monica]195-monica '[455-her sister]

' [I]5786-the younger do n't confess what [you]185-alice think , '[5786-the younger] went on [the younger]5786-the younger , with more calmness than [she]5786-the younger had yet commanded in these discussions .

' Of that [I]455-her sister am not guilty . [I]455-her sister am afraid of [his]4995-your husband knowing , because [he]4995-your husband will never believe [me]455-her sister . [I]455-her sister have a proof which would convince [anyone else]5893-anyone else ; but , even if [I]455-her sister produced it , it would be no use . [I]455-her sister do n't think it is possible to persuade [him]4995-your husband - when once [he]4995-your husband knows '[455-her sister]

' If [you]185-alice were innocent [you]185-alice would disregard that . '[455-her sister]

' Listen to [me]455-her sister , [Alice]185-alice . If [I]455-her sister were guilty [I]455-her sister should not be living [here]3495-here at [his]4995-your husband expense . [I]455-her sister only consented to do that when [I]455-her sister knew what [my]455-her sister condition was . But for this thing [I]455-her sister should have refused to accept another penny from [him]4995-your husband . [I]455-her sister should have drawn upon [my]455-her sister own money until [I]455-her sister was able to earn [my]455-her sister own living again . If [you]185-alice wo n't believe this it shows [you]185-alice know nothing of [me]455-her sister . [Your]185-alice reading of [my]455-her sister face is all foolishness . '[455-her sister]

' [I]204-miss madden would to God [I]204-miss madden were sure of what [you]185-alice say ! '[204-miss madden] moaned [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , with vehemence which seemed extraordinary in such [a feeble , flabby person]3247-a feeble , flabby person .

' [You]185-alice know that [I]195-monica told [[my]195-monica husband]5246-my husband lies , '[195-monica] exclaimed [Monica]195-monica , ' so [you]185-alice think [I]195-monica am never to be trusted . [I]195-monica did tell [him]5246-my husband lies ; [I]195-monica ca n't deny it , and [I]195-monica am ashamed of it . But [I]195-monica am not [a deceitful woman]5896-a deceitful woman [I]195-monica can say that boldly . [I]195-monica love the truth better than falsehood . If it were n't for that [I]195-monica should never have left [home]364-home . [A deceitful woman]5896-a deceitful woman , in [my]195-monica circumstances [you]185-alice do n't understand [them]5899-them would have cheated [[her]5896-a deceitful woman husband]4145-her husband into forgiving [her]5896-a deceitful woman such [a husband as [mine]195-monica]5901-a husband as mine . [She]5896-a deceitful woman would have calculated the most profitable course . [I]195-monica left [[my]195-monica husband]5246-my husband because it was hateful to [me]195-monica to be with [a man for whom [I]195-monica had lost every trace of affection]5903-a man for whom i had lost every trace of affection . In keeping away from [him]5246-my husband [I]195-monica am acting honestly . But [I]195-monica have told [you]185-alice that [I]195-monica am also afraid of [his]5246-my husband making a discovery . [I]195-monica want [him]5246-my husband to believe when the time comes '[195-monica]

[She]3248-i broke off .

' Then , [Monica]195-monica , [you]195-monica ought to make known to [him]5246-my husband what [you]195-monica have been concealing . If [you]195-monica are telling the truth , that confession ca n't be anything very dreadful . '[3248-i]

' [Alice]185-alice , [I]3248-i am willing to make an agreement . If [[my]3248-i husband]5246-my husband will promise never to come near [Clevedon]1-clevedon until [I]3248-i send for [him]5246-my husband [I]3248-i will go and live there with [you]185-alice and [Virgie]209-virgie . '[3248-i]

' [He]5246-my husband has promised that , [darling]3629-darling , '[204-miss madden] cried [Miss Madden]204-miss madden delightedly .

' Not to [me]3248-i . [He]5246-my husband has only said that [he]5246-my husband will make [[his]5246-my husband home in [London]6-london]5906-his home in london for a time : that means [he]5246-my husband would come whenever [he]5246-my husband wished , if it were only to speak to [you]185-alice and [Virgie]209-virgie . But [he]5246-my husband must undertake never to come near until [I]3248-i give [him]5246-my husband permission . If [he]5246-my husband will promise this , and keep [his]5246-my husband word , [I]3248-i pledge [myself]3248-i to let [him]5246-my husband know the whole truth in less than a year . Whether [I]3248-i live or die , [he]5246-my husband shall be told the truth in less than a year . '[3248-i]

Before going to bed [Alice]185-alice wrote and dispatched a few lines to [Widdowson]217-widdowson , requesting an interview with [him]217-widdowson as soon as possible . [She]185-alice would come to [[his]217-widdowson house]4634-his house at any hour [he]217-widdowson liked to appoint . The next afternoon brought a reply , and that same evening [Miss Madden]204-miss madden went to [Herne Hill]32-herne hill . As a result of what passed [there]453-there , a day or two saw the beginning of the long - contemplated removal to [Clevedon]1-clevedon . [Widdowson]217-widdowson found a lodging in [the neighbourhood of [[his]217-widdowson old home]3252-his old home]3251-the neighbourhood of his old home ; [he]217-widdowson had engaged never to cross [the bounds of [Somerset]36-somerset]3253-the bounds of somerset until [he]217-widdowson received [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife 's permission .

As soon as this compact was established [Monica]195-monica wrote to [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . A short submissive letter . ' [I]195-monica am about to leave [London]6-london , and before [I]195-monica go [I]195-monica very much wish to see [you]197-rhoda . Will [you]197-rhoda allow [me]195-monica to call at some hour when [I]195-monica could speak to [you]197-rhoda in private ? There is something [I]195-monica must make known to [you]197-rhoda , and [I]195-monica can not write it . '[195-monica] After a day 's interval came the reply , which was still briefer . [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda would be at [home]364-home at half - past eight this or the next evening .

[Monica]195-monica 's announcement that [she]195-monica must go out alone after nightfall alarmed [[her]195-monica sisters]516-her sisters . When told that [her]195-monica visit was to [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda [they]516-her sisters were somewhat relieved , but [Alice]185-alice begged to be permitted to accompany [her]195-monica .

' It will be lost trouble , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica declared . ' More likely than not there is [a spy waiting to follow [me]195-monica wherever [I]195-monica go]5907-a spy waiting to follow me wherever i go . [Your]195-monica assurance that [I]195-monica really went to [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's wo n't be needed . '[195-monica]

When [the others]397-the others still opposed [her]195-monica purpose [she]195-monica passed from irony into anger .

' Have [you]195-monica undertaken to save [him]5907-a spy waiting to follow me wherever i go the expense of [private detectives]5908-private detectives ? Have [you]195-monica promised never to let [me]195-monica go out of [your]195-monica sight ? '[195-monica]

' Certainly [I]185-alice have not , '[185-alice] said [Alice]185-alice .

' Nor [I]191-virginia , [dear]3530-dear , '[191-virginia] protested [Virginia]191-virginia . ' [He]5907-a spy waiting to follow me wherever i go has never asked anything of the kind . '[191-virginia]

' Then [you]3530-dear may be sure that [the spies]5910-the spies are still watching [me]195-monica . Let [them]5910-the spies have something to do , [poor creatures]5911-poor creatures . [I]195-monica shall go alone , so [you]3530-dear need n't say any more . '[195-monica]

[She]195-monica took [train]3815-train to [York Road Station]50-york road station , and thence , as the night was fine , walked to [Chelsea]19-chelsea . This semblance of freedom , together with the sense of having taken a courageous resolve , raised [her]195-monica spirits . [She]195-monica hoped that [a detective]3259-a detective might be tracking [her]195-monica ; the futility of such measures afforded [her]195-monica a contemptuous satisfaction . Not to arrive before the appointed hour [she]195-monica loitered on [Chelsea Embankment]43-chelsea embankment , and it gave [her]195-monica pleasure to reflect that in doing this [she]195-monica was outraging the proprieties . [Her]195-monica mind was in a strange tumult of rebellious and distrustful thought . [She]195-monica had determined on making a confession to [Rhoda]197-rhoda ; but would [she]195-monica benefit by it ? Was [Rhoda]197-rhoda generous enough to appreciate [her]195-monica motives ? It did not matter much . [She]195-monica would have discharged a duty at the expense of such shame , and this fact alone might strengthen [her]195-monica to face the miseries beyond .

As [she]195-monica stood at [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot 's door [he]3260-he heart quailed . To [the servant who opened [she]195-monica could only speak [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's name]3261-the servant who opened she could only speak miss nunn 's name ; fortunately instructions had been given , and [she]195-monica was straightway led to [the library]3604-the library . Here [she]195-monica waited for nearly five minutes . Was [Rhoda]197-rhoda doing this on purpose ? [Her]195-monica face , when at length [she]195-monica entered , made it seem probable ' , a cold dignity , only not offensive haughtiness , appeared in [her]195-monica bearing . [She]195-monica did not offer to shake hands , and used no form of civility beyond requesting [[her]195-monica visitor]619-her visitor to be seated .[195-monica]

' [I]195-monica am going away , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica began , when silence compelled [her]195-monica to speak .

' Yes , so [you]197-rhoda told [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

' [I]3263-i can see that [you]197-rhoda ca n't understand why [I]3263-i have come . '[3263-i]

' [Your]197-rhoda note only said that [you]197-rhoda wished to see [me]195-monica . '[195-monica]

[Their]3263-i eyes met , and [Monica]195-monica knew in the moment that succeeded that [she]195-monica was being examined from head to foot . It seemed to [her]195-monica that [she]195-monica had undertaken something beyond [her]195-monica strength ; [her]195-monica impulse was to invent a subject of brief conversation and escape into the darkness . But [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda spoke again .

' Is it possible that [I]197-rhoda can be of any service to [you]195-monica ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes . [You]195-monica might be . But [I]197-rhoda find it is very difficult to say what [I]197-rhoda '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda waited , offering no help whatever , not even that of a look expressing interest .

' Will [you]197-rhoda tell [me]197-rhoda , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda , why [you]197-rhoda behave so coldly to [me]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Surely that does n't need any explanation , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson ? '[197-rhoda]

' [You]197-rhoda mean that [you]197-rhoda believe everything [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson has said ? '[197-rhoda]

' [Mr. Widdowson]217-widdowson has said nothing to [me]197-rhoda . But [I]197-rhoda have seen [[your]197-rhoda sister]3611-your sister , and there seemed no reason to doubt what [she]3611-your sister told [me]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

' [She]3611-your sister could n't tell [you]197-rhoda the truth , because [she]3611-your sister does n't know it . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda presume [she]3611-your sister at least told no untruth . '[197-rhoda]

' What did [Virginia]191-virginia say ? [I]197-rhoda think [I]197-rhoda have a right to ask that . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda appeared to doubt it . [She]197-rhoda turned [her]197-rhoda eyes to the nearest bookcase , and for a moment reflected .

' [Your]197-rhoda affairs do n't really concern [me]197-rhoda , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said at length . ' [They]5914-they have been forced upon [my]197-rhoda attention , and perhaps [I]197-rhoda regard [them]5914-they from a wrong point of view . Unless [you]197-rhoda have come to defend [yourself]197-rhoda against a false accusation , is there any profit in [our]5915-our talking of these things ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda have come for that . '[197-rhoda]

' Then [I]197-rhoda am not so unjust as to refuse to hear [you]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

' [My]197-rhoda name has been spoken of together with [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot 's . This is wrong . It began from a mistake . '[197-rhoda]

[Monica]195-monica could not shape [her]195-monica phrases . Hastening to utter the statement that would relieve [her]195-monica from [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's personal displeasure , [she]195-monica used the first simple words that rose to [her]195-monica lips .

' When [I]195-monica went to [Bayswater]77-bayswater that day [I]195-monica had no thought of seeing [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot . [I]195-monica wished to see [someone else]5916-someone else . '[195-monica]

[The listener]632-the listener manifested more attention . [She]195-monica could not mistake the signs of sincerity in [Monica]195-monica 's look and speech .

' [Some one]735-some one , '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked coldly , ' who was living with [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot ? '[195-monica]

' No . [Some one in [the same building]5919-the same building]5918-some one in the same building ; in [another flat]5920-another flat . [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's look was fixed on [the speaker]884-the speaker 's countenance .

' [You]195-monica knew [he]249-mr. barfoot was going to [Cumberland]86-cumberland ? '[195-monica] [she]195-monica asked in a slow , careful voice .

' [He]249-mr. barfoot told [me]195-monica so . [I]195-monica met [him]249-mr. barfoot , quite by chance , the day before . '[195-monica]

' Where did [you]195-monica meet [him]249-mr. barfoot ? '[195-monica]

' Near [the flats]2649-the flats , '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica answered , colouring . ' [He]249-mr. barfoot had just come out [I]195-monica saw [him]249-mr. barfoot come out . [Her]195-monica voice failed . [She]195-monica saw that [Rhoda]197-rhoda had begun to mistrust [her]195-monica , to think that [she]195-monica was elaborating falsehoods . The burdensome silence was broken by [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's saying repellently ,

' [I]197-rhoda have n't asked for [your]197-rhoda confidence , remember . '[197-rhoda]

' No and if [you]197-rhoda try to imagine what it means for [me]197-rhoda to be speaking like this [I]197-rhoda am not shameless . The agitation which found utterance in these words had its effect upon [Rhoda]197-rhoda . In spite of [herself]197-rhoda [she]197-rhoda was touched by the note of womanly distress .

' Why have [you]197-rhoda come ? Why do [you]197-rhoda tell [me]197-rhoda this ? '[197-rhoda]

' Because it is n't only that [I]197-rhoda have been falsely accused . ' Simply by denying it . '[197-rhoda]

' Has n't [he]249-mr. barfoot wished to appeal to [me]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda do n't know . [I]197-rhoda have n't heard of [his]249-mr. barfoot expressing such a wish . ' Has [he]249-mr. barfoot done so ? '[195-monica] [Monica]195-monica asked eagerly . ' Did [you]197-rhoda believe [him]249-mr. barfoot when [he]249-mr. barfoot denied '[195-monica]

' But what does it matter whether [I]197-rhoda believed [him]249-mr. barfoot or not ? '[197-rhoda]

' [He]249-mr. barfoot would think it mattered a great deal . '[195-monica]

' [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot would think so ? Why ? '[197-rhoda]

' [He]249-mr. barfoot told [me]195-monica how much [he]249-mr. barfoot wished to have [your]197-rhoda good opinion That is what [we]5925-we used to talk about . [I]195-monica do n't know why [he]249-mr. barfoot took [me]195-monica into [his]249-mr. barfoot confidence . It happened first of all when [we]5925-we were going by [train]3815-train [the same train]5927-the same train , by chance after [we]5925-we had both been calling [here]3495-here . [He]249-mr. barfoot asked [me]195-monica many questions about [you]197-rhoda , and at last said that [he]249-mr. barfoot loved [you]197-rhoda or something that meant the same . '[195-monica]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's eyes had fallen .

' After that , '[195-monica] pursued [Monica]195-monica , ' [we]5925-we several times spoke of [you]197-rhoda . [We]5925-we did so when [we]5925-we happened to meet near [[his]249-mr. barfoot rooms]2960-his rooms as [I]195-monica have told [you]197-rhoda . [He]249-mr. barfoot told [me]195-monica [he]249-mr. barfoot was going to [Cumberland]86-cumberland with the hope of seeing [you]197-rhoda ; and [I]195-monica understood [him]249-mr. barfoot to mean [he]249-mr. barfoot wished to ask [you]197-rhoda '[195-monica]

The sudden and great change in [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's expression checked [the speaker]884-the speaker . Scornful austerity had given place to a smile , stern indeed , but exultant . There was warmth upon [her]197-rhoda face ; [her]197-rhoda lips moved and relaxed ; [she]197-rhoda altered [her]197-rhoda position in the chair as if inclined for more intimate colloquy .

' There was never more than that between [us]5930-us , '[195-monica] pursued [Monica]195-monica with earnestness . ' [My]195-monica interest in [Mr. Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot was only on [your]197-rhoda account . [I]195-monica hoped [he]249-mr. barfoot might be successful . And [I]195-monica have come to [you]197-rhoda because [I]195-monica feared [you]197-rhoda would believe [[my]195-monica husband]5246-my husband as [I]195-monica see [you]197-rhoda have done . '[195-monica]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda , though [she]197-rhoda thought it very unlikely that all this should be admirable acting , showed that the explanation had by no means fully satisfied [her]197-rhoda . A look of suffering appeal obliged [her]197-rhoda to break the silence .

' [I]197-rhoda am very sorry [you]197-rhoda have laid this task upon [yourself]197-rhoda '[197-rhoda]

Still [Monica]195-monica looked at [her]197-rhoda , and at length murmured ,

A flash of stern intelligence shot from [the listener]632-the listener 's eyes .

' Not since . '[195-monica]

Again [Rhoda]197-rhoda was oppressed by the difficulty of determining how much credit was due to such assertions . [Monica]195-monica understood [her]195-monica look .

Human feeling prompted [the listener]632-the listener to declare that [she]632-the listener had no doubts left . Yet [she]632-the listener could not give utterance to the words . [Monica]195-monica broke into sobbing . The strain of this last effort had overtaxed [her]195-monica strength .

Rapidly [she]3275-i recounted the incidents of that fatal Saturday afternoon . At the conclusion [her]3275-i self - command was again overcome ; [she]3275-i shed tears , and murmured broken entreaties for kindness .

' What shall [I]3275-i do , [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda ? How can [I]3275-i live until ? [I]3275-i know it 's only for a short time . [My]3275-i wretched life will soon be at an end '[3275-i]

' [Monica]195-monica there is one thing [you]195-monica must remember . '[3275-i]

' Life seems so bitter to [you]195-monica that [you]195-monica are in despair . Yet is n't it [your]195-monica duty to live as though some hope were before [you]195-monica ? '[3275-i]

[Monica]195-monica gazed in uncertainty .

' [You]195-monica mean '[195-monica] [she]195-monica faltered .

' Yes [you]195-monica have understood [me]195-monica '[195-monica]

'[3275-i]

[Herself]3277-i strongly moved , [Rhoda]197-rhoda had never spoken so impressively , had never given counsel of such earnest significance . [She]3277-i felt [her]3277-i power in quite a new way , without touch of vanity , without posing or any trivial self - consciousness . When [she]3277-i least expected it an opportunity had come for exerting the moral influence on which [she]3277-i prided [herself]3277-i , and which [she]3277-i hoped to make the ennobling element of [her]3277-i life . All the better that the case was one calling for courage , for contempt of vulgar reticences ; the combative soul in [her]3277-i became stronger when faced by such conditions . Seeing that [her]3277-i words were not in vain , [she]3277-i came nearer to [Monica]195-monica and spoke yet more kindly .

' Why do [you]195-monica encourage that fear of [your]195-monica life coming to an end ? '[3277-i]

' It 's more a hope than a fear at most times . [I]3277-i can see nothing before [me]3277-i . [I]3277-i do n't wish to live . '[3277-i]

' That 's morbid . It is n't [yourself]195-monica that speaks , but [your]195-monica trouble . [You]195-monica are young and strong , and in a year 's time very much of this unhappiness will have passed . '[3277-i]

' [I]3277-i have felt it like a certainty as if it had been foretold to [me]3277-i ever since [I]3277-i knew '[3277-i]

' [I]3277-i think it very likely that [young wives]5947-young wives have often the same dread . [You]195-monica will live , because the poor little life will need [your]195-monica care . '[3277-i]

[Monica]195-monica turned [her]195-monica head away and moaned .

' [I]3277-i shall not love [[my]3277-i child]5948-my child . '[3277-i]

' Yes , [you]195-monica will . And that love , that duty , is the life to which [you]195-monica must look forward . [You]195-monica have suffered a great deal , but after such sorrow as [yours]195-monica there comes quietness and resignation . [Nature]241-nature will help [you]195-monica . '[3277-i]

' Oh , if [you]195-monica could give [me]3277-i some of [your]195-monica strength ! [I]3277-i have never been able to look at life as [you]195-monica do . ' [Your]195-monica mistake was in looking only at [the weak women]5950-the weak women . ' Two - and - twenty . '[3277-i]

' Well , [I]3277-i am two - and - thirty and [I]3277-i do n't call [myself]3277-i old . Do n't talk or think about sins ; simply make up [your]195-monica mind that [you]195-monica wo n't be beaten by trials and hardships . There can not can there ? be the least doubt as to how [you]195-monica ought to live through these next coming months . [Your]195-monica duty is perfectly clear . Strengthen [yourself]195-monica in body and mind . [You]195-monica have a mind , which is more than can be said of [a great many women]5955-a great many women . [Monica]195-monica bent suddenly forward and took one of [[her]195-monica friend]631-her friend 's hands , and clung to it .

' [I]3277-i knew [you]631-her friend could say something that would help [me]3277-i . [You]631-her friend have a way of speaking . But it is n't only now . [I]3277-i shall be so far away , and so lonely , all through the dark winter . Will [you]631-her friend write to [me]3277-i ? '[3277-i]

' Gladly . And tell [you]631-her friend all [we]5956-we are doing . '[3277-i]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda 's voice sank for a moment ; [her]197-rhoda eyes wandered ; but [she]197-rhoda recovered the air of confidence .

[She]3279-you rose .

And [Rhoda]197-rhoda stood with erect head , smiling [her]197-rhoda smile of liberty . [Monica]195-monica did not dare to ask any question . [She]195-monica moved up to [[her]195-monica friend]631-her friend , holding out both hands timidly .

CHAPTER XXX

RETREAT WITH [HONOUR]314-honour

Alighting , on [his]3284-his return to [London]6-london , at [the Savoy Hotel]3285-the savoy hotel , [Barfoot]249-mr. barfoot insensibly prolonged [his]3284-his stay [there]453-there . For the present [he]3284-his had no need of [a more private dwelling]3287-a more private dwelling ; [he]3284-his could not see more than a few days ahead ; [his]3284-his next decisive step was as uncertain as it had been during the first few months after [his]3284-his coming back from [the East]177-the east .

Meantime , [he]3284-his led a sufficiently agreeable life . [The Brissendens]274-the brissendens were not in [town]624-town , but [his]3284-his growing intimacy with [that family]3289-that family had extended [his]3284-his social outlook , and in a direction correspondent with the change in [his]3284-his own circumstances . [He]3284-his was making friends in [the world with which [he]3284-his had a natural affinity]3290-the world with which he had a natural affinity ; that of [wealthy and cultured people who seek no prominence]3291-wealthy and cultured people who seek no prominence , who shrink from contact with the circles known as ' smart , '[3292-its women] who possess [their]3291-wealthy and cultured people who seek no prominence souls in quiet freedom . It is a small class , especially distinguished by the charm of [its women]3292-its women . [Everard]242-everard had not adapted [himself]242-everard without difficulty to this new atmosphere ; from the first [he]242-everard recognized its soothing and bracing quality , but [his]242-everard experiences had accustomed [him]242-everard to an air more rudely vigorous ; it was only after those weeks spent abroad in frequent intercourse with [the Brissendens]274-the brissendens that [he]242-everard came to understand the full extent of [his]242-everard sympathy with the social principles [these men]4542-these men and [women]3478-women represented .

In [the houses where [his]242-everard welcome]3295-the houses where his welcome was now assured [he]242-everard met [some three of [four women among whom it would have been difficult to assign the precedence for grace of manner and of mind]3297-four women among whom it would have been difficult to assign the precedence for grace of manner and of mind]3296-some three of four women among whom it would have been difficult to assign the precedence for grace of manner and of mind . [These persons]1765-these persons were not in declared revolt against the order of things , religious , ethical , or social ; that is to say , [they]1765-these persons did not think it worthwhile to identify [themselves]1765-these persons with any ' movement '[242-everard] ; [they]1765-these persons were content with the unopposed right of liberal criticism . [They]1765-these persons lived placidly ; refraining from much that [the larger world]3299-the larger world enjoined , but never aggressive . [Everard]242-everard admired [them]1765-these persons with increasing fervour . With one exception [they]1765-these persons were married , and suitably married ; [that member of the charming group who kept [her]3300-that member of the charming group who kept her maiden freedom maiden freedom]3300-that member of the charming group who kept her maiden freedom was [Agnes Brissenden]275-agnes brissenden , and it seemed to [Barfoot]242-everard that , if preference were at all justified , [Agnes]275-agnes brissenden should receive the palm . [His]242-everard view of [her]275-agnes brissenden had greatly changed since the early days of [their]1765-these persons acquaintance ; in fact , [he]242-everard perceived that till of late [he]242-everard had not known [her]275-agnes brissenden at all . [His]242-everard quick assumption that [Agnes]275-agnes brissenden was at [his]242-everard disposal if [he]242-everard chose to woo [her]275-agnes brissenden had been mere fatuity ; [he]242-everard misread [her]275-agnes brissenden perfect simplicity of demeanour , the unconstraint of [her]275-agnes brissenden intellectual sympathies . What might now be [her]275-agnes brissenden personal attitude to [him]242-everard [he]242-everard felt altogether uncertain , and the result was a genuine humility such as [he]242-everard had never known . Nor was it [Agnes]275-agnes brissenden only that subdued [his]242-everard masculine self - assertiveness ; [[her]275-agnes brissenden sisters]516-her sisters in grace had scarcely less dominion over [him]242-everard ; and at times , as [he]242-everard sat conversing in [one of [these drawing - rooms]3303-these drawing - rooms]3302-one of these drawing - rooms , [he]242-everard broke off to marvel at [himself]242-everard , to appreciate the perfection of [his]242-everard own suavity , the vast advance [he]242-everard had been making in polished humanism .

Towards the end of November [he]242-everard learnt that [the Brissendens]274-the brissendens were at [[their]3304-their town house]3305-their town house , and a week later [he]242-everard received an invitation to dine with [them]3304-their .

Over [his]242-everard luncheon at [the hotel]5444-the hotel [Everard]242-everard reflected with some gravity , for , if [he]242-everard were not mistaken , the hour had come when [he]242-everard must make up [his]242-everard mind on a point too long in suspense . What was [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda doing ? [He]242-everard had heard nothing whatever of [her]197-rhoda . [[His]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin [Mary]213-mary wrote to [him]242-everard , whilst [he]242-everard was at [Ostend]175-ostend , in a kind and friendly tone , informing [him]242-everard that [his]242-everard simple assurance with regard to a certain disagreeable matter was all [she]213-mary had desired , and hoping that [he]242-everard would come and see [her]213-mary as usual when [he]242-everard found [himself]242-everard in [London]6-london . But [he]242-everard had kept away from [the house in [Queen 's Road]18-queen 's road]1274-the house in queen 's road , and it was probable that [Mary]213-mary did not even know [his]242-everard address . As the result of meditation [he]242-everard went to [[his]242-everard sitting - room]3309-his sitting - room , and with an air of reluctance sat down to write a letter . It was a request that [Mary]213-mary would let [him]242-everard see [her]213-mary somewhere or other not at [[her]213-mary house]3584-her house . Could n't [they]3311-they have a talk at [the place in [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street]4718-the place in great portland street , when [no one else]3619-no one else was [there]453-there ?

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot answered with brief assent . If [he]242-everard liked to come to [Great Portland Street]27-great portland street at three o'clock on Saturday [she]213-mary would be awaiting [him]242-everard .

On arriving , [he]242-everard inspected [the rooms]1005-the rooms with curiosity .

' [I]242-everard have often wished to come [here]3495-here , [Mary]213-mary . Show [me]242-everard over [the premises]1004-the premises , will [you]213-mary ? '[242-everard]

' That was [your]242-everard purpose ? '[213-mary]

' No , not altogether . But [you]213-mary know how [your]213-mary work interests [me]242-everard . '[242-everard]

[Mary]213-mary complied , and freely answered [his]242-everard various questions . Then [they]3316-they sat down on hard chairs by the fire , and [Everard]242-everard , leaning forward as if to warm [his]242-everard hands , lost no more time in coming to the point .

' [I]213-mary want to hear about [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . '[213-mary]

' To hear about [her]197-rhoda ? Pray , what do [you]213-mary wish to hear ? '[3317-i]

' Is [she]197-rhoda well ? '[213-mary]

' Very well indeed . '[3317-i]

' [I]213-mary 'm[213-mary] very glad of that . Does [she]3317-i ever speak of [me]0-i ? '[3317-i]

' Let [me]3317-i see [I]3317-i do n't think [she]3317-i has referred to [you]213-mary lately . '[3317-i]

[Everard]242-everard looked up .

' Do n't let [us]3316-they play a comedy , [Mary]213-mary . [I]242-everard want to talk very seriously . Shall [I]242-everard tell [you]213-mary what happened when [I]242-everard went to [Seascale]137-seascale ? '[242-everard]

' Ah , [you]242-everard went to [Seascale]137-seascale , did [you]242-everard ? '[3317-i]

' Did n't [you]242-everard know that ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard asked , unable to decide the question from [[his]242-everard cousin]1165-his cousin 's face , which was quite friendly , but inscrutable .

' [You]242-everard went when [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda was [there]453-there ? '[3317-i]

' Of course . [You]242-everard must have known [I]3317-i was going , when [I]3317-i asked [you]242-everard for [her]197-rhoda [Seascale]137-seascale address . '[3317-i]

' And what did happen ? [I]3317-i shall be glad to hear if [you]242-everard feel at liberty to tell [me]3317-i . '[3317-i]

After a pause , [Everard]242-everard began the narrative . But [he]242-everard did not see fit to give it with all the detail which [Mary]213-mary had learnt from [[her]213-mary friend]631-her friend . [He]242-everard spoke of the excursion to [Wastwater]151-wastwater , and of the subsequent meeting on [the shore]3760-the shore .

' The end of it was that [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda consented to marry [me]242-everard . '[242-everard]

' [She]197-rhoda consented ? '[242-everard]

' That comes as a surprise ? '[242-everard]

' Please go on . '[242-everard]

' Well , [we]5968-we arranged everything . [Rhoda]197-rhoda was to stay till the fifteen days were over , and the marriage would have been there . But then arrived [your]242-everard letter , and [we]5968-we quarrelled about it . [I]242-everard was n't disposed to beg and pray for justice . [I]242-everard told [Rhoda]197-rhoda that [her]197-rhoda wish for evidence was an insult , that [I]242-everard would take no step to understand [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's behaviour . [Rhoda]197-rhoda was illogical , [I]242-everard think . [She]197-rhoda did not refuse to take [my]242-everard word , but [she]197-rhoda would n't marry [me]242-everard until the thing was cleared up . [I]242-everard told [her]197-rhoda that [she]197-rhoda must investigate it for [herself]197-rhoda , and so [we]3321-these two people parted in no very good temper . '[242-everard]

[Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot smiled and mused . [Her]212-miss barfoot duty , [she]212-miss barfoot now felt convinced , was to abstain from any sort of meddling . [These two people]3321-these two people must settle [their]3321-these two people affairs as [they]3321-these two people chose . To interfere was to incur an enormous responsibility . For what [she]212-miss barfoot had already done in that way [Mary]213-mary reproved [herself]213-mary .

' Now [I]242-everard want to ask [you]213-mary a plain question , '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard resumed . ' That letter [you]213-mary wrote to [me]242-everard at [Ostend]175-ostend did it represent [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's mind as well as [your]213-mary own ? '[242-everard]

' It 's quite impossible for [me]213-mary to say . [I]213-mary did n't know [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's mind . '[213-mary]

' Well , perhaps that is a satisfactory answer . It implies , no doubt , that [she]197-rhoda was still resolved not to concede the point on which [I]242-everard insisted . But since then ? Has [she]197-rhoda come to a decision ? '[242-everard]

It was necessary to prevaricate . [Mary]213-mary knew of the interview between [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda and [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson , knew its result ; but [she]213-mary would not hint at this .

' [I]213-mary have no means of judging how [she]197-rhoda regards [you]3322-you , [Everard]242-everard . '[213-mary]

' It is possible [she]197-rhoda even thinks [me]213-mary [a liar]5969-a liar ? '[213-mary]

' [I]3322-you understood [you]3322-you to say that [she]197-rhoda never refused to believe [you]3322-you . '[3322-you]

[He]3322-you made a movement of impatience .

' Plainly [you]3322-you will tell [me]213-mary nothing ? '[213-mary]

' [I]213-mary have nothing to tell . '[213-mary]

' Then [I]213-mary suppose [I]213-mary must see [Rhoda]197-rhoda . Perhaps [she]197-rhoda will refuse to admit [me]213-mary ? '[213-mary]

' [I]213-mary ca n't say . But if [she]197-rhoda does [her]197-rhoda meaning would be unmistakable . '[213-mary]

' [Cousin Mary]213-mary '[3322-you] [he]3322-you looked at [her]3323-you and laughed ' [I]3322-you think [you]3323-you will be very glad if [she]197-rhoda does refuse . '[3322-you]

[She]3323-you seemed about to reply with some pleasantry , but checked [herself]3323-you , and spoke in a serious voice .

' No . [I]3323-you have no such feeling . Whatever [you]3323-you both agree upon will satisfy [me]3323-you . So come by all means if [you]3323-you wish . [I]3323-you can have nothing to do with it . [You]3323-you had better write and ask [her]197-rhoda if [she]197-rhoda will see [you]3323-you , [I]3323-you should think . '[3323-you]

[Barfoot]242-everard rose from [his]242-everard seat , and [Mary]213-mary was glad to be released so quickly from a disagreeable situation . For [her]213-mary own part [she]213-mary had no need to put indiscreet questions ; [Everard]242-everard 's manner acquainted [her]213-mary quite sufficiently with what was going on in [his]242-everard thoughts . However , [he]242-everard had still something to say .

' [You]242-everard think [I]242-everard have behaved rather badly let [us]5970-us say , harshly ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard am not so foolish as to form any judgment in such a case , [cousin Everard]242-everard . '[242-everard]

' Speaking as [a woman]615-a woman , should [you]242-everard say that [Rhoda]197-rhoda had reason on [her]197-rhoda side in the first instance ? '[242-everard]

' [I]213-mary think , '[213-mary] [Mary]213-mary replied , with reluctance , but deliberately , ' that [she]197-rhoda was not unreasonable in wishing to postpone [her]197-rhoda marriage until [she]197-rhoda knew what was to be the result of [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's indiscreet behaviour . '[213-mary]

' Well , perhaps [she]197-rhoda was not , '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard admitted thoughtfully .

' And what has been the result ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard only know that [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson has left [London]6-london and gone to live at [a house [[her]265-mrs. widdowson husband]4145-her husband has taken [somewhere in [the country]3602-the country]5974-somewhere in the country]5972-a house her husband has taken somewhere in the country . '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard 'm[242-everard] relieved to hear that . By - the - bye , [the little lady]3324-the little lady 's " indiscreet behaviour " is as much a mystery to [me]0-i as ever . '[3324-the little lady]

' And to [me]213-mary , '[213-mary] [Mary]213-mary replied with an air of indifference .

' Well , then , let [us]5976-us take it for granted that [I]242-everard was rather harsh with [Rhoda]197-rhoda . But suppose [she]197-rhoda still meets [me]242-everard with the remark that things are just as they were that nothing has been explained ? '[242-everard]

' [I]242-everard ca n't discuss [your]242-everard relations with [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]
