' [I]212-miss barfoot shall admit nothing , '[212-miss barfoot] interrupted [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot rather tartily . ' [I]212-miss barfoot have advised [you]242-everard to see [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda if [she]197-rhoda is willing . And there 's nothing more to be said . '[212-miss barfoot]

' Good . [I]242-everard will write to [her]197-rhoda . '[242-everard]

[He]3325-he did so , in the fewest possible words , and received an answer of equal brevity . In accordance with permission granted , on the Monday evening [he]3325-he found [himself]3325-he once more in [[[his]3325-he cousin]1165-his cousin 's drawing - room]3327-his cousin 's drawing - room , sitting alone , waiting [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda 's appearance . [He]3325-he wondered how [she]197-rhoda would present [herself]197-rhoda , in what costume . [Her]197-rhoda garb proved to be a plain dress of blue serge , certainly not calculated for effect ; but [his]3325-he eye at once distinguished the fact that [she]197-rhoda had arranged [her]197-rhoda hair as [she]197-rhoda wore it when [he]3325-he first knew [her]197-rhoda , a fashion subsequently abandoned for one that [he]3325-he thought more becoming .

[They]3328-they shook hands . [Externally Barfoot]315-externally barfoot was the more agitated , and [his]3325-he embarrassment appeared in the awkward words with which [he]3325-he began .

' [I]3325-he had made up [my]3325-he mind never to come until [you]197-rhoda let [me]3325-he know that [I]3325-he was tried and acquitted But after all it is better to have reason on one 's side . '[3325-he]

' Much better , '[197-rhoda] replied [Rhoda]197-rhoda , with a smile which emphasized [her]197-rhoda ambiguity .

[She]197-rhoda sat down , and [he]3325-he followed [her]197-rhoda example . [Their]3328-they relative positions called to mind many a conversation [they]3328-they had held in [this room]3501-this room . [Barfoot]315-externally barfoot [he]315-externally barfoot wore evening - dress settled in the comfortable chair as though [he]315-externally barfoot were [an ordinary guest]3330-an ordinary guest .

' [I]315-externally barfoot suppose [you]315-externally barfoot would never have written to [me]315-externally barfoot ? '[315-externally barfoot]

' Never , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda answered quietly .

' Because [you]315-externally barfoot are too proud , or because the mystery is still a mystery ? '[315-externally barfoot]

' There is no longer any mystery . '[315-externally barfoot]

[Everard]242-everard made a movement of surprise .

' Indeed ? [You]315-externally barfoot have discovered what it all meant ? '[315-externally barfoot]

' Yes , [I]315-externally barfoot know what it all meant . '[315-externally barfoot]

' Can [you]315-externally barfoot gratify [my]315-externally barfoot not unnatural curiosity ? '[315-externally barfoot]

' [I]315-externally barfoot can say nothing about it , except that [I]315-externally barfoot know how the misunderstanding arose . '[315-externally barfoot]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda was betraying the effort it had cost [her]197-rhoda to seem so self - possessed when [she]197-rhoda entered . [Her]197-rhoda colour had deepened , and [she]197-rhoda spoke hurriedly , unevenly .

' And it did n't occur to [you]315-externally barfoot that it would be a kindness , not inconsistent with [your]315-externally barfoot dignity , to make [me]315-externally barfoot in some way acquainted with this fact ? '[315-externally barfoot]

' [I]315-externally barfoot feel no uneasiness on [your]315-externally barfoot account . '[315-externally barfoot]

[Everard]242-everard laughed .

' Splendidly frank , as of old . [You]315-externally barfoot really did n't care in the least how much [I]242-everard suffered ? '[242-everard]

' [You]315-externally barfoot misunderstand [me]315-externally barfoot . [I]315-externally barfoot felt sure that [you]315-externally barfoot did n't suffer at all . '[315-externally barfoot]

' Ah , [I]242-everard see . [You]315-externally barfoot imagined [me]242-everard calm in the assurance that [I]242-everard should some day be justified . '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda had every reason for imagining it , '[197-rhoda] rejoined [Rhoda]197-rhoda . ' Other wise , [you]242-everard would have given some sign . '[197-rhoda]

Of course [he]242-everard had deeply offended [her]197-rhoda by [his]242-everard persistent silence . [He]242-everard had intended to do so first of all ; and afterwards had thought it might be as well . Now that [he]242-everard had got over the difficulty of the meeting [he]242-everard enjoyed [his]242-everard sense of security . How the interview would end [he]242-everard know not ; but on [his]242-everard side there would be nothing hasty , unconsidered , merely emotional . Had [Rhoda]197-rhoda any new revelation of personality within [her]197-rhoda resources ? that was the question . If so , [he]242-everard would be pleased to observe it . If not why , it was only the end to which [he]242-everard had long ago looked forward .

' It was not for [me]242-everard to give any sign , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard remarked .

' Yet [you]197-rhoda have said that it is well to have reason on [one]472-one 's side . '[242-everard]

Perhaps a softer note allowed itself to be detected in these words . In any case , they were not plainly ironical .

' Admit , then , that an approach was due from [me]197-rhoda . [I]197-rhoda have made it . [I]197-rhoda am here . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda said nothing . Yet [she]197-rhoda had not an air of expectancy . [Her]197-rhoda eye was grave , rather sad , as though for the moment [she]197-rhoda had forgotten what was at issue , and had lost [herself]197-rhoda in remoter thought . Regarding [her]197-rhoda , [Everard]242-everard felt a nobility in [her]197-rhoda countenance which amply justified all [he]242-everard had ever felt and said . But was there anything more any new power ?

' So [we]5978-we go back , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard pursued , ' to [our]5978-we day at [Wastwater]151-wastwater . The perfect day was n't it ? '[242-everard]

' [I]197-rhoda shall never wish to forget it , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda reflectively .

' And [we]5978-we stand as when [we]5978-we quitted [each other]543-each other that night do [we]5978-we ? '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda glanced at [him]242-everard .

' [I]197-rhoda think not . '[197-rhoda]

' Then what is the difference ? '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard waited some seconds , and repeated the question before [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered .

' [You]242-everard are conscious of no difference ? '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said .

' [Months]316-months have lapsed . [We]5978-we are different because [we]5978-we are older . But [you]242-everard speak as if [you]242-everard were conscious of some greater change . '[242-everard]

' Yes , [you]242-everard are changed noticeably . [I]242-everard thought [I]242-everard knew [you]242-everard ; perhaps [I]242-everard did . Now [I]242-everard should have to learn [you]242-everard all over again . It is difficult , [you]242-everard see , for [me]242-everard to keep pace with [you]242-everard . [Your]242-everard opportunities are so much wider . '[242-everard]

This was puzzling . Did it signify mere jealousy , or a profounder view of things ? [Her]197-rhoda voice had something even of pathos , as though [she]197-rhoda uttered a simple thought , without caustic intention .

' [I]3331-me try not to waste [my]3331-me life , '[3331-me] [he]3331-me answered seriously . ' [I]3331-me have made [new acquaintances]1754-new acquaintances . '[3331-me]

' Will [you]3331-me tell [me]242-everard about [them]1754-new acquaintances ? '[242-everard]

' Tell [me]3331-me first about [yourself]242-everard . [You]242-everard say [you]242-everard would never have written to [me]3331-me . That means , [I]3331-me think , that [you]242-everard never loved [me]3331-me . When [you]242-everard found that [I]3331-me had been wrongly suspected and [you]242-everard suspected [me]3331-me [yourself]242-everard , say what [you]242-everard will if [you]242-everard had loved [me]3331-me , [you]242-everard would have asked forgiveness . '[3331-me]

' [I]242-everard have a like reason for doubting [your]242-everard love . If [you]242-everard had loved [me]242-everard [you]242-everard could never have waited so long without trying to remove the obstacle that was between [us]5981-us . '[242-everard]

' It was [you]242-everard who put the obstacle there , '[242-everard] said [Everard]242-everard , smiling .

' No . An unlucky chance did that . Or [a lucky one]5982-a lucky one . Who knows ? '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard began to think : If [this woman]2086-this woman had enjoyed the social advantages to which [Agnes Brissenden]275-agnes brissenden and [those others]3333-those others were doubtless indebted for so much of [their]3333-those others charm , would [she]2086-this woman not have been [their]3333-those others equal , or more ? For the first time [he]242-everard compassionated [Rhoda]197-rhoda . [She]197-rhoda was brave , and circumstances had not been kind to [her]197-rhoda . At this moment , was [she]197-rhoda not contending with [herself]197-rhoda ? Was not [her]197-rhoda honesty , [her]197-rhoda dignity , struggling against the impulses of [her]197-rhoda heart ? [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's love had been worth more than [his]242-everard , and it would be [her]197-rhoda one love in life . A fatuous reflection , perhaps ; yet every moment 's observation seemed to confirm it .

' Well , now , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said , ' there 's the question which [we]5983-we must decide . If [you]197-rhoda incline to think that the chance was fortunate '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda would not speak .

' [We]5983-we must know [each other]543-each other 's mind . '[197-rhoda]

' Ah , that is so difficult ! '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda murmured , just raising [her]197-rhoda hand and letting it fall .

' Yes , unless [we]5983-we give [each other]543-each other help . Let [us]5983-we imagine [ourselves]5983-we back at [Seascale]137-seascale , down by the waves . How cold and grim it must be there to - night ! [I]197-rhoda repeat what [I]197-rhoda said then : [Rhoda]197-rhoda , will [you]197-rhoda marry [me]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda looked fixedly at [him]242-everard .

' [You]242-everard did n't say that then . '[197-rhoda]

' What do the words matter ? '[197-rhoda]

' That was not what [you]242-everard said . '[242-everard]

[He]242-everard watched the agitation of [her]197-rhoda features , until [his]242-everard gaze seemed to compel [her]197-rhoda to move . [She]197-rhoda stepped towards the fireplace , and moved a little screen that stood too near the fender .

' Why do [you]197-rhoda want [me]242-everard to repeat exactly what [I]242-everard said ? '[242-everard] [Everard]242-everard asked , rising and following [her]197-rhoda .

' [You]197-rhoda speak of the " perfect day . " Did n't the day 's perfection end before there was any word of marriage ? '[197-rhoda]

[He]242-everard looked at [her]197-rhoda with surprise . [She]197-rhoda had spoken without turning [her]197-rhoda face towards [him]242-everard ; it was visible now only by the glow of the fire . Yes , what [she]197-rhoda said was true , but a truth which [he]242-everard had neither expected nor desired to hear . Had the new revelation prepared itself ?

' Who first used the word , [Rhoda]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes ; [I]197-rhoda did . '[197-rhoda]

There was silence . [Rhoda]197-rhoda stood unmoving , the fire 's glow upon [her]197-rhoda face , and [Barfoot]242-everard watched [her]197-rhoda .

' Perhaps , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard said at length , ' [I]242-everard was not quite serious when [I]242-everard '[242-everard]

[She]197-rhoda turned sharply upon [him]242-everard , a flash of indignation in [her]197-rhoda eyes .

' Not quite serious ? Yes , [I]197-rhoda have thought that . And were [you]242-everard quite serious in anything [you]242-everard said ? '[197-rhoda]

' [I]242-everard loved [you]197-rhoda , '[242-everard] [he]242-everard answered curtly , answering [her]197-rhoda steady look .

' Yet wanted to see whether '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda could not finish the sentence ; [her]197-rhoda throat quivered .

' [I]197-rhoda loved [you]242-everard , that 's all . And [I]197-rhoda believe [I]197-rhoda still love [you]242-everard . '[197-rhoda]

[Rhoda]197-rhoda turned to the fire again .

' Will [you]197-rhoda marry [me]242-everard ? '[242-everard] [he]242-everard asked , moving a step nearer .

' [I]197-rhoda think [you]197-rhoda are " not quite serious " . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda have asked [you]242-everard twice . [I]197-rhoda ask for the third time . '[197-rhoda]

' [I]197-rhoda wo n't marry [you]242-everard with the forms of marriage , '[197-rhoda] [Rhoda]197-rhoda answered in an abrupt , harsh tone .

' Now it is [you]242-everard who play with a serious matter . '[197-rhoda]

' [You]242-everard said [we]5986-us had both changed . [I]197-rhoda see now that [our]5986-us " perfect day " was marred by [my]197-rhoda weakness at the end . If [you]242-everard wish to go back in imagination to that summer night , restore everything , only let [me]197-rhoda be what [I]197-rhoda now am . '[197-rhoda]

[Everard]242-everard shook [his]242-everard head .

' Impossible . It must be then or now for both of [us]5986-us . '[242-everard]

' Legal marriage , '[197-rhoda] [she]197-rhoda said , glancing at [him]242-everard , ' has acquired some new sanction for [you]242-everard since then ? '[197-rhoda]

' On the whole , perhaps it has . '[242-everard]

' Naturally . But [I]197-rhoda shall never marry , so [we]5986-us will speak no more of it . '[197-rhoda]

As if finally dismissing the subject [she]197-rhoda walked to the opposite side of the hearth , and there turned towards [[her]197-rhoda companion]812-her companion with a cold smile .

' In other words , then , [you]242-everard have ceased to love [me]197-rhoda ? '[197-rhoda]

' Yes , [I]197-rhoda no longer love [you]242-everard . '[197-rhoda]

' Yet , if [I]197-rhoda had been willing to revive that fantastic idealism as [you]242-everard thought it '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda interrupted [him]242-everard sternly .

' What was it ? '[197-rhoda]

' Oh , a kind of idealism undoubtedly . [I]197-rhoda was so bent on making sure that [you]242-everard loved [me]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

[She]197-rhoda laughed .

' After all , the perfection of [our]5986-us day was half make - believe . [You]242-everard never loved [me]197-rhoda with entire sincerity . And [you]242-everard will never love [any woman]5257-any woman even as well as [you]242-everard loved [me]197-rhoda . '[197-rhoda]

' Upon [my]197-rhoda soul , [I]197-rhoda believe it , [Rhoda]197-rhoda . And even now '[197-rhoda]

' And even now it is just possible for [us]5986-us to say goodbye with something like friendliness . But not if [you]242-everard talk longer . Do n't let [us]5986-us spoil it ; things are so straight and clear '[197-rhoda]

A threatened sob made [her]197-rhoda break off , but [she]197-rhoda recovered [herself]197-rhoda and offered [him]3335-he [her]197-rhoda hand .

[He]3335-he walked all the way back to [[his]3335-he hotel]3336-his hotel , and the cold , clammy night restored [his]3335-he equanimity . A fortnight later , sending a Christmas present , with greetings , to [Mr.]3337-mr. and [Mrs. Micklethwaite]270-micklethwaite , [he]3335-he wrote thus

' [I]3335-he am about to do [my]3335-he duty as [you]242-everard put it that is , to marry . The name of [[my]3335-he future wife]4315-my future wife is [Miss Agnes Brissenden]275-agnes brissenden . It will be in March , [I]3335-he think . But [I]3335-he shall see [you]242-everard before then , and give [you]242-everard a fuller account of [myself]3335-he . '[3335-he]

CHAPTER XXXI

[A NEW BEGINNING

Widdowson]317-a new beginning widdowson tried two or three lodgings ; [he]3335-he settled at length in [a small house at [Hampstead]178-hampstead]3338-a small house at hampstead ; occupying [two plain rooms]3339-two plain rooms . [Here]3495-here , at long intervals , [[his]3335-he friend]1214-his friend [Newdick]268-mr. newdick came to see [him]3335-he , but [no one else]3619-no one else . [He]3335-he had brought with [him]3335-he a selection of solid books from [[his]3335-he library]3343-his library , and over these the greater part of each day was spent . Not that [he]3335-he studied with any zeal ; reading , and of a kind that demanded close attention , was [his]3335-he only resource against melancholia ; [he]3335-he knew not how else to occupy [himself]3335-he . [Adam Smith]318-adam smith 's classical work , perused with laborious thoroughness , gave [him]318-adam smith employment for a couple of months ; subsequently [he]318-adam smith plodded through all the volumes of [Hallam]179-hallam .

[[His]3335-he landlady]3344-his landlady , and [the neighbours who were at leisure to observe [him]3335-he when [he]3335-he went out for [his]3335-he two hours ' walk in the afternoon]5989-the neighbours who were at leisure to observe him when he went out for his two hours ' walk in the afternoon , took [him]3335-he for [an old gentleman of sixty - five or so]5990-an old gentleman of sixty - five or so . [He]3335-he no longer held [himself]3335-he upright , and when out of doors seldom raised [his]3335-he eyes from the ground ; grey streaks had begun to brindle [his]3335-he hair ; [his]3335-he face grew yellower and more deeply furrowed . Of [his]3335-he personal appearance , even of cleanliness , [he]3335-he became neglectful , and occasionally it happened that [he]3335-he lay in bed all through the morning , reading , dozing , or in a state of mental vacuity .[3344-his landlady]

It was long since [he]3335-he had seen [[his]3335-he relative]1396-his relative , [the sprightly widow]3346-the sprightly widow ; but [he]3335-he had heard from [her]3346-the sprightly widow . On the point of leaving [England]58-england for [her]3346-the sprightly widow summer holiday , [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson sent [him]3335-he a few lines , urging [him]3335-he , in the language of [the world]3462-the world , to live more sensibly , and let [[his]3335-he wife]4133-his wife ' have [her]3346-the sprightly widow head '[265-mrs. widdowson] now and then ; it would be better for [both of [them]534-both of them]534-both of them . Then followed the time of woe , and for many weeks [he]3335-he gave no thought to [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson . But close upon the end of the year [he]3335-he received one day a certain society journal , addressed in a hand [he]3335-he knew to [the house at [Herne Hill]32-herne hill]3350-the house at herne hill . In it was discoverable , marked with a red pencil , the following paragraph .

' Among [the English who this year elected to take [their]5991-the english who this year elected to take their repose and recreation at trouville repose and recreation at [Trouville]180-trouville]5991-the english who this year elected to take their repose and recreation at trouville there was no more brilliant figure than [Mrs. Luke Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson . [This lady]4194-this lady is well known in the monde where [one never s'ennuie]5993-one never s'ennuie ; where [smart people are gathered together]5994-smart people are gathered together , there is [the charming widow]5995-the charming widow sure to be seen . [We]5996-we are able to announce that , before leaving [Trouville]180-trouville , [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson had consented to a private engagement with [Capt]319-capt . [William Horrocks]320-william horrocks no other , indeed , than " [Captain Bill]5997-captain bill , " [the universal favourite , so beloved by [hostesses]5999-hostesses as [a sure dancing man]6000-a sure dancing man . By the lamented death of [[his]320-william horrocks father]4208-his father]5998-the universal favourite , so beloved by hostesses as a sure dancing man . by the lamented death of his father , [this best of good fellows]6002-this best of good fellows has now become [Sir William]321-sir william , and [we]6003-we understand that [his]320-william horrocks marriage will be celebrated after the proper delays . [Our]6003-we congratulations ! '[265-mrs. widdowson]

Subsequently arrived a newspaper with an account of the marriage . [Mrs. Luke]265-mrs. widdowson was now [Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks : [she]322-lady horrocks had the title desired of [her]322-lady horrocks heart .

Another two months went by , and there came a letter re - addressed , like the other communications , at [the post office in which [[the baronet]3352-the baronet 's wife]3353-the baronet 's wife]3351-the post office in which the baronet 's wife declared [herself]3353-the baronet 's wife anxious to hear of [[her]3353-the baronet 's wife friends]1123-her friends . [She]3353-the baronet 's wife found [they]1123-her friends had left [Herne Hill]32-herne hill ; if this letter reached [him]3352-the baronet , would not [Edmund]217-widdowson come and see [her]3353-the baronet 's wife at [[her]3353-the baronet 's wife house in [Wimpole Street]181-wimpole street]3355-her house in wimpole street ?

Misery of solitude , desire for [a woman]615-a woman 's sympathy and counsel , impelled [him]217-widdowson to use this opportunity , little as it seemed to promise . [He]217-widdowson went to [Wimpole Street]181-wimpole street and had a very long private talk with [Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks , who , in some way [he]217-widdowson could not understand , had changed from [her]322-lady horrocks old self . [She]322-lady horrocks began frivolously , but in rather a dull , make - believe way ; and when [she]322-lady horrocks heard that [Widdowson]217-widdowson had parted from [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife , when a few vague , miserable words had suggested the domestic drama so familiar to [her]322-lady horrocks observation , [she]322-lady horrocks at once grew quiet , sober , sympathetic , as if really glad to have something serious to talk about .

' Now look here , [Edmund]217-widdowson . Tell the whole story from the first . [You]217-widdowson 're[322-lady horrocks] [the sort of man to make awful blunders in such a case as this]3358-the sort of man to make awful blunders in such a case as this . [Women]3478-women make fools of [themselves]3478-women well , never mind . [He]217-widdowson had a struggle with [himself]217-widdowson , but at length narrated everything , often interrupted by shrewd questions .

' [No one]3554-no one writes to [you]217-widdowson ? '[632-the listener] [the listener]632-the listener finally inquired .

' [I]217-widdowson am expecting to hear from [them]3554-no one , '[217-widdowson] was [Widdowson]217-widdowson 's answer , as [he]217-widdowson sat in the usual position , head hanging forward and hands clasped between [his]217-widdowson knees .

' To hear what ? '[322-lady horrocks]

' [I]322-lady horrocks think [I]322-lady horrocks shall be sent for . '[322-lady horrocks]

' Sent for ? To make it up ? '[322-lady horrocks]

' [She]6005-the little girl is going to give birth to [a child]3719-a child . '[322-lady horrocks]

[Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks nodded twice thoughtfully , and with a faint smile .

' How did [you]217-widdowson find this out ? '[322-lady horrocks]

' [I]322-lady horrocks have known it long enough . [[Her]6005-the little girl sister]455-her sister [Virginia]191-virginia told [me]322-lady horrocks before [they]3554-no one went away . [I]322-lady horrocks had a suspicion all at once , and [I]322-lady horrocks forced [her]6005-the little girl to tell [me]322-lady horrocks . '[322-lady horrocks]

' And if [you]217-widdowson are sent for shall [you]217-widdowson go ? '[322-lady horrocks]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson seemed to mutter an affirmative , and added ,

' [I]217-widdowson shall hear what [she]6005-the little girl has to tell [me]217-widdowson , as [she]6005-the little girl promised . '[217-widdowson]

' Is it is it possible ? '[322-lady horrocks]

[The lady]4316-the lady 's question remained incomplete . [Widdowson]217-widdowson , though [he]217-widdowson understood it , vouchsafed no direct answer . Intense suffering was manifest in [his]217-widdowson face , and at length [he]217-widdowson spoke vehemently .

' Whatever [she]6005-the little girl tells [me]217-widdowson how can [I]217-widdowson believe it ? When once [a woman]615-a woman has lied how can [she]615-a woman ever again be believed ? [I]217-widdowson ca n't be sure of anything . '[217-widdowson]

' All that fibbing , '[322-lady horrocks] remarked [Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks , ' has an unpleasant look . No denying it . [She]6005-the little girl got entangled somehow . But [I]322-lady horrocks think [you]217-widdowson had better believe that [she]6005-the little girl pulled up just in time . '[322-lady horrocks]

' [I]217-widdowson have no love for [her]6005-the little girl left , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson went on in a despairing voice . ' It all perished in those frightful days . [I]217-widdowson tried hard to think that [I]217-widdowson still loved [her]6005-the little girl . [I]217-widdowson kept writing letters but they meant nothing or they only meant that [I]217-widdowson was driven half crazy by wretchedness . [I]217-widdowson had rather [we]6011-we lived on as [we]6011-we have been doing . It 's miserable enough for [me]217-widdowson , God knows ; but it would be worse to try and behave to [her]6005-the little girl as if [I]217-widdowson could forget everything . [I]217-widdowson know [her]6005-the little girl explanation wo n't satisfy [me]217-widdowson . Whatever it is [I]217-widdowson shall still suspect [her]6005-the little girl . [I]217-widdowson do n't know that [the child]6012-the child is [mine]217-widdowson . [It]6012-the child may be . Perhaps as it grows up there will be a likeness to help [me]217-widdowson to make sure . But what a life ! Every paltry trifle will make [me]217-widdowson uneasy ; and if [I]217-widdowson discovered any fresh deceit [I]217-widdowson should do something terrible . [You]322-lady horrocks do n't know how near [I]217-widdowson was '[217-widdowson]

[He]3361-he shuddered and hid [his]3361-he face .

' The Othello business wo n't do , '[322-lady horrocks] said [Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks not unkindly . ' [You]322-lady horrocks could n't have gone on together , of course ; [you]322-lady horrocks had to part for a time . Well , that 's all over ; take it as something that could n't be helped . [You]322-lady horrocks were behaving absurdly , [you]322-lady horrocks know ; [I]322-lady horrocks told [you]322-lady horrocks plainly ; [I]322-lady horrocks guessed there 'd be trouble . [You]322-lady horrocks ought n't to have married at all , that 's the fact ; it would be better for most of [us]6013-us if [we]6013-us kept out of it . [Some]3589-some marry for a good reason , some for a bad , and mostly it all comes to the same in the end . But there , never mind . Pull [yourself]3362-you together , [dear boy]6015-dear boy . It 's all nonsense about not caring for [her]3363-her . Of course [you]3362-you 're[322-lady horrocks] eating [your]3362-you heart out for want of [her]3363-her . [She]3363-her has sowed [her]3363-her wild oats why should n't [a woman]615-a woman as well as [a man]3627-a man ? Go down to [Clevedon]1-clevedon and forgive [her]3363-her . [You]3362-you 're [an honest man]5285-an honest man , and it is n't [every woman]5258-every woman never mind . Life 's as [you]3362-you take it : all gloom or moderately shiny . '[3362-you]

With much more to the same solacing effect . For the time [Widdowson]217-widdowson was perchance a trifle comforted ; at all events , [he]217-widdowson went away with a sense of gratitude to [Lady Horrocks]322-lady horrocks . And when [he]217-widdowson had left [the house]368-the house [he]217-widdowson remembered that not even a civil formality with regard to [Sir William]321-sir william had fallen from [his]217-widdowson lips . But [[Sir William]321-sir william 's wife]3370-sir william 's wife , for whatever reason , had also not once mentioned [the baronet]3352-the baronet 's name .

Only a few days passed before [Widdowson]217-widdowson received the summons [he]217-widdowson was expecting . It came in the form of a telegram , bidding [him]217-widdowson hasten to [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife ; not a word of news added . At the time of [its]3373-its arrival [he]217-widdowson was taking [his]217-widdowson afternoon walk ; this delay made it doubtful whether [he]217-widdowson could get to [Paddington]182-paddington by six - twenty , [the last train which would enable [him]217-widdowson to reach [Clevedon]1-clevedon]3374-the last train which would enable him to reach clevedon that night . [He]217-widdowson managed it , with only two or three minutes to spare .

Not till [he]217-widdowson was seated in [the railway carriage]3375-the railway carriage could [he]217-widdowson fix [his]217-widdowson thoughts on the end of the journey . An inexpressible repugnance then affected [him]217-widdowson ; [he]217-widdowson would have welcomed any disaster to [the train]866-the train , any injury which might prevent [his]217-widdowson going to [Monica]195-monica at such a time . Often , in anticipation , the event which was now come to pass had confused and darkened [his]217-widdowson mind ; [he]217-widdowson loathed the thought of it . If [the child]6012-the child , perhaps already born , were in truth [his]217-widdowson , it must be very long before [he]217-widdowson could regard it with a shadow of paternal interest ; uncertainty , to which [he]217-widdowson was condemned , would in all likelihood make it an object of aversion to [him]217-widdowson as long as [he]217-widdowson lived .

[He]217-widdowson was at [Bristol]25-bristol by a quarter past nine , and had to change for [a slow train]3378-a slow train , which by ten o'clock brought [him]217-widdowson to [Yatton]52-yatton , [the little junction for [Clevedon]1-clevedon]3379-the little junction for clevedon . It was a fine starry night , but extremely cold . For the few minutes of detention [he]217-widdowson walked restlessly about [the platform]865-the platform . [His]217-widdowson chief emotion was now a fear lest all might not go well with [Monica]195-monica . Whether [he]217-widdowson could believe what [she]195-monica had to tell [him]217-widdowson or not , it would be worse if [she]195-monica were to die before [he]217-widdowson could hear [her]195-monica exculpation . The anguish of remorse would seize upon [him]217-widdowson .

Alone in [[his]217-widdowson compartment]3381-his compartment , [he]217-widdowson did not sit down , but stamped backwards and forwards on the floor , and before [the train]866-the train stopped [he]217-widdowson jumped out . [No cab]3383-no cab was procurable ; [he]217-widdowson left [his]217-widdowson bag at [the station]586-the station , and hastened with all speed in the direction that [he]217-widdowson remembered . But very soon the crossways had confused [him]217-widdowson . As [he]217-widdowson met [no one whom [he]217-widdowson could ask to direct [him]217-widdowson]3385-no one whom he could ask to direct him , [he]217-widdowson had to knock at a door . Streaming with perspiration , [he]217-widdowson came at length within sight of [[his]217-widdowson own house]3386-his own house . [A church]705-a church clock was striking eleven .

[Alice]185-alice and [Virginia]191-virginia were both standing in [the hall]2087-the hall when the door was opened ; [they]3389-they beckoned [him]217-widdowson into [a room]1298-a room .

' Is it over ? '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson asked , staring from one to the other with [his]217-widdowson dazzled eyes .

' At four this afternoon , '[185-alice] answered [Alice]185-alice , scarce able to articulate . ' [A little girl]4507-a little girl . '[185-alice]

' [She]4507-a little girl had to have chloroform , '[191-virginia] said [Virginia]191-virginia , who looked a miserable , lifeless object , and shook like one in an ague .

' And all 's well ? '[185-alice]

' [We]3391-we think so [we]3391-we hope so , '[3391-we] [they]3391-we stammered together .

[Alice]185-alice added that [the doctor]352-the doctor was to make another call to - night . [They]3391-we had [a good nurse]3393-a good nurse . [The infant]3394-the infant seemed healthy , but was a very , very little mite , and had only made [its]3394-the infant voice heard for a few minutes .

' [She]4507-a little girl knows [you]352-the doctor sent for [me]3394-the infant ? '[3394-the infant]

' Yes . And [we]3391-we have something to give [you]352-the doctor . [You]352-the doctor were to have this as soon as [you]352-the doctor arrived . '[3393-a good nurse]

[Miss Madden]204-miss madden handed [him]352-the doctor a sealed envelope ; then both [the sisters]358-the sisters drew away , as if fearing the result of what [they]358-the sisters had done . [Widdowson]217-widdowson just glanced at the unaddressed missive and put it into [his]217-widdowson pocket .

' [I]217-widdowson must have something to eat , '[217-widdowson] [he]217-widdowson said , wiping [his]217-widdowson forehead . ' When [the doctor]352-the doctor comes [I]217-widdowson 'll see [him]1293-the patient . '[217-widdowson]

This visit took place while [he]217-widdowson was engaged on [his]217-widdowson supper . On coming down from [the patient]1293-the patient [the doctor]352-the doctor gave [him]217-widdowson an assurance that things were progressing ' fairly well '[352-the doctor] ; the morning , probably , would enable [him]217-widdowson to speak with yet more confidence . [Widdowson]217-widdowson had another brief conversation with [the sisters]358-the sisters , then bade [them]358-the sisters good - night , and went to [the room that had been prepared for [him]217-widdowson]3399-the room that had been prepared for him . As [he]217-widdowson closed the door [he]217-widdowson heard a thin , faint wail , and stood listening until it ceased ; it came from [a room on the floor below]3400-a room on the floor below .

Having brought [himself]217-widdowson with an effort to open the envelope [he]217-widdowson had received , [he]217-widdowson found several sheets of notepaper , one of them , remarked immediately , in [a man]3627-a man 's writing . At this [he]217-widdowson first glanced , and the beginning showed [him]217-widdowson that it was a love - letter written to [Monica]195-monica . [He]217-widdowson threw it aside and took up the other sheets , which contained a long communication from [[his]217-widdowson wife]4133-his wife ; it was dated two months ago . In it [Monica]195-monica recounted to [him]217-widdowson , with scrupulous truthfulness , the whole story of [her]195-monica relations with [Bevis]288-bevis .

' [I]195-monica only make this confession '[195-monica] so [she]195-monica concluded ' for the sake of [the poor child that will soon be born]6022-the poor child that will soon be born . [The child]6012-the child is [yours]217-widdowson , and ought not to suffer because of what [I]195-monica did . The enclosed letter will prove this to [you]217-widdowson , if anything can . For [myself]195-monica [I]195-monica ask nothing . [I]195-monica do n't think [I]195-monica shall live . If [I]195-monica do [I]195-monica will consent to anything [you]217-widdowson propose . [I]195-monica only ask [you]217-widdowson to behave without any pretence ; if [you]217-widdowson can not forgive [me]195-monica , do not make a show of it . Say what [your]217-widdowson will is , and that shall be enough '[195-monica] .

[He]3403-he did not go to bed that night . There was a fire in [the room]444-the room , and [he]3403-he kept it alight until daybreak , when [he]3403-he descended softly to [the hall]2087-the hall and let [himself]3403-he out of [the house]368-the house .

In a fierce wind that swept from [the north - west]3407-the north - west down [the foaming Channel]3408-the foaming channel , [he]3403-he walked for an hour or two , careless whither [the roads]3409-the roads directed [him]3403-he . All [he]3403-he desired was to be at a distance from [that house]5316-that house , with [its]5316-that house hideous silence and the faint cry that could scarcely be called a sound . The necessity of returning , of spending days [there]453-there , was an Oppression which held [him]3403-he like a nightmare .

[Monica]195-monica 's statement [he]3403-he neither believed nor disbelieved ; [he]3403-he simply could not make up [his]3403-he mind about it . [She]195-monica had lied to [him]3403-he so resolutely before ; was [she]195-monica not capable of elaborate falsehood to save [her]195-monica reputation and protect [[her]195-monica child]4416-her child ? The letter from [Bevis]288-bevis might have been a result of conspiracy between [them]3413-them .

That [Bevis]288-bevis was [the man against whom [his]3403-he jealousy should have been directed at first astounded [him]3403-he]3414-the man against whom his jealousy should have been directed at first astounded him . By now [he]3403-he had come to a full perception of [his]3403-he stupidity in never entertaining such a thought . The revelation was equivalent to a second offence just discovered ; for [he]3403-he found it impossible to ignore [his]3403-he long - cherished suspicion of [Barfoot]242-everard , and [he]3403-he even surmised the possibility of [Monica]195-monica 's having listened to love - making from that quarter previously to [her]195-monica intimacy with [Bevis]288-bevis . [He]3403-he loathed the memory of [his]3403-he life since marriage ; and as for pardoning [[his]3403-he wife]4133-his wife , [he]3403-he could as soon pardon and smile upon the author of that accursed letter from [Bordeaux]133-bordeaux .

But go back to [the house]368-the house [he]3403-he must . By obeying [his]3403-he impulse , and straightway returning to [London]6-london , [he]3403-he might be the cause of a fatal turn in [Monica]195-monica 's illness . Constraint of bare humanity would keep [him]3403-he here until [[his]3403-he wife]4133-his wife was out of danger . But [he]3403-he could not see [her]4133-his wife , and as soon as possible [he]3403-he must escape from such unendurable circumstances .

Re - entering at half - past eight , [he]3403-he was met by [Alice]185-alice , who seemed to have slept as little as [he]3403-he [himself]3403-he had done . [They]3418-they went into [the dining - room]3603-the dining - room .

' [She]4133-his wife has been inquiring about [you]3403-he , '[204-miss madden] began [Miss Madden]204-miss madden timorously .

' How is [she]4133-his wife ? '[3403-he]

' Not worse , [I]3403-he believe . But so very weak . [She]4133-his wife wishes [me]3403-he to ask [you]3403-he '[3403-he]

' What ? '[3403-he]

[His]3403-he manner did not encourage [the poor woman]3570-the poor woman .

' [I]3403-he shall be obliged to tell [her]4133-his wife something . If [I]3403-he have nothing to say [she]4133-his wife will fret [herself]4133-his wife into a dangerous state . [She]4133-his wife wants to know if [you]3403-he have read [her]4133-his wife letter , and if if [you]3403-he will see [the child]6012-the child . '[3403-he]

[Widdowson]217-widdowson turned away and stood irresolute . [He]217-widdowson felt [Miss Madden]204-miss madden 's hand upon [his]217-widdowson arm .

' Oh , do n't refuse ! Let [me]204-miss madden give [her]4133-his wife some comfort . '[204-miss madden]

' It 's [the child [she]4133-his wife 's anxious about]6025-the child she 's anxious about ? '[204-miss madden]

[Alice]185-alice admitted it , looking into [[her]185-alice brother - in - law]2580-her brother - in - law 's face with woeful appeal .

[Alice]185-alice shook [her]185-alice head .

' Then say [I]2580-her brother - in - law forgive [her]4133-his wife . '[2580-her brother - in - law]

As [he]2580-her brother - in - law directed so it was done ; and in the course of the morning [Miss Madden]204-miss madden brought word to [him]2580-her brother - in - law that [[her]204-miss madden sister]455-her sister had experienced great relief . [She]455-her sister was sleeping .

But [the doctor]352-the doctor thought it necessary to make two visits before nightfall , and late in the evening [he]2580-her brother - in - law came again . [He]2580-her brother - in - law explained to [Widdowson]217-widdowson that there were complications , not unlikely to be dangerous , and finally [he]2580-her brother - in - law suggested that , if the morrow brought no decided improvement , [a second medical man]3424-a second medical man should be called in to consult . This consultation was held . In the afternoon [Virginia]191-virginia came weeping to [[her]191-virginia brother - in - law]2580-her brother - in - law , and told [him]2580-her brother - in - law that [Monica]195-monica was delirious . That night [the whole household]5197-the whole household watched . Another day was passed in the gravest anxiety , and at dusk [the medical attendant]3427-the medical attendant no longer disguised [his]3427-the medical attendant opinion that [Mrs. Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was sinking . [She]455-her sister became unconscious soon after , and in the early morning breathed [her]455-her sister last .

[Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson was in [the room]444-the room , and at the end sat by the bedside for an hour . But [he]2580-her brother - in - law did not look upon [[his]2580-her brother - in - law wife]4133-his wife 's face . When it was told [him]2580-her brother - in - law that [she]455-her sister had ceased to breathe , [he]2580-her brother - in - law rose and went into [[his]2580-her brother - in - law own chamber]3430-his own chamber , death - pale , but tearless .

On the day after the funeral [Monica]195-monica was buried in [the cemetery]3431-the cemetery , which is hard by [the old church]3432-the old church [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson and [the elder sister]473-the elder sister had a long conversation in private . It related first of all to [the motherless baby]3434-the motherless baby . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's desire was that [Miss Madden]204-miss madden should undertake the care of [the child]6012-the child . [She]204-miss madden and [Virginia]191-virginia might live wherever [they]3436-we preferred ; [their]3436-we needs would be provided for . [Alice]185-alice had hardly dared to hope for such a proposal as it concerned [the child]6012-the child , that is to say . Gladly [she]185-alice accepted it .

' But there 's something [I]185-alice must tell [you]265-mrs. widdowson , '[185-alice] [she]185-alice said , with embarrassed appeal in [her]185-alice wet eyes . ' [Poor Virginia]324-poor virginia wishes to go into [an institution]6027-an institution . '[185-alice]

[Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson looked at [her]185-alice , not understanding ; whereupon [she]185-alice broke into tears , and made known that [[her]185-alice sister]455-her sister was such a slave to strong drink that [they]3436-we both despaired of reformation unless by help of the measure [she]455-her sister had indicated . There were [people]3536-people , [she]185-alice had heard , who undertook the care of [inebriates]3440-inebriates .

' [You]265-mrs. widdowson know that [we]3436-we are by no means penniless , '[185-alice] sobbed [Alice]185-alice . ' [We]3436-we can very well bear the expense . But will [you]265-mrs. widdowson assist [us]3436-we to find a suitable place ? '[185-alice]

[He]3441-he promised to proceed at once in the matter .

' And when [she]324-poor virginia is cured , '[204-miss madden] said [Miss Madden]204-miss madden , ' [she]324-poor virginia shall come and live with [me]204-miss madden . And when [baby]6028-baby is about two years old [we]3436-we will do what [we]3436-we have been purposing for a long time . [We]3436-we will open [a school for [young children]3839-young children]6029-a school for young children , either here or at [Weston]13-weston . That will afford [[my]204-miss madden poor sister]6031-my poor sister occupation . Indeed , [we]3436-we shall both be better for the exertion of such an undertaking do n't [you]204-miss madden think so ? '[204-miss madden]

' It would be a wise thing , [I]3441-he have no doubt whatever . '[3441-he]

[The large house]3442-the large house was to be abandoned , and as much of the furniture as seemed needful transported to [a smaller dwelling in [another part of [Clevedon]1-clevedon]3444-another part of clevedon]3443-a smaller dwelling in another part of clevedon . For [Alice]185-alice resolved to stay [here]3495-here in spite of painful associations . [She]185-alice loved [the place]1355-the place , and looked forward with quiet joy to the life that was prepared for [her]185-alice . [Widdowson]265-mrs. widdowson 's books would go back to [London]6-london ; not to [the [Hampstead]178-hampstead lodgings]3447-the hampstead lodgings , however . Fearful of solitude , [he]3448-he proposed to [[his]3448-he friend]1214-his friend [Newdick]268-mr. newdick that [they]3450-they should live together , [he]3448-he , as [a man of substance]3451-a man of substance , bearing the larger share of the expense . And this plan also came into execution .

Three months went by , and on a day of summer , when [the wooded hills and green lanes and rich meadows of [Clevedon]1-clevedon]3452-the wooded hills and green lanes and rich meadows of clevedon looked their best , when [the Channel]1895-the channel was still and blue , and [the Welsh mountains]3454-the welsh mountains loomed through a sunny haze , [Rhoda Nunn]197-rhoda came over from [the Mendips]3455-the mendips to see [Miss Madden]204-miss madden . It could not be a gladsome meeting , but [Rhoda]197-rhoda was bright and natural , and [her]197-rhoda talk as inspiriting as ever . [She]197-rhoda took [the baby]3456-the baby in [her]197-rhoda arms , and walked about with [it]3456-the baby for a long time in [the garden]3457-the garden , often murmuring , ' [Poor little child]6032-poor little child ! [Dear little child]6033-dear little child ! '[197-rhoda] There had been doubt whether [it]3456-the baby would live , but the summer seemed to be fortifying its health . [Alice]185-alice , it was plain , had found [her]185-alice vocation ; [she]185-alice looked better than at any time since [Rhoda]197-rhoda had known [her]185-alice . [Her]185-alice complexion was losing its muddiness and spottiness ; [her]185-alice step had become light and brisk .

' And where is [[your]197-rhoda sister]3611-your sister ? '[197-rhoda] inquired [Miss Nunn]197-rhoda .

' Staying with [friends]3725-friends at present . [She]3611-your sister will be back before long , [I]197-rhoda hope . And as soon as [baby]6028-baby can walk [we]6037-we are going to think very seriously about [the school]3929-the school . [You]197-rhoda remember ? '[197-rhoda]

' [The school]3929-the school ? [You]197-rhoda will really make the attempt ? '[197-rhoda]

' It will be so good for [us]6037-we both . Why , look , '[185-alice] [she]185-alice added laughingly , ' here is [one pupil growing for [us]6037-we]6040-one pupil growing for us ! '[185-alice]

' Make [a brave woman]6041-a brave woman of [her]3611-your sister , '[197-rhoda] said [Rhoda]197-rhoda kindly .

' [We]6037-we will try ah , [we]6037-we will try ! And is [your]197-rhoda work as successful as ever ? '[197-rhoda]

' More ! '[197-rhoda] replied [Rhoda]197-rhoda . ' [We]6037-we flourish like the green bay - tree . [We]6037-we shall have to take [larger premises]6042-larger premises . By - the - bye , [you]197-rhoda must read the paper [we]6037-we are going to publish ; the first number will be out in a month , though the name is n't quite decided upon yet . [Miss Barfoot]212-miss barfoot was never in such health and spirit nor [I]197-rhoda [myself]197-rhoda . [The world]3462-the world is moving ! '[197-rhoda]

Whilst [Miss Madden]204-miss madden went into [the house]368-the house to prepare hospitalities , [Rhoda]197-rhoda , still nursing , sat down on a garden bench . [She]197-rhoda gazed intently at those diminutive features , which were quite placid and relaxing in soft drowsiness . The dark , bright eye was [Monica]195-monica 's . And as [the baby]3456-the baby sank into sleep , [Rhoda]197-rhoda 's vision grew dim ; a sigh made [her]197-rhoda lips quiver , and once more [she]197-rhoda murmured , ' [Poor little child]6032-poor little child !
